original: So Abram went up out of Egypt into the Negev—he and his wife and all his possessions—and Lot was with him.
translation: Abram i go ap long Egypt, na em i go insait long hap bilong Negev – em, meri bilong em, na olgeta samting bilong em – na Lot i stap wantaim em.

original: And Abram had become extremely wealthy in livestock and silver and gold.
translation: Na Abram em i kamap rik tumas long animal na silva na gol.

original: From the Negev he journeyed from place to place toward Bethel, until he came to the place between Bethel and Ai where his tent had formerly been pitched,
translation: Long Nigebu em i go waka long ples iba long ples, go namel long Beteli, na em i kam apost long ples i stap antap long beteli na Ai, olsem ples we em i putim haus bilong tente bipo.

original: to the site where he had built the altar. And there Abram called on the name of the LORD.
translation: Long ples we em bin mekim altar, na Abram i kolim nem bilong LORD hia.

original: Now Lot, who was traveling with Abram, also had flocks and herds and tents.
translation: Nau Lot, i go wail wanpela wan Abram, na em i gat ol pikinini animal na ol bulmakau na haus bilong en.

original: But the land was unable to support both of them while they stayed together, for they had so many possessions that they were unable to coexist.
translation: Gras bilong ol i no inap halivim ol tu wail na stap long wanpela hap, wantaim ol i gat planti samting, olesta ol i no inap stap long wanpela hap.

original: And there was discord between the herdsmen of Abram and the herdsmen of Lot. At that time the Canaanites and the Perizzites were also living in the land.
translation: Na ol man hus bosim ol pik bilong Abram i gat kainkain tok harol long ol man hus bosim ol pik bilong Lot. Long hap taim, Canaanites na Perizzites i stap yet long kantri.

original: So Abram said to Lot, “Please let there be no contention between you and me, or between your herdsmen and my herdsmen. After all, we are brothers.
translation: Abram i tokim Lot, “Ino gat kros long yu na mi, ol man i lukaut moninga bilong yu na ol man i lukaut moninga bilong mi. Yumitupela bratren, olgeta hap, ino gat kros long yumitupela.”

original: Is not the whole land before you? Now separate yourself from me. If you go to the left, I will go to the right; if you go to the right, I will go to the left.”
translation: Em i no olgeta graun i stap bifor yu? Nau yu kirap long me. Yu go long lef, mi go long rait; yu go long rait, mi go long lef.

original: And Lot looked out and saw that the whole plain of the Jordan, all the way to Zoar, was well watered like the garden of the LORD, like the land of Egypt. (This was before the LORD destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah.)
translation: Na Lot i harim i lukim, plaen bilong Jordan olgeta, uspeka long Zoar, em i kamap strong olsem garcen bilong LORD, olsem lagrik bilong Ijip. (Em ol i go bifor LORD bagarapim Sodom na Gomorrah).

original: So Lot chose the whole plain of the Jordan for himself and set out toward the east. And Abram and Lot parted company.
translation: Na Lot i chusim graun bilong Jonordan holem, na em i go long sid bilong solwara. Na Abram na Lot i wok wei tupela.

original: Abram lived in the land of Canaan, but Lot settled in the cities of the plain and pitched his tent toward Sodom.
translation: Abram i stap long kantri bilong Kanaan, tasol Lot i go stap long siti long plein, na i putim tent bilong en long sid bilong Sodim.

original: But the men of Sodom were wicked, sinning greatly against the LORD.
translation: Ol man bilong Sodom i no gut, ol i warkim sin longweiy against LORD.

original: After Lot had departed, the LORD said to Abram, “Now lift up your eyes from the place where you are, and look to the north and south and east and west,
translation: Long Lot i go pinis, Bikpela i tokim Abram, “Nau kamap na luk long ples yu stap, na luk long not, saut, is, na wes,”

original: for all the land that you see, I will give to you and your offspring forever.
translation: Long olgeta graun we yu lukim, mi baim gim long yu na pikinini bilong yu oltaim.

original: I will make your offspring like the dust of the earth, so that if one could count the dust of the earth, then your offspring could be counted.
translation: Mi bai mekim ol descendants bilong yu olsem aus bilong graun, bilong dispela, sapos man i ken kauntim ol aus bilong graun, nanin ol descendants bilong yu i ken kauntim ol.

original: Get up and walk around the land, through its length and breadth, for I will give it to you.”
translation: Kam daun na go wok raun long kantri, longpela na waidpela bilong en, olsem na mi bai givim iyu.

original: So Abram moved his tent and went to live near the Oaks of Mamre at Hebron, where he built an altar to the LORD.
translation: Na Abram kam karryim husat bilong en i go, stap klostu long Makao bilong Mamre long Hebron, na bere ia i birua wanpela altar long Jehovah.

original: In those days Amraphel king of Shinar, Arioch king of Ellasar, Chedorlaomer king of Elam, and Tidal king of Goiim
translation: Long taim bifo Amraphel king bilong Shinar, Arioch king bilong Ellasar, Chedorlaomer king bilong Elam, na Tidal king bilong Goiim

original: went to war against Bera king of Sodom, Birsha king of Gomorrah, Shinab king of Admah, Shemeber king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (that is, Zoar).
translation: Ol i go long war gen Bera king bilong Sodim, Birsha king bilong Gomora, Shinab king bilong Admah, Shemeber king bilong Zeboiim, na king bilong Bela, em i mekim Zoar.

original: The latter five came as allies to the Valley of Siddim (that is, the Salt Sea).
translation: Nambis na faiv kam ol i kam halivim long Vale Siddim, em i man Sin Sea.

original: For twelve years they had been subject to Chedorlaomer, but in the thirteenth year they rebelled.
translation: Ol i bin iusim long Chedorlaomer long twelv yia, tasol long thirteenth yia, ol i bin kam bek long han bilong en.

original: In the fourteenth year, Chedorlaomer and the kings allied with him went out and defeated the Rephaites in Ashteroth-karnaim, the Zuzites in Ham, the Emites in Shaveh-kiriathaim,
translation: Long yia fourtinen, Chedorlaomer na ol kwin i stap wantaim em i go aut na winim Rephaite long Ashteroth-karnaim, Zuzite long Ham, Emite long Shaveh-kiriathaim.

original: and the Horites in the area of Mount Seir, as far as El-paran, which is near the desert.
translation: Na Ol Horait long hap bilong Maunt Seir, go long El-paran, we i kamap nambis long desert.

original: Then they turned back to invade En-mishpat (that is, Kadesh), and they conquered the whole territory of the Amalekites, as well as the Amorites who lived in Hazazon-tamar.
translation: Na tisa ol i tingim bek long go bak na winim En-mispat, em i Kades, na ol i winim hap graun bilong Pipol Amaleki, na Pipol Amori husat i stap long Hazason-Tamar.

original: Then the king of Sodom, the king of Gomorrah, the king of Admah, the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (that is, Zoar) marched out and arrayed themselves for battle in the Valley of Siddim
translation: King bilong Sodom, king bilong Gomorrah, king bilong Admah, king bilong Zeboiim, na king bilong Bela (em i minim Zoar) ol i go aut, na ol i stap redi long pait long vale bilong Siddim

original: against Chedorlaomer king of Elam, Tidal king of Goiim, Amraphel king of Shinar, and Arioch king of Ellasar—four kings against five.
translation: Long Chedorlaomer king bilong Elam, Tidal king bilong Goiim, Amraphel king bilong Shinar, na Arioch king bilong Ellasar – king foa i go bekim king faiv.

original: Now the Valley of Siddim was full of tar pits, and as the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled, some men fell into the pits, but the survivors fled to the hill country.
translation: Na Lanasi Siddim em i fulap long pitis blak, na king bilong Sodom na Gomorrah i ranawe, ol man i slip long pitis, tasol ol saveman i ranawe go long kantri hail.

original: The four kings seized all the goods of Sodom and Gomorrah and all their food, and they went on their way.
translation: Fopla kingly i pikimapim ap olgeta samting bilong Sodom na Gomorrah, kaikai bilong ol, na ol i go na i stap.

original: They also carried off Abram’s nephew Lot and his possessions, since Lot was living in Sodom.
translation: Ol i kisim i go we nambawan kusin bilong Abram, Lot, wantaim ol samting bilong em, long namel husat em Lot i stap long Sodom.

original: Then an escapee came and reported this to Abram the Hebrew. Now Abram was living near the Oaks of Mamre the Amorite, a brother of Eshcol and Aner, all of whom were bound by treaty to Abram.
translation: Wanpela i ranawe na tokim dispela stori long Abram Hebrew. Abram i stap klostu long Oak bilong Mamre Amorite, brata bilong Eshcol na Aner, ol i bin pakim agriwoment wantaim Abram.

original: And when Abram heard that his relative had been captured, he mobilized the 318 trained men born in his household, and they set out in pursuit as far as Dan.
translation: Taim Abram harim olsem bikpela brata bilong em i go daun long han bilong enemy, em i kamapim ol man bilong pait, 318 i gat, ol i born long haus bilong em, na ol i go bek long ranim, ol i stap go long Dan.

original: During the night, Abram divided his forces and routed Chedorlaomer’s army, pursuing them as far as Hobah, north of Damascus.
translation: Long nait, Abram i divelopim ol solida bilong en, i go waid, na i kilim win ol solida bilong Chedorlaomer, i pursuim ol i go long wei bilong Hobah, nort bilong Damaskas.

original: He retrieved all the goods, as well as his relative Lot and his possessions, together with the women and the rest of the people.
translation: Em i kisim bek ol samting bilong en, wantaim nephu bilong em Lot na ol samting bilong em, longsid meri na ol arapela manmeri.

original: After Abram returned from defeating Chedorlaomer and the kings allied with him, the king of Sodom went out to meet him in the Valley of Shaveh (that is, the King’s Valley).
translation: Bihaen long Abram i kam bek long taim em i winim Chedorlaomer na king ol i joimim em, king bilong Sodom i go aut long mitim em long Vale bilong Shaveh, em i Vale bilong King.

original: Then Melchizedek king of Salem brought out bread and wine—since he was priest of God Most High—
translation: Na Melkisedek king bilong Salem, em i prist bilong God bilong hevigut tru, kam aut bret na wain.

original: and he blessed Abram and said: “Blessed be Abram by God Most High, Creator of heaven and earth,
translation: Na em i givim blesing long Abram, ol i tok: “Abram i bles namel long God bilong haipepela, Maker bilong heven na graun,”

original: and blessed be God Most High, who has delivered your enemies into your hand.” Then Abram gave Melchizedek a tenth of everything.
translation: Na blesim i go long God Bilong Heven, we i givim poisin bilong yu long han bilong yu. Na Abram i givim Melkisidek 10% bilong olgeta samting.

original: The king of Sodom said to Abram, “Give me the people, but take the goods for yourself.”
translation: King bilong Sodom i tokim Abram, “Givim mi ol pipol, na yu yet kisim ol samting bilong yu.”

original: But Abram replied to the king of Sodom, “I have raised my hand to the LORD God Most High, Creator of heaven and earth,
translation: Abram i tokim king bilong Sodom, “Mi liftim han bilong mi long LORD God Bikpela Tru, Makar bilong heven na graun,”

original: that I will not accept even a thread, or a strap of a sandal, or anything that belongs to you, lest you should say, ‘I have made Abram rich.’
translation: Mi no ken akseptim, niu thred, niu rop bilong sanal, niu samting i bilong yu, bai yumi tok olsem, 'Ol i mekim Abram ikamap rich.'

original: I will accept nothing but what my men have eaten and the share for the men who went with me—Aner, Eshcol, and Mamre. They may take their portion.”
translation: Mi no ken akseptim nogat samting blo mipela, tasol ol samting we ol man bilong mi kai kam, na ka moning long ol man i go wantaim mi—Aner, Eshcol, na Mamre. Ol i mas kisim posen bilong ol.

original: After these events, the word of the LORD came to Abram in a vision: “Do not be afraid, Abram. I am your shield, your very great reward.”
translation: Long olgeta samting i go, tok bilong GOD i kam long Abram long wanpela sisen: “No ken bekim, Abram. Mi shielding yu, mi bikpela reward tru long yu.”

original: But Abram replied, “O Lord GOD, what can You give me, since I remain childless, and the heir of my house is Eliezer of Damascus?”
translation: Abram i tok bek, “O Bikpela God, wusai yu ken givim mi, long taim mi stap yet i no get pikinini, na man i inheritem haus bilong mi em i Eliezer bilong Damascus?”

original: Abram continued, “Behold, You have given me no offspring, so a servant in my household will be my heir.”
translation: Abram i go i stap, "Susa! Yu no givim mi pikinini, nau wanpela boi bilong servise inside haus bilong mi bai i kam na em i mas boss bilong olgeta."

original: Then the word of the LORD came to Abram, saying, “This one will not be your heir, but one who comes from your own body will be your heir.”
translation: Tok bilong GOD i kam long Abraham, i tok olsem: “Man bilong ikam, em i no ken stap long ples bilong yu, tapi man bilong ikam husat i kam long bodi bilong yu, em i ken stap long ples bilong yu.”

original: And the LORD took him outside and said, “Now look to the heavens and count the stars, if you are able.” Then He told him, “So shall your offspring be.”
translation: Na LORD i kam bek long en, i tokim em, "Nau yu kisim lok long heven na kauntim sta, igo yu inap."  Olsem hem i tokim em, "Ol pikinini bilong yu bai i kamap olsem."

original: Abram believed the LORD, and it was credited to him as righteousness.
translation: Abram bilivim long LORD, na em i kamap dai na rait long en.

original: The LORD also told him, “I am the LORD, who brought you out of Ur of the Chaldeans to give you this land to possess.”
translation: LORD i tokim em, "Mi LORD, we i bringim yu bek long Ur bilong Chaldeans, na mi givim yu dispela graun long poses olsem gen."

original: But Abram replied, “Lord GOD, how can I know that I will possess it?”
translation: Abram i tok bek long Lod God olsem, "Lod God, olsem wanem mi inap save dispela graun em mi bai kisim?"

original: And the LORD said to him, “Bring Me a heifer, a goat, and a ram, each three years old, along with a turtledove and a young pigeon.”
translation: Na LORD i tokim em, “Kisim long me bulmakau we i no katim gris yet, kangapu, na ram, olgeta tripela yia ol ikam, wantaim pisin turtul na pikinini pisin.”

original: So Abram brought all these to Him, split each of them down the middle, and laid the halves opposite each other. The birds, however, he did not cut in half.
translation: Na Abram i bringim ol dispela na i kam long Em, i katim ol i go daun long hap, i laikim hap bilong ol i go opisit long wan anoda. Pisin, em i no katim long hap.

original: And the birds of prey descended on the carcasses, but Abram drove them away.
translation: Na pisin bilong pait i kam daun long bodi bilong animal i dai pinis, tasol Abram i rausim ol i go.

original: As the sun was setting, Abram fell into a deep sleep, and suddenly great terror and darkness overwhelmed him.
translation: Taim san i go daun, Abram i go longpela slip, na nogat longtaim, gret fear na darkness i kam strong iet long en.

original: Then the LORD said to Abram, “Know for certain that your descendants will be strangers in a land that is not their own, and they will be enslaved and mistreated four hundred years.
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Abram, “Yu mas save long hem, ol descentan bilong yu bai stap olsem man bus long kantri we em i no bilong ol, na ol bai iusim ol long wok harde na ol bai kisim bagarap long four hundred yia.

original: But I will judge the nation they serve as slaves, and afterward they will depart with many possessions.
translation: Mi bai givim sentens long nesen we ol i wok olsem slave, na bihain ol i bai lus wantaim olgeta propati.

original: You, however, will go to your fathers in peace and be buried at a ripe old age.
translation: Yu, olsem na, bai yu go long papa bilong yu long peis na kisim bek i go daun long taim em i kamap.

original: In the fourth generation your descendants will return here, for the iniquity of the Amorites is not yet complete.”
translation: Long namba foa jenarasion, ol desenden bilong yu bai kam bek hia, wantaim bilong ol samting nogut bilong Amori i no yet kam klia.

original: When the sun had set and darkness had fallen, behold, a smoking firepot and a flaming torch appeared and passed between the halves of the carcasses.
translation: Taim san i go daun na darkness i kamap, lukim, paip bilong smok na flam i kamap na i pas long halves bilong ol dek bilong animal.

original: On that day the LORD made a covenant with Abram, saying, “To your descendants I have given this land—from the river of Egypt to the great River Euphrates—
translation: Long dispela de, LORD i mekim pinis pek wantaim Abram, olsem: "Mi givim yu laine dispela graun - from wara bilong Ijip long sait bilong sout, na i go inap long Riv Efrates - long ol desenden yu."

original: the land of the Kenites, Kenizzites, Kadmonites,
translation: kantri bilong ol Keniti, ol Kenisi, ol Kadmoni

original: Hittites, Perizzites, Rephaites,
translation: Pipol Hiti, Pipol Perizi, Pipol Rephai,

original: Amorites, Canaanites, Girgashites, and Jebusites.”
translation: Amoraitis, Kanaanitis, Girgasitis, na Jebusitis.

original: Now Abram’s wife Sarai had borne him no children, but she had an Egyptian maidservant named Hagar.
translation: Meri bilong Abram, Sarai, ibin karim olsem na i no salim pikinini long en, tasol em i gat wan susa nambawan meri bilong Ejip we em i kolim Hagar.

original: So Sarai said to Abram, “Look now, the LORD has prevented me from bearing children. Please go to my maidservant; perhaps I can build a family by her.” And Abram listened to the voice of Sarai.
translation: Sarai i tokim Abram, "Lukim nau, Papa God i stap stopim mi from karim pikinini. Ples go long servant meri bilong mi; em bai me kim bekim famili long han bilong em." Na Abram i harim toktok bilong Sarai.

original: So after he had lived in Canaan for ten years, his wife Sarai took her Egyptian maidservant Hagar and gave her to Abram to be his wife.
translation: Bihaen long em i stap long Kanan olsem yia ten, meri bilong en Sarai i kisim meri servist blo Ejip Hagar, na i givim Hagar i go long Abram olsem meri bilong en.

original: And he slept with Hagar, and she conceived. But when Hagar realized that she was pregnant, she began to despise her mistress.
translation: Na em i go stap wantaim Hagar, na em i slep wantaim em, na Hagar i kisim bel. Tasol long taim Hagar i save olsem em i gat bel, em i stat long mekim birua long missis bilong en.

original: Then Sarai said to Abram, “May the wrong done to me be upon you! I delivered my servant into your arms, and ever since she saw that she was pregnant, she has treated me with contempt. May the LORD judge between you and me.”
translation: Na Sarai i tokim Abram, “Mipela i laik LORD i kam jijim bikos long yu na mi, olsem i no gut long me. Mi givim meri servan bilong mi long han bilong yu, na bel bilong em i kam antap, em i wari nau long me, em i no save respektem mi. Mipela i laik LORD i kam jijim bikos long yu na mi.”

original: “Here,” said Abram, “your servant is in your hands. Do whatever you want with her.” Then Sarai treated Hagar so harshly that she fled from her.
translation: Abram i tok olsem, "Manmeri bilong yu em i stap long han bilong yu. Yu mekim olsem yu laik long en." Na Sarai i biruaim Hagar i kam strong, olsem na Hagar i ranawe long en.

original: Now the angel of the LORD found Hagar by a spring of water in the desert—the spring along the road to Shur.
translation: Nau Eyangel bilong Lod i kam bek long Hagar nambis sios long wanpela wata i stap long desot, long rod i go long Shur.

original: “Hagar, servant of Sarai,” he said, “where have you come from, and where are you going?” “I am running away from my mistress Sarai,” she replied.
translation: Hagar, hausmeri bilong Sarai, em i tok olsem, “Yumi kam long we, na yumi go long we?” Em i tok olsem, “Mi lusim meri bilong mi Sarai.”

original: So the angel of the LORD told her, “Return to your mistress and submit to her authority.”
translation: Enjel bilong LORD i tokim em, "Yu go bek gen long missis bilong yu, na yu mas lusim bek i go daun long auoriti bilong em."

original: Then the angel added, “I will greatly multiply your offspring so that they will be too numerous to count.”
translation: Na aenjel i tok yet, "Mi bai kampnaupim bikpela ol pikinini bilong yu, nogat ken kauntim ol, bikos ol i plenti."

original: The angel of the LORD proceeded: “Behold, you have conceived and will bear a son. And you shall name him Ishmael, for the LORD has heard your cry of affliction.
translation: Enek bilong LORD i go bek: “Sios, yu hamarim na bai yu karim man. Bai yu givim nem bilong em Ishmael, long bikos LORD i harim tok bilong yu long taim yu suf.”

original: He will be a wild donkey of a man, and his hand will be against everyone, and everyone’s hand against him; he will live in hostility toward all his brothers.”
translation: Em bai ol i stap olsem kenguru na man, na han bilong en bai i go long olgeta man, na olgeta han bilong ol mana meri bai i go long em; bai em i stap long hevi wantaim ol brata bilong en.

original: So Hagar gave this name to the LORD who had spoken to her: “You are the God who sees me,” for she said, “Here I have seen the One who sees me!”
translation: Na Hagar i givim dispela nem long LORD olsem: "Yu em God bilong siwai mi," bikos em i tok olsem: "Hia mi lukim dispela man i siwai mi!"

original: Therefore the well was called Beer-lahai-roi. It is located between Kadesh and Bered.
translation: Bia-lahai-roi em i kolim olsem nau. Em i stap long bikim Kades na Bered.

original: And Hagar bore Abram a son, and Abram gave the name Ishmael to the son she had borne.
translation: Na Hagar i karim bek Abram wanpela man, na Abram i givim nem Ishmael long pikinini em i karim.

original: Abram was eighty-six years old when Hagar bore Ishmael to him.
translation: Abram em eighty-sik yia na i go wannem Hagar i karim Ishmael long em.

original: When Abram was ninety-nine years old, the LORD appeared to him and said, “I am God Almighty. Walk before Me and be blameless.
translation: Taim Abram i 99 yia olgeta, Bikpela God, LORD i kam ap long en na i tokim em, “Mi bikpela God. Yu wok bifo mi, na yu i nogat skul.”

original: I will establish My covenant between Me and you, and I will multiply you exceedingly.”
translation: Mi bai plantim kovenan bilong mi bikos yu na mi, na mi bai i kamapim yu longpela.

original: Then Abram fell facedown, and God said to him,
translation: Na Abram i go daun klostu long graun, na God i tokim em

original: “As for Me, this is My covenant with you: You will be the father of many nations.
translation: Long mi, dispela em i pakt long yu na mi: Yu bai kamap tata bilong planti ol narapela kantri.

original: No longer will you be called Abram, but your name will be Abraham, for I have made you a father of many nations.
translation: Nogat ken olsem bai yu kam kolim Abram, bamboo yu yet kolim Abraham, wantaim mi mekim yu papa bilong planti nesen.

original: I will make you exceedingly fruitful; I will make nations of you, and kings will descend from you.
translation: Mi bai mekim yu planta longwe; mi bai mekim ol nesen long yu, na ol king bai kam bek long yu.

original: I will establish My covenant as an everlasting covenant between Me and you and your descendants after you, to be your God and the God of your descendants after you.
translation: Mi bai plantim kot bilong Mi olsem wanpela kot we? long taim, long mi na yu na ol desenden bilong yu, na mi bai kamap olsem God bilong yu na ol desenden bilong yu.

original: And to you and your descendants I will give the land where you are residing—all the land of Canaan—as an eternal possession; and I will be their God.”
translation: Na mi bai givim yu na ol desenden bilong yu kantri we yu i stap nau - olgeta Kanaan - olsem ples bilong ol long taim; na mi bai kamap God bilong ol.

original: God also said to Abraham, “You must keep My covenant—you and your descendants in the generations after you.
translation: God i tokim Abraham, “Yu mas holim kaantri bilong mi – yu na ol desenden ol i kam bihain long jenereishen ol i kam.”

original: This is My covenant with you and your descendants after you, which you are to keep: Every male among you must be circumcised.
translation: Em i Kovanen bilong Mi wantaim yu na ol desenden bilong yu bihaenim yu, wanchain yu mas holim: Ol man husat i stap long yu, olgeta mas kisim kot olsem sahn bilong Kovanen.

original: You are to circumcise the flesh of your foreskin, and this will be a sign of the covenant between Me and you.
translation: Yu mas katim sken bilong yu, na dispela bai i kamap santing bilong tok long pakt bilong Mi na yu.

original: Generation after generation, every male must be circumcised when he is eight days old, including those born in your household and those purchased from a foreigner—even those who are not your offspring.
translation: Genarasen long genarasen, ol man husat i mas kamapim skIN bipo tupela dei eit na skIN bipo em i go, inklusiv ol pikinini i kamap longaus bilong yu, na ol pipel husat yu baim long han bilong man bilong kantri narapela - nogat tasol ol pikinini bilong yu, bat ol narapela tu.

original: Whether they are born in your household or purchased, they must be circumcised. My covenant in your flesh will be an everlasting covenant.
translation: Ol i kamap long hus bilong yu o ol i bin baim, ol mas i kisim sunat. Kovenanet bilong mi long flesh bilong yu, em bai i stap oltaim, kovenanet we i no pinis.

original: But if any male is not circumcised, he will be cut off from his people; he has broken My covenant.”
translation: Sapos man i no katim skin bilong penis, em bai i lusim ol araf na ples bilong em; em bin brokim kaiven long me.

original: Then God said to Abraham, “As for Sarai your wife, do not call her Sarai, for her name is to be Sarah.
translation: Na God i tokim Abraham, "Long meri bilong yu, Sarai, yu no ken kolim em olsem, nem bilong en i mas Sarah.

original: And I will bless her and will surely give you a son by her. I will bless her, and she will be the mother of nations; kings of peoples will descend from her.”
translation: Na mi blesim her, na mi givim yu pikinini long hem. Mi blesim her, na em bai kamap mama bilong ol nesen; king bilong ol piple bai kam bek long hem.

original: Abraham fell facedown. Then he laughed and said to himself, “Can a child be born to a man who is a hundred years old? Can Sarah give birth at the age of ninety?”
translation: Abraham i go daun klostu long graun. Em i laif na tokim em yet long en himself, “Pikinini ina bai kam long man husat em i gat 100 yia olsem? Sarah ina bai karim bek long taim em i gat 90 yia olsem?”

original: And Abraham said to God, “O that Ishmael might live under Your blessing!”
translation: Na Abraham i tokim God, "O tasol Ishmael i ken stap ananit long blaesing bilong yu!"

original: But God replied, “Your wife Sarah will indeed bear you a son, and you are to name him Isaac. I will establish My covenant with him as an everlasting covenant for his descendants after him.
translation: God i tokim olsem, “Meri bilong yu, Sarah, bai karim bek yu wanpela man, na yu mas givim nem long em Isaac. Mi bai mekim kaantri bilong mi wantaim em oltaim, ol desenden bilong em na, mi bai plantim em long oltaim.”

original: As for Ishmael, I have heard you, and I will surely bless him; I will make him fruitful and multiply him greatly. He will become the father of twelve rulers, and I will make him into a great nation.
translation: Long Ishmael, mi harim yu, na mi bai blesim em surely; mi bai mekim em i kamap planti, na em bai multipulim ol i go het. Em bai kamap papa bilong twelve bikpela lida, na mi bai mekim em i go bekem wanpela nesen gat plenti manmeri.

original: But I will establish My covenant with Isaac, whom Sarah will bear to you at this time next year.”
translation: Mi bai plantim kaanu bilong mi wontem Isaac, emas Sarah bai karim i go long yu bai bihain long yia nau.

original: When He had finished speaking with Abraham, God went up from him.
translation: Taim em i finis tok long Abaraham, Bikpela i go ap gen long en.

original: On that very day Abraham took his son Ishmael and all those born in his household or purchased with his money—every male among the members of Abraham’s household—and he circumcised them, just as God had told him.
translation: Long namel olsem de, Abraham em kisim pikinini bilong en Ishmael na ol i kamap long haus bilong en o em bin baim ol wantaim moni bilong en – ol man husat i stap long hap bilong Abraham – na em i katim sken bilong ol, olsem Bikpela i tokim em.

original: So Abraham was ninety-nine years old when he was circumcised,
translation: Abram i bin ninetinan yia olsem, na em i kamap ain i katim skin bilong en long kul.

original: and his son Ishmael was thirteen;
translation: Na pikinini bilong em Ishmael em i go nau long thirteen;

original: Abraham and his son Ishmael were circumcised on the same day.
translation: Abram na i pikinini Ishimael ol i kisim sain bilong kotim skin bilong kok long wanpela de.

original: And all the men of Abraham’s household—both servants born in his household and those purchased from foreigners—were circumcised with him.
translation: Na ol man bilong hous belo long Abraham, wokman na man bilong naiten, em baim ol long man bilong naiten, olgeta i kamapim skin bilong ol long en.

original: Then the LORD appeared to Abraham by the Oaks of Mamre in the heat of the day, while he was sitting at the entrance of his tent.
translation: Na Papa God i kisim ap long Abraham klostu long Oak bilong Mamre long taem bilong de, wail em i siddown klostu long entris bilong haus bilong en.

original: And Abraham looked up and saw three men standing nearby. When he saw them, he ran from the entrance of his tent to meet them and bowed low to the ground.
translation: Na Abrahim i lukup, na i sikim tripela man i stap klostu. Long taim em i sikim ol, em i ranawe from hap bilong haus bilong en, na em i go metim ol, na em i paul ais long graun.

original: “My lord,” said Abraham, “if I have found favor in your sight, please do not pass your servant by.
translation: Papa bilong mi, yu givim mi gutpela hariap long sait bilong yu, no ken go pasim servant bilong yu.

original: Let a little water be brought, that you may wash your feet and rest yourselves under the tree.
translation: Kisim liklik wara i kam, na wosim piksa bilong yu, na bihain yumi katim bel na sindaun unda long diwai.

original: And I will bring a bit of bread so that you may refresh yourselves. This is why you have passed your servant’s way. After that, you may continue on your way.” “Yes,” they replied, “you may do as you have said.”
translation: Mipela bai bringim sampela kaikai, na yu yet mas lukautim yuself. Dispela em i kam bek long rot bilong servan, na bihain yu ken go long we bilong yu yet. "Ian," ol i tok, "yu ken mekim olsem yu tok."

original: So Abraham hurried into the tent and said to Sarah, “Quick! Prepare three seahs of fine flour, knead it, and bake some bread.”
translation: Na Abraham i go insait long hanus kviktaim, na em i tokim Sara, "Kwiktaim! Preperm na tripla seah bilong painim finis flour, miksim na mekim em i kamap dough, na kukim baed."

original: Meanwhile, Abraham ran to the herd, selected a tender and choice calf, and gave it to a servant, who hurried to prepare it.
translation: Wail em, Abraham rann i go long hap bilong animol, em pilim wanpela calf i nais, i swit moa, na em givim i go long wanpela yangpela manmeri, em harim i go long kukim.

original: Then Abraham brought curds and milk and the calf that had been prepared, and he set them before the men and stood by them under the tree as they ate.
translation: Na Abraham kisim kukurumakau bilong susu, susu, na kakaruk na i pikinini we i redi, na i putim ol i go long ol man, na i stanbai wantaim ol long anaba trees wail ol i kaikai.

original: “Where is your wife Sarah?” they asked. “There, in the tent,” he replied.
translation: Husat i stap meri Sarah bilong yu? ol i askim. Em i stap, long haus bilong mipela, em i mekim tok.

original: Then the LORD said, “I will surely return to you at this time next year, and your wife Sarah will have a son!” Now Sarah was behind him, listening at the entrance to the tent.
translation: LORD i tokim, "Bai em kam bek gen long taim nau yia, na meri bilong yu Sara bai karim pikinini!" Na Sara i stap bihain long em, i harim tok long entris bilong haus bilong ples namel.

original: And Abraham and Sarah were already old and well along in years; Sarah had passed the age of childbearing.
translation: Na Abraham na Sarah ol i bikpela gen, ol i go longwe na, Sarah i pasim taim bilong karim pikinini.

original: So she laughed to herself, saying, “After I am worn out and my master is old, will I now have this pleasure?”
translation: Na em i laifim lo hes, ol i tok, “Nau bai mi i tambuain pinis na bos bilong me i bikim olta, bai mi ken getim pes bilong me nau?”

original: And the LORD asked Abraham, “Why did Sarah laugh and say, ‘Can I really bear a child when I am old?’
translation: Na Bikpela i askim Abraham, “Wanem samting Sarah i laif na tok olsem, ‘Ina bai mi karim pikinini na mi bikpela?’”

original: Is anything too difficult for the LORD? At the appointed time I will return to you—in about a year—and Sarah will have a son.”
translation: I go nau long olgeta samting i bikim hap tumas long Jehovah? Long taim we i kamap, mi bai go bek gen long yu – em i stap long wanpela yia – na Sara bai karim pikinini man.

original: But Sarah was afraid, so she denied it and said, “I did not laugh.” “No,” replied the LORD, “but you did laugh.”
translation: Sara i bin poret, na em i tok nogut long en, em i tok, 'Mi no laft.' Na Bikpela i tok bek, 'Tasol yu laft.'

original: When the men got up to leave, they looked out over Sodom, and Abraham walked along with them to see them off.
translation: Taim ol man i kam daun na lus, em i lukim ol i go longwe Sodom, na Abram i wok wantaim ol, givim ka long ol plesman na wok nabaut long desla long bidim farwel.

original: And the LORD said, “Shall I hide from Abraham what I am about to do?
translation: Na Lod i tok, “Me bai kaikaim long Abraham olgetting long me bai me mekim?

original: Abraham will surely become a great and powerful nation, and through him all the nations of the earth will be blessed.
translation: Abraham em bai kamap tru nesen bikpela na strongpela, na ol nesen long graun bai blesim long hap bilong en.

original: For I have chosen him, so that he will command his children and his household after him to keep the way of the LORD by doing what is right and just, in order that the LORD may bring upon Abraham what He has promised.”
translation: Mi bin chusim em, na em bai tok instrukshen long ol pikinini bilong en na long hauslain bilong en i go bek, olsem oli ken stap long wei bilong Lod, ovasi, na wokim ol samting i gutpela na rait, nasampela Lod bai bringim ol samting we em promis long Abraham.

original: Then the LORD said, “The outcry against Sodom and Gomorrah is great. Because their sin is so grievous,
translation: Bikpela i tok, "Wail long Sodom na Gomorrah i go antap long, sin bilong ol i bikpela, em i hevi tru, nau ol i kamap strong."

original: I will go down to see if their actions fully justify the outcry that has reached Me. If not, I will find out.”
translation: Mipela bai go daun lukim olsem wok bilong ol i kamap strong, na ol isi we i kam bek long mi, em i justifai olgeta, nogat tasol, bai mipela laik save.

original: And the two men turned away and went toward Sodom, but Abraham remained standing before the LORD.
translation: Na tupela man i turnim bek na i go long Sodim, tasol Abrahimu i stap yet olsem long ples bifor Papa bilong mipela.

original: Abraham stepped forward and said, “Will You really sweep away the righteous with the wicked?
translation: Abram i kam bek long front na tokim, "Bai yu washout ol i gat laif i orait wantaim ol i nogut?"

original: What if there are fifty righteous ones in the city? Will You really sweep it away and not spare the place for the sake of the fifty righteous ones who are there?
translation: Sapos fifty man i gat save long stap, bai yuu kiram i bagarapim em yet? Yuu no ken givim spaes long ples bilong ol man i gat save fifty i stap insait long em?

original: Far be it from You to do such a thing—to kill the righteous with the wicked, so that the righteous and the wicked are treated alike. Far be it from You! Will not the Judge of all the earth do what is right?”
translation: Nogat ken olsem, bai yu kilim ol righteous wantaim ol wicked, na ol i gat wankain treatment. Nogat ken olsem! Mas husat i go jijim ol graun, em bai mekim olgeta samting orait?

original: So the LORD replied, “If I find fifty righteous ones within the city of Sodom, on their account I will spare the whole place.”
translation: Papa God i tokim, “Mi finisim fifty ol man i kamap strong long spirit long taun bilong Sodam, long ol narapela hap, bai mi lusim hap graun.”

original: Then Abraham answered, “Now that I have ventured to speak to the Lord—though I am but dust and ashes—
translation: Na Abrahama i bekim tok, "Nau mi go pinis tokim Pinis long ol bikpela - nogat samting, mipela i kam long dret na smok."

original: suppose the fifty righteous ones lack five. Will You destroy the whole city for the lack of five?” He replied, “If I find forty-five there, I will not destroy it.”
translation: Sapos finifati man i no nap long faiv, bai yu bagarapim hap kauntri bilong ol long faiv i no inap? Emi tok, "Mi finim forty-five i stap, mi no bai bagarapim."

original: Once again Abraham spoke to the LORD, “Suppose forty are found there?” He answered, “On account of the forty, I will not do it.”
translation: Genagen Abram i tokim long LORD, "Sapos forti i stap long hap?" Em i ansa, "Long ol forti, mi no bai mekim dispela."

original: Then Abraham said, “May the Lord not be angry, but let me speak further. Suppose thirty are found there?” He replied, “If I find thirty there, I will not do it.”
translation: Abram tok, “Papa bilong mipela no inap bungim bel, mi bai tok gen. Sapos triati insil na i stap?” Na em tok, “Sapos mi finisim triati insil i stap, mi no bai mekim desela.”

original: And Abraham said, “Now that I have ventured to speak to the Lord, suppose twenty are found there?” He answered, “On account of the twenty, I will not destroy it.”
translation: Na Abraham i tok, "Nau mi go kam tok long Papa bilong mipela, sapos tweanti ikam i stap? Em i ansa, "Long twenty ikam i stap, mi no bai bagarapim ples."

original: Finally, Abraham said, “May the Lord not be angry, but let me speak once more. Suppose ten are found there?” And He answered, “On account of the ten, I will not destroy it.”
translation: Namba las, Abraham i bikim bekim, "Tok bilong God, yu no ken kas, lamna mi tok wanpela gen. Sapos ten i stap long hap, bai ol i stap?" Na God i ansa, "Long olsem ten i stap, mi no winim dai ples."

original: When the LORD had finished speaking with Abraham, He departed, and Abraham returned home.
translation: Taim LORD i winim tok bilong en long Abraham, em i go bek, na Abraham i go bek long haus bilong en.

original: Now the two angels arrived at Sodom in the evening, and Lot was sitting in the gateway of the city. When Lot saw them, he got up to meet them, bowed facedown,
translation: Nau tu einjes i kam lond long Sodom long apinun, na Lot i sindaun long gate bilong taun. Long taim Lot i lukim ol, i get up long mekim welkam, na i kuku i go daun long graun.

original: and said, “My lords, please turn aside into the house of your servant; wash your feet and spend the night. Then you can rise early and go on your way.” “No,” they answered, “we will spend the night in the square.”
translation: Papa bilong mipela, kam bek long haus bilong husat i wok servos; wasim leg na spen nait. Kamap erli na go long rot bilong yu. “Nogat,” ol i tok, “mipela bai spen nait long skaure.”

original: But Lot insisted so strongly that they followed him into his house. He prepared a feast for them and baked unleavened bread, and they ate.
translation: Lot i bikim strong long ol, na ol i bihainim em go insait long haus bilong en. Em i kirapim kaikai bilong ol, na i mekim bret insait i no gat foam, na ol i kaikai.

original: Before they had gone to bed, all the men of the city of Sodom, both young and old, surrounded the house.
translation: Bipo ol i go stap long bodi yet, ol man bilong taun Sodom, yangpela na olpela, i kam raitim haus.

original: They called out to Lot, saying, “Where are the men who came to you tonight? Send them out to us so we can have relations with them!”
translation: Ol i singautim Lot, ol i tok, "Manmeri husat i kam stap gen long yu tede? Kisim ol i go long mipela, mipela i laik stap wantaim ol, na mipela i mekim klostu wantaim ol!"

original: Lot went outside to meet them, shutting the door behind him.
translation: Lot i go autsait long miksim ol, na klosim dorai behain bilo.

original: “Please, my brothers,” he pleaded, “don’t do such a wicked thing!
translation: “Bratas bilong mi,” em i kirapim, “yu no ken mekim samting olsem, em i bikhet!”

original: Look, I have two daughters who have never slept with a man. Let me bring them to you, and you can do to them as you please. But do not do anything to these men, for they have come under the protection of my roof.”
translation: Luke, mipela i gat tupela daughters we ol i no gat wanpela husat yet, olsem mipela bai kisim ol i go kam long yu, na bai yu mekim olsem yu laik long ol. Bai yu no ken mekim sampela samting long dispela man ya, long ol i kauntim long hap bilong balus bilong mi.

original: “Get out of the way!” they replied. And they declared, “This one came here as a foreigner, and he is already acting like a judge! Now we will treat you worse than them.” And they pressed in on Lot and moved in to break down the door.
translation: “Kam bek long we!” ol i tok. Na ol i tok, “Man bilong hap dispela i kam na em i wok olsem wan jaj! Ol bai bagarapim yu moa yet long ol.” Na ol i kam klose long Lot, na ol i go insait long winim dior.

original: But the men inside reached out, pulled Lot into the house with them, and shut the door.
translation: Ol man i stap inside, stretim han na kisim Lot, kisim Lot i go insait long haus wantaim ol, na pasim dor.

original: And they struck the men at the entrance, young and old, with blindness, so that they wearied themselves trying to find the door.
translation: Na ol i kilim man ol long entris, liklik na dai pinis sot, wantaim sipuma, na ol i traim long finim dor, ol i wari pinis long lukim.

original: Then the two men said to Lot, “Do you have anyone else here—a son-in-law, your sons or daughters, or anyone else in the city who belongs to you? Get them out of here,
translation: Na tupela man i tokim Lot, “Yu gat narapela hap, em belong yu, olsem man bilong meri bilong yu, pikinini man, pikinini meri, o narapela hu i bilong yu long siti? Kisim ol i go long wei.

original: because we are about to destroy this place. For the outcry to the LORD against its people is so great that He has sent us to destroy it.”
translation: Mipela i go daiim duspla hap. Koz i gat bikpela wail long Lod olsem wanem samting ol i mekim, na em i salim mipela i kam daiim dispela hap.

original: So Lot went out and spoke to the sons-in-law who were pledged in marriage to his daughters. “Get up,” he said. “Get out of this place, for the LORD is about to destroy the city!” But his sons-in-law thought he was joking.
translation: Lot i go na tokim ol i pleg nogut long marit bilong pikinini meri bilong em. "Kam daun," em i tok. "Lusim ples ia, bikos LORD i kam bagarap gen ples ia!" Tasol ol i ting se em i givim tok pisai.

original: At daybreak the angels hurried Lot along, saying, “Get up! Take your wife and your two daughters who are here, or you will be swept away in the punishment of the city.”
translation: Bikos em i kamap namel long de, eniels i harim Lot i go fas, ol i tok olsem: "Kam daun! Kisim wife bilong yu na tu daughta bilong yu we i stap hia, bekas bai yu i go daun olgeta long peni bilong siti."

original: But when Lot hesitated, the men grabbed his hand and the hands of his wife and his two daughters. And they led them safely out of the city, because of the LORD’s compassion for them.
translation: Bai ol man i kisim han bilong Lot na han bilong meri bilong en na han bilong tupela pikinini meri bilong en, na ol i lei ol gutpela na kilim ol long siti, bikos LORD i gat kompasion bilong ol.

original: As soon as the men had brought them out, one of them said, “Run for your lives! Do not look back, and do not stop anywhere on the plain! Flee to the mountains, or you will be swept away!”
translation: Ol man i kam autim ol nau, wanpela bilong ol i tok, “Ran i go long ples bilong yumi! No look back, na stap nowhere long plen! Ran i go long maunten, nau bai ol i pulapim yumi!”

original: But Lot replied, “No, my lords, please!
translation: Lot i tokim ol bikpela, "Nogat, papa bilong mipela, olsem, plis!"

original: Your servant has indeed found favor in your sight, and you have shown me great kindness by sparing my life. But I cannot run to the mountains; the disaster will overtake me, and I will die.
translation: Wokman bilong yu i save harim mi, na yu showim mi bikpela kain long skulim laip bilong mi. Tasol mi no inap rin i go long maunten olsem rot bilong eskep, disasta bai kam bekim mi, na bai mi dai.

original: Look, there is a town nearby where I can flee, and it is a small place. Please let me flee there—is it not a small place? Then my life will be saved.”
translation: Lukim, hap i stap klostu long taun, na em i ples liklik, mi ina save ranawe, mi yet mas ranawe go long hap - em i ples liklik, inato em i no? Na laif bilong mi bai i savetik.

original: “Very well,” he answered, “I will grant this request as well, and will not demolish the town you indicate.
translation: “Em i orait,” em tok, “Mi bai givim dispela rikues, na bai mi no ken bagarapim taun we yu shohim.”

original: Hurry! Run there quickly, for I cannot do anything until you reach it.” That is why the town was called Zoar.
translation: Harim tok pes! Yu ran i go kisim hap, bikos mi no inap long mekim sampela samting bai yu rikim. Olegita bilong dispela toksave, na em i givim nem Zoar long ples.

original: And by the time the sun had risen over the land, Lot had reached Zoar.
translation: Na long bai tim san i go antap long kantri, Lot ol i kamap long Zoar.

original: Then the LORD rained down sulfur and fire on Sodom and Gomorrah—from the LORD out of the heavens.
translation: Na Papa God i kamdaun rainim salfata na faia long Sodam na Gomora, kamu long Papa God na kamdaun long heven.

original: Thus He destroyed these cities and the entire plain, including all the inhabitants of the cities and everything that grew on the ground.
translation: Em i bagarapim ol siti ya wantaim olgeta plan, na ol manmeri bilong ol siti, na olgeta samting i karim long graun, ol i bagarap.

original: But Lot’s wife looked back, and she became a pillar of salt.
translation: Meri bilong Lot i tingim bek, na em i kamapim pila sal.

original: Early the next morning, Abraham got up and returned to the place where he had stood before the LORD.
translation: Bikos moroten bembe, Abraham i kam bek na i go bek gen long ples we i stap bifor LORD.

original: He looked down toward Sodom and Gomorrah and all the land of the plain, and he saw the smoke rising from the land like smoke from a furnace.
translation: Em i luk dawn long Sodom na Gomorrah na olgeta lan bilong plen, na em i si smok i go ap long lan olsem smok i kamap long farenas.

original: So when God destroyed the cities of the plain, He remembered Abraham, and He brought Lot out of the catastrophe that destroyed the cities where he had lived.
translation: Na taim God i bagarapim ol towns long plain, Em i memba Abraham, na em i kamautim Lot long nau long disaster i bin bagarapim ol towns we em i bin stap.

original: Lot and his two daughters left Zoar and settled in the mountains—for he was afraid to stay in Zoar—where they lived in a cave.
translation: Lot na tupela pikinini meri bilong em i lusim Zoar na i stap long maunten – em i bikim fear long stap long Zoar – na ol i stap insait long hole.

original: One day the older daughter said to the younger, “Our father is old, and there is no man in the land to sleep with us, as is the custom over all the earth.
translation: Wanpela de, susa i bikim olgeta i tokim susa i pikinini, "Papa bilong mipela i bikim olgeta, na i no gat man long kantri ya na stap wantaim mipela olsem kastom long hap graun."

original: Come, let us get our father drunk with wine so we can sleep with him and preserve his line.”
translation: Kam, mipela ken givim papa bilong mipela kaikai wain, em bai dring i go long het bilong en, na mipela ken slip wantaim em, olsem mipela ken save lin bilong em.

original: So that night they got their father drunk with wine, and the firstborn went in and slept with her father; he was not aware when she lay down or when she got up.
translation: Nait i kam, na ol i givim papa bilong ol wain, ol i drinkim papa, na pikinini namba wan i go insait na slip wantaim papa bilong en; em i no save long olgeta, stap long en i go daun oa em i kam bek gen.

original: The next day the older daughter said to the younger, “Look, I slept with my father last night. Let us get him drunk with wine again tonight so you can go in and sleep with him and we can preserve our father’s line.”
translation: Bihainim dei, pikinini meri bikpela i tokim long pikinini meri liklik, “Lookim, last nait mipela i stap wantaim papa. Nau tudei mipela i drinkim wain, na em bai i kalap, olsem yu bai go insait na kisim em, na mipela i save stapim lain bilong papa.”

original: So again that night they got their father drunk with wine, and the younger daughter went in and slept with him; he was not aware when she lay down or when she got up.
translation: Na bihain long nait, ol i kaikai wain, na papa bilong ol i dal i go, ol i dringim em long wain, na liklik meri i go insait na slip wantaim papa bilong ol; papa bilong ol i no save long taim em i lain i go na taim em i kam bek.

original: Thus both of Lot’s daughters became pregnant by their father.
translation: Ol Meri bilong Lot i kamap bekim long tumbuna ol, na dispela i kamap bikos tumbuna ol i bekim ol.

original: The older daughter gave birth to a son and named him Moab. He is the father of the Moabites of today.
translation: Daughter bikpela i karim man, tupela givim nem bilong em Moab. Em i papa bilong ol Moabiti long tude.

original: The younger daughter also gave birth to a son, and she named him Ben-ammi. He is the father of the Ammonites of today.
translation: Daughter i pikinini birua i kamap na em i givim nem bilong em Ben-ammi. Em i papa bilong Ol Ammon tude.

original: Now Abraham journeyed from there to the region of the Negev and settled between Kadesh and Shur. While he was staying in Gerar,
translation: Nau Abraham i go bek long hap Negev na i stap antap long em, na em i stap istap long ples i go daun long Kadesh na Shur. Na wail em i stap istap long Gerar,

original: Abraham said of his wife Sarah, “She is my sister.” So Abimelech king of Gerar had Sarah brought to him.
translation: Abram tok long wif bilong en, Sera, “Em i susa bilong mi.” Na Abimelek king bilong Gerar bingim Sera i kam kisim.

original: One night, however, God came to Abimelech in a dream and told him, “You are as good as dead because of the woman you have taken, for she is a married woman.”
translation: Wan nait, God i kam long Abimeleki long taim bilong sip na i tokim em, "Yu kola pinis olsem long ol meri yu tekem, wantaim em i meri i gat husban."

original: Now Abimelech had not gone near her, so he replied, “Lord, would You destroy a nation even though it is innocent?
translation: Nau Abimelek i no go klostu long em, nau em i tok, "Papa God, bai yu bagarapim ples bilong ol pipol, olsem wanem, ples ia i nogat gilty?"

original: Didn’t Abraham tell me, ‘She is my sister’? And she herself said, ‘He is my brother.’ I have done this in the integrity of my heart and the innocence of my hands.”
translation: Abram em tokim mi, ‘Em i sistta bilong mi,’ na em yet, em tok olsem, ‘Em i brata bilong mi.’ Mi mekim dispela long klean bilong het bilong mi na long nogut niuse long han bilong mi.

original: Then God said to Abimelech in the dream, “Yes, I know that you did this with a clear conscience, and so I have kept you from sinning against Me. That is why I did not let you touch her.
translation: Na God i tokim Abimelech long taim bilong drim, "Yaa, mi save olsem yu mekim dispela wok wantaim het bilong yu i klia, na bihain mi holim yu na yu no ken sindaon long ai bilong Mi, na em i ples we mi no givim yu chans long kamapim skin bilong en.

original: Now return the man’s wife, for he is a prophet; he will pray for you and you will live. But if you do not restore her, be aware that you will surely die—you and all who belong to you.”
translation: Nau bringim bek meri bilong dispela man, wantaim em i stap propet; em bai pray long yu, na yu bai stap. Baimbai yu no bringim bek dispela meri, yu mas save olsem yu bai dai pinis - yu na ol pipol bilong yu.

original: Early the next morning Abimelech got up and summoned all his servants; and when he described to them all that had happened, the men were terrified.
translation: Abimelek em i kirap na kisim ol wokmanmeri bilong en, na em i tokim ol long stori bilong olgeta samting i kamap, na ol man i save pipelmol.

original: Then Abimelech called Abraham and asked, “What have you done to us? How have I sinned against you, that you have brought such tremendous guilt upon me and my kingdom? You have done things to me that should not be done.”
translation: Abimelek i kolim Abraham na askim, "Wusai yu mekim olsem long mipela? Olsem wanem mi bin sin long yu, dat yu bringim bikpela gutpela shame long mi na ples bilong mi? Yu mekim sampela samting we no ken mekim long mi."

original: Abimelech also asked Abraham, “What prompted you to do such a thing?”
translation: Abimelek tu siroksim Abraham, "Wanem i bringen yu long mekim samting olsem?"

original: Abraham replied, “I thought to myself, ‘Surely there is no fear of God in this place. They will kill me on account of my wife.’
translation: Abram hamasim tok, "Mi bin tingim masalai long hes, 'No gat fea long God long hap ini. Ol bai kilim mi long meri bilong mi.'"

original: Besides, she really is my sister, the daughter of my father—though not the daughter of my mother—and she became my wife.
translation: Olsem na, em i sistta bilong me tru, wanpela daughters bilong papa bilong me, tasol em i no daughters bilong mama bilong me, na em i kamap meri bilong me.

original: So when God had me journey from my father’s house, I said to Sarah, ‘This is how you can show your loyalty to me: Wherever we go, say of me, “He is my brother.”’”
translation: Na God i bin karim mi go wokabaut long haus bilong papa bilong mi, na mi tokim Sarah, 'Dispela em i rot bilong yu long show bilip long me: Husat taim yumi go, yu mas tok olsem, "Em i brata bilong mi.'"

original: So Abimelech brought sheep and cattle, menservants and maidservants, and he gave them to Abraham and restored his wife Sarah to him.
translation: Na Abimelek i bringim sheep na bulmakau, ol man servist na ol meri servist, na i givim olsem long Abraham, na i bekim wife bilong em, Sarah, i kam bek long en.

original: And Abimelech said, “Look, my land is before you. Settle wherever you please.”
translation: Na Abimeleki i tok, "Kantri bilong me i stap bifor yu, kam, yu ken stilim we bilong yu laik."

original: And he said to Sarah, “See, I am giving your brother a thousand pieces of silver. It is your vindication before all who are with you; you are completely cleared.”
translation: Em i tokim Sarah, “Lukim, mi givim brata bilong yu wan thousand silva. Em i vindikesen bilong yu long ol pipol i stap wantaim yu; yu pilai klia pinis.”

original: Then Abraham prayed to God, and God healed Abimelech and his wife and his maidservants, so that they could again bear children—
translation: Na Abraham i praizim God, na God i helem Abimelek na meri bilong em na ol hausmeri bilong em, so ol i ken karim pikinini gen.

original: for on account of Abraham’s wife Sarah, the LORD had completely closed all the wombs in Abimelech’s household.
translation: Long bilong meri bilong Abraham, Sara, Bikpela im bin kukim i stap klostu ol bel bilong pipel long haos bilong Abimelek.

original: Now the LORD attended to Sarah as He had said, and the LORD did for Sarah what He had promised.
translation: Na Papa God i lukim Sarah olsem Hem i tok bifo, na Papa God i mekim olgeta samting long Sarah olgeta samting Hem i promis.

original: So Sarah conceived and bore a son to Abraham in his old age, at the very time God had promised.
translation: Sara i kisim bel na karim man long Abraham taim em i go dae olsem, long taem wei God i promis.

original: And Abraham gave the name Isaac to the son Sarah bore to him.
translation: Na Abrama i givim nem Aisak long pikinini Sara i karim i kam long em.

original: When his son Isaac was eight days old, Abraham circumcised him, as God had commanded him.
translation: Taim pikinini Isaac i 8 de bilong em, Abram i katim skin bilong em, olsem God i tokim em.

original: Abraham was a hundred years old when his son Isaac was born to him.
translation: Abram i gat hundred yia na Isaac i kam bon long em.

original: Then Sarah said, “God has made me laugh, and everyone who hears of this will laugh with me.”
translation: Sarah i tok, “God i wail long mi, na olgeta harem dispela stori bai laikim wantaim mi.”

original: She added, “Who would have told Abraham that Sarah would nurse children? Yet I have borne him a son in his old age.”
translation: Em i kam bek long en, “Husat i bin tokim Abraham olsem Sarah bai i kisim susu long ol pikinini? Yet mi biruaim pikinini man long taim bilong bikim old.”

original: So the child grew and was weaned, and Abraham held a great feast on the day Isaac was weaned.
translation: Pikinini i go growe na i tanim susu, na Abaraham i makim bikpela kaikai long de Isaac i tanim susu.

original: But Sarah saw that the son whom Hagar the Egyptian had borne to Abraham was mocking her son,
translation: Na Sara i lukim olsem pikinini una Hagara meri Ijip bin karim long Abraham i bin katkat long pikinini bilong em.

original: and she said to Abraham, “Expel the slave woman and her son, for the slave woman’s son will never share in the inheritance with my son Isaac!”
translation: Na em tokim Abraham, “Kasim bek slave meri na pikinini bilong em, bikos pikinini bilong slave meri no ken gat shares long moni bilong papa wantaim Aisak, pikinini bilong mi!”

original: Now this matter distressed Abraham greatly because it concerned his son Ishmael.
translation: Na dispela kamas i kamas strong long Abraham kasol bilong em i go long pikinini bilong em, Ishmael.

original: But God said to Abraham, “Do not be distressed about the boy and your maidservant. Listen to everything that Sarah tells you, for through Isaac your offspring will be reckoned.
translation: Bikpela i tokim Abraham, "No ken stap sori long bikpela man na meri bilong servis. Harim olgeta samting Sara itokim yu, bikos ol pikinini bilong yu bai kamap olsem long Aisak."

original: But I will also make a nation of the slave woman’s son, because he is your offspring.”
translation: Mi bai mekim narapela nesen tu bilong pikinini blo meri slave, bikos em i kam bek long yu.

original: Early in the morning, Abraham got up, took bread and a skin of water, put them on Hagar’s shoulders, and sent her away with the boy. She left and wandered in the Wilderness of Beersheba.
translation: Bikos belo inap long moning, Abraham em i kam antap, kisim bret na balus wara, putim ol long han bilong Hagar, na em i rausim em wantaim pikinini. Ol i wanda long Bus bilong Beersheba.

original: When the water in the skin was gone, she left the boy under one of the bushes.
translation: Taim wara i go daun long sak, na em i lusim pikinini i stap underside wanpela bus.

original: Then she went off and sat down nearby, about a bowshot away, for she said, “I cannot bear to watch the boy die!” And as she sat nearby, she lifted up her voice and wept.
translation: Na em i go na sindaun klostu longwe bilong banara, ol i sindaun klostu, bikos em i tok, “Mi no inap long lukim pikinini i dai!” Na em i sindaun klostu, em i lusim voys bilong en na krai.

original: Then God heard the voice of the boy, and the angel of God called to Hagar from heaven, “What is wrong, Hagar? Do not be afraid, for God has heard the voice of the boy where he lies.
translation: Na God harim tok bilong pikinini, na einjel bilong God kolim Hagara long heven, “Wanem nau i go long yu, Hagara? No ken bekim fear, bikos God harim tok bilong pikinini we i stap.

original: Get up, lift up the boy, and take him by the hand, for I will make him into a great nation.”
translation: Kam daun, kisim i go ap long boy, kisim han bilong en, bikos mi bai mekim em i go na bikpela narion.

original: Then God opened her eyes, and she saw a well of water. So she went and filled the skin with water and gave the boy a drink.
translation: Na Gott i opim ai bilong meri, na em i lukim wanpela wal i kamap long wara. Na em i go na filim skin bilong em wantaim wara, na em i givim draik long pikinini.

original: And God was with the boy, and he grew up and settled in the wilderness and became a great archer.
translation: Na Gott i stap wantaim pikinini, na em i gro kam, em i stap long bus, na em i kamap man long shot bilong banis.

original: And while he was dwelling in the Wilderness of Paran, his mother got a wife for him from the land of Egypt.
translation: Na wail em i stap yet long Wilerness bilong Paran, mama bilong en i bambekim meri bilong en long kantri bilong Ijip.

original: At that time Abimelech and Phicol the commander of his army said to Abraham, “God is with you in all that you do.
translation: Long taim ia Abimelek na Fikol komanda bilong armi i tokim Abraham, “God i stap wantaim yu long ol samting yu mekim.”

original: Now, therefore, swear to me here before God that you will not deal falsely with me or my children or descendants. Show to me and to the country in which you reside the same kindness that I have shown to you.”
translation: Nau, olega long mi yet, bai yu givim promis long mi hare long Bikpela, bikos yu no ken wok kombug long mi, na ol pikinini bilong mi, na ol desenden bilong mik. Yu mas strongim bel bilong yu, givim gutpela sindaun wantaim mi, na wantaim kantri we yu stap, olsem nau mi bin givim gutpela long yu.

original: And Abraham replied, “I swear it.”
translation: Na Abraham i tokim ol, "Mi hamamas long tok olsem."

original: But when Abraham complained to Abimelech about a well that Abimelech’s servants had seized,
translation: Taim Abraham i bikmaim long Abimelek gen wanpela welle, servants bilong Abimelek i kisim.

original: Abimelech replied, “I do not know who has done this. You did not tell me, so I have not heard about it until today.”
translation: Abimelech i tok bek, "Mi no save husat i mekim dispela. Yu no bin tokim mi, na mipela ibin harim nau tasol tede."

original: So Abraham brought sheep and cattle and gave them to Abimelech, and the two men made a covenant.
translation: Na Abram bingim sip na bulmakau, givim ol i go long Abimelek, na tupela man i mekim pinis agrikmen.

original: Abraham separated seven ewe lambs from the flock,
translation: Abraham i skelimapim sewen ewe pikini ol i stap long ol biruks.

original: and Abimelech asked him, “Why have you set apart these seven ewe lambs?”
translation: Na Abimelek i askim em, “Yu mas yet long dispela seven olpela meri pik?”

original: He replied, “You are to accept the seven ewe lambs from my hand as my witness that I dug this well.”
translation: Em i tokim ol, "Yu mas kisim sevenpela liklik pik na lambok long meri long han bilong mi olsem wanes witness bilong mi, em i mekim mi save ol i no, mi bin digim dispela wal."

original: So that place was called Beersheba, because it was there that the two of them swore an oath.
translation: Na hap bilong en i kamap nem Bia Siba, wantaim ol i makim pren long hap em.

original: After they had made the covenant at Beersheba, Abimelech and Phicol the commander of his army got up and returned to the land of the Philistines.
translation: Ol i wokim pinis covenant long Bia Siba, Abimelek na Fikol komanda bilong army ibin sanap na go bek long kantri bilong Filistia.

original: And Abraham planted a tamarisk tree in Beersheba, and there he called upon the name of the LORD, the Eternal God.
translation: Na Abraham plantim tarimakis tree long Beersheba, na long hap em i kolim nem bilong LORD, God bilong taim bilong oltaim.

original: And Abraham resided in the land of the Philistines for a long time.
translation: Na Abraham i stap long kantri bilong Filistia long taim oliva.

original: Some time later God tested Abraham and said to him, “Abraham!” “Here I am,” he answered.
translation: Olfala taim igo pinis Bikpela i triim Abraham na tokim olsem long em, "Abraham!" "Mi stap hare," em i tok bak.

original: “Take your son,” God said, “your only son Isaac, whom you love, and go to the land of Moriah. Offer him there as a burnt offering on one of the mountains, which I will show you.”
translation: “Kisim pikinini bilong yu pepea, Aisak, we yu lamusim, na go long kantri bilong Moria. Ofa em we long hap bilong bungim ol samting, long wanpela maunten we God bai yu showim.”

original: So Abraham got up early the next morning, saddled his donkey, and took along two of his servants and his son Isaac. He split the wood for a burnt offering and set out for the place God had designated.
translation: Abraham em i kamap erli long moning namba wanpela de, em i pasim sak sak long donki bilong en, na em i kisim i go wantaim tupla wokmanmeri bilong en na Isaac. Em i katim diwai bilong kae bilong bungim God, na em i go bek long ples we Bikpela i tokim ol.

original: On the third day Abraham looked up and saw the place in the distance.
translation: Long long tri dei Abaraham kam lukim na si ples i stap longwe.

original: “Stay here with the donkey,” Abraham told his servants. “The boy and I will go over there to worship, and then we will return to you.”
translation: Stap hia wantaim donki, Abraham i tokim wokmanmeri bilong en. Pikinini na mi bai yumi go long hap ia na wosip, na bai yumi i kam bek gen long yu.

original: Abraham took the wood for the burnt offering and placed it on his son Isaac. He himself carried the fire and the sacrificial knife, and the two of them walked on together.
translation: Abrahim kisim diwai bilong ofing bung, na em putim i go antap long pikinini Isaac bilong em. Em yet karim faia na naip bilong ofing, na ol i go wankain.

original: Then Isaac said to his father Abraham, “My father!” “Here I am, my son,” he replied. “The fire and the wood are here,” said Isaac, “but where is the lamb for the burnt offering?”
translation: Na Isaac i tokim papa bilong en Abraham, “Papa!” “Mipela stap, son bilong yu,” em i ansa. “Faia na diwai i stap,” olsem Isaac i tok, “tasol we bilong lem i stap long ofa bilong bungim?”

original: Abraham answered, “God Himself will provide the lamb for the burnt offering, my son.” And the two walked on together.
translation: Abram i bekim tok, “God em yet yu yet bai givim lek bilong ofa bilong katim na bai kaikai olsem smok, Pikinini.” Na tupela i go wankain.

original: When they arrived at the place God had designated, Abraham built the altar there and arranged the wood. He bound his son Isaac and placed him on the altar, atop the wood.
translation: Tupela i kam long ples we Bikpela i chusim, Abraham wokim ait bilong sacrfis na paitim diwai. Em i binim pikinini blo em, Isaak, na putim em antap long ait, antap long diwai.

original: Then Abraham reached out his hand and took the knife to slaughter his son.
translation: Abrama em strechim han bilong en na kisim naif, ili kilim pikinini bilong en.

original: Just then the angel of the LORD called out to him from heaven, “Abraham, Abraham!” “Here I am,” he replied.
translation: Na Eingel bilong Jehovah i singaut long hap bilong heven, “Abrahamu, Abrahamu!” “Mipela i stap,” na em i mekim.

original: “Do not lay a hand on the boy or do anything to him,” said the angel, “for now I know that you fear God, since you have not withheld your only son from me.”
translation: “Yu no ken rausim han long pikinini, yu no ken mekim sampela samting long em,” ol i tok, “long bikos nau mi save olsem yu gat respek long God, long yu kisim bek we biceman pikinini bilong yu long mi.”

original: Then Abraham looked up and saw behind him a ram in a thicket, caught by its horns. So he went and took the ram and offered it as a burnt offering in place of his son.
translation: Na Abraham i lukup na em i si binatime long hap bilong en, na em i si wanpela ram i kisim long horn bilong en insait long bus. Na em i go na em i kisim ram, na em i givim olsem sacrifis bilong faya inaplong pikinini bilong en.

original: And Abraham called that place The LORD Will Provide. So to this day it is said, “On the mountain of the LORD it will be provided.”
translation: Na Abrama i kolim ples ya The LORD Bai Stap Long Provisa. Ol i tok olsem, "Long maunten bilong LORD bai kamap long provisa."

original: And the angel of the LORD called to Abraham from heaven a second time,
translation: Na ainjel bilong Jehovah i singaut long Abraham long heven wanpela gen.

original: saying, “By Myself I have sworn, declares the LORD, that because you have done this and have not withheld your only son,
translation: Mi yet go hed long mi yet, ol tok bilong GOD ol i sei, em i mekim dispela, bikos yu wokim dispela na yu no bin kisim bek yu yet wankain pikinini.

original: I will surely bless you, and I will multiply your descendants like the stars in the sky and the sand on the seashore. Your descendants will possess the gates of their enemies.
translation: Mi bai blesim yu tru, na mi bai iumiplantim pikinini bilong yu olsem sta bilong heven na san long solwara. Pikinini bilong yu bai kisim gaten bilong eni.

original: And through your offspring all nations of the earth will be blessed, because you have obeyed My voice.”
translation: Na olgeta nesen long graun bai i kamap strong na blessed olsem long ol desenden bilong yu, bikos yu harim tok bilong mi.

original: Abraham went back to his servants, and they got up and set out together for Beersheba. And Abraham settled in Beersheba.
translation: Abraham i go bek long servant bilong en, na ol i kamap na ol i go wantaim long Beersheba. Na Abraham i stap long Beersheba.

original: Some time later, Abraham was told, “Milcah has also borne sons to your brother Nahor:
translation: Olsen taim igo pinis, Abram i tokim ol, "Milka tu i karim mani pikinini long brata yumi Nahor."

original: Uz the firstborn, his brother Buz, Kemuel (the father of Aram),
translation: Uz em i pikinini bilong papa, brata bilong em Buz, Kemuel (papa bilong Aram)

original: Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph, and Bethuel.”
translation: Kesedi, Hazwo, Pilidas, Jidlap, na Betueli.

original: And Bethuel became the father of Rebekah. Milcah bore these eight sons to Abraham’s brother Nahor.
translation: Na Bethuel i kamap papa bilong Rebekah. Milcah i karim despin eightpela man bilong brata bilong Abraham, Nahor.

original: Moreover, Nahor’s concubine, whose name was Reumah, bore Tebah, Gaham, Tahash, and Maacah.
translation: Na Kukubu meri bilong Nahor, em Riuma, karim pikinini: Teba, Gaham, Tahas, na Maaka.

original: Now Sarah lived to be 127 years old.
translation: Na Sara em i stap na i gat 127 yia.

original: She died in Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron) in the land of Canaan, and Abraham went out to mourn and to weep for her.
translation: Em i dai pinis long Kiriath-arba, em i Hebron, long kantri bilong Kanana, na Abraham i go aut na katim sorry na kisim tarangau long em.

original: Then Abraham got up from beside his dead wife and said to the Hittites,
translation: Na Abaraham em i kam bek long sait bilong meri i dai, na em i tokim Hiti.

original: “I am a foreigner and an outsider among you. Give me a burial site among you so that I can bury my dead.”
translation: Mi man i kam long ples another, na mi no stap long ples. Givim mi ples bilong kisim ogra na kambek long midst bilong yu, so mi ken kisim ogra bilong mi na kambek.

original: The Hittites replied to Abraham,
translation: Hitaitis i tokim long Abraham,

original: “Listen to us, sir. You are God’s chosen one among us. Bury your dead in the finest of our tombs. None of us will withhold his tomb for burying your dead.”
translation: Harim tok long yumi, sir. Yu em i pikinini chose bilong God long mipela. Kisim ol dei bilong yu na buri long holep bilong mipela, holep bilong ol dei. Nogat wanpela husat yumi no ken givim holep bilong ol dei long em, mipela bai ol i buri.

original: Then Abraham rose and bowed down before the people of the land, the Hittites.
translation: Na Abram i kam bek long graun, na i kisim hed i go daun bifor ol Hiti, pipol bilong kantri.

original: “If you are willing for me to bury my dead,” he said to them, “listen to me, and approach Ephron son of Zohar on my behalf
translation: Sapos yu wil, kisim na buri ol dai bilong mi, harim tok bilong mi, go klostu long Ephron sussa bilong Zohar long hap bilong mi.

original: to sell me the cave of Machpelah that belongs to him; it is at the end of his field. Let him sell it to me in your presence for full price, so that I may have a burial site.”
translation: Em i mas go selim mi gufa bilong Makpela, em i stap long hap bilong ples bilong em. Im mas selim ol long moni tru, na mipela i ken kisim ples bilong putim bodi long bihain bilong yu.

original: Now Ephron was sitting among the sons of Heth. So in the presence of all the Hittites who had come to the gate of his city, Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham,
translation: Nau Efron i siddaun long olgeta hap bilong Hiti. Olsem, long ai bilong geit bilong taun, i go long ol pikinini bilong Heti we i kam, Efron Hiti i tokim Abraham,

original: “No, my lord. Listen to me. I give you the field, and I give you the cave that is in it. I give it to you in the presence of my people. Bury your dead.”
translation: Nogat, papa bilong yu. Harim tok long mi. Mi givim yu graun, na mi givim yu hole i stap insait long en. Mi givim long hap bilong ol pipol. Kisim ol ded bilong yu na bakim.

original: Again Abraham bowed down before the people of the land
translation: Abram i go daun long graun gen, long bikman meri bilong kantri, na i soim respek long ol pipal bilong ples.

original: and said to Ephron in their presence, “If you will please listen to me, I will pay you the price of the field. Accept it from me, so that I may bury my dead there.”
translation: Ol i tokim Ephron long hap bilong ol, “Mi harim tok bilong yu, baim prais bilong graun na givim olgeta long mi, kalek, bekim graun bilong planim garden bilong ded bilong mi, sho rispek long askim permis, kisim moni bilong em na bekim i go, mipela i kam apotaim long ples, bai yu givim em long mi.”

original: Ephron answered Abraham,
translation: Efron i bekim tok long Abraham

original: “Listen to me, my lord. The land is worth four hundred shekels of silver, but what is that between you and me? Bury your dead.”
translation: Harim tok long mi, papa bilong mipela. Dispela graun em i wort four hundred shekel bilong silva, tasol wanem samting i kam long yu na mi? Kisim ol ded bilong yu na kilim i go.

original: Abraham agreed to Ephron’s terms and weighed out for him the price he had named in the hearing of the Hittites: four hundred shekels of silver, according to the standard of the merchants.
translation: Abraham i givim tok intraim long Ephron, na em i mekim pe long en olsem prais bilong en: four hundred silva shekel, olsem ka bilong besnisman ol i usim, long han bilong Hitti.

original: So Ephron’s field at Machpelah near Mamre, the cave that was in it, and all the trees within the boundaries of the field were deeded over
translation: Ples Ephron long Machpelah, nambis Mamre, gua i stap insait long em, na ol diwai i stap insait long kauntri, ol i kamap propati bilong ol.

original: to Abraham’s possession in the presence of all the Hittites who had come to the gate of his city.
translation: Long stret bilong Abraham, ibin stap long ai bilong olgeta Hiti i kam lukim gat bilong taun bilong em.

original: After this, Abraham buried his wife Sarah in the cave of the field at Machpelah near Mamre (that is, Hebron) in the land of Canaan.
translation: Bihaen long dispela, Abraham i kisim meri bilong em Sara, i go daun im long hole bilong graun long Makpele, we i neks long Mamre, em i Hebron, long kantri bilong Kanaan.

original: So the field and its cave were deeded by the Hittites to Abraham as a burial site.
translation: Na ples na hole bilong em, Hitait i baim ol i givim long Abraham olsem ples bilong putim bodi.

original: By now Abraham was old and well along in years, and the LORD had blessed him in every way.
translation: Abram i go long olsem, i bikim olpela, na LORD i givim bless long em long olgeta wei.

original: So Abraham instructed the chief servant of his household, who managed all he owned, “Place your hand under my thigh,
translation: Na Abraham i givim tok bilong bikpela servant blong em, husat i manejim olgeta samting em i gat, long hus lain bilong en, "Putim han bilong yu ananit lo leg bilong mi."

original: and I will have you swear by the LORD, the God of heaven and the God of earth, that you will not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites among whom I am dwelling,
translation: Mipela bai yu tok olegis long han bilong Jehovah, Bikpela God bilong heven na God bilong graun, olsem yu no ken tek meri bilong pikinini bilong mi long ol gel bilong Kanana long ples we mipela i stap.

original: but will go to my country and my kindred to take a wife for my son Isaac.”
translation: Bai mi go long kantri bilong mi na long wantok bilong mi, olsem na bai mi tekim meri bilong pikinini bilong mi, Isaak.

original: The servant asked him, “What if the woman is unwilling to follow me to this land? Shall I then take your son back to the land from which you came?”
translation: Husat i askim em, “Sapos meri i no wan go bek long mi long dispela gras, orait mipela bai kisim yanpela pikinini i go bek long ples we yu kam long hap?”

original: Abraham replied, “Make sure that you do not take my son back there.
translation: Abram hamasim tok, “Yu mas no bringim pikinini bilong me go bek gen.”

original: The LORD, the God of heaven, who brought me from my father’s house and my native land, who spoke to me and promised me on oath, saying, ‘To your offspring I will give this land’—He will send His angel before you so that you can take a wife for my son from there.
translation: Ol Masalai, Bikpela God bilong heven, we i bringim me long husat bilong papa na graun bilong ples bilong mi, we i tokim me na promisim me long oat, olsem, 'Mipela bai givim dispela graun long genaration bilong yu'—Em bai sendim enjel bilong en befro yumi, so yumi ken kisim meri bilong pikinini bilong mi long hap.

original: And if the woman is unwilling to follow you, then you are released from this oath of mine. Only do not take my son back there.”
