translation: Na sapos meri i no wanbel long bihainim yu, then yu fri long promis bilong me. Tasol, no bringim bek pikinini bilong me long hap ben.

original: So the servant placed his hand under the thigh of his master Abraham and swore an oath to him concerning this matter.
translation: Na servit i putim han bilong en aninit long lek bilong masita Abrahamu, na i makim oth long dispela matemat.

original: Then the servant took ten of his master’s camels and departed with all manner of good things from his master in hand. And he set out for Nahor’s hometown in Aram-naharaim.
translation: Servant ibin kisim ten bilong masta camels na olgeta samting gut, na ibin wokabaut i go long ples bilong Nahor long Aram-naharaim.

original: As evening approached, he made the camels kneel down near the well outside the town at the time when the women went out to draw water.
translation: Long taim bai i kamap, na em i wokim ol kemel i kukurum klostu long wel igo long taun, taim we meri i go aut long draim wara.

original: “O LORD, God of my master Abraham,” he prayed, “please grant me success today, and show kindness to my master Abraham.
translation: O PAPA, God bilong masta Abraham, givim mi sindaun nau, na mekim gutpela long masta Abraham.

original: Here I am, standing beside the spring, and the daughters of the townspeople are coming out to draw water.
translation: Mi stap hare, staning besait long wara i kam up, na ol meri pikinini bilong ol pisin bilong taun i kam aut long pulim wara.

original: Now may it happen that the girl to whom I say, ‘Please let down your jar that I may drink,’ and who responds, ‘Drink, and I will water your camels as well’—let her be the one You have appointed for Your servant Isaac. By this I will know that You have shown kindness to my master.”
translation: Em bai kamap, mipela i tokim meri, 'Kisim bilong yu i go daun, mi bai kaikai,' na em yet i tok, 'Mi bai kaikai, na yu yet wataim kamel bilong yu tu.' Meri olsem bai Yu gim olsem long husat i servism Isaac. Long dispela, mipela bai save olsem Yu showim gutpela long bos bilong mipela.

original: Before the servant had finished praying, Rebekah came out with her jar on her shoulder. She was the daughter of Bethuel son of Milcah, the wife of Abraham’s brother Nahor.
translation: Bifoa hausboi i kam pinis long beten, Rebekah i kam aut, em i kisim bek na putim long susa bilong en. Em i pikinini meri bilong Betuel, pikinini bilong Milka, meri bilong brata bilong Abraham, yaem Nahor.

original: Now the girl was very beautiful, a virgin who had not had relations with any man. She went down to the spring, filled her jar, and came up again.
translation: Na meri i luk strong bikos em i pekpek tru, i no gat save long man yet. Em i go daun klostu wara, i fulim koroboi bilong en, na i kam bek gen.

original: So the servant ran to meet her and said, “Please let me have a little water from your jar.”
translation: Na servan i ran i go bekim em, stap tokim em olsem, "Givim mi liklik wara from jalab iyu."

original: “Drink, my lord,” she replied, and she quickly lowered her jar to her hands and gave him a drink.
translation: “Dringim, papa bilong yu,” em i tok, na em i kisim bekim wara i go daun, na em i givim drink long em.

original: After she had given him a drink, she said, “I will also draw water for your camels, until they have had enough to drink.”
translation: Em i givim drink long hem, na em tok, “Mi bai kisim wara long kemel bilong yu, na dringim wara, long ol i pinis drink.”

original: And she quickly emptied her jar into the trough and ran back to the well to draw water, until she had drawn water for all his camels.
translation: Na meri i kilim hariap jar bilong en long piti, na em i ran i go bek long wela, long kisim wara, na em i kisim wara long ol camel bilong en, til em i pinis kisim wara long ol.

original: Meanwhile, the man watched her silently to see whether or not the LORD had made his journey a success.
translation: Na man i lukim em quiet long bilong lukim igras em yet LORDE im wankain stap strong bilong em long wokabaut bilong en.

original: And after the camels had finished drinking, he took out a gold ring weighing a beka, and two gold bracelets for her wrists weighing ten shekels.
translation: Na bihaen ol kamel i pinis draik, em i kisim wanpela ring bilong gol we i pesa beka, na tupela bel bilong arm bilong gol we i pesa ten siksel, na em i givim long han bilong meri.

original: “Whose daughter are you?” he asked. “Please tell me, is there room in your father’s house for us to spend the night?”
translation: Husat dai yu? Tokim mi, rum i stap long haus bilong papa bilong yu, inap mipela i sarap lo ip?

original: She replied, “I am the daughter of Bethuel, the son that Milcah bore to Nahor.”
translation: Em i tok bek, “Mi bin meri bilong Betuel, pikinini i Milka ibin karim long Nahor.”

original: Then she added, “We have plenty of straw and feed, as well as a place for you to spend the night.”
translation: Na em i mekim yet, "Mipela i gat planti gras na ka, na yu ken slip long ples, tonait."

original: Then the man bowed down and worshiped the LORD,
translation: Na man i go daun klostu, i wosipim LORD olsem.

original: saying, “Blessed be the LORD, the God of my master Abraham, who has not withheld His kindness and faithfulness from my master. As for me, the LORD has led me on the journey to the house of my master’s relatives.”
translation: Praiz i go long LORD, God bilong maser Abraham, we i no stap holim kaikai na trut long em. Mi yet, LORD i leadim mi long rod long haus bilong wantok bilong maser.

original: The girl ran and told her mother’s household about these things.
translation: Meri i ranawe na tokim ol i stap long haus bilong mama bilong em long dispela samting.

original: Now Rebekah had a brother named Laban, and he rushed out to the man at the spring.
translation: Nau Rebeka i gat brata nem Laban, na em i ron igo long man long wanpela spring.

original: As soon as he saw the ring, and the bracelets on his sister’s wrists, and heard Rebekah’s words, “The man said this to me,” he went and found the man standing by the camels near the spring.
translation: Olsem em i lukim ring bilong han, na bel bilong arm long arm bilong susa bilong em, na em i harim toksave long Rebekah, "Man i tok olsem long me," em i go na finisim man i stap klostu long kemel klostu long wara bilong wata.

original: “Come, you who are blessed by the LORD,” said Laban. “Why are you standing out here? I have prepared the house and a place for the camels.”
translation: Kam, yu husat i blesim olgeta long han bilong LORD, Laban i tok. Wai yu stap otside long hia? Mi preparim haus na ples bilong kemel.

original: So the man came to the house, and the camels were unloaded. Straw and feed were brought to the camels, and water to wash his feet and the feet of his companions.
translation: Na man i kam long haus, na ol kamel i katim bek long karim ol samting. Ol i bringim kaikai bilong animal na straw long ol kamel, na wara bilong wasim lek bilong em na lek bilong ol brata bilong en.

original: Then a meal was set before the man, but he said, “I will not eat until I have told you what I came to say.” So Laban said, “Please speak.”
translation: Na kaikai i redi pinis, tasol man i tok, "Mi no ken kaikai yet, mi mas tokim yu wusai mi kam tokim long olsem." Laban i tok, "Tok Tok, yumi harim tok bilong yu."

original: “I am Abraham’s servant,” he replied.
translation: Mi wanpela servent bilong Abraham, na em i tok olsem.

original: “The LORD has greatly blessed my master, and he has become rich. He has given him sheep and cattle, silver and gold, menservants and maidservants, camels and donkeys.
translation: Papa God i givim bikpela bless long mak bilong mi, na em i kamap rich nau. Em i givim em sip, bulmakau, silva, gold, wokman, meri wok, kamel, na donki.

original: My master’s wife Sarah has borne him a son in her old age, and my master has given him everything he owns.
translation: Meri bilong bikman sarah im birim pikinini long en long taim em i go daun, na bikman im givim evri samting we em i gat long en.

original: My master made me swear an oath and said, ‘You shall not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites in whose land I dwell,
translation: Bos bilong mi me wari long ath, na em tok olsem, 'Yu no ken kisim meri bilong pikinini bilong mi long kanam Kanani, long graun em mi stap.

original: but you shall go to my father’s house and to my kindred to take a wife for my son.’
translation: Bipo, yu ken go long haus bilong papa bilong mi, na long ol wantok bilong mi, na kisim meri bilong pikinini bilong mi.

original: Then I asked my master, ‘What if the woman will not come back with me?’
translation: Mi askim maser bilong mi, sapos meri i no kam bek gen long me?

original: And he told me, ‘The LORD, before whom I have walked, will send His angel with you and make your journey a success, so that you may take a wife for my son from my kindred and from my father’s house.
translation: Na em i tokim mi, Bikpela, we bilong mi i go behain, baim i sendim enjiel bilong em wantaim yu, na wokim rot bilong yu i kamap strong, so yu ken kisim meri long wantok bilong mi, long brata na susa bilong mi, long haus bilong papa bilong mi, meri bilong pikinini blong mi.

original: And when you go to my kindred, if they refuse to give her to you, then you will be released from my oath.’
translation: Na em yu go long ol famili bilong mi, sapos ol i no givim meri bilong yu, orait, bai yu ken fri long promis bilong mi.

original: So when I came to the spring today, I prayed: O LORD, God of my master Abraham, if only You would make my journey a success!
translation: Taim mi go kam long wata spring tude, mi mekim prea: O Bikpela, Bikpela bilong Bos Abram, mi laikim olsem bikos yu tok save long mi, na yu mas helpim mi, makim wokabaut bilong mi i kamap strong!

original: Here I am, standing beside this spring. Now if a maiden comes out to draw water and I say to her, ‘Please let me drink a little water from your jar,’
translation: Mi stap klostu long dispela wata. Nau if meri i kam aut long draim wata na mi tokim em, 'Mipela i drinkim liklik wata long jar bilong yu,'

original: and she replies, ‘Drink, and I will draw water for your camels as well,’ may she be the woman the LORD has appointed for my master’s son.
translation: Na em i tok bek, ‘Dringim, na mi bai kirapim wara long camel bilong yu tu,’ em ina bai meri ia we Papa God i bin ordim long pikinini bilong bos.

original: And before I had finished praying in my heart, there was Rebekah coming out with her jar on her shoulder, and she went down to the spring and drew water. So I said to her, ‘Please give me a drink.’
translation: Na bipo nau mi pinis praing long het bilong mi, Rebekah i kam aut wantaim bilong en jar long shoulder bilong en, na em i go daun i go long wanpela spring na draiim water. Na mi tokim em, ‘Givim mi dring.’

original: She quickly lowered her jar from her shoulder and said, ‘Drink, and I will water your camels as well.’ So I drank, and she also watered the camels.
translation: Em i kisim bekim na kilim i daun quan em i tok, ‘Dring, na mi bai givim wara long ol kamel bilong yu.’ So mi dring, na em i tu givim wara long ol kamel.

original: Then I asked her, ‘Whose daughter are you?’ She replied, ‘The daughter of Bethuel son of Nahor, whom Milcah bore to him.’ So I put the ring on her nose and the bracelets on her wrists.
translation: Mi askim em, 'Wos dota yu?' Em i tok bek, 'Mi dota Betuel, pikinini blo Nahor, we Milka i karim i kam long en.' Na mi putim rin long nos bilong en, na braset long ol arm bilong en.

original: Then I bowed down and worshiped the LORD; and I blessed the LORD, the God of my master Abraham, who led me on the right road to take the granddaughter of my master’s brother for his son.
translation: Na mi klosim ai na wosipim Lod, na mi givim thank yu long Lod, God bilong papa bilong Abraham, em i bringim mi long rot bilong tru olsem tekim daugta bilong brata bilong papa bilong mi olsem meri bilong pikinini bilong em.

original: Now if you will show kindness and faithfulness to my master, tell me; but if not, let me know, so that I may go elsewhere.”
translation: Sapos yu ken showim gutpela na trutru long bos bilong mi, tokim mi; nogat, givim mi save, naso mi ken go long narapela hap.

original: Laban and Bethuel answered, “This is from the LORD; we have no choice in the matter.
translation: Laban na Bethuel i tok, "Dispela i kam bek long Holi Spirit, mipela i no inap makim desision long dispela matar."

original: Rebekah is here before you. Take her and go, and let her become the wife of your master’s son, just as the LORD has decreed.”
translation: Ribeka i stap here long ples bilong yu. Kisim em na go, na em inap i kamap meri bilong Pikinini bilong bos bilong yu, olsem GOD i tok.

original: When Abraham’s servant heard their words, he bowed down to the ground before the LORD.
translation: Wokman bilong Abraham harim tok ples, em i go daun klostu long graun bifor ai bilong GOD.

original: Then he brought out jewels of silver and gold, and articles of clothing, and he gave them to Rebekah. He also gave precious gifts to her brother and her mother.
translation: Na em kisim oltabot jewelry silva na gold, klos na rags, na givim long Rebekah. Em tu givim olgeta samting presus long brata bilong en na mama bilong en, olsem gif we i presus tru long ol.

original: Then he and the men with him ate and drank and spent the night there. When they got up the next morning, he said, “Send me on my way to my master.”
translation: Na em na ol man i kam wantaim em, ol i kaikai na dram na stap ol nait. Kamap bek long moning next dei, em i tok, “Sindim mi go long Bos bilong me.”

original: But her brother and mother said, “Let the girl remain with us ten days or so. After that, she may go.”
translation: Brata na mama i tok, "Kisim meri i stap wantaim mipela long wanpela wik o sem. Bihaen long dispela, em bai i go."

original: But he replied, “Do not delay me, since the LORD has made my journey a success. Send me on my way so that I may go to my master.”
translation: Em i tok bek, “Yu no ken holim mi bak, bikos Papa God i mekim wokabaut bilong mi wins. Yu salim mi i go, na mi go long bos bilong mi.”

original: So they said, “We will call the girl and ask her opinion.”
translation: Ol i tok, "Mipela bai kisim meri i kam, na mipela bai tanim tok bilong meri."

original: They called Rebekah and asked her, “Will you go with this man?” “I will go,” she replied.
translation: Ol i kolim Rebeka na ol i askim her, "Yu bai go wantaim man ini?" "Mi bai go," ol i harim tok bilong Rebeka.

original: So they sent their sister Rebekah on her way, along with her nurse and Abraham’s servant and his men.
translation: Ol i kirapim susa Rebekah i go, wantaim nus bilong en, na servant bilong Abraham, na ol man bilong en.

original: And they blessed Rebekah and said to her, “Our sister, may you become the mother of thousands upon thousands. May your offspring possess the gates of their enemies.”
translation: Na ol i givim bikim Rebekah, ol i tokim em, "Susa, yu yet kamap mama bilong tausens na tausens. Mipela i laik ol pikinini bilong yu bai kisim gaten bilong ol eni."

original: Then Rebekah and her servant girls got ready, mounted the camels, and followed the man. So the servant took Rebekah and left.
translation: Na Rebeka wantaim gels we i wok servos ol i redei, ol i sindaun long kamel, na ol i folowa man we i wok servos. Bai servant man i kisim Rebeka na lus.

original: Now Isaac had just returned from Beer-lahai-roi, for he was living in the Negev.
translation: Na Aisak emapim lo return long wes from Bia-lahai-roi, bikos em i stap long plaun Negewi.

original: Early in the evening, Isaac went out to the field to meditate, and looking up, he saw the camels approaching.
translation: Long bai i go apinun, Isak i go aut long bus, na i luk i go hap, na i si ol kamel i kom.

original: And when Rebekah looked up and saw Isaac, she got down from her camel
translation: Na Ribeka i lukup, i sikim Isak, na em i kambek dawn long kamel.

original: and asked the servant, “Who is that man in the field coming to meet us?” “It is my master,” the servant answered. So she took her veil and covered herself.
translation: Na em i askim hausboi, "Husat man i kam i go long ples, i kam mekim welkam long yumi?" "Em i bos bilong mi," hausboi i tok. Na meri i kisim bilum bilong en na i kovara pes bilong en.

original: Then the servant told Isaac all that he had done.
translation: Na servan i tokim Isak olgeta samting em i mekim.

original: And Isaac brought her into the tent of his mother Sarah and took Rebekah as his wife. And Isaac loved her and was comforted after his mother’s death.
translation: Na Aisak i bringim Rebeka i go insait long haus bilong mama Sara, na em i kisim Rebeka olsem meri bilong em. Na Aisak i lakim em, na em i kamap strong gen after mama bilong em, Sara, i dai.

original: Now Abraham had taken another wife, named Keturah,
translation: Abaraham i kisim meri nupela, em i kolim Keturah.

original: and she bore him Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, and Shuah.
translation: Na em i karim Zimran, Jokshan, Medan, Midian, Ishbak, na Shuah.

original: Jokshan was the father of Sheba and Dedan. And the sons of Dedan were the Asshurites, the Letushites, and the Leummites.
translation: Jokshan em papa bilong Siba na Dedan. Na pikinini bilong Dedan i gat Ol Asshurites, Ol Letushites, na Ol Leummites.

original: The sons of Midian were Ephah, Epher, Hanoch, Abida, and Eldaah. All these were descendants of Keturah.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Midian em i Epha, Efer, Hanok, Abida, na Eldaah. Ol dispela i kam bilong Keturah.

original: Abraham left everything he owned to Isaac.
translation: Abram levi olgeta samting bilong en, na em i givim olgeta long Isak.

original: But while he was still alive, Abraham gave gifts to the sons of his concubines and sent them away from his son Isaac to the land of the east.
translation: Bai wail em i stap yet, Abraham i givim gif long pikinini bilong meri wara na i rausim ol longwei long pikinini Isaac, ol i go long kantri bilong east.

original: Abraham lived a total of 175 years.
translation: Abram i stap olgeta 175 yia.

original: And at a ripe old age he breathed his last and died, old and contented, and was gathered to his people.
translation: Na em i go long taim igo pinis, em i lusim win blong en na i dai, em i go long taim na em i amamas, na em i kamap wantaim ol papa bilong en.

original: His sons Isaac and Ishmael buried him in the cave of Machpelah near Mamre, in the field of Ephron son of Zohar the Hittite.
translation: Susa bilong em, Isaak na Ishmael, i kisim em i go wai long graun long hole bilong Machpelah nambis Mamre, long ples bilong Ephron pikinini bilong Zohar Hiti.

original: This was the field that Abraham had bought from the Hittites. Abraham was buried there with his wife Sarah.
translation: Em i ples bilong Abram, Abram baim ples ia long Hiti. Abram na meri bilong em, Sara, ol i go daun long graun ole geta long ples ia.

original: After Abraham’s death, God blessed his son Isaac, who lived near Beer-lahai-roi.
translation: Long taim Abraham i dai pinis, God i givim blesing long pikinini bilong en Isaac, we em i stap klostu long Beer-lahai-roi.

original: This is the account of Abraham’s son Ishmael, whom Hagar the Egyptian, Sarah’s maidservant, bore to Abraham.
translation: Stori bilong pikinini Abraham, Ishmael, we Hagar hausmeri bilong Sara, meri Egypt i karim bek long Abraham.

original: These are the names of the sons of Ishmael in the order of their birth: Nebaioth the firstborn of Ishmael, then Kedar, Adbeel, Mibsam,
translation: Dispela nem bilong pikinini man meri bilong Ismael i kam long dispela ordanem bilong bith: Nebaiot em i bikpela pikinini bilong bith bilong Ismael, na bihain Kedar, Adbiel, Mibsam.

original: Mishma, Dumah, Massa,
translation: Mishma, Dumah, Massa, ol i nem bilong ples i kam long famili bilong Abraham.

original: Hadad, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, and Kedemah.
translation: Hadad, Tema, Jetur, Naphish, na Kedemah.

original: These were the sons of Ishmael, and these were their names by their villages and encampments—twelve princes of their tribes.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Ishmael, na ol nem bilong ol long ples na ol wail em ol save stap – twelev pipol i save lidim ol trib long ol.

original: Ishmael lived a total of 137 years. Then he breathed his last and died, and was gathered to his people.
translation: Ismael i stap 137 yia, na bai em i pusim win bilong en, na bai em i dai pinis, na em i kamap wantaim ol papa bilong en.

original: Ishmael’s descendants settled from Havilah to Shur, which is near the border of Egypt as you go toward Asshur. And they lived in hostility toward all their brothers.
translation: Ol desenden bilong Ismael i go sindaun long Havila kas ol i kam inap long Sua, we i klostu long boda bilong Ijip ol i go long sait bilong Asiria. Na ol i stap long kaikai nogut long ol bratas bilong ol.

original: This is the account of Abraham’s son Isaac. Abraham became the father of Isaac,
translation: Dispela em i stori bilong Aisak, pikinini bilong Abraham. Abraham i kamap papa bilong Aisak.

original: and Isaac was forty years old when he married Rebekah, the daughter of Bethuel the Aramean from Paddan-aram and the sister of Laban the Aramean.
translation: Na Isaac em i 40 yia na em i marit wantaim Rebeka, daughta bilong Betuel man Aramenia long hap bilong Paddan-aram, na susa bilong Laban man Aramenia.

original: Later, Isaac prayed to the LORD on behalf of his wife, because she was barren. And the LORD heard his prayer, and his wife Rebekah conceived.
translation: Bihain, Isak i praikim long Lod long han bilong meri bilong em, bekas meri bilong em i no inap bringim pikinini. Na Lod i harim praik bilong em, na meri bilong em Rebeka i kamap bigbel.

original: But the children inside her struggled with each other, and she said, “Why is this happening to me?” So Rebekah went to inquire of the LORD,
translation: Bikos pikinini i go harim i spak long insait bilong em, na em i tok, “Wanem olsem nau i kam long me?” Na Rebekah i go askim LORD.

original: and He declared to her: “Two nations are in your womb, and two peoples from within you will be separated; one people will be stronger than the other, and the older will serve the younger.”
translation: Em i tokim olsem long em: "Tupela nesen i stap inside bel bilong yu, na tupela grup bilong man i kamap long insaet bilong yu, na bai tupela i tanim i go ap; wanpela grup bai i strongpela na be Tupela i no samting, na braata olgeta bai i wark long han bilong litorol."

original: When her time came to give birth, there were indeed twins in her womb.
translation: Taim bilong em i kam bek gen long karim pikinini, na tru, tupela pikinini i stap insait long bel bilong em.

original: The first one came out red, covered with hair like a fur coat; so they named him Esau.
translation: Em i kamap nau, rek na klosim sking long en olsem kot bilong gras, na ol i givim nem long em, Esau.

original: After this, his brother came out grasping Esau’s heel; so he was named Jacob. And Isaac was sixty years old when the twins were born.
translation: Na bihaen long dispela, brata bilong em i kam aus, na em i kamap long hap bilong Esau, olsem na ol i givim em nem Jacob. Na Isaac i gat siksis yia taim twinpela i kam born.

original: When the boys grew up, Esau became a skillful hunter, a man of the field, while Jacob was a quiet man who stayed at home.
translation: Taim pikinini i go big nau, Esau i kamap strong long hanting, em i man bilong bus, wail Jacob em i man bilong ples quiet, i stap hap kas.

original: Because Isaac had a taste for wild game, he loved Esau; but Rebekah loved Jacob.
translation: Bikos Aisak i gat laik long kan mit, em i lavim Esau; tasol Rebekah em i lavim Jakob.

original: One day, while Jacob was cooking some stew, Esau came in from the field and was famished.
translation: Wanpela de, wail Jacob i kukim sop long mumu, Esau i kam insait from ples gras na i belisik tumas.

original: He said to Jacob, “Let me eat some of that red stew, for I am famished.” (That is why he was also called Edom.)
translation: Em i tokim Jacob, “Mipela i kaikai olsem samting bilong red stew ya, long bikos mi bel isakal.” (Oli birua em Edom).

original: “First sell me your birthright,” Jacob replied.
translation: “Pastaim yu salim mi birthrait bilong yu,” Jacob i tok.

original: “Look,” said Esau, “I am about to die, so what good is a birthright to me?”
translation: “Lukim,” tok Esau, “Mi go nau dai, bai wanem gutpela bikos long mi rait bilong bipo?”

original: “Swear to me first,” Jacob said. So Esau swore to Jacob and sold him the birthright.
translation: “Kisim oth long me pas,” Yakob i tok. Na Esau i kisim oth long Yakob na selim birthroat, em dinau bilong bipo, long em.

original: Then Jacob gave some bread and lentil stew to Esau, who ate and drank and then got up and went away. Thus Esau despised his birthright.
translation: Na bihain Yakob i givim baun na stui bilong lentil long Esau, na em i kaikai na dring, na bihain em i kamdaun na i go we. Olsem nau Esau i lusim rait bilong en long kantri.

original: Now there was another famine in the land, subsequent to the one that had occurred in Abraham’s time. And Isaac went to Abimelech king of the Philistines at Gerar.
translation: Na i kam bek long namba tu famine bihaen long dispela we i bin katim long taim bilong Abraham. Na Isaac i go long Abimelech king bilong Filistia long Gerar.

original: The LORD appeared to Isaac and said, “Do not go down to Egypt. Settle in the land where I tell you.
translation: Papa God i kamap long Isaac na tokim em, “Yu no go daun long Egip. Kam daun, bai yu stat long kantri we mi tokim yu.”

original: Stay in this land as a foreigner, and I will be with you and bless you. For I will give all these lands to you and your offspring, and I will confirm the oath that I swore to your father Abraham.
translation: Stap long kantri bilong oderea olsem man i kam bek long ples anor, mi stap wantaim yu na blesim yu. Mi givim yu na pikinini bilong yu olgeta dispela kantry, na mi strongim promis nau we mi promisim tata bilong yu, Abraham.

original: I will make your descendants as numerous as the stars in the sky, and I will give them all these lands, and through your offspring all nations of the earth will be blessed,
translation: Mi bai mekim ol desenden bilong yu olsem plenti olsem sta bilong heven, na mi bai givim olgeta dispela lains bilong yumi, na olsem long ol pikinini bilong yu, olgeta nesen bilong graun bai kisim blessing.

original: because Abraham listened to My voice and kept My charge, My commandments, My statutes, and My laws.”
translation: Bikos Abraham harim tok bilong Mi na kisim karem wok bilong Mi, komando bilong Mi, statut bilong Mi, na lo bilong Mi.

original: So Isaac settled in Gerar.
translation: Na Aisak istap long ples Gerar.

original: But when the men of that place asked about his wife, he said, “She is my sister.” For he was afraid to say, “She is my wife,” since he thought to himself, “The men of this place will kill me on account of Rebekah, because she is so beautiful.”
translation: Taim ol man bilong ples ia askim em about meri bilong en, em i tok, 'Em i susa bilong me', em i bin pored long tok "Em i meri bilong me" wantaim em i ting long en himself, "Ol man bilong dispela ples bai kilim mi bilong Rebeka, bekas em i swit moa olgeta."

original: When Isaac had been there a long time, Abimelech king of the Philistines looked down from the window and was surprised to see Isaac caressing his wife Rebekah.
translation: Wanpela taim Isaak i stap long ples ia, Abimelek king bilong Filistia i luk daun from windoa na i amaze long harim Isaak i kirapim meri bilong en Rebeka.

original: Abimelech sent for Isaac and said, “So she is really your wife! How could you say, ‘She is my sister’?” Isaac replied, “Because I thought I might die on account of her.”
translation: Abimelech i go bekim Isaac, i tokim Isaac olsem, "Em i meri bilong yu, tasol yu bin tokim olsem 'em i susa bilong mi'? " Isaac ibekim olsem, "Bikos mi bin tingim bai mi dai bilong em."

original: “What is this you have done to us?” asked Abimelech. “One of the people could easily have slept with your wife, and you would have brought guilt upon us.”
translation: Abimelech i askim, "Wanem samting yu mekim long mipela? I gat posibol wanpela man i koikai wantaim meri bilong yu, na yu bai bringim bagarap long mipela."

original: So Abimelech warned all the people, saying, “Whoever harms this man or his wife will surely be put to death.”
translation: Na Abimelek i givim waning long olgeta pipol, olsem: "Husait i bagarapim man ia o meri bilong em, bai i dai pinis."

original: Now Isaac sowed seed in the land, and that very year he reaped a hundredfold. And the LORD blessed him,
translation: Na Isaak i planim pikinini long kantri, na em i kisim bikpela harvest long yia ia, olsem 100 fac. Na LORD i givim blesing long em.

original: and he became richer and richer, until he was exceedingly wealthy.
translation: Na em i kamap rik moa na moa, olsem na em i bihain i kamap man bilong moni tru.

original: He owned so many flocks and herds and servants that the Philistines envied him.
translation: Em i gat planti ol kanu na ol bulmakau na ol wokman, olsem nau ol Filisti i sikim em.

original: So the Philistines took dirt and stopped up all the wells that his father’s servants had dug in the days of his father Abraham.
translation: Filistia i takim mati na klosim olgeta wels ol husat servis bilong papa ibin digim long taim bilong papa Abraham.

original: Then Abimelech said to Isaac, “Depart from us, for you are much too powerful for us.”
translation: Abimelek i tokim Ysak long toktok, "Kam daun na lusim mipela, yu strong tumas, yu bikpela na yu klostu long mipela."

original: So Isaac left that place and encamped in the Valley of Gerar and settled there.
translation: Na Aisak lusim ples we na kam pikinim long Velley bilong Gerar, na stap we long hap.

original: Isaac reopened the wells that had been dug in the days of his father Abraham, which the Philistines had stopped up after Abraham died. And he gave these wells the same names his father had given them.
translation: Aisak i opim gen wel bilong ol igen em i bin mekim long taim bilong papa Abraham, wel ol Filistia i kamapim klostu afta Abraham i dai pinis. Na em i givim dispela wel ol nem olsem papa bilong em Abraham i bin givim ol.

original: Then Isaac’s servants dug in the valley and found a well of fresh water there.
translation: Wokman bilong Isak ol i digim long vali na ol i kisim wanpela bun wel bilong wara fres long hap dere.

original: But the herdsmen of Gerar quarreled with Isaac’s herdsmen and said, “The water is ours!” So he named the well Esek, because they contended with him.
translation: Ol man i save lukautim ol pikinini long Gerar i kros long ol man i save lukautim ol pikinini bilong Isak, ol i tok, "Wara i bilong mipela!" Na em i givim nem 'Esek' long wara, long ol i bagarap long en.

original: Then they dug another well and quarreled over that one also; so he named it Sitnah.
translation: Ol i digim another wél, na ol i kros long em, na em i givim nem Sitnah long em.

original: He moved on from there and dug another well, and they did not quarrel over it. He named it Rehoboth and said, “At last the LORD has made room for us, and we will be fruitful in the land.”
translation: Em i go bek long hap bilong en, em i digim another wel, na ol i no gat pikinini long em. Em i givim nem bilong en Rehoboth na em i tok, "LORD i makim rum bilong mipela, na mipela i kamap strong na abondans long kantri."

original: From there Isaac went up to Beersheba,
translation: Baiande Aisak i go ap long Beersheba,

original: and that night the LORD appeared to him and said, “I am the God of your father Abraham. Do not be afraid, for I am with you. I will bless you and multiply your descendants for the sake of My servant Abraham.”
translation: Na nitim em i go, LORD i kamap long em na tokim em, "Mi God bilong papa Abraham. No ken kirap, no tingim, long mi stap wantaim yu. Mi bai givim yu blessin na mi bai multiplicem ol desenden bilong yu, long servise bilong servant Abraham."

original: So Isaac built an altar there and called on the name of the LORD, and he pitched his tent there. His servants also dug a well there.
translation: Na Aisak im mekim wanpela ait bilong ofa hap bilong en, na im kalim nem bilong GOD, na im pitim haus bilong trabel hap bilong en. Wokmanmeri bilong en i digim wan wàn water hap bilong en.

original: Later, Abimelech came to Isaac from Gerar, with Ahuzzath his adviser and Phicol the commander of his army.
translation: Bihain, Abimelech king bilong Filistia i kam long Isaac figa bilong Abraham, wantaim Ahuzzath adevisa bilong em na Phicol komanda bilong plesen bilong en, from Gerar.

original: “Why have you come to me?” Isaac asked them. “You hated me and sent me away.”
translation: Isaak i askim ol: “Wai yus i kam long me?” “Yus i bagarapim me na rausim me.”

original: “We can plainly see that the LORD has been with you,” they replied. “We recommend that there should now be an oath between us and you. Let us make a covenant with you
translation: Mipela i klarim gut olsem Bikpela i stap wantaim yu, ol i tokim olsem. Mipela i rekomendim olsem i mas pinis nau oleka i kamap longpela bipela mipela na yu. Mipela i mekim iles wantaim yu.

original: that you will not harm us, just as we have not harmed you but have done only good to you, sending you on your way in peace. And now you are blessed by the LORD.”
translation: Mipela hop iyu no ken harmim mipela, olsem nau mipela i no harmim yumi, bikos mipela mekim gutpela wok long yupela, na mipela lusim yupela go long peis. Na nau yupela i blessim long han bilong LORD.

original: So Isaac prepared a feast for them, and they ate and drank.
translation: Na Aisak wokim kaikai bilong bikpela de, na ol i kaikai na dring.

original: And they got up early the next morning and swore an oath to each other. Then Isaac sent them on their way, and they left him in peace.
translation: Na ol i go ap long taim bikos bihain, na ol i tek olegis wan towa. Em i sendim ol i go, na ol i lusim em long peis.

original: On that same day, Isaac’s servants came and told him about the well they had dug. “We have found water!” they told him.
translation: Long dispela dei, sarvis blo Isaac i kam na toktok long em, ol i tok: "Ol i kolim wanpela wel, na ol i kisim wara!" ol i toktok long em.

original: So he called it Shibah, and to this day the name of the city is Beersheba.
translation: Na em i kolim olsem Shibah, na inap long tede nama bilong taun em i Beersheba.

original: When Esau was forty years old, he took as his wives Judith daughter of Beeri the Hittite and Basemath daughter of Elon the Hittite.
translation: Taim Esau em i 40 yia, em i go marit na em i kisim Judith meri bilong Beeri Hiti na Basemath meri bilong Elon Hiti olsem wives bilong en.

original: And they brought grief to Isaac and Rebekah.
translation: Ol i kisim sorere i go long han bilong Isak na Ribeka.

original: When Isaac was old and his eyes were so weak that he could no longer see, he called his older son Esau and said to him, “My son.” “Here I am,” Esau replied.
translation: Taim Isaak i bikim olsem lapun, na ai bilong en i no strong tumas, en no ina save luk luk gen, na em i kolim pikinini blong en, Esau, em i bikpela, em tokim em, 'Pikinini.' 'Mipela i stap,' Esau i tok bek.

original: “Look,” said Isaac, “I am now old, and I do not know the day of my death.
translation: “Lukim,” i tok olsem Isak, “mi nau i pikinini i go long taim, na mi no save hariap long de bilong mi dai.”

original: Take your weapons—your quiver and bow—and go out into the field to hunt some game for me.
translation: Kisim banu na bilum bilong aruw, na go long bus, waid long ples bilong yu, na paitim kai bilong mi.

original: Then prepare a tasty dish that I love and bring it to me to eat, so that I may bless you before I die.”
translation: Kirapim ka moninga swit, bringim i kam long me nau na kaikai, bilong me blesim yu bifora mi dai.

original: Now Rebekah was listening to what Isaac told his son Esau. So when Esau went into the field to hunt game and bring it back,
translation: Nau Rebekah i harim tok bilong Isaac em i tokim pikinini Esau bilong en. Na bihain long taem Esau i go hetim kan long bus, ili bringim i kam,

original: Rebekah said to her son Jacob, “Behold, I overheard your father saying to your brother Esau,
translation: Ribeka i tokim pikinini Jacob, “Luukim, mi harim papa bilong yu i tok long brata bilong yu Esau,”

original: ‘Bring me some game and prepare me a tasty dish to eat, so that I may bless you in the presence of the LORD before I die.’
translation: Kisim kaikai bilong bus i kam long me, prepaem kaikai naispela i go long me eat, bilong me blesim yu long ai bilong LORD bifora mi dai.

original: Now, my son, listen to my voice and do exactly as I tell you.
translation: Nau, pikinami, harim tok bilong mi na wokakim olgeta samting we mi tokim yu.

original: Go out to the flock and bring me two choice young goats, so that I can make them into a tasty dish for your father—the kind he loves.
translation: Go long na i go bek long ol pikinini bilong yapala, bringim mi tu pikinini goat we i gat gutpela flesh, na meikim olsem ka we i swit moa, kain we em i laikim, long papa bilong yu.

original: Then take it to your father to eat, so that he may bless you before he dies.”
translation: Kisim i go long papa bilong yu, na ol i kaikai, nau em bai givim yu bles bifor em i dai.

original: Jacob answered his mother Rebekah, “Look, my brother Esau is a hairy man, but I am smooth-skinned.
translation: Yakob i tokim mama bilong em, "Lukim, brata bilong mi Esau em i man bilong bus, gras i pulap long skin bilong em, tasol mi skin bilong mi i skinglas."

original: What if my father touches me? Then I would be revealed to him as a deceiver, and I would bring upon myself a curse rather than a blessing.”
translation: Sapos papa bilong me kam tetchim mi, orait mi bai i kam klia long em olsem narapela man i no gat tru, na mi bai i bringim bek long mi katig o poisen, nogat olsem blesin.

original: His mother replied, “Your curse be on me, my son. Just obey my voice and go get them for me.”
translation: Mama bilong em i tok bek, “Kros blong yu i stap long me, pikinini man. Harim na bilipim vosis blong me, go kisim ol i kam long me.”

original: So Jacob went and got two goats and brought them to his mother, who made the tasty food his father loved.
translation: Na Jacob i go na kisim tupela goat na bringim ol long mama bilong en, na mama i mekim kaikai i swit moa we papa bilong en i laik tru.

original: And Rebekah took the finest clothes in the house that belonged to her older son Esau, and she put them on her younger son Jacob.
translation: Na Rebekah i kisim klotes nambawan husat i stap long haus, em i bilong pikinini bipo Esau, na em i putim long pikinini bilong en, Jacob.

original: She also put the skins of the young goats on his hands and on the smooth part of his neck.
translation: Na em putim skins bilong kid goats long han bilong en na long nek bilong en, we i kamap smat.

original: Then she handed her son Jacob the tasty food and bread she had made.
translation: Na em i givim Jakob pikinini bilong em ka bilong kai switpela na bret ol samting em i mekim.

original: So Jacob went to his father and said, “My father.” “Here I am!” he answered. “Which one are you, my son?”
translation: Na Jakob i go long papa bilong en, ol tok, "Papa bilong mi." Ol tok bek, "Mi stap hare." "Yu husat, pikinini bilong mi?"

original: Jacob said to his father, “I am Esau, your firstborn. I have done as you told me. Please sit up and eat some of my game, so that you may bless me.”
translation: Yakob i tokim papa bilong em, "Mi Esau, pikinini namba wan bilong yu. Mi wokim olgeta samting yu tokim mi. Plezi sindaun na hamamas long sampela kai bilong mi, bilong yu inap givim bless long me."

original: But Isaac asked his son, “How did you ever find it so quickly, my son?” “Because the LORD your God brought it to me,” he replied.
translation: Isak i askim pikinini bilong em, "Yu finim dispela samting long wanpela taim, pikinini bilong me?" "Bikos Lorden God bilong yu, em bringim i kam long me," na em i tok.

original: Then Isaac said to Jacob, “Please come closer so I can touch you, my son. Are you really my son Esau, or not?”
translation: Na Isaac i tokim Jacob olsem, "Kam klostu na mi inap tachim yu, pikinini bilong me. Yu tru wanpela pikinini bilong me Esau, o nogat?"

original: So Jacob came close to his father Isaac, who touched him and said, “The voice is the voice of Jacob, but the hands are the hands of Esau.”
translation: Namba wan, Jakob i kam klostu long papa bilong en, Isaak, na i tekim em na i tokim em olsem, "Vois bilong dispela i vois bilong Jakob, tasol han bilong dispela i han bilong Esau."

original: Isaac did not recognize him, because his hands were hairy like those of his brother Esau; so he blessed him.
translation: Isaac i no save longen em, wantaim han bilong em i kus olsem han bilong brata Esau, na em i givim blesing long em.

original: Again he asked, “Are you really my son Esau?” And he replied, “I am.”
translation: Em i askim gen, "Yu tru son bilong me Esau?" Na em i mekim olsem, "Mi Tru."

original: “Serve me,” said Isaac, “and let me eat some of my son’s game, so that I may bless you.” Jacob brought it to him, and he ate; then he brought him wine, and he drank.
translation: Isak i tok, "Serim mi, na givim mi kaikai long kai bilong yu, pikinini bilong mi, na bai mi blesim yu." Yakob i brum i kam long em, na em i kai kai; olsem na em i brum wain i kam long em, na em i dring.

original: Then his father Isaac said to him, “Please come near and kiss me, my son.”
translation: Na papa Isak i tokim em olsem, "Kam klostu, na baisim mi, pikinini bilong yu."

original: So he came near and kissed him. When Isaac smelled his clothing, he blessed him and said: “Ah, the smell of my son is like the smell of a field that the LORD has blessed.
translation: Na em i kam klostu na kisim em. Na Isaac i smel klos bilong en, na em i givim blesing long em na tok: "Ah, smel bilong pikinini belong me olsem smel bilong graun we LORD i blessim."

original: May God give to you the dew of heaven and the richness of the earth—an abundance of grain and new wine.
translation: GOD bai givim yu reni bilong heven na planti ka bilong graun – plenti grain na wain nupela.

original: May peoples serve you and nations bow down to you. May you be the master of your brothers, and may the sons of your mother bow down to you. May those who curse you be cursed, and those who bless you be blessed.”
translation: Ol pipel i servim yu, na ol nesen i kona idaun long yu. Yu stap bos bilong brata bilong yu, na ol pikinini bilong mama bilong yu i kona idaun long yu. Ol dispela i kurse yu, bai ol i kurse, na ol dispela i blesim yu, bai ol i blesim.

original: As soon as Isaac had finished blessing him and Jacob had left his father’s presence, his brother Esau returned from the hunt.
translation: Olsem wanpela taim Yacobu finisim bikim bekim Aisak na Yakob lusim husat papa bilong em i stap, brata bilong em Esau i kam bek long han bilong em.

original: He too made some tasty food, brought it to his father, and said to him, “My father, sit up and eat of your son’s game, so that you may bless me.”
translation: Em i mekim kaikai i swit moa, na bungim i go long papa bilong en, na em i tokim papa bilong en olsem, "Papa bilong mi, kam daun na kaikai bilong animal bilong bus bilong pikinini bilong yu, ole Kem bilev yu inap givim blessing long mi."

original: But his father Isaac replied, “Who are you?” “I am Esau, your firstborn son,” he answered.
translation: Bap Isak i tokim, “Hu yu?” “Mi Esau, pikinini bilong yu em i kam first,” itok.

original: Isaac began to tremble violently and said, “Who was it, then, who hunted the game and brought it to me? Before you came in, I ate it all and blessed him—and indeed, he will be blessed!”
translation: Isak i statim skelim strong na tok, "Husat i bin hetim kanu na kamo, bringim i kam long me? Bifora yu kam insait, mi kai kilim olgeta na mi givim bikpela tanim long em - tru indeed, em bai stap i blessed!"

original: When Esau heard his father’s words, he let out a loud and bitter cry and said to his father, “Bless me too, O my father!”
translation: Taim Esau harim tok bilong papa bilong en, i kirap strong na i singsing olsem wanpela man i sori tru, na i tokim papa bilong en, "Givim blesing long me tu, O papa bilong mi!"

original: But Isaac replied, “Your brother came deceitfully and took your blessing.”
translation: Aisak i tok bek, “Brata bilong yu i kam na i bin givim bikpela kileng, na i takim bereis bilong yu long ol sem.”

original: So Esau declared, “Is he not rightly named Jacob? For he has cheated me twice. He took my birthright, and now he has taken my blessing.” Then he asked, “Haven’t you saved a blessing for me?”
translation: Esau i tok olsem, "Em i no usait long nem Jacob? Em i bikim bilip long me twice. Em i takim raite bilong me, na nau em i kisim blesing bilong me." Na em i askim, "Inap yu no save wanim blesing bilong me?"

original: But Isaac answered Esau: “Look, I have made him your master and given him all his relatives as servants; I have sustained him with grain and new wine. What is left that I can do for you, my son?”
translation: Bareta, Isaak i tokim Esau: "Luke, mi bin mekim em i bos bilong yu, na mi bin givim ol famili bilong em olsem servis man long em; mi bin sapotim em wantaim ka na wain nupela. Oli samting we mi ken mekim gen long yu, em wei, pikinini bilong mi?"

original: Esau said to his father, “Do you have only one blessing, my father? Bless me too, O my father!” Then Esau wept aloud.
translation: Esau i tokim papa bilong en, “Papa bilong mi, yu gat wanpela blesin tasol? Blessim mi tu, papa bilong mi!” Na Esau i krai olsem na sindaun i go daun.

original: His father Isaac answered him: “Behold, your dwelling place shall be away from the richness of the land, away from the dew of heaven above.
translation: Papa Isaac i tokim em: "Lukim, husat bilong yu stap, em bai stap long wei weel ples i no gat planti ka, long wei waris bilong heven i kamdaun from heven above."

original: You shall live by the sword and serve your brother. But when you rebel, you will tear his yoke from your neck.”
translation: Yu bai kaikaim nau long suwod, wokim servis long brata bilong yu. Baine yu no obadia, yu pulim yoke bilong em na kisim long nek bilong yu.”

original: Esau held a grudge against Jacob because of the blessing his father had given him. And Esau said in his heart, “The days of mourning for my father are at hand; then I will kill my brother Jacob.”
translation: Esau i bin holim bek long Jacob olsem bilong blessing ia papa ibin givim. Na Esau i tok long haret bilong en, “De po monin bilong papa mi i kam nau; orait bai mi kilim brata mi Jacob.”

original: When the words of her older son Esau were relayed to Rebekah, she sent for her younger son Jacob and told him, “Look, your brother Esau is consoling himself by plotting to kill you.
translation: Taim olsem wod long bikpela sut bilong Esau i kam bek, Rebeka em bai senem bos long pikinini sut Jacob, na em tokim em, "Bikpela brata bilong yu Esau i laik kilim yu tasol em i stap strongim het bilong en."

original: So now, my son, obey my voice and flee at once to my brother Laban in Haran.
translation: Nau, pikinini, harim tok bilong mi na runitaun na go longwe long brata Laban bilong mi long Haran.

original: Stay with him for a while, until your brother’s fury subsides—
translation: Bai yu stap wantaim em olsem long taim, na popoia bilong brata yuu i kamdaun.

original: until your brother’s rage against you wanes and he forgets what you have done to him. Then I will send for you and bring you back from there. Why should I lose both of you in one day?”
translation: Na ragemu bilong brata yumi i go daun, na em i foryetim ol samting yu mekim long em. Oltaim em i foryetim, mi bai sendim man i go bek long yu, na mi bai bringim yu i kam bek gen. Wai mi mas losim tupela yumi long wanpela de?

original: Then Rebekah said to Isaac, “I am weary of my life because of these Hittite women. If Jacob takes a Hittite wife from among them, what good is my life?”
translation: Rebekah i tokim Isaac, “Mi les long life bilong mi long ol meri Hiti. Jacob i kisim meri Hiti long ol, orait olgeta gutpela samting bilong life bilong mi istap we?”

original: So Isaac called for Jacob and blessed him. “Do not take a wife from the Canaanite women,” he commanded.
translation: Na Aisak i kolim Jakob, i givim blessing long em. I tokim em: "Yu no ken tek meri long kantri bilong Canaan,"

original: “Go at once to Paddan-aram, to the house of your mother’s father Bethuel, and take a wife from among the daughters of Laban, your mother’s brother.
translation: Go nau na go long Paddan-aram, long haus bilong Bethuel papa bilong mama, kisim meri long ol daughters bilong Laban, brata bilong mama.

original: May God Almighty bless you and make you fruitful and multiply you, so that you may become a company of peoples.
translation: Gott Bikpela i givim yu blesing na i mekim yu planim olsem na i multiplai yupela, na husat i mekim yupela i kamap olsem grin bilong ol pipol.

original: And may He give the blessing of Abraham to you and your descendants, so that you may possess the land where you dwell as a foreigner, the land God gave to Abraham.”
translation: Na em i givim blessing bilong Abrahamu long yu na ol desenden bilong yu, so yu ken kaikai graun na stap long hap yu stap olsem man i kam bihain, graun we God i givim long Abrahamu.

original: So Isaac sent Jacob to Paddan-aram, to Laban son of Bethuel the Aramean, the brother of Rebekah, who was the mother of Jacob and Esau.
translation: Na Isak i salim Jacob long Paddan-aram, stap go long Laban sut bilong Bethuel Aramia, em nau brata bilong Rebeka, mama bilong Jacob na Esau.

original: Now Esau learned that Isaac had blessed Jacob and sent him to Paddan-aram to take a wife there, commanding him, “Do not marry a Canaanite woman,”
translation: Nau Esau i save olsem Isaac im bin givim bless long Jacob, na im sendim i go long Paddan-aram ibin go lusim meri, skulim em: "Yu no ken marit mere kanan."

original: and that Jacob had obeyed his father and mother and gone to Paddan-aram.
translation: Na Jakob i bihainim papa na mama bilong en, na i go kamap long Paddan-aram.

original: And seeing that his father Isaac disapproved of the Canaanite women,
translation: Na olsem na, papa Isaac i no laikim meri bilong Kanaan,

original: Esau went to Ishmael and married Mahalath, the sister of Nebaioth and daughter of Abraham’s son Ishmael, in addition to the wives he already had.
translation: Esau i go kam lukim Ishmael na i maritim Mahalath, susa bilong Nebaioth, dai bilong Ishmael, pikinini bilong Abraham, olsem em i joinim ol meri em i gat bipo na.

original: Meanwhile Jacob left Beersheba and set out for Haran.
translation: Wail Jakob līvim Beersheba long baksait na i go kamap long Haran.

original: On reaching a certain place, he spent the night there because the sun had set. And taking one of the stones from that place, he put it under his head and lay down to sleep.
translation: Tukul i go long wanpela ples, na san i go daun, em i slip ol nait long hap. Na em i kisim wanpela ston long hap, em i putim leg i go aninit long hed bilong en na katim slip.

original: And Jacob had a dream about a ladder that rested on the earth with its top reaching up to heaven, and God’s angels were going up and down the ladder.
translation: Na Jakob em i gat drim long lada bilong klaimap, em i stap i go daun long graun, na igat top em i go ап long heven, na enjel bilong God ol i go ап na daun long lada.

original: And there at the top the LORD was standing and saying, “I am the LORD, the God of your father Abraham and the God of Isaac. I will give you and your descendants the land on which you now lie.
translation: Na long top em i stap, olsem bikos LORD i stap, em i tok, "Mi em i LORD, God bilong papa yu Abram na God bilong Isak. Mi bai givim yu na ol desenden yu kauntri we yu i laipas nau."

original: Your descendants will be like the dust of the earth, and you will spread out to the west and east and north and south. All the families of the earth will be blessed through you and your offspring.
translation: Ol desenden bilong yu bai kamap olsem aus bilong graun, na yu bai skatim i go long wes, ist, not na saut. Ol famili long graun oli bikosim threshen ol pikinini bilong yu.

original: Look, I am with you, and I will watch over you wherever you go, and I will bring you back to this land. For I will not leave you until I have done what I have promised you.”
translation: Luke, mi stap wantaim yu, na mi bai kakarim yu whe bilong yu go, na mi bai bringim yu bek long dispela lan. Bikos mi no lusim yu until mi mekim ol promis bilong mi i promisim yu.

original: When Jacob woke up, he thought, “Surely the LORD is in this place, and I was unaware of it.”
translation: Taim Jakob kisim i op, em ting: “Strongim LORD i stap long hap em, na mi no save long dispela.”

original: And he was afraid and said, “How awesome is this place! This is none other than the house of God; this is the gate of heaven!”
translation: Na em i stap afraid, na em tok olsem: "Em i wanpela ples we i gat bikpela respek! Dispela em i haus bilong God; dispela em i gaten bilong heven!"

original: Early the next morning, Jacob took the stone that he had placed under his head, and he set it up as a pillar. He poured oil on top of it,
translation: Bikos nem moning, Jacob kisim ston bilong hed i kisim, na em i putim i go olsem wanpela ston bilong sindaun. Na em i kirapim oil antap long en.

original: and he called that place Bethel, though previously the city had been named Luz.
translation: Na em i kolim ples ya Betel, maski bipo taun ya i gat nem Lus.

original: Then Jacob made a vow, saying, “If God will be with me and watch over me on this journey, and if He will provide me with food to eat and clothes to wear,
translation: Na Jakob i makolim vov, ol i tok, “Bai God i stap wantaim mi, yu ken lukautim mi long dispela jurney, na bai yu givim mi kaikai long kaikai na klot long werarim,”

original: so that I may return safely to my father’s house, then the LORD will be my God.
translation: Inap long me katim bek long hus bilong papa bilong me, na LORD bai i stap kamap olsem God bilong me.

original: And this stone I have set up as a pillar will be God’s house, and of all that You give me I will surely give You a tenth.”
translation: Na ston i go setim olsem wanpela pilia, em bai kamap haus bilong God, na long olgeta samting yu givim mi, bai mi garanti givim yu tenth.

original: Jacob resumed his journey and came to the land of the people of the east.
translation: Jakob i go bek again long rot bilong en, na em i kam long kantri bilong ol pipal bilong ist.

original: He looked and saw a well in the field, and near it lay three flocks of sheep, because the sheep were watered from this well. And a large stone covered the mouth of the well.
translation: Em i lukim na em i si wara ine long graun, na klosup long em tripela lok ol sip i stap, bikos sip ol i drink wara long dispela wara. Na bikpela ston i kambak meni long mowmou long wara.

original: When all the flocks had been gathered there, the shepherds would roll away the stone from the mouth of the well and water the sheep. Then they would return the stone to its place over the mouth of the well.
translation: Wanpela taim olgeta flock i kam long wanpela ples finis, ol pasinda bai kisim ston i go bek long en na givim wara long ol sheep. Na bai ol putim ston i go bek long ples bilong en, na ol sheep bai drai bek gen.

original: “My brothers,” Jacob asked the shepherds, “where are you from?” “We are from Haran,” they answered.
translation: “Brata bilong mipela,” Yakob askim ol pastro ol pipol i lukauten animol, “yu kam long wei?” “Mipela kam long Haran,” ol i ansa.

original: “Do you know Laban the grandson of Nahor?” Jacob asked. “We know him,” they replied.
translation: “Yu save long Laban, pikinini bilong Nahor?” Jakob askim. “Mipela saveim em,” ol i tok.

original: “Is he well?” Jacob inquired. “Yes,” they answered, “and here comes his daughter Rachel with his sheep.”
translation: “Em i gutpela?” Yakob askim. “Yes,” ol i tokim bek, “na bek i kam, na pikinini meri bilong em Rachel i kam wantaim ol sip bilong en.”

original: “Look,” said Jacob, “it is still broad daylight; it is not yet time to gather the livestock. Water the sheep and take them back to pasture.”
translation: “Look,” tok Jacob, “yet em i de bilong dei; i no yet taim long kam bekim ol animol. Givim wara long ol sheep na putim bak long graon.”

original: But they replied, “We cannot, until all the flocks have been gathered and the stone has been rolled away from the mouth of the well. Then we will water the sheep.”
translation: Ol i tokim, "Mipela no inap, na olgeta yangpela mob i kam yet, tasol. Stoan i go daun long maus bilong warahole, orait mipela bai givim wara long sheep."

original: While he was still speaking with them, Rachel arrived with her father’s sheep, for she was a shepherdess.
translation: Wail em i stap yet tok, Raechel i kam apo long ol sheep bilong papa bilong em, wantaim em i meri save lukautim ol sheep.

original: As soon as Jacob saw Rachel, the daughter of his mother’s brother Laban, with Laban’s sheep, he went up and rolled the stone away from the mouth of the well and watered his uncle’s sheep.
translation: Taim Jacob harim Rachel, dau bilong bros bilong mama bilong em, Laban, wantaim ol sheep bilong Laban, em i go antap na kisim ston i go longwe na kam bek long maus bilong wel, na em i givim wara long sheep bilong ankal bilong em.

original: Then Jacob kissed Rachel and wept aloud.
translation: Na Jakob i kisim Rachel, na em i krai aus.

original: He told Rachel that he was Rebekah’s son, a relative of her father, and she ran and told her father.
translation: Em i tokim Rachel, em i pikinini bilong Rebeka, na em i wantok bilong papa bilong en, na Rachel i ron na toktok long papa bilong en.

original: When Laban heard the news about his sister’s son Jacob, he ran out to meet him. He embraced him and kissed him and brought him to his home, where Jacob told him all that had happened.
translation: Long taim Laban harim stori na ran i go bekim Jakob, nambis kusin bilong em. Em i rapsaitim em, kisim em, na givim em welkam kiss. Ol i go long haus bilong Laban, na Jakob tokim em olgeta samting i hapen long en.

original: Then Laban declared, “You are indeed my own flesh and blood.” After Jacob had stayed with him a month,
translation: Na Laban i tok olsem, “Yu tru long bosom na blut bilong mi yet.” After Jacob i stap wantaim em long wanpela mun,

original: Laban said to him, “Just because you are my relative, should you work for nothing? Tell me what your wages should be.”
translation: Laban i tokim em, "Yu bilong me, brata susa, yu no ken mekim wok bai narapela. Yu tokim mi, pe long yu bai kam, nau yu tokim mi, wanem pekimbil long wok bilong yu."

original: Now Laban had two daughters; the older was named Leah, and the younger was named Rachel.
translation: Na Laban i gat tu daugta meri; bikpela daugta meri em i kolim Leah, na liklik daugta meri em i kolim Rakel.

original: Leah had weak eyes, but Rachel was shapely and beautiful.
translation: Leah i gat ai i no strong, tasol Raekei em i woman we i gat bodi nais na em i lukim gut.

original: Since Jacob loved Rachel, he answered, “I will serve you seven years for your younger daughter Rachel.”
translation: Bikos Yakob i lakim Rekel, em i tok, "Mi bai wokim servos long yu seven yia olsem na mi bai kisim yngpela dauti bilong yu, Rekel."

original: Laban replied, “Better that I give her to you than to another. Stay here with me.”
translation: Laban i tokim ol, "Mi baik long givim em i go long yu na nogat long narapela man. Yu mas stap hariap long mi."

original: So Jacob served seven years for Rachel, yet it seemed but a few days because of his love for her.
translation: Na Yakob i sarve sevén yia bilong Rachel, tasol em i kamap olsem de nau dispela bikos of em i laikim em i mas.

original: Finally Jacob said to Laban, “Grant me my wife, for my time is complete, and I want to sleep with her.”
translation: Bihain olsem Yakob i tokim Laban, “Givim mi meri bilong me, tasol taim bilong me i kam pinis, na mi laik go na slip wantaim em.”

original: So Laban invited all the men of that place and prepared a feast.
translation: Na Laban i kolim ol man husat i stap long hap na i preparim kaikai bilong ples.

original: But when evening came, Laban took his daughter Leah and gave her to Jacob, and he slept with her.
translation: Taitim i kamap, Laban i kisim meri bilong en Leah, na i givim Leah long Jacob, na Jacob i stap wantaim Leah.

original: And Laban gave his servant girl Zilpah to his daughter Leah as her maidservant.
translation: Na Laban i givim meri servant bilong em, Zilpah, long daughta bilong en, Leah, olsem meri servant bilong em.

original: When morning came, there was Leah! “What have you done to me?” Jacob said to Laban. “Wasn’t it for Rachel that I served you? Why have you deceived me?”
translation: Bikos em i kamap long moning, na Lea i stap! "Yu mekim wanem long mi?" Jacob i tokim Laban olsem. "Ating em olsem yu bin givim mi long Rakel nau, tasol wai yu bilipim mi long ol sem? Yu bin givim mi Lea, tasol mi bin workim bikos blong Rakel."

original: Laban replied, “It is not our custom here to give the younger daughter in marriage before the older.
translation: Laban i tok bek, “Em i no kastom bilong yumi long dispela ples, bai yumi givim susa ya opela i go long marit bifor meri ya tubel. Ol susa i go bifor long marit, na ol meri ino ken go bifor ol susa.”

original: Finish this week’s celebration, and we will give you the younger one in return for another seven years of work.”
translation: Kamapim pinis selibrisen bilong wik igo, na mipela bai givim yu pikinini olsem kompensesen long nupela seven yia wok.

original: And Jacob did just that. He finished the week’s celebration, and Laban gave him his daughter Rachel as his wife.
translation: Na Jakob i mekim olsem tasol. Em i pomoi pinis hap bilong wik, na Laban i givim dafter bilong em, Raequel, long em olsem meri bilong em.

original: Laban also gave his servant girl Bilhah to his daughter Rachel as her maidservant.
translation: Laban i givim Bilhah, pikinini meri bilong em, long Rachel, long wok servise bilong em olsem meri servise.

original: Jacob slept with Rachel as well, and indeed, he loved Rachel more than Leah. So he worked for Laban another seven years.
translation: Yakob i go nap long Rachel, na em i moa likim Rachel long olgeta we Leah, olegeda Laban i givim em chans long wok gen long en long naiten yia.

original: When the LORD saw that Leah was unloved, He opened her womb; but Rachel was barren.
translation: Taim LORD i lukim ol Leah i no gat lav, Em i opim bel bilong Leah; bat Rachel i no inap karim bebi.

original: And Leah conceived and gave birth to a son, and she named him Reuben, for she said, “The LORD has seen my affliction. Surely my husband will love me now.”
translation: Na Lea i kamap na i bikim bek, na em i givim nem Reuben long en, olsem em i tok, "LORD ibin lukim pain bilong mi. Husat mi husat bai mi husat i lakim mi nau."

original: Again she conceived and gave birth to a son, and she said, “Because the LORD has heard that I am unloved, He has given me this son as well.” So she named him Simeon.
translation: Em i kisim bek na em i banis na bornim wanpela pikinini naba, na em i tok, “LORD ibin harim olsem mi nogat laik, em i givim mi dispela pikinini.” Na em i givim nem long em olsem Simeon.

original: Once again Leah conceived and gave birth to a son, and she said, “Now at last my husband will become attached to me, because I have borne him three sons.” So he was named Levi.
translation: Lea i kisim bel gen na i kamapim man, na em i tok, "Nau em i kam, husband bilong mi bai i stap wantaim mi, bekas mi birnim tripela man bilong em." Na em i kolim Levai.

original: And once more she conceived and gave birth to a son and said, “This time I will praise the LORD.” So she named him Judah. Then Leah stopped having children.
translation: Na em i kamap gen na em i bikim bebé namba tu, na em i tok, "Taim bilong dispela bai mi givim sankyu long LORD." Olsem na em i givim nem bilong em Judah. Na Leah i stap long karim pikinini.

original: When Rachel saw that she was not bearing any children for Jacob, she envied her sister. “Give me children, or I will die!” she said to Jacob.
translation: Wanpela taim Raekeil i lukim olsem em i no inap karim bebe, em i bilong kros long susa meri bilong em. "Givim mi pikinini," em i tokim Jacob, "nogat moa bai mi dai!"

original: Jacob became angry with Rachel and said, “Am I in the place of God, who has withheld children from you?”
translation: Yakob i bagarap olsem, na tokim Rekel, “Mipela ino God, we i stap klostu long pikinini bilong yu?”

original: Then she said, “Here is my maidservant Bilhah. Sleep with her, that she may bear children for me, so that through her I too can build a family.”
translation: Em i tok, “Hapa meri bilong servis bilong me, Bilhah. Yu slep wantaim em, na em bai karim pikinini bilong me, na mipela bai wokim husat i go.”

original: So Rachel gave Jacob her servant Bilhah as a wife, and he slept with her,
translation: Na Reachel i givim hausmeri bilong em, Bilhah, long Jacob olsem meri bilong em, na Jacob i stap wantaim em.

original: and Bilhah conceived and bore him a son.
translation: Na Bilhah i kamap bikos na i karim man bilong en.

original: Then Rachel said, “God has vindicated me; He has heard my plea and given me a son.” So she named him Dan.
translation: Rachel i tok, “God im givim mi rait; Em i harim bekim tok bilong mi na im givim mi wanpela man.” Na em i givim nem Dan long dispela.

original: And Rachel’s servant Bilhah conceived again and bore Jacob a second son.
translation: Na hausmeri bilong Rekel, Bilaha, i go long bel, na i kam bekim pikinini namba tu bilong Jakob.

original: Then Rachel said, “In my great struggles, I have wrestled with my sister and won.” So she named him Naphtali.
translation: Na Raeli tokim, "Mi bin paitim wantaim susa bilong mi na win." Na Raeli i givim em nem Naphtali.

original: When Leah saw that she had stopped having children, she gave her servant Zilpah to Jacob as a wife.
translation: Lea harim ol i stap long stap na bai i no inap karim bebe moa, na em i givim meri servist Zilpa long Jakob olsem husan bilong em.

original: And Leah’s servant Zilpah bore Jacob a son.
translation: Na Haus meri bilong Lea, Zilpah, i karim bek man bilong Yakob.

original: Then Leah said, “How fortunate!” So she named him Gad.
translation: Na Lepa i tok, “O, gutpela!” Na em i givim nem bilong em Gad.

original: When Leah’s servant Zilpah bore Jacob a second son,
translation: Taim Leah i go givim hausmeri Zilpah i karim bek gen Jacob, na Zilpah i karim pikinini man namba tu bilong Jacob.

original: Leah said, “How happy I am! For the women call me happy.” So she named him Asher.
translation: Lea i tok, "Hamamas tru long me! Ol meri i kolim mi bikos mi hamamas." Na Lea i givim nem Asher long em.

original: Now during the wheat harvest, Reuben went out and found some mandrakes in the field. When he brought them to his mother, Rachel begged Leah, “Please give me some of your son’s mandrakes.”
translation: Long taem waet harves i kamap, Ruben i go aut na finisim mandrek long bus. Na em bringsim ol i go long mama bilong en, Raeke i prea long Leah, “Ples gimme sampela bilong mandrek bilong pikinini bilong yu.”

original: But Leah replied, “Is it not enough that you have taken away my husband? Now you want to take my son’s mandrakes as well?” “Very well,” said Rachel, “he may sleep with you tonight in exchange for your son’s mandrakes.”
translation: Bareket Leah i tok bek, “Yu kam na kisim husband bilong mi go we, nau yu laik kisim mandrake bilong pikinini bilong mi tu, em i no inap long yu?” “Orait,” tok Rachel, “em bai slip long yu tunde, strong long mandrake bilong yuson.”

original: When Jacob came in from the field that evening, Leah went out to meet him and said, “You must come with me, for I have hired you with my son’s mandrakes.” So he slept with her that night.
translation: Wanpela de Jakob i kam bek long bus, Lea i go aut long mikim peis, tokim, "Yu kem na kam wantaim mi, fromwe mi peilim wok long yu gen olsem plani bilong narapela kastom bilong pikinini bilong mi." Na Jakob i sleep wantaim em that nait.

original: And God listened to Leah, and she conceived and bore a fifth son to Jacob.
translation: Na God i harim tok long Leah, na em i kamap na banisim man namba faiv long Jacob.

original: Then Leah said, “God has rewarded me for giving my maidservant to my husband.” So she named him Issachar.
translation: Na Lea i tok, “God i givim mi planti long me givim hausmeri bilong me long husband bilong me.” Na em i kisim nem Isakar.

original: Again Leah conceived and bore a sixth son to Jacob.
translation: Leah i karim bel gen, na i bekim man namba sikis long Jacob.

original: “God has given me a good gift,” she said. “This time my husband will honor me, because I have borne him six sons.” And she named him Zebulun.
translation: “God i blesim mi,” olsem na. “Taim ini husband bilong mi bai mekim respek long mi, bikos mi karim sixpela man bilong em.” Na em i givim nem Zebulun long em.

original: After that, Leah gave birth to a daughter and named her Dinah.
translation: Bihain long dispela, Leah i karim bek baby gel, na tupela i givim nem bilong gel i go Dinah.

original: Then God remembered Rachel. He listened to her and opened her womb,
translation: Na God i memba Rachel. Em i harim tok bilong en, na em i opim bel bilong en, olsem em i givim en chans long karim bebi.

original: and she conceived and gave birth to a son. “God has taken away my shame,” she said.
translation: Na em i kamap na em i bikim bel, "God i kisim wei shem bilong me," em i tok.

original: She named him Joseph, and said, “May the LORD add to me another son.”
translation: Em i givim nem Joseph, na em i tok, “Mai LORD i givim mi wanpela sun i go we.”

original: Now after Rachel had given birth to Joseph, Jacob said to Laban, “Send me on my way so I can return to my homeland.
translation: Bihaen Rachel i karim Joseph, Jacob i tokim Laban, "Kisim na wai long we, na mi go bek long ples bilong mi."

original: Give me my wives and children for whom I have served you, that I may go on my way. You know how hard I have worked for you.”
translation: Givim mi meri na pikinini bilong me olsem mi bin sarve long yu, na mi ken go long we bilong me. Yu save long olsem wanem kain harde wok mi mekim long yu.

original: But Laban replied, “If I have found favor in your eyes, please stay. I have learned by divination that the LORD has blessed me because of you.”
translation: Laban i tok bek, "Yu laikim mi yet, ples yu stap. Mi lusim bek long rot bilong spirit, na mi save olsem Bikpela i givim mi planti bikos yu."

original: And he added, “Name your wages, and I will pay them.”
translation: Na em i tok, "Nem pe bilong wok bilong yu, mi bai peim ol."

original: Then Jacob answered, “You know how I have served you and how your livestock have thrived under my care.
translation: Na Jacob i bekim tok, "Yu save olsem mi servim yu, na ol animol bilong yu i kamap strong long hap blong mi."

original: Indeed, you had very little before my arrival, but now your wealth has increased many times over. The LORD has blessed you wherever I set foot. But now, when may I also provide for my own household?”
translation: Inan, yu bin havim liklik tasol bifo ai kam, nau plaenta bilong yu i go apo olgeta tenfold. LORD ibin givim yu blesing we ai putim fut. Nau, bai wanem taim na bai mi givim kaikai long husat i belong long me?

original: “What can I give you?” Laban asked. “You do not need to give me anything,” Jacob replied. “If you do this one thing for me, I will keep on shepherding and keeping your flocks.
translation: “Wanem samting bai mi givim yu?” Laban askim. “Yu no need long givim mi eni samting,” Jacob i tok. “Sapos yu mekim dispela wanpela samting long mi, mi bai kamap shepard na lukautim olk fok bilong yu yet, na mi bai kontinu long wokim dispela wok bilong shepardim.”

original: Let me go through all your flocks today and remove from them every speckled or spotted sheep, every dark-colored lamb, and every spotted or speckled goat. These will be my wages.
translation: Laim mi go pasim olgeta lok ba sindaun bilong yu, kisim na putim wei olgets pekpek na spotted sheep, olgets duk kala lamb, na olgets spotted na pekpek goat. Dispela bai bihain long moni bilong mi.

original: So my honesty will testify for me when you come to check on my wages in the future. If I have any goats that are not speckled or spotted, or any lambs that are not dark-colored, they will be considered stolen.”
translation: Klostu bilong mi bai toktru long me, na bai yu kim na lukim moni bilong mi long taim bilong futur. I gat bek goat we i no spakelta o potospot, o bek lamb we i no dakkolored, ol i tingim olsem ibin stilim.

original: “Agreed,” said Laban. “Let it be as you have said.”
translation: “Okei,” Laban i tok. “Olsem yu tok, em bai olsem.”

original: That very day Laban removed all the streaked or spotted male goats and every speckled or spotted female goat—every one that had any white on it—and every dark-colored lamb, and he placed them under the care of his sons.
translation: Dispela de Laban i kirapim olgeta male goat we i gat lain kol na spak, na ol female goat we i gat liklik spak na spak, na ol goat we i gat white long bodi bilong ol, na ol lamb we i gat kol blak, na em i givim ol i go long han bilong pikinini bilong em.

original: Then he put a three-day journey between himself and Jacob, while Jacob was shepherding the rest of Laban’s flocks.
translation: Em waipeim tri-dei jorni bilong wokabaut long namel, wail em Jacob i bin lusim ol pipol bilong en i go lusim ol bikpela animal bilong Laban.

original: Jacob, however, took fresh branches of poplar, almond, and plane trees, and peeled the bark, exposing the white inner wood of the branches.
translation: Yakob, tasol, i kisim niupela branis bilong taro poplar, almond, na plane trees, na rukim skinpela bark bilong ol, olsem ol i kamap strong white inner wud bilong ol branis.

original: Then he set the peeled branches in the watering troughs in front of the flocks coming in to drink. So when the flocks were in heat and came to drink,
translation: Em plantim branis i go pinis long watahol olsem ples we bilong animal na kam tanim, long front bilong ol mokolkol i kam in long dring. Na taim ol i masalai na ol i kam dring,

original: they mated in front of the branches. And they bore young that were streaked or speckled or spotted.
translation: Ol i mekim Gen long hap bilong branis. Na ol i karim pikinini we i gat kol bilong strekkim o spakulim o spotim.

original: Jacob set apart the young, but made the rest face the streaked dark-colored sheep in Laban’s flocks. Then he set his own stock apart and did not put them with Laban’s animals.
translation: Yakob i separatem pikinini, tasol i wokim ol narapela i facim sheep i gat kol bilong blak na wait long ol fok bilong Laban. Na bai em i separatem propretn bilong em yet, na i no putim ol gen long animal bilong Laban.

original: Whenever the stronger females of the flock were in heat, Jacob would place the branches in the troughs, in full view of the animals, so that they would breed in front of the branches.
translation: Wanpela taim ol bikpela meri bilong mosim i kamap strong na katim tok, Yakob itokim ol branis i go insait long ol troks, long ai bilong everybody, olsem na ol bai karim pikinini long sait bilong ol branis.

original: But if the animals were weak, he did not set out the branches. So the weaker animals went to Laban and the stronger ones to Jacob.
translation: Sapos ol animal i no strong, em i no salim braunche olsem, na ol animal i no strong i go long Laban, na ol i strong i go long Jakob.

original: Thus Jacob became exceedingly prosperous. He owned large flocks, maidservants and menservants, and camels and donkeys.
translation: Na Jacob em i kamap bikpela na strong tumas. Em i gat ol fok long pig na kuskus na kanak na sip, em i gat hap meri na hap man long sarvisim em, na em i gat kamel na donki.

original: Now Jacob heard that Laban’s sons were saying, “Jacob has taken away all that belonged to our father and built all this wealth at our father’s expense.”
translation: Nau Yakob harim tok: Sos bilong Laban i tok, "Yakob i kisim bek olgeta long moni bilong tambu bilong mipela, na i bikim olgeta em i kamap strongpela long expens bilong papa bilong mipela."

original: And Jacob saw from the countenance of Laban that his attitude toward him had changed.
translation: Na Yakob i lukim long fac bilong Laban, na im i kirapim save long dispela: laban i changim wok bilong het long em.

original: Then the LORD said to Jacob, “Go back to the land of your fathers and to your kindred, and I will be with you.”
translation: Na Lod i tokim Jekob olsem, “Go bak long ples bilong tumbuna i yu na long wantok i yu, Mi stap wantaim yu.”

original: So Jacob sent word and called Rachel and Leah to the field where his flocks were,
translation: Na Jakob i givim tok, kallis Raekele na Lea i go long ples we ol bikpela man i save lukautim ol sip.

original: and he told them, “I can see from your father’s countenance that his attitude toward me has changed; but the God of my father has been with me.
translation: Em i tokim ol, "Mi lukim long face bilong papa bilong yu, it i chang long em tasol; be God bilong papa bilong mi, em i stap wantaim mi.

original: You know that I have served your father with all my strength.
translation: Yu save, mi bin sarve papa bilong yu wantaim olgeta strong bilong mi.

original: And although he has cheated me and changed my wages ten times, God has not allowed him to harm me.
translation: Maski em i bikim ol sem bilong mi, em i chanim pe bilong mi ten taem, God i no givim em chans long bagarapim mi.

original: If he said, ‘The speckled will be your wages,’ then the whole flock bore speckled offspring. If he said, ‘The streaked will be your wages,’ then the whole flock bore streaked offspring.
translation: Em i tok, 'Spakel bai olsem bai yu kamap moni bilong yu,' na olgeta mosim na ol i karim bek spakel pikinini. Em i tok, 'Stripim bai olsem bai yu kamap moni bilong yu,' na olgeta mosim na ol i karim bek stripim pikinini.

original: Thus God has taken away your father’s livestock and given them to me.
translation: Thus Bikpela i bin tekewe bikpela stock bilong papa na i givim olgeta long me.

original: When the flocks were breeding, I saw in a dream that the streaked, spotted, and speckled males were mating with the females.
translation: Taim ol kanu i save karim pikinini, mi lukim long wanpela dopi ol man bulmakau i gat kol, spak, na smal spot i save mekim gen long ol meri.

original: In that dream the angel of God said to me, ‘Jacob!’ And I replied, ‘Here I am.’
translation: Long taem bilong draim, Eiyan bilong God i tokim mi, 'Jakob!' Na mi bekim tok, 'Mi stap hia.'

original: ‘Look up,’ he said, ‘and see that all the males that are mating with the flock are streaked, spotted, or speckled; for I have seen all that Laban has done to you.
