translation: Kisim hevi, lukim olsem ol man husat i stap slip wantaim ol pikinini sheep na ol goat, ol i gat kol bilong brum na wait, ol i gat spak brum na wait, ol i gat liklik spak; mi lukim olgeta samting Laban i mekim long yu.

original: I am the God of Bethel, where you anointed the pillar and made a solemn vow to Me. Now get up and leave this land at once, and return to your native land.’”
translation: Mi bilong God bilong Betel, we yu anointim pilia na makim promis strong long mi. Nau kam daun, lusim kantri ia hariap, na go bek long ples bilong yu.

original: And Rachel and Leah replied, “Do we have any portion or inheritance left in our father’s house?
translation: Na Rael na Lea i tok olsem, “Yu no ina kisim narapela hap o narapela injanasin long haus bilong papa bilong mipela?”

original: Are we not regarded by him as outsiders? Not only has he sold us, but he has certainly squandered what was paid for us.
translation: Em i tingim mipela olsem ol pipol i no gat rel? Em i salim mipela tasol, na em i bilasim moni em i peim bilong bipela.

original: Surely all the wealth that God has taken away from our father belongs to us and to our children. So do whatever God has told you.”
translation: Sapos olgeta wel bilong Bikpela i kam bek long brata na susa bilong papa, em i bilong mipela na bilong pikinini mipela. Oli wokim olsem tok bilong Bikpela i tokim yu.

original: Then Jacob got up and put his children and his wives on camels,
translation: Na Yakob em i kam bek gen, na em i putim ol pikinini na meri bilong em long camel.

original: and he drove all his livestock before him, along with all the possessions he had acquired in Paddan-aram, to go to his father Isaac in the land in Canaan.
translation: Na em i driwim olgeta animal bilong em bipo em, longlong ol samting em i kamapim na kisim long ol ples bilong Aram, i go long papa bilong em Aisak long kantri Kanaan.

original: Now while Laban was out shearing his sheep, Rachel stole her father’s household idols.
translation: Wail Laban i go kasim ol sip bilong en, Raekele i stilim smal spirit bilong papa bilong em.

original: Moreover, Jacob deceived Laban the Aramean by not telling him that he was running away.
translation: Yakob i bikim gogo long Laban man Aram, em i no tokim em, olsem na em i ranawe na lusim ples.

original: So he fled with all his possessions, crossed the Euphrates, and headed for the hill country of Gilead.
translation: Na em i rin bek long en, i go wantaim olgeta samting bilong em, em kam akros river Euphrates, na em i go bek gen long kantri bilong maunten Gilead.

original: On the third day Laban was informed that Jacob had fled.
translation: Long dei namba three Laban i save olsem Yakob i ranawe.

original: So he took his relatives with him, pursued Jacob for seven days, and overtook him in the hill country of Gilead.
translation: Em i kisim ol famili bilong em wantaim em, em i go bek gen Jacob long wei long seven de, na em i kam apostim em long kantri bilong maunten Gilead.

original: But that night God came to Laban the Aramean in a dream and warned him, “Be careful not to say anything to Jacob, either good or bad.”
translation: Bai nat i go daun, God i kam long Laban bilong Aram via sip na givim warming long em, "Yu mas tok stret, no ken tok gutpela na nogut long Jakob."

original: Now Jacob had pitched his tent in the hill country of Gilead when Laban overtook him, and Laban and his relatives camped there as well.
translation: Nau Jakob em pundaun tent bilong en long kantri hap graun bilong Gilead, tasol Laban i kam ap gen long en, na Laban wantaim ol wantok bilong em ol i kam pundaun kamp ol yet.

original: Then Laban said to Jacob, “What have you done? You have deceived me and carried off my daughters like captives of war!
translation: Laban i tokim Jekob, “Wanem yu mekim? Yu bin giaman me, na yu kisim bek daughters bilong me olsem prison bilong war!

original: Why did you run away secretly and deceive me, without even telling me? I would have sent you away with joy and singing, with tambourines and harps.
translation: Wai yu ripot i go bek klostu, na yu givim mi tok bokis? Na yu no tokim mi yet. Mi olsem harim bel hevi, mi sendim yupela i go wantaim tamborin na hap, na mipela singting wantaim bel hevi.

original: But you did not even let me kiss my grandchildren and my daughters goodbye. Now you have done a foolish thing.
translation: Yu no let mi kisim ol pikinini bilong mi na ol meri bilong mi goodbye, nau yu mekim wankain samting i no gut.

original: I have power to do you great harm, but last night the God of your father said to me, ‘Be careful not to say anything to Jacob, either good or bad.’
translation: Mi gat pawa na me bai me mekim bikpela iet long yu, tasol nap night God bilong papa bilong yu tokim olsem long me, ‘Yu mas timbuk long tokim Jakob nogat, i gohd igo, bikos em i no ken tokim em gutpela o birua.’

original: Now you have gone off because you long for your father’s house. But why have you stolen my gods?”
translation: Nau yu go bek long wei, yu save kisim han bilong ples bilong papa yu. Baimbai, why yu stolem ol spirit bilong mi?

original: “I was afraid,” Jacob answered, “for I thought you would take your daughters from me by force.
translation: “Mi bin poret,” Jacob i tok, “bikos mi bin tingim yu bai yusim strong long karim bek daughters bilong me.”

original: If you find your gods with anyone here, he shall not live! In the presence of our relatives, see for yourself if anything is yours, and take it back.” For Jacob did not know that Rachel had stolen the idols.
translation: Sapos yu finim god bilong yu long hap nau, em i no ken stap! Long presens bilong wantok bilong mipela, lukim yu yet, sapos sampela samting i bilong yu, kisim bek gen. Na Jakob i no save olsem Rebeca i stilim idol.

original: So Laban went into Jacob’s tent, then Leah’s tent, and then the tents of the two maidservants, but he found nothing. Then he left Leah’s tent and entered Rachel’s tent.
translation: Laban i go insait long tent bilong Jakob, olgeta long tent bilong Lea, na long tent bilong tu meri bilong wok, tasol em i no finim nothing. Olsem na em i lusim tent bilong Lea na i go insait long tent bilong Rakel.

original: Now Rachel had taken Laban’s household idols, put them in the saddlebag of her camel, and was sitting on them. And Laban searched everything in the tent but found nothing.
translation: Na Reachel i kisim idol bilong haus bilong Laban, putim ol long bag bilong salsa bilong kamel, na i sidaun long top bilong ol. Na Laban i serchim hap tasol long tent, tasol i no finisim wanpela.

original: Rachel said to her father, “Sir, do not be angry that I cannot stand up before you; for I am having my period.” So Laban searched, but could not find the household idols.
translation: Rae kel bilong me i tokim papa bilong em, "Papa, no ken kros; mi no inap sanap bifor yu, long taim blut bilong meri i kam." Laban i wokabaut, i serch ol samting bilong bihainim ol spirit long hus, tasol i no inap bekim ol idol bilong hus.

original: Then Jacob became incensed and challenged Laban. “What is my crime?” he said. “For what sin of mine have you so hotly pursued me?
translation: Jacob em i kirap strong na em i go bekim Laban. Em i tok, "Wanem samting nau mi mekim? Yuz save birua miksim na kam bekim mi long we?

original: You have searched all my goods! Have you found anything that belongs to you? Put it here before my brothers and yours, that they may judge between the two of us.
translation: Yu kim go wailisim olgeta samting bilong me! Yu finimd somting we bilong yu? Putim i hia bifo brata bilong mipela na bilong yu, na ol i ken jaj long tupela bilong yumi.

original: I have been with you for twenty years now. Your sheep and goats have not miscarried, nor have I eaten the rams of your flock.
translation: Mi bin stap wantaim yu long twenti yia nau. Ol sip na ol goat bilong yu i no ken slip, na mi no kai ram bilong ol sip bilong yu.

original: I did not bring you anything torn by wild beasts; I bore the loss myself. And you demanded payment from me for what was stolen by day or night.
translation: Mi no bringim bek i go long yu olgeta samting ol bin kilim na katim na ibin kolim long bus, mi baim kaerim los tu mi yet. Yu askim mi long pe na moni bilong ol samting we ibin stil long dei o nait.

original: As it was, the heat consumed me by day and the frost by night, and sleep fled from my eyes.
translation: Hot i kam bekim mi bembe long dei, na ais i kam bekim mi bembe long nait, na sip i ranawe long ai bilong mi.

original: Thus for twenty years I have served in your household—fourteen years for your two daughters and six years for your flocks—and you have changed my wages ten times!
translation: Thus nau, long twenti yia mi servim hus na bikos bilong yu - fotinin yia long pikinini bel meri tu bilong yu, na sikis yia long ol kanu bilong yu, na yu bin senisim pe bilong mi ten taim.

original: If the God of my father, the God of Abraham and the Fear of Isaac, had not been with me, surely by now you would have sent me away empty-handed. But God has seen my affliction and the toil of my hands, and last night He rendered judgment.”
translation: Igat God bilong papa bilong me, God bilong Abraham, na Fear bilong Isaac, i no stap wantaim mi, orait nau bai yumi sendim mi i go na emti han. Bat God i lukim sore bilong mi na wok bilong han bilong mi, na las nait Em i givim desisian.

original: But Laban answered Jacob, “These daughters are my daughters, these sons are my sons, and these flocks are my flocks! Everything you see is mine! Yet what can I do today about these daughters of mine or the children they have borne?
translation: Baimbai Laban i tokim Jacob, “Ol daughters bilong me em ol daughters bilong me, ol sons bilong me em ol sons bilong me, na ol flocks bilong me em ol flocks bilong me! Olgat samting yu lukim em bilong me! Bai mi ken mekim wanem tude long ol daughters bilong me o siklik long ol pikinini ol i kamapim?

original: Come now, let us make a covenant, you and I, and let it serve as a witness between you and me.”
translation: Kam na, yu na mipela mekim kovenan, na em i servim olsem wanpela witnes bibain long yu na mipela.

original: So Jacob picked out a stone and set it up as a pillar,
translation: Na Jakob em i piksimo wanpela ston, na em i putim i stap olsem wanpela pilia.

original: and he said to his relatives, “Gather some stones.” So they took stones and made a mound, and there by the mound they ate.
translation: Em tokim ol famili bilong en, “Kam na kisim ston.” Na ol i kisim ston na wokim wanpela mun, na ol i kaikai long sait bilong mun.

original: Laban called it Jegar-sahadutha, and Jacob called it Galeed.
translation: Laban i kolim em Jegar-sahadutha, na Jacob i kolim em Galeed.

original: Then Laban declared, “This mound is a witness between you and me this day.” Therefore the place was called Galeed.
translation: Na Laban i tok olsem, "Kondom bilong stoan dispela em i saksak bilong witnes long yu na mi tude. Olsem na hap bilong ples ia i kolim Galeed.

original: It was also called Mizpah, because Laban said, “May the LORD keep watch between you and me when we are absent from each other.
translation: Em i kolim Mizpah tu, bikos Laban i tok, "Papa God i mas kisim ka long yu na mi wampela taim yumi i no kamap long wampela."

original: If you mistreat my daughters or take other wives, although no one is with us, remember that God is a witness between you and me.”
translation: Yu no ken kilim ol meri bilong me o yu kisim narapela meri, maski nogat man i stap wantaim yumi, yu rimembir, God em i stap longpela witness bung between yu na mi.

original: Laban also said to Jacob, “Here is the mound, and here is the pillar I have set up between you and me.
translation: Laban i tokim Jacob, “Kanu i stap, na pilaia we mi plantim long mit na yu.”

original: This mound is a witness, and this pillar is a witness, that I will not go past this mound to harm you, and you will not go past this mound and pillar to harm me.
translation: Dispela mun em i witness, na dispela pila em i witness, bilong tok olsem: mi no go pasim dispela mun na bagarapim yu, na yu no go pasim dispela mun na pila na bagarapim mi.

original: May the God of Abraham and the God of Nahor, the God of their father, judge between us.” So Jacob swore by the Fear of his father Isaac.
translation: Mipela i harim tok bilong God bilong Abraham na God bilong Nahor, God bilong papa bilong ol, bai em i givim sentens long mipela. Na Jacob i kam bek long promis bilong Fia bilong Isaac, papa bilong em.

original: Then Jacob offered a sacrifice on the mountain and invited his relatives to eat a meal. And after they had eaten, they spent the night on the mountain.
translation: Na Jakob i givim sakrifis long maunten na i kam na kisim ol famili bilong em na ol i kaikai mumu. Na after ol i finis kaikai, ol i spen nait long maunten.

original: Early the next morning, Laban got up and kissed his grandchildren and daughters and blessed them. Then he left to return home.
translation: Bikos tumora moning Laban i kamap na em i kisim pikinini bilong pikinini na meri bilong en, na em i givim blesing long ol. Na em i go bek gen long ples bilong en.

original: Jacob also went on his way, and the angels of God met him.
translation: Na Jakob i go long we, na enjel bilong God i kamapikim em.

original: When Jacob saw them, he said, “This is the camp of God.” So he named that place Mahanaim.
translation: Taim Yakob pilim ol, na em i tok, “Dispela em i kemp bilong God.” Na em i givim nem bilong ples ia Mahanaim.

original: Jacob sent messengers ahead of him to his brother Esau in the land of Seir, the country of Edom.
translation: Jakob salim messenja i go bifor long lan bilong Seir, kantri bilong Edom, goTo long brata bilong em, Esau.

original: He instructed them, “You are to say to my master Esau, ‘Your servant Jacob says: I have been staying with Laban and have remained there until now.
translation: Em i givim tok bilong ol, "Yu tokim papa bilong mi Esau, 'Boi bilong yu Jakob i tok: Mi stap wantaim Laban, na mi stap yet long hap bilong em.'"

original: I have oxen, donkeys, flocks, menservants, and maidservants. I have sent this message to inform my master, so that I may find favor in your sight.’”
translation: Mi havim oksen, donki, olgeta kol bilong mia, manmeri i wok servos long mi, na meri i wok servos long mi. Mi bin salim dispela mesij long tokim biceman bilong mi, bai mi ken kisim gutpela tingting long ai bilong yu.’”

original: When the messengers returned to Jacob, they said, “We went to your brother Esau, and now he is coming to meet you—he and four hundred men with him.”
translation: Taim ol man husat i go girai i go bek long Yakob, ol i tok, "Mipela i go long brata yumi Esau, na nau em i kam bikos em i laik kisim yu - em na four hundred man i go wantaim em."

original: In great fear and distress, Jacob divided his people into two camps, as well as the flocks and herds and camels.
translation: Long wei bilong bikpela fea na sori, Jakob i divelopim piple bilong en i go long tupela kanu, olsem na ol pikinini animal bilong kukim gras, ol bulmakau, na kemel.

original: He thought, “If Esau comes and attacks one camp, then the other camp can escape.”
translation: Em i ting, “Sapos Esau i kam na winim wanpela ken, nanem wanpela ken inap ron igo.”

original: Then Jacob declared, “O God of my father Abraham, God of my father Isaac, the LORD who told me, ‘Go back to your country and to your kindred, and I will make you prosper,’
translation: Na Jacob i tok olsem, "O God bilong papa Abraham blong me, God bilong papa Isaac blong me, LORD i bin tokim mi, 'Go bek gen long kantri bilong yu na long famili bilong yu, na mi bai mekim yu gat plenti.'"

original: I am unworthy of all the kindness and faithfulness You have shown Your servant. Indeed, with only my staff I came across the Jordan, but now I have become two camps.
translation: Mi no worti olgeta gutpela na trutpela yu bin mekim long mi, wokman bilong yu. Mi go daun long wara bilong Jordan, na mi holim stik bilong mi tasol, nau mi i kamap tu hap grupe.

original: Please deliver me from the hand of my brother Esau, for I am afraid that he may come and attack me and the mothers and children with me.
translation: Kisim me nau longwey long han bilong brata Esau, bikos Mi afraid tumas olsem em bai kam na katim mipela, mama na pikinini, na ol i stap wantaim mi.

original: But You have said, ‘I will surely make you prosper, and I will make your offspring like the sand of the sea, too numerous to count.’”
translation: Yu tokim ol, ‘Mi bai kamapim yu strong na givim yu planti manmeri, na mi bai mekim pikinini bilong yu olsem san bilong solwara, tasol i no ken kauntim ol.’”

original: Jacob spent the night there, and from what he had brought with him, he selected a gift for his brother Esau:
translation: Jakob i stap long nait, na em i usim sampela bilong ol samting em i bringim, em i piksim givim long brata bilong en, Esau:

original: 200 female goats, 20 male goats, 200 ewes, 20 rams,
translation: 200 kikim bilong meri, 20 kikim bilong man, 200 sip bilong meri, 20 ram bilong man,

original: 30 milk camels with their young, 40 cows, 10 bulls, 20 female donkeys, and 10 male donkeys.
translation: 30 kamel i gat susu na pikinini bilong ol, 40 bulmakau, 10 bolku, 20 female kengura, na 10 male kengura.

original: He entrusted them to his servants in separate herds and told them, “Go on ahead of me, and keep some distance between the herds.”
translation: Em i givim olgeta wok long servant blong em, olsem ia, em i tokim ol, "Yu go bifo long me, na yu ken keepim espas long herds, bikos ol i mas stap olsem, herd bikos, herd liklik."

original: He instructed the one in the lead, “When my brother Esau meets you and asks, ‘To whom do you belong, where are you going, and whose animals are these before you?’
translation: Em i givim instrukshon long dispela man i go bifor, “Wanpela taim brata Esau i kam long yu na askim, ‘Yu bilong husat, yu go we, na husat olsem kina animal i stap bikosim yu?’”

original: then you are to say, ‘They belong to your servant Jacob. They are a gift, sent to my lord Esau. And behold, Jacob is behind us.’”
translation: “Yupela mas tokim olsem long narapela man, ol i bilong wokman bilong yumi, Yakob. Ol i salim olsem gif go long Bikpela Esau. Na bek, Yakob i kam behain long yumi.”

original: He also instructed the second, the third, and all those following behind the herds: “When you meet Esau, you are to say the same thing to him.
translation: Em i givim instructon long nambatu, long nambatri, na olgeta i go behain long bus na kul: "Wanpela yu kamap long Esau, yu tok olsem long em."

original: You are also to say, ‘Look, your servant Jacob is right behind us.’” For he thought, “I will appease Esau with the gift that is going before me. After that I can face him, and perhaps he will accept me.”
translation: Yu mas tok olsem, 'Lukim, wokman bilong yu Jacob i kam behain long yumi.' Mi think olsem, 'Mi bai givim Esau praes bilong pesem, na bihain mi ken go bek gen long en, mipela bai tok okay.'

original: So Jacob’s gifts went on before him, while he spent the night in the camp.
translation: Gifta bilong Yakob i go bifo em, na em i spen nait long kamp.

original: During the night Jacob got up and took his two wives, his two maidservants, and his eleven sons, and crossed the ford of the Jabbok.
translation: Long nait, Jakob em i kamap, em i go, na em i kisim meri bilong em tu, hausmeri bilong em tu, na pikinini man bilong em ileven, na ol i pas long ples wara i nakis bilong Jabok.

original: During the night Jacob got up and took his two wives, his two maidservants, and his eleven sons, and crossed the ford of the Jabbok.
translation: Em i go ap long nait, na em i kisim meri tu bilong em, haus meri tu bilong em, na pikinini man oleven bilong em, na em i pas long wara bilong Jabbok.

original: He took them and sent them across the stream, along with all his possessions.
translation: Em i kisim ol, na em i sendim ol i go konbek long wara, wanta em i gat ol samting bilong en.

original: So Jacob was left all alone, and there a man wrestled with him until daybreak.
translation: Na Jakob i stap wanpela tasol, na wanpela man i kisim faet wantaim em, ol i wail long nait, tasol bai darte i kam.

original: When the man saw that he could not overpower Jacob, he struck the socket of Jacob’s hip and dislocated it as they wrestled.
translation: Taim man i si em i no inap winim Yakob, em i kilim banis bilong Yakob na braking i go long taim ol i pait long wresol.

original: Then the man said, “Let me go, for it is daybreak.” But Jacob replied, “I will not let you go unless you bless me.”
translation: Na man i tok, "Lusim mi go, long taem bikos em i dai pinis." Na Yakob i bekim tok, "Mi no inap lusim yu, maski yu givim mi bless."

original: “What is your name?” the man asked. “Jacob,” he replied.
translation: “Nem bilong yu em i wanem?” man i askim. “Jacob,” em i mekim bek.

original: Then the man said, “Your name will no longer be Jacob, but Israel, because you have struggled with God and with men, and you have prevailed.”
translation: Na man i tok, "Nem bilong yu nogat Jakob gen, Iserel tasol, bikos yu hamamas long Bikpela na long ol man, na yu win."

original: And Jacob requested, “Please tell me your name.” But he replied, “Why do you ask my name?” Then he blessed Jacob there.
translation: Na Jakob i askim, "Yu tok mipela long nem bilong yu, plis." Olsem na em i tok, "Wai yu askim nem bilong mi?" Na em i givim Jakob bikpela blessin olsem wankain pasin bilong beten long hap ia.

original: So Jacob named the place Peniel, saying, “Indeed, I have seen God face to face, and yet my life was spared.”
translation: Na Jakob i givim nem Peniel long hap, olsem, "Mi lukim God karae i go long ples bilong en, na yet life bilong mi i save."

original: The sun rose above him as he passed by Penuel, and he was limping because of his hip.
translation: Sana i go antap long em olsem em i pas long Penuel, na em i wakabaut i go bek gen klostu long lek bilong en.

original: Therefore to this day the Israelites do not eat the tendon which is at the socket of the hip, because the socket of Jacob’s hip was struck near that tendon.
translation: Na tode, O Israel i no kaikai tendon we i stap klostu long soket bilong hip, bikos soket bilong hip bilong Jacob i bin katim klostu long em.

original: Now Jacob looked up and saw Esau coming toward him with four hundred men. So he divided the children among Leah, Rachel, and the two maidservants.
translation: Nau Yakob i lukaut i si na si Esau i kam narak long em wantaim ol man four hundred. Na em i skelim ol pikinini long Lea, Raeke, na tupela haus meri.

original: He put the maidservants and their children in front, Leah and her children next, and Rachel and Joseph at the rear.
translation: Em putim meri i wok longaus na ol pikinini bilong ol i go bifo, Leah na ol pikinini bilong Leah i kam bihain, na Rachel na Joseph i stap long bihain.

original: But Jacob himself went on ahead and bowed to the ground seven times as he approached his brother.
translation: Bareket, Jakob em yet i go bikhet long fron, na em i kisim ken gras seven taem, em i kam klusim brata bilong em.

original: Esau, however, ran to him and embraced him, threw his arms around his neck, and kissed him. And they both wept.
translation: Esau ron i go kisim em, em i kamapim em, em i kisim nek bilong em i dai long armbilong em, na em i pispis long em. Na ol i tete.

original: When Esau looked up and saw the women and children, he asked, “Who are these with you?” Jacob answered, “These are the children God has graciously given your servant.”
translation: Taim Esau lukimapim na si ol meri na pikinini, em askim, “Ol husat i stap wantaim yu?” Jacob i bekim tok, “Ol dispela i pikinini Bikpela i givim frei long wokman bilong yu.”

original: Then the maidservants and their children approached and bowed down.
translation: Na hap kas na pikinini bilong ol i kam antap, ol i kisim hed i daun.

original: Leah and her children also approached and bowed down, and then Joseph and Rachel approached and bowed down.
translation: Leah na ol pikinini bilong em i kam antap na kilaot i daun, na Joseph na Rachel i kam antap na kilaot i daun.

original: “What do you mean by sending this whole company to meet me?” asked Esau. “To find favor in your sight, my lord,” Jacob answered.
translation: “Yu min bilong senisim dispela kompani i kam mitim me?” Esau askim. “Bikim ol i kam mitim yu, for yu givim mi gutpela hap long ai bilong yu,” Jacob i tok.

original: “I already have plenty, my brother,” Esau replied. “Keep what belongs to you.”
translation: “Mipela i gat planti olgeta, brata,” Esau i tokim. “Lusim ol samting bilong yu yet.”

original: But Jacob insisted, “No, please! If I have found favor in your sight, then receive this gift from my hand. For indeed, I have seen your face, and it is like seeing the face of God, since you have received me favorably.
translation: Bai Jacob i stap strong, "Nogat, pls! Sapos yu givim mi gutpela tok, kisim dispela gif long han bilong mi. Dispela em i olsem bikos mi lukim pes bilong yu, na em i olsem lukim pes bilong God, long olgetting yu akseptim mi gutpela."

original: Please accept my gift that was brought to you, because God has been gracious to me and I have all I need.” So Jacob pressed him until he accepted.
translation: Kisim gif bilong mi we i bringim i kam long yu, bikos God i stap long moni grace wantaim mi na mi gat olgeta samting we mi lukim. Na so Jacob i traim na toktok strong til em i kisim.

original: Then Esau said, “Let us be on our way, and I will go ahead of you.”
translation: Na Esau i tok, "Yumi kam na go, na mi go bifo yu."

original: But Jacob replied, “My lord knows that the children are frail, and I must care for sheep and cattle that are nursing their young. If they are driven hard for even a day, all the animals will die.
translation: Jacob i tok bek, “Papa bilong mi save ol pikinini i no gat strong, na ol sheep na bulmakau i givim susu long pikinini bilong en. Mi mas kukim gut ol, na bai mi no larim ol i go harim ol tasol wanpela de, olgeta bai dai.”

original: Please let my lord go ahead of his servant. I will continue on slowly, at a comfortable pace for the livestock and children, until I come to my lord at Seir.”
translation: Lusim papa bilong yu, em i go bek bipo long wokman bilong yu. Mi yet bai mi go i go slo, longwe tasol, na stap strong long ples bilong kakaruk na pikinini, olsem na mi bai kam bek gen long papa bilong yu long Seir.

original: “Let me leave some of my people with you,” Esau said. But Jacob replied, “Why do that? Let me find favor in the sight of my lord.”
translation: “Mipela bai lusim ol pipel bilong mipela i go wankain long yu,” Esau i tok. “Wai yu mekim olsem,” Jacob i birua, “Mipela i laik kisim bekim long ai bilong papa bilong yu.”

original: So that day Esau started on his way back to Seir,
translation: Na dispela de Esau i go long wei bilong en, i go bek long Seir.

original: but Jacob went on to Succoth, where he built a house for himself and shelters for his livestock; that is why the place was called Succoth.
translation: Na Jakob i go nap long Sukkot, na em i bikim haus bilong em yet, na em i mekim hesel long animol bilong en; olraison long dispela, ol i kolim plesia Sukkot.

original: After Jacob had come from Paddan-aram, he arrived safely at the city of Shechem in the land of Canaan, and he camped just outside the city.
translation: After Jakob i kam bek long Paddan-aram, em i kam gut long taun bilong Shekem long kantri bilong Kanaan, na em i wai ples klostu long taun.

original: And the plot of ground where he pitched his tent, he purchased from the sons of Hamor, Shechem’s father, for a hundred pieces of silver.
translation: Na pe bilong graun we i bamim hus, em baim long ol pikinini bilong Hamor, papa bilong Sikem, long hanred pis silva.

original: There he set up an altar and called it El-Elohe-Israel.
translation: Long hap em i wokim wanpela aita na em i kolim El-Elohe-Israel.

original: Now Dinah, the daughter Leah had borne to Jacob, went out to visit the daughters of the land.
translation: Na Dina, pikinini Leah i karim bek long Jakeb, i go bekim meri bilong kantri.

original: When Shechem son of Hamor the Hivite, the prince of the region, saw her, he took her and lay with her by force.
translation: Taim Shechem, pikinini bilong Hamor Hiviti, papa bilong ples, lukim em, na em kisim em i go, em stap wantaim em olsem na em bagarap em.

original: And his soul was drawn to Dinah, the daughter of Jacob. He loved the young girl and spoke to her tenderly.
translation: Na spirit blong em i kam antap long Dinah, pikinini meri bilong Jakob. Em i lukim na hamamas long liklik gel, em i tok sweol long em.

original: So Shechem told his father Hamor, “Get me this girl as a wife.”
translation: Sekem i tokim papa bilong en, Hamor, "Bai yu givim mi meri dispela, olsem meri bilong mi."

original: Jacob heard that Shechem had defiled his daughter Dinah, but since his sons were with his livestock in the field, he remained silent about it until they returned.
translation: Yakob harim tok long Shechem em i bagarap meri blo pom Dinah, tasol ol pikinini bilong en i stap wantaim animals na moni bus long gras bilong planim ka, na em i stap mama, i no tok, i w8 ol i kam bek.

original: Meanwhile, Shechem’s father Hamor came to speak with Jacob.
translation: Bai Hamor, papa bilong Sikem, i kam bihaen long tokim wantaim Jakeb.

original: When Jacob’s sons heard what had happened, they returned from the field. They were filled with grief and fury, because Shechem had committed an outrage in Israel by lying with Jacob’s daughter—a thing that should not be done.
translation: Taim pikinini bilong Yakob harim dispela tok, ol i kam bek long bus. Ol i kamap string long hed na gutpela samting, wantaim ol i bel kol posin, bikos Shekem wokim wanpela wok nogut long Isrel, em i go lip long dauta bilong Yakob - wanpela wok nogut i no ken harim.

original: But Hamor said to them, “My son Shechem longs for your daughter. Please give her to him as his wife.
translation: Hamor i tokim ol, "Pikinini man bilong mi, Shechem i laik tumas pikinini meri bilong yu. Mi askim yu, givim meri bilong yu long em na em bai kolim em meri."

original: Intermarry with us; give us your daughters, and take our daughters for yourselves.
translation: Marry wantaim mipela; givim mipela pikinini meri bilong yu, na mipela bai kisim pikinini meri bilong mipela long ol.

original: You may settle among us, and the land will be open to you. Live here, move about freely, and acquire your own property.”
translation: Yu ken kam daun stap wantaim mipela, na graun bai i opim long yu. Yu stap hia, wokabaut fri long ples, na bekim ples bilong yumi yet.

original: Then Shechem said to Dinah’s father and brothers, “Grant me this favor, and I will give you whatever you ask.
translation: Shechem i tokim papa na brata bilong Dinah, "Givim mi dispela hap, na bai mi givim yu wanem samting yu askim."

original: Demand a high dowry and an expensive gift, and I will give you whatever you ask. Only give me the girl as my wife!”
translation: Bikim pret moni long bride price, na givim mi gif narak. Mi bai givim yu olgeta samting yu laik, tasol givim meri ia long me olsem meri bilong me!

original: But because Shechem had defiled their sister Dinah, Jacob’s sons answered him and his father Hamor deceitfully.
translation: Bikos Shechem i bagarap Dinah, sister bilong ol, sons bilong Jacob i tokim em na papa bilong en Hamor long rot.

original: “We cannot do such a thing,” they said. “To give our sister to an uncircumcised man would be a disgrace to us.
translation: Inap no ken mekim samting olsem, ol i tok. I givim susa meri long man we i no katim skin bilong penis, em i go long shem, na emasin ken kam long yumi.

original: We will consent to this on one condition, that you become circumcised like us—every one of your males.
translation: Mipela i go agri long dispela long wan kondishen, olsem yu mas katim skin bilong pruning bilong yu olsem mipela, na ol man bilong yu, husat i man, mipela i askim yu long dispela.

original: Then we will give you our daughters and take your daughters for ourselves. We will dwell among you and become one people.
translation: Mipela bai givim yu pikinini meri bilong mipela, na mipela bai kisim pikinini meri bilong yu, olsem mipela yet. Mipela bai stap wantaim yupela, na mipela bai kamap ol pipol wanpela, long marit na famili, olsem simbol bilong yuniti na alians.

original: But if you will not agree to be circumcised, then we will take our sister and go.”
translation: Sapos yu no givim tok arere long katim skin bilong kok bilong yu, mipela bai kisim susa bilong mipela na go.

original: Their offer seemed good to Hamor and his son Shechem.
translation: Ofa bilong ol i luk good long Hamor na pikinini bilong em Shechem.

original: The young man, who was the most respected of all his father’s household, did not hesitate to fulfill this request, because he was delighted with Jacob’s daughter.
translation: Yong man, em i gat respek tumas long olgeta long haus bilong papa, i no bin wait, bamim bekim dispela rikues, bikos em i amaze long pikinini meri bilong Jacob.

original: So Hamor and his son Shechem went to the gate of their city and addressed the men of their city:
translation: Na Hamor na Sikem pikinini i go long gat bilong taun ol i stap, na ol i toktok wantaim ol man bilong taun:

original: “These men are at peace with us. Let them live and trade in our land; indeed, it is large enough for them. Let us take their daughters in marriage and give our daughters to them.
translation: Ol man ya i stap na pasifik long yumi. Igivim pis long ol, ol i stap na bikim bisnis long kantri bilong yumi; ol i kisim pikinini meri bilong ol long marit, na yumi inap givim pikinini meri bilong yumi long ol, bikos kantri bilong yumi i gat spes nambarpela.

original: But only on this condition will the men agree to dwell with us and be one people: if all our men are circumcised as they are.
translation: Bai mipela i stap wantaim yupela na mipela i wanpela ples long dispela kondishen tasol: if ol man bilong mipela i katim skin bilong ol long wei ol i katim skin bilong yupela.

original: Will not their livestock, their possessions, and all their animals become ours? Only let us consent to them, and they will dwell among us.”
translation: Olgeta animal, propati, na kakaruk bilong ol bai i kam bilong mipela? Mipela tasol inagrem na tokim yes long ol, na oli bai i stap wantaim mipela.

original: All the men who went out of the city gate listened to Hamor and his son Shechem, and every male of the city was circumcised.
translation: Ol man husat i go aut long gate bilong siti, ol i harim tok bilong Hamor na sikin bilong em Shechem, na ol man husat i stap long siti, ol i kisim sun i go daun, ol i katim sken bilong ol.

original: Three days later, while they were still in pain, two of Jacob’s sons (Dinah’s brothers Simeon and Levi) took their swords, went into the unsuspecting city, and slaughtered every male.
translation: Tri dei bihain, wail ol pikinini bilong Yakob, ol brata bilong Dinah, Simeon na Levi, i kisim sop na ol i go insait long siti we i no save gut, na ol i kilim ol man husat i stap, wail em i stap yet long pekpek.

original: They killed Hamor and his son Shechem with their swords, took Dinah out of Shechem’s house, and went away.
translation: Ol i kilim Hamor na pikinini bilong em wantaim sepik bilong ol, ol i kisim Dinah long haus bilong Sikehem, na ol i go wai.

original: Jacob’s other sons came upon the slaughter and looted the city, because their sister had been defiled.
translation: Olegta Pikinini bilong Yakob i kam bek long ples slaughter, na ol i stilim ol samting bilong taun, bikos susa bilong ol i bin bagarap.

original: They took their flocks and herds and donkeys, and everything else in the city or in the field.
translation: Ol i kisim olgeta animol bilong ol, na ol bulmakau, donki, na ol samting ol i gat long taun o long bus.

original: They carried off all their possessions and women and children, and they plundered everything in their houses.
translation: Ol i kisim olgeta samting bilong ol, ol meri, na ol pikinini, na ol i bagarapim olgeta samting long haus bilong ol.

original: Then Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, “You have brought trouble upon me by making me a stench to the Canaanites and Perizzites, the people of this land. We are few in number; if they unite against me and attack me, I and my household will be destroyed.”
translation: Na Jacob i tokim Simeon na Levi, "Yupela i bringim hevi i kam long me, makin mi smel no gud long Kanaanit na Perisit, ol pipal bilong dispela ples. Mipela i lak olsem, nipela tasol, na if ol i kam wan bel long me na paitim mi, mipela husat na haus lain bai i bagarap."

original: But they replied, “Should he have treated our sister like a prostitute?”
translation: Ol i bekim tok, "Em i mas givim susa bilong mipela wik kuk olsem wanpela meri long streto?"

original: Then God said to Jacob, “Arise, go up to Bethel, and settle there. Build an altar there to the God who appeared to you when you fled from your brother Esau.”
translation: Na God i tokim Jacob olsem, "Kam daun, go ap long Bethel, stap we long hap. Wokim wan altar long hap long God hu i apak showim yu wen yu ranawe long brata yuu Esau."

original: So Jacob told his household and all who were with him, “Get rid of the foreign gods that are among you. Purify yourselves and change your garments.
translation: Na Yakob i tokim husat i kam wantaim em, "Kisim bek god bilong narapela kantri i stap long yupela. Purifai yuself na chanim klos bilong yupela."

original: Then let us arise and go to Bethel. I will build an altar there to God, who answered me in my day of distress. He has been with me wherever I have gone.”
translation: Orait, mipela yet i go aplau long Betel. Mi bai bikim wanpela alter long han bilong God, em i givim ansa long mi long taim bilong sikis. Em i stap wantaim mi everywhere mi go.

original: So they gave Jacob all their foreign gods and all their earrings, and Jacob buried them under the oak near Shechem.
translation: Ol i givim Jakob ol kina sigim god bilong nesen na ol kina rinji bilong ol, na Jakob i kilim dai ol dispela samting ango unda long diwai oak klostu long Sekem.

original: As they set out, a terror from God fell over the surrounding cities, so that they did not pursue Jacob’s sons.
translation: Taim ol i go, wiket bilong God i kam daun long ples bilong narapela taun, na so nau ol i no go bihain long susa bilong Jacob.

original: So Jacob and everyone with him arrived in Luz (that is, Bethel) in the land of Canaan.
translation: Na Jakob wantaim ol arapela i kamap long Luz, em i Betel, long kantri bilong Kanaan.

original: There Jacob built an altar, and he called that place El-bethel, because it was there that God had revealed Himself to Jacob as he fled from his brother.
translation: Long hap ia, Yakob i bikim wanpela ston bilong pray, na em i kisim nem bilong ples ia El-bethel, bikos long hap em i God i sho im yet long Yakob olsem em i ranawe long brotha bilong en.

original: Now Deborah, Rebekah’s nurse, died and was buried under the oak below Bethel. So Jacob named it Allon-bachuth.
translation: Nau Deborah, nus bilong Rebekah, i dai na ol i kisim em go buri ananit long diwai oak i stap klostu long Bethel. Na Jacob i givim nem bilong ples em Allon-bacuth.

original: After Jacob had returned from Paddan-aram, God appeared to him again and blessed him.
translation: Yakob i kam bek gen from Paddan-aram, God i apokim gen i kam long em, na i givim blessing long em.

original: And God said to him, “Though your name is Jacob, you will no longer be called Jacob. Instead, your name will be Israel.” So God named him Israel.
translation: Na God i tokim em, “Nem bilong yu Jacob, tasol yu no ken kolim Jacob gen. Nem bilong yu bai Israel.” Na God i givim em nem Israel.

original: And God told him, “I am God Almighty. Be fruitful and multiply. A nation—even a company of nations—shall come from you, and kings shall descend from you.
translation: Na Bikpela God i tokim em, "Mi bikpela God olgeta. Bären long ol i go na i plenti, na i go longwe na i plenti. Nesen balusai bai kamap long yu, na kings ol lida bilong taim bifo bai kam bek long yu.

original: The land that I gave to Abraham and Isaac I will give to you, and I will give this land to your descendants after you.”
translation: Lan i givim long Abrahamu na Aisak, mi bai givim long yu, na mi bai givim dispela lan long genarashun bilong yu.

original: Then God went up from the place where He had spoken with him.
translation: Bikpela i go ap long ples we em i tokim olsem wantaim em.

original: So Jacob set up a pillar in the place where God had spoken with him—a stone marker—and he poured out a drink offering on it and anointed it with oil.
translation: Na Jakob i wokim wanpela pilia long ples we God i toktok long em - em i usim sten bilong mekim marker - na em i kisim oliga i go daun olsem ofring bilong dring long en, na em i givim em oli.

original: Jacob called the place where God had spoken with him Bethel.
translation: Yakob i kolim ples we God i tok long em, Betel.

original: Later, they set out from Bethel, and while they were still some distance from Ephrath, Rachel began to give birth, and her labor was difficult.
translation: Ol i go bek long Betel, na wail ol i stap yet long wei, long taun bilong Ephrata, Rakel i stat long karim bebi, na taitim bilong karim em i kam, em i painim difikulti.

original: During her severe labor, the midwife said to her, “Do not be afraid, for you are having another son.”
translation: Wanpela taim em i kam bilong biknem na, meri helper bilong kilim bebi i tokim em olsem, "No ken skul, kuz yu go ken kisim man bilong yu gen."

original: And with her last breath—for she was dying—she named him Ben-oni. But his father called him Benjamin.
translation: Na long win bilong laik i go daun - em i kisim sik long die, mama i givim nem long em, nem bilong em Ben-oni. Tasol papa bilong em i kolim em Benjamin.

original: So Rachel died and was buried on the way to Ephrath (that is, Bethlehem).
translation: Na Raekel i dai, na ol i birim em long rot igo long Efret, em ol i kolim Betlehemi.

original: Jacob set up a pillar on her grave; it marks Rachel’s tomb to this day.
translation: Yakob wokim wanpela pilia long graun bilong Rachel, na em i makim gravesait bilong Rachel inap long taim nau.

original: Israel again set out and pitched his tent beyond the Tower of Eder.
translation: Isrel i go bek gen na putim tent bilong en bihain long Tawa bilong Edera.

original: While Israel was living in that region, Reuben went in and slept with his father’s concubine Bilhah, and Israel heard about it. Jacob had twelve sons:
translation: Wanpela taim Isrel i stap long hap bilong en, Ruben i go insait na sindaun wantaim Bilhah, meri bilong papa long servos bilong em. Na Isrel i harim tok bilong dispela. Jakob i gat twelvpea man:

original: The sons of Leah were Reuben the firstborn of Jacob, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, and Zebulun.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Leah i bin: Ruben, em pikinini namba wan bilong Jakob, Simeon, Levi, Juda, Isakar, na Sebulun.

original: The sons of Rachel were Joseph and Benjamin.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Rekel em i Joseph na Benjamin.

original: The sons of Rachel’s maidservant Bilhah were Dan and Naphtali.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong haus meri Bilhah bilong Rekel em i Dan na Nafatali.

original: And the sons of Leah’s maidservant Zilpah were Gad and Asher. These are the sons of Jacob, who were born to him in Paddan-aram.
translation: Na ol pikinini bilong haus meri bilong Leah, Zilpah, em i Gad na Asher. Dispela ol i pikinini bilong Jacob, em i kamap long em long Paddan-aram.

original: Jacob returned to his father Isaac at Mamre, near Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron), where Abraham and Isaac had stayed.
translation: Jakob i go bek gen long papa bilong em, Aisak, long Mamre, klostu long Kiriath-arba (em i tok olsem Hebron), we bilong Abraham na Isaac i stap.

original: And Isaac lived 180 years.
translation: Na Isak i stap long yia 180.

original: Then he breathed his last and died and was gathered to his people, old and full of years. And his sons Esau and Jacob buried him.
translation: Na em i kamap pinis, i dai finis, na ol i karim i go klostu long ol papa bilong en, em i bikim olpela gen na i strong yet. Na susa bilong em, Esau na Jakob, ol i kisim i go buri.

original: This is the account of Esau (that is, Edom).
translation: Dispela em i stori bilong Esau, em i min bilong Edom.

original: Esau took his wives from the daughters of Canaan: Adah daughter of Elon the Hittite, Oholibamah daughter of Anah and granddaughter of Zibeon the Hivite,
translation: Esau i kisim meri bilong en long ol dai bilong Kanaan: Adah, dai bilong Elon Hiti, Oholibamah, dai bilong Anah na granda dai bilong Zibeon Hivi.

original: and Basemath daughter of Ishmael and sister of Nebaioth.
translation: Na Basemath dau bilong Ishmael, susa bilong Nebaioth.

original: And Adah bore Eliphaz to Esau, Basemath gave birth to Reuel,
translation: Na Adah i karim Eliphaz long Esau, Basemath i kamapim Reuel,

original: and Oholibamah gave birth to Jeush, Jalam, and Korah. These were the sons of Esau, who were born to him in the land of Canaan.
translation: Na Oholibamah i karim bek, na i bikim Jeush, Jalam, na Korah. Ol i pikinini bilong Esau, ol i kamap long en i go bek long kantri Kanaan.

original: Later, Esau took his wives and sons and daughters and all the people of his household, along with his livestock, all his other animals, and all the property he had acquired in Canaan, and he moved to a land far away from his brother Jacob.
translation: Bihain, Esau kisim meri i go na ol pikinini man na meri, ol pipol bilong haus bilong em, longlong wanpela stap wantaim ol hus, ol narapela animol, na ol samting em i kamapim long Canaan, na em i go long ples i dai wail long brata bilong en Jakob.

original: For their possessions were too great for them to dwell together; the land where they stayed could not support them because of their livestock.
translation: Olgeta samting bilong ol i bikpela tumas, ol i no inap stap viritim; grasn na kantri we ol i stap, em i no inap long sapotim ol bekos ol i gat planti animol hus.

original: So Esau (that is, Edom) settled in the area of Mount Seir.
translation: Na Esau, em i tok olsem Edom, i go sindaun long hap bilong Maunt Seir.

original: This is the account of Esau, the father of the Edomites, in the area of Mount Seir.
translation: Em i stori bilong Esau, papa bilong Edomait, long hap bilong Maunten Seir.

original: These are the names of Esau’s sons: Eliphaz son of Esau’s wife Adah, and Reuel son of Esau’s wife Basemath.
translation: Nem bilong ol pikinini bilong Esau i stap: Elifasi, pikinini bilong Ada, meri bilong Esau, na Ruel, pikinini bilong Basemati, meri bilong Esau.

original: The sons of Eliphaz were Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, and Kenaz.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Eliphaz i kol Teman, Omar, Zepho, Gatam, na Kenaz.

original: Additionally, Timna, a concubine of Esau’s son Eliphaz, gave birth to Amalek. These are the grandsons of Esau’s wife Adah.
translation: Na Timna, meri i no bin marit yet, tasol i go long Eliphaz, pikinini blo Esau, i karim bek na bambekim Amalek. Dispela ol i granisuns blo Adah, meri blo Esau.

original: These are the sons of Reuel: Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah. They are the grandsons of Esau’s wife Basemath.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Reuel em i Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, na Mizzah. Ol i ol grandchildren bilong wife bilong Esau, Basemath.

original: These are the sons of Esau’s wife Oholibamah (daughter of Anah and granddaughter of Zibeon) whom she bore to Esau: Jeush, Jalam, and Korah.
translation: Ol i pikinini bilong Oholibamah, meri bilong Esau, em i dai Anah na grandaughter bilong Zibeon, ol i kam long meri na kisim bek long Esau: Jeush, Jalam, na Korah.

original: These are the chiefs among the sons of Esau. The sons of Eliphaz the firstborn of Esau: Chiefs Teman, Omar, Zepho, Kenaz,
translation: Ol bikpela man husat i stap long ol pikinini bilong Esau: Ol pikinini bilong Eliphaz, em i pikinini namba wan bilong Esau, ol bikpela man: Teman, Omar, Zepho, Kenaz.

original: Korah, Gatam, and Amalek. They are the chiefs of Eliphaz in the land of Edom, and they are the grandsons of Adah.
translation: Korah, Gatam, na Amalek. Ol i bikpela man bilong Eliphaz long lan bilong Edom, na ol i pikinini bilong Adah.

original: These are the sons of Esau’s son Reuel: Chiefs Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, and Mizzah. They are the chiefs descended from Reuel in the land of Edom, and they are the grandsons of Esau’s wife Basemath.
translation: Ol i stap pikinini bilong Reuel, Pikinini bilong Esau: bikpela man Nahath, Zerah, Shammah, na Mizzah. Ol i stap bikpela man, ol i kam bek long lain bilong Reuel long grun bilong Edom, na ol i stap grandchildren bilong Basemath, meri bilong Esau.

original: These are the sons of Esau’s wife Oholibamah: Chiefs Jeush, Jalam, and Korah. They are the chiefs descended from Esau’s wife Oholibamah, the daughter of Anah.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong meri Esau Oholibamah: ol bifman Jeush, Jalam, na Korah. Ol bifman i kam long meri Esau Oholibamah, daugter bilong Anah.

original: All these are the sons of Esau (that is, Edom), and they were their chiefs.
translation: Ol dispela i ol pikinini bilong Esau, em i tok olsem Edom, na ol i bikpela long ol.

original: These are the sons of Seir the Horite, who were living in the land: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Seir Horit, ol i stap long lan, em i: Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah.

original: Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan. They are the chiefs of the Horites, the descendants of Seir in the land of Edom.
translation: Dishon, Ezer, na Dishan. Ol i bikpela manmeri bilong Horiti, ol desenden bilong Seir long lan bilong Edom.

original: The sons of Lotan were Hori and Hemam. Timna was Lotan’s sister.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Lotan i kolim Hori na Hemam. Timna em sistta bilong Lotan.

original: These are the sons of Shobal: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, and Onam.
translation: Ol i narapela pikinini bilong Shobal: Alvan, Manahath, Ebal, Shepho, na Onam.

original: These are the sons of Zibeon: Aiah and Anah. (This is the Anah who found the hot springs in the wilderness as he was pasturing the donkeys of his father Zibeon.)
translation: Ol i stap pikinini bilong Zibeon: Aiah na Anah. (Anah hia em i bikos long en i painim ples hot spring insait long bus, long taim em i lukautim donki bilong papa bilong em Zibeon.)

original: These are the children of Anah: Dishon and Oholibamah daughter of Anah.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Anah em i stap: Dishon na Oholibamah meri bilong Anah.

original: These are the sons of Dishon: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, and Cheran.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Dishon: Hemdan, Eshban, Ithran, na Cheran.

original: These are the sons of Ezer: Bilhan, Zaavan, and Akan.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Ezer em i Bilhan, Zaavan, na Akan.

original: These are the sons of Dishan: Uz and Aran.
translation: Ol i pikinini bilong Disan: Us na Aran.

original: These are the chiefs of the Horites: Chiefs Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah,
translation: Ol bikpela manmeri bilong ol Horiti: Bikpela manmeri Lotan, Shobal, Zibeon, Anah

original: Dishon, Ezer, and Dishan. They are the chiefs of the Horites, according to their divisions in the land of Seir.
translation: Disyon, Eza, na Disan. Ol i bif bilong Horit, olsem ol i stap long grupe bilong ol long lan bilong Seir.

original: These are the kings who reigned in the land of Edom before any king reigned over the Israelites:
translation: Ol bikpela king i stap, ol i bin rulim kantri Edom long taim bifo eni king i no bin rulim ol Israel.

original: Bela son of Beor reigned in Edom; the name of his city was Dinhabah.
translation: Bela pikinini bilong Beor i kam bos long Edom; nem bilong taun bilong em i Dinhabah.

original: When Bela died, Jobab son of Zerah from Bozrah reigned in his place.
translation: Wanpela taim Bela i dai pinis, Jobab pikinini bilong Zerah from Bozrah i kam bihain long em, na i bos.

original: When Jobab died, Husham from the land of the Temanites reigned in his place.
translation: Taim Jobab i dai pinis, Husam long kantri bilong Temanitis i kam bihain long ples bilong em.

original: When Husham died, Hadad son of Bedad, who defeated Midian in the country of Moab, reigned in his place. And the name of his city was Avith.
translation: Taim Husham i dai pinis, Hadad man bilong Bedad i kam bihain long en, em i winim Midian long kantri bilong Moab, na em i raitim long ples bilong en. Nem bilong taun bilong em Avith.

original: When Hadad died, Samlah from Masrekah reigned in his place.
translation: Taim Hadad i dai pinis, Samlah bilong Masrekah i kam bihain long em, na i bos.

original: When Samlah died, Shaul from Rehoboth on the Euphrates reigned in his place.
translation: Taim Samlaha i dai pinis, na Shaul husat i kam long Rehobot lon Efrates i bihem long ples bilong em.

original: When Shaul died, Baal-hanan son of Achbor reigned in his place.
translation: Taim Shaul i dai pinis, Baal-hanan pikinini bilong Achbor i kam bos long hap bilong en.

original: When Baal-hanan son of Achbor died, Hadad reigned in his place. His city was named Pau, and his wife’s name was Mehetabel daughter of Matred, the daughter of Me-zahab.
translation: Taim Baal-hanan, pikinini bilong Achbor, i dai, Hadad i kam bihain long em. Taun bilong en i kolim Pau, na meri bilong en i kolim Mehetabel, pikinini meri bilong Matred, pikinini meri bilong Me-zahab.

original: These are the names of Esau’s chiefs, according to their families and regions, by their names: Chiefs Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,
translation: Nem bilong bif bilong Esau, olsem ol i kam long ol famili na ol hap bilong ol, long nem bilong ol: Bif Timna, Alvah, Jetheth,

original: Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon,
translation: Oholibamah, Elah, Pinon, ol i nem bilong ples long Nem bilong Bikpela Buk.

original: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar,
translation: Kenaz, Teman, Mibzar, ol i stap long lis bilong nem propa bilong Bibel.

original: Magdiel, and Iram. These were the chiefs of Edom, according to their settlements in the land they possessed. Esau was the father of the Edomites.
translation: Magdiel, na Iram. Ol i bikpela man bilong Edom ol i stap long ples ol i kukim ol yet na ol i stap. Esau em i papa bilong ol Edom.

original: Now Jacob lived in the land where his father had resided, the land of Canaan.
translation: Nau Jakob i stap long kantri we bilong papa i bin stap, kantri bilong Kanan.

original: This is the account of Jacob. When Joseph was seventeen years old, he was tending the flock with his brothers, the sons of his father’s wives Bilhah and Zilpah, and he brought their father a bad report about them.
translation: Em i stori bilong Yakob. Taim Yusuf i 17 yia olsem, em i lukautim ol pipol bilong ples na ol brata bilong em, olsem san bilong Bilhah na Zilpah, meri bilong papa bilong em, na em i kisim stori nogut long ol brata bilong em na i givim long papa bilong em.

original: Now Israel loved Joseph more than his other sons, because Joseph had been born to him in his old age; so he made him a robe of many colors.
translation: Na Isrel i lakim Joseph moa yet long ol arapela pikinini bilong en, bikos Joseph ibin kam long en long taim em i go antap; olsem na em i wokim klos bilong plenti kala long en.

original: When Joseph’s brothers saw that their father loved him more than any of them, they hated him and could not speak a kind word to him.
translation: Braza bilong Joseph i lukim papa bilong ol i lakim em iet, ol i bagarap long en, na ol no ina save tokaut gutpela toktok long en.

original: Then Joseph had a dream, and when he told it to his brothers, they hated him even more.
translation: Na Joseph em i gat draim, na em i tokim ol brata bilong en, na ol i hatim em i strong moa.

original: He said to them, “Listen to this dream I had:
translation: Em i tokim ol, “Harim dispela drim we mi drim:”

original: We were binding sheaves of grain in the field, and suddenly my sheaf rose and stood upright, while your sheaves gathered around and bowed down to mine.”
translation: Mipela i bin klosim na baidim pipia bilong graun long graun, na mama mia pipia i go ap na stanp longpela, wail pipia bilong yu i kam klostu na katim hed long pipia bilong mi.

original: “Do you intend to reign over us?” his brothers asked. “Will you actually rule us?” So they hated him even more because of his dream and his statements.
translation: Brata i askim, "Yu laik bosim mipela? Yu yet long bosim mipela olgeta?" Na oli hatim em i kam strong mo bikos em i tok drem na toksave bilong em.

original: Then Joseph had another dream and told it to his brothers. “Look,” he said, “I had another dream, and this time the sun and moon and eleven stars were bowing down to me.”
translation: Na Joseph i gat narapela drim, na em i tokim ol brata bilong em. Em i tok, "Lukim, mi gat narapela drim, na dispela taim san, mun, na sta eleven i kisim kaikai long ai bilong mi."

original: He told his father and brothers, but his father rebuked him and said, “What is this dream that you have had? Will your mother and brothers and I actually come and bow down to the ground before you?”
translation: Em i tokim papa na brata bilong em, taso papa bilong em i strongim em na i tok, "Dispela dream yu driman, wha ting bai yu laik tok long em? Mama bilong yu, brata na papa bai i go daun na bugiem hed long graun bifor yu olgeta?"

original: And his brothers were jealous of him, but his father kept in mind what he had said.
translation: Na brata i bilong em i sakai long em, tasol papa bilong em i save long hap wanem samting em i tok.

original: Some time later, Joseph’s brothers had gone to pasture their father’s flocks near Shechem.
translation: Olsem taim igo pinis, Brata bilong Joseph i go pasuur namel long graon bilong papa ol nambis na Shekem.

original: Israel said to him, “Are not your brothers pasturing the flocks at Shechem? Get ready; I am sending you to them.” “I am ready,” Joseph replied.
translation: Isrel i tokim Josep, "Ol bratas bilong yu i no stap lo long Sekem kolim ol bikman? Bikim yu redi; mi go senem yu go long ol." "Mi redi," Josep i tok.

original: Then Israel told him, “Go now and see how your brothers and the flocks are faring, and bring word back to me.” So he sent him off from the Valley of Hebron. And when Joseph arrived in Shechem,
translation: Isrel i tokim Josep, "Go nau na lukim ol brata bilong yu na stap ol fok long wei, na kisim stori na kam bek long me." Ol i sendim em i go long Vali bilong Hebron. Na em i kamap long Sikem,

original: a man found him wandering in the field and asked, “What are you looking for?”
translation: Wanpela man i kampim em i wakabaut long gras na ol i askim em, “Yu lukim wanem?”

original: “I am looking for my brothers,” Joseph replied. “Can you please tell me where they are pasturing their flocks?”
translation: Mi laik sampela brotha bilong mi, yu inap tokim mi long we ol i stap lukautim ol kalsa bilong ol?

original: “They have moved on from here,” the man answered. “I heard them say, ‘Let us go to Dothan.’” So Joseph set out after his brothers and found them at Dothan.
translation: Ol i go pinis long hap nau, man i tok. Mi harim ol tok ples, 'Mipela i go long Dotan.' Joseph i wakabaut bihain long brata bilong en na i kisim ol long Dotan.

original: Now Joseph’s brothers saw him in the distance, and before he arrived, they plotted to kill him.
translation: Na brata bilong Joseph ol i si im longwe bilong ples, na bifo em i kam, ol i planim olsem wanem nao bai ol i kilim em.

original: “Here comes that dreamer!” they said to one another.
translation: “I kam nau, man bilong drim!” ol i tok long ol yet.

original: “Come now, let us kill him and throw him into one of the pits. We can say that a vicious animal has devoured him. Then we shall see what becomes of his dreams!”
translation: Kam daun nau, mipela i kirapim em, na mipela i troim i go long wanpela hol. Mipela i tok: 'Animal i gat bel isi i kaiim em!' Na bai mipela i lukim bai husat i kamap long tok bilong nap bilong em!

original: When Reuben heard this, he tried to rescue Joseph from their hands. “Let us not take his life,” he said.
translation: Taim Reuben harim dispela toktok, em try long savem Joseph husat i stap long han bilong ol. Em tok, "Mipela no ken kilim em."

original: “Do not shed his blood. Throw him into this pit in the wilderness, but do not lay a hand on him.” Reuben said this so that he could rescue Joseph from their hands and return him to his father.
translation: No ken tu pilim blod bilong em, tromoi em i go insait long hap pit long bus, yu no ken rausim han go long em. Ruben i tok olsem nau bilong en savem Yosep long hand bilong ol, na bringim em i go bek long papa bilong em.

original: So when Joseph came to his brothers, they stripped him of his robe—the robe of many colors he was wearing—
translation: Taim Yosep i kam long ol brata bilong en, ol i biruaim rop bilong plenti kala em i wap long en -

original: and they took him and threw him into the pit. Now the pit was empty, with no water in it.
translation: Ol i kisim em na ol i troim em i go daun long hole. Hole igat nokis samting, nogat wara i stap insait long en.

original: And as they sat down to eat a meal, they looked up and saw a caravan of Ishmaelites coming from Gilead. Their camels were carrying spices, balm, and myrrh on their way down to Egypt.
translation: Na ol sindaun na kaikai mumu, ol lookim up na lukim wanpela grup bilong ol man i karam long rot, Pipol bilong Ishimaeli, i kam bek long Gilead. Ol animol bilong desot bilong ol i karam samting i smel gud, medisin blong hevim skin, na resin blong tri, ol i go daun long Egipt.

original: Then Judah said to his brothers, “What profit will we gain if we kill our brother and cover up his blood?
translation: Yuda i tokim ol brata bilong en, “Wanem maninig mipela i gat long dispela, mipela i kilim brata bilong mipela na kamuflem blod bilong em?”

original: Come, let us sell him to the Ishmaelites and not lay a hand on him; for he is our brother, our own flesh.” And they agreed.
translation: Kam, mipela bai selim em long ol pikinini bilong Ismail na mipela no ken katim han bilong em; long em i brata bilong mipela, bodili bilong mipela. Na ol i tok oraite.

original: So when the Midianite traders passed by, his brothers pulled Joseph out of the pit and sold him for twenty shekels of silver to the Ishmaelites, who took him to Egypt.
translation: Taim ol trensela Midianite i go pas, brata bilong en i kisim Joseph aus long hole na selim em long twenty shekel silva long ol Ishmaelite, ol i karim em go long Egip.

original: When Reuben returned to the pit and saw that Joseph was not there, he tore his clothes,
translation: Taim Ruben i go bek long piti, na i luk olsem Yusuf i no stap, nau em i kirapim kus bilong en.

original: returned to his brothers, and said, “The boy is gone! What am I going to do?”
translation: I kam bek gen long brata bilong en, na tokim ol, "Kupela pikinini i go wes! Mi bai mekim wanem?"

original: Then they took Joseph’s robe, slaughtered a young goat, and dipped the robe in its blood.
translation: Ol i kisim kos bilong Joseph, ol i kilim kid goat yangpela, na ol i wetim kos bilong em long blod bilong goat.

original: They sent the robe of many colors to their father and said, “We found this. Examine it to see whether it is your son’s robe or not.”
translation: Ol i salim rop blong plenti kala long papa blong ol na ol i tok, “Mipela finisim dispela. Lu lukim i gut, bekim olsem em i rop blong pikinini blong yu o nogat.”

original: His father recognized it and said, “It is my son’s robe! A vicious animal has devoured him. Joseph has surely been torn to pieces!”
translation: Papa bilong en i save long em na i tok, "Em i laplap bilong koat blong pikinini bilong mi! Muvver animal i kaikai pinis im, na Joseph em i brikim i go daun long ol geta!"

original: Then Jacob tore his clothes, put sackcloth around his waist, and mourned for his son many days.
translation: Na Jakob im ripsapim klos blong em, im bin putim sakklot arond waist blong em, na im bin mornin long pikinini blong em olgeta de.

original: All his sons and daughters tried to comfort him, but he refused to be comforted. “No,” he said. “I will go down to Sheol mourning for my son.” So his father wept for him.
translation: Ol pikinini na ol meri bilong en i traim long givim hem komfort, tasol em i no wanpela komfort. "Nogat," em i tok. "Mi go daun long hap graun, ples bilong ol dai, long sori bilong Pikinini." Na Papa bilong en i kisim sori, nail i ail bilong en.

original: Meanwhile, the Midianites sold Joseph in Egypt to Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh and captain of the guard.
translation: Wanpela taim, Midianiti i salim Jozef long Enet na i go long Potifa, ofisa bilong Pharaoh na kapten bilong gadi.

original: About that time, Judah left his brothers and settled near a man named Hirah, an Adullamite.
translation: Long taem olsem, Judah livaim brata na susa bilong em, stap klostu long man Hirah, Man Adullam.

original: There Judah saw the daughter of a Canaanite man named Shua, and he took her as a wife and slept with her.
translation: Long hap Jude, em i lukim pikinini meri bilong man Canaanite we em i kolim Suwa, na Jude i kisim em i go olsem meri bilong en, na em i slip wantaim em.

original: So she conceived and gave birth to a son, and Judah named him Er.
translation: Na em i kamap na em i bornim man pikinini, na Judah i givim nem bilong en Er.

original: Again she conceived and gave birth to a son, and she named him Onan.
translation: Em i kisim bebi gen na em i banisim man pikinini, na em i givim nem Onan long em.

original: Then she gave birth to another son and named him Shelah; it was at Chezib that she gave birth to him.
translation: Na em i karim bebé namba tu, na em i givim nem bilong em Shelah; em i karim em long Chezib.

original: Now Judah acquired a wife for Er, his firstborn, and her name was Tamar.
translation: Nau Judah ikamaua meri bilong Er, pikinini namba wan bilong en, na nem bilong em i Tamar.

original: But Er, Judah’s firstborn, was wicked in the sight of the LORD; so the LORD put him to death.
translation: Bareket, nambawan pikinini bilong Yuda, em i bikim olgeta samting nogut long ai bilong GOD; olsem na LORD imekim em i dai.

original: Then Judah said to Onan, “Sleep with your brother’s wife. Perform your duty as her brother-in-law and raise up offspring for your brother.”
translation: Yuda i tokim Onan, “Sleep long meri bilong brata bilong yu. Wokim wok bilong yu olsem brata bilong mari, kamapim pikinini bilong brata bilong yu.”

original: But Onan knew that the offspring would not belong to him; so whenever he would sleep with his brother’s wife, he would spill his seed on the ground so that he would not produce offspring for his brother.
translation: Bare Onan save olsem pikinini bai no bilong em, na taim em slip wantaim meri bilong brata, em bai kasim semen long graun, olsem bai em i no inap produsim pikinini bilong brata.

original: What he did was wicked in the sight of the LORD, so He put Onan to death as well.
translation: Olsem em mekim maret long ai bilong Jehovah, na so em i kilim Onan tu.

original: Then Judah said to his daughter-in-law Tamar, “Live as a widow in your father’s house until my son Shelah grows up.” For he thought, “He may die too, like his brothers.” So Tamar went to live in her father’s house.
translation: Na Yuda i tok olsem long Tamar, meri bilong pikinini bilong em, "Yu stap olsem wei meri husat man i dai klostu haus bilong papa bilong yu, waitim sikiuson bilong mi Shelah i bikimol." Na Tamar i go stap long haus bilong papa bilong en.

original: After a long time Judah’s wife, the daughter of Shua, died. When Judah had finished mourning, he and his friend Hirah the Adullamite went up to his sheepshearers at Timnah.
translation: Longtaim igo pinis, meri bilong Judah, Pikinini Meri bilong Suwa, i dai pinis. Judah i pinis mournin na, na em tasol wantaim Hirah Adulamit i go ap long Timnah, go kisim wool bilong sip wantaim ol man i wokim sheepshearing.

original: When Tamar was told, “Your father-in-law is going up to Timnah to shear his sheep,”
translation: Ol i tokim Tamar, "Papa bilong husband yu i go ap long Timnah long harim sip bilong en."

original: she removed her widow’s garments, covered her face with a veil to disguise herself, and sat at the entrance to Enaim, which is on the way to Timnah. For she saw that although Shelah had grown up, she had not been given to him as a wife.
translation: Na em i kisim wei i go long lo bilong widou, na i kisim laplap na i korim pes bilong en, long harim em i go, na mekim bodi bilong en i luk olsem narapela, na i sindaun long entris long Enaim, we bilong rodo long go long Timnah. Na em i lukim ol, Shelah i bikim ol, i grow up finis, tasol i no bin givim olsem meri long em.

original: When Judah saw her, he thought she was a prostitute because she had covered her face.
translation: Taim Judah lukim em, ol tinkim em i bikim meri bosmon, bikos em i kisim skarfto kaivim pes bilong em.

original: Not realizing that she was his daughter-in-law, he went over to her and said, “Come now, let me sleep with you.” “What will you give me for sleeping with you?” she inquired.
translation: Em i no save olsem meri bilong pikinini bilong em, na em i go klostu long en na tokim em, "Kam, mi laik slip wantaim yu." Na meri bilong pikinini bilong em i askim em, "Wanem samting yu ken givim mi long slip wantaim yu?"

original: “I will send you a young goat from my flock,” Judah answered. But she replied, “Only if you leave me something as a pledge until you send it.”
translation: “Mi bai sendim yu kid goat,” Judah i tok. “Nogat,levimi samting olsem seki bilong yu, na bai mi kisim, wail nau yu bai sendim kid goat.”

original: “What pledge should I give you?” he asked. She answered, “Your seal and your cord, and the staff in your hand.” So he gave them to her and slept with her, and she became pregnant by him.
translation: “Wanem promis mi mas givim yu?” em askim. Em tok, “Sial bilong yu, kord bilong yu, na staf bilong yu we yu holim.” Na em givim ol samting bilong em long em, na sleep wantaim em, na em i kamap behane long en.

original: Then Tamar got up and departed. And she removed her veil and put on her widow’s garments again.
translation: Na Tamar em i kam daun na i go. Na em i kisim veil bilong em na putim i daun, na em i putim klos blong widou long bodi bilong em gen.

original: Now when Judah sent his friend Hirah the Adullamite with the young goat to collect the items he had left with the woman, he could not find her.
translation: Taim Judah salim frend bilong em, Hirah man bilong Adullam, i go wantaim youngpela goat bekim ol samting em lus wantaim meri, em i no inablu finim em.

original: He asked the men of that place, “Where is the shrine prostitute who was beside the road at Enaim?” “No shrine prostitute has been here,” they answered.
translation: Em askim manmeri bilong ples ia, "Meri bilong spirit we i stap long sait bilong rot klostu long Enaim i go we?" Ol i ansa, "Inap meri bilong spirit i no stap hia."

original: So Hirah returned to Judah and said, “I could not find her, and furthermore, the men of that place said, ‘No shrine prostitute has been here.’”
translation: Hirah i go bek long Judah na tokim em, "Ol i no inabe finim em, na tu ol man meri bilong ples ia ol tok, 'Meri bilong haus lotu i no stap hia.'"

original: “Let her keep the items,” Judah replied. “Otherwise we will become a laughingstock. After all, I did send her this young goat, but you could not find her.”
translation: Em i mas holim ol samting, mipela bai kamapim ol pipel laif. Mi bin salim dispela kid pik long em, tasol yupela i no inap finim em.

original: About three months later, Judah was told, “Your daughter-in-law Tamar has prostituted herself, and now she is pregnant.” “Bring her out!” Judah replied. “Let her be burned to death!”
translation: Long taim three munth igo pinis, ol i tokim Judah, "Meri bilong pikinini man Tamar i go bek long wikim bilong narapela man, na nau em i kamap suk." Kamautim em ovasait, Judah i tok. Wanbel, ol i kilim em wantaim faia!

original: As she was being brought out, Tamar sent a message to her father-in-law: “I am pregnant by the man to whom these items belong.” And she added, “Please examine them. Whose seal and cord and staff are these?”
translation: Wanpela taim ol i kisim em go aut, Tamar i sendim tok long papa bilong husban bilong em: “Mi go long bel, na man we em i gat ol samting dispela, em i papa bilong pikinini.” Na em i bin addim: “Plis yu lukim gut ol dispela. Husman we em i gat sip, kord, na stik bilong em, husat i mas?”

original: Judah recognized the items and said, “She is more righteous than I, since I did not give her to my son Shelah.” And he did not have relations with her again.
translation: Yuda i save long ol samting, na em i tok olsem, "Em i moraiti long me, long olgeta, bikos mi no givim meri long pikinini bilong mi Shelah." Na em Yuda i no gat wes wantaim em gen.

original: When the time came for Tamar to give birth, there were twins in her womb.
translation: Taim i kam long Tamar i go long karim pikinini, i gat twin bubu i stap insait long bel bilong en.

original: And as she was giving birth, one of them put out his hand; so the midwife took a scarlet thread and tied it around his wrist. “This one came out first,” she announced.
translation: Na meri i helpim mama karim bebi, em i stretchim han bilong en, na meri i kisim thread bilong redi kol na katim antid long bel bilong en. "Em i kam aus bikos em i namba wan," ol i tok.

original: But when he pulled his hand back and his brother came out, she said, “You have broken out first!” So he was named Perez.
translation: Bain em pulim han bilong en bek, na bros bilong em i kam aut, na em tok, “Yu brokin aut fas!” Na em i kolim Perez.

original: Then his brother came out with the scarlet thread around his wrist, and he was named Zerah.
translation: Na brata bilong em i kam aus wantaim thred bilong red i go raunm long han bilong em, na em i kolim Zerah.

original: Meanwhile, Joseph had been taken down to Egypt, where an Egyptian named Potiphar, an officer of Pharaoh and captain of the guard, bought him from the Ishmaelites who had taken him there.
translation: Wanpela taim, Josep im go daun long Ijip, na Potifa, ofisa bilong Faraoh long Ijip, kapten bilong gadi, bamim bek long em husat Ismaelite i kisim i go daun long en.

original: And the LORD was with Joseph, and he became a successful man, serving in the household of his Egyptian master.
translation: Na Bikpela i stap wantaim Yosef, na em i kamap man strong na gutpela, em i wok long haus bilong maser Egypt.

original: When his master saw that the LORD was with him and made him prosper in all he did,
translation: Taim master bilong en i lukim Bikpela i stap wantaim em, na i mekim em i wok strong long ol samting em i mekim.

original: Joseph found favor in his sight and became his personal attendant. Potiphar put him in charge of his household and entrusted him with everything he owned.
translation: Yusuf i pikinim favaret long ai bilong Potifara, na em i kamap olsem yangpela boi bilong em. Potifara i putim em i stap long ples bilong bos, na i givim em olgeta samting long han bilong em, from hus na olgeta samting em i gat, Yusuf i menejim hus.

original: From the time that he put Joseph in charge of his household and all he owned, the LORD blessed the Egyptian’s household on account of him. The LORD’s blessing was on everything he owned, both in his house and in his field.
translation: Long taim em putim Joseph i kam bos long haus bilong en na long kisim bilong em, Papa God i givim blesing long haus bilong Egyptian man. Blesing bilong Papa God i stap long olgeta samting em i gat, long haus bilong en na long graun bilong en.

original: So Potiphar left all that he owned in Joseph’s care; he did not concern himself with anything except the food he ate. Now Joseph was well-built and handsome,
translation: Potiphar i lusim olgeta samting em i bin hav long han bilong Yosep; em i no bin tok long en, sapos long ka em i kaikai. Na Yosep em i strongpela na em i gutpela.

original: and after some time his master’s wife cast her eyes upon Joseph and said, “Sleep with me.”
translation: Olsem taim i go pinis, meri bilong bos i lukim na kisim interest long Joseph na i tok, "Kam slep wantaim mi."

original: But he refused. “Look,” he said to his master’s wife, “with me here, my master does not concern himself with anything in his house, and he has entrusted everything he owns to my care.
translation: Em i refusim. "Lukim," em i tokim meri bilong papa bilong en, "long mi hap, papa bilong mi no save tok olsem long husat i kam long haus, na olgeta samting bilong en em i givim long mi yet, ol samting bilong en em i kekalem long mi.

original: No one in this house is greater than I am. He has withheld nothing from me except you, because you are his wife. So how could I do such a great evil and sin against God?”
translation: Nogat wan man i bikpela long haus bilong mipela olsem na mi. Em i stap raisim mipela, tasol yu alone em i no givim mipela, olsem yu meri bilong em. Olsem wanem mi bai ken mekim dispela bikpela nogut na sin bilong God?

original: Although Potiphar’s wife spoke to Joseph day after day, he refused to go to bed with her or even be near her.
translation: Meri bilong Potiphar i tokim Joseph oldei bihain oldei, tasol em i no laik go bek long bodi wantaim em, naua em i no kam klostu long em.

original: One day, however, Joseph went into the house to attend to his work, and not a single household servant was inside.
translation: Wanpela de, Josep i go insait long haus long mekim wok bilong en, na ikam na i no gat servit man hus i stap insait.

original: She grabbed Joseph by his cloak and said, “Sleep with me!” But leaving his cloak in her hand, he escaped and ran outside.
translation: Meri i tumasim Joseph long klos bilong en na tokim em, “Sleep wantaim mi!” Tasol Joseph i luskim klos bilong en, i stap long han bilong meri, na em i ronawe na ranapim igo long ausait.

original: When she saw that he had left his cloak in her hand and had run out of the house,
translation: Tupela i kukim ol i bikim dispela: Em i lukim klos bilong em i stap yet long han bilong meri, na em i ranawe pinis long haus.

original: she called her household servants. “Look,” she said, “this Hebrew has been brought to us to make sport of us. He came to me so he could sleep with me, but I screamed as loud as I could.
translation: Em i kolim ol servan bilong em. “Lukim,” em i tok, “dispela Hebrew i kam long mipela na ol i laik bagarapim mipela. Em i kam long me na em i laik slep wantaim me, tasol mi go wail langeleve.

original: When he heard me scream for help, he left his cloak beside me and ran out of the house.”
translation: Wanpela taim em harim mi singautim strong long hap, em lusim klos bilong en nambis long mi na ranawe rausim haus.

original: So Potiphar’s wife kept Joseph’s cloak beside her until his master came home.
translation: Meri bilong Potiphar i kisim klos bilong Josep na i wiat til masuta bilong em i kam bek long haus.

original: Then she told him the same story: “The Hebrew slave you brought us came to me to make sport of me,
translation: Na em i tokim em olsem samting nau: “Slave bilong Isrel yu brimgim mipela kam, em i kam bek long me na laik mekim bilak bilong mi.
