translation: Na Bikpela i tokim Moses, “Yusim tok long Aaron, ‘Stretchim han bilong yu wantaim stik bilong mekim wok bilong yu long rivers, kanal, na pondo, na mekim ol frog i kam up long graun bilong Ijip.’”

original: So Aaron stretched out his hand over the waters of Egypt, and the frogs came up and covered the land of Egypt.
translation: Aaron em i stretim han bilong en long wata bilong Ijip, na rop i kam na kisim kova graun bilong Ijip.

original: But the magicians did the same thing by their magic arts, and they also brought frogs up onto the land of Egypt.
translation: Bikos ol magisi i mekim samting olsem long ol geta bilong ol, na ol i karim froak i kamap antap long lain bilong Ijip.

original: Pharaoh summoned Moses and Aaron and said, “Pray to the LORD to take the frogs away from me and my people. Then I will let your people go, that they may sacrifice to the LORD.”
translation: Faraao i kolim Moses na Aaron, na i tok olsem: “Pri long tok save long LORD, kisim frog ol i go we, na mi bai lusiim piple bilong yu, na bai yu i go wok sacrifice long LORD.

original: Moses said to Pharaoh, “You may have the honor over me. When shall I pray for you and your officials and your people that the frogs (except for those in the Nile) may be taken away from you and your houses?”
translation: Mosese i tokim Pharaoh, "Yu gat respek winim mi. Wanem taim bai mi Rogrenai long yu na ol ofisa na ol pipol bilong yu, na mipi ol frogs em bai i go longwe, eksept long ol i stap insait long Nail?"

original: “Tomorrow,” Pharaoh answered. “May it be as you say,” Moses replied, “so that you may know that there is no one like the LORD our God.
translation: “Tumora,” Pharaoh i tok bek. “Em i orait olsem yu tok,” Moses i givim bek, “olsem yu ken know long tok bilong LORD God bilong yumi, em i spesol, i no gat narapela olsem em.”

original: The frogs will depart from you and your houses and your officials and your people; they will remain only in the Nile.”
translation: Rop bai i go longwe long yu, na long hus na ofisa na ol pipol bilong yu; tasol bai ol i stap yet long Nai.

original: After Moses and Aaron had left Pharaoh, Moses cried out to the LORD for help with the frogs that He had brought against Pharaoh.
translation: Long Moses na Aaron i go bek long Pharaoh, Moses i singaut i go long Lodol yar i helpim wantaim frogs ol i kam bek long Pharaoh.

original: And the LORD did as Moses requested, and the frogs in the houses, the courtyards, and the fields died.
translation: Na Bikpela i mekim olsem Musa i bin askim, na ol frog i dai pinis long haus, long ka, na long graun.

original: They were piled into countless heaps, and there was a terrible stench in the land.
translation: Ol bodi i pilim long hap bilong en, na i gat smel nogut tru long kantri.

original: When Pharaoh saw that there was relief, however, he hardened his heart and would not listen to Moses and Aaron, just as the LORD had said.
translation: Wanpela taim Faraon i lukim olgeta i kamap strong gen, em i strongim het bilong em, na em i no lisin long Moses na Aaron, olsem LORD i tok.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Tell Aaron, ‘Stretch out your staff and strike the dust of the earth, that it may turn into swarms of gnats throughout the land of Egypt.’”
translation: LORD i tokim Mosese, “Yu tokim Aron, ‘Yu stretim stick bilong yu na paitim dust bilong graun, na dust bai i kamapim ol narapela kala smok i go pinis long kantri bilong Ijip.’”

original: This they did, and when Aaron stretched out his hand with his staff and struck the dust of the earth, gnats came upon man and beast. All the dust of the earth turned into gnats throughout the land of Egypt.
translation: Ol i wokim wanpela akson, na taim Aron i stretim han bilong em wantaim stik bilong em, na i kilim dust bilong graun, gnats i kamap long man na beast. Olgeta dust bilong graun i chanj long gnats long kantri bilong Egip.

original: The magicians tried to produce gnats using their magic arts, but they could not. And the gnats remained on man and beast.
translation: Ol magisan i traim long mekim mosquitos tasol ol i no inap. Na mosquitos i stap yet long man na animal.

original: “This is the finger of God,” the magicians said to Pharaoh. But Pharaoh’s heart was hardened, and he would not listen to them, just as the LORD had said.
translation: “Em i finger bilong God,” ol magisan i tokim Pharaoh. Tasol harten bilong Pharaoh i bin harden olsem ston, na em i no lisin long ol, olsem Bikpela i bin tok.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Get up early in the morning, and when Pharaoh goes out to the water, stand before him and tell him that this is what the LORD says: ‘Let My people go, so that they may worship Me.
translation: Papa God i tokim Mose, "Kam daun bikos em i moaning, na wankain Faraon i go long wara, stap bifor em na toktok wantaim em, olsem: 'Lusim ples ren na bilong mi, naso ol i ken go lotu long me.'"

original: But if you will not let My people go, I will send swarms of flies upon you and your officials and your people and your houses. The houses of the Egyptians and even the ground where they stand will be full of flies.
translation: Bai yumi no givim piple bilong me i go, mi bai sendim plenti flae i kam ans long yu na ol ofisa bilong yu na piple bilong yu na haus bilong yu. Haus bilong Egyptian na graun we ol i stan yet, olgeta bai fulap long flae.

original: But on that day I will give special treatment to the land of Goshen, where My people live; no swarms of flies will be found there. In this way you will know that I, the LORD, am in the land.
translation: Bain olgeta de mi bai givim speshal tingting long kantri bilong Goshen, we bilong ples ol pipol bilong mi istap; ino plenti flies bai stap long hap. Long dispela wei yupela bai save olsem, mi, LORD, istap long kantri.

original: I will make a distinction between My people and your people. This sign will take place tomorrow.’”
translation: Mi bai mekim difrens bilong ol pipol bilong Mi na ol pipol bilong yu. Dispela sain em bai i kamap tumora.

original: And the LORD did so. Thick swarms of flies poured into Pharaoh’s palace and into the houses of his officials. Throughout Egypt the land was ruined by swarms of flies.
translation: Na LORD i mekim olsem. Plenti flies i kam insait long haus bilong Faraon na insait long haus bilong ofisala bilong em. Long olgeta hap bilong Egypt, kantri i bagarap olgeta long plenti flies.

original: Then Pharaoh summoned Moses and Aaron and said, “Go, sacrifice to your God within this land.”
translation: Na Pharaoh i kirapim Moses na Aaron, i tok, "Go, wokim sakrifis long Gott bilong yupela long kantri ia."

original: But Moses replied, “It would not be right to do that, because the sacrifices we offer to the LORD our God would be detestable to the Egyptians. If we offer sacrifices that are detestable before the Egyptians, will they not stone us?
translation: Moses itokim, "Em no inap long wokim olsem, bikos mipela bai ofa saksak long LORD God bilong mipela, na em i nogut tru long Egyptian. I saksak ol i no liklik long Egyptian, bai ol i kilim mipela wantaim ston?"

original: We must make a three-day journey into the wilderness and sacrifice to the LORD our God as He commands us.”
translation: Mipela mas wokabaut i go long bus tri dei na brukim sakramen long Jehovah olsem em i laikim mipela.

original: Pharaoh answered, “I will let you go and sacrifice to the LORD your God in the wilderness, but you must not go very far. Now pray for me.”
translation: Faraon i tok, "Mi bai lusi yumupela go na wokim sakrifis long LORD Bikpela bilong yu long bus, bere na yu no go longwe na i go dae. Nau prey bilong yu long mi."

original: “As soon as I leave you,” Moses said, “I will pray to the LORD, so that tomorrow the swarms of flies will depart from Pharaoh and his officials and his people. But Pharaoh must not act deceitfully again by refusing to let the people go and sacrifice to the LORD.”
translation: Olsem mi lusim yu, Moses i tok, “Mi bai pray long LORD, na yumai ol swarm bilong flies bai lusim Pharaoh na ofisala bilong em na ol pipel bilong em. Tasol Pharaoh no ken stretim ol sem long gen, i no givim ples long ol pipel i go na ofa long LORD.”

original: Then Moses left Pharaoh and prayed to the LORD,
translation: Na Mosis i lusim Farao, na i beten long LORD.

original: and the LORD did as Moses requested. He removed the swarms of flies from Pharaoh and his officials and his people; not one fly remained.
translation: Na Bikpela i mekim olsem Musa i bin askim. Em i kisim awai ol flai i kam harim long Faraao, ofisa, na ol pipol bilong em; ol flai ikam harim i no stap, tasol i go pinis.

original: But Pharaoh hardened his heart this time as well, and he would not let the people go.
translation: Bare Faraon i strongim het bilong en tena, na em i no lusim ol pipol i go.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Go to Pharaoh and tell him that this is what the LORD, the God of the Hebrews, says: ‘Let My people go, so that they may worship Me.
translation: Papa God i tokim Mosis, “Go long Pharaoh na tokim em, Bikpela God bilong Hepri i tok olsem: ‘Lusim pkin bilong Mi go, naso ol i ken sarve Mi.’”

original: But if you continue to restrain them and refuse to let them go,
translation: Bai yupela i holim strong olsem na stap, nosave givim pinis permission long ol,

original: then the hand of the LORD will bring a severe plague on your livestock in the field—on your horses, donkeys, camels, herds, and flocks.
translation: Na han bilong LORD bai bringim wail pes bilong strongpela sik long ol animol bilong yu long graun - long hors, donki, kemel, ol bulmakau, na ol fok.

original: But the LORD will make a distinction between the livestock of Israel and the livestock of Egypt, so that no animal belonging to the Israelites will die.’”
translation: Papa God bai wokim difrens long animit bilong Israel na animit bilong Ijip, nau olsem bai no kind animal bilong Israelit bai dai.

original: The LORD set a time, saying, “Tomorrow the LORD will do this in the land.”
translation: Papa bilong yumiyumi i setim taim, ol i tok, "Tumora Papa bilong yumiyumi bai mekim dispela klostu long kantri."

original: And the next day the LORD did just that. All the livestock of the Egyptians died, but not one animal belonging to the Israelites died.
translation: Na dia nambawan, Bikpela i mekim olsem tasol. Ol kain animal bilong Ijipita i dai olgeta, tasol not a single wan animal bilong Israelites i no dai.

original: Pharaoh sent officials and found that none of the livestock of the Israelites had died. But Pharaoh’s heart was hardened, and he would not let the people go.
translation: Faraon i sendim ofisala, na ol i lukim be nem igat olgeta animals bilong Israelait i dai pinis. Tasol harten bilong Faraon i strongim, na em i no givim ples long pipel i go.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses and Aaron, “Take handfuls of soot from the furnace; in the sight of Pharaoh, Moses is to toss it into the air.
translation: Bikpela i tokim Moses na Aaron, “Kamautim hanfuls bilong soot long plaia bilong kotim kanaka; long ai bilong Faraon, Moses i mas throwim i go long aire.

original: It will become fine dust over all the land of Egypt, and festering boils will break out on man and beast throughout the land.”
translation: Em bai kamap dae drai pinis long olgeta graun bilong Egip, na sukul bungim na kirapim bai kamap long ol manmeri na ol bek long ol hap bilong graun.

original: So they took soot from the furnace and stood before Pharaoh. Moses tossed it into the air, and festering boils broke out on man and beast.
translation: Ol i kisim kol bilong pot na ol i stap bifo Faraon. Moses i kirapim em i go antap long ako, na sipikpik i kamap olsem ulsavers long bodi bilong man na animal.

original: The magicians could not stand before Moses, because the boils had broken out on them and on all the Egyptians.
translation: Maman i no inap stap bifor Moses, bikos boil i kam antap long ol, na long ol Ijip.

original: But the LORD hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he would not listen to them, just as the LORD had said to Moses.
translation: Bikpela i givim bel bilong Faraon i strong na strong, na em i no lissen olsem, olsem Bikpela i tokim Mosese.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Get up early in the morning, stand before Pharaoh, and tell him that this is what the LORD, the God of the Hebrews, says: ‘Let My people go, so that they may worship Me.
translation: Bikpela i tokim Mosis, "Kam bek long moning i go, stap bifo Farao, tokim em olsem: Bikpela God bilong Hebri i tok olsem: 'Lusim ol pipol bilong Mi i go, na ol i ken wosipim Mi.'"

original: Otherwise, I will send all My plagues against you and your officials and your people, so you may know that there is no one like Me in all the earth.
translation: Nogat ananit, Mi bai sendim olgeta plak bilong mi long yu na ofisa bilong yu na ol pipol bilong yu, na yu ken know ol i no gat narapela laik me long olgeta graun.

original: For by this time I could have stretched out My hand and struck you and your people with a plague to wipe you off the earth.
translation: Na em i go long taim nau, mi harim tok, mi putim han bilong mi, na mi kilim yu na ol ples bilong yu wantaim sik long plague, na yu na ol i no stap long graun.

original: But I have raised you up for this very purpose, that I might display My power to you, and that My name might be proclaimed in all the earth.
translation: Mi bin kirapim yu bilong dispela pasin, dat me inap showim yu strongpela wok bilong me, na nem bilong me i go ol arong long graun.

original: Still, you lord it over My people and do not allow them to go.
translation: Yu yet bosim ol pipol bilong Mi, na yu no givim pinis permission long ol i go.

original: Behold, at this time tomorrow I will rain down the worst hail that has ever fallen on Egypt, from the day it was founded until now.
translation: Sios, ba yia long tude, mi bai bringim ais pes i kam daun, em i nogut tumas, olsem we ai neva bin pundaun yet long Ijip, stat long wanem taim ples ia igat birua, long taim bilong ples ia.

original: So give orders now to shelter your livestock and everything you have in the field. Every man or beast that remains in the field and is not brought inside will die when the hail comes down upon them.’”
translation: Givim tok strong nau, kisim ol animol bilong yu na putim insait long haus, na ol samting yu gat long graun. Ol man o animol husat i stap yet long graun na no bringim i go insait, bai ol dai wen ais i kam daun ponim ol.

original: Those among Pharaoh’s officials who feared the word of the LORD hurried to bring their servants and livestock to shelter,
translation: Long long namel bilong ofisala bikman Pharaoh, ol i bikimiked na gat respek long tok bilong LORD, oli harim go na bringim wokman na ol kind bilong animal long ples we bai ol i stap na kisim hevi.

original: but those who disregarded the word of the LORD left their servants and livestock in the field.
translation: Bareket ol i no givim importans long tok bilong Jehovah, na ol i lusim ol servit na ol animol long graun.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Stretch out your hand toward heaven, so that hail may fall on all the land of Egypt—on man and beast and every plant of the field throughout the land of Egypt.”
translation: Bikpela i tokim Mosis olsem, “Stretim han bilong yu go hap long heven, na hail i pundaun long graun bilong Egypt, long ol manmeri, animal, na ol kain plants bilong graun.”

original: So Moses stretched out his staff toward heaven, and the LORD sent thunder and hail, and lightning struck the earth. So the LORD rained down hail upon the land of Egypt.
translation: Na Mosis em i stretim stap bilong en long heven, na Bikpela i salim thunder na hail, na laipin i kam daun na kilim graun. Na Bikpela i rainim hail daun long kantri bilong Ijip.

original: The hail fell and the lightning continued flashing through it. The hail was so severe that nothing like it had ever been seen in all the land of Egypt from the time it became a nation.
translation: Hail i pundaun na laitning i go antap longpela taim olsem. Hail i kam strong Tru, olgeta samting i no nap saves long dispela, nogat samting olsem i kamap bifora long kantri bilong Ijip, taim em i bihainim nesen bilong en.

original: Throughout the land of Egypt, the hail struck down everything in the field, both man and beast; it beat down every plant of the field and stripped every tree.
translation: Long olgeta graun bilong Egip, hail i paitim daun ol samting long graun, ol man na beast; ol i kam daun strong, na i kilim ol kala bilong graun, na i birua ol diwai.

original: The only place where it did not hail was in the land of Goshen, where the Israelites lived.
translation: Em i wanpela hap we rein i no kamdaun long lan bilong Gosen, we Isrelait i stap.

original: Then Pharaoh summoned Moses and Aaron. “This time I have sinned,” he said. “The LORD is righteous, and I and my people are wicked.
translation: Faraon i kolim Moses na Aaron. "Taim bilong mi sin nau," ol i tok. "Bikpela i stap rait, na mi na ol pikinini bilong mi i no gat rait."

original: Pray to the LORD, for there has been enough of God’s thunder and hail. I will let you go; you do not need to stay any longer.”
translation: Prea long tokim Lod, genanap long taim nau, olgeta thunder na hailston bilong God i go pinis. Bai mi lusim yu go, yu no ken stap harolongtaim.

original: Moses said to him, “When I have left the city, I will spread out my hands to the LORD. The thunder will cease, and there will be no more hail, so that you may know that the earth is the LORD’s.
translation: Moses i tokim em, “Namba wanpela taim mi lusim taun, mi go waisim han bilong mi long LORD. Thunder bai i stap, na rein bilong ais bai i no kam bek gen, na yu ken know gras em i bilong LORD.

original: But as for you and your officials, I know that you still do not fear the LORD our God.”
translation: Bai yu yet na ofisala bilong yu, mi save olsem yu i no stil ken isave long Bikpela God bilong yumi.

original: (Now the flax and barley were destroyed, since the barley was ripe and the flax was in bloom;
translation: Na flaks na bareli ibin bagarap, long taim barley ibin kamap strong olsem na flaks ibin mekim flawa.

original: but the wheat and spelt were not destroyed, because they are late crops.)
translation: Na wheat na spelt i no bin dai pinis, bikos ol i krops i kam long taim.

original: Then Moses departed from Pharaoh, went out of the city, and spread out his hands to the LORD. The thunder and hail ceased, and the rain no longer poured down on the land.
translation: Na Mosis i go bek long Faraon, i kamaut long siti, na i wandaupim han bilong en long LORD. Thunder na hail i pinis, ren i no givim rain i kam daunogen long graun gen.

original: When Pharaoh saw that the rain and hail and thunder had ceased, he sinned again and hardened his heart—he and his officials.
translation: Wanpela taim Faraon i lukim ren, hail, na thanda i stap pinis, em i sin agen na strongim het bilong en – em tasol, na ofisa bilong en.

original: So Pharaoh’s heart was hardened, and he would not let the Israelites go, just as the LORD had said through Moses.
translation: Hati bilong Pharaoh i kamap strong olsem ston, na em i no wanpela lusim Israelites i go, olsem Ol Masalai i tok thru Moses.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Go to Pharaoh, for I have hardened his heart and the hearts of his officials, that I may perform these miraculous signs of Mine among them,
translation: Bikpela i tokim Mosis, “Yu go long Pharaoh, bikos mi bin strongim het bilong en na het bilong ofisa bilong en, ili mi ken mekim singsing bung wo ol i lukim long ol.

original: and that you may tell your children and grandchildren how severely I dealt with the Egyptians when I performed miraculous signs among them, so that all of you may know that I am the LORD.”
translation: Na yupela i mas tokim ol pikinini na ol grandfathers bilong yu olsem, mi strongim Egyptians, mi mekim sain i go hevi long ol, mipela i mekim wok bung long ol, so ol i ken know, mi em i LORD.

original: So Moses and Aaron went to Pharaoh and told him, “This is what the LORD, the God of the Hebrews, says: ‘How long will you refuse to humble yourself before Me? Let My people go, so that they may worship Me.
translation: Na Moses na Aaron i go bekim Pharaoh, ol i toktok long em, "Dispela em i tok bilong Bikpela, God bilong Hebrew: 'Oli man i go het long yu refusim, yu no ken lusim praid bilong yu? Lirim pipol bilong Mi, yangpela yu mas servisim Mi.'"

original: But if you refuse to let My people go, I will bring locusts into your territory tomorrow.
translation: Bai yu nogat wan bilong letim piple bilong Mipela i go, orait Mipela bai bringim lokis i kam insait kantri bilong yu tude.

original: They will cover the face of the land so that no one can see it. They will devour whatever is left after the hail and eat every tree that grows in your fields.
translation: Ol bai kova bekim gras bilong kantri, nogat wanpela i kam sikim. Ol bai kaikaim ol samting i stap bihain long ais, na ol bai kai ol diwai i karim long graun bilong yu.

original: They will fill your houses and the houses of all your officials and every Egyptian—something neither your fathers nor your grandfathers have seen since the day they came into this land.’” Then Moses turned and left Pharaoh’s presence.
translation: Ol bai filim haus bilong yu, na ol haus bilong ofisa bilong yu, na ol Egipsi – samting we papa bilong yu na papa bilong papa bilong yu i no see yet sinds dai ol i kam insait long kantri.’” Na Moses i turnim bek na lusim prisens bilong Pharaoh.

original: Pharaoh’s officials asked him, “How long will this man be a snare to us? Let the people go, so that they may worship the LORD their God. Do you not yet realize that Egypt is in ruins?”
translation: Ofisala bilong Pharaoh i askim em, "Em nau bai wail long wanem taim olsem na stap na? Lusim ol pipol i go, nasel wosipim Lord God bilong ol. Yu no save yet long dispela Ejip i bagarap pinis?"

original: So Moses and Aaron were brought back to Pharaoh. “Go, worship the LORD your God,” he said. “But who exactly will be going?”
translation: Moses na Aaron i kam bek gen long Faraon. "Yu go wosipim Bikpela God bilong yu," Faraon i tok. "Husat olsem bai go?"

original: “We will go with our young and old,” Moses replied. “We will go with our sons and daughters, and with our flocks and herds, for we must hold a feast to the LORD.”
translation: Mipela bai go wantaim ol pikinini na ol big man, wantaim ol man na ol meri, na wantaim ol liklik beast na ol bigpela beast, mipela bai kisim kaikai long Jehovah.

original: Then Pharaoh told them, “May the LORD be with you if I ever let you go with your little ones. Clearly you are bent on evil.
translation: Na Pharaoh i tokim ol, "Mipela i hope LORD i stap wantaim yupela, mi bai lusim yupela go wantaim pikinini bilong yupela. Inap long ol, yupela i masalai, yupela i laik mekim ol samting nogut."

original: No, only the men may go and worship the LORD, since that is what you have been requesting.” And Moses and Aaron were driven from Pharaoh’s presence.
translation: Nogat, ol man bai go na wosipim Lod long ples, bikos em i stap long pikinini bilong yupela i askim. Na Moses na Aaron im bin kasim long wei husat i go long ples bilong Pharaoh.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Stretch out your hand over the land of Egypt, so that the locusts may swarm over it and devour every plant in the land—everything that the hail has left behind.”
translation: Na Lod i tokim Mosis olsem, “Taitim han bilong yu ibric long kantri bilong Ijip, bilong gras hopa i kam na kisim kantri, na kaikai olgeta kain planti long graun—olgeta samting we rein i kat olsem ais i lusim bihain.”

original: So Moses stretched out his staff over the land of Egypt, and throughout that day and night the LORD sent an east wind across the land. By morning the east wind had brought the locusts.
translation: Na Mosis em i stretim owtim stik bilong en ibirim graun bilong Ejip, na long de bilem na nait, Bikpela i salim win bilong east ibiram graun. Biaka, win bilong east em i bringim lokis.

original: The locusts swarmed across the land and settled over the entire territory of Egypt. Never before had there been so many locusts, and never again will there be.
translation: Ol lokis i kamautim olgeta long kantri, na ol i pundaun olgeta long hap graun bilong Ijip. Nogat yet olsem kain lokis i kamap, na nogat bihain bai ol i kamap gen.

original: They covered the face of all the land until it was black, and they consumed all the plants on the ground and all the fruit on the trees that the hail had left behind. Nothing green was left on any tree or plant in all the land of Egypt.
translation: Ol i kova fas bilong olgeta graun, na ol i kamapoi black, ol i kaikai planti olgeta plan long graun, na olgeta fruit long diwai we hail ibin lusim bihain. Inogat sampela grinpela i stap long diwai o plan long olgeta graun bilong Ijip.

original: Pharaoh quickly summoned Moses and Aaron and said, “I have sinned against the LORD your God and against you.
translation: Faraon i kisim Moses na Aron hariup na ol i tok, "Mi bin sin agensim LORD God bilong yu na agensim yupela."

original: Now please forgive my sin once more and appeal to the LORD your God, that He may remove this death from me.”
translation: Nau, bikos hamamas, forgivim sin bilong mi genagena, na yu makim apel i go long LORD God bilong yu, kia He inap kisim wei des laip bilong mi.

original: So Moses left Pharaoh’s presence and appealed to the LORD.
translation: Moses lusim pesens bilong Faraon na i go bekim LORD.

original: And the LORD changed the wind to a very strong west wind that carried off the locusts and blew them into the Red Sea. Not a single locust remained anywhere in Egypt.
translation: Na GOD bilong yumi i changem win blong wes, win i strong tru, na ol lokis i kisim i go, na ol i bungim i go insait long Red Si. Maski wanpela lokis i no stap long eni hap long Ijip.

original: But the LORD hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he would not let the Israelites go.
translation: Bikpela i strongim het bilong Faraon, na em i no wanpela lusim Israelites i go.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Stretch out your hand toward heaven, so that darkness may spread over the land of Egypt—a palpable darkness.”
translation: Na Lod i tokim Mosis olsem, "Strechim han bilong yu long heven, bilong mekim dek i strong long kamautim, dek i go antap long kantri Egypt."

original: So Moses stretched out his hand toward heaven, and total darkness covered all the land of Egypt for three days.
translation: Na Mususi stretchim han bilong en long heven, na dikwan bes na kova olgeta graun bilong Ipig foa de.

original: No one could see anyone else, and for three days no one left his place. Yet all the Israelites had light in their dwellings.
translation: Nogat wanpela i kam sikim narapela, na long tripe de, ol Israelites i gat lait long ol husat, tasol nogat wanpela i lusim ples bilong en.

original: Then Pharaoh summoned Moses and said, “Go, worship the LORD. Even your little ones may go with you; only your flocks and herds must stay behind.”
translation: Na Pharaoh i kolim Moses na tokim, "Yu go wosipim Lord. Ol pikinini bilong yu inap go wantaim yu; nogat samting, ol bulmakau na ol pig bilong yu mas stap behain."

original: But Moses replied, “You must also provide us with sacrifices and burnt offerings to present to the LORD our God.
translation: Moses i tokim ol, "Bai yumui givim mipela sakrifis na ofing bung bai bringim i go long Hanu bilong yumi."

original: Even our livestock must go with us; not a hoof will be left behind, for we will need some of them to worship the LORD our God, and we will not know how we are to worship the LORD until we arrive.”
translation: Ol anus bilong mipela mas i go wantaim mipela; not a singel hofo bai i stap behain, bikos mipela bai needim ol long worshipim Lod God bilong yumi, na mipela yet inogat save long wanem samting bai mipela usim long worshipim Lod, until mipela i kamap.

original: But the LORD hardened Pharaoh’s heart, and he was unwilling to let them go.
translation: Bikpela i strongim bel bilong Faraon, na em i no laik lusim ol.

original: “Depart from me!” Pharaoh said to Moses. “Make sure you never see my face again, for on the day you see my face, you will die.”
translation: Faraoh i tokim Moses, "Lusim me! Singsing i go longwe na yu no ken si facem bilong me gen, bikos long de yu si facem bilong me, yu bai dai."

original: “As you say,” Moses replied, “I will never see your face again.”
translation: Olsem yu tok, Mosis i bekim tok, Mi no ina lukim pes bilong yu gen.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “I will bring upon Pharaoh and Egypt one more plague. After that, he will allow you to leave this place. And when he lets you go, he will drive you out completely.
translation: Na Papa God i tokim Mosis, "Mi bai bringim wanpela narakain pestis i go long Faraon na Egip. Na bihain em bai givim yu lus long ples ia, na em bai pusim yu longwe nau.

original: Now announce to the people that men and women alike should ask their neighbors for articles of silver and gold.”
translation: Tokim ol pipol long stori, man na meri olsem wan, bekim nek balans bilong ol long kaunsel, ol i mas askim nekbalans bilong ol long givim samting bilong silva na gol.

original: And the LORD gave the people favor in the sight of the Egyptians. Moreover, Moses himself was highly regarded in Egypt by Pharaoh’s officials and by the people.
translation: Na LORD i givim pipol gutpela sindaun long ai bilong Egipcan. Na Moses em selv i stap strong long tok bilong ol, ofisal bilong Pharaoh na pipol long Egip.

original: So Moses declared, “This is what the LORD says: ‘About midnight I will go throughout Egypt,
translation: Moses i tokim ol, "Dispela em tok bilong Papa God: 'Bai mi go long midnait, na mi go long ol ples bilong Ijip',"

original: and every firstborn son in the land of Egypt will die, from the firstborn of Pharaoh who sits on his throne, to the firstborn of the servant girl behind the hand mill, as well as the firstborn of all the cattle.
translation: Na olgeta pikinini bilong papa long graun bilong Ijip bai dai, stat long pikinini bilong Farao hu i sidaun long thron bilong en, na go long pikinini bilong hap meri i wok behaind long han mil, olsem na pikinini bilong ol kaskas.

original: Then a great cry will go out over all the land of Egypt. Such an outcry has never been heard before and will never be heard again.
translation: Narakai bikpela kalabusai bai go daun long olgeta graun bilong Ijip. Nem igat stret tumas, ino bin harim bifo, na nem igat stret tumas, ino bai harim gen.

original: But among all the Israelites, not even a dog will snarl at man or beast.’ Then you will know that the LORD makes a distinction between Egypt and Israel.
translation: Bai olgeta Israel, dog nogat bikim nogut long man o animal. Na bai yupela save olsem LORD i mekim difrens long Ejip na Israel.

original: And all these officials of yours will come and bow before me, saying, ‘Go, you and all the people who follow you!’ After that, I will depart.” And hot with anger, Moses left Pharaoh’s presence.
translation: Na ol ofisala bilong yu yet, ol i go na katim hed long mi, ol i tok, 'Yu go, yu na ol manmeri i folo yu!' Bihaen long dispela, mi bai lusim. Na Musá i bel hot long rausim, em i lusim haus bilong Farao.

original: The LORD said to Moses, “Pharaoh will not listen to you, so that My wonders may be multiplied in the land of Egypt.”
translation: Papa God i tokim Mosis, “Faraon no bai harim tok bilong yu, na mipela ken planti mekim wondar long kantri bilong Ijip.”

original: Moses and Aaron did all these wonders before Pharaoh, but the LORD hardened Pharaoh’s heart so that he would not let the Israelites go out of his land.
translation: Moses na Aaron wokim olgeta wondana nau bifor Pharaoh, tasol LORD i strongim bel bilong Pharaoh, nasal i no lem Israelites lusim kantri bilong en.

original: Now the LORD said to Moses and Aaron in the land of Egypt,
translation: Bikpela i tok long Moses na Aron long lan bilong Ijip,

original: “This month is the beginning of months for you; it shall be the first month of your year.
translation: Dispela mun em i stap long nambawan ples bilong kalenda bilong yu; em bai i stap long nambawan dei bilong yia bilong yu.

original: Tell the whole congregation of Israel that on the tenth day of this month each man must select a lamb for his family, one per household.
translation: Tokim olgeta long komuniti bilong Israel, long de tenth dei bilong dispa mondh, husat man i mas chusim wanpela lam bilong papa na mama, wanpela long hus.

original: If the household is too small for a whole lamb, they are to share with the nearest neighbor based on the number of people, and apportion the lamb accordingly.
translation: Sapos hus na i no nuf long en, ol i mas sare wantaim neiiba nau, ikam daun long namba bilong manmeri, na givim lam insait long hap bilong ol.

original: Your lamb must be an unblemished year-old male, and you may take it from the sheep or the goats.
translation: Lamb bilong yu masi be man bilong wan yia, em i no gat birua, na yu kam bek long sheep oa goat na kisim.

original: You must keep it until the fourteenth day of the month, when the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel will slaughter the animals at twilight.
translation: Yu mas holim i go long de fourtinen dei bilong mun, wanem taim olgeta assembli bilong congregation bilong Israel bai kilim animal long wei bilong san i go daun.

original: They are to take some of the blood and put it on the sides and tops of the doorframes of the houses where they eat the lambs.
translation: Ol i mas kisim sampela blod na putim i go long sait na antap long hap bilong dor blo hus we ol i kaikai lambs.

original: They are to eat the meat that night, roasted over the fire, along with unleavened bread and bitter herbs.
translation: Ol i mas kaikai mit na kaikai i go nau long nait, kukim ol i go long paia, wantaim rot bilong brede we no gat yeast na spakle trut.

original: Do not eat any of the meat raw or cooked in boiling water, but only roasted over the fire—its head and legs and inner parts.
translation: Yu no ken kaikai bek bilong mit na olsem mit i stap yet, o boiled long wara i boil, nogat, bikos mit bai i mas kamap olsem roasted long paia, long head bilong en, leg na pati insait long en.

original: Do not leave any of it until morning; before the morning you must burn up any part that is left over.
translation: No lusim i go long moning; bipo moning, yu mas burnim olgeta we i stap yet.

original: This is how you are to eat it: You must be fully dressed for travel, with your sandals on your feet and your staff in your hand. You are to eat in haste; it is the LORD’s Passover.
translation: Yu mas kaikai olsem: Yu mas klostu gut long wokabaut, sandal i stap long lek bilong yu, na stik bilong wokim strong i stap long han bilong yu. Yu mas kaikai i go longlong; em i Pasova blong LORD.

original: On that night I will pass through the land of Egypt and strike down every firstborn male, both man and beast, and I will execute judgment against all the gods of Egypt. I am the LORD.
translation: Long nait i go, mi go brunim ai long kantri bilong Ijip, na mi kilim olgeta pikinini man bilong papa, man na animal, na mi mekim jusis i kam long ol gog bilong Ijip. Mi em i LORDE.

original: The blood on the houses where you are staying will distinguish them; when I see the blood, I will pass over you. No plague will fall on you to destroy you when I strike the land of Egypt.
translation: Blaod i stap long haus olsem yu stap, ol bai ol i makim ol difren; taim mi lukim blaod, mi bai pas go long yu. No bikpela sik i no kam daun long yu na bagarapim yu taim mi kilim kantri bilong Ijip.

original: And this day will be a memorial for you, and you are to celebrate it as a feast to the LORD, as a permanent statute for the generations to come.
translation: Na dei ya bai i stap olsem wanpela samting bilong memoriam bilong yupela, na yupela mas haleim i olsem wanpela kaikai bilong bikpela de long Bikpela, olsem wanpela laen bilong stap long taim bilong genarashon i kam bihain.

original: For seven days you must eat unleavened bread. On the first day you are to remove the leaven from your houses. Whoever eats anything leavened from the first day through the seventh must be cut off from Israel.
translation: Long seven dei, yu mas kaikai bret unleavened. Long dei namba wan, yu mas rausim leaven long house bilong yu. Husat i kaikai samting long wei leaven long dei namba wan kas long dei namba seven, em bai kat ol loa long Israel.

original: On the first day you are to hold a sacred assembly, and another on the seventh day. You must not do any work on those days, except to prepare the meals—that is all you may do.
translation: Long de namba wan dei, yu mas kisim asamblei bilong haliv, na long de namba seven dei, yu mas kisim asamblei bilong haliv gen. Yu no ken wokim eni kain wok long ol dei, apa yu ken preparim kaikai tasol – em i las samting yu ken mekim.

original: So you are to keep the Feast of Unleavened Bread, for on this very day I brought your divisions out of the land of Egypt. You must keep this day as a permanent statute for the generations to come.
translation: Olsem na, yu mas kisim kaek i go long Fest bilong Bred Em I No Gat Yogal, bikos long dei em i go, mi bringim ol clans bilong yu nesen long graun bilong Ipigip. Yu mas kisim dei bilong yumi olsem lau i no inap senis, olsem ol genereashon i kam bihain.

original: In the first month you are to eat unleavened bread, from the evening of the fourteenth day until the evening of the twenty-first day.
translation: Long mun bilong em, yupela mas kaikai bret bain, stat long apinun bilong de fourteen na stret long apinun bilong de twenty-one.

original: For seven days there must be no leaven found in your houses. If anyone eats something leavened, that person, whether a foreigner or native of the land, must be cut off from the congregation of Israel.
translation: Long sampela de peles seven, inogat no ken got wanpela yau bilong bread i stap long hus na balus bilong yu. I givim olsem: man i kam from naiton ananit o man bilong ples, dispensel i kaikai samting we i gat yau bilong bread, dispela man bai pusim longwe na i no inap go bek long assembli bilong Israel ol.

original: You are not to eat anything leavened; eat unleavened bread in all your homes.”
translation: Yu no ken kaikai samting bret i gat yeast; yu mas kaikai bret unleavened long olgeta haus bilong yu.

original: Then Moses summoned all the elders of Israel and told them, “Go at once and select for yourselves a lamb for each family, and slaughter the Passover lamb.
translation: Mozes i bilong kisim ol bikpela man long Isrel olgeta, na toktok long ol, “Yu go nau, chusim pig long ples bilong yusupela yet, na kilim pig bilong Pasowa.

original: Take a cluster of hyssop, dip it into the blood in the basin, and brush the blood on the top and sides of the doorframe. None of you shall go out the door of his house until morning.
translation: Kisim wanpela bun hyssop, putim em insait long bloo i stap inside basin, na paintim bloo antap na saitlong bilong frame bilong doa. Nogat wanpela bilong yu bai go aut na inap long doa bilong haus bilong en tepela yet, klia olsem san.

original: When the LORD passes through to strike down the Egyptians, He will see the blood on the top and sides of the doorframe and will pass over that doorway; so He will not allow the destroyer to enter your houses and strike you down.
translation: Wanpela taim Bikpela i go pasim na kilim ol, em bai lukim blod i stap long top na sait bilong fraem bilong dor, na bai pasim long hap doorway; olsem nau, bai no givim ruim long destroyer i go insait long hus na kilim yumi.

original: And you are to keep this command as a permanent statute for you and your descendants.
translation: Yu mas kispelim komanda ili olsem wanpela loa tru long taim, na yu na ol desenden yu mas holim.

original: When you enter the land that the LORD will give you as He promised, you are to keep this service.
translation: Wanpela taim yu go insait long graun we Bikpela LORD i promis long yu olsem Hem i promis, yu mas holim dispela servisis.

original: When your children ask you, ‘What does this service mean to you?’
translation: Wanpela taim pikinini bilong yu askim yu, 'Dispela servos i min bilong wanem long yu?'

original: you are to reply, ‘It is the Passover sacrifice to the LORD, who passed over the houses of the Israelites in Egypt when He struck down the Egyptians and spared our homes.’” Then the people bowed down and worshiped.
translation: Yu mas tokbek, 'Em i sakrifis bilong Pasowa long LORD, husat i go antap long aus bilong Israel long Taim Israel i stap long Ijip, na we i kilim ol Ijipita na em i skulim haus bilong yumi.' Na ol pipol i kilaunti daun na wosip.

original: And the Israelites went and did just what the LORD had commanded Moses and Aaron.
translation: Na Pipol Israel i go na mekim olgeta wankain olsem Bikpela i tokim Mosis na Aron.

original: Now at midnight the LORD struck down every firstborn male in the land of Egypt, from the firstborn of Pharaoh, who sat on his throne, to the firstborn of the prisoner in the dungeon, as well as all the firstborn among the livestock.
translation: Long moningtaim GOD Bilong Yumi i kilim olgeta pikinini man bilong papa long kantri bilong Ijip, from pikinini bilong Kwin bilong Ijip, hu i sit long sit bilong Kwin, kas ol i kam long pikinini bilong man i kam long kalabus, long kalabus, na olgeta pikinini bilong animal tu.

original: During the night Pharaoh got up—he and all his officials and all the Egyptians—and there was loud wailing in Egypt; for there was no house without someone dead.
translation: Bai long nait Faraon, em i kamap, em na ol ofisa bilong en na olgeta Ijip, na wail moa strong long Egypt; Haus hari i no stap, olgeta i gat ded.

original: Then Pharaoh summoned Moses and Aaron by night and said, “Get up, leave my people, both you and the Israelites! Go, worship the LORD as you have requested.
translation: Faraon em i kolim Moses na Aron long nait na tokim ol, “Kam daun, lusim piple bilong me, yupela na Israelites! Go, wosipim LORD olsem yupela i bin askim.”

original: Take your flocks and herds as well, just as you have said, and depart! And bless me also.”
translation: Kisim ol dok bilong sheep na ol bulmakau, olsem yu tok, na lusim hap! Na givim mi bles na.

original: And in order to send them out of the land quickly, the Egyptians urged the people on. “For otherwise,” they said, “we are all going to die!”
translation: Na ol pipol Egypt i bungim bel bilong ol pipol, kisim ol i go aut long kantri kviktaim. Ol i tok, "Nogat olsem, yumi olgeta bai dai!"

original: So the people took their dough before it was leavened, carrying it on their shoulders in kneading bowls wrapped in clothing.
translation: Ol pipol i kisim ka bifor em i kamap strong, na ol i karim i go long han bilong ol insait long bilong wokim bret, ol i rapim wantaim klos.

original: Furthermore, the Israelites acted on Moses’ word and asked the Egyptians for articles of silver and gold, and for clothing.
translation: Ol Pipol Israel i wok long tok bilong Moisi na ol i askim Ijip long samting bilong silva na gol, na klos.

original: And the LORD gave the people such favor in the sight of the Egyptians that they granted their request. In this way they plundered the Egyptians.
translation: Na Bikpela i givim pipol gutpela namel long ai bilong Ijip, ol i tokim yes long tok ples bilong ol, na ol i pilim olgeta samting bilong Ijip.

original: The Israelites journeyed from Rameses to Succoth with about 600,000 men on foot, besides women and children.
translation: Pipol Isrel i go bek long Rameses na i kamap long Sukkot wantaim ol man i gat namel long 600,000, ol i wok abaut, bipoa meri na pikinini.

original: And a mixed multitude also went up with them, along with great droves of livestock, both flocks and herds.
translation: Na mipela miksimilipepla i go ap long ol, wantaim olpela mun mak bilong animals, fok na herd, i kam.

original: Since their dough had no leaven, the people baked what they had brought out of Egypt into unleavened loaves. For when they had been driven out of Egypt, they could not delay and had not prepared any provisions for themselves.
translation: Bikos dok bilong ol i no gat leaven, ol man meri i kukim ol samting ol i kisim long Egip long banis loaf. Long taim ol i kamautim long Egip, ol i no inap bihain na ol i no redi bekim ka moning bilong ol yet.

original: Now the duration of the Israelites’ stay in Egypt was 430 years.
translation: Nau taim ol Israelait i stap long Egip em 430 yia.

original: At the end of the 430 years, to the very day, all the LORD’s divisions went out of the land of Egypt.
translation: Long 430 yia i kam pinis, olasol long de bilem, olgeta kaikai bilong LORD i go aut long kate long laine bilong Ijip.

original: Because the LORD kept a vigil that night to bring them out of the land of Egypt, this same night is to be a vigil to the LORD, to be observed by all the Israelites for the generations to come.
translation: Bikos GOD i stap strong long nait, bai bringim ol i go aut long kantri bilong Ijip, dispela same nait i mas stat long taim bilong wait bilong GOD, ol Isrelaiti oli mas observe long genarason i kam bihain.

original: And the LORD said to Moses and Aaron, “This is the statute of the Passover: No foreigner is to eat of it.
translation: Na Papa God i tokim Mose na Aron, “Dispela em i lo bilong Pasko: Nogat man i kam long nesen, inap i kaikai long em.”

original: But any slave who has been purchased may eat of it, after you have circumcised him.
translation: Tasol enipela slav i bin bayim em i ken kaikai bilong en bihaenim yu katim skin bilong em na wokim em i kamap olsem arapela man.

original: A temporary resident or hired hand shall not eat the Passover.
translation: Man i kam bek long taim o man i wok hire, ina no ken kaikai Pasova.

original: It must be eaten inside one house. You are not to take any of the meat outside the house, and you may not break any of the bones.
translation: Em i mas kaikai insait wan hap. Yu no ken kisim mit i go na kaml long bodi, na yu no ken brukim bek nek.

original: The whole congregation of Israel must celebrate it.
translation: Olgets wel kamap long Congreshen bilong Isreael bai ol i mas halivim.

original: If a foreigner resides with you and wants to celebrate the LORD’s Passover, all the males in the household must be circumcised; then he may come near to celebrate it, and he shall be like a native of the land. But no uncircumcised man may eat of it.
translation: Sapos wanpela man i kam from naiton anather na stap wantaim yu, na em i laik kisim kaen long Pasowa bilong LORD, ol man husat i stap long haus, olgeta mas katim skin bilong kok bilong ol; em inap kam klostu long kisim kaen long em, na em bai olsem wanpela man husat i stap long kantri. Tasol, i no gat man husat skin bilong kok i no katim inap kaikai bilong en.

original: The same law shall apply to both the native and the foreigner who resides among you.”
translation: Sampela loa bai i kamap long ol indigenous na ol foreigner we husat i stap long mipela.

original: Then all the Israelites did this—they did just as the LORD had commanded Moses and Aaron.
translation: Na ol Israeliti i mekim olsem - ol i wokim olsem Ol Masalai i bin tokim Moses na Aron.

original: And on that very day the LORD brought the Israelites out of the land of Egypt by their divisions.
translation: Na long olsem dei LORDE ibin bringim Israelites i go naua long graun bilong Ijip ol i go hap pasal.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Consecrate to Me every firstborn male. The firstborn from every womb among the Israelites belongs to Me, both of man and beast.”
translation: Givim autoriti long mi ol pikinini namba wan, ol man na animal, bilong ol Israel. Pikinini namba wan bilong ol Israel, haman na animal, i bilong mi, em i go long mi.

original: So Moses told the people, “Remember this day, the day you came out of Egypt, out of the house of slavery; for the LORD brought you out of it by the strength of His hand. And nothing leavened shall be eaten.
translation: Moses i tokim ol pipol, "Yumai yet long dispela dei, dei yu kamaut long Egip, long hus slaivri; bikos LORD i bringim yu kamaut long en bilong strong bilong han bilong En. Na nil leaven i no ken kaikai.

original: Today, in the month of Abib, you are leaving.
translation: Tudei, long mun Abib, yupela i go na.

original: And when the LORD brings you into the land of the Canaanites, Hittites, Amorites, Hivites, and Jebusites—the land He swore to your fathers that He would give you, a land flowing with milk and honey—you shall keep this service in this month.
translation: Na wati em LORD i bringim yu go long graun bilong Kanaanit, Hiti, Amori, Hivi, na Jebusi - graun we LORD i promis long papa bilong yu ol, olsem em yet bai givim yu, em i graun we i flowe long milk na honey - yu mas holim sarvis ya long mun ya.

original: For seven days you are to eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day there shall be a feast to the LORD.
translation: Long wik seven dei, yu mas kaikai bret i no gat yam, na long de namba seven de, bikpela kaikai bai kam long mekim bikpela kaikai long LORD.

original: Unleavened bread shall be eaten during those seven days. Nothing leavened may be found among you, nor shall leaven be found anywhere within your borders.
translation: Bread narapela bai ol i kaikai long seven de, inogat samting i gat yeast i stap long mit bilong yupela, na nogat yeast bai i stap insait long kauntri bilong yupela.

original: And on that day you are to explain to your son, ‘This is because of what the LORD did for me when I came out of Egypt.’
translation: Na long dei ya, yu mas tokim olsem long pikinini bilong yu, ‘Dispela kam long hap tumas, em i bikos LORD god i mekim olsem long mi long taim mi kamap nau long Ijip.’

original: It shall be a sign for you on your hand and a reminder on your forehead that the Law of the LORD is to be on your lips. For with a mighty hand the LORD brought you out of Egypt.
translation: Em bai sindaun olsem san long han bilong yu na ripot long memoriam long heve bilong yu, na Lan bilong Lod i mas kam long maus bilong yu, wantaim Lod i usim han bilong powa na bringim yu nau long Egypt.

original: Therefore you shall keep this statute at the appointed time year after year.
translation: Yu mas holim dispela lo bilong olgeda long taim we i kamap, yia bihain yia.

original: And after the LORD brings you into the land of the Canaanites and gives it to you, as He swore to you and your fathers,
translation: Na bihaen long LORD i bringim yu go insait long kantri bilong Kananaits, na i givim kantri ia long yu, olsem Hem i promis long yu na papa bilong yu.

original: you are to present to the LORD the firstborn male of every womb. All the firstborn males of your livestock belong to the LORD.
translation: Yu mas bringim pikinini man i kam first long belly bilong meri, na long belly bilong animals, i go long Lod. Olgeta pikinini man i kam first long animals olgeta, em i bilong Lod.

original: You must redeem every firstborn donkey with a lamb, and if you do not redeem it, you are to break its neck. And every firstborn of your sons you must redeem.
translation: Yupela mas bikim pe bilong eni wanpela donki ibin bon nau na yu usim lek, na if yu no bikim pe bilong en, yupela mas kirim nek bilong en i go daun. Na olgeta pikinini bilong yu ibin bon nau, yupela mas bikim pe bilong ol.

original: In the future, when your son asks you, ‘What does this mean?’ you are to tell him, ‘With a mighty hand the LORD brought us out of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
translation: Bai ol i kam, wanpela de nau pikinini bilong yu em i askim yu, ‘Whatu min bilong dispela?’ yu mas tokim em, ‘Long han bilong pawa LORD i bringim mipela ngo Egypt, ngo haus bilong slavri.’

original: And when Pharaoh stubbornly refused to let us go, the LORD killed every firstborn in the land of Egypt, both of man and beast. This is why I sacrifice to the LORD the firstborn male of every womb, but I redeem all the firstborn of my sons.’
translation: Na Faraon i bikhet long nogut, em i no lem us go, LORD i kilim olgeta pikinini bilong papa long kantri bilong Ijip, husat i man na husat i bel. Em i ples we mi sakrifais long LORD olgeta pikinini bilong man bilong bel, tasol mi bebaim olgeta pikinini bilong man bilong mi.

original: So it shall serve as a sign on your hand and a symbol on your forehead, for with a mighty hand the LORD brought us out of Egypt.”
translation: Na bai em i servis olsem santing bilong tokautim long han bilong yu na em i kam bekim simbol long biforhed bilong yu, wantaim han bilong powa Papa bilong yumi kam bekim mipela long kantri bilong Faraon, Egip.

original: When Pharaoh let the people go, God did not lead them along the road through the land of the Philistines, though it was shorter. For God said, “If the people face war, they might change their minds and return to Egypt.”
translation: Taim Pharaoh lusiim ol pipol i go, God i no lidim ol long rot bilong kantri Philistia, nogat rot i kuk, bikos God i tok, "Ol pipol bai i harim wok na ol bai sindaun bek gen long Egip."

original: So God led the people around by the way of the wilderness toward the Red Sea. And the Israelites left the land of Egypt arrayed for battle.
translation: Na God i bringim ol pipol go raun long wei bilong wildestan, na ol i go long sait bilong Red Si. Na ol Israelites i lusim lan bilong Ijip, na ol i redi long fait.

original: Moses took the bones of Joseph with him because Joseph had made the sons of Israel swear a solemn oath when he said, “God will surely attend to you, and then you must carry my bones with you from this place.”
translation: Moses kisim bon bilong Yosep wantaim em, bikos Yosep bin mekim pikinini bilong Israel ol i kamapim olegis strongim, long em ia tok olsem, "God bai inaf yu yet, na bai yumi kisim bon bilong mi i go wantaim yumi long hap ples."

original: They set out from Succoth and camped at Etham on the edge of the wilderness.
translation: Ol i go bek long Sukkot na kamped long Etam long sait bilong bus.

original: And the LORD went before them in a pillar of cloud to guide their way by day, and in a pillar of fire to give them light by night, so that they could travel by day or night.
translation: Na Bikpela i go bifor ol long kaur na klab long de, long givim lanus long ol, na long kaur na faia long nait, long givim lait long ol, so ol i ken go wakabaut long de o nait.

original: Neither the pillar of cloud by day nor the pillar of fire by night left its place before the people.
translation: Na kol na klaud long de, na kol na faia long nait, istap yet long ples bilong en, no lusim ples bilong en bifo ol pipol.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Tell the Israelites to turn back and encamp before Pi-hahiroth, between Migdol and the sea. You are to encamp by the sea, directly opposite Baal-zephon.
translation: Sindaunim Pipol Israel long go bek na kam kaikai long sait bilong Pi-hahiroth, long namel bilong Migdol na solwara. Yusufa kam kaikai long solwara, drai opisit long Baal-zephon.

original: For Pharaoh will say of the Israelites, ‘They are wandering the land in confusion; the wilderness has boxed them in.’
translation: Faraon bai tokim ol Israelites i go wail long ples na konfujo, bus na wilderness i kam bek gen long ol.

original: And I will harden Pharaoh’s heart so that he will pursue them. But I will gain honor by means of Pharaoh and all his army, and the Egyptians will know that I am the LORD.” So this is what the Israelites did.
translation: Na mi bai harim het bilong Pharaoh, em bai bihain long ol. Mi bai kisim respek long Pharaoh na ol solja bilong en, na Egyptian bai save olsem mi em iambap bilong Jehovah. Ol Isrelaiti tu, ol mekim olsem.

original: When the king of Egypt was told that the people had fled, Pharaoh and his officials changed their minds about them and said, “What have we done? We have released Israel from serving us.”
translation: King bilong Ejip i save long em, Faraon na ofisal bilong en i bin salim bek tok bilong ol, na ol i bin tok, "Wanem samting mipela mekim? Mipela i lusim Isrel long servim mipela."

original: So Pharaoh prepared his chariot and took his army with him.
translation: Na Faraon i rediim kareta bilong em, na i kisim army bilong en i go wantaim.

original: He took 600 of the best chariots, and all the other chariots of Egypt, with officers over all of them.
translation: Em i kisim sikis hanred kar, bikpela kar i go nau long ol kar, na ol kar i stap long Egypt, wantaim ofisa i stap long ol.

original: And the LORD hardened the heart of Pharaoh king of Egypt so that he pursued the Israelites, who were marching out defiantly.
translation: Na Bikpela i strongim bel bilong Faraoni king bilong Ijip, olsem na em i go bek long ples Ol Israel, ol i wakabaut i go olsem samting strong.

original: The Egyptians—all Pharaoh’s horses and chariots, horsemen and troops—pursued the Israelites and overtook them as they camped by the sea near Pi-hahiroth, opposite Baal-zephon.
translation: Ijip, olgeta hors na kareta bilong Faraon, man husait i raisim hors na soldia, ol i go bek long Israelites, na ol i kam ap long ol, na ol i kemp klostu long sos, long hap Pi-hairoth, long sait bilong Baal-sefon.

original: As Pharaoh approached, the Israelites looked up and saw the Egyptians marching after them, and they were terrified and cried out to the LORD.
translation: Taim Pharaoh i kam klostu, Oli Israelaiti lukup na si ol Ijipita i kam bihain long ol, na oli bikimae na ol singautim long LORD.

original: They said to Moses, “Was it because there were no graves in Egypt that you brought us into the wilderness to die? What have you done to us by bringing us out of Egypt?
translation: Ol i tokim Mosis, “I no gat ples bilong rausim bodi long Egypt? Yu bringim mipela i go long bus na mipela i dai? Wanem yu mekim long mipela, yu kam bekim mipela na mipela lusim Egypt?”

original: Did we not say to you in Egypt, ‘Leave us alone so that we may serve the Egyptians’? For it would have been better for us to serve the Egyptians than to die in the wilderness.”
translation: Ino, mipela olsem tok long Egypt olsem, ‘Lusim mipela na mipela i servim Pipol bilong Egypt.’ Bai mipela servim Pipol bilong Egypt bai nap better long mipela, na ino i die na i go daun long bus.

original: But Moses told the people, “Do not be afraid. Stand firm and you will see the LORD’s salvation, which He will accomplish for you today; for the Egyptians you see today, you will never see again.
translation: Moses i tokim ol pipol, “No ken bekim fright. Stan strong olsem na yupela bai lukim LORD i save yumupela, em bai mekim olgeta samting longpela dei; ol Egyptian yupela lukim tudei, yupela no go lukim gen.

original: The LORD will fight for you; you need only to be still.”
translation: LORD bai pairap long yu; yu mas stap kalta na nogat wari.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Why are you crying out to Me? Tell the Israelites to go forward.
translation: Bikpela i tokim Mose, “Olsem wanem yu kirap strong long Me?” Yu tokim ol Isrel long go bek.

original: And as for you, lift up your staff and stretch out your hand over the sea and divide it, so that the Israelites can go through the sea on dry ground.
translation: Na long yu, kisim stik bilong yu na liftim i go up, stretim han bilong yu olsem long solwara na dividim solwara, Olsen pipol bilong Isrel i go insait long solwara long graun dri.

original: And I will harden the hearts of the Egyptians so that they will go in after them. Then I will gain honor by means of Pharaoh and all his army and chariots and horsemen.
translation: Na mi bai strongim het bilong Ejiputas, olsem oli bai go bihain long ol. Olsem na mi bai kisim ren na namel long Faraon na olgeta army bilong en, kareta, na soldia husait i ridim hors.

original: The Egyptians will know that I am the LORD when I am honored through Pharaoh, his chariots, and his horsemen.”
translation: Ijip ol i save long Bikpela wail na mi respek long Pharaoh, long kar em i gat, na ol horsman bilong em.

original: And the angel of God, who had gone before the camp of Israel, withdrew and went behind them. The pillar of cloud also moved from before them and stood behind them,
translation: Na angiul bilong God, we i go bifor kemp bilong Israel, em i withdrawim na go bihain long ol. Kol na klud i move from bifor ol, na em i stap bihain long ol.

original: so that it came between the camps of Egypt and Israel. The cloud was there in the darkness, but it lit up the night. So all night long neither camp went near the other.
translation: Na kol i kam long namel bilong tupela kanu, kol i stap yet long skai bilong de, em i laitim ap nait. Olsem na kanu tupela, Ijip na Isrel, i no go klostu long wan another ol nait.

original: Then Moses stretched out his hand over the sea, and all that night the LORD drove back the sea with a strong east wind that turned it into dry land. So the waters were divided,
translation: Na Mosese stretchim han bilong en ibox long solwara, na LORD i usim win blong ist strong tru, pusim bek solwara olsem nau, olsem wata i go bek, na solwara i kamap dustri graun. Na wata i dividim, ol i go ap long sindaunim na sindaunim bilong en.

original: and the Israelites went through the sea on dry ground, with walls of water on their right and on their left.
translation: Na Pipol Israel i go pinis long solwara long granis dri, wantaim wal bilong wara long sait rig na long sait lef.

original: And the Egyptians chased after them—all Pharaoh’s horses, chariots, and horsemen—and followed them into the sea.
translation: Na Egipita i go bek long ol, ol hos, kariot, na man hus bilong Faraoh, folim ol i go insait long solwara.

original: At morning watch, however, the LORD looked down on the army of the Egyptians from the pillar of fire and cloud, and He threw their camp into confusion.
translation: Bikos long moning wach, Papa God i luk i daun from pila bilong faia na klau ol i go long army bilong Egyptian, na em i kirapim kamp bilong ol isi.

original: He caused their chariot wheels to wobble, so that they had difficulty driving. “Let us flee from the Israelites,” said the Egyptians, “for the LORD is fighting for them against Egypt!”
translation: Em i mekim wheela bilong kar sha em i no inap go straigt, ol i kisim hevi long driva. “Mipela i ranawe fraim Israel,” ol Ijipia i tok, “kosi LORD i paitim igo long ol long Egypt!”

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Stretch out your hand over the sea, so that the waters may flow back over the Egyptians and their chariots and horsemen.”
translation: Na Lod i tokim Mose olsem, “Strechim han bilong yu i go long solwara, bai wara inap kam bek gen long Egyptian na ol chariot na ol horsemen bilong ol.”

original: So Moses stretched out his hand over the sea, and at daybreak the sea returned to its normal state. As the Egyptians were retreating, the LORD swept them into the sea.
translation: Na Mosis em i stretim han bilong en olsem solwara, na long moningtaim solwara i kam bek gen long stil bilong en. Ol Egyptian i go bek gen, na LORD em i kilim ol long solwara.

original: The waters flowed back and covered the chariots and horsemen—the entire army of Pharaoh that had chased the Israelites into the sea. Not one of them survived.
translation: Wara i go bek, na i kambak long karai na horsemen – olgeta armi bilong Pharaoh ol i bin pasim Israelites i go insait long solwara. Not wanpela bilong ol i stap.

original: But the Israelites had walked through the sea on dry ground, with walls of water on their right and on their left.
translation: Pipol Israel ol i wok long solwara long graun dri, wantaim wal bilong wara long sait bilong richt na long sait bilong left.

original: That day the LORD saved Israel from the hand of the Egyptians, and Israel saw the Egyptians dead on the shore.
translation: Dispela dei Olgeta Bikpela i save Israel long han bilong Egipita, na Israel i lukim Egipita i dai olsem long shaor.

original: When Israel saw the great power that the LORD had exercised over the Egyptians, the people feared the LORD and believed in Him and in His servant Moses.
translation: Taim Israel i lukim pawa bikpela we LORD i usim long ol Ijip, ol pipel i fearim LORD na ol bilev long Em na long servants Moses.

original: Then Moses and the Israelites sang this song to the LORD: “I will sing to the LORD, for He is highly exalted. The horse and rider He has thrown into the sea.
translation: Moses na Israelities i singim song long LORDE: “Mi bai singim long LORDE, bikos em i gat bikpela namel. Hos na ridaman em i pusa long solwara.”

original: The LORD is my strength and my song, and He has become my salvation. He is my God, and I will praise Him, my father’s God, and I will exalt Him.
translation: Papa God em i mekim strong na em i singsing bilong me, na em i kamap saveman bilong me. Em i God bilong me, na bai mi bungim ples bilong en, olsem Tambu bilong papa God, na bai mi lifim hap bilong en.

original: The LORD is a warrior, the LORD is His name.
translation: Papa God em i man bilong pait, Papa God em i nem bilong Em.

original: Pharaoh’s chariots and army He has cast into the sea; the finest of his officers are drowned in the Red Sea.
translation: Kareta na arme bilong Pharaoh em i go daun long solwara; ofisa namba wan bilong en ol i drowne long Red Sea.

original: The depths have covered them; they sank there like a stone.
translation: Olgeta i go daun long solwara, ol i pundaun ole time, ol i sindaun olsem ston na i no kam bek gen.

original: Your right hand, O LORD, is majestic in power; Your right hand, O LORD, has shattered the enemy.
translation: Han rait, O Papa, em i gutpela tru long powa; Han rait, O Papa, i brukim enemy.

original: You overthrew Your adversaries by Your great majesty. You unleashed Your burning wrath; it consumed them like stubble.
translation: Yu kisim bek long ol eni i no larim yu, long gret na powa bilong Yu. Yu lusim fir i birua long ol; ol i katim na pai olsem gras we i katim na i pai.

original: At the blast of Your nostrils the waters piled up; like a wall the currents stood firm; the depths congealed in the heart of the sea.
translation: Long daun bilong ol nus bilong yu, wara i kam antap; olgeta karai i stap olsem wanpela barak; ol dip dip i bin frij long mit blong solwara.

original: The enemy declared, ‘I will pursue, I will overtake. I will divide the spoils; I will gorge myself on them. I will draw my sword; my hand will destroy them.’
translation: Po i tok, 'Mi bai bihainim, mi bai kisim bek gen. Mi bai dipositim ol samting bilong en long ol; mi bai kaikaim ol yet. Mi bai kisim sup bilong mi; han bilong mi bai brisim ol.'

original: But You blew with Your breath, and the sea covered them. They sank like lead in the mighty waters.
translation: Bikos yu blowim wit yu breth, na solwara i kambek long ol, na ol i sindaun olsem lid long wara bikpela.

original: Who among the gods is like You, O LORD? Who is like You—majestic in holiness, revered with praises, performing wonders?
translation: Husat long ol god i likelik You, o Bikpela? Husat i likelik you - witpela long haliness, i respek long sang, wokim mirakol?

original: You stretched out Your right hand, and the earth swallowed them up.
translation: Yu stretchim ot rait han bilong yu, na graun i kaikai ol.

original: With loving devotion You will lead the people You have redeemed; with Your strength You will guide them to Your holy dwelling.
translation: Long dosi bilong lov, Yu yet bai lidim ol pipol we Yu bin pe gim ol; na long strong bilong Yu, Yu yet bai bringim ol long ples bilong Yu we em i halow.

original: The nations will hear and tremble; anguish will grip the dwellers of Philistia.
translation: Ol nesen bai harim na tetebese; sikal bai kamap long ol i stap long Philistia.

original: Then the chiefs of Edom will be dismayed; trembling will seize the leaders of Moab; those who dwell in Canaan will melt away,
translation: Bilong Edom ol bikpela i go bek gen; tremol i kam long ol bikpela leda bilong Moab; na ol i stap long Kanana bai ol i bagarap na silip i go.

original: and terror and dread will fall on them. By the power of Your arm they will be as still as a stone until Your people pass by, O LORD, until the people You have bought pass by.
translation: Na kikim na wikim bai i kam antap long ol. Long strongpela bos bilong han bilong yu, yu no moa harim, yu stap olsem ston, til pipo bilong yu pinis pas, o Bikpela, til pipo yu bin baim pinis pas.

original: You will bring them in and plant them on the mountain of Your inheritance—the place, O LORD, You have prepared for Your dwelling, the sanctuary, O Lord, Your hands have established.
translation: Yu bai kisim ol i go insait na plantim ol long maunten bilong ineritans - ples bilong yu, Papa, we yu i redi long em, holy ples we han bilong yu i establis.

original: The LORD will reign forever and ever!”
translation: Papa God i go ken stret oltaim na oltaim gen!

original: For when Pharaoh’s horses, chariots, and horsemen went into the sea, the LORD brought the waters of the sea back over them. But the Israelites walked through the sea on dry ground.
translation: Wanpela taim hos, kareta, na horsemens bilong Pharaio i go insait long solwata, LORD i bringim bakhet wara bilong solwata i kam bek gen long ol. Tasol Israelites i wakabaut long graun drai nde i go thro solwata.

original: Then Miriam the prophetess, Aaron’s sister, took a tambourine in her hand, and all the women followed her with tambourines and dancing.
translation: Na Miriam, meri prophet, susa bilong Aaron, em kisim tamborin long han bilong en, na ol meri i go bihain im, wantaim tamborin na dans.

original: And Miriam sang back to them: “Sing to the LORD, for He is highly exalted; the horse and rider He has thrown into the sea.”
translation: Na Miriam i singim bek long ol: “Yu mas singim sang long LORD, em i gat bikpela nem, em i pilai hos na ranita i go daun long solwara.”

original: Then Moses led Israel from the Red Sea, and they went out into the Desert of Shur. For three days they walked in the desert without finding water.
translation: Na Mosis i lidim Israel long Solwara Red, na ol i go aut na i go long Desert bilong Shur. Ol i warka long bus tri de, beka ina pais, i no faendim wara.

original: And when they came to Marah, they could not drink the water there because it was bitter. (That is why it was named Marah.)
translation: Na ol i kam long Marah, ol no ina save dringim wa long hap em i bita, na ol i givim nem Marah long hap.

original: So the people grumbled against Moses, saying, “What are we to drink?”
translation: Ol pipel i bikim bel long Moses, ol i tok, “Nupela bai yumi dringim wanem?”

original: And Moses cried out to the LORD, and the LORD showed him a log. And when he cast it into the waters, they were sweetened. There the LORD made for them a statute and an ordinance, and there He tested them,
translation: Na Moses i harim tok long LORD, na LORD i showim em wanpela stik. Na em i kastim i go long wara, na wara i kam sweit. Long hap em, LORD i mekim Lo na wanpela ka long ol, na em i traim ol.

original: saying, “If you will listen carefully to the voice of the LORD your God, and do what is right in His eyes, and pay attention to His commands, and keep all His statutes, then I will not bring on you any of the diseases I inflicted on the Egyptians. For I am the LORD who heals you.”
translation: Sende tok klostu, “Yupela harim tok klostu long voys bilong Bikpela, wokim ol samting we i gut long ai bilong Em, kisim notis long komands bilong Em, holim strongim ol laen bilong En, orait yupela no inap kisim sik olsem Bikpela i bin givim long Ejip. Bikpela em i LORD we i strongim bodi bilong yu.”

original: Then they came to Elim, where there were twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees, and they camped there by the waters.
translation: Ol i kam long Elim, we bilong twelv springs blong wara na sebmten palma diwai i stap, na ol i pasin dai besait long wara.

original: On the fifteenth day of the second month after they had left the land of Egypt, the whole congregation of Israel set out from Elim and came to the Desert of Sin, which is between Elim and Sinai.
translation: Long fifteenth de bilem two mun ol i go pinis long kantri Egypt, olgeta yangpela Isrel i kisim ruwet long Elim na i kamap long Deset Sin, we bilong bihain long Elim na Sinai.

original: And there in the desert they all grumbled against Moses and Aaron.
translation: Na long despert, ol i tok strong olsem bilong bekim Moses na Aron.

original: “If only we had died by the LORD’s hand in the land of Egypt!” they said. “There we sat by pots of meat and ate our fill of bread, but you have brought us into this desert to starve this whole assembly to death!”
translation: Mipela i mas dai pinis long han bilong LORD long kantri bilong Ijip! Mipela i sindaun klostu long kukim ol ka bilong mit na mipela i kaikai bret, na mipela i pulapela, tasol yu bringim mipela i kam insait long dispela bus, na yu laik kilim dispela assembli olegeta, na wasim ol.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Behold, I will rain down bread from heaven for you. Each day the people are to go out and gather enough for that day. In this way I will test whether or not they will follow My instructions.
translation: Na Lod i tokim Mosis olsem, "Mipela bai bringim ka bairod long heven na yu kam kaikai. Tasol ol pipol i mas go aut na katim gen inap long dei bilong ol yet. Mi bai trai ol long wether ol bai follem tok bilong Mi o nogat."

original: Then on the sixth day, when they prepare what they bring in, it will be twice as much as they gather on the other days.”
translation: Long dispela dei sikis, wewan ol i save prepaem, olgeta samting ol i bringim i go insait bai ol i bringim planti mo, dupela mo olsem ol i save kam long narakain de.

original: So Moses and Aaron said to all the Israelites, “This evening you will know that it was the LORD who brought you out of the land of Egypt,
translation: Moses na Aaron i tok olsem long ol Pipol Israel, "Tude long belo yu yet bai yu save olsem Bikpela em i kam bekim yupela long kantri Egypt".

original: and in the morning you will see the LORD’s glory, because He has heard your grumbling against Him. For who are we that you should grumble against us?”
translation: Na long moning yu bai lukim glori bilong LORD, bikos Em i harim toktok nogut bilong yu long En. Husat mipela, olsem yu tok nogut long mipela?

original: And Moses added, “The LORD will give you meat to eat this evening and bread to fill you in the morning, for He has heard your grumbling against Him. Who are we? Your grumblings are not against us but against the LORD.”
translation: Na Mosese i tok tu, "Papa God bai givim yu kakaruk na kaikai long apinun dispela de, na bret long moning bai fulim bel bilong yumi, kasem Papa God harim toktok nogut bilong yumi long en. Yumi husat? Toktok nogut bilong yumi i no long us yet, tasol em i go long Papa God."

original: Then Moses said to Aaron, “Tell the whole congregation of Israel, ‘Come before the LORD, for He has heard your grumbling.’”
translation: Na Moses i tokim Aaron, “Yu tokim olgeta yangpela Isael, ‘Kam bek long bikmus bilong LORD, em i harim toktok nogut bilong yu.’”

original: And as Aaron was speaking to the whole congregation of Israel, they looked toward the desert, and there in a cloud the glory of the LORD appeared.
translation: Na Aron em i tok long olgeta yangpela Isreal, na ol i lukim long bus, na long klod glori bilong Lod i kamap.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “I have heard the grumbling of the Israelites. Tell them, ‘At twilight you will eat meat, and in the morning you will be filled with bread. Then you will know that I am the LORD your God.’”
translation: Mi harim toktok bilong Israel ol i no gat bel. Yu tokim ol, 'Bai plaun long san i go doun, yu bambai kaikai mit, na long moningtaim, yu bambai pulap long bret. Na yu ken laik olsem, mi em i Bikpela God bilong yu.'

original: That evening quail came and covered the camp, and in the morning there was a layer of dew around the camp.
translation: Bai apinun kakaruk i kam na kisim olgeta ples long kamp, na long moning olgeta ples i gat ren kom nambaut long kamp.

original: When the layer of dew had evaporated, there were thin flakes on the desert floor, as fine as frost on the ground.
translation: Wanem dei ren i go daun, klostu ya i kamapim ol flakis finai long graun bilong desert, olsem ol sapele flak na stap klostu long graun, olsem ol frost i katim graun.

original: When the Israelites saw it, they asked one another, “What is it?” For they did not know what it was. So Moses told them, “It is the bread that the LORD has given you to eat.
translation: Taim Pipol bilong Israel i lukim, ol i askim wan another, "Wanem em i?" Ol i no save long em. Moses i tokim ol, "Em i bret we LORD, Bikpela, i givim yu fo kaikai."

original: This is what the LORD has commanded: ‘Each one is to gather as much as he needs. You may take an omer for each person in your tent.’”
translation: Dispela em i tok olsem: LORD i givim dispela law, husat i sek kan, em i mas kisim olgeta samting we em i gat nid. Yupela ken kisim wan omer bilong ol man meri i stap insait long hap bilong yupela.

original: So the Israelites did this. Some gathered more, and some less.
translation: Oli Israelait i mekim olsem. Narapela i kamap moa yet, na narapela i kamap liklik.

original: When they measured it by the omer, he who gathered much had no excess, and he who gathered little had no shortfall. Each one gathered as much as he needed to eat.
translation: Wanpela taim ol i mesim long omer, namba wan i bikim planti i no kisim moa, na namba tu i bikim liklik i no lus. Yupela i painim narakain long kaikai, ol i gat wonem ol i laik kaikai.

original: Then Moses said to them, “No one may keep any of it until morning.”
translation: Mosis i tokim ol long, “Nogat wanpela man i ken kaikai bekim sampela bilong en go long moning.”

original: But they did not listen to Moses; some people left part of it until morning, and it became infested with maggots and began to smell. So Moses was angry with them.
translation: Ol i no harim tok bilong Moisi; ol i leevim part bilong em yet long moning, na i kamap fulap bilong kurukuru, na i stat long smel. Na Moisi i bel kol long ol.

original: Every morning each one gathered as much as was needed, and when the sun grew hot, it melted away.
translation: Long moning i kam, ol i kam wanwan, na taim sun i hat olsem, em i tan.

original: On the sixth day, they gathered twice as much food—two omers per person—and all the leaders of the congregation came and reported this to Moses.
translation: Long dei sikis, ol i kam bikim tupela taim planti ka – tu omers long wanpela man – na ol bigpela man bilong kongregation i kam, ol i toktok long Moses.

original: He told them, “This is what the LORD has said: ‘Tomorrow is to be a day of complete rest, a holy Sabbath to the LORD. So bake what you want to bake, and boil what you want to boil. Then set aside whatever remains and keep it until morning.’”
translation: Em i tokim ol, “Nambawan dei bai i kam, em i dei bilong rip pinis, wanpela Sabat bilong Gott i kamap strongim. Olsem, bai yu bakim sampela ka, na boilim sampela ka, na putim wei sampela tinging i stap, bekim na kisim go long moning.”

original: So they set it aside until morning as Moses had commanded, and it did not smell or contain any maggots.
