translation: Ol putim asiade kalap long moning olsem Musa i bin tokim, na em i no gat smel, na i no gat kokorak.

original: “Eat it today,” Moses said, “because today is a Sabbath to the LORD. Today you will not find anything in the field.
translation: Kaikai nau, Moses i tok olsem, tudei em i Sabat bilong LORD. Tudei yu no finim sampting long graun.

original: For six days you may gather, but on the seventh day, the Sabbath, it will not be there.”
translation: Long sikis de ba yu ken kisim, tasol long naiten de, De ba Sabat, em no stap.

original: Yet on the seventh day some of the people went out to gather, but they did not find anything.
translation: Na long namba seven de, ol i go wokabaut long kisim, tasol ol i no finim nothing.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “How long will you refuse to keep My commandments and instructions?
translation: Bikpela i tokim Mosis, “Oli bai yusim wanem taim igo long refusim kisim komando na lo bilong mi?

original: Understand that the LORD has given you the Sabbath; that is why on the sixth day He will give you bread for two days. On the seventh day, everyone must stay where he is; no one may leave his place.”
translation: Yu mas save olsem LORD i givim yu Sabat; em i givim yu kaikai long tu de, bekas em bai givim yu kaikai long de namba seis. Long de namba sevxn, olgeta man i mas stap we istap; nogat man i ken lusim ples bilong en.

original: So the people rested on the seventh day.
translation: Na ol pipol i stap bek long namba seven de.

original: Now the house of Israel called the bread manna. It was white like coriander seed and tasted like wafers made with honey.
translation: Haus bilong Israel i kolim bret ol manna. Em i white olsem sindri seed na ol i tambuain olsem wafas we ibin mekim wantaim hanisuk.

original: Moses said, “This is what the LORD has commanded: ‘Keep an omer of manna for the generations to come, so that they may see the bread I fed you in the wilderness when I brought you out of the land of Egypt.’”
translation: Mosis i tokim, “Dispela em i komando bilong LORD: ‘Iu save kepm manna long wan hap omer, olsem na bai ol generaion i kam bihain, ol bai lukim bun i givim yumi kaikai long bus, wankain taem yu kamap long graun Egypt.’”

original: So Moses told Aaron, “Take a jar and fill it with an omer of manna. Then place it before the LORD to be preserved for the generations to come.”
translation: Na Moses i tokim Aaron, “Kisim wanpela tub na ipurim em long wan omer bilong manna. Putim i klostu long LORD ol i stap olsem long genarasyon ol i kam.”

original: And Aaron placed it in front of the Testimony, to be preserved just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Na Aron i putim em long hap bilong Telemark, olsem bai em i stap oltaim olsem Jehovah i tokim Mose.

original: The Israelites ate manna forty years, until they came to a land where they could settle; they ate manna until they reached the border of Canaan.
translation: Oli Israel i kaikai manna long fonetik yias poroje, na go long taim oli kamap long wanpela ples ol inap stap; olsem na oli kaikai manna yet, olsem taim oli kamap long bun granis bilong Kanaan.

original: (Now an omer is a tenth of an ephah.)
translation: Nau wan omer em i stap long hap taen bilong ephah.

original: Then the whole congregation of Israel left the Desert of Sin, moving from place to place as the LORD commanded. They camped at Rephidim, but there was no water for the people to drink.
translation: Olgeta asamble ya Israel i go long Desert bilong Sin, waka i go long hap na hap olsem Papa God i givim tok. Ol i kam pundaun klostu Rephidim, tasol i no gat wara long ol pipol bai dring.

original: So the people contended with Moses, “Give us water to drink.” “Why do you contend with me?” Moses replied. “Why do you test the LORD?”
translation: Ol pipel i bagarap wantaim Mosese, "Givim mipela wara long drink." "Wai yu bagarap wantaim mi?" Mosese i tok bek. "Bai yu trai long Jehovah?"

original: But the people thirsted for water there, and they grumbled against Moses: “Why have you brought us out of Egypt—to make us and our children and livestock die of thirst?”
translation: Bikos ol i torst long wara, na ol i tok strong long Mosese: “Wai yu bringim mipela i go bek long Egip – olsem mipela, pikinini bilong mipela, na animals hus bilong mipela i dai long torst?”

original: Then Moses cried out to the LORD, “What should I do with these people? A little more and they will stone me!”
translation: Musá harim tok long Jehovah, “Mi mas mekim wanem long ol piple ia? Liklik yet na bai ol i rokim mi!”

original: And the LORD said to Moses, “Walk on ahead of the people and take some of the elders of Israel with you. Take along in your hand the staff with which you struck the Nile, and go.
translation: Na Bikpela i tokim Mosis, "Go bek i go bifo ol pipol na kisim sampela bilong ol bikpela man bilong Isrel na karim i go wantaim yu. Karim stik bilong yu long han bilong yu, stik em we yu hamarim Nain, na go.

original: Behold, I will stand there before you by the rock at Horeb. And when you strike the rock, water will come out of it for the people to drink.” So Moses did this in the sight of the elders of Israel.
translation: Mi bai stap hap kas olsem long ples bilong yu long rok bilong Horeb. Na wanpela taim yu kilim rok, wara bai kam ausait long em, na ol manmeri bai dring. Mosis mekim dispela olsem long ai bilong olegta pikinini bilong Israel.

original: He named the place Massah and Meribah because the Israelites quarreled, and because they tested the LORD, saying, “Is the LORD among us or not?”
translation: Em i givim nem bilong ples Masah na Meribah, long ol Israelites i kros, na ol i traim LORD, ol i tok, “LORD i stap wantaim yumi o nogat?”

original: After this, the Amalekites came and attacked the Israelites at Rephidim.
translation: Narakai olgeta, Amalekait i kam na winim Israelit long Rephidim.

original: So Moses said to Joshua, “Choose some of our men and go out to fight the Amalekites. Tomorrow I will stand on the hilltop with the staff of God in my hand.”
translation: Moses i skulim Joshua, “Pikinim man long go lusim wara na i preparim ol long fait wantaim Amalekait. Tumora bai mi stanap antap long maunten, wantaim stik bilong God i stap long han bilong mi.”

original: Joshua did as Moses had instructed him and fought against the Amalekites, while Moses, Aaron, and Hur went up to the top of the hill.
translation: Josua i mekim olsem Musa i tokim em, na em i fait long ol Amalekait, wail Musa, Aron, na Hur i go antap long top bilong hil.

original: As long as Moses held up his hands, Israel prevailed; but when he lowered them, Amalek prevailed.
translation: Olsem Moses i holim han bilong en yet, Israel i winim; tasol taim em i lakim han bilong en i daun, Amalek i winim.

original: When Moses’ hands grew heavy, they took a stone and put it under him, and he sat on it. Then Aaron and Hur held his hands up, one on each side, so that his hands remained steady until the sun went down.
translation: Wanpela taim han bilong Moisi i kamap strongpela na i no inap holim op, ol i kisim wanpela ston na i putim daun bilo leg bilong em, na em i sindaun long en. Aron na Hur i holim op han bilong em, wanpela long wanpela sait, na han bilong em i stap strongtru olsem na i no inap miov pinis tasol sun i go daun.

original: So Joshua overwhelmed Amalek and his army with the sword.
translation: Na Josua i winim Amalek wantaim arimi bilong en i go daun long sord.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Write this on a scroll as a reminder and recite it to Joshua, because I will utterly blot out the memory of Amalek from under heaven.”
translation: Papa God i tokim Mosis, “Wraim dispela toksave long banis na tokim Joshuwa, bikos mi bai kisim Amalek na rausim nem bilong en, nas pamuk long heven.”

original: And Moses built an altar and named it The LORD Is My Banner.
translation: Na Moses wokim wanpela aita, na em givim nem long em, olsem: LORD Em I Nambawan Banar Bilong Mi.

original: “Indeed,” he said, “a hand was lifted up toward the throne of the LORD. The LORD will war against Amalek from generation to generation.”
translation: Em i tok olsem, “Wan han i go ap long trohn bilong LORD. LORD bai kisim war long Amalek long olgenaration.”

original: Now Moses’ father-in-law Jethro, the priest of Midian, heard about all that God had done for Moses and His people Israel, and how the LORD had brought Israel out of Egypt.
translation: Nau papa bilong Moses, Jethro, pries bilong Midian, harim olgeta wei God wokim long Moses na pipol bilong en, Israel, na Lod kisim Israel komota long Ijip.

original: After Moses had sent back his wife Zipporah, his father-in-law Jethro had received her,
translation: Bihaen long Moses i go bekim meri bilong en, Sipora, i go, tambu bilong en, Jetro, i kam pikinim em.

original: along with her two sons. One son was named Gershom, for Moses had said, “I have been a foreigner in a foreign land.”
translation: Wantaim tupela pikinini bilong em. Wanpela pikinini em i kolim Gershom, bikos Moses i tok, “Mi bin stap olsem man i kam long nesen anarapela long kantri i stap long we bilong arapela.”

original: The other son was named Eliezer, for Moses had said, “The God of my father was my helper and delivered me from the sword of Pharaoh.”
translation: Narapela pikinini i kolim Eliezer, wantaim Moses i tok, “God bilong papa bilong me i halivim mi, na i skulim mi long sord bilong Pharaoh.”

original: Moses’ father-in-law Jethro, along with Moses’ wife and sons, came to him in the desert, where he was encamped at the mountain of God.
translation: Papa bilong meri bilong Moses, Jethro, wantaim meri bilong Moses na ol pikinini bilong em, i kam lukim em long bus, we em i stap klostu long maunten bilong God.

original: He sent word to Moses, “I, your father-in-law Jethro, am coming to you with your wife and her two sons.”
translation: Em i salim toktok long Moses, “Mi, papa bilong husban yu Jethro, mi kam long yu wantaim meri bilong yu na tu pikinini bilong em.”

original: So Moses went out to meet his father-in-law and bowed down and kissed him. They greeted each other and went into the tent.
translation: Moses i go aut long mikim papa bilong meri blong em, na em i katim kila na kusim em. Ol i tok gut long ol yet, na ol i go insait long hanhaus.

original: Then Moses recounted to his father-in-law all that the LORD had done to Pharaoh and the Egyptians for Israel’s sake, all the hardships they had encountered along the way, and how the LORD had delivered them.
translation: Na Moses i tala long papa bilong meri bilong em olgeta samting we LORD bin mekim long Faraoh na Ijip long moninga bilong Israel, olgeta harez na trabel ol i kam na kisim long rot bilong ol, na olsem LORD bin savedim ol.

original: And Jethro rejoiced over all the good things the LORD had done for Israel, whom He had rescued from the hand of the Egyptians.
translation: Na Jetro i amamas long olgeta samting nais LORD em mekim long Israel, olsem em bekim ol long han bilong Ijip.

original: Jethro declared, “Blessed be the LORD, who has delivered you from the hand of the Egyptians and of Pharaoh, and who has delivered the people from the hand of the Egyptians.
translation: Jethro i tok olsem, "Praizim Lord, bikos em i skulim yu nau long han bilong Ijip na long han bilong Pharaoh, na em i skulim piple nau long han bilong Ijip."

original: Now I know that the LORD is greater than all other gods, for He did this when they treated Israel with arrogance.”
translation: Mi save nau, Bikpela i bikpela tru long ol god nodor, em i mekim dispela wok long ol long ai bilong Yisrael, ol i birua long ol.

original: Then Moses’ father-in-law Jethro brought a burnt offering and sacrifices to God, and Aaron came with all the elders of Israel to eat bread with Moses’ father-in-law in the presence of God.
translation: Na papa bilong missis Moses, Jethro, i bringim ofing bai i go dasol long God olsem wok bilong lotu, na i bringim ol sacrifices namba wan i go long God. Aaron i kam wantaim ol bikpela man bilong Israel, na bai ol i kaikai bret wantaim papa bilong Moses long ai bilong God, bilong mekim wok bilong felosip na komuniti.

original: The next day Moses took his seat to judge the people, and they stood around him from morning until evening.
translation: Mosis i sindaun long jujumim ol pipol, na ol i stap arondim em from moning kamap apinun.

original: When his father-in-law saw all that Moses was doing for the people, he asked, “What is this that you are doing for the people? Why do you sit alone as judge, with all the people standing around you from morning till evening?”
translation: Taim papa bilong wife bilong Moses i lukim olgeta samting Moses i mekim long ol pipol, em i askim, “Dispela em i wok bilong yu long ol pipol? Wanem yu siddown lone olsem jaj, wantaim ol pipol i stap raun long yu from moning ka moning til apinun?”

original: “Because the people come to me to inquire of God,” Moses replied.
translation: Bikos ol pipol i kam long me askim God, Moses i tok.

original: “Whenever they have a dispute, it is brought to me to judge between one man and another, and I make known to them the statutes and laws of God.”
translation: Wanpela taem ol i gat birua, ol i bringim i go long mi bilong mi jujumoi, na mi givim tok bilong statut na lo bilong God long ol.

original: But Moses’ father-in-law said to him, “What you are doing is not good.
translation: Papa bilong meri bilong Moses i tokim em, "Ol samting yu mekim ol i no gut."

original: Surely you and these people with you will wear yourselves out, because the task is too heavy for you. You cannot handle it alone.
translation: Yu na ol pipol hia wantaim yu bai tikim hat long yuself, bekos wok em i bikpela moa long yu, Yu no inap haniman alone.

original: Now listen to me; I will give you some advice, and may God be with you. You must be the people’s representative before God and bring their causes to Him.
translation: Nau harim tok long yu; mi bai givim yu sampla toktok, na mipela hop God i stap wantaim yu. Yu mas kamap olgeta manmeri bilong ples long han bilong God, na brinngim olegta kesa bilong ol i go long Em.

original: Teach them the statutes and laws, and show them the way to live and the work they must do.
translation: Tisim ol i save long loa na statut, na showim ol i go long rot bilong life, na wok ol mas mekim.

original: Furthermore, select capable men from among the people—God-fearing, trustworthy men who are averse to dishonest gain. Appoint them over the people as leaders of thousands, of hundreds, of fifties, and of tens.
translation: Inap, pilim ol man i gat save na strong, ol i gat respek long God, tru long tok, na no laikim benifit nogut. Wokim ol lidaman long tausen, long haned, long fifiti, na long ten, olsem wok bilong lidaman long piple.

original: Have these men judge the people at all times. Then they can bring you any major issue, but all minor cases they can judge on their own, so that your load may be lightened as they share it with you.
translation: Ol jijim i mas jijim ol pipol long ol taim. Ol bai bringim i go long yu bikpela samting, tasol ol liklik kesa ol yet bai ol jijim sebete long ol yet, na yu inap karim lek, mi sharim igo long yu.

original: If you follow this advice and God so directs you, then you will be able to endure, and all these people can go home in peace.”
translation: Sapos yu folowim dispela toktok, olsem God i laik, na God i givim tok bilong yu, then yu inap long sufak, na ol pipol i go bak long ples na stap long peis.

original: Moses listened to his father-in-law and did everything he said.
translation: Mosis harim tok bilong papa bilong meri, na em mekim olgeta samting em i tok.

original: So Moses chose capable men from all Israel and made them heads over the people as leaders of thousands, of hundreds, of fifties, and of tens.
translation: Na Moses i skelim ol man bilong pawa na em i mekim ol bikpela long pipol, olgeta i kamap ol lida long tausen, long handred, long fifiti, na long ten.

original: And they judged the people at all times; they would bring the difficult cases to Moses, but any minor issue they would judge themselves.
translation: Ol i givim desisipn long ol pipel long taim olgeta; ol i bringim kes i hevi long Moses, tasol kes i liklik ol i givim desisipn long ol yet.

original: Then Moses sent his father-in-law on his way, and Jethro returned to his own land.
translation: Na Mosis i sendim papa bilong wife bilong em i go, na Jetoro i go bek long kantri bilong em yet.

original: In the third month, on the same day of the month that the Israelites had left the land of Egypt, they came to the Wilderness of Sinai.
translation: Long mun tri, long de sam dei bilong mun ol Pipol Israel i lusim lan bilong Ijip, ol i kam long Desert bilong Sina.

original: After they had set out from Rephidim, they entered the Wilderness of Sinai, and Israel camped there in front of the mountain.
translation: Ol i go kamaut long Rephidim, na ol i go insait long Wikneshis bilong Sinai, na Israel i kam pikinimo long ples we i klostu long maunten.

original: Then Moses went up to God, and the LORD called to him from the mountain, “This is what you are to tell the house of Jacob and explain to the sons of Israel:
translation: Na Moses i go ap long God, na LORD i singautim em long maunten, “Dispela em i tok bilong yu: yu mas tokim long hap bilong Jakob na ekspleinim long ol pikinini bilong Israel:

original: ‘You have seen for yourselves what I did to Egypt, and how I carried you on eagles’ wings and brought you to Myself.
translation: Yupela i lukim ya ol samting wei mi mekim long Egip, na mista mi karim yupela long wing bilong eagl, na mi bringim yupela kam long mi.

original: Now if you will indeed obey My voice and keep My covenant, you will be My treasured possession out of all the nations—for the whole earth is Mine.
translation: Sapos yu yet harim tok bilong mi na holim covenant bilong mi, bam yu bambai bikpela treasure bilong mi long ol narapela kantri — olgeta graun em belon mi.

original: And unto Me you shall be a kingdom of priests and a holy nation.’ These are the words that you are to speak to the Israelites.”
translation: Na yu na mi, bai yu kamap wanpela kingdom bilong prist, na wanpela nesen i stap long holiground. Dispela em i tok bilong yu ken spikim long ol Israelait.”

original: So Moses went back and summoned the elders of the people and set before them all these words that the LORD had commanded him.
translation: Na Moses i go bek, na i singautim olegta bikman meri bilong ples, na i putim ol samting klia long moninga bilong ol, olsem Lod i bin givim hem instruction.

original: And all the people answered together, “We will do everything that the LORD has spoken.” So Moses brought their words back to the LORD.
translation: Na ol pipel i tok olgeta wanbel, “Yumi wokim ol samting we GOD Papa i tok.” Moses i bringim bek tok bilong ol long GOD Papa.

original: The LORD said to Moses, “Behold, I will come to you in a dense cloud, so that the people will hear when I speak with you, and they will always put their trust in you.” And Moses relayed to the LORD what the people had said.
translation: Papa God i tokim Mosis, "Lukim, mi bai kam long yu insait klostu kloud, na ol pipel bai harim wen mi tok long yu, na ol bai putim bel kol long yu foreva." Na Mosis i tokim Papa God olsem ol pipel i tok.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Go to the people and consecrate them today and tomorrow. They must wash their clothes
translation: Bikpela i tokim Mosis, “Yu go long ol pipol na tamua na tede ol i kamap strongpela. Ol i mas wasim klos blong ol.”

original: and be prepared by the third day, for on the third day the LORD will come down on Mount Sinai in the sight of all the people.
translation: Na yumi mas i redi nau long de tri, bikos long de tri OL MASALAI bai kam daun long Maun Sinai olsem ples santing, na olgeta manmeri bai lukim em long ai bilong olgeta manmeri.

original: And you are to set up a boundary for the people around the mountain and tell them, ‘Be careful not to go up on the mountain or touch its base. Whoever touches the mountain shall surely be put to death.
translation: Na yu mas wokim kaunti long hap long piple raun maunten na tokim ol, ‘Bek i go, no go antap long maunten, na no kisim hap bilong en.’ Husat i kisim hap bilong maunten, bai em i dai Pinis.

original: No hand shall touch him, but he shall surely be stoned or shot with arrows—whether man or beast, he must not live.’ Only when the ram’s horn sounds a long blast may they approach the mountain.”
translation: Nogat wanpela han bai kam na kisim em, em bai dai pinis, ol bai stonim em o ol bai paitim em wantaim banarang – olsem man o animal, nogat ken i stap. Bikos long taim ol i save hearim saund bilong horn bilong ram i go daun yet, orait ol ken kam antap long maunten.

original: When Moses came down from the mountain to the people, he consecrated them, and they washed their clothes.
translation: Mosis i kam daun long mauntin, em i makim ol hol, na ol i wasim skit bilong ol.

original: “Be prepared for the third day,” he said to the people. “Do not draw near to a woman.”
translation: “Biprem na long de wai long dei namba tri,” em i tokim ol pipol. “No ken go klostu long meri.”

original: On the third day, when morning came, there was thunder and lightning. A thick cloud was upon the mountain, and a very loud blast of the ram’s horn went out, so that all the people in the camp trembled.
translation: Long dei thrid, taim mornin i kamap, thunder na lightning i save. Kloud tik i stap long maunten, na saut bilong horn bilong ram i go aut strong, ol pipel inside kamp i shake.

original: Then Moses brought the people out of the camp to meet with God, and they stood at the foot of the mountain.
translation: Mususi i kamautim ol pipol i go long kamp, bai ol i go bekim God, na ol i stap klostu long fut bilong maunten.

original: Mount Sinai was completely enveloped in smoke, because the LORD had descended on it in fire. And the smoke rose like the smoke of a furnace, and the whole mountain quaked violently.
translation: Maunten Sainai i kamapim olgeta long smok, bikos LOROD i daun kom long em langa faia. Na smok i go ap long olsem smok bilong fenis, na maunten hole i shakem strong olgeta.

original: And as the sound of the ram’s horn grew louder and louder, Moses spoke and God answered him in the thunder.
translation: Na saun bilong horne bilong ram i go antap moa na moa, Mosese i tok, na God i ankim em long thunder.

original: The LORD descended to the top of Mount Sinai and called Moses to the summit. So Moses went up,
translation: Bikpela i kam daun long top bilong Maunten Sinai na i singautim Mosis long hap bilong maunten. Na Mosis i go antap.

original: and the LORD said to him, “Go down and warn the people not to break through to see the LORD, lest many of them perish.
translation: Na Papa God i tokim em, “Go daun na givim wail long ol piple, no ken go insait lukim Papa God, bere bere ol i perisim.”

original: Even the priests who approach the LORD must consecrate themselves, or the LORD will break out against them.”
translation: Pries ol i mas kam klostu long LORD, na tupela i mas puripim olsem, nogat narapela LORD bai i kamap strong olsem war long ol.

original: But Moses said to the LORD, “The people cannot come up Mount Sinai, for You solemnly warned us, ‘Put a boundary around the mountain and set it apart as holy.’”
translation: Moses i tokim GOD bilong yumi, “Ol pipol ina posibol long go antap long Maunt Sinay, bikos Yu bin givim us strong tok, ‘Kisim stik long raitim banis long mauntia na me kim long wankain halow.’”

original: And the LORD replied, “Go down and bring Aaron with you. But the priests and the people must not break through to come up to the LORD, or He will break out against them.”
translation: Na Lod i tok, "Yu go daun na bringim Aron wantaim yu. Tasol ol priis na ol pipol no ken go pas long kam ap long Lod, nogat, othawise em bai kamap strong olsem i bagarapim ol."

original: So Moses went down to the people and spoke to them.
translation: Na Mosese i go daun long ol pipol na i tokim ol.

original: And God spoke all these words:
translation: Na God i tok olgeta wod nau:

original: “I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery.
translation: Mi bilong yu, bikpela God, mi kam bekim yupela long kantri bilong Ijip, long haus bilong slaviri.

original: You shall have no other gods before Me.
translation: Yu mas havim nobodi god igo long yu bifor Mi, yu mas tok bilong wan God tasol.

original: You shall not make for yourself an idol in the form of anything in the heavens above, on the earth below, or in the waters beneath.
translation: Yu no ken mekim olsem idoli bilong yu long stap bilong eni samting long heven ibaksai, long graun aninit, o long wara anidai.

original: You shall not bow down to them or worship them; for I, the LORD your God, am a jealous God, visiting the iniquity of the fathers on their children to the third and fourth generations of those who hate Me,
translation: Yu no ken kuku i go daun long ol, yu no ken servim ol; bikos Mi, LORD God bilong yu, em i God i gat jelos, mi kam lukim ol samting nogut bilong papa i go long ol pikinini ol long ol genarashon thaith na foa bilong ol i no laikim Mi.

original: but showing loving devotion to a thousand generations of those who love Me and keep My commandments.
translation: Bai mi soim kavara long lav i go long tausend generesen blong ol manmeri i givim lav long Mi na holim komando Mi.

original: You shall not take the name of the LORD your God in vain, for the LORD will not leave anyone unpunished who takes His name in vain.
translation: Yusim nem bilong GOD bilong yumi long nating, bikos GOD bilong yumi bai no leukim i go long wanem samting, na em i no givim penati long eni husat i yusim nem bilong en long nating.

original: Remember the Sabbath day by keeping it holy.
translation: Rimembim dei bilong Sabat, na yusim em long mekim em hol.

original: Six days you shall labor and do all your work,
translation: Sikis dei yu mas wok na mekim olgeta wok bilong yu,

original: but the seventh day is a Sabbath to the LORD your God, on which you must not do any work—neither you, nor your son or daughter, nor your manservant or maidservant or livestock, nor the foreigner within your gates.
translation: Bareket, de be seven de, em i de bilong Sabat long Bikpela God bilong yu, na yu no ken mekim wok igo - nogat yu, nogat pikinini bilong yu, husat i man o meri, nogat man i wok servis bilong yu, nogat meri i wok servis bilong yu, nogat ol animol bilong ples, nogat man i kam from naiten long boundary bilong yu.

original: For in six days the LORD made the heavens and the earth and the sea and all that is in them, but on the seventh day He rested. Therefore the LORD blessed the Sabbath day and set it apart as holy.
translation: Long sikis dei, LORD i mekim heven na graun na solwara na olgeta samting i stap insait long ol, tasol long namba seven dei em i stap, nogat wok. Olsem, LORD i givim berek long dei bilong Sabat, na em i makim dei bilong Sabat olsem dei holy.

original: Honor your father and mother, so that your days may be long in the land that the LORD your God is giving you.
translation: Sambai papa na mama bilong yu, na bai yu kaikaim olpela taine bilong yu i go long long graun we LORD God bilong yu i givim yu.

original: You shall not murder.
translation: Yu no ken kilim man.

original: You shall not commit adultery.
translation: Yu no ken wokim sin bilong marit.

original: You shall not steal.
translation: Yu no ken stim.

original: You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor.
translation: Yu no ken kisim tok bokis long hap bilong yu.

original: You shall not covet your neighbor’s house. You shall not covet your neighbor’s wife, or his manservant or maidservant, or his ox or donkey, or anything that belongs to your neighbor.”
translation: Yu no ken laikim haus bilong neighbor yu. Yu no ken laikim meri bilong neighbor yu, o man bilong wok o meri bilong wok bilong em, o bulmakau o as bilong em, o ol samting bilong neighbor yu.

original: When all the people witnessed the thunder and lightning, the sounding of the ram’s horn, and the mountain enveloped in smoke, they trembled and stood at a distance.
translation: Wanpela taim ol pipol i lukim thunder na lait, saun bilong horne bilong ram i go dap long ai, maunten i kapud long smok, ol i trai olsem na stan long wei.

original: “Speak to us yourself and we will listen,” they said to Moses. “But do not let God speak to us, or we will die.”
translation: “Tokim olsem long yumi yet, na yumi bai harim,” ol i tokim Moses. “Bikpela no ken tokim yumi direkt, nogat na bai yumi kisim bikpela trabel.”

original: “Do not be afraid,” Moses replied. “For God has come to test you, so that the fear of Him may be before you, to keep you from sinning.”
translation: “Noken bekimaf,” Moses i tok. “God i kam long testim yu, olsem respek long em i stap bifor yu, na yu no ken sin.”

original: And the people stood at a distance as Moses approached the thick darkness where God was.
translation: Na ol pipol i stap longwe far wail Mosis i kam klostu long depeka darkness we Bikpela i stap.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “This is what you are to tell the Israelites: ‘You have seen for yourselves that I have spoken to you from heaven.
translation: Bikpela i tokim Mosis, “Yu tokim ol Israel olsem: ‘Yupela i lukim nabaut long yu, Bikpela i tok long yu from heven.’”

original: You are not to make any gods alongside Me; you are not to make for yourselves gods of silver or gold.
translation: Yupela no ken wokim ol kinda god iles long ai; yupela no ken wokim bilong yuself god long sila o gol.

original: You are to make for Me an altar of earth, and sacrifice on it your burnt offerings and peace offerings, your sheep and goats and cattle. In every place where I cause My name to be remembered, I will come to you and bless you.
translation: Wokim long mi wanpela altia long graun, na brukim olkaen i go long en, na ofa bilong yumi, na peis ofa bilong yumi, ol sip, goat, na bulmakau. Long ol ples we ol i kolim nem bilong mi, mi bai kam long yu, na bai givim yu bless.

original: Now if you make an altar of stones for Me, you must not build it with stones shaped by tools; for if you use a chisel on it, you will defile it.
translation: Nau, sapos yu wokim wankain altar bilong Mif long ston, yu no ken wokim em long ston i kamap strong na gut long hap; bikos, sapos yu yusim ais bilong kisim aut pasin bilong en, bai yu bagarapim em.

original: And you must not go up to My altar on steps, lest your nakedness be exposed on it.’
translation: Na yu no ken go ap long alta bilong Mi long steppel, bikos bodi yu bai i kamap long en.

original: “These are the ordinances that you are to set before them:
translation: Dispela ol loa i kam: yu mas writim i go bek long ol.

original: If you buy a Hebrew servant, he is to serve you for six years. But in the seventh year, he shall go free without paying anything.
translation: Yupela baim wanpela sarvan bilong Iuda, em i mas sarve yupela long sikis yia. Bareket long sevén yia, em i go fri long nambis, em i no pai eni samting.

original: If he arrived alone, he is to leave alone; if he arrived with a wife, she is to leave with him.
translation: I kam solo, em i go solo; i kam wantaim meri bilong em, meri bilong em i go wantaim em.

original: If his master gives him a wife and she bears him sons or daughters, the woman and her children shall belong to her master, and only the man shall go free.
translation: Sapos masita i givim meri long en, na meri i karim bek pins bilong en, tasol pikinini man o pikinini meri, meri wantaim ol pikinini bilong en bai i bilong masita, tasol man bai i go fri.

original: But if the servant declares, ‘I love my master and my wife and children; I do not want to go free,’
translation: Bai em i tok olsem, 'Mi lamuim master bilong mi na meri bilong mi na pikinini bilong mi; Mi no laik kisim freedom,'

original: then his master is to bring him before the judges. And he shall take him to the door or doorpost and pierce his ear with an awl. Then he shall serve his master for life.
translation: Na masta bai kisim i go long ol majistret, na bai painim igat bilong en long post bilong dor, na bai mekim kol bilong igat bilong en long su bilong awl. Na bai servitut bilong en i kamap wok bilong masta bilong en foreva.

original: And if a man sells his daughter as a servant, she is not to go free as the menservants do.
translation: Na if man i salim daughta bilong em olsem servant meri, em i no ken igo fri olsem ol boi bilong man husat i wok.

original: If she is displeasing in the eyes of her master who had designated her for himself, he must allow her to be redeemed. He has no right to sell her to foreigners, since he has broken faith with her.
translation: Sapos meri em i nogat laik long ai bilong masta nau, em i appointim em yet long en, masta mas givim chanis long en de bilong en i go bek. Masta igat noksin rait long selim em long narapela kantri, wantaim em i bin bruk trast long en.

original: And if he chooses her for his son, he must deal with her as with a daughter.
translation: Sapos em i laikim meri long ol son bilong en, em mas wokim gut long em olsem mama i wokim long pikinini meri.

original: If he takes another wife, he must not reduce the food, clothing, or marital rights of his first wife.
translation: Sapos em i kisim meri narak, em i no ken redusim ka, klotes, o raits bilong meri em i kisim pastaim.

original: If, however, he does not provide her with these three things, she is free to go without monetary payment.
translation: Sapos em i no givim ol samting tripele: ka, klos, na pe bilong mani, den em i fri long go bai olsem, tasol em i no mas pai moni.

original: Whoever strikes and kills a man must surely be put to death.
translation: Husai i paitim na kilim man, emas i dai tasol.

original: If, however, he did not lie in wait, but God allowed it to happen, then I will appoint for you a place where he may flee.
translation: Em i no hidim bek long w8, tasol God i givim sankam na em i kamap, mi bai apoinim ples wanpela long yu, olsem na man i ken ranawe go long hap.

original: But if a man schemes and acts willfully against his neighbor to kill him, you must take him away from My altar to be put to death.
translation: Bai ol i kirapim yu long kilim narapela man meri, na yu wok long han bilong yu yet long tok harim, bai yu kisim em i go bek long altiya bilong Mipela, na em bai dai.

original: Whoever strikes his father or mother must surely be put to death.
translation: Husat i kilim papa o mama, em i mas i dai pinis.

original: Whoever kidnaps another man must be put to death, whether he sells him or the man is found in his possession.
translation: Olsem wanem man i go bekim narapela man, em i mas kilim dai pinis, sapos em i salim man, o man i stap wantaim em yet, bai em i dai pinis.

original: Anyone who curses his father or mother must surely be put to death.
translation: Olsem wan man i kukim kurse long papa oa mama bilong em, em bai i die tasol.

original: If men are quarreling and one strikes the other with a stone or a fist, and he does not die but is confined to bed,
translation: Ol man i kaikai tok, na wanpela i paitim narapela wantaim stoan o fist, na em i no dai, tasol i stap insait long bet,

original: then the one who struck him shall go unpunished, as long as the other can get up and walk around outside with his staff. Nevertheless, he must compensate the man for his lost work and see that he is completely healed.
translation: Nogat ken gat punishmen i go long dispela man, olsem na em i kam daun na wokabaut na usim stik bilong helpim o sapot long sindaun. Tasol, em i mas peim peni long man, na man i heal kamap strong olgeta, na givim pei long em long taim we em i no wok.

original: If a man strikes his manservant or maidservant with a rod, and the servant dies by his hand, he shall surely be punished.
translation: Man i paitim man servant oa meri servant wantaim stik, na em i dai long han bilong em, bai em i kisim penati tru.

original: However, if the servant gets up after a day or two, the owner shall not be punished, since the servant is his property.
translation: Sapos servant i kam antap bihain long de na tu, oyna masalai bai no ken krosim, bikos servant em i propati bilong en.

original: If men who are fighting strike a pregnant woman and her child is born prematurely, but there is no further injury, he shall surely be fined as the woman’s husband demands and as the court allows.
translation: Ol man i go nau long pait, i kilim meri i go long bel, na pikinini i kam bek long bel tasol, i no ken gat moa kros, em bai mas pekimbak olsem husband bilong meri i askim, na kot i givim token.

original: But if a serious injury results, then you must require a life for a life—
translation: Bai ikam long olsem i kamapim bikpela sore, na bai yu mas askim laif bilong man i kilim olsem, laif bilong man i go bek long laif bilong man.

original: eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot,
translation: Ai bilong ai, tith bilong tith, han bilong han, fut bilong fut, olsem Lo Bilong Pe Bilong Pe, em i tok olsem: paitim bek long nem bilong pe bilong pe.

original: burn for burn, wound for wound, and stripe for stripe.
translation: Baun olsem baun, suk olsem suk, na stripe olsem stripe.

original: If a man strikes and blinds the eye of his manservant or maidservant, he must let the servant go free as compensation for the eye.
translation: I go kilim man servist o meri servist, na i kamapim ai bilong en i stap klosim, em i mas wokim servant i go fri long han bilong en olsem kompensesen bilong ai.

original: And if he knocks out the tooth of his manservant or maidservant, he must let the servant go free as compensation for the tooth.
translation: Na sapos em i kilim tuwot long teeti bilong man servent o meri servent, em bai lusim servant i go fri olsem kisim pe bilong teeti.

original: If an ox gores a man or woman to death, the ox must surely be stoned, and its meat must not be eaten. But the owner of the ox shall not be held responsible.
translation: Sapos bulmakau i kilim man o meri, na i dai, bulmakau ya em i mas pidik long ston, na mifala no ken kaikai mit blo pisin. Be tasol, man husat i bosim bulmakau, em i no birua.

original: But if the ox has a habit of goring, and its owner has been warned yet does not restrain it, and it kills a man or woman, then the ox must be stoned and its owner must also be put to death.
translation: Sapos bulmakau i gat tokwin long mekim kros, na oleta meri bilong en ibin givim waning, em i no holim bek, na i kilim man o meri, tasol bulmakau mas i stap long ston, na meri bilong en tu mas i dai.

original: If payment is demanded of him instead, he may redeem his life by paying the full amount demanded of him.
translation: Sampela man i askim pei, em ina baim bak life bilong em yet, olsem na em bai pei olgeta moni.

original: If the ox gores a son or a daughter, it shall be done to him according to the same rule.
translation: Sapos bulmakau i bagarap pikinini man o pikinini meri, olsem bai mekim olsem long em.

original: If the ox gores a manservant or maidservant, the owner must pay thirty shekels of silver to the master of that servant, and the ox must be stoned.
translation: Sapos bulmakau i kisim na i kilim man servist o meri servist, bosi bilong bulmakau i mas pai thirty sikl bilong silva long bos bilong servist, na bulmakau i mas i go daun long ston.

original: If a man opens or digs a pit and fails to cover it, and an ox or a donkey falls into it,
translation: Wanpela man i opim o ikam pit long graun, na em i no kapim bek, na bulmakau o nak na donki i slip i go daun long pit.

original: the owner of the pit shall make restitution; he must pay its owner, and the dead animal will be his.
translation: I papa bilong hole em bai pei bek long papa bilong en, na em bai kisim dai animal, bekside em i go long em.

original: If a man’s ox injures his neighbor’s ox and it dies, they must sell the live one and divide the proceeds; they also must divide the dead animal.
translation: Sapos man i go na bulumakau i kilim bulumakau bilong neba na i dai, ol mas selim bulumakau i stap yet na divelapim moni bilong salim, na ol mas divelapim bulumakau i dai tu.

original: But if it was known that the ox had a habit of goring, yet its owner failed to restrain it, he shall pay full compensation, ox for ox, and the dead animal will be his.
translation: Sapos em i save long ol dispela bulmakau em i gat weslong long mekim ol i paitim, na olsen i no inap long holim bek, em bai peim bikpela kisim, bulmakau bilong bulmakau, na bulmakau i dai bai i go long en.

original: “If a man steals an ox or a sheep and slaughters or sells it, he must repay five oxen for an ox and four sheep for a sheep.
translation: Igat man i stilim bulmakau o sip na i kisim i go kasem o sellem, em mas pei bek faiv bulmakau long wanpela bulmakau na foa sip long wanpela sip.

original: If a thief is caught breaking in and is beaten to death, no one shall be guilty of bloodshed.
translation: Sapos man i kaikai i go brukim haus na i kisim bek, i kamap bek impaitim dai pinis, nogat wanman bai katim bilong givil long shedim blod olsem loa.

original: But if it happens after sunrise, there is guilt for his bloodshed. A thief must make full restitution; if he has nothing, he himself shall be sold for his theft.
translation: Sapos em i kamap bihain long san i go ap, i gat skul long blood bilong en i spillim. Tif i mas pilim bek olgeta samting em i stilim; sapos em i no gat samting, em yet i sal be long pris bilong tif bilong en.

original: If what was stolen is actually found alive in his possession—whether ox or donkey or sheep—he must pay back double.
translation: Sapos ol samting we i stilim i kam bek long han bilong man, na em i lukim ol i stap yet long han bilong em - ol bulmakau, donki, na sip - em mas pei bek dupela.

original: If a man grazes his livestock in a field or vineyard and allows them to stray so that they graze in someone else’s field, he must make restitution from the best of his own field or vineyard.
translation: Yusain man i kaikai gras bilong en long gaden win o gras, na em lusim ol i go long we na kaikai gras bilong arapela man, em bai mas pei bek long bes bilong en gras o gaden win.

original: If a fire breaks out and spreads to thornbushes so that it consumes stacked or standing grain, or the whole field, the one who started the fire must make full restitution.
translation: Sapos ai i kamap na i go long bus na dokim ak, na bekim pe i stap, em bai mas bekim olgeta, bikos em i mas bekim pe long ol samting, na man i mekim ai, em bai mas givim bek pe long ol samting we i bin Bekim.

original: If a man gives his neighbor money or goods for safekeeping and they are stolen from the neighbor’s house, the thief, if caught, must pay back double.
translation: I givim moni o gabaza bilong en long narapela man husat i ken holim gut long en, na ol samting bilong ples i pinis long hus bilong narapela, dispela man bilong stilim, em bai mas pei bek tuwai.

original: If the thief is not found, the owner of the house must appear before the judges to determine whether he has taken his neighbor’s property.
translation: Sapos man i stilim i no inap findim, oleta meri bilong haus i mas kam bek long ol jaj ol bai ken stretim hu ia kam tokolim propati bilong narapela man.

original: In all cases of illegal possession of an ox, a donkey, a sheep, a garment, or any lost item that someone claims, ‘This is mine,’ both parties shall bring their cases before the judges. The one whom the judges find guilty must pay back double to his neighbor.
translation: Long olgeta kese bilong posesen we no laikim, em bilong bulmakau, donki, sip, klos, o samting we harim, na husat i klaim, 'Em bilong mi,' tupela i kam bringim kesa bilong ol i go long magistrat. Magistrat i kisim olsem guilty, bekim pe bilong dupla i go long neiba bilong en.

original: If a man gives a donkey, an ox, a sheep, or any other animal to be cared for by his neighbor, but it dies or is injured or stolen while no one is watching,
translation: I givim donki, oks, ship, o samting narapela animal long neba blong em, i givim bek long lokautim, tasol em i dai o i kisim sik o i stilim wail nogat man i luk.

original: an oath before the LORD shall be made between the parties to determine whether or not the man has taken his neighbor’s property. The owner must accept the oath and require no restitution.
translation: Lop wanpela oat long han bilong GOD i mas kamap long ol pipol, bilong finisim olsem o nogat man i pilim propati bilong narapela man. Pipol i stap, proprietor i mas kisim oat, na nogut long bekim pe.

original: But if the animal was actually stolen from the neighbor, he must make restitution to the owner.
translation: Sipos animal i stilim, em mas pilim bek i go bek long ples bilong en, na bai em givim bek long baiwon bilong en.

original: If the animal was torn to pieces, he shall bring it as evidence; he need not make restitution for the torn carcass.
translation: Sapos animal i go bagarap olgeta, em bai bringim bodi bilong animal i dai olsem evidens, na em no need bekim pe long em.

original: If a man borrows an animal from his neighbor and it is injured or dies while its owner is not present, he must make full restitution.
translation: Igat man i save karim animal long narapela man, na em i paul oder em i dai wail em i no stap, bai em i mas pilim bek gen olgeta long bai bilong em.

original: If the owner was present, no restitution is required. If the animal was rented, the fee covers the loss.
translation: Sapos olegta meri bilong en i stap, em i mas pai bek nogat. Sapos animal i bin ronim long narapela man, pe em i kisim olgeta los, na moni bilong ronim bai bekim moni i go bek gen.

original: If a man seduces a virgin who is not pledged in marriage and sleeps with her, he must pay the full dowry for her to be his wife.
translation: Man i winim meri i no marit yet, na em i go insait long meri, em i mas peim prais bilong meri olgeta, na bai meri i kamap meri bilong man.

original: If her father absolutely refuses to give her to him, the man still must pay an amount comparable to the bridal price of a virgin.
translation: Sapos papa bilong meri i no givim tokstrong olsem, man i mas pei prize bilong meri i go daun long kantri, olsem samting ol i usim pe long meri i nogat husban.

original: You must not allow a sorceress to live.
translation: Yu no ken letim meri sorseri i stap.

original: Whoever lies with an animal must surely be put to death.
translation: Husat i go na lukim animal, em i mas dai pinis.

original: If anyone sacrifices to any god other than the LORD alone, he must be set apart for destruction.
translation: Ol i ofa long ol god narapela long LORD, ol i mas i kamapim long drek.

original: You must not exploit or oppress a foreign resident, for you yourselves were foreigners in the land of Egypt.
translation: Yupela no ken stretim ol man i kam nau long kantri, bikos long taim bipo yupela yet masalai i kam long kantri Ejip.

original: You must not mistreat any widow or orphan.
translation: Yu no ken krosim eni widou o ba orphan, ol meri we i les na husban o pikinini we i no hav papa o mama.

original: If you do mistreat them, and they cry out to Me in distress, I will surely hear their cry.
translation: Yupela i givim nogut long ol, na ol i singaut long me long taem ol i stap in hevi, Mi bai harim toktok bilong ol.

original: My anger will be kindled, and I will kill you with the sword; then your wives will become widows and your children will be fatherless.
translation: Mai bel i mas karim strong, na mi bai kilim yu long sop; ol meri bilong yu ol bai stap widou, na ol pikinini bilong yu ol bai losim papa.

original: If you lend money to one of My people among you who is poor, you must not act as a creditor to him; you are not to charge him interest.
translation: Yupela i no ken givim moni long wanpela bilong mipela ol i no gat moni, tasol yupela i no ken wok olsem man bilong kredit; yupela i no ken kisim pei long moni.

original: If you take your neighbor’s cloak as collateral, return it to him by sunset,
translation: Sapos yu kisim klos bilong neba yu olsem sekiriti, yu mas bringim bek long em bifor san go doun.

original: because his cloak is the only covering he has for his body. What else will he sleep in? And if he cries out to Me, I will hear, for I am compassionate.
translation: Bilong em cloak i stap wanpela klosim skin bilong en, bodi bilong en bai i kisim klostu long wanem? Bai hem i slip long wanem taine? Na sapos hem i singaut i go long me, Mi hia, bikos mi gat bel isi.

original: You must not blaspheme God or curse the ruler of your people.
translation: Yu no ken tromoi long God o kirapim tok bilong papa bilong yu.

original: You must not hold back offerings from your granaries or vats. You are to give Me the firstborn of your sons.
translation: Yu no ken holim bek ofring long haus bilong ka na tanki bilong win. Yu mas givim Mifala pikinini namba wan bilong ol man bilong yu.

original: You shall do likewise with your cattle and your sheep. Let them stay with their mothers for seven days, but on the eighth day you are to give them to Me.
translation: Yu mas mekim olsem wantaim bulmakau na sip bilong yu, letim ol i stap wantaim mama bilong ol long seven de, be onninth de yu givim ol long Mi.

original: You are to be My holy people. You must not eat the meat of a mauled animal found in the field; you are to throw it to the dogs.
translation: Yupela mas stap ol pipol we bilong Mipela na stap long wei holiholi. Yupela no ken kaikai mit blo animal we i bin katim olsem na i dai, yupela inap i givim i go long dog.

original: “You shall not spread a false report. Do not join the wicked by being a malicious witness.
translation: Yu no ken skulpim tok bokis. No joine ol i stap long ol bikpela man na wari long givim tus wis.

original: You shall not follow the crowd in wrongdoing. When you testify in a lawsuit, do not pervert justice by siding with the crowd.
translation: Yu no ken foloim ol pipol long wong samting. Wanpela yu givim evidens long kesi, yu no ken bagarapim justis bilong siding wantaim ol pipol.

original: And do not show favoritism to a poor man in his lawsuit.
translation: No ken mekim pasin bilong pikinini long narapela long kes bilong man i no gat moni.

original: If you encounter your enemy’s stray ox or donkey, you must return it to him.
translation: Yupela i lukim bulmakau poisin o donki i bagarap, yupela mas bringim bek long em.

original: If you see the donkey of one who hates you fallen under its load, do not leave it there; you must help him with it.
translation: Yupela lukim donki bilong man i amamas long yupela i kirap long karim pikinini bilong en, no lusim i stap yet; yupela mas halivim em, halivim pinis man.

original: You shall not deny justice to the poor in their lawsuits.
translation: Yu no ken rikisa nogut long jusis long ol pikinini na ol i no gat moni long kaes ol i kam kot.

original: Stay far away from a false accusation. Do not kill the innocent or the just, for I will not acquit the guilty.
translation: Tum ol i go longwe we long tok bokis. Yu no ken kilim man nogat gilt o dairo, bikos mi no bai givim yu ripon long gilt.

original: Do not accept a bribe, for a bribe blinds those who see and twists the words of the righteous.
translation: Nogat accepim moni i go long ol politisman, binislong em i kirap ai bilong ol i luk, na i kirap toktok bilong ol i gat Jastis, na mekim ol i go daun long rot.

original: Do not oppress a foreign resident, since you yourselves know how it feels to be foreigners; for you were foreigners in the land of Egypt.
translation: No ken stretim man i kam long ples, wantaim yupela save long ol feelings bilong tumbuna na bikos long bikpela taim bifo, yupela yet stap ol man i kam long kantri bilong Ijip.

original: For six years you are to sow your land and gather its produce,
translation: Long sampela sikis yia, yu mas planim graun bilong yu na kisim ka moni bilong en.

original: but in the seventh year you must let it rest and lie fallow, so that the poor among your people may eat from the field and the wild animals may consume what they leave. Do the same with your vineyard and olive grove.
translation: Bai long yia sevén, yu mas lusi i stap na kisim brek, olesem bai ol pobre man long ples bilong yu inap kaikai ris long graun, na ol bus animal bai kaikai ol samting ol i lusim. Yu mas mekim olsem tu long garden balus na oliv tan.

original: For six days you are to do your work, but on the seventh day you must cease, so that your ox and your donkey may rest and the son of your maidservant may be refreshed, as well as the foreign resident.
translation: Long sikis de, yu mas wokim wok bilong yu, tapi long sevenpela de, yu mas opim han bilong wok, so ol bulmakau na donki bilong yu ken kisim res, na pikinini bilong meri i wok servos na man i kam from naiton anather ken kamap fresh gen.

original: Pay close attention to everything I have said to you. You must not invoke the names of other gods; they must not be heard on your lips.
translation: Kilim olsem long olgeta samting na yumi harim tok bilong mi. Yus no ken kaikaim long maus bilong yu, nem bilong odas god olsem, na yu no ken yusim long wok bilong yu.

original: Three times a year you are to celebrate a feast to Me.
translation: Tripla taim long yia, yu mas kisim kaikai bilong halepim long mi.

original: You are to keep the Feast of Unleavened Bread as I commanded you: At the appointed time in the month of Abib you are to eat unleavened bread for seven days, because that was the month you came out of Egypt. No one may appear before Me empty-handed.
translation: Yupela mas holim Kaikai Bred Nogat Yun olsem na mi bin tokim yupela: long taim we i kamap, long mun Abib, yupela mas kaikai bred nogat yun long sevendei, bikos em i mun we yupela i kam bek long Egip. Ina nogo moni, ina nogo kina samting, yupela i no ken kam bek long mi tasol.

original: You are also to keep the Feast of Harvest with the firstfruits of the produce from what you sow in the field. And keep the Feast of Ingathering at the end of the year, when you gather your produce from the field.
translation: Yu mas kisim Kaikai Bilong Harves wantaim kaikai ibin kam first long graun, olgeta samting yu plantim long graun. Na yu mas kisim Kaikai Bilong Bikpela Harves bung long taitim yia i go daun, wail yu kisim kaikai bilong yu long graun.

original: Three times a year all your males are to appear before the Lord GOD.
translation: Tripla taim long yia, ol man bilong yu mas kamap bifoa Lod God.

original: You must not offer the blood of My sacrifices with anything leavened, nor may the fat of My feast remain until morning.
translation: Yu no ken givim blod bilong sakrifis bilong Mi wantaem samting i gat yeast, na ol fat bilong kaikai bilong Mi inap ripot long moning.

original: Bring the best of the firstfruits of your soil to the house of the LORD your God. You must not cook a young goat in its mother’s milk.
translation: Kisim gutpela ka bilong kastom, olsem gras bilong graun, na bringim i go long haus bilong LORD God bilong yu. Yu no ken kukim kid bilong goat insait long susu bilong mama bilong em.

original: Behold, I am sending an angel before you to protect you along the way and to bring you to the place I have prepared.
translation: Susa, lukim, mi salim enjel bosboi bifo yu long lukautim yu olsem long rot na bringim yu go long ples we mi preparim.

original: Pay attention to him and listen to his voice; do not defy him, for he will not forgive rebellion, since My Name is in him.
translation: Kisim notis long em na harim tok bilong em; no ken stretim bek long em, olsem em no bai givim sin i go long ribel, wantaim Nem bilong mi i stap long em.

original: But if you will listen carefully to his voice and do everything I say, I will be an enemy to your enemies and a foe to your foes.
translation: Bai yu harim tok bilong em i go longwe na wokim olgeta samting mi tokim yu, orait mi bai i stap bagarap long ol birua bilong yu, na mi bai i birua long ol i no likim yu.

original: For My angel will go before you and bring you into the land of the Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, Canaanites, Hivites, and Jebusites, and I will annihilate them.
translation: Ein angel bai go bifoa yu na bai bringim yu go long graun bilong Amorait, Hiti, Perizait, Kanaanit, Hivait, na Jebusait, na Mi bai bagarapim ol.

original: You must not bow down to their gods or serve them or follow their practices. Instead, you are to demolish them and smash their sacred stones to pieces.
translation: Yupela no ken buk bembe long god bilong ol, yupela no ken servim ol, yupela no ken follem pratiks bilong ol. Insited, yupela mas krosim ol, na brukim ston bilong spirit bilong ol i go bagarap olgeta.

original: So you shall serve the LORD your God, and He will bless your bread and your water. And I will take away sickness from among you.
translation: Olsem yu mas servim Lord God bilong yu, na Em bai givim planti bless long bret na wara bilong yu. Na mi go inap long kisim sik bilong yu.

original: No woman in your land will miscarry or be barren; I will fulfill the number of your days.
translation: Inap long kantri bilong yu, meri igat bel, bai i no poketik, na i no inap karim bebé; mi bai kamupim taim bilong yu olgeta.

original: I will send My terror ahead of you and throw into confusion every nation you encounter. I will make all your enemies turn and run.
translation: Mi bai sendim tok bilong fear na win bilong me bihain long yu, na mi bai kirapim olgeta kantri yu kamap long en, na ol i no inap long wok. Mi bai mekim ol enemy bilong yu yet, na ol i ronawe.

original: I will send the hornet before you to drive the Hivites and Canaanites and Hittites out of your way.
translation: Mi bai sendim winim hornet long puskim oltabot Hiviti, Kanaanit, na Hitait long wei bilong yu.

original: I will not drive them out before you in a single year; otherwise the land would become desolate and wild animals would multiply against you.
translation: Mi no go draivim olsem out bifor yu yet long wanpela yia; nogat, plaun bai kamap klia na bos, na ol busna kain animal bai i kamap planti tumas against yu.

original: Little by little I will drive them out ahead of you, until you become fruitful and possess the land.
translation: Liklik bihain mi bai kickim ol longwe go bihain long yu, long olgeta taim na yu kamap strong na i stap, na yu bosim graun.

original: And I will establish your borders from the Red Sea to the Sea of the Philistines, and from the desert to the Euphrates. For I will deliver the inhabitants into your hand, and you will drive them out before you.
translation: Mipela bai plantim kauntim bilong yu long Solwara Rot na i go inap long Solwara bilong Filistia, na long kantry bus na i go inap long Euphrates. Mipela bai givim ol pipol long ples ia long han bilong yu, na yupela bai pusim ol i go bifoa yupela.

original: You shall make no covenant with them or with their gods.
translation: Yu no ken makim pepe wantaim ol, na yu no ken makim pepe wantaim gologolo bilong ol.

original: They must not remain in your land, lest they cause you to sin against Me. For if you serve their gods, it will surely be a snare to you.”
translation: Ol i no ken stap yet long graun bilong yu, inap long ol bai i mekim yu sin agensim Mi. Bikos olsem yu mas sarve olkain god bilong ol, em bai i kamapim trap long yu.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Come up to the LORD—you and Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and seventy of Israel’s elders—and you are to worship at a distance.
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses, "Kamap, go long Lod - yu, Aron, Nadab, Abihu, na siksitipala bikpela manmeri bilong Israel - na yu mas worship long wei."

original: Moses alone shall approach the LORD, but the others must not come near. And the people may not go up with him.”
translation: Mosis tasol i kam klostu long Papa God, bikos ol narapela no ken go klostu. Na pipel igat no ken go antap wantaim em.

original: When Moses came and told the people all the words and ordinances of the LORD, they all responded with one voice: “All the words that the LORD has spoken, we will do.”
translation: Wanpela taim Mosese i kam na toktok long ol pipol olgeta tok bilong Bikpela na lo bilong Bikpela, olgeta i givim wanpela voys: “Olgeta tok bilong Bikpela i tok, mipela bai mekim.”

original: And Moses wrote down all the words of the LORD. Early the next morning he got up and built an altar at the base of the mountain, along with twelve pillars for the twelve tribes of Israel.
translation: Na Moses raitim daun ol tok bilong LORD. Bikos kalabus moning em i kam bek na em bilton wan altia long bun bilong maunten, wantaim twelve pilia bilong twelve tribe bilong Israel.

original: Then he sent out some young men of Israel, and they offered burnt offerings and sacrificed young bulls as peace offerings to the LORD.
translation: Na em sendim yung man bilong Israel i go, na ol i kilim bulmakau kol na ofim ol long we bilong pis olsem peis ofing long LORD, na ol givim ofing blong em i go daun, em ol bin ofim na bikos LORD i ples.

original: Moses took half of the blood and put it in bowls, and the other half he sprinkled on the altar.
translation: Mosese i kisim hap bilong blood, i putim long bol, na nambis hap em i sprinklem long alta.

original: Then he took the Book of the Covenant and read it to the people, who replied, “All that the LORD has spoken we will do, and we will be obedient.”
translation: Na em i kisim Buk bilong Kaovenan, na em i ritim long ol pipol, ol i bekim tok, “Mipela bai mekim olgeta samting GOD Papa i tok, na mipela bai hariap.”

original: So Moses took the blood, sprinkled it on the people, and said, “This is the blood of the covenant that the LORD has made with you in accordance with all these words.”
translation: Na Moses kisim blod i go, na em sprinklem blod long ol pipol, na em tok, 'Dispela blod em i blod bilong kaivakam we LORD i mekim wantaim yumi olgeta long dispela tok.'

original: Then Moses went up with Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, and seventy of the elders of Israel,
translation: Na Moses i go ap, Aaron, Nadab, Abihu, na seventy bilong olegta pikinini bilong Israel.

original: and they saw the God of Israel. Under His feet was a work like a pavement made of sapphire, as clear as the sky itself.
translation: Na ol i lukim God bilong Israel. Aninit long lek bilong Em i stap wok olsem paipasa bilong safia, olsem klia olsem ska itself.

original: But God did not lay His hand on the nobles of Israel; they saw Him, and they ate and drank.
translation: Bikos God i no kilim han bilong en long papa bilong Israel; ol i lukim em, na ol i kaikai na dring.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Come up to Me on the mountain and stay here, so that I may give you the tablets of stone, with the law and commandments I have written for their instruction.”
translation: Papa God i tokim Mosis, “Kam long me antap long maunten na stap herem, na bai mi givim yu plak bilong ston, wantaim lo bilong God na komando ol i bin raitim bilong skulim ol.”

original: So Moses set out with Joshua his attendant and went up on the mountain of God.
translation: Na Moses i go bek long Josaia haus boi bilong em, na ol i go ap gen long maunten bilong God.

original: And he said to the elders, “Wait here for us until we return to you. Aaron and Hur are here with you. Whoever has a dispute can go to them.”
translation: Na em i tokim ol bikman meri, “Wai hus ere long wei yumi go bek kam na yumias go bek gen long yu. Aron na Hur i stap hia wantaim yu. Husat i gat faet inap go bekim kasol long ol.”

original: When Moses went up on the mountain, the cloud covered it,
translation: Wanpela taim Mosese i go antap long maunten, klau i kambengim em.

original: and the glory of the LORD settled on Mount Sinai. For six days the cloud covered it, and on the seventh day the LORD called to Moses from within the cloud.
translation: Glori bilong LORD i kam daun na i pundaun long Maunt Sinai. Klaud i kova em long sikis de, na long de seventh day, LORD i singautim Mose from insait long klaud.

original: And the sight of the glory of the LORD was like a consuming fire on the mountaintop in the eyes of the Israelites.
translation: Na lukim bilong glori bilong Bikpela i olsem faia i kaikai everything long top bilong maunten long ai bilong Pipol Israel.

original: Moses entered the cloud as he went up on the mountain, and he remained on the mountain forty days and forty nights.
translation: Mosis i go insait long klau em i go ap long maunten, na em i stap olsem long maunten forti de na forti nait.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Tell the Israelites to bring Me an offering. You are to receive My offering from every man whose heart compels him.
translation: Tusim ol Israel long kam na tokim ol: Husat haret i givim em, em i mas bringim mi ofing. Yumi mas kisim ofing bilong mi long ol man husat haret i givim em.

original: This is the offering you are to accept from them: gold, silver, and bronze;
translation: Em i ples bilong ofing yu mas tekim bek long ol: gołd, silva, na bronz;

original: blue, purple, and scarlet yarn; fine linen and goat hair;
translation: Blu, paipul, na skarlet tainkinds; linen finis na hair bilong goat;

original: ram skins dyed red and fine leather; acacia wood;
translation: Skim bilong ram we i stap redi, lether finis, na diwai akasia;

original: olive oil for the light; spices for the anointing oil and for the fragrant incense;
translation: Oliva oyil bilong lait; spais olgeta bilong oyil bilong anointim na bilong insens we i smell strong;

original: and onyx stones and gemstones to be mounted on the ephod and breastpiece.
translation: Na ston onyx na ston bilong valiu i go long hap bilong ephod na breispis.

original: And they are to make a sanctuary for Me, so that I may dwell among them.
translation: Ol mas wokim ples bilong saintuari bilong Mi, na mi ken stap klostu long ol.

original: You must make the tabernacle and design all its furnishings according to the pattern I show you.
translation: Yu mas wokim haus lotu na desain olgeta samting bilong husat i go insait long em, olsem piksa we mi sho yu.

original: And they are to construct an ark of acacia wood, two and a half cubits long, a cubit and a half wide, and a cubit and a half high.
translation: Ol i mas wokim kanu long akasia timbra, iki long em i go long 2.5 kibit, wiht ol i go long 1.5 kibit, na hai bilong em i go long 1.5 kibit.

original: Overlay it with pure gold both inside and out, and make a gold molding around it.
translation: Kamapim em wantaim golpela, na longwe na nakamal, wokim molding bilong gol long hap bilong en.

original: Cast four gold rings for it and fasten them to its four feet, two rings on one side and two on the other.
translation: Wokim foa ring bilong gol na kisim i go, na raitim ol long foa lek bilong en, tu long wan sait na tu long nara sait.

original: And make poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold.
translation: Wokim poles long diwai bilong akasia na kaverim olgeta wantaim gol.

original: Insert the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark, in order to carry it.
translation: Putim stik i go insait long ring bilong ark, olsem bai yu ken kisim i go.

original: The poles are to remain in the rings of the ark; they must not be removed.
translation: Stik bilong karim bai i mas stap yet insait long ring bilong ak, ol i no ken kisim aut.

original: And place inside the ark the Testimony, which I will give you.
translation: Na putim Tekstmani i go insait long arka, we husat mi bai givim yu.

original: And you are to construct a mercy seat of pure gold, two and a half cubits long and a cubit and a half wide.
translation: Yu mas wokim sip bilong grace na em bai bihaen long ota long gol, tu na hap cubit lon, na wan cubit na hap waid.

original: Make two cherubim of hammered gold at the ends of the mercy seat,
translation: Wokim tupela kerubim longpela gol we ili hammerim na wokim ol i go long hap bilong sit bilong mercy.

original: one cherub on one end and one on the other, all made from one piece of gold.
translation: Wanpela kerabim long wanpela hap na wanpela long narapela hap, olgeta mekim pinis long wanpis gold.

original: And the cherubim are to have wings that spread upward, overshadowing the mercy seat. The cherubim are to face each other, looking toward the mercy seat.
translation: Na kerubim i mas have wing i go ap, ol i kukim daun long ples bilong mercy. Ol kerubim i mas lookim wan another, ol i kaivim olgeta long ples bilong mercy.

original: Set the mercy seat atop the ark, and put the Testimony that I will give you into the ark.
translation: Putim sip malumun i go antap long ark, na putim Testameni i go insait long ark.

original: And I will meet with you there above the mercy seat, between the two cherubim that are over the ark of the Testimony; I will speak with you about all that I command you regarding the Israelites.
translation: Na mipela bai kaikaim yu i go daun long merisi sit, bitwin tu cherubim i stap aunten long bokis bilong Testameni; mipela bai toktok wantaim yu long ol samting mipela laik givim instraksin long yu bilong mekim wanem long Israelait.

original: You are also to make a table of acacia wood two cubits long, a cubit wide, and a cubit and a half high.
translation: Yupela mas wokim dispela tebol long timbur bilong akasia, em i gat ukur long two cubit, waid long won cubit, na hait long wanpela cubit na hap.

original: Overlay it with pure gold and make a gold molding around it.
translation: Kambekim em wantaim golpela gol, na wokim banis gol namel long sip.

original: And make a rim around it a handbreadth wide and put a gold molding on the rim.
translation: Wokim wanpela edje long en, na edje em i mas wanpela han breth wid, na putim gilding molding long edje.

original: Make four gold rings for the table and fasten them to the four corners at its four legs.
translation: Wokim fourpela ring bilong gol na holim ol long four kona bilong tepul, long four leg bilong em.

original: The rings are to be close to the rim, to serve as holders for the poles used to carry the table.
translation: Ring ili wan i go klos long edgim, olsem na bai ol i servim olsem holde bilong stik, i usim long karim des.

original: Make the poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold, so that the table may be carried with them.
translation: Wokim bek na pole bilong deskal long akasia timba, kaverim olgeta long gol, bilong mekim deskal i karim igo long ol.

original: You are also to make the plates and dishes, as well as the pitchers and bowls for pouring drink offerings. Make them out of pure gold.
translation: Yu mas wokim plenu na diwa, olgeta em tasol, jip na bol long givim ofing bilong dring. Wokim ol long golpela we i pia.

original: And place the Bread of the Presence on the table before Me at all times.
translation: Putim Bred bilong Prezens i go long tebol bifor Mi olgeta taim.

original: Then you are to make a lampstand of pure, hammered gold. It shall be made of one piece, including its base and shaft, its cups, and its buds and petals.
translation: Yupela mas wokim wanpela lайт stand longpela gol we i kamap bikos man i paitim, em i mas wokim long wan peis, wantaim bes na shaft bilong em, kalab, knots na flawa bilong em.

original: Six branches are to extend from the sides of the lampstand—three on one side and three on the other.
translation: Sik branis i go longim sampela hap bilong laman, tripela long wanpela sait na tripela long narapela sait.

original: There are to be three cups shaped like almond blossoms on the first branch, each with buds and petals, three on the next branch, and the same for all six branches that extend from the lampstand.
translation: Tripela kap i luk olsem badam flauer i mas stap long branch nambawan, wankain na ol i gat bud na petal, tripela long branch nambatu, olsem nau long ol sikis branch ol i go raun raun long lampstand.

original: And on the lampstand there shall be four cups shaped like almond blossoms with buds and petals.
translation: Long lampstand, i gohet foa kap olsem blom bilong badam, wantaim bud na petal.

original: For the six branches that extend from the lampstand, a bud must be under the first pair of branches, a bud under the second pair, and a bud under the third pair.
translation: Long sikis branis i go pinis long lampstan, wan bud i mas stap anidas long first pea branis, wan bud i mas stap anidas long sekond pea, na wan bud i mas stap anidas long thard pea.

original: The buds and branches are to be all of one piece with the lampstand, hammered out of pure gold.
translation: Ol kap bilong painap na ol han bilong en olgeta i mas wan pes, wantaim lamen bilong lait, wokim ap long golpela gold.

original: Make seven lamps and set them up on the lampstand so that they illuminate the area in front of it.
translation: Mekim sampela lanpem seven, plantim ol i go long lanpstend, na givim lait long hap bilong em.

original: The wick trimmers and their trays must be of pure gold.
translation: Ol i save kisim wiks na ol plat bilong ol mas i kam long gol we em i pakpela tru.

original: The lampstand and all these utensils shall be made from a talent of pure gold.
translation: Lampstan na olgeta hap bilong em, ol i mas mekim long wan talen bilong golpura.

original: See to it that you make everything according to the pattern shown you on the mountain.
translation: Kisim hed long tok, na mekim olgeta samting olsem piksa i showim yu long maunten.

original: “You are to construct the tabernacle itself with ten curtains of finely spun linen, each with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and cherubim skillfully worked into them.
translation: Yu mas wokim haus lotu gen, wantaim ten kurten long finis silken, na blu, palet, na red iet, na cherubim i kamap strong long ol.

original: Each curtain shall be twenty-eight cubits long and four cubits wide—all curtains the same size.
translation: Nambis wan bilong kurtin i mas nambis twenty-eight han bilong arm i go long na nambis four han bilong arm i go waid — kurtin olgeta i mas sampela sais.

original: Five of the curtains are to be joined together, and the other five joined as well.
translation: Faiv bilong ol klet i mas jion togeta, na arapela faiv i mas jion tu.

original: Make loops of blue material on the edge of the end curtain in the first set, and do the same for the end curtain in the second set.
translation: Wokim luk blu long sait bilong karpet i go daun long set ples nau, na me kim olsem long set namba tu.

original: Make fifty loops on one curtain and fifty loops on the end curtain of the second set, so that the loops line up opposite one another.
translation: Wokim fifty lup long wanpela klet na fifty lup long las klet bilong sekend set, so ol lup i kamap oposan long ol yet.

original: Make fifty gold clasps as well, and join the curtains together with the clasps, so that the tabernacle will be a unit.
translation: Wokim fifty klos bilong gol, na jionim bikos long tok win, bilong mekim tabenakal i kamap wan.

original: You are to make curtains of goat hair for the tent over the tabernacle—eleven curtains in all.
translation: Yu mas wokim skurtim bilong haus long iba long haus tabernakol, na skurtim em i gat hel bilong goat, eleven skurtim olgeta.

original: Each of the eleven curtains is to be the same size—thirty cubits long and four cubits wide.
translation: Ol karpet eleven ol i masal i stap long wanem saiz - thirty cubit em i go long na foa cubit em i go wide.

original: Join five of the curtains into one set and the other six into another. Then fold the sixth curtain over double at the front of the tent.
translation: Jionim faiv bilong karati long wan set, na narpela sikis long narakapela set. Folim sixpela karati i go dupel long front bilong haus tambu.

original: Make fifty loops along the edge of the end curtain in the first set, and fifty loops along the edge of the corresponding curtain in the second set.
translation: Wokim fifty luk bilong loop long sait bilong kambet i go antap long set namba wan, na wokim fifty luk bilong loop long sait bilong kambet i go daun long set namba tu, em i kambet bilong winim.

original: Make fifty bronze clasps and put them through the loops to join the tent together as a unit.
translation: Wokim fifty klasp bilong bras, na putim ol i go insait long luk, inap jionim haus bilong tambuwan long tu, olsem wan unit.

original: As for the overlap that remains of the tent curtains, the half curtain that is left over shall hang down over the back of the tabernacle.
translation: Long hap stap i remain na i go daun bilong kurtin bilong tent, hap kurtin namba wan i hang daun bihain long haus lotu.

original: And the tent curtains will be a cubit longer on either side, and the excess will hang over the sides of the tabernacle to cover it.
translation: Na klostu bilong haus bai go long moa wan fut long hap sait na arapela hap, na plantii bai hang we long sait bilong kovaem haus lotu.

original: Also make a covering for the tent out of ram skins dyed red, and over that a covering of fine leather.
translation: Wokim kanu long haus bilong Spirit, na usim skins bilong ram i drai redd. Na bihain, wokim kanu gen long antap long dispela, na usim letha finis.

original: You are to construct upright frames of acacia wood for the tabernacle.
translation: Yu mas wokim frems stret na strong long diwai bilong akasia olsem banis bilong Haus Lotu.

original: Each frame is to be ten cubits long and a cubit and a half wide.
translation: Yupela mas putim wanpela frame olsem, em i go long ten kibit na wide em i go wide a hap kibit.

original: Two tenons must be connected to each other for each frame. Make all the frames of the tabernacle in this way.
translation: Tu tenon mas joine together long ol fraem, wokim ol fraem olgeta olsem.

original: Construct twenty frames for the south side of the tabernacle,
translation: Wokim twenti frens long sait bilong sais bilong templa,

original: with forty silver bases under the twenty frames—two bases for each frame, one under each tenon.
translation: Wantaim forti silva besis i stap aninit long twenty freme – tu besis long wanpela freme, wan besis aninit long wanpela tenon.

original: For the second side of the tabernacle, the north side, make twenty frames
translation: Long saond sait bilong not bilong tembol, wokim twenti femes.

original: and forty silver bases—two bases under each frame.
translation: Na foati silva bes – tu bes aninit long bikos tupela.

original: Make six frames for the rear of the tabernacle, the west side,
translation: Wokim sikis frames long bihain bilong tabenakol, sait long wes.

original: and two frames for the two back corners of the tabernacle,
translation: na tu pepepa bokis long tu kona bilong behain bilong tabenakul,

original: coupled together from bottom to top and fitted into a single ring. These will serve as the two corners.
translation: Ol i juntaim ol i kamap wantaim, long bun bilong en kale na go long top bilong en, na ol i pas long wanpela ring sais. Olsem nau, ol i servim olsem tu kona.

original: So there are to be eight frames and sixteen silver bases—two under each frame.
translation: I gat eightpela frem bilong en, na sixteenpela bes bilong silva - tu unda long dispela frem.

original: You are also to make five crossbars of acacia wood for the frames on one side of the tabernacle,
translation: Yu mas wokim faiv krosbar long diwai akasia bilong fram igo long wan sait bilong tabenakl.
