original: five for those on the other side, and five for those on the rear side of the tabernacle, to the west.
translation: Faiv bilong ol i go long sait narakai, na faiv bilong ol i stap long bihain bilong tabenakl, long wes.

original: The central crossbar in the middle of the frames shall extend from one end to the other.
translation: Krassbara bilong mitim long mitim bilong freme emas stret long wan en go long narak en.

original: Overlay the frames with gold and make gold rings to hold the crossbars. Also overlay the crossbars with gold.
translation: Kambekim em i go long frames wantaim gol, wokim rin wantaim gol olsem bai holim crossbars, na kambekim crossbars wantaim gol.

original: So you are to set up the tabernacle according to the pattern shown you on the mountain.
translation: Stapim tabenakol olsem piksa we yu lukim long maunten.

original: Make a veil of blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and finely spun linen, with cherubim skillfully worked into it.
translation: Wokim wanpela bel klos blu, paola, na red i pas long yar, wantaim linen i wak long finis, na kerubim i kamap strong long en.

original: Hang it with gold hooks on four posts of acacia wood, overlaid with gold and standing on four silver bases.
translation: Hanigim em wantaim hook bilong gol long foa post bilong diwai akasia, ol i kamapim olgeta wantaim gol, na em i stap long foa bek bilong silva.

original: And hang the veil from the clasps and place the ark of the Testimony behind the veil. So the veil will separate the Holy Place from the Most Holy Place.
translation: Na hangim vel bilong tabenakl long klasps, na putim ark bilong testamen bifo vel. Olsem na vel bai separetim ples holy long ples winim holy.

original: Put the mercy seat on the ark of the Testimony in the Most Holy Place.
translation: Putim sip blo grace long bus bilong tok tru insait ples bilong holide.

original: And place the table outside the veil on the north side of the tabernacle, and put the lampstand opposite the table, on the south side.
translation: Na putim tebol long ples i go long ausait bilong vil, long sait bilong not bilong tabenakel, na putim lampa long hap bilong tebol, long sait bilong saut.

original: For the entrance to the tent, you are to make a curtain embroidered with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and finely spun linen.
translation: Long entris bilong tent, yu mas mekim wanpela kambek i gat blu, paleta, na rekett kola, na linin i wokim finis.

original: Make five posts of acacia wood for the curtain, overlay them with gold hooks, and cast five bronze bases for them.
translation: Wokim fem klos bilong diwai bilong akasia long kurtan, kovarem olgeta wantaim huk bilong gol, na katim fem bes bilong bronzi bilong ol.

original: “You are to build an altar of acacia wood. The altar must be square, five cubits long, five cubits wide, and three cubits high.
translation: Yu mas wokim wanpela aitar long akasia timba. Aitar i mas be squar, em i gat hamas long five kibit, wide long five kibit, na high long three kibit.

original: Make a horn on each of its four corners, so that the horns are of one piece, and overlay it with bronze.
translation: Wokim wanpela han long olgeta foa kona bilong em, na han bilong em i stap antap long wan peis, kaverim em wantaim bronzi.

original: Make all its utensils of bronze—its pots for removing ashes, its shovels, its sprinkling bowls, its meat forks, and its firepans.
translation: Wokim olgeta hap bilong em long bronz — ol pot bilong kisim as bilong faia, ol speda bilong em, ol bol bilong waswas, ol piksa bilong katim mit, na ol pan bilong em long faia.

original: Construct for it a grate of bronze mesh, and make a bronze ring at each of the four corners of the mesh.
translation: Wokim em wanpela grile long mesh long bronzu, na wokim wanpela ring long bronzu long kona nibin bilong em.

original: Set the grate beneath the ledge of the altar, so that the mesh comes halfway up the altar.
translation: Putim gris aninit long hap bilong alta, na gris i go hap long alta, ili i kamap haf na haf.

original: Additionally, make poles of acacia wood for the altar and overlay them with bronze.
translation: Wokim stik bilong karamut long altan bilong ofa, na kaverim olgets long bronz, na stik bilong karamut em oli mak bilong diwai bilong akasia.

original: The poles are to be inserted into the rings so that the poles are on two sides of the altar when it is carried.
translation: Stik bilong karim alta bai go insait long ring, na stik bilong karim em i go daun long tupela sait bilong alta wén em i karim.

original: Construct the altar with boards so that it is hollow. It is to be made just as you were shown on the mountain.
translation: Wokim alti long bol na bord, na em i mas hul. Wokim olsem yu bin lukim long Maunten.

original: You are also to make a courtyard for the tabernacle. On the south side of the courtyard make curtains of finely spun linen, a hundred cubits long on one side,
translation: Yupela mas wokim ka long haus lotu bilong Yehova. Long sait bilong saut, yupela mas wokim kaltan long linen i wokim gutpela, em i gat hundred kibit lon.

original: with twenty posts and twenty bronze bases, and silver hooks and bands on the posts.
translation: Wantaim twentiespela post na twentiespela bes bronzi, na hook silva na banis long post.

original: Likewise there are to be curtains on the north side, a hundred cubits long, with twenty posts and twenty bronze bases, and with silver hooks and bands on the posts.
translation: Olsem tu, mas i gat kambek long hap sait bilong not, em i gat kunai kubiti, wantaim twenti stik na twenti bes bronze, na hook silva na band bilong stik i go long dispela.

original: The curtains on the west side of the courtyard shall be fifty cubits wide, with ten posts and ten bases.
translation: Karai bilong wes saiden long ples kot em bai go wide fifty kapik, wantaim ten post na ten pes.

original: The east side of the courtyard, toward the sunrise, is to be fifty cubits wide.
translation: Sait bilong east na kantri, i go longwei bilong san i kamap, em i mas fifty cubits waid.

original: Make the curtains on one side fifteen cubits long, with three posts and three bases,
translation: Wokim bilum long wanpela sait fifteen kyubits i go, wantaim tri pos na tri bes.

original: and the curtains on the other side fifteen cubits long, with three posts and three bases.
translation: Na karat bilong napol na apin em i stap fiftin kibit lon, wantaim tri pos na tri bes.

original: The gate of the courtyard shall be twenty cubits long, with a curtain embroidered with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and finely spun linen. It shall have four posts and four bases.
translation: Get bilong ka em i go long twenty cubit, wantaim klos embroidered long blu, paipa na red yarn, na linen i spinning gutpela. Em i mas havim foa post na foa pes.

original: All the posts around the courtyard shall have silver bands, silver hooks, and bronze bases.
translation: Olgeta post long ka long ples i mas havim banis silva, hook silva, na bes bronze.

original: The entire courtyard shall be a hundred cubits long and fifty cubits wide, with curtains of finely spun linen five cubits high, and with bronze bases.
translation: Em i go olgeta yard bilong em, em mas go nap long hundred cubit, na fifty cubit wide, na weti bilong klos finely spun i go long hap, limpi limpi, na bronzyang bilong em i go daun.

original: All the utensils of the tabernacle for every use, including all its tent pegs and the tent pegs of the courtyard, shall be made of bronze.
translation: Olgeta kain bilong ka bilong tabenakol long ol samting ya, wantaim na ol pinis bilong ten, na ol pinis bilong ka arias, bai ol i mekim ap long bronz.

original: And you are to command the Israelites to bring you pure oil of pressed olives for the light, to keep the lamps burning continually.
translation: Na yu mas givim komando long Israelit, oli bringim oil paiya na klia husat i kam long oliv pinis ol i kukim, long lait, olsem lamp igo i stap burn oltaim.

original: In the Tent of Meeting, outside the veil that is in front of the Testimony, Aaron and his sons are to tend the lamps before the LORD from evening until morning. This is to be a permanent statute for the Israelites for the generations to come.
translation: Long Haus Lotu, bifo veil we i stap fron long Testameni, Aron na ol pikinini bilong en oli mas kisim ka long lait bihain long Jehovah, frm evenin go long moning. Dispela lo bilong statit permanent long ol Israel, na long genarashon i kam bihain.

original: “Next, have your brother Aaron brought to you from among the Israelites, along with his sons Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar, to serve Me as priests.
translation: Nekis, kisim brother bilong yu Aaron i kam long yu, na ol pikinini bilong em, Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, na Ithamar, long ol pipol Israel, wok servisman long Mipela olsem minista.

original: Make holy garments for your brother Aaron, to give him glory and splendor.
translation: Makim klia bilong holigas long brata yumi Aron, givim em glori na klostari.

original: You are to instruct all the skilled craftsmen, whom I have filled with a spirit of wisdom, to make garments for Aaron’s consecration, so that he may serve Me as priest.
translation: Yu mas skulim olgeta wokman bilong save long wok, we mi fillim ol long spirit bilong save, ol i ken wokim klos bilong Aaron long taim bilong en i kamap bishop, na em i ken sarve Mipela olsem bishop.

original: These are the garments that they shall make: a breastpiece, an ephod, a robe, a woven tunic, a turban, and a sash. They are to make these holy garments for your brother Aaron and his sons, so that they may serve Me as priests.
translation: Em i kolos bilong ol: bilong kolim skina bilong brest, apron bilong prist, lovai, skit bilong woven, banti wantaim hed, na rop bilong bel. Ol i mas mekim despla kolos bilong halivim bilong Aron na ol pikinini bilong en, nas ol i ken wok olsem man bilong lotu long Me.

original: They shall use gold, along with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and fine linen.
translation: Oli usim gol, olsem na blu, paiple, na skarlet yarn, na finis linen.

original: They are to make the ephod of finely spun linen embroidered with gold, and with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn.
translation: Ol i mas wokim ephod long lain we i spin pisini, i gat kamo long gol, blu, palet, na skarlet yarn.

original: It shall have two shoulder pieces attached at two of its corners, so it can be fastened.
translation: Em i mas havim tu ples bilong skul ilong long tu kona bilong en, bilong em i ken kukim strong.

original: And the skillfully woven waistband of the ephod must be of one piece, of the same workmanship—with gold, with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and with finely spun linen.
translation: Na belt bilong ephod i mas kamap strong olsem em i wan peis, ol i wok long wanem samting - long gold, blu, palet, na ret yarn, na long linin i spinning gutpela.

original: Take two onyx stones and engrave on them the names of the sons of Israel:
translation: Kisim tu ston oniks, raitim nem bilong ol pikinini blo Israel long stap.

original: six of their names on one stone and the remaining six on the other, in the order of their birth.
translation: Nek six bilong ol i stap long wan ston, na arapela six i stap long narapela ston, ol i go daunbilo long rota bilong taim bilong ol i kam.

original: Engrave the names of the sons of Israel on the two stones the way a gem cutter engraves a seal. Then mount the stones in gold filigree settings.
translation: Kamautim nem bilong ol pikinini bilong Isrel long tupela ston olsem man i katim ston i kamautim sial. Pasim ston long hap bilong gol rop bilong pasim ston.

original: Fasten both stones on the shoulder pieces of the ephod as memorial stones for the sons of Israel. Aaron is to bear their names on his two shoulders as a memorial before the LORD.
translation: Klosim strongim ston tu olsem ston bilong memori long hap bilong sukul bilong efod, na Aaron i holim nem bilong pikinini bilong Israel long hap bilong sukul i go, olsem memori bifor LORD.

original: Fashion gold filigree settings
translation: Wokim gol long stil na katting long filigri.

original: and two chains of pure gold, made of braided cord work; and attach these chains to the settings.
translation: Na tuwei lain bilong gol we i kamap strong, ol i wokim long wok bilong windim rop i go raun; na husat i mas pasim desain chain long hap.

original: You are also to make a breastpiece of judgment with the same workmanship as the ephod. Construct it with gold, with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and with finely spun linen.
translation: Yu mas wokim bekpes bilong jusis olsem wok long epot. Wokim em wantaim gol, blu, palet, na redi, na linin we i kamap strong nau.

original: It must be square when folded over double, a span long and a span wide.
translation: Em mas kwadrat wen i kisim i go daunbek gen, bek gen, i go long wan span, na i go waid long wan span.

original: And mount on it a setting of gemstones, four rows of stones: In the first row there shall be a ruby, a topaz, and an emerald;
translation: Na katim antap long em wanpela seting blong ston pisini, foa lain blong ston: Long lain namba wan, yu mas putim rubi, topazi, na emerali;

original: in the second row a turquoise, a sapphire, and a diamond;
translation: Long nambatu ro, wan turquoise, wan sapphire, na wan diamond;

original: in the third row a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;
translation: Long tripa lain, wan jasin, wan aget, na wan ames;

original: and in the fourth row a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper. Mount these stones in gold filigree settings.
translation: Long namba foa ro, yu inam beril, oniks, na jaspis. Kam bekim dispela ston long gol na wokim ol i kamap finis long gol filigri seting.

original: The twelve stones are to correspond to the names of the sons of Israel, each engraved like a seal with the name of one of the twelve tribes.
translation: Ston twelev i mas go long nam bilong pikinini bilong Israel, wanwan i karam ap olsem sindaun bilong nem bilong wanpela tribe husat i go long twelv.

original: For the breastpiece, make braided chains like cords of pure gold.
translation: Wokim skar bilong brus, mekim ren kom olsem kord bilong gol i stap kuk.

original: You are also to make two gold rings and fasten them to the two corners of the breastpiece.
translation: Yupela mas wokim tupela ring bilong gol na pasim ol long tupela koner bilong banis bilong pris.

original: Then fasten the two gold chains to the two gold rings at the corners of the breastpiece,
translation: Na yusim twopela gold chain i go long Twopela gold ring we istap long konar bilong breaspis.

original: and fasten the other ends of the two chains to the two filigree settings, attaching them to the shoulder pieces of the ephod at the front.
translation: Na klosim nael i go long chain tupela, na josim pinis long wok bilong silva ilo katim na kisim pasin bilong dekorasin, na klosim long hap bilong ephod long fron.

original: Make two more gold rings and attach them to the other two corners of the breastpiece, on the inside edge next to the ephod.
translation: Wokim tupela moa ring bilong gol na holim ol long narapela tupela kona bilong pesbilong, long sait bilong insait, klostu long ephod.

original: Make two additional gold rings and attach them to the bottom of the two shoulder pieces of the ephod, on its front, near its seam just above its woven waistband.
translation: Wokim tu moa ring bilong gol na rokim ol long bodi bilong tu hap pilis bilong ephod, long front bilong en, klostu long hem bilong en, jus abovim banis bilong en bilong klos.

original: The rings of the breastpiece shall be tied to the rings of the ephod with a cord of blue yarn, so that the breastpiece is above the waistband of the ephod and does not swing out from the ephod.
translation: Ring bilong brespeis i go long ring bilong efod na ibin joinimapim wantaim blu yol, salim brespeis i stap antap long bel bilong efod, na i no inap go autsait long efod.

original: Whenever Aaron enters the Holy Place, he shall bear the names of the sons of Israel over his heart on the breastpiece of judgment, as a continual reminder before the LORD.
translation: Wanpela taim Aaron i go insait long Ples Bilong Saint, em i mas kisim nem bilong pikinini Israel long hap bilong em, olsem wanpela tok bilong memori long bifor LORD, long bilas bilong jusis.

original: And place the Urim and Thummim in the breastpiece of judgment, so that they will also be over Aaron’s heart whenever he comes before the LORD. Aaron will continually carry the judgment of the sons of Israel over his heart before the LORD.
translation: Putim Urim na Thummim i go insait long skarft bilong desisipn, na bai ol i stap long hap bilong Aaron, long taim em i kam bifo LOTU. Na Aaron bai karim desisipn bilong Israelites long han, long taim, bifo LOTU.

original: You are to make the robe of the ephod entirely of blue cloth,
translation: Yu mas wokim kus bilong ephod olsem blu klos tasol.

original: with an opening at its top in the center. Around the opening shall be a woven collar with an opening like that of a garment, so that it will not tear.
translation: I gat opening long top bilong en, na longsait long opening, i gat kolar bilong woven wantaim opening olsem klos, bilong em i no tear.

original: Make pomegranates of blue, purple, and scarlet yarn all the way around the lower hem, with gold bells between them,
translation: Wokim poinapal long olgeta hap bilong hem i go daun, na mekim ol i go naikis, yaani, blu, paipul, na yarn i stap redi, wantaim bel kol i stap biporm olgeta.

original: alternating the gold bells and pomegranates around the lower hem of the robe.
translation: Ol changim bel bilong gol na pomegranate long hap bilong skat bilong rokwe.

original: Aaron must wear the robe whenever he ministers, and its sound will be heard when he enters or exits the sanctuary before the LORD, so that he will not die.
translation: Aron mas kusim kaliko taim em i wok pastor, na saun bilong em bai i harim taim em i go insait ovasait long temple bifor GOD, olsem nau em nogat bai i dai.

original: You are to make a plate of pure gold and engrave on it as on a seal: HOLY TO THE LORD.
translation: Wokim wanpela plak bilong golpela we i paiawer, na karamapim ol leta long em olsem long seil: HOLI LONG LORD.

original: Fasten to it a blue cord to mount it on the turban; it shall be on the front of the turban.
translation: Klostuim long blu rop na putim i go antap long kapul bilong hevi, em bai stap long fron bilong kapul.

original: And it will be worn on Aaron’s forehead, so that he may bear the iniquity of the holy things that the sons of Israel consecrate with regard to all their holy gifts. It shall always be on his forehead, so that they may be acceptable before the LORD.
translation: Na em bai go long hevi bilong Aron, olesta em bekim bikimik long samting santing bilong God ol padi bilong Israel dairoim, na ol givim samting bilong God. Em bai i stap long hevi bilong en, olesta, na ol bai i stap gut long ai bilong LORD, pesem bicim tasol.

original: You are to weave the tunic with fine linen, make the turban of fine linen, and fashion an embroidered sash.
translation: Yu mas wivim tunik long linen finis, mekim turban long linen finis, na karamapim laplap bilong broka.

original: Make tunics, sashes, and headbands for Aaron’s sons, to give them glory and splendor.
translation: Mekim tunik, laplap, na heddres long Pikinini bilong Aron, olsem wanem bai givim ol glory na splenda.

original: After you put these garments on your brother Aaron and his sons, anoint them, ordain them, and consecrate them so that they may serve Me as priests.
translation: Bihaenim yu putim klos i go long brata Aron na pikinini bilong em, givim ol olian, tokautim ol long wok bilong prist, makim ol i hol, na wokim servis long mi olsem prist.

original: Make linen undergarments to cover their bare flesh, extending from waist to thigh.
translation: Wokim skarft bilong laine bilong kova flesh bilong ol narakai, stat long wei bilong belt na go inap long thigh.

original: Aaron and his sons must wear them whenever they enter the Tent of Meeting or approach the altar to minister in the Holy Place, so that they will not incur guilt and die. This is to be a permanent statute for Aaron and his descendants.
translation: Aron na ol pikinini bilong en mas wokim olsem na kirap long taim ol i go insait long Haus Bilong Miting o klostu long alta i go wark long servis long Ples Bilong Holiness, bilong ol no ken kisim giltri na i dai. Dispela em i lo bilong taim olta long Aron na ol descenden bilong en.

original: “Now this is what you are to do to consecrate Aaron and his sons to serve Me as priests: Take a young bull and two rams without blemish,
translation: Nau dispela em i go long yumi: yumi mas wokim konsekresen bilong Aaron na ol pikinini bilong em, makim ol holide wokim servis long Mipela olsem prist. Yumi mas kisim bulmakau i no gat birua yet na tu rams i no gat birua,

original: along with unleavened bread, unleavened cakes mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers anointed with oil. Make them out of fine wheat flour,
translation: Longsai bred bai ol i no gat yausim, keik i no gat yausim i mixim wantaim oil, na wafas i no gat yausim ol i anointim wantaim oil. Mekim ol gen long fine flauer bilong wheat.

original: put them in a basket, and present them in the basket, along with the bull and the two rams.
translation: Putim ol i go insait bilum, na bringim ol i kam insait bilum wantaim bulmakau na tu rams.

original: Then present Aaron and his sons at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting and wash them with water.
translation: Kisim Aaron na ol pikinini bilong em, presentim ol long entris bilong Haus bilong Miting, na wesim ol long wara.

original: Take the garments and clothe Aaron with the tunic, the robe of the ephod, the ephod itself, and the breastplate. Fasten the ephod on him with its woven waistband.
translation: Kisim ol klos, kovara Aaron wantaim tunik, rok bilong ephod, ephod em yet, na brestplet. Pasim ephod long en wantaim wesket we yumai.

original: Put the turban on his head and attach the holy diadem to the turban.
translation: Putim turban long hed bilong em na klostuam diadem holip long turban.

original: Then take the anointing oil and anoint him by pouring it on his head.
translation: Kisim oili bilong anointim, anointim em, na pila oili gen long hed bilong em.

original: Present his sons as well and clothe them with tunics.
translation: Bringim ol pikinini bilong en tu, na givim ol laplap long bodi bilong ol.

original: Wrap the sashes around Aaron and his sons and tie headbands on them. The priesthood shall be theirs by a permanent statute. In this way you are to ordain Aaron and his sons.
translation: Kamapim skaf solomon long Aaron na ol pikinini bilong en, na karamapim hedban long ol. Priesdhum bai bilong ol olsem lo bilong taim bilong oltaim. Olsem nau yu mas ordainim Aaron na ol pikinini bilong en.

original: You are to present the bull at the front of the Tent of Meeting, and Aaron and his sons are to lay their hands on its head.
translation: Yu mas kisim na karamapim bullok long hap bilong Tent blong Miting, na Aron na pikinini bilong em bai pasim han bilong ol long hed bilong em.

original: And you shall slaughter the bull before the LORD at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Yu mas kilim bullok long hap bilong LORD nambis long entris bilong Tent bilong Miting.

original: Take some of the blood of the bull and put it on the horns of the altar with your finger; then pour out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.
translation: Kisim sampela blod bilong bulmakau na putim i go long horn bilong alta wantaim finger bilong yu; olsem na pilipim aut ol blod i stap long bais bilong alta.

original: Take all the fat that covers the entrails and the lobe of the liver, and both kidneys with the fat on them, and burn them on the altar.
translation: Kisim olgeta graun i kamap long intrails bilong animal, lop bilong liver, na tu kidni bilong animal wantaim olgeta graun i stap long ol, na wokim bun long altaplis.

original: But burn the flesh of the bull and its hide and dung outside the camp; it is a sin offering.
translation: Bikim na kukim bikos bilong bulmakau, skin bilong en, na kakaruk bilong en, longwe na outsait bilong kamp; em i ofing bokis long sindaun.

original: Take one of the rams, and Aaron and his sons shall lay their hands on its head.
translation: Kisim wanpela bilong ol rama, na Aron na ol pikinini bilong en i mas putim han bilong ol long hed bilong em.

original: You are to slaughter the ram, take its blood, and sprinkle it on all sides of the altar.
translation: Yu mas kilim rambi, kisim blod bilong en, na sprinkim em long ol sait bilong alta.

original: Cut the ram into pieces, wash the entrails and legs, and place them with its head and other pieces.
translation: Kotim rami longpela i go hen, wosim inpela na lek, na putim ol i go wantaim hed na arapela kala.

original: Then burn the entire ram on the altar; it is a burnt offering to the LORD, a pleasing aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
translation: Bai yu kisim olgeta ram na rausim long alta; em i wanpela ofing bung long Jehovah, em i givim smel i swit moa, em i ofing we i pakim long paia long Jehovah.

original: Take the second ram, and Aaron and his sons are to lay their hands on its head.
translation: Kisim ram nambatu, na Aaron na pikinini bilong en i mas stap han bilong ol long hed bilong em.

original: Slaughter the ram, take some of its blood, and put it on the right earlobes of Aaron and his sons, on the thumbs of their right hands, and on the big toes of their right feet. Sprinkle the remaining blood on all sides of the altar.
translation: Iusim ram na kilim, kisim sampela blod bilong en, putim blod long tepa han bilong Aaron na ol pikinini bilong en, long finga numbwan bilong lima rait bilong ol, na long finga bik bilong lek rait bilong ol. Sprinkim blod i stap long ol sait bilong alta.

original: And take some of the blood on the altar and some of the anointing oil and sprinkle it on Aaron and his garments, as well as on his sons and their garments. Then he and his garments will be consecrated, as well as his sons and their garments.
translation: Na yu kisim sampela blod long alta na sampela oil blong anointing, na sprinkim em long Aaron na klos blong en, olsem na long ol sons blong en na klos blong ol. Na em bai i holim, na klos blong en, olsem na ol sons blong en na klos blong ol bai i holim tu.

original: Take the fat from the ram, the fat tail, the fat covering the entrails, the lobe of the liver, both kidneys with the fat on them, and the right thigh (since this is a ram for ordination),
translation: Kisim grese bilong ram, punda bilong grese, grese i kap long insait bilong ani, hap bilong lever, both kidney wantaim grese i stap long tupela, na rigt leg (long bikpela ordinance), olsem ram i go long ordinance.

original: along with one loaf of bread, one cake of bread made with oil, and one wafer from the basket of unleavened bread that is before the LORD.
translation: Longsait wanpela loaf bilong bret, wanpela kek bilong bret i mekim wantaim oili, na wanpela waf long basket bilong bret i no gat yaus bifora LORD.

original: Put all these in the hands of Aaron and his sons and wave them before the LORD as a wave offering.
translation: Putim olgeta long han bilong Aaron na pikinini bilong ol, na wipim ol i go bikosi long LORD olsem wipim ofa.

original: Then take them from their hands and burn them on the altar atop the burnt offering as a pleasing aroma before the LORD; it is an offering made by fire to the LORD.
translation: Kisim ol i go long han bilong ol, kaumim ol long alti, ofing bai i go daun long aisa, olsem smel i lukraiboi long lip bilong LORD, em i ofing we i mekim long paia long LORD.

original: Take the breast of the ram of Aaron’s ordination and wave it before the LORD as a wave offering, and it will be your portion.
translation: Kisim susu bilong ram we i stap long tainim pastor Aarona, na wipim em i go long ples bilong LORD olsem ofa bilong wipim, na em bai kamap gen long yu.

original: Consecrate for Aaron and his sons the breast of the wave offering that is waved and the thigh of the heave offering that is lifted up from the ram of ordination.
translation: Mekim ol i holim Apin na ol pikinini bilong en bret bilong ofing bai i go antap long ples we ol i ofim, na le bilong ofing bai i kisim antap long ples we ol i ofim husat i kam long ram bilong mekim prist.

original: This will belong to Aaron and his sons as a regular portion from the Israelites, for it is the heave offering the Israelites will make to the LORD from their peace offerings.
translation: Dispela bai belong na stap long Haron na ol pikinini bilong en olsem porisn bilong taim, long ol Israel, from we ol Israel bai givim na makim long LORD, ofa em i go antap long LORD, long peis ofing bilong ol.

original: The holy garments that belong to Aaron will belong to his sons after him, so they can be anointed and ordained in them.
translation: Ol klos bilong God i bilong Aron, bai ol i go long pikinini bilong en, na ol bai painim oili na kamap bishop long ol.

original: The son who succeeds him as priest and enters the Tent of Meeting to minister in the Holy Place must wear them for seven days.
translation: Susa kalabai i kam bihain long em olsem prist, na i go insait long Haus Bilong Miting wok servos long Ples Holy, em bai mas putim klos i wearim long weik sebengde.

original: You are to take the ram of ordination and boil its flesh in a holy place.
translation: Yu mas kisim rama bilong ordinance, na suim ben bilong em long hap graun.

original: At the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, Aaron and his sons are to eat the meat of the ram and the bread that is in the basket.
translation: Long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting, Aaron na ol pikinini bilong en ol i kaikai mit na bret i stap inside bilum.

original: They must eat those things by which atonement was made for their ordination and consecration. But no outsider may eat them, because these things are sacred.
translation: Oli mas kaikai ol samting long we i mekim peis bilong pimples long ordinesen na sanctifikesen bilong ol, tasol nogat man i kam long nait i kaikai ol dispela samting, bikos ol dispela samting em i stap strong bilong spirit.

original: And if any of the meat of ordination or any bread is left until the morning, you are to burn up the remainder. It must not be eaten, because it is sacred.
translation: Sapos samting bilong mit na bred bilong ordination i stap yet, yupela mas burnim olgeta i stap yet, ol i no ken kaikai, bikos em i samting sacred.

original: This is what you are to do for Aaron and his sons based on all that I have commanded you, taking seven days to ordain them.
translation: Olsem wanem yu mas mekim long Aaron na ol pikinini bilong em, long olgeta samting we mi tokim yu, nau yu mas ordinance ol i go long seven de, bilong ordainim ol.

original: Sacrifice a bull as a sin offering each day for atonement. Purify the altar by making atonement for it, and anoint it to consecrate it.
translation: Ofaim ol bulmakau long moninga bilong sin, purim alta em i go long stretim na mekim kisim bek long en, na givim oli long en konseratem.

original: For seven days you shall make atonement for the altar and consecrate it. Then the altar will become most holy; whatever touches the altar will be holy.
translation: Long seven de, yu mas mekim pekam peis bilong altare, na wosim em i holigren. Na bihain altare bai kamap holi tru; mipela i gat ol samting husat i tambuwan long altare, bai kamap holi.

original: This is what you are to offer regularly on the altar, each day: two lambs that are a year old.
translation: Ofa olsem taim bilong plan long alta, mipela mas bringen bek long dikeni de: tu lambis wanpela yia ol.

original: Offer one lamb in the morning and the other at twilight.
translation: Ofa wanpela lik lik long moning na namba tu long belo san.

original: With the first lamb offer a tenth of an ephah of fine flour, mixed with a quarter hin of oil from pressed olives, and a drink offering of a quarter hin of wine.
translation: Wanpela lamb em i kam first, na yu mas brukim tenth wanpela ephah bilong flour i gat kwaliti, mixim wantaim quarter hin bilong oliv oil pinis, na ofa bilong dring long quarter hin win.

original: And offer the second lamb at twilight with the same grain offering and drink offering as in the morning, as a pleasing aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
translation: Na givim sekend lamb long taem san i go daun, wantaim samting bilong kaikai ofing na dring ofing olsem moning, olsem smel i kamap strong na swit moa, ofing we i mekim long paia bilong LORD.

original: For the generations to come, this burnt offering shall be made regularly at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting before the LORD, where I will meet you to speak with you.
translation: Long olsem ol i kam bihain, ofa bisnis ya em i mas go we long taim long entris bilong Tenen blong Miting bifor LORD, we bilong ples em i bai yumi tok stret wantaim.

original: I will also meet with the Israelites there, and that place will be consecrated by My glory.
translation: Mi bai kamap long ol Pipol Israel long hap em, na ol bai save i stap long wei bilong glori.

original: So I will consecrate the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and I will consecrate Aaron and his sons to serve Me as priests.
translation: Mi bai makim ol i hol impas long Haus Bilong Miting na alta, na mi bai makim ol i hol impas long Aaren na ol pikinini bilong en ol i servisim mi olsem prist.

original: Then I will dwell among the Israelites and be their God.
translation: Bai mi stap klostu long ol Israel na bai mi kam bekim God bilong ol.

original: And they will know that I am the LORD their God, who brought them out of the land of Egypt so that I might dwell among them. I am the LORD their God.
translation: Na ol i save se mi em i Lord God bilong ol, we em i kam long han bilong mipela long lad Egypt, na mi kam stap wantaim ol. Mi em i Lord God bilong ol.

original: “You are also to make an altar of acacia wood for the burning of incense.
translation: Yu mas wokim wanpela alta long diwai bilong akasia, Alta ya, bai yu usim long banisim smel bilong prai.

original: It is to be square, a cubit long, a cubit wide, and two cubits high. Its horns must be of one piece.
translation: Em mas kamap squer, em i go long wan han bilong arm, em i go wide wan han bilong arm, na em i go high tu han bilong arm. Kande bilong animal bilong en ol i mas stap long wan peis.

original: Overlay with pure gold the top and all the sides and horns, and make a molding of gold around it.
translation: Kambekim longtaim wantaim golpela hap, saits, na horn, na wokim sharak na kisim gol i go raunim em.

original: And make two gold rings below the molding on opposite sides to hold the poles used to carry it.
translation: Wokim tupela ring bilong gol aninit long sait bilong kapis long hap bilong tu hap, bilong holim stik ol i usim long karim em.

original: Make the poles of acacia wood and overlay them with gold.
translation: Wokim na pem bilong diwai bilong akasia, na kisim gol na kivim sop bilong ol.

original: Place the altar in front of the veil that is before the ark of the Testimony—before the mercy seat that is over the Testimony—where I will meet with you.
translation: Puta alti i go long hap bilong veil, bifor ark bilong Testimoni, bifor sit bilong merisi we i stap ibric long Testimoni, wai yumi bai mitim na tok togeta.

original: And Aaron is to burn fragrant incense on it every morning when he tends the lamps.
translation: Na Aron i mas kisim smel gude olsem bus, burnim long en, long bai mornin, long taim em i wokim lamp.

original: When Aaron sets up the lamps at twilight, he must burn the incense perpetually before the LORD for the generations to come.
translation: Taim Aaron i putim lamp bilong en i go dae, em i mas kisim smel bilong incense long taim olgeta bifoa LORD, olsem wok bilong tumbuna, long genarason ol i kam.

original: On this altar you must not offer unauthorized incense or a burnt offering or grain offering; nor are you to pour a drink offering on it.
translation: Long dispela alta, yu no ken ofa insens we i no orait, ofa em i bung wantaim faia, ofa ka, na ofa wara; na yu no ken pia wara long en.

original: Once a year Aaron shall make atonement on the horns of the altar. Throughout your generations he shall make atonement on it annually with the blood of the sin offering of atonement. The altar is most holy to the LORD.”
translation: Wanpela taim long yia Aron i mas mekim peis long korn bilong alta. Long olgenarashon bung em i mas mekim peis long en long yia, yia wantaim bled bilong ofing bung na sin. Alta em i moa halow long LORD.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “When you take a census of the Israelites to number them, each man must pay the LORD a ransom for his life when he is counted. Then no plague will come upon them when they are numbered.
translation: Wanpela taem yu kisim kaunta long ol Israelites, nambautim ol, yu mas peim ransome long LORD bilong laip blong em wanken em i kamaut. Olsem, no ken disease i kam long ol taim yu nambautim ol.

original: Everyone who crosses over to those counted must pay a half shekel, according to the sanctuary shekel, which weighs twenty gerahs. This half shekel is an offering to the LORD.
translation: Ol pipel we i go pas, na i kamap long ol namba, yu mas pei hap shekel, olsem shekel bilong haiwe haus, we i gat twentieth gerah. Dispela hap shekel em i tok say long LORD, olsem ofa long temple, em i hap shekel olsem taksesen o sindikin.

original: Everyone twenty years of age or older who crosses over must give this offering to the LORD.
translation: Olgeta manmeri twenti yia na olsem oloda, husat i go pas, mas givim dispela ofing long LORD.

original: In making the offering to the LORD to atone for your lives, the rich shall not give more than a half shekel, nor shall the poor give less.
translation: Long wokim ofing long LORD bilong kisim bek yu yet, plaenti no ken givim planti moa long hap sikil, na nating no ken givim liklik.

original: Take the atonement money from the Israelites and use it for the service of the Tent of Meeting. It will serve as a memorial for the Israelites before the LORD to make atonement for your lives.”
translation: Kisim moni bilong pekpek bilong Pipol Israel na usim long wok bilong Haus Bilong Miting. Em bai i stap olsem ai bilong memori long pipol Israel bifor GOD, olsem na bai mekim pekpek long laip bilong yumi.

original: And the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tokim Moses,

original: “You are to make a bronze basin with a bronze stand for washing. Set it between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and put water in it,
translation: Yu mas wokim wanpela bekene long brozn wantaim stan long brozn bilong waswas. Yu putim i go bikos tumora long Haus Bilong Miting na alta, na putim wara inside.

original: with which Aaron and his sons are to wash their hands and feet.
translation: Wantaim dispela ol i mas wasim han na fel bilong ol, Aaron na pikinini bilong en.

original: Whenever they enter the Tent of Meeting or approach the altar to minister by presenting an offering made by fire to the LORD, they must wash with water so that they will not die.
translation: Wanpela taim ol i go insait long Haus Bilong Miting o kam antap long alta warkim servis olsem presentim ofing we i mekim olsem ai long LORD, ol i mas wasim skink bilong ol long wara, nogat ol i dai.

original: Thus they are to wash their hands and feet so that they will not die; this shall be a permanent statute for Aaron and his descendants for the generations to come.”
translation: Ol i mas wasim han na fet, bekos ol no ken dai; dispela em i go on oltaim, lo bilong statut long taim, long Aron na descendants bilong en genarason i kam bihain.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Take the finest spices: 500 shekels of liquid myrrh, half that amount (250 shekels) of fragrant cinnamon, 250 shekels of fragrant cane,
translation: Kisim spices namba wan: 500 shekels bilong myrrh ol i liklik wara, hap halftaim bilong dispela, em 250 shekels bilong cinnamon i smell gut, na 250 shekels bilong kaon tru i smell gut.

original: 500 shekels of cassia—all according to the sanctuary shekel—and a hin of olive oil.
translation: 500 shekel bilong kasia, olgeta strong long wei bilong shekel bilong ples priester, na wan hin bilong oil bilong oliv.

original: Prepare from these a sacred anointing oil, a fragrant blend, the work of a perfumer; it will be a sacred anointing oil.
translation: Prepaem long dispela wan spesal ol bilong anointim, miksasa blo smel gud, wok bilong man i mekim smel; dispela bai i stap olsem wan spesal ol bilong anointim.

original: Use this oil to anoint the Tent of Meeting, the ark of the Testimony,
translation: Usim oil bilong yupela long anointim Haus Bilong Miting, na bokis bilong Testimoni.

original: the table and all its utensils, the lampstand and its utensils, the altar of incense,
translation: Tebol na olgeta samting bilong em, lait stan na olgeta samting bilong em, alta bilong insens

original: the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils, and the basin with its stand.
translation: Alta bilong ofing bung na ol samting bilong em, na basin wantaim em santing.

original: You are to consecrate them so that they will be most holy. Whatever touches them shall be holy.
translation: Yu mas makim ol i holipela, nau ol bai i stap holi tru. Wanpela samting i kamap long ol, em bai i holi.

original: Anoint Aaron and his sons and consecrate them to serve Me as priests.
translation: Wokim sakrament long Aaron na ol pikinini bilong em, na mekim ol i redi long sarve Mipela olsem prist.

original: And you are to tell the Israelites, ‘This will be My sacred anointing oil for the generations to come.
translation: Yu mas tokim ol Pipol Israel, 'Oli bilong sanctus bilong mi, em i stap long genarason ol i kam.

original: It must not be used to anoint an ordinary man, and you must not make anything like it with the same formula. It is holy, and it must be holy to you.
translation: Ina mas no usim long givim oli man bilong klostu, yu no ken mekim sampela olsem long usim kaunsol nem. Em i halow, na em mas i halow long yu.

original: Anyone who mixes perfume like it or puts it on an outsider shall be cut off from his people.’”
translation: I mekim perfum olsem o i putim perfum long man i no bilong em, bikim ol i kirapim em long ol pipol bilong en.

original: The LORD also said to Moses, “Take fragrant spices—gum resin, onycha, galbanum, and pure frankincense—in equal measures,
translation: Papa God i tokim Mosis, “Kisim smel gude olsem spais – resin bilong diwai, onycha smel, galbanum smel, na frankincense smel – long olgeta samting, wan ais.

original: and make a fragrant blend of incense, the work of a perfumer, seasoned with salt, pure and holy.
translation: Wokim smel gude, olsem wok bilong man i mekim smel, i gat solwara, klin na hol.

original: Grind some of it into fine powder and place it in front of the Testimony in the Tent of Meeting, where I will meet with you. It shall be most holy to you.
translation: Pulim i go na mekim poraupowda, putim i go long hap bilong Tok Bilong Ol long Haus Bilong Miting, we bilong mi mekim tok igo long hap. Em bai i stap ol wei holiest tupela yumi.

original: You are never to use this formula to make incense for yourselves; you shall regard it as holy to the LORD.
translation: Yusim formula ya, yumi no ken wokim smel bilong yufala yet; yumi mas givim respek long em olsem samting holi long Lod.

original: Anyone who makes something like it to enjoy its fragrance shall be cut off from his people.”
translation: Wanpela man i wokim samting olsem, na bilong enji fragrans bilong em, em bai katim long ol pipol bilong en.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “See, I have called by name Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.
translation: "Luukim, mi kolim olsem nem Bezalel sambai bilong Uri, em sambai bilong Hur, bilong traibe bilong Juda."

original: And I have filled him with the Spirit of God, with skill, ability, and knowledge in all kinds of craftsmanship,
translation: Mi fillim em i go wantaim Speret bilong God, wantaim skil, abiliti, na save long ol samting we em i wark long han.

original: to design artistic works in gold, silver, and bronze,
translation: Long planim woks bilong at long gold, silva, na bronz.

original: to cut gemstones for settings, and to carve wood, so that he may be a master of every craft.
translation: Ol i ken katim ston bilong decorate, na ol i ken skulim timba, bilong em i kamap strong long olgeta kain wok.

original: Moreover, I have selected Oholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, as his assistant. I have also given skill to all the craftsmen, that they may fashion all that I have commanded you:
translation: Mi selektem Oholiab son bilong Ahisamach, blo tribe bilong Dan, olsem asisten bilong em. Mi givim skil long olgeta wokman, ol i ken mekim ol samting we mi tokim yu.

original: the Tent of Meeting, the ark of the Testimony and the mercy seat upon it, and all the other furnishings of the tent—
translation: Haus bilong Miting, bokis bilong Testimeni na ples bilong amnesti i stap antap long em, na ol samting bilong Haus bilong Miting —

original: the table with its utensils, the pure gold lampstand with all its utensils, the altar of incense,
translation: Tebol wantaim olgeta tupela samting bilong em, laitpepa bilong gol pura wantaim olgeta samting bilong em, alta bilong insens,

original: the altar of burnt offering with all its utensils, and the basin with its stand—
translation: Alta bilong ofing bung wantaim ol samting bilong wokim ofing, na balus bilong waswas wantaim lek bilong em —

original: as well as the woven garments, both the holy garments for Aaron the priest and the garments for his sons to serve as priests,
translation: Olsem na klos blong wei em i bin mekim, klos bilong halim long Aaron prist, na klos bilong pikinini bilong em ol i servis olsem prist.

original: in addition to the anointing oil and fragrant incense for the Holy Place. They are to make them according to all that I have commanded you.”
translation: Long olsem oil bilong anointim na smel gude long nus bilong Holi Ples. Ol i mas mekim ol olsem olgeta samting we mi bin tokim yu.

original: And the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tokim Moses,

original: “Tell the Israelites, ‘Surely you must keep My Sabbaths, for this will be a sign between Me and you for the generations to come, so that you may know that I am the LORD who sanctifies you.
translation: Tusim na long ol Israel, ‘Ol i mas save wai ples bilong mi, em i sindaun long mipela long genarations i kam bihain, na ol i save se em mi, LORD, yu puripim ol.

original: Keep the Sabbath, for it is holy to you. Anyone who profanes it must surely be put to death. Whoever does any work on that day must be cut off from among his people.
translation: Kipim Sabat, em i halow long yu. Husat i bagarapim em, bai i dai pinis. Husat i wok long dei, bai i katim long ol pipol bilong en.

original: For six days work may be done, but the seventh day is a Sabbath of complete rest, holy to the LORD. Whoever does any work on the Sabbath day must surely be put to death.
translation: Long sikis de, yu ken wok, tapi dei sevhen em i de Sabbath bilong paitim olgeta wok, em halim long LORD. Husat i mekim wok long dei bilong Sabbath, yasol bai em i kamap long dai.

original: The Israelites must keep the Sabbath, celebrating it as a permanent covenant for the generations to come.
translation: Olia Israel i mas holim Sabat, ol i selebreim em olsem wanpela ples kot bilong taim bai i go long ol genarasyon i kam bihain.

original: It is a sign between Me and the Israelites forever; for in six days the LORD made the heavens and the earth, but on the seventh day He rested and was refreshed.’”
translation: Em i sain bilong mi na Isrelait long taim olgeta; bikos long sikis de bilong mekim ol samting, LORD em i mekim heven na graun, tasol long de namba sevhen em i stap na kisim strong.

original: When the LORD had finished speaking with Moses on Mount Sinai, He gave him the two tablets of the Testimony, tablets of stone inscribed by the finger of God.
translation: Taim olsem LORD i winim tok bilong en wantaim Mosese long Maunt Sinay, na em i givim em tupela ston bilong Toksave, ston bilong kokim tok save, GOD i raitim long finga bilong en.

original: Now when the people saw that Moses was delayed in coming down from the mountain, they gathered around Aaron and said, “Come, make us gods who will go before us. As for this Moses who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has happened to him!”
translation: Tasol ol pipol i si Moses i bihain long kam daun from maunten, oli kam bikosim Aaron na tok, “Kam, mekim gog na dei bai go bifor mipela. Dispela Moses we i bringim mipela longan long bilong Ejip, yumi no save long em olsem wanem i kamap long en!”

original: So Aaron told them, “Take off the gold earrings that are on your wives and sons and daughters, and bring them to me.”
translation: Aron i tokim ol, “Kisim na rausim gol pkinini i stap long meri, pikinini man, na pikinini meri bilong yupela, na bringim ol i go long mi.”

original: Then all the people took off their gold earrings and brought them to Aaron.
translation: Olgeta manmeri kisim gol ring long ear na kisim long hap, na ol i kam bek long Aron.

original: He took the gold from their hands, and with an engraving tool he fashioned it into a molten calf. And they said, “These, O Israel, are your gods, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt!”
translation: Em i kisim gol na karim, na em i wokim ol i go bek long ston, na ol i kamap olsem kalv we i bin kukim. Na ol i tok, "Dispela, O Isrel, em i gots bilong yu, ol i karim yu long graun bilong Ijip!"

original: When Aaron saw this, he built an altar before the calf and proclaimed: “Tomorrow shall be a feast to the LORD.”
translation: Taim Aaron harim dispela, na em i bikim wanpela altar long kakaruk, na em i autim tok: “Tupela dei naba bai i kam na yumi olgeta bai go long kaikai bilong halepim Bikpela.”

original: So the next day they arose, offered burnt offerings, and presented peace offerings. And the people sat down to eat and drink, and got up to indulge in revelry.
translation: Na namba de bikos, ol i kamap, ol i bringim ofing we bilong bren na peis ofing. Na ol pipol i siddaun kaikai na dring, na ol i kirap go long ples bilong wankain pasin.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Go down at once, for your people, whom you brought up out of the land of Egypt, have corrupted themselves.
translation: Papa God i tokim Mosis, “Go daun nau yet, ol pipol we yu bringup long kantri bilong Ijip, ol i bagarap yet.

original: How quickly they have turned aside from the way that I commanded them! They have made for themselves a molten calf and have bowed down to it. They have sacrificed to it and said, ‘These, O Israel, are your gods, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt.’”
translation: Ol i tulim bek long wei na mi givim komando long ol! Ol makim molten kaf bilong ol yet, na ol klosim hed i go daun long en. Ol givim ofa long en, na ol tok olsem, 'Dispela, o Israel, em i god bilong yu, ol i bringim yu kam bek long kantri bilong Ijip.'

original: The LORD also said to Moses, “I have seen this people, and they are indeed a stiff-necked people.
translation: Papa God i tokim Mosis, “Mi laikim dispela pipol, na ol i pipol ol i stret nek, ol i no gat bel bilong harim.”

original: Now leave Me alone, so that My anger may burn against them and consume them. Then I will make you into a great nation.”
translation: Lusim mi, na inu bilong mi bai i kam antap long ol, na bai ol i dai, na mi bai mekim yu olsem nesen gret.

original: But Moses sought the favor of the LORD his God, saying, “O LORD, why does Your anger burn against Your people, whom You brought out of the land of Egypt with great power and a mighty hand?
translation: Moses kisim sot long bilong LORD God bilong en, olsem, "O LORD, walum ol i angre bilong yu long pipo bilong yu, olsem wanem yu bringim bek long kantri Ijip wantaim powa bilong bikpela na han bilong strong?"

original: Why should the Egyptians declare, ‘He brought them out with evil intent, to kill them in the mountains and wipe them from the face of the earth’? Turn from Your fierce anger and relent from doing harm to Your people.
translation: Ol Ijip bai tokim, ‘Em i kamautim ol go pinis, long nogut long tok, kilim ol long maunten na brisim ol long fas bilong graun’. Lusim ken long bungim bel, na i stap long was long mekim i no nap long Pipol bilong yu.

original: Remember Your servants Abraham, Isaac, and Israel, to whom You swore by Your very self when You declared, ‘I will make your descendants as numerous as the stars in the sky, and I will give your descendants all this land that I have promised, and it shall be their inheritance forever.’”
translation: Rimembirim servant bilong yu, Abraham, Aisak, na Isrel, olsem yu promis long yu yet, Yu tok olsem: 'Mi go wokim pikinini bilong yu olsem plenti olsem sta bilong heven, na mi go givim pikinini bilong yu olgeta graun ya, na bai ol ikaan inairitans bilong ol long taim ol ivory.'

original: So the LORD relented from the calamity He had threatened to bring on His people.
translation: Na Bikpela i kam bek gen long dispela hevi tok, em i bin tok long kisim bek i go long ol pipol bilong Em.

original: Then Moses turned and went down the mountain with the two tablets of the Testimony in his hands. They were inscribed on both sides, front and back.
translation: Na Mosis i turnim na i go daun long mauntin, wantaim tupela pilakai bilong Toksave i holim long han bilong en. Ol i bin raitim long hap tasol, agens long fron na bek.

original: The tablets were the work of God, and the writing was the writing of God, engraved on the tablets.
translation: Tepis i wok bilong God, na ripot i ripot bilong God, i kamap long tepis.

original: When Joshua heard the sound of the people shouting, he said to Moses, “The sound of war is in the camp.”
translation: Taim Yoshua harim saut bilong ol pipol i save kalap, em i tokim Mosis, “Saut bilong faet i stap insait long kanu.”

original: But Moses replied: “It is neither the cry of victory nor the cry of defeat; I hear the sound of singing!”
translation: Moses i tokim ol: “Em i no krai bilong win, na em i no krai bilong lus; mi harim saun bilong sing!”

original: As Moses approached the camp and saw the calf and the dancing, he burned with anger and threw the tablets out of his hands, shattering them at the base of the mountain.
translation: Mosis i go klostu long kaem na lukim bikpela kal bilong gol we ol pipol i wokim olsem idol, na ol i dans, em i birua nogut tru, na i kisim Ten Komandmen na rausim long han bilong en, na i brukim ol long bun bilong maunten.

original: Then he took the calf they had made, burned it in the fire, ground it to powder, and scattered the powder over the face of the water. Then he forced the Israelites to drink it.
translation: Na em i kisim kal ol i mekim, sunim i go long paia, krabim i go daun olsem powda, tromwe powda igo long win, na rausim Israelites i dring.

original: “What did this people do to you,” Moses asked Aaron, “that you have led them into so great a sin?”
translation: “Ol i mekim wanem long yu, Moses askim Aaron, dat yu bringim ol pipol long go long bikpela sin blong ol?”

original: “Do not be enraged, my lord,” Aaron replied. “You yourself know that the people are intent on evil.
translation: “No ken slip long bel, papa bilong mi,” Aaron i tok. “Yu yet save olsem, ol pipol i laik mekim ol samting nogut.”

original: They told me, ‘Make us gods who will go before us. As for this Moses who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has happened to him!’
translation: Ol i tokim mi, 'Mekim gog na dei bai go bikosim yumi.' Long dispela Mosese we i kamap long yumi long kantri bilong Ijip, yumi no save long em, wat i kamap long en.

original: So I said to them, ‘Whoever has gold, let him take it off,’ and they gave it to me. And when I threw it into the fire, out came this calf!”
translation: Mi tokim ol long dispela, 'Nambawan husat i gat gold, im mas i kisim i go pas,' na ol i givim mi. Na taim mi pilim em i go insait paia, na Dispela pikinini bulmakau i kam aut!

original: Moses saw that the people were out of control, for Aaron had let them run wild and become a laughingstock to their enemies.
translation: Moses harim ol i si pemai ol pipol i go longwei, wantaim Aaron im go pasim ol, na ol i go long longwei, na ol i kamap olpela stori long eni.

original: So Moses stood at the entrance to the camp and said, “Whoever is for the LORD, come to me.” And all the Levites gathered around him.
translation: Na Moses i stap klostu long entris bilong ples bilong ol, na em i tok, "Hu i stap wantaim Bikpela, kam bek long me." Na Ol Levai ol i kam raunem em.

original: He told them, “This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: ‘Each of you men is to fasten his sword to his side, go back and forth through the camp from gate to gate, and slay his brother, his friend, and his neighbor.’”
translation: Em i tokim ol, “LORD, Bikpela God bilong Israel, i tok: ‘Yupela man, yupela mas isap long sua i go long sait bilong en, go bek gen na go gen bek long ples kamp, from geit long geit, na kilim brata bilong yu, poroman bilong yu, na nephew bilong yu.’”

original: The Levites did as Moses commanded, and that day about three thousand of the people fell dead.
translation: Ol Levit i mekim olsem Musa i tokim, na long hap tripela tasen bilong ol pipol i dai pinis.

original: Afterward, Moses said, “Today you have been ordained for service to the LORD, since each man went against his son and his brother; so the LORD has bestowed a blessing on you this day.”
translation: Na Moses i tok igo, "Tude yapla i kamap ol man i servis long Jehovah, long nen igat i go bek gen long pikinini na brata bilong en; olsem nau Jehovah i givim yupla blesing dispela de."

original: The next day Moses said to the people, “You have committed a great sin. Now I will go up to the LORD; perhaps I can make atonement for your sin.”
translation: Dia nambawan Mosis i tokim ol pipol, “Yupela i mekim bikpela sin. Nau mi go ap long Bikpela; em ina posibol bai mi ken bekim peis bilong yupela sin.”

original: So Moses returned to the LORD and said, “Oh, what a great sin these people have committed! They have made gods of gold for themselves.
translation: Moses i go bek gen long LORD na tokim olsem, "O, dispela bikpela sin ol pipol i mekim! Ol i wokim god bilong gol, na ol i mekim em i kamap olgeta god bilong ol."

original: Yet now, if You would only forgive their sin.... But if not, please blot me out of the book that You have written.”
translation: Sapos yu hariap long forgivim sin bilong ol... Baimbai, sapos nogat, rausim mi long Buk Bilong Laif we yu wriim.

original: The LORD replied to Moses, “Whoever has sinned against Me, I will blot out of My book.
translation: Papa God i tokim Mosis, “Husai i gat bikim sin long Mi, mi bai rausim em long Buk bilong Mi.”

original: Now go, lead the people to the place I described. Behold, My angel shall go before you. But on the day I settle accounts, I will punish them for their sin.”
translation: Nau go na lidim ol pipol i go long ples we mi tok aut. Lukim, einjel olsem mesenja bilong God bai i go bifo yu. Tasol long de mi bai kisim bek moni, mi bai givim penati long ol long sin blong ol.

original: And the LORD sent a plague on the people because of what they had done with the calf that Aaron had made.
translation: Na Papa God i salim sik long ol pisin bilong ol samting ol i mekim wantaim kalv we Aaron i wokim.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Leave this place, you and the people you brought up out of the land of Egypt, and go to the land that I promised to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob when I said, ‘I will give it to your descendants.’
translation: Na Lod i tokim Mosis olsem, "Lusim ples ia, yu na ol pipol we yu kisim long kantri Ijip, na go long kantri we mi promis long Abraham, Aisak, na Jakob, we mi tok olsem, 'Mi bai givim long pikinini bilong yu'."

original: And I will send an angel before you, and I will drive out the Canaanites, Amorites, Hittites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites.
translation: Na mi bai sendim enjel bipo yu, na mi bai drivaam aut Kanani, Amori, Hiti, Perisi, Hivi, na Jebusi.

original: Go up to a land flowing with milk and honey. But I will not go with you, because you are a stiff-necked people; otherwise, I might destroy you on the way.”
translation: Go ap long graun bilong promis, we grain bai i flowe long milk na honey. Tasol mi no go wantaim yu, bikos yu ol i stap olsem pipel we elpela nek strong; inap mi harim yu long rot, na belak mi bagarapim yu.

original: When the people heard these bad tidings, they went into mourning, and no one put on any of his jewelry.
translation: Taim ol pipol harim dispela tok bilong hevi, ol i go long mosin, na nogat wanpela i putim apim jewelri bilong en.

original: For the LORD had said to Moses, “Tell the Israelites, ‘You are a stiff-necked people. If I should go with you for a single moment, I would destroy you. Now take off your jewelry, and I will decide what to do with you.’”
translation: Bikos LORD i tokim Moses olsem, "Yu tokim pisin Israel olsem, 'Yupela i pikinini harim long nek, nogut tru. Sapos mi go wantaim yupela long taim wanpela, mi bai bagarapim yupela.' Nau rausim ol jewellery bilong yupela, na mi bai desisim wanem mi ken mekim long yupela."

original: So the Israelites stripped themselves of their jewelry from Mount Horeb onward.
translation: Ol Israel i kisim of jeweli bilong ol long Maunten Horeb i go inap long taim bung.

original: Now Moses used to take the tent and pitch it at a distance outside the camp. He called it the Tent of Meeting, and anyone inquiring of the LORD would go to the Tent of Meeting outside the camp.
translation: Na Moses i kisim Haus Tikim na putim i go longwe olsem long distans ouside long ples kamp. Em i kollim em olsem Haus Tikim, na husat i laik askim tok bilong LORD i go long Haus Tikim ouside long ples kamp.

original: Then, whenever Moses went out to the tent, all the people would stand at the entrances to their own tents and watch Moses until he entered the tent.
translation: Na, taim Muso i go aut long haus tikai bilong en, ol pipel i stap long entris bilong haus tikai bilong ol yet, ol i wachim Muso til em i go insait long haus tikai.

original: As Moses entered the tent, the pillar of cloud would come down and remain at the entrance, and the LORD would speak with Moses.
translation: Moses i go insait long haus bilong praiz, pila bilong klod i kam daun na stap klostu long entris, na LORD bai tokim Moses.

original: When all the people saw the pillar of cloud standing at the entrance to the tent, they would stand up and worship, each one at the entrance to his own tent.
translation: Wanpela taim ol pipol i lukim kumul bilong smok bilong klaut i stap long entris bilong haus bilong hap, ol i stap na i wosip, nambauten wan long entris bilong haus bilong hap bilong en.

original: Thus the LORD would speak to Moses face to face, as a man speaks to his friend. Then Moses would return to the camp, but his young assistant Joshua son of Nun would not leave the tent.
translation: Bikpela i stap tokim Mosis marasin long marasin, olsem wan man i tokim narapela man wantaim bilong en. Na Mosis i go bek long ka, tasol Joshua pikinini bilong Nun i no lusim haus tik.

original: Then Moses said to the LORD, “Look, You have been telling me, ‘Lead this people up,’ but You have not let me know whom You will send with me. Yet You have said, ‘I know you by name, and you have found favor in My sight.’
translation: Na Moses i tokim LORD, "Susu! Yu bin tokim mi olsem, 'Kisim ples na i kam antap,' tapi yu no givim mi save long husat yu bai sendim go wantaim mi. Yet yu bin tokim olsem, 'Mi save nau yu we yu kolim nem bilong yu,' na yu lukim mi gut long sait bilong yu."

original: Now if indeed I have found favor in Your sight, please let me know Your ways, that I may know You and find favor in Your sight. Remember that this nation is Your people.”
translation: Sapos tru, mi finisim favore long ai bilong yu, Givim mi gutpela tok bilong yu, soim mi rot bilong yu, na mi ken i save long yu, Givim mi gutpela tok bilong yu. Mingat ol, nesen ia i narapela pisin bilong yu.

original: And the LORD answered, “My Presence will go with you, and I will give you rest.”
translation: Na Papa God i ansa, “Presens bilong mi bai go wantaim yu, na mi bai givim yu ripos.”

original: “If Your Presence does not go with us,” Moses replied, “do not lead us up from here.
translation: “Sapos Presence bilong yu no i kam wantaim mipela,” Mosis i tokim, “no lingim mipela go apo long hia.”

original: For how then can it be known that Your people and I have found favor in Your sight, unless You go with us? How else will we be distinguished from all the other people on the face of the earth?”
translation: Olsem wanem nau bai mipela i save sei, ol bikpela hamamas long ai bilong Yu i stap long us, mipela na yu, yupela kam wantaim mipela? Nogat, mipela no inap i luk olsem em i spesal long ai bilong yu, mipela na ol narapela pisin long fas bilong graun.

original: So the LORD said to Moses, “I will do this very thing you have asked, for you have found favor in My sight, and I know you by name.”
translation: Papa God i tokim Mosis, "Mi bai mekim dispela wok yet yu bin askim, bikos yu kamap gut long ai bilong mi, na mi save nem bilong yu."

original: Then Moses said, “Please show me Your glory.”
translation: Na Moses i tok olsem, "Plez, yu showim mi glori bilong yu."

original: “I will cause all My goodness to pass before you,” the LORD replied, “and I will proclaim My name—the LORD—in your presence. I will have mercy on whom I have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion.”
translation: “Mi bai bringim ol gupela tok bilong mi i go long yu,” Bikpela i tok, “na mi bai talem nem bilong mi — Bikpela — long ples bilong yu. Mi bai givim kros long wanpela i laik, na mi bai mekim bel hesi long wanpela i laik.”

original: But He added, “You cannot see My face, for no one can see Me and live.”
translation: Em i kam bek long tok, “Yu no ina save lukim pes bilong Mi, nogat man i ken lukim Mi na i stap.”

original: The LORD continued, “There is a place near Me where you are to stand upon a rock,
translation: Papa God i go yet, “I gat ples nambis nearim mi we bilong stap antap long wanpela rok.”

original: and when My glory passes by, I will put you in a cleft of the rock and cover you with My hand until I have passed by.
translation: Na wanpela taim glori bilong mi i go pas, mi go putim yu insait long rok i gat hole, na mi go kisim han bilong mi i kaivim yu, until mi go pas na stap.

original: Then I will take My hand away, and you will see My back; but My face must not be seen.”
translation: Na bai mi kisim han bilong mi i go, na yu bai lukim behain bilong mi; tasol faes bilong mi i no ken kukim.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Chisel out two stone tablets like the originals, and I will write on them the words that were on the first tablets, which you broke.
translation: Bikpela i tokim Mosis, “Kam beksaitim tuwe bilong ston tabale olsem orijinal, na mi bai raitim long dispela wods ol i stap long ston tabale birua, we yu hammarm long em.”

original: Be ready in the morning, and come up on Mount Sinai to present yourself before Me on the mountaintop.
translation: Bere na moning i redi, kam long antap long Maunt Sinaya, na yu yet kisim yu yet long bifo mi long topp long mauntaintop.

original: No one may go up with you; in fact, no one may be seen anywhere on the mountain—not even the flocks or herds may graze in front of the mountain.”
translation: Nogat man i go ap long yu; tru olsem, nogat even man i kam daun na i stap long maunten, na nogat even ol pikinini animal na ol bulmakau i ken kaikai gras long sait bilong maunten.

original: So Moses chiseled out two stone tablets like the originals. He rose early in the morning, and taking the two stone tablets in his hands, he went up Mount Sinai as the LORD had commanded him.
translation: Na Moses i wailisim aut tu tabla bilong ston olsem dispela tabla bilong ston i bin go bifo. Em i kamap erli long moning, na em i kisim tu tabla bilong ston i go antap long Maunt Sinai olsem Papa bilong olgeta i bin tokim em long tingting.

original: And the LORD descended in a cloud, stood with him there, and proclaimed His name, the LORD.
translation: Na Bikpela i kam daun olsem ren na kukim, i stap wantaim em, na ol i tisaunem nem bilong Em, Bikpela.

original: Then the LORD passed in front of Moses and called out: “The LORD, the LORD God, is compassionate and gracious, slow to anger, abounding in loving devotion and faithfulness,
translation: Bikpela God LORD i go pas long front bilong Moses na em i singaut: “Bikpela God LORD, em i gat gutpela hati na em i amamas, i no quick long bungim bel, em i gat planti lavin liklik na strongpela bilip,

original: maintaining loving devotion to a thousand generations, forgiving iniquity, transgression, and sin. Yet He will by no means leave the guilty unpunished; He will visit the iniquity of the fathers on their children and grandchildren to the third and fourth generations.”
translation: I holim lovin na kisim i gat hatwok long taim, forgivim ol samting nogut, ol birua, na sin. Tasol em i no luskim ol i gat skul nau, bai penati i kam bekim long ol. Em i kisim bekim ol samting nogut bilong papa na mama i go daun long pikinini, nogat wanpela kain, long tri na foa genarashon i go bek.

original: Moses immediately bowed down to the ground and worshiped.
translation: Mosese raitim i go daun long graun na i wosip.

original: “O Lord,” he said, “if I have indeed found favor in Your sight, my Lord, please go with us. Although this is a stiff-necked people, forgive our iniquity and sin, and take us as Your inheritance.”
translation: “Papa bilong olgeta,” em i tokim, “mi finis findim gutpela hariap long ai bilong yu, Papa bilong mipela, kam wanpela wantaim mipela. Ol man i stap stronghed long ol tetel bilong ol, forgivim ol sin na oganisa bilong mipela, na tokim mipela olsem pikinini bilong yu.”

original: And the LORD said, “Behold, I am making a covenant. Before all your people I will perform wonders that have never been done in any nation in all the world. All the people among whom you live will see the LORD’s work, for it is an awesome thing that I am doing with you.
translation: Na LORD i tok, "Behold, mi wokim pakt. Bifoa ol pipol bilong yu, mi meikim wondas we neva bin mekim befoa long eni nesen long warld. Ol pipol we yu stap wantaim bai lukim wok bilong LORD, bikos em i wankain samting bikpela we mi meikim wantaim yu."

original: Observe what I command you this day. I will drive out before you the Amorites, Canaanites, Hittites, Perizzites, Hivites, and Jebusites.
translation: Lukim ol samting we mi givim yu tude. Mi bai drivaibaut ol i go bifor yu: Ol Amoraitis, Ol Kanaanitis, Ol Hitaitis, Ol Perizitis, Ol Hivitis, na Ol Jebusitis.

original: Be careful not to make a treaty with the inhabitants of the land you are entering, lest they become a snare in your midst.
translation: Bai yu tokaut na wokim pinis pinis treaty wantaim ol pipol i stap long lain yu i go insait, kalabus ol bai i no kamapim trap long yu.

original: Rather, you must tear down their altars, smash their sacred stones, and chop down their Asherah poles.
translation: Yupela mas rausim alta bilong ol, brukim ston bilong spirut bilong ol, na katim daun polo bilong Asherah bilong ol.

original: For you must not worship any other god, for the LORD, whose name is Jealous, is a jealous God.
translation: Yu no ken worshipim god narapela, bikos LORD, we usai i kolim nem bilong em Jealous, em i God i gat jelos, na em i wanpela God i triu, we i no gat narapela.

original: Do not make a covenant with the inhabitants of the land, for when they prostitute themselves to their gods and sacrifice to them, they will invite you, and you will eat their sacrifices.
translation: No wokim pakt wantaim ol pipol bilong kantri, bikos long taim ol i go bek long ol kastom bilong ol, na ol i servisim ol geta bilong ol, ol bai bringim ofa long ol, tupela i askim yu kam, na yu kaikai ol samting ol i bringim ofa.

original: And when you take some of their daughters as brides for your sons, their daughters will prostitute themselves to their gods and cause your sons to do the same.
translation: Na em bai yu kisim ol meri bilong ol long we go bride bilong pikinini bilong yu, ol meri bilong ol yet bai ol i lusim skina bilong ol yet long dek ol poro god bilong ol, na bai ol i mekim pikinini bilong yu yet tu ol i marit long ol narapela lotu, na bagarapim ol hevi bilong ol i go antap long ol samting bodi.

original: You shall make no molten gods for yourselves.
translation: Yupela no ken mekim bagarap god bilong aiwara long yuself.

original: You are to keep the Feast of Unleavened Bread. For seven days at the appointed time in the month of Abib, you are to eat unleavened bread as I commanded you. For in the month of Abib you came out of Egypt.
translation: Yu mas holim Kaen Dei Blong Bred Nambawan. Long mun blong Abib, yu mas kaikai bred nambawan long seven de, olsem mi bin tokim yu long taim we mi bin appointim. Bikos long mun blong Abib, yu kam aut long Egip.

original: The first offspring of every womb belongs to Me, including all the firstborn males among your livestock, whether cattle or sheep.
translation: Pikinini nambawan bilong bek na bek, ol man pikinini nambawan bilong bulmakau na sip, i kam long mi, wantaim olgeta man pikinini nambawan bilong ol kindi busna.

original: You must redeem the firstborn of a donkey with a lamb; but if you do not redeem it, you are to break its neck. You must redeem all the firstborn of your sons. No one shall appear before Me empty-handed.
translation: Yupela mas baim bek pikinini donki i kam first long ol na usim lamb. Sapos yu no baim bek, olsem yu mas kilim nek bilong en. Yupela mas baim bek olgeta pikinini i kam first long ol yupela man. Nogat man i mas kam bifor mi na han bilong en i stap klos.

original: Six days you shall labor, but on the seventh day you shall rest; even in the seasons of plowing and harvesting, you must rest.
translation: Sikis dei yu ken wokabaut, bai sei dei namba seven, yu mas stap Slip long ples; nau long taim bilong kaunkaun bilong planim na kakaruk, yu mas stap Slip.

original: And you are to celebrate the Feast of Weeks with the firstfruits of the wheat harvest, and the Feast of Ingathering at the turn of the year.
translation: Yu mas rejoisim Fest bilong Wiks wantaim ka moning bilong harves bilong whea, na yu mas rejoisim Fest bilong Kamdaun i go long taim yia i wokabaut.

original: Three times a year all your males are to appear before the Lord GOD, the God of Israel.
translation: Tripe taim long yia, ol man husat i mas kam ap long bifoa Lod God, God bilong Israel.

original: For I will drive out the nations before you and enlarge your borders, and no one will covet your land when you go up three times a year to appear before the LORD your God.
translation: Mi bai driimautim ol nesen bifor yu na mi bai waidim kauntri bilong yu, na nogat man i save jalim lAIN bilong yu wen yu go ap tripela taim long yia long lukim Bikpela LORD God bilong yu.

original: Do not offer the blood of a sacrifice to Me along with anything leavened, and do not let any of the sacrifice from the Passover Feast remain until morning.
translation: Yu no ken givim blod bilong sakrifis long mi wantaim samting i gat ka long bun, na yu no ken lusim sakrifis i stap yet long moning long Kaen Dei bilong Pasaka.

original: Bring the best of the firstfruits of your soil to the house of the LORD your God. You must not cook a young goat in its mother’s milk.”
translation: Kisim gutpela ka bilong ofa bilong fresmoning na bringim i go long haus bilong LORD God bilong yu. Yu no ken kukim kid bilong goat long susu bilong mama.

original: The LORD also said to Moses, “Write down these words, for in accordance with these words I have made a covenant with you and with Israel.”
translation: Papa God i tokim Mosis, “Raitim daon dispela wod, bikos long dispela wod olsem laik mi bin mekim agriemento wantaim yu na wantaim Israel.”

original: So Moses was there with the LORD forty days and forty nights without eating bread or drinking water. He wrote on the tablets the words of the covenant—the Ten Commandments.
translation: Na Mususi i stap wantaim LORD long forti de na forti nait, bai hem i no kaikai bret nau dring wara. Hem i raitim ol wod bilong kovenan, Ten Komanda, long tiobel.

original: And when Moses came down from Mount Sinai with the two tablets of the Testimony in his hands, he was unaware that his face had become radiant from speaking with the LORD.
translation: Na Moses i kam daun long Maunt Sinaya wantaim tupela pilakai bilong Toksave long han bilong en, i no save long en tasol, em face bilong en i kamap birua olsem nau long bihainim tokim olsem long LORD, God.

original: Aaron and all the Israelites looked at Moses, and behold, his face was radiant. And they were afraid to approach him.
translation: Aron na ol pipol bilong Israel i lukim Moses, na lukim, face bilong em i brikti. Na ol i bikim afraid long go klostu long em.

original: But Moses called out to them; so Aaron and all the leaders of the congregation returned to him, and Moses spoke to them.
translation: Mosese harim i go bek long ol; Aron na ol bikpela man bilong kongres i kam bek gen, na Mosese tokim ol.

original: And after this all the Israelites came near, and Moses commanded them to do everything that the LORD had told him on Mount Sinai.
translation: Na bihaen long dispela, olgeta Pipol Israel kam klostu, na Mosis i givim ol tok instruct long ol olsem GOD i tokim em long Maun Sinay.

original: When Moses had finished speaking with them, he put a veil over his face.
translation: Mosis finisim tok bilong en, na em i kisim wanpela laplap i go antap long pes bilong en.

original: But whenever Moses went in before the LORD to speak with Him, he would remove the veil until he came out. And when he came out, he would tell the Israelites what he had been commanded,
translation: Na bai wanpela taim Moses i go insait bifor LORD, em inap tokim bek long Em, na em kisim wei bilum i go. Na em i kam aut, orait em talem long Israelites olgeta samting we em i bin givim tok long en.

original: and the Israelites would see that the face of Moses was radiant. So Moses would put the veil back over his face until he went in to speak with the LORD.
translation: Na ol Israelites bai si face bilong Moses i glow strong. Olsem na Moses bai putim bek bilum gen long face bilong en, istap til em i go insait long tok save wantaim LORD.

original: Then Moses assembled the whole congregation of Israel and said to them, “These are the things that the LORD has commanded you to do:
translation: Na Moses i assemblim hap whole kongres bilong Israel, na i tokim ol long tok: “Dispela ol samting em LORD i givim komando long yu:”

original: For six days work may be done, but the seventh day shall be your holy day, a Sabbath of complete rest to the LORD. Whoever does any work on that day must be put to death.
