translation: Long sikis de, wok ina ken go hap, bai de namba seven yumi mas holim na Sabeth long ples bilong resis olgeta ki Bikpela. Husat i mekim wok long de, em bai i kilim man.

original: Do not light a fire in any of your dwellings on the Sabbath day.”
translation: Yu no ken litim paia long hap bilong yu long dei bilong Sabat.

original: Moses also told the whole congregation of Israel, “This is what the LORD has commanded:
translation: Na Mosese i tokim olgeta long ol pikinini bilong Isrel, olsem Papa God i givim tok:

original: Take from among you an offering to the LORD. Let everyone whose heart is willing bring an offering to the LORD: gold, silver, and bronze;
translation: Kisim long yupela wanpela ofing long LORD. Ol husat i gat bel wel, inap bringim ofing long LORD: gol, silva, na bronz;

original: blue, purple, and scarlet yarn; fine linen and goat hair;
translation: Blu, paiple, na redish-paiple twine; linen i gat kwaliti na hairs bilong goat;

original: ram skins dyed red and fine leather; acacia wood;
translation: Skins bilong ram we ol i mekim red, lether bilong animal we ol i kurim gut, na diwai bilong akasia;

original: olive oil for the light; spices for the anointing oil and for the fragrant incense;
translation: Oli blong oliv bilong lait; spais bilong wata we i kamapim skin bilong man i swit moa na bilong smel gude tru insens;

original: and onyx stones and gemstones to be mounted on the ephod and breastpiece.
translation: Na ston onyx na ston bilong dekorasin ol i mas go antap long ephod na bresepis.

original: Let every skilled craftsman among you come and make everything that the LORD has commanded:
translation: Olgeta husat i gat skil long wok bilong en, inap i kam na wokim olgeta samting we LORD i tokim.

original: the tabernacle with its tent and covering, its clasps and frames, its crossbars, posts, and bases;
translation: Haos blong tabernakul wantaim tent blong em na kapa blong em, klasps blong em na frem blong em, krosba blong em, pos blong em, na bes blong em;

original: the ark with its poles and mercy seat, and the veil to shield it;
translation: Bokis na em i gat stik bilong en, na plak bilong mercy, na kambet bilong kova em;

original: the table with its poles, all its utensils, and the Bread of the Presence;
translation: Tebol wantaim polo bilong en, na ol samting bilong kaikai bilong en, na Bred bilong Presens;

original: the lampstand for light with its accessories and lamps and oil for the light;
translation: Diwai bilong lait wantaim sampela samting bilong en na laip na oil bilong givim lait;

original: the altar of incense with its poles; the anointing oil and fragrant incense; the curtain for the doorway at the entrance to the tabernacle;
translation: Alta bilong insens long nogat i go, wara bilong anointim na insens bilong switpela smell, kurtin bilong entris long tabernakl.

original: the altar of burnt offering with its bronze grate, its poles, and all its utensils; the basin with its stand;
translation: Alta bilong ofing bung wantaim gras bronzi, rop, na ol samting bilong wokim ka; basi wantaim stil bilong en.

original: the curtains of the courtyard with its posts and bases, and the curtain for the gate of the courtyard;
translation: Karai bilong yard long ples, wantaim post na bes, na karai bilong gate long yard;

original: the tent pegs for the tabernacle and for the courtyard, along with their ropes;
translation: Peg nael bilong tent long tabenakil na long ka bilong tabenakil, wantaim rop bilong ol.

original: and the woven garments for ministering in the holy place—both the holy garments for Aaron the priest and the garments for his sons to serve as priests.”
translation: Na klos bilong warkim servis long ples halivim—klos bilong halivim bilong Aron pries na klos bilong pikinini bilong en i go long sarve olsem pries.

original: Then the whole congregation of Israel withdrew from the presence of Moses.
translation: Olgeta asamble bilong Israel i go bek long wei bilong Moisi.

original: And everyone whose heart stirred him and whose spirit prompted him came and brought an offering to the LORD for the work on the Tent of Meeting, for all its services, and for the holy garments.
translation: Na ol pipel we usim het bilong ol i kam, na we spirit bilong ol i promtim ol, ol i kam na bringim ofing long Bikpela, wok long Haus Bilong Miting, ol servisis, na klos bilong holidei.

original: So all who had willing hearts, both men and women, came and brought brooches and earrings, rings and necklaces, and all kinds of gold jewelry. And they all presented their gold as a wave offering to the LORD.
translation: Ol man na meri ol i gat haret bilong givim, ol i kam na bringim broches, erings, rings, nekles, na ol kain kain jewelry bilong gol. Na ol i presentim gold bilong ol long wei bilong ofing bai ofing long Papa God.

original: Everyone who had blue, purple, or scarlet yarn, or fine linen, goat hair, ram skins dyed red, or articles of fine leather, brought them.
translation: Ol pipel we igat blu, paupul, skarit yen, fain linin, goat hari, ram skins i painim red, o samting bilong fain letha, ol i bringim ol long.

original: And all who could present an offering of silver or bronze brought it as a contribution to the LORD. Also, everyone who had acacia wood for any part of the service brought it.
translation: Na olgeta i ken kisim i go long olgeta na ofa em, silva o bronz, ol i bringim em olsem kontribusen long LORD. Na olgeta i gat akasia timba bilong eni part long servos, ol i usim em long servos bilong ol.

original: Every skilled woman spun with her hands and brought what she had spun: blue, purple, or scarlet yarn, or fine linen.
translation: Ol meri skil i go spinning, na ol i kam na bringim spinning blong ol: blu, paola, o skarlet yarn, o linen finis.

original: And all the skilled women whose hearts were stirred spun the goat hair.
translation: Na ol meri skil i gat save, harim bilong ol i kamap strong, ol spinim har bilong yangpela pik.

original: The leaders brought onyx stones and gemstones to mount on the ephod and breastpiece,
translation: Ol lida i bringim ston oniks na ston bilong valiu long go ap long ephod na brepsis,

original: as well as spices and olive oil for the light, for the anointing oil, and for the fragrant incense.
translation: spais na oliv oll long lamp, long anointing oll, na long swit moa smel.

original: So all the men and women of the Israelites whose hearts prompted them brought a freewill offering to the LORD for all the work that the LORD through Moses had commanded them to do.
translation: Ol man na meri bilong Israel ol i gat haret igo long en, na ol i kisim givim ofa bilong freewill long LORD, long mekim ol wok olsem LORD i tokim Moses long mekim.

original: Then Moses said to the Israelites, “See, the LORD has called by name Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah.
translation: Na Moses i tok long Pipol Israel, “Lukim, LORD i bin kolim nem Bezalel, pikinini bilong Uri, pikinini bilong Hur, bilong traibe bilong Juta.

original: And He has filled him with the Spirit of God, with skill, ability, and knowledge in all kinds of craftsmanship,
translation: Na em i givim Spirit bilong God long en, skil, abiliti, na save long ol kain kinds artpela wok bilong han.

original: to design artistic works in gold, silver, and bronze,
translation: Long planim woks bilong art long goold, sila, na bronz,

original: to cut gemstones for settings, and to carve wood, so that he may be a master of every artistic craft.
translation: Em i ken katim ston bilong decorate, na em i ken skulim timba, na em bai i stap olsem wanpela mastaa long olgeta kain wok bilong han.

original: And the LORD has given both him and Oholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, the ability to teach others.
translation: Na Lod i givim em, na Oholiab man bilong Ahisamach, husat i man bilong tribe bilong Dan, powa bilong tisim narapela manmeri.

original: He has filled them with skill to do all kinds of work as engravers, designers, embroiderers in blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and fine linen, and as weavers—as artistic designers of every kind of craft.
translation: Em i givim ol skil long ol, olsem engravers, designers, embroiderers long blu, paleta, na red yen na fine linin, na olsem weavers, olsem artistic designers bilong ol kain kinda wok, olsem kain craft.

original: “So Bezalel, Oholiab, and every skilled person are to carry out everything commanded by the LORD, who has given them skill and ability to know how to perform all the work of constructing the sanctuary.”
translation: Bezalel, Oholiab, na ol man husat i gat skil, ol i mas wokim olgeta samting em i bin tokim long han bilong GOD bilong yumi, em i givim ol skil na abiliti long ol, ol i ken wokim olgeta wok bilong mekim Haus Lotu.

original: Then Moses summoned Bezalel, Oholiab, and every skilled person whom the LORD had gifted—everyone whose heart stirred him to come and do the work.
translation: Na Moses i kirapim Bezalel, Oholiab, na ol man husat i gat skil olgeta, ol husat LORD i givim gif long ol, husat het bilong ol i opim ol, i kam na wokim wok.

original: They received from Moses all the contributions that the Israelites had brought to carry out the service of constructing the sanctuary. Meanwhile, the people continued to bring freewill offerings morning after morning,
translation: Ol i kam bek long Moses na kisim olgeta kontribushon we Israelait i bringim bilong mekim wokim servos long buildim haus lotu. Na ol pipel i stap yet bringim ofing bai volken moning na moning,

original: so that all the skilled craftsmen who were doing all the work on the sanctuary left their work
translation: Olgeta wokman wisai i gat skil, ol i save wokim olgeta wok long hap tambuwan, na lusiim wok bilong ol.

original: and said to Moses, “The people are bringing more than enough for doing the work the LORD has commanded us to do.”
translation: Ol i tokim Mosese, “Ol pisin i bringim planti long ol wok Bikpela i givim oda long mipela long mekim, na em i go longplaused.”

original: After Moses had given an order, they sent a proclamation throughout the camp: “No man or woman should make anything else as an offering for the sanctuary.” So the people were restrained from bringing more,
translation: Bihaen Moses i givim tok, ol i kirapim tokSAVE long haus man bilong ol: “Nogat man na nogat meri mas mekim sampela narakain tinging long givim long ples bilong Lotu.” Na ol pipel i stap, ol no ken kisim moa.

original: since what they already had was more than enough to perform all the work.
translation: Bikos olgeta samting oli stap long ol i kamap strong long ol, na ol i ken warkim olgeta wok.

original: All the skilled craftsmen among the workmen made the ten curtains for the tabernacle. They were made of finely spun linen, as well as blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, with cherubim skillfully worked into them.
translation: Olgeta wokman wei i gat skil moa yet long wok, ol i mekim ten kurten bilong tabenakl. Ol i mekim ol kurten ikon long kaliko bilong painim, wantaim bla, paleta, na red nambis, na cherubim wei i kamap strong long ol.

original: Each curtain was twenty-eight cubits long and four cubits wide; all the curtains were the same size.
translation: Evet kurten i go long 28 cubit na i go waid 4 cubit; ol kurten i stap wanem samting.

original: And he joined five of the curtains together, and the other five he joined as well.
translation: Na em i bin joinim faiv bilong klet long wankain, na arapela faiv em i bin joinim ol tu.

original: He made loops of blue material on the edge of the end curtain in the first set, and also on the end curtain in the second set.
translation: Em i mekim lup lup bilong matirial blu long sait bilong karpet i go daun long set nau em i kam first, na em i mekim lup lup bilong matirial blu long sait bilong karpet i go daun long set nau em i kam sekond.

original: He made fifty loops on one curtain and fifty loops on the end curtain of the second set, so that the loops lined up opposite one another.
translation: Em i mekim fifty laplap long wanpela karpet na fifty laplap long karpet i stap long end bilong sekond set, so ol laplap i kamap strong olsem wanwan.

original: He also made fifty gold clasps to join the curtains together, so that the tabernacle was a unit.
translation: Em i mekim fifty klasps bilong gol long jionim bikos long ken together ol kurten, na halivim tabernakel i stap wanpela.

original: He then made curtains of goat hair for the tent over the tabernacle—eleven curtains in all.
translation: Em bai mekim klostu long hap bilong lotu, em makim klostu olsem hiri bilong goat, eleven klostu i go daun, long haus bilong tabernacle, olgeta.

original: Each of the eleven curtains was the same size—thirty cubits long and four cubits wide.
translation: Oli eleven karpet ya olgeta i stap wanem siz, em i go long tripela ten hap mit na foa hap mit em i go wide.

original: He joined five of the curtains into one set and the other six into another.
translation: Em i kamapim faiv bilong karapa i go wankain, ol i go wankain long wanpela set, na nambatu six bilong karapa i go long narpela set.

original: He made fifty loops along the edge of the end curtain in the first set, and fifty loops along the edge of the corresponding curtain in the second set.
translation: Em i mekim fifty lup lup long namel long klosim karapa bilong karapa nambawan, na fifty lup lup long namel long klosim karapa bilong karapa nambatu.

original: He also made fifty bronze clasps to join the tent together as a unit.
translation: Em i mekim fifty klasps bronze long joiim hap bilong tabernakel o hap sacret, olsem wan unit, na ol i kam ap long toketa.

original: Additionally, he made for the tent a covering of ram skins dyed red, and over that a covering of fine leather.
translation: Em i go nau long haus bilong en, na em i makim wanpela kaveri bilong skin bilong ram i painim redden, na bihainim em i putim wanpela kaveri bilong leather i bikpela.

original: Next, he constructed upright frames of acacia wood for the tabernacle.
translation: Em bin mekim bemble long painim i go stap long tabenakel, na em yusim diwai bilong akasia.

original: Each frame was ten cubits long and a cubit and a half wide.
translation: Nambis iven wel bilong en i göt ten kyubiti lonng na wan kyubiti na hap kaikai waid.

original: Two tenons were connected to each other for each frame. He made all the frames of the tabernacle in this way.
translation: Tu tenon i joim long tu, ol i go long ol bikpela fraem. Na em i mekim olgeta fraem bilong hap tambuan olsem.

original: He constructed twenty frames for the south side of the tabernacle,
translation: Em i mekim twenti bembe long sait bilong saut bilong tembol.

original: with forty silver bases to put under the twenty frames—two bases for each frame, one under each tenon.
translation: Wantaim forti silva besis i go long putim daunbilo twenty frames, tu besis long wanpela frame, wan besis i stap daunbilo wanpela tenon.

original: For the second side of the tabernacle, the north side, he made twenty frames
translation: Long sait bilong not, sapara namba tu bilong tabenakl, em mekim twenty wokboksen.

original: and forty silver bases—two bases under each frame.
translation: Na foti silva bes, tu bes i go daun aninit long bikos tupela.

original: He made six frames for the rear of the tabernacle, the west side,
translation: Em i mekim sikis frames long bihain bilong tabernakul, sait bilong wes.

original: and two frames for the two back corners of the tabernacle,
translation: Na tu pepepa frem bilong tupela korona bihain bilong tabenakol.

original: coupled together from bottom to top and fitted into a single ring. He made both corners in this way.
translation: Ol i jijimbil long tu, long botom go hap kaikai, na ol i kam ap long wanpela ring sais. Na God i mekim tupela koner olsem.

original: So there were eight frames and sixteen silver bases—two under each frame.
translation: Na i gat eytpeila frem na sikssilen silva beses – tu anda long bek bilong dispela frem.

original: He also made five crossbars of acacia wood for the frames on one side of the tabernacle,
translation: Em i mekim faiv krusba long akasia timbra bilong frems long sait bilong tabernakol.

original: five for those on the other side, and five for those on the rear side of the tabernacle, to the west.
translation: Faiv bilong ol i go na stap long sait narak, na faiv bilong ol i go na stap long baksait bilong tabenakl, long wes.

original: He made the central crossbar to run through the center of the frames, from one end to the other.
translation: Em i mekim bar namel long mit na i rin insait long mit bilong bikpele, fraim wan hap kaikai go long narapela hap.

original: And he overlaid the frames with gold and made gold rings to hold the crossbars. He also overlaid the crossbars with gold.
translation: Na em i kasim frame wantaim gol na em i makim ring bilong gol na holim bar bilong kros, na em i kasim bar bilong kros wantaim gol.

original: Next, he made the veil of blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and finely spun linen, with cherubim skillfully worked into it.
translation: Em mekim bilong en veil wantaim blu, paipple, na red i karim planti kol long en, na linen i wokim gut, wantaim kerubim i kamap strong long en.

original: He also made four posts of acacia wood for it and overlaid them with gold, along with gold hooks; and he cast four silver bases for the posts.
translation: Em tu makim foa post long diwai bilong akasia olsem, na em kisim gold i go antap long ol, wantaim gold krok; na em katim foa bes long silva bilong ol post.

original: For the entrance to the tent, he made a curtain embroidered with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and finely spun linen,
translation: Long entris long haus bilong tambu, em mekim wanpela klosim skrin, wokim pinis wantaim blu, paipul, na red i tek hevi, na klos long mul.

original: together with five posts and their hooks. He overlaid the tops of the posts and their bands with gold, and their five bases were bronze.
translation: Tambua wantaim faiv bilong en na huk bilong en. Em i kisim gold pasim antap long bilong en na banis bilong en, na beses faiv bilong en i brops.

original: Bezalel went on to construct the ark of acacia wood, two and a half cubits long, a cubit and a half wide, and a cubit and a half high.
translation: Bezalel em i go long kam na wokim bokis bilong ka bilong akasia, bokis ya em i lapun two na hap kibit, wan kibit na hap wide, na wan kibit na hap hait.

original: He overlaid it with pure gold, both inside and out, and made a gold molding around it.
translation: Em i kisim golpela gol na kovaim em long namel na long nambis, na em i wokim banis gol bilong en.

original: And he cast four gold rings for its four feet, two rings on one side and two on the other.
translation: Na em i kisim foa ring bilong gol, na putim ol long foa lek bilong en, tu bilong ring long wan sait na tu long narapela sait.

original: Then he made poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.
translation: Em mekim stanabaut long akasia timba na kova long gol.

original: He inserted the poles into the rings on the sides of the ark in order to carry it.
translation: Em i putim stik bilong karim long ring we i stap long sait bilong ak, olsem na bai ol i karim i go.

original: He constructed a mercy seat of pure gold, two and a half cubits long and a cubit and a half wide.
translation: Em i mekim wanpela sit bilong grazim mai bilong gol kolim, tu na hap cubit lon, na wan cubit na hap cubit waid.

original: He made two cherubim of hammered gold at the ends of the mercy seat,
translation: Em i mekim tu kerubim long gol we i kamap long hap, long hap bilong siat bilong mercy.

original: one cherub on one end and one on the other, all made from one piece of gold.
translation: Wanpela kerabim long wanpela hap na wanpela long narapela hap, olgeta mekim pinis long wanpela peis bilong gol.

original: And the cherubim had wings that spread upward, overshadowing the mercy seat. The cherubim faced each other, looking toward the mercy seat.
translation: Na Kerubim igat wing, na ol i go ap long namel, na ol i kisim shade long ples bilong merisi. Ol Kerubim i mekim face each other, na ol i luk daun long ples bilong merisi.

original: He also made the table of acacia wood two cubits long, a cubit wide, and a cubit and a half high.
translation: Em i mekim tu tebol bilong diwai akasia, em i gat tu kot long, wan kot waid, na wan kot na hap long.

original: He overlaid it with pure gold and made a gold molding around it.
translation: Em i kamapim gild i stap olsem long en, na em i wokim moling bilong gild nambaut long en.

original: And he made a rim around it a handbreadth wide and put a gold molding on the rim.
translation: Na em i mekim wanpela edje long hap, wanpela han breadth i go ronnda, na em i putim gol molding long edje.

original: He cast four gold rings for the table and fastened them to the four corners at its four legs.
translation: Em i makim foa ring bilong gol long tepul, na em i holim ol ring long foa kona bilong en long foa lek.

original: The rings were placed close to the rim, to serve as holders for the poles used to carry the table.
translation: Ringi ibin putim klose long edj, ol i servim olsem holde bilong stik, na ol i usim long kisim desibel i go.

original: He made the poles of acacia wood for carrying the table and overlaid them with gold.
translation: Em mekim bek na pos long des husat i kom from diwai bilong akasia, na em kasim bek na pos wantaim gol.

original: He also made the utensils for the table out of pure gold: its plates and dishes, as well as its bowls and pitchers for pouring drink offerings.
translation: Emi wokim ol pes bilong ka long tepul bilong God, na ol i kamap bilong gol pu: plent, dises, bol, na pitcha bilong paoim ofering bilong dring.

original: Then he made the lampstand out of pure hammered gold, all of one piece: its base and shaft, its cups, and its buds and petals.
translation: Em i mekim lamp stan long gol we em i paitim pinis, gol i klia tru, ol i wan peis: aninit long en, na stik bilong en, kap bilong en, na buk na petal bilong en.

original: Six branches extended from the sides, three on one side and three on the other.
translation: Sikis branis i go raun long sait, tri bipela long wan sait na tri bipela long narakain sait.

original: There were three cups shaped like almond blossoms on the first branch, each with buds and petals, three on the next branch, and the same for all six branches that extended from the lampstand.
translation: Long branis namba wan, tripela kap i luk olsem flauer bilong badam, olgeta i gat bud na petal, na tripela long branis nambatu, olsem nau long sip branis ol i go bek long lampstand.

original: And on the lampstand were four cups shaped like almond blossoms with buds and petals.
translation: Na long lambston, stap foa kap i stap olsem flawa bilong badam wantaim buds na petal.

original: A bud was under the first pair of branches that extended from the lampstand, a bud under the second pair, and a bud under the third pair.
translation: Wanpela kalab i stap aninit long hap pair bilong branis em i go bek long lampstan, wanpela kalab i stap aninit long sekend pair, na wanpela kalab i stap aninit long thard pair.

original: The buds and branches were all of one piece with the lampstand, hammered out of pure gold.
translation: Olgeta kalakal na branis ol i stap wanpepa tasol wantaim lampstan, ol i wokim ap long golpela pure.

original: He also made its seven lamps, its wick trimmers, and trays of pure gold.
translation: Em i mekim lamp seven bilong en, sipuna bilong trimim wick, na tray bilong golpela pure.

original: He made the lampstand and all its utensils from a talent of pure gold.
translation: Em i mekim lamput na ol kai-kai bilong en long wanpela talen bilong gol i klorim.

original: He made the altar of incense out of acacia wood. It was square, a cubit long, a cubit wide, and two cubits high. Its horns were of one piece.
translation: Em i mekim alti bilong smel long diwai bilong akasia. Em i kvadrat, wan kibit i go long, wan kibit i go waid, na tu kibit i go antap. Horn bilong en i wan pis.

original: And he overlaid with pure gold the top and all the sides and horns. Then he made a molding of gold around it.
translation: Na em i kamapim antap na olgetsaid bilong em, na ek na horn bilong em, wantaim golpella kaikai. Em i wokim wanpela karukaruk bilong golpella long sait bilong em.

original: He made two gold rings below the molding on opposite sides to hold the poles used to carry it.
translation: Em i mekim tupela ring bilong gol aninit long sait bilong molding long hap pasis, na ol i holim poles, ol poles em ol i usim long kisim bek i go.

original: And he made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with gold.
translation: Na em mekim bek na pols long diwai bilong akasia, na em kisim gol na kapim bek long pols.

original: He also made the sacred anointing oil and the pure, fragrant incense, the work of a perfumer.
translation: Em i mekim olsen em oli anointing oil bilong God, na insens we i swit na smel strong, wok bilong man i mekim smela.

original: Bezalel constructed the altar of burnt offering from acacia wood. It was square, five cubits long, five cubits wide, and three cubits high.
translation: Bezalel i mekim alta bilong ofring baren long wel wooden acasia. Em i kwadrat, em i bikim namel long five kibit, wide em i five kibit, na high em i three kibit.

original: He made a horn at each of its four corners, so that the horns and altar were of one piece, and he overlaid the altar with bronze.
translation: Em i mekim wanpela horn long olgeta foa kona bilong en, so olsem horn na altan em i stap wantaim, ol i wan pais, na em i kambek altan wantaim bronsis.

original: He made all the altar’s utensils of bronze—its pots, shovels, sprinkling bowls, meat forks, and firepans.
translation: Em i mekim olgeta samting bilong alta long bronz — ol pot, speda, bol bilong sprinklem, pok bilong mit, na pan bilong faia.

original: He made a grate of bronze mesh for the altar under its ledge, halfway up from the bottom.
translation: Em wokim wanpela greit long mes blo bronz, long altar aninit long hap blo en, stat long hap tumas, long bittim.

original: At the four corners of the bronze grate he cast four rings as holders for the poles.
translation: Long foa kona bilong grit bilong bronz, em i kirapim foa ring olsem holde bilong ol stik.

original: And he made the poles of acacia wood and overlaid them with bronze.
translation: Na em mekim poles long diwai bilong akasia, na em kisim bronze i go antap long ol.

original: Then he inserted the poles into the rings on the sides of the altar for carrying it. He made the altar with boards so that it was hollow.
translation: Em putim stik long ring bilong sais bilong alta, olsem na bai ol i karim i go. Em mekim alta long bod, nogat samting i stap insait, em i holow.

original: Next he made the bronze basin and its stand from the mirrors of the women who served at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Nambawan em mekim basin kuprum na stat long en long glas bilong meri ol i wok long entris long Haus Bilong Miting.

original: Then he constructed the courtyard. The south side of the courtyard was a hundred cubits long and had curtains of finely spun linen,
translation: Na em i mekim ka bilong tabernakol. Said bilong saut long ka i go long hundred cubits, na i gat klosim skarft bilong linen we i spinning gutpela.

original: with twenty posts and twenty bronze bases, and with silver hooks and bands on the posts.
translation: wantaim twenti pos na twenti bes wain bilong bronze, na huk na banis silva long pos.

original: The north side was also a hundred cubits long, with twenty posts and twenty bronze bases. The hooks and bands of the posts were silver.
translation: Said blong nort tu em i stap long hundred kapitis, wantaim twenty post na twenty bes blong bronz. Huk na band blong post ol i bin mekim ape long silva.

original: The west side was fifty cubits long and had curtains, with ten posts and ten bases. The hooks and bands of the posts were silver.
translation: Said wes ikamap long fifty kyubiti, em i gat kambani, wetem ten post na ten pes, na huk na band bilong post ol i bilong silva.

original: And the east side, toward the sunrise, was also fifty cubits long.
translation: Na sait bilong east, we i go inap long bun piksa, em i lukim 50 kapitis lon.

original: The curtains on one side of the entrance were fifteen cubits long, with three posts and three bases.
translation: Kambani long wanpela sait bilong entris em i go long fiftein kapitis, wantaim tri post na tri bes.

original: And the curtains on the other side were also fifteen cubits long, with three posts and three bases as well.
translation: Na karati i stap long sait nara, em i 15 kibit lonng, wantaim tri pos na tri bes.

original: All the curtains around the courtyard were made of finely spun linen.
translation: Olgeta karat bilong ka, long sait bilong ka, ol i mekim ap long finis lip bilong kalip, wokim gut na i silk.

original: The bases for the posts were bronze, the hooks and bands were silver, and the plating for the tops of the posts was silver. So all the posts of the courtyard were banded with silver.
translation: Pes bilong post ol i bronze, krok na band ol i silva, na kap bilong antap long post ol i silva, na ol post bilong ka long courtyard ol i bandim wantaim silva.

original: The curtain for the entrance to the courtyard was embroidered with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and finely spun linen. It was twenty cubits long and, like the curtains of the courtyard, five cubits high,
translation: Kalten bilong entris long ka bilong courtyard em i bin mekim stap wantaim blu, paipul, na red nait, na linin i bin spinnim finis. Em i bin 20 cubit long, na olsem kalten bilong courtyard, em i bin 5 cubit high.

original: with four posts and four bronze bases. Their hooks were silver, as well as the bands and the plating of their tops.
translation: Em i gat foa posting na foa bes bilong bronze. Huk bilong ol i silva, na olgeta kat na plating bilong het bilong ol i silva tu.

original: All the tent pegs for the tabernacle and for the surrounding courtyard were bronze.
translation: Olgeta pini bilong tent long tabenakil na long ka bilong em, ol i bin bronze.

original: This is the inventory for the tabernacle, the tabernacle of the Testimony, as recorded at Moses’ command by the Levites under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.
translation: Em i kalkul pes bilong ol samting long haus lotu bilong Toksave, olsem oli raaitim long komanda bilong Moses, ol Levi ol i wok long ples bilong Ithamar, sun bilong Aaron priest.

original: Bezalel son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, made everything that the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Bezalel sut bilong Uri, sut bilong Hur, long taim bilong trai Jada, wokim olgeta samting olsem LORD i givim komando long Musa.

original: With him was Oholiab son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver, designer, and embroiderer in blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and fine linen.
translation: Na Oholiab, pikinini bilong Ahisamach, bilong tribe bilong Dan, i stap wantaim em, em i wokim senis long ston, draimapim klos, na mekim embroidery long blu, paleta, na red i dai yarn, na linen finis.

original: All the gold from the wave offering used for the work on the sanctuary totaled 29 talents and 730 shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel.
translation: Olgeta gol bilem long ofa bilong God i usim long wok bilong haus lotu bilong ol Israel i kamap 29 talents na 730 shekels, strongim long shekel bilong hap tembol.

original: The silver from those numbered among the congregation totaled 100 talents and 1,775 shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel—
translation: Silva bilong ol i kamap long namba i kamap 100 talen na 1,775 sikels, strongim lo bilong sikel bilong haiwe.

original: a beka per person, that is, half a shekel, according to the sanctuary shekel, from everyone twenty years of age or older who had crossed over to be numbered, a total of 603,550 men.
translation: Wanpela beka long ol manmeri, em i hap shekel, olsem shekel bilong ples namel, long everybody twenty yia na i go long olsem, ol i kam daun long kountim ol, ol man i gat 603,550.

original: The hundred talents of silver were used to cast the bases of the sanctuary and the bases of the veil—100 bases from the 100 talents, one talent per base.
translation: Hundred talen bilong silva i go long wokim bes bilong graun long hap bilong sanctuary na long hap bilong veil - em i 100 bes, 100 talen, wan talen long wan bes.

original: With the 1,775 shekels of silver he made the hooks for the posts, overlaid their tops, and supplied bands for them.
translation: Long 1,775 sikkel silva em i mekim hook bilong post, ol kisim top bilong ol i go antap long silva, na ol givim band bilong ol.

original: The bronze from the wave offering totaled 70 talents and 2,400 shekels.
translation: Bronz bilong ofing bung i kamap 70 talet na 2,400 sikils.

original: He used it to make the bases for the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, the bronze altar and its bronze grating, all the utensils for the altar,
translation: Em i usim long mekim pes bilong entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting, alta bilong brenz na grit bilong brenz, na ol kain kain samting bilong wok bilong alta.

original: the bases for the surrounding courtyard and its gate, and all the tent pegs for the tabernacle and its surrounding courtyard.
translation: Pes bilong kot i go raunim, na gate bilong en, na ol pinis bilong tabernakel, na kot bilong em.

original: From the blue, purple, and scarlet yarn they made specially woven garments for ministry in the sanctuary, as well as the holy garments for Aaron, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Long blu, papla, na red i kam, ol i makim klos bilong spesal wei bilong wok ministeri long hap graun, olsem na klos bilong haliness bilong Aron, olsem LORD i bin givim tok long MOSES.

original: Bezalel made the ephod of finely spun linen embroidered with gold, and with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn.
translation: Bezalel wokim epod long kaliko bilong spinning wei i swit moa, ol i kisim nambis, blu, paarl, na red yarn, na mekim olsem bilas long en.

original: They hammered out thin sheets of gold and cut threads from them to interweave with the blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and fine linen—the work of a skilled craftsman.
translation: Ol i wokim sipak long plet gol na katim smol, ol i katim threat long ol, na ol i miksim suip long blu, paiple, na red iet, wantaim linen naispela – em wok bilong man husat i gat save long wok.

original: They made shoulder pieces for the ephod, which were attached at two of its corners, so it could be fastened.
translation: Ol i mekim peis bilong efod, ol i karam ap long tu kona bilong en, bilong em i ken kukim.

original: And the skillfully woven waistband of the ephod was of one piece with the ephod, of the same workmanship—with gold, with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and with finely spun linen, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Na belt bilong ephod i kamap strong olsem wanpela piksa, em i stap tu long namel bilong ephod, ol i wok longen samting - gold, blu, paupla, na red i kamo strong long yar, na linen i pinis finis, olsem Bikpela, God bilong Israel, i tokim Mosis.

original: They mounted the onyx stones in gold filigree settings, engraved like a seal with the names of the sons of Israel.
translation: Ol i go apo long ston onyx, na ol i putim long seting bilong gol we i gat paiawer, na ol i wraitim nem bilong pikinini Israel olsem sindaun bilong han.

original: Then they fastened them on the shoulder pieces of the ephod as memorial stones for the sons of Israel, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Na ol i holim strong olsem ston bilong memori long shoulder bilong ephod, bilong pikinini Israel, olsem LORD i givim tok bilong Moses.

original: He made the breastpiece with the same workmanship as the ephod, with gold, with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and with finely spun linen.
translation: Em mekim pes bilong en olsem wok long epoda, long gol, blu, paleta, skarlet, na yarn balus, na linin fini balus.

original: It was square when folded over double, a span long and a span wide.
translation: Em i skwea, wenn em i foldim dupela taim, em i gat wan spen long na wan spen waid.

original: And they mounted on it four rows of gemstones: The first row had a ruby, a topaz, and an emerald;
translation: Na ol i go apo long en foa lain bilong ston pikinini we i shine: Lain namba wan em i gat rubi, topas, na emeral;

original: the second row had a turquoise, a sapphire, and a diamond;
translation: Ro wa sekend em i gat turquoise, sapphire, na diamond;

original: the third row had a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;
translation: Ro wa thrid em i gat jasin, aget, na amethist;

original: and the fourth row had a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper. These stones were mounted in gold filigree settings.
translation: Na ro wa fo em i gat beryl, oniks, na jasper. Ston dispela i go insait long gildet filigri seting.

original: The twelve stones corresponded to the names of the sons of Israel. Each stone was engraved like a seal with the name of one of the twelve tribes.
translation: Ston twelve i kamapim nam bilong pikinini bilong Israel. Everi ston i bin karam ap long stil bilong siel wantaim nem bilong wan bilong twelve traib.

original: For the breastpiece they made braided chains like cords of pure gold.
translation: Long hap bilong breispis, ol i makim chain bilong braid olsem rop bilong gol pipel.

original: They also made two gold filigree settings and two gold rings, and fastened the two rings to the two corners of the breastpiece.
translation: Ol bikim tupela seting bilong gol we i gat kol kilim na tupela ring bilong gol, na ol pasim tupela ring long tupela kona bilong hap bilong brus.

original: Then they fastened the two gold chains to the two gold rings at the corners of the breastpiece,
translation: Na ol i kisim tupele chain bilong gol na katim pinis long tupele ring bilong gol long koner bilong pes bilong brest.

original: and they fastened the other ends of the two chains to the two filigree settings, attaching them to the shoulder pieces of the ephod at the front.
translation: Na ol i holim na klosem hap end bilong tu len bilong silva long tu wok bilong silva ibin mekim olsem, na ol irokim ol long ples bilong skul bilong efod long fron.

original: They made two more gold rings and attached them to the other two corners of the breastpiece, on the inside edge next to the ephod.
translation: Ol makim tu moa ring bilong gol na ol pasim long nupela korner tupela bilong sak bilong brijen, long inpait sait bilong epamara.

original: They made two additional gold rings and attached them to the bottom of the two shoulder pieces of the ephod, on its front, near the seam just above its woven waistband.
translation: Ol bin mekim tu moa ring bilong gol na ol bin kisim i go hap long bodi bilong tu peis bilong efod, long front bilong en, klostu long ples we ili pas, jast abovim banis bilong en we ili bin wokim.

original: Then they tied the rings of the breastpiece to the rings of the ephod with a cord of blue yarn, so that the breastpiece was above the waistband of the ephod and would not swing out from the ephod, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Na ol i bin kisim ring bilong bres pis na rangim long ring bilong efod wantaim kord bilong blu yarn, olsem na bres pis i go hap long bel bilong efod, na i no inap slip aut bak gen long efod, olsem Lod i bin tokim Mose.

original: They made the robe of the ephod entirely of blue cloth, the work of a weaver,
translation: Ol i makim rop bilong efod hole tin, ol i usim blu klos, wok bilong wan man i save mekim klos.

original: with an opening in the center of the robe like that of a garment, with a collar around the opening so that it would not tear.
translation: Wantaim hap op long mitim bilong rok olsem rok bilong bodi, wantaim kolara ibin go raunim hap, bai em i no holim.

original: They made pomegranates of blue, purple, and scarlet yarn and finely spun linen on the lower hem of the robe.
translation: Ol makim pomegranet long blu, papla, na skarlet wol, na lip klos finis spinning, long hap bloз long rok bilong en.

original: They also made bells of pure gold and attached them around the hem between the pomegranates,
translation: Ol i mekim bel bilong golpela gold na karamim long hap bilong skat, long namel bilong pomegranet.

original: alternating the bells and pomegranates around the lower hem of the robe to be worn for ministry, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Ol i change bell na pomegranet olsem wanem long hap bilong rok bilong kabasi, long en i go wokim minisiti, olsem Jehovah i givim tok impot long Moses.

original: For Aaron and his sons they made tunics of fine linen, the work of a weaver,
translation: Ol i mekim skit bilong linen i gat kwaliti long Aaron na ol pikinini bilong en, wok bilong man i mekim klos.

original: as well as the turban of fine linen, the ornate headbands and undergarments of finely spun linen,
translation: turban bilong klos finis, hedbend bilong kol bilong gat planti dekorasin, na klot i go daunon olsem klots i wokim long fibers bilong plan.

original: and the sash of finely spun linen, embroidered with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Na lop lap bilong wol ikon longpela spinning, wokim olsem na kisim blu, paleta, na red nambis i go insait long en, olsem Jehovah i tokim Mosis.

original: They also made the plate of the holy crown of pure gold, and they engraved on it, like an inscription on a seal: HOLY TO THE LORD.
translation: Oli wokim bek bilong em, kraun holihol bilong golpela gold, na oli karamapim i go long en olsem tok bokis long sik: HALIM LONG LORD.

original: Then they fastened to it a blue cord to mount it on the turban, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Na ol i kisim string blu na katim, ol putim em long hap bilong turban, olsem Jehovah i tokim Mosis.

original: So all the work for the tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting, was completed. The Israelites did everything just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Olgeta wok long Haus bilong Miting, em i kamap pinis. Israelites i mekim olgeta samting olsem LORD i tokim Moses.

original: Then they brought the tabernacle to Moses: the tent with all its furnishings, its clasps, its frames, its crossbars, and its posts and bases;
translation: Ol i kam bringim tabenakl i go long Moses, husat em i gat haus sel wantaim ol samting bilong en, klasp, fram, bar bilong kros, pos na pes bilong pos;

original: the covering of ram skins dyed red, the covering of fine leather, and the veil of the covering;
translation: Kava bilong skin bilong ram i painim redd, kava bilong letha fini, na bilip bilong kava;

original: the ark of the Testimony with its poles and the mercy seat;
translation: Bokis bilong TokSAVE wantaim stik bilong karim em na ples bilong amnesti;

original: the table with all its utensils and the Bread of the Presence;
translation: Tebol wantaim olgeta ka na viles, na Bred bilong Presens;

original: the pure gold lampstand with its row of lamps and all its utensils, as well as the oil for the light;
translation: Ka lamp long gol i klia tru wantaim rol bilong lampa na ol samting bilong em, na oi bilong bringim lait;

original: the gold altar, the anointing oil, the fragrant incense, and the curtain for the entrance to the tent;
translation: Alta bilong gol, oil bilong givim spirit, smel gud bilong insens, na kurtin bilong entris long haus tikus;

original: the bronze altar with its bronze grating, its poles, and all its utensils; the basin with its stand;
translation: Alta bilong bronz wantaim sapele bronz, spol bilong en, na ol samting bilong wokim sakrament; bilum water long sapim.

original: the curtains of the courtyard with its posts and bases; the curtain for the gate of the courtyard, its ropes and tent pegs, and all the equipment for the service of the tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting;
translation: Kurtens bilong yard longpela, wantaem em i gat pos na bes; kurtens bilong gate bilong yard longpela, ropes na pegs bilong tent, na ol samting bilong wokim servis bilong tabernakl, Haus bilong Miting;

original: and the woven garments for ministering in the sanctuary, both the holy garments for Aaron the priest and the garments for his sons to serve as priests.
translation: Na klos bilong warkim sabis long haus bilong Lotu, klos bilong halivim bilong Aaron prist, na klos bilong pikinini bilong en ol i servis olsem prist.

original: The Israelites had done all the work just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Pipol Israel i wokim pinis olgeta wok olsem Bikpela i tokim Moses.

original: And Moses inspected all the work and saw that they had accomplished it just as the LORD had commanded. So Moses blessed them.
translation: Na Mususi i lukim olgeta wok, na i si ol i winim wok bilong ol olsem Jehovah i tok, na Mususi i givim blesing long ol.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “On the first day of the first month you are to set up the tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Long moning drai dei bilong moning em i nambawan, yu mas plantim tabenakil, Haus bilong Miting.

original: Put the ark of the Testimony in it and screen off the ark with the veil.
translation: Putim bokis bilong Tok Aut long em, na karamim bokis bilong Tok Aut wantaim vail.

original: Then bring in the table and set out its arrangement; bring in the lampstand as well, and set up its lamps.
translation: Kisim tepul na putim ol samting we i mas stap long em; kisim kan na bringim i go long ples, putim laip long em.

original: Place the gold altar of incense in front of the ark of the Testimony, and hang the curtain at the entrance to the tabernacle.
translation: Putim gol altap long smel i go antap long ples, long sait bilong ark bilong Testimoni, na hangim kambet long entris bilong tabenakl.

original: Place the altar of burnt offering in front of the entrance to the tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Putim altar bilong ofing na bungim ol samting long hap bilong entris long haus bilong miting, Haus Bilong Tok Save.

original: And place the basin between the Tent of Meeting and the altar, and put water in it.
translation: Na putim basin long ples, long half time bipor long Haus Bilong Miting na altia, na putim wara inside.

original: Set up the surrounding courtyard and hang the curtain for the entrance to the courtyard.
translation: Kamapim ples kot na hangim kurten long entris bilong em.

original: Take the anointing oil and anoint the tabernacle and everything in it; consecrate it along with all its furnishings, and it shall be holy.
translation: Kisim oila bilong anointim na anointim tabernakel, makim i holimp lo tabernakel na ol samting bilong em, na em bai kamap holiholi.

original: Anoint the altar of burnt offering and all its utensils; consecrate the altar, and it shall be most holy.
translation: Wanpela oil i go long altia bilong ofa em i bun na ol hap kas bilong en; makim altia, na em bai kamap holi long olgeta.

original: Anoint the basin and its stand and consecrate them.
translation: Weksainim bekenu na stamba bilong en, makim ol i stap long ples bilong God.

original: Then bring Aaron and his sons to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting and wash them with water.
translation: Kisim Aaron na ol pikinini bilong em, bai yu bringim ol i go long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting, na wesim ol long wara.

original: And you are to clothe Aaron with the holy garments, anoint him, and consecrate him, so that he may serve Me as a priest.
translation: Yu mas kisim klotes halo i go long bodi bilong Aaron, yu put olsem we i kam long spirit long en, na mekim en i kamap man bilong God tru, bilong en servisim yu olsem prist.

original: Bring his sons forward and clothe them with tunics.
translation: Kam bek long bringim ol pikinini i go na givim olsem klos blong ol, ol tunik.

original: Anoint them just as you anointed their father, so that they may also serve Me as priests. Their anointing will qualify them for a permanent priesthood throughout their generations.”
translation: Wanpela anointim ol olsem yu bin anointim papa bilong ol, nasel ol i servim Mi olsem prist. Anointing bilong ol bai givim ol kwalifikeshon long ofis bilong prist, na ol i ken wok long jenarashen ol jenarashen.

original: Moses did everything just as the LORD had commanded him.
translation: Moses wokim olgeta olsem Jehovah i givim em tok long en.

original: So the tabernacle was set up on the first day of the first month of the second year.
translation: Haos blong tabenakel i kam ap long dei fest blong mun fest blong yia sekend.

original: When Moses set up the tabernacle, he laid its bases, positioned its frames, inserted its crossbars, and set up its posts.
translation: Moses setim tabenakul i go, na em i kisim ston na putim bek long en, stapim fram na rib long en, putim bar long en, na setim post bilong en.

original: Then he spread the tent over the tabernacle and put the covering over the tent, just as the LORD had commanded him.
translation: Em i karim hous i go antap long tabernakul na em i putim kova bilong en i go antap, olsem Jehovah i givim tok.

original: Moses took the Testimony and placed it in the ark, attaching the poles to the ark; and he set the mercy seat atop the ark.
translation: Moses kisim Testament, na em putim i insait long ark; em holim stik bilong karai long ark, na em putim sit bilong grace antap long ark.

original: Then he brought the ark into the tabernacle, put up the veil for the screen, and shielded off the ark of the Testimony, just as the LORD had commanded him.
translation: Na em i bringim bikosi long haus lotu, i putim veil bilong skrin, na i kisim ark bilong Testimeni i go insait, olsem GOD i givim tok bilong en.

original: Moses placed the table in the Tent of Meeting on the north side of the tabernacle, outside the veil.
translation: Mosis putim tebol long hap long Haus Bilong Miting, long sait nort bilong tabernakol, beyond long kambek.

original: He arranged the bread on it before the LORD, just as the LORD had commanded him.
translation: Em i arapim bikpela ka long hap bilong LORD, olsem LORD i givim tok long em.

original: He also placed the lampstand in the Tent of Meeting opposite the table on the south side of the tabernacle
translation: Na em putim limptabul i go long Haus Bilong Miting, kwila long tebol, long sait bilong saut bilong tabenakol.

original: and set up the lamps before the LORD, just as the LORD had commanded him.
translation: Putim lamp bilong ol i go bifor dispela Lord, olsem dispela Lord i givim tok long em.

original: Moses placed the gold altar in the Tent of Meeting, in front of the veil,
translation: Musai putim altap bilong gol long ples bilong miting, bifoa vail.

original: and he burned fragrant incense on it, just as the LORD had commanded him.
translation: Na em i bunim smel gutpela insens long en, olsem LORD i bin tokim em.

original: Then he put up the curtain at the entrance to the tabernacle.
translation: Em plantim karpet long entris bilong tabenakol.

original: He placed the altar of burnt offering near the entrance to the tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting, and offered on it the burnt offering and the grain offering, just as the LORD had commanded him.
translation: Em putim altar bilong ofing bifo God klostu long entris bilong tabenakl, Haus Bilong Miting, na em ofim ofing bifo God na ofing balus olsem olgeta we Lod i tokim em.

original: He placed the basin between the Tent of Meeting and the altar and put water in it for washing;
translation: Em putim basin long ples bilong bihain long Haus Bilong Miting na altare, na em putim wara long en bilong ol i wasim.

original: and from it Moses, Aaron, and his sons washed their hands and feet.
translation: Na long em, Mosis, Aron, na pikinini bilong em i wasim han bilong ol na lek bilong ol.

original: They washed whenever they entered the Tent of Meeting or approached the altar, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Ol i woshim bodi bilong ol wanpela taim ol go insait long Haus Bilong Miting o tasol ol kam klostu long altan, olsem Bikpela i tokim Moses.

original: And Moses set up the courtyard around the tabernacle and the altar, and he hung the curtain for the entrance to the courtyard. So Moses finished the work.
translation: Na Moses i kamapim ples bilong tabernakul long tabernakul na altia, na em i hangim karpet bilong entris long gate bilong ples. Na Moses i pinisim wok.

original: Then the cloud covered the Tent of Meeting, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
translation: Klau i kambek long Haus bilong Miting, na glori bilong Lod i fulim tabernakul.

original: Moses was unable to enter the Tent of Meeting because the cloud had settled on it, and the glory of the LORD filled the tabernacle.
translation: Mosis i no inap go insait long Haus Bilong Miting bikos klaud i kam daun stap long em, na glori bilong Lod i fulap tabenakol.

original: Whenever the cloud was lifted from above the tabernacle, the Israelites would set out through all the stages of their journey.
translation: Wanpela taim kalabus i kamdaun from we bilong heven, Oro Israel, pikinini bilong God, i go bek, na ol i wokabaut olgeta hap bilong ol.

original: If the cloud was not lifted, they would not set out until the day it was taken up.
translation: Sapos klaud i no go antap, ol i no inap wokabaut yet, long taem em i kamdaun.

original: For the cloud of the LORD was over the tabernacle by day, and fire was in the cloud by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel through all their journeys.
translation: Klok bilong Lod i stap antap long haus bilong praizim bai de, na faia i stap insait long klok bai nait, olsem ol i lukim long ai bilong olgeta hap bilong Israel olsem ol i go long ol ples.

original: Then the LORD called to Moses and spoke to him from the Tent of Meeting, saying,
translation: Na Lod i kolim Moses, na i tokim em long Haus Bilong Miting, i mekim tok

original: “Speak to the Israelites and tell them: When any of you brings an offering to the LORD, you may bring as your offering an animal from the herd or the flock.
translation: Tokim ol long ol Israel, long taim yu bringim sakris long LORD, bai yu bringen animal husat i kam long bulmakau o sip, na dispela bai i kamap olsem ofing bilong yu.

original: If one’s offering is a burnt offering from the herd, he is to present an unblemished male. He must bring it to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting for its acceptance before the LORD.
translation: Sapos man i bringim ofing bilong em na em i wanpela ofing bilong paia, em i mas bringim man bilong kuk, i go strong, no got kranki. Em i mas kisim i go long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting, olsem God bai aceptim i go long ai bilong em.

original: He is to lay his hand on the head of the burnt offering, so it can be accepted on his behalf to make atonement for him.
translation: Em i mas putim han long hed bilong ofa bilong bun, na God bai akseptim bekim olgeta samting long namel bilong em, makim peis bilong sindaun long namel bilong em.

original: And he shall slaughter the young bull before the LORD, and Aaron’s sons the priests are to present the blood and sprinkle it on all sides of the altar at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Na em bai kilim bulmakau yangpela long bikpela, na ol pikinini bilong Aron ol priis bai bringim blod i go long Papa God, na scaterim i go long ol sait bilong alta long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting.

original: Next, he is to skin the burnt offering and cut it into pieces.
translation: Nambawan, em i mas pilim skin bilo na katim i go long ol piksa.

original: The sons of Aaron the priest shall put a fire on the altar and arrange wood on the fire.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Aaron prist ol bai putim faia long altar na ol bai pasim tambaran long faia.

original: Then Aaron’s sons the priests are to arrange the pieces, including the head and the fat, atop the burning wood on the altar.
translation: Na sons bilong Aaron ol priests i mas putim ol piecis, bikos long head na ol griwara, antap long diwai i bun long alta.

original: The entrails and legs must be washed with water, and the priest shall burn all of it on the altar as a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
translation: Gutpela pasin bilong animal na leks bilong animal mas i go was long wara, na pris bai burnim olgeta long altan olsem ofing we yu mekim long paia, ofing bai yu kisim i go long LORD, em i kamap switpela smel i kamap long ai bilong LORD.

original: If, however, one’s offering is a burnt offering from the flock—from the sheep or goats—he is to present an unblemished male.
translation: Sapos ofa bilong em i kamapim ol burnt offering long ol pikinini animal husat i stap long bus - ol sheep o goats, em i mas kisim i kam wanpela man husat i gat strepela kain.

original: He shall slaughter it on the north side of the altar before the LORD, and Aaron’s sons the priests are to sprinkle its blood against the altar on all sides.
translation: Em bai kilim ol long hap bilong alta long not sais bilong alta, long bihain bilong LORD, na Sona bilong Aarun ol pries oli mas pilim blod bilong em long ol sait bilong alta.

original: He is to cut the animal into pieces, and the priest shall arrange them, including the head and fat, atop the burning wood that is on the altar.
translation: Pris i mas katim animal, na pris bai sanap ol piece, long antap long faiwa, wantaim hed na graun, long tap bilong faiwa i bung long altare.

original: The entrails and legs must be washed with water, and the priest shall bring all of it and burn it on the altar; it is a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
translation: Gutpela koros na leks i mas i go was long wara, na prist bai bringim olgeta na bungim ol long altan; em i ofing bilong bun, smel bilong swit na welkam long LORD.

original: If, instead, one’s offering to the LORD is a burnt offering of birds, he is to present a turtledove or a young pigeon.
translation: Sapos man i laik givim ofa bilong em i go long LORD olsem kae bilong fakim ol samting, em i mas kisim turteldov o pigin ia i no ol yet na em i go long LORD.

original: Then the priest shall bring it to the altar, twist off its head, and burn it on the altar; its blood should be drained out on the side of the altar.
translation: Na prist i kisim ol i go long altia, rulim hed bilong ol, burnim olgeta long altia; ol i pispisim blod igo daun long sait bilong altia.

original: And he is to remove the crop with its contents and throw it to the east side of the altar, in the place for ashes.
translation: Na em bai kisim kup wantaim sampela samting i inside na prangim i go long sait bilong solwara bilong alta, long ples bilong as.

original: He shall tear it open by its wings, without dividing the bird completely. And the priest is to burn it on the altar atop the burning wood. It is a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
translation: Em bai katim op long wing bilong pisin, naus long hapim pisin i go daun komplet. Na prist i mas kukim ol long alta, long tap bilongaira em i bun. Em i ofa bilong bun, wanpela ofa we em i mekim long paia, smel i kamap strong long ai bilong LORD.

original: “When anyone brings a grain offering to the LORD, his offering must consist of fine flour. He is to pour olive oil on it, put frankincense on it,
translation: Wanpela man i bringim ka moninga ofing long Bikpela, ofing bilong en i mas kam long paip bilong painim finis, na em i putim oil bilong oliv long en, na em i putim frankinsens long en.

original: and bring it to Aaron’s sons the priests. The priest shall take a handful of the flour and oil, together with all the frankincense, and burn this as a memorial portion on the altar, an offering made by fire, a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
translation: Na bai yu kisim i go long pikinini bilong Aaron ol pris. Pris bai kisim hap wantaim flao na oil, tu na frankinsens, na kaikai dispela olsem memori porcin antap long alta, ofa em i mekim na bai i go antap olsem smok, em i swit igo long LORD olsem naraka smel.

original: The remainder of the grain offering shall belong to Aaron and his sons; it is a most holy part of the offerings made by fire to the LORD.
translation: Nupela ka monop na grain ofing, em i go long Aaron na ol pikinini bilong em; em i hap bilong bikpela holiness long ol samting yu bring long faia na givim long LORD.

original: Now if you bring an offering of grain baked in an oven, it must consist of fine flour, either unleavened cakes mixed with oil or unleavened wafers coated with oil.
translation: Sapos yu bringim ofing bilong graun nambis long ovon, em i mas kamap long finespela flauer, ita kek we i no gat yeast, mixim wantaim oil, o wafas we i no gat yeast, koverim wantaim oil.

original: If your offering is a grain offering prepared on a griddle, it must be unleavened bread made of fine flour mixed with oil.
translation: Sapos yu bringim kanaka ofing bilong yu, em i bikim long tepi, bret bilong yu mas i no gat yausoi, na em i mas kam long flauer bilong gudepela kain kanaka i mixim wantaim moil.

original: Crumble it and pour oil on it; it is a grain offering.
translation: Tumbuna i go daun, kamautim oil ibin long en; em i ofa bilong grain.

original: If your offering is a grain offering cooked in a pan, it must consist of fine flour with oil.
translation: Sapos yu kam na kisim ofing bilong yu, i kam long ka bilong grain ofing, ina bai i kukim long pan, em bai i mas kamap long flauer finis wantaim moil.

original: When you bring to the LORD the grain offering made in any of these ways, it is to be presented to the priest, and he shall take it to the altar.
translation: Wanpela taim yu bringim ofing bai graun long LorD, em i mas kam bek long ol narapela rot, bai yu givim i go long priest, na priest bai karim i go long alta.

original: The priest is to remove the memorial portion from the grain offering and burn it on the altar as an offering made by fire, a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
translation: Prist i mas kisim porisen long ples bilong memori long ofa bilong graun, burnim em long altare olsem ofa bilong faia, na wonem smel i kamap swit mo plisim LORD.

original: But the remainder of the grain offering shall belong to Aaron and his sons; it is a most holy part of the offerings made by fire to the LORD.
translation: Bikos ol ripot bilong ofing bung i go long Aron na ol pikinini bilong en, em i wanpela hap i tambu tru long ol samting em i givim long paia olsem LORD i laik.

original: No grain offering that you present to the LORD may be made with leaven, for you are not to burn any leaven or honey as an offering made by fire to the LORD.
translation: Ina nau moni ofa i go daun long paia long LORD, nogat bungim sait bilong bread o sirope, bikos yu no ken wokim long paia long LORD.

original: You may bring them to the LORD as an offering of firstfruits, but they are not to be offered on the altar as a pleasing aroma.
translation: Yu ken kisim ol i go long LORD olsem ofring bilong klostu i kam bek gen, tasol ol no ken dinau long altia olsem smel i luk good.

original: And you shall season each of your grain offerings with salt. You must not leave the salt of the covenant of your God out of your grain offering; you are to add salt to each of your offerings.
translation: Na yu mas putim sol long olgeta ofa bilong graun. Yu no ken lusim sol bilong kovenaaet bilong God bilong yu long olgeta ofa; yu mas putim sol long olgeta ofa, em i sol bilong kovenaaet.

original: If you bring a grain offering of firstfruits to the LORD, you shall offer crushed heads of new grain roasted on the fire.
translation: Sapos yu bringim ka moninga ofing na bikpela kago bilong tumbuna long LORD, bai yu mas kilim hed bilong nupela kaukau na rostem long paia.

original: And you are to put oil and frankincense on it; it is a grain offering.
translation: Na yu mas putim paua bilong swit smel na oil long en; em i bikos bilong ofing bilong graun.

original: The priest shall then burn the memorial portion of the crushed grain and the oil, together with all its frankincense, as an offering made by fire to the LORD.
translation: Prist i go nau bungim toksave porcin bilong krai grain na oil, wantaim frankincense, me kim olsem long fait, olsem ofing bilong fait i go long LORD.

original: “If one’s offering is a peace offering and he offers an animal from the herd, whether male or female, he must present it without blemish before the LORD.
translation: Sapos man i bringim ofing bilong peis, na em i bringim animal long mob bilong kuk, olsem man o meri, em i mas putim i go long ples bilong Jehovah ina bai i stap gutpela, i no bagarap.

original: He is to lay his hand on the head of the offering and slaughter it at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting. Then Aaron’s sons the priests shall sprinkle the blood on all sides of the altar.
translation: Em i mas longim han bilong en long hed bilong givim na kilim olsem long entrance bilong Haus Bilong Miting. Olsem nau, Sons bilong Aron ol pries i mas sprusim blod long ol sait bilong alta.

original: From the peace offering he is to bring an offering made by fire to the LORD: the fat that covers the entrails, all the fat that is on them,
translation: Long taim bilong peis ofing, em i mas bringim ofing i go long paia long LORD, gras bilong ka, ol gras i stap long ka bilong animals.

original: both kidneys with the fat on them near the loins, and the lobe of the liver, which he is to remove with the kidneys.
translation: Boten kidney wantaim ol fet i go het long ol, klostu long hap bilong bipo, na hap bilong lever, em bai rausim wantaim kidney.

original: Then Aaron’s sons are to burn it on the altar atop the burnt offering that is on the burning wood, as an offering made by fire, a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
translation: Sos bilong Aaron bai kaikaim kakaruk na bungim olsem long altap, antap long taun burnt ofing bai go, olsem wok bilong givim prais long papa, switpela smel i kamap strong long LORD.

original: If, however, one’s peace offering to the LORD is from the flock, he must present a male or female without blemish.
translation: Sapos man i mekim peis ofering bilong en long Jehovah, na em i usim animal husat i kam long bulmakau, orait em i mas bringim man o meri we i no goa long kankaman.

original: If he is presenting a lamb for his offering, he must present it before the LORD.
translation: Em i bringim lembu long toktok bilong ofing, em i mas bringim i go long ples bilong Bikpela.

original: He is to lay his hand on the head of his offering and slaughter it in front of the Tent of Meeting. Then Aaron’s sons shall sprinkle its blood on all sides of the altar.
translation: Em i mas lainim han bilong en long hed bilong ofa na kisim na kilim ol i go long font long Haus Bilong Miting. Na Pikinini bilong Aron oli mas sprinkle blod bilong en long ol sait bilong alta.

original: And from the peace offering he shall bring an offering made by fire to the LORD consisting of its fat: the entire fat tail cut off close to the backbone, the fat that covers the entrails, all the fat that is on them,
translation: Na long peis ofing, em i bringim wanpela ofing i go daun long paia long Jehovah, em i kamap longwei bilong fat: fat bilong tetel i kotim klostu long bakin baksait, fat i karim gutpela pasin, na ol fat i stap long ol gutpela pasin.

original: both kidneys with the fat on them near the loins, and the lobe of the liver, which he is to remove with the kidneys.
translation: Boten kidney wantaim gras ol i kap long hem nambis long lapun bilong man, na loba bilong lever, em bai rausim wantaim kidney.

original: Then the priest is to burn them on the altar as food, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
translation: Na prist i mas bungim ol i go long altia olsem ka, ofing bai faia long wei bilong Jehovah.

original: If one’s offering is a goat, he is to present it before the LORD.
translation: Sapos wan man i givim ofing bilong en na em i goat, em i mas kisim i go bek long ples bilong GOD.

original: He must lay his hand on its head and slaughter it in front of the Tent of Meeting. Then Aaron’s sons shall sprinkle its blood on all sides of the altar.
translation: Em i mas putim han bilong en long hed bilong animal, kilim animal long sait bilong Haus Bilong Miting. Na pikinini bilong Aron i mas sprinkim blod bilong en long ol sait bilong alta.

original: And from his offering he shall present an offering made by fire to the LORD: the fat that covers the entrails, all the fat that is on them,
translation: Na long ofing blong em, em bai bringim ofing i kam long LORD, ol gris we i kisim ka bilong animal, na ol gris ol i stap long en.

original: both kidneys with the fat on them near the loins, and the lobe of the liver, which he is to remove with the kidneys.
translation: Bubu kidni na olgeta gis bilong ol i stap klostu long hap bilong bipele, na hap bilong leba, em i mas rausim ol kidni.

original: Then the priest is to burn the food on the altar as an offering made by fire, a pleasing aroma. All the fat is the LORD’s.
translation: Na pris bai i kaikai long alta olsem ofing bai i go long paia, smel i swit moa long God. Olgeta kina i bilong LORD.

original: This is a permanent statute for the generations to come, wherever you live: You must not eat any fat or any blood.”
translation: Em i laik bilong statut permanent long olgenaration i kam, we bilong yu stap: Yu no ken kaikai kilo o blod.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Tell the Israelites to do as follows with one who sins unintentionally against any of the LORD’s commandments and does what is forbidden by them:
translation: Tokim ol Yisrael olsem: Dispela em i go long wanpela man o meri husat i sindaun nogut bai mistak long eni ka bilong LORD, na ol i mekim samting i no inap long mekim, em i go long ol.

original: If the anointed priest sins, bringing guilt on the people, he must bring to the LORD a young bull without blemish as a sin offering for the sin he has committed.
translation: Igat pris we ili bin anointim long en i go sind, long kamapim dokol long ol pipol, em i mas bringim bikpela bulmakau i no goa hap long LORD olsem ofing bokis bilong sind long sind em i mekim.

original: He must bring the bull to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting before the LORD, lay his hand on the bull’s head, and slaughter it before the LORD.
translation: Em i mas kisim bulmakau i go long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting bipo LORD, putim han bilong em long hed bilong bulmakau, na kilim bek bilong en bipo LORD.

original: Then the anointed priest shall take some of the bull’s blood and bring it into the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Na pries bilong en de take sampela blod bilong bulmakau na bringim i go insait long Haus Bilong Miting.

original: The priest is to dip his finger in the blood and sprinkle some of it seven times before the LORD, in front of the veil of the sanctuary.
translation: Pris i dipim finga bilong en long blood, na i sprinklem sampela bilong em seven taim bifor LORD, long sait bilong vel bilong ples santuari.

original: The priest must then put some of the blood on the horns of the altar of fragrant incense that is before the LORD in the Tent of Meeting. And he is to pour out the rest of the bull’s blood at the base of the altar of burnt offering at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Prist bai putim sampela blod long horn bilong alta bilong smel gude pasin i stap bifor LORD long Haus Bilong Miting. Na em bai kisim narakai blod bilong bulum i go daun long pa bilong alta bilong bun animol long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting.

original: Then he shall remove all the fat from the bull of the sin offering—the fat that covers the entrails, all the fat that is on them,
translation: Em bai kisim wei olgeta graun bilong bulmakau long ofing bilon sin, graun ol i kova tripela balus, na olgeta samting bilong graun i stap long tripela balus.

original: both kidneys with the fat on them near the loins, and the lobe of the liver, which he is to remove with the kidneys—
translation: Boten kidni wantaim ol i go het long fat, klosap long hap bilong lek, na lop bilong lever, em bai rausim wantaim kidni—

original: just as the fat is removed from the ox of the peace offering. Then the priest shall burn them on the altar of burnt offering.
translation: Olsem olsem yu kilim fat i go long bulmakau bilong peis ofering, pris bilong God bai kaibrim ol long alta bilong bungim.

original: But the hide of the bull and all its flesh, with its head and legs and its entrails and dung—
translation: Bareket bilong bulmakau na olgeta flesh bilong en, wantaim hed bilong en na leg bilong en na olgeta insait long bel bilong en na kankam —

original: all the rest of the bull—he must take outside the camp to a ceremonially clean place where the ashes are poured out, and there he must burn it on a wood fire on the ash heap.
translation: Olgeta nating bilong bulmakau em i mas kisim i go long outsait bilong ples kamp, long ples we em i klia tru na we i tulim ashes i go daun, na long hap em i mas kukim ol i long paia bilong diwai.

original: Now if the whole congregation of Israel strays unintentionally and the matter escapes the notice of the assembly so that they violate any of the LORD’s commandments and incur guilt by doing what is forbidden,
translation: Sapos olgeta asamble bilong Isrel i go daun long wei nogut bai ol i no save, na mater i go hen long notis bilong asamble, ol i vilietim ol tok bilong LORD, na ol i kisim skul long wokim samting i no orait,

original: when they become aware of the sin they have committed, then the assembly must bring a young bull as a sin offering and present it before the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Wewan em i save long dispela sine ol i mekim, assembli i mas bringim bulmakau i no ol yet olgeta nau tasol ol i usim long ofing bilong sine, na ol i presentim i go long fron long Haus Bilong Miting.

original: The elders of the congregation are to lay their hands on the bull’s head before the LORD, and it shall be slaughtered before the LORD.
translation: Ol bikpela man bilong asosiesen i mas putim han bilong ol long hed bilong bullock, na bullock bai i slip long ples bifo LORD.

original: Then the anointed priest is to bring some of the bull’s blood into the Tent of Meeting,
translation: Na prist we i gat anointing bai kisim sampela blod bilong bulmakau na karim i go insait long Haus bilong Miting,

original: and he is to dip his finger in the blood and sprinkle it seven times before the LORD in front of the veil.
translation: Na em i mas dipim finga bilong en long blod na sprinklem sebn taim bifao LORD long sait bilong veil.

original: He is also to put some of the blood on the horns of the altar that is before the LORD in the Tent of Meeting, and he must pour out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar of burnt offering at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Em i mas putim sampela blod long horn bilong alta i stap bifor LORD long Haus Bilong Miting, na em i mas kisim olsem blod i go daun long bun bilong alta bilong bungim ol samting long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting.

original: And he is to remove all the fat from it and burn it on the altar.
translation: Na em bai kisim ota bilong olgeta graun na rausim, baren ol long alta.

original: He shall offer this bull just as he did the bull for the sin offering; in this way the priest will make atonement on their behalf, and they will be forgiven.
translation: Em bai ofa bulmakau ini olsem nem bilong em bin mekim long bulmakau bilong ofing sin, na pris bai mekim peis long behalf bilong ol, na ol bai kamap klostu.

original: Then he is to take the bull outside the camp and burn it, just as he burned the first bull. It is the sin offering for the assembly.
translation: Em i mas kisim bulmakau i go long ol ouside bilong kaen na burnim, olsem nau em burnim bulmakau em i kamp. Em i ofing bilong sin long ol asamble.

original: When a leader sins unintentionally and does what is prohibited by any of the commandments of the LORD his God, he incurs guilt.
translation: Wanpela bic head i kamakim ol sin bilong em long nogo, na em i mekim ol samting i no inarapim long ol tok save bilong LORD God bilong em, em bai i kisim skul.

original: When he becomes aware of the sin he has committed, he must bring an unblemished male goat as his offering.
translation: Wanpela em i kisim save long sin em i mekim, bai em i bringim bikpela male goat we i no go long eni kranki olsem ofing bilong en.

original: He is to lay his hand on the head of the goat and slaughter it at the place where the burnt offering is slaughtered before the LORD. It is a sin offering.
translation: Em i mas pitim han bilong en long het bilong bikpela ol i save kolim goat, na kilim ol i go long ples we ol i birua ka nomo long ai bilong GOD. Em i ofing bilong sin long ai bilong GOD.

original: Then the priest is to take some of the blood of the sin offering with his finger, put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and pour out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.
translation: Na prist i mas kisim sampela blod bilong ofing bilong sin, putim em long horn bilong alta bilong bun ol samting, na pilipim aut hap blod i go daun bai kom long bungraun bilong alta.

original: He must burn all its fat on the altar, like the fat of the peace offerings; thus the priest will make atonement for that man’s sin, and he will be forgiven.
translation: Em i mas bungim olgeta gis bilong em long alta, olsem gis bilong peis ofring; prist i go mekim senis long sin bilong man, na em bai i kamap gut namane.

original: And if one of the common people sins unintentionally and does what is prohibited by any of the LORD’s commandments, he incurs guilt.
translation: Na sapos wanpela husat i stap long ol pipol i stap long ples i go klostu long sin tasol i no save, na i mekim ol samting we i no inarapim long komands bilong LORD, bai i kamapim skul.

original: When he becomes aware of the sin he has committed, he must bring an unblemished female goat as his offering for that sin.
translation: Wanpela taim em i save long sin em i mekim, em i mas bringim kuskus doe pig na i no gat skirapim olsem ofing bilong sin em.

original: He is to lay his hand on the head of the sin offering and slaughter it at the place of the burnt offering.
translation: Em i mas putim han long hed bilong ofing bilong sin na kisim i go na kilim long hap bilong ofing bilong bun.

original: Then the priest is to take some of its blood with his finger, put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and pour out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.
translation: Na prist i ken kisim sampela blod bilong em wantaim finger bilong en, putim em long horn bilong alta bilong bun animol, na paulim aut hap blod i go daun long bais bilong alta.

original: Then he is to remove all the fat, just as it is removed from the peace offering, and the priest is to burn it on the altar as a pleasing aroma to the LORD. In this way the priest will make atonement for him, and he will be forgiven.
translation: Na em bai kisim wei olgeta bilong graun na kastom, olsem ol kisim long pesemak bilong pisin, na prist bai kaim ol i go long altan na brenim ol, olsem smel bilong swit igo long Bikpela. Na husat i mekim desuai, prist bai wokim pesemak long en, na em bai i stap fri long sin.
