original: If, however, he brings a lamb as a sin offering, he must bring an unblemished female.
translation: Sapos, long wei nau, em i bringim lep olsem ofing bilong sin, em i mas bringim meri lep i gat pes.

original: And he is to lay his hand on the head of the sin offering and slaughter it as a sin offering at the place where the burnt offering is slaughtered.
translation: Na em i mas plantim han bilong en long hed bilong ofing bilong sin, na kilim olsem ofing bilong sin long ples we ofing bilong bun em i kilim.

original: Then the priest is to take some of the blood of the sin offering with his finger, put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering, and pour out the rest of its blood at the base of the altar.
translation: Na prist bai kisim sampela blod bilong ofing bilong sin, putim long horn bilong alta bilong bun animol, na pauaotim blod i stap long bun graun bilong alta.

original: And he shall remove all the fat, just as the fat of the lamb is removed from the peace offerings, and he shall burn it on the altar along with the offerings made by fire to the LORD. In this way the priest will make atonement for him for the sin he has committed, and he will be forgiven.
translation: Na em bai kisim ota fat i go, olsem fat bilong lem i go long peis ofring, na em bai kaibinim ol i go long alta, long namel long ofring we i kukim long faia long LORD. Olsem priest bai me kim tokaut long en, long sin em i mekim, na em bai kamap strong nogut long sin, na em bai gat toksave.

original: “If someone sins by failing to testify when he hears a public charge about something he has witnessed, whether he has seen it or learned of it, he shall bear the iniquity.
translation: Sipos yu no givim testimoni olsem wan witnes, na yu harim tok bilong kot long samting yu lukim o yu harim tok save long em, bekim bikhet long sindaun, yu kisim sik bilong yu.

original: Or if a person touches anything unclean—whether the carcass of any unclean wild animal or livestock or crawling creature—even if he is unaware of it, he is unclean and guilty.
translation: Ovasit em i tingim samting i no klin – olsem bodi i dai bilong animal i wil, animal i save stap long ples, o animal krukim krukim na i go long graun – tasol em i no save long dispela, em bai bagarap na gilt.

original: Or if he touches human uncleanness—anything by which one becomes unclean—even if he is unaware of it, when he realizes it, he is guilty.
translation: Ovasit em i kaman long pkinini bilong man, na em i kamap nogut, sapos em i no save long dispela, taim em i kisim save long dispela, em i mas bekim.

original: Or if someone swears thoughtlessly with his lips to do anything good or evil—in whatever matter a man may rashly pronounce an oath—even if he is unaware of it, when he realizes it, he is guilty in the matter.
translation: Ovasait, sapos man i tok bokis long maus bilong en wok nogut o wok gut, na em i tok strong long promis bifo em ting, i no save long dispela, taim em harim, em gilty long dispela matar.

original: If someone incurs guilt in one of these ways, he must confess the sin he has committed,
translation: Sapos man i kisim gilty long wanpela wei, em bai tokautim na koborim sin em wokim.

original: and he must bring his guilt offering to the LORD for the sin he has committed: a female lamb or goat from the flock as a sin offering. And the priest will make atonement for him concerning his sin.
translation: Na em mas bringim ofing bilong gilit bilong en long LORD olsem ofing bilong sin we em mekim: wanpela pikinin lamb ow goat husat i kam long mob olsem ofing bilong sin. Na prist bai meekim peis long en long sin bilong en.

original: If, however, he cannot afford a lamb, he may bring to the LORD as restitution for his sin two turtledoves or two young pigeons—one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering.
translation: Sapos em i no ina bekim lamp, em ina bringim go long Lod kolombu tu o pijin pikinini tu olsem pe i kilim bilong sin bilong en: wan olsem ofing bokis bilong sin long Lod, na narak olsem ofing bokis bilong ban long Lod.

original: He is to bring them to the priest, who shall first present the one for the sin offering. He is to twist its head at the front of its neck without severing it;
translation: Em i mas bringim ol i go long pastor, na pastor i mas kisim da one we em i mekim bilong sakim sin. Em i mas kirapim hed bilong em long fron bilong nek bilong en na nogat katim yet.

original: then he is to sprinkle some of the blood of the sin offering on the side of the altar, while the rest of the blood is drained out at the base of the altar. It is a sin offering.
translation: Em bai pilim i go long sampela blod long sait bilong alta, na blod i stap olsem na i go daun long bun bilong alta. Em i tokol sin ofing.

original: And the priest must prepare the second bird as a burnt offering according to the ordinance. In this way the priest will make atonement for him for the sin he has committed, and he will be forgiven.
translation: Na pries i mas mekim pisin namba tu olsem ofing bifo God lo bilong wok. Olsem na pries bai mekim pes namel long en, na em bai kisim forgivim long sin em hamarim.

original: But if he cannot afford two turtledoves or two young pigeons, he may bring a tenth of an ephah of fine flour as a sin offering. He must not put olive oil or frankincense on it, because it is a sin offering.
translation: Sapos em i no inap pei twopela turteldoves o twopela pijin nogut, em inap bringim wanpela ten bilong ephah bilong flauer finis olsem ofing bilong sin. Em no ken putim oil bilong oliv o frankincense long en, bikos em i olsem ofing bilong sin.

original: He is to bring it to the priest, who shall take a handful from it as a memorial portion and burn it on the altar atop the offerings made by fire to the LORD; it is a sin offering.
translation: Em bai kisim i go long pastor, na pastor bai kisim hap han ful bilong memori na burnim em long alti, antap long ofa em i go daun long paia bilong GOD; dispela em i ofa bilong sin.

original: In this way the priest will make atonement for him for any of these sins he has committed, and he will be forgiven. The remainder will belong to the priest, like the grain offering.”
translation: Olsem na prist bai mekim peis bilong em long ol sin olsem em warkim, na em bai forgiven. Narapela olgeta bai bilong prist, olsem ofing bilong grain.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “If someone acts unfaithfully and sins unintentionally against any of the LORD’s holy things, he must bring his guilt offering to the LORD: an unblemished ram from the flock, of proper value in silver shekels according to the sanctuary shekel; it is a guilt offering.
translation: Sapos man i stap long wikim bilong en na i kisim sin long nogut, na i sin long samting bilong LORD olgeta we i halivim, em bai broughtim ofa bilong gilm long LORD: ram we i gat skin klia na i kam long mob bilong aninal, we i gat vailu tru long silva sikel, olsem sikel bilong háus lotu; dispela em i ofa bilong gilm.

original: Regarding any holy thing he has harmed, he must make restitution by adding a fifth of its value to it and giving it to the priest, who will make atonement on his behalf with the ram as a guilt offering, and he will be forgiven.
translation: Long olgeta samting bilong God em i harmim, em i mas pai bek gen, em i mas kisim hap times faif na givim long prist, em i mas mekim peis long en nau long ram bilong ofing bai em i kamap guilt offering, na em i was long sin bilong en.

original: If someone sins and violates any of the LORD’s commandments even though he was unaware, he is guilty and shall bear his punishment.
translation: Wanpela man i kamapim sin, na em i bagarapim wanpela bilong LORD komandi, maski em i no save, em i gilti, na bai em i kisim penati bilong en.

original: He is to bring to the priest an unblemished ram of proper value from the flock as a guilt offering. Then the priest will make atonement on his behalf for the wrong he has committed in ignorance, and he will be forgiven.
translation: Em bai kisim ram we i no got kranki, olsem pe bilong em yet, na sakrifaisim ram bilong gulti long pastor, na pastor bai mekim ples baal long en long ol samting nogut em wokim papila ikam, na em bai gat forgivim.

original: It is a guilt offering; he was certainly guilty before the LORD.”
translation: Em i ofa bilong gilty, na em i gulty tru long ai bilong LORD.

original: And the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tokim Moses,

original: “If someone sins and acts unfaithfully against the LORD by deceiving his neighbor in regard to a deposit or security entrusted to him or stolen, or if he extorts his neighbor
translation: Sapos wanpela man i sin na mekim ol samting we i no inaman long LORD, olsem na bilipim nambaut i no truth long narapela man long samting we yu givim em na yu laikim em i kisim kea, o i stilim samting we narapela man i putim i go bek long en, o i bagarap narapela man, tasol em i mas katai na toktok tru.

original: or finds lost property and lies about it and swears falsely, or if he commits any such sin that a man might commit—
translation: Olsa em i lukim samting we i los na yalua long tok bilong em, na tok bai i gat strong bilong God olsem nogat, o em i wokim sin olsem, em i ken kisim bekim long han bilong en, -

original: once he has sinned and becomes guilty, he must return what he has stolen or taken by extortion, or the deposit entrusted to him, or the lost property he found,
translation: Wanpela taim em i go sins, na em i kamap guili, em bai brimi bekim samting em i stilim, olsem samting em i pikinim long pas, olsem deposit we em i lusim na em i finis, olsem samting nupela em i finis, em bai givim bek long raitful owena.

original: or anything else about which he has sworn falsely. He must make restitution in full, add a fifth of the value, and pay it to the owner on the day he acknowledges his guilt.
translation: Em bai makim restsisen olgeta, putim 1/5 bilong valiu i go antap, na givim moni long owena long de em i amamas long sin bilong en, olsem em i tok bai i no truth.

original: Then he must bring to the priest his guilt offering to the LORD: an unblemished ram of proper value from the flock.
translation: Em bai kisim i go long pries ofa bilong gilty long LORD: ram we i no bin gat skirapim, pe bilong em yet, munusi.

original: In this way the priest will make atonement for him before the LORD, and he will be forgiven for anything he may have done to incur guilt.”
translation: Olsem na prist bai mekim peis bilong pasin long ai bilong LORD, na em bai kisim forgivim long olgeta samting em bin mekim i go daun, na em bai nogo long gilt.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok long Moses,

original: “Command Aaron and his sons that this is the law of the burnt offering: The burnt offering is to remain on the hearth of the altar all night, until morning, and the fire must be kept burning on the altar.
translation: Tokim Aaron na ol pikinini bilong em, dispela em i lo bilong ofing bifo God: Ofing bifo God i mas stap yet long paip bilong alta ol nait, kamap long moning, na faia i mas i go yet long alta.

original: And the priest shall put on his linen robe and linen undergarments, and he shall remove from the altar the ashes of the burnt offering that the fire has consumed and place them beside it.
translation: Na prist i putim kot bilong linen long bodi, kot bilong unda bilong linen, na em i kisim i go we long alta ases bilong ofing bai i burn, na em i pilim ol gen besaida long en.

original: Then he must take off his garments, put on other clothes, and carry the ashes outside the camp to a ceremonially clean place.
translation: Em i mas kisim of bilas bilong en, kisim klost we nou, putim long bodi bilong en, na karim as bilong faia i go ousait long ples klia long loa bilong God.

original: The fire on the altar shall be kept burning; it must not be extinguished. Every morning the priest is to add wood to the fire, arrange the burnt offering on it, and burn the fat portions of the peace offerings on it.
translation: Aita i go daun long alta, inap bai i stap yet, no ken pusim moa drai. Praist bai bringim timber i go long paia, organisa ofing na bungim ol samting we i mas bung, na burnim ol graun na oil bilong animal husat i kam long peis ofing.

original: The fire shall be kept burning on the altar continually; it must not be extinguished.
translation: Faia bai i stap bun long altan olsem taim bilong yap, em ina posibol bai em i dai aus.

original: Now this is the law of the grain offering: Aaron’s sons shall present it before the LORD in front of the altar.
translation: Nau em i loa bilong ofa bilong grain: Ol pikinini bilong Aeron bai yu kam bekim i go long ples bilong LORD long sait bilong alta.

original: The priest is to remove a handful of fine flour and olive oil, together with all the frankincense from the grain offering, and burn the memorial portion on the altar as a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
translation: Prist i mas kisim hap wantaim han flauer bilong gaden na oil bilong oliv, wantaim frankinsens bilong ofing bilong grain, na baunim ol parti bilong memoriam long alta olsem ofing long LORD, olsem wonem smel i kamap strong na swit.

original: Aaron and his sons are to eat the remainder. It must be eaten without leaven in a holy place; they are to eat it in the courtyard of the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Aron na ol pikinini bilong em bai kaikaim ol samting we i nap. Em i mas kaikaim long ples holig na long samting we i no gat yiest; ol bai kaikaim long paus bilong Haus Bilong Miting.

original: It must not be baked with leaven; I have assigned it as their portion of My offerings made by fire. It is most holy, like the sin offering and the guilt offering.
translation: Em i no ken baikim wantaim yau; ol i givim ol dispela porisen long ol, wokim long paia. Em i holi tru, olsem ofa bilong sin na ofa bilong gilt.

original: Any male among the sons of Aaron may eat it. This is a permanent portion from the offerings made by fire to the LORD for the generations to come. Anything that touches them will become holy.”
translation: Ol man husat i stap long ol pikinini bilong Aron inap kaikai. Wanpela poro em i kam long ol samting ol i bring long faia go long LORD, na em i stap long taim bai i go i go, long ol genarasyon i kam bihain. Sampela samting husat i tek langtu husat bai i kamap holy.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “This is the offering that Aaron and his sons must present to the LORD on the day he is anointed: a tenth of an ephah of fine flour as a regular grain offering, half of it in the morning and half in the evening.
translation: Dispela em i ofa bilong God: Aron na ol pikinini bilong en i mas givim long LORD long de bilem em i kamap prist, taim 10 blo efah bilong flauer bilong gudepela kaukau olsem ofa bilong graun we yumi givim oltaim, hap long moning na hap long apinun.

original: It shall be prepared with oil on a griddle; you are to bring it well-kneaded and present it as a grain offering broken in pieces, a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
translation: Em bai i redi wantaim moil long gril; yu mas kisim i go na mekim em i sanap strong, brinigm em olsem ofing bilong graun brokin i go olsem peses, wonem smel i lukimbil long LORD.

original: The priest, who is one of Aaron’s sons and will be anointed to take his place, is to prepare it. As a permanent portion for the LORD, it must be burned completely.
translation: Prist i go wokim olsem, em i wanpela bilong sons bilong Aaron, na em bai i kam daun long en, na em i go wokim olsem poro longwe taem bilong LORD. Olgets we i burn olgeta, em i stap long LORD, na em i givim ofa long LORD, na em i kam inap long hap bilong en, olsem poro longwe taem bilong LORD.

original: Every grain offering for a priest shall be burned completely; it is not to be eaten.”
translation: Olsem na olgeta ofing bilong graun long narapela man priest inap go daun kan long aip, yu no ken kaikai.

original: And the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok long Mosese,

original: “Tell Aaron and his sons that this is the law of the sin offering: In the place where the burnt offering is slaughtered, the sin offering shall be slaughtered before the LORD; it is most holy.
translation: Tokim Aaron na ol pikinini bilong em, dispela em i law bilong ofing bai sindaun: Long ples wey ol i kilim ofing bai kaikai, ofing bai sindaun bai kilim long wei bilong Lod, bifo Lod; em i holi tru.

original: The priest who offers it shall eat it; it must be eaten in a holy place, in the courtyard of the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Pries bilong mekim olsem bai kai kai, em bai kaikai long ples bilong saint, long ka aorot bilong Tent bilong Miting.

original: Anything that touches its flesh will become holy, and if any of the blood is spattered on a garment, you must wash it in a holy place.
translation: Olgeta samting husat i kamap long skin bilong en bai i kamap holy, na sapos olgeda blod i pilak long klos, yu mas wasim long ples holy.

original: The clay pot in which the sin offering is boiled must be broken; if it is boiled in a bronze pot, the pot must be scoured and rinsed with water.
translation: Diwai bilong klia ofing bilon sin i kukim emasim i mas bruk; sapos em i kuk long pot bilon bronzi, pot i mas skrubim na wasim wantaim wata.

original: Any male among the priests may eat it; it is most holy.
translation: Ol man husat i stap long priesthood, em ina kaikai; em i holy tru.

original: But no sin offering may be eaten if its blood has been brought into the Tent of Meeting to make atonement in the Holy Place; it must be burned.
translation: Inap no ken kaikai ofing bung if blod bilong en igat bring long Haus Bilong Miting i go wokim pasin kamautim long Ples Santu; em mas bung.

original: “Now this is the law of the guilt offering, which is most holy:
translation: Nau dispela em i laik bilong ofing bilon pak, ofing holi tru:

original: The guilt offering must be slaughtered in the place where the burnt offering is slaughtered, and the priest shall sprinkle its blood on all sides of the altar.
translation: Ofing blem tok bilong guiwt i mas kilim long ples we ofing i go daun, na pries bai sprikim blod bilong em long ol sait bilong alta.

original: And all the fat from it shall be offered: the fat tail, the fat that covers the entrails,
translation: Na olgeta telwe bilong em bai i go long lo: telwe bilong pik, telwe i karim abus bilong inet,

original: both kidneys with the fat on them near the loins, and the lobe of the liver, which is to be removed with the kidneys.
translation: Boten kidney wantaim ol fat i stap long hem nambis long sindaun bilong man, na hap bilong lever, em i mas kamaut wantaim kidney.

original: The priest shall burn them on the altar as an offering made by fire to the LORD; it is a guilt offering.
translation: Prist i go burnim ol long altar olsem ofing bai faia long han bilong LORD; em i ofing bilong gilton.

original: Every male among the priests may eat of it. It must be eaten in a holy place; it is most holy.
translation: Ol man husat i priest, ol i mas kaikai bilong en. Yupela mas kaikai long ples bilong haliv; em i haliv tru.

original: The guilt offering is like the sin offering; the same law applies to both. It belongs to the priest who makes atonement with it.
translation: Ofisa bilong gilt em i olsem ofisa bilong sin, wanpela lo i kamap long ol tu. Em i bilong pries we i mekim peis wantaim.

original: As for the priest who presents a burnt offering for anyone, the hide of that offering belongs to him.
translation: Long ol priest i go bringim ofing bilong bun em, skin bilong dispela ofing i bilong em tasol.

original: Likewise, every grain offering that is baked in an oven or cooked in a pan or on a griddle belongs to the priest who presents it,
translation: Olsem tu, olgeta ofring bilong graun i bin kukim long ovon o i bin kukim long pen o long plet, em i bilong pries husat i kam bekim.

original: and every grain offering, whether dry or mixed with oil, belongs equally to all the sons of Aaron.
translation: Olgeta grain ofing, em i ya hus na em i ya milim long moi, i bilong olgeta sons of Aaron alike.

original: Now this is the law of the peace offering that one may present to the LORD:
translation: Nau em i lukim loa bilong peis ofering, husat man i mas bringim i go long Lod:

original: If he offers it in thanksgiving, then along with the sacrifice of thanksgiving he shall offer unleavened cakes mixed with olive oil, unleavened wafers coated with oil, and well-kneaded cakes of fine flour mixed with oil.
translation: Em i mekim olsem long taim bilong hamamas, na em i mas bringim sakrifis bilong hamamas, kek nau i no gat yist muv long en ibin mixim wantaim oil bilong oliv, wafers i no gat yist ibin kovarem wantaim oil, na kek nau i bin mekim strong, ibin mixim wantaim finis flaur na oil.

original: Along with his peace offering of thanksgiving he is to present an offering with cakes of leavened bread.
translation: Wantaim ofing bung long en, em i mas kisim wanpela ofing long givim sankyu, na em i go wantaim loaf baket ol i gat yist.

original: From the cakes he must present one portion of each offering as a contribution to the LORD. It belongs to the priest who sprinkles the blood of the peace offering.
translation: Long bilong kek, em i mas putim wanpela hap bilong en long LORD olsem kontribusen. Em i bilong pries we i sprinklem bled bilong peis ofing.

original: The meat of the sacrifice of his peace offering of thanksgiving must be eaten on the day he offers it; none of it may be left until morning.
translation: Mit na sakrifis bilong peis ofing blong hanuim tok tok em bai ol mas kaikai long de nomo, nogat ken i stap kamaut long moning.

original: If, however, the sacrifice he offers is a vow or a freewill offering, it shall be eaten on the day he presents his sacrifice, but the remainder may be eaten on the next day.
translation: Sapos, olsem na ofa em i givim long wanbel o givim long tok bilong hart, inap kaikai long dei em i kamautim, tasol arapela i mas kaikai long namba tupela dei.

original: But any meat of the sacrifice remaining until the third day must be burned up.
translation: Olkain kai bilong sakrifis i stap yet long taem bilong dei thri, olgeta bai i mas burn pinis.

original: If any of the meat from his peace offering is eaten on the third day, it will not be accepted. It will not be credited to the one who presented it; it shall be an abomination, and the one who eats of it shall bear his iniquity.
translation: Sapos ol i kaikai bilong peis ofing long dei thri, em bai no ken kamap gut, em bai no ken kisim bek long dispela man i bringim, em bai bagarap tru, na dispela man i kaikai bai kisim sik bilong en.

original: Meat that touches anything unclean must not be eaten; it is to be burned up. As for any other meat, anyone who is ceremonially clean may eat it.
translation: Mit na i kamap long samting nogut, yu no ken kaikai, em bai i burn long paia. Narakai mit, husat i klia long lotu, bodi ken kaikai.

original: But if anyone who is unclean eats meat from the peace offering that belongs to the LORD, that person must be cut off from his people.
translation: Sapos wanpela i no klia na kaikai mit blong peis ofering, ol samting bilong Jehovah, bai em i kisim penati long ol anu.

original: If one touches anything unclean, whether human uncleanness, an unclean animal, or any unclean, detestable thing, and then eats any of the meat of the peace offering that belongs to the LORD, that person must be cut off from his people.”
translation: Sapos wanpela man i tichim ol samting nogut, olsem nogut bilong manmeri, animal nogut, o samting i no inarapela, na em bai kaikai ol kina ka moni bilong peis ofing we i bilong GOD, dispela man bai mas katol long ol pisin bilong em.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Likiliki i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Speak to the Israelites and say, ‘You are not to eat any of the fat of an ox, a sheep, or a goat.
translation: Tokim long ol Israel, yupela no ken kaikai bilong ol kina kuala, bulmakau, sip, na be.

original: The fat of an animal found dead or mauled by wild beasts may be used for any other purpose, but you must not eat it.
translation: Fati bilong animal we i dai pinis, o i kamap olsem nogat, i bin katim na kilim olsem bilong beits bilong bus, em bai yu inap usim long narapela wok, tasol bai yu no ken kaikai.

original: If anyone eats the fat of an animal from which an offering made by fire may be presented to the LORD, the one who eats it must be cut off from his people.
translation: I go long olsem wanpela i kaikai olsem fat bilong animal ofa mak bilong faia i kamapim na igivim long LORD, dispela man i kisim bek long ol pisin bilong em.

original: You must not eat the blood of any bird or animal in any of your dwellings.
translation: Yupela no ken kaikai bled bilong eni pisin o animal long olgeta haus bilong yupela.

original: If anyone eats blood, that person must be cut off from his people.’”
translation: Sapos wanpela man i kaikai blod, mas kat aus long ol piple bilong en.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Speak to the Israelites and say, ‘Anyone who presents a peace offering to the LORD must bring it as his sacrifice to the LORD.
translation: Tokim long ol Israel, husat i kam na givim ofing bilong peis long LORD, em i mas bringim i go long em olsem sakrifis bilong en.

original: With his own hands he is to bring the offerings made by fire to the LORD; he shall bring the fat, together with the breast, and wave the breast as a wave offering before the LORD.
translation: Em yet bai bringim ofingi we bilong faia long LORD wantaim han bilong em yet, na bai wafim susu, olsem wafim ofing, bai em wafim olsem wafim ofing bifor LORD.

original: The priest is to burn the fat on the altar, but the breast belongs to Aaron and his sons.
translation: Prist i mas bun olgeta fat long alta, tasol bris i go long Aron na pikinini bilong em.

original: And you are to give the right thigh to the priest as a contribution from your peace offering.
translation: Na yu mas givim lega rait long prist olsem kontribusen long toktok bilong peis.

original: The son of Aaron who presents the blood and fat of the peace offering shall have the right thigh as a portion.
translation: Susa bilong Aron i go brinim blood na graun bilong peis ofering, em i gat lait leg olsem wanpela ka.

original: I have taken from the sons of Israel the breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the contribution of their peace offerings, and I have given them to Aaron the priest and his sons as a permanent portion from the sons of Israel.’”
translation: Mi kisim long pikinini bilong Isrel bosom bilong ofing bung na han bilong helpim long peis ofing, na mi givim ol i go long Aron pries na ol pikinini bilong en olsem portion we i stap longtaim long pikinini bilong Isrel.

original: This is the portion of the offerings made by fire to the LORD for Aaron and his sons since the day they were presented to serve the LORD as priests.
translation: Em i ples bilong ka moninga bilong ofing wokim olsem long faia na givim long LORD bilong Aron na ol pikinini bilong en, dispela de ol i kam na wok long servisim LORD olsem prist.

original: On the day they were anointed, the LORD commanded that this be given them by the sons of Israel. It is a permanent portion for the generations to come.
translation: Long dey ol i kamapim, LORD i givim tok long ol pikinini bilong Israel ol i givim dispela ka. Em i porisen bilong genarasion i karim i go.

original: This is the law of the burnt offering, the grain offering, the sin offering, the guilt offering, the ordination offering, and the peace offering,
translation: Dispela em i loa bilong ofing bung, ofing painim graun, ofing sin, ofing rausim gilt, ofing ordination, na ofing pikinini.

original: which the LORD gave Moses on Mount Sinai on the day He commanded the Israelites to present their offerings to the LORD in the Wilderness of Sinai.
translation: LORD i givim Moses long Mount Sinai, wanken em i tokim ol Israelites long dei em i laik ol i bringim gif na ofa bilong ol long LORD long bus bilong Sinai.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Take Aaron and his sons, their garments, the anointing oil, the bull of the sin offering, the two rams, and the basket of unleavened bread,
translation: Kisim Aaron na ol pikinini bilong em, ol klos blong ol, oli blong anointing, buluk blong ofring bilong sin, tu ram blong ofring, na baskit blong bret isi.

original: and assemble the whole congregation at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.”
translation: na bungim olgeta kongregation long entris bilong Tenen blong Miting.

original: So Moses did as the LORD had commanded him, and the assembly gathered at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Na Mususi ibin mekim olsem Jehovah ibin tok, na asamble i kam bikam long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting.

original: And Moses said to them, “This is what the LORD has commanded to be done.”
translation: Na Mosis i tokim ol long, "Dispela em i wanpela wok we LORD i givim ol man long mekim."

original: Then Moses presented Aaron and his sons and washed them with water.
translation: Na Moses i kam bek long presentim Aron na ol pikinini bilong en, na washim ol long wara.

original: He put the tunic on Aaron, tied the sash around him, clothed him with the robe, and put the ephod on him. He tied the woven band of the ephod around him and fastened it to him.
translation: Em i putim tunik long bodi bilong Aron, em i bin kisim sas na kisim rondua long en, em i kisim rop na i givim long em, na em i putim efod long em. Em i bin kisim band bilong efod we i bin mekim olsem woven na kisim rondua long em, na em i holim strong long em.

original: Then he put the breastpiece on him and placed the Urim and Thummim in the breastpiece.
translation: Na em i putim breispis long em, na ol i putim Urim na Thummim insait long breispis.

original: Moses also put the turban on Aaron’s head and set the gold plate, the holy diadem, on the front of the turban, as the LORD had commanded him.
translation: Na Mosese i putim turban long hed bilong Aron, na i setim plak bilong gol, diadem bilong haliv, long front bilong turban, olsem Jehovah i tokim em.

original: Next, Moses took the anointing oil and anointed the tabernacle and everything in it; and so he consecrated them.
translation: Nekis, Moses kisim oili bilong anointing na anointim haus lotu na ol samting i stap inside, na em makim ol santing i holide.

original: He sprinkled some of the oil on the altar seven times, anointing the altar and all its utensils, and the basin with its stand, to consecrate them.
translation: Em i sprendim olgeta oil bilong en long alta seven taim, anointim alta na ol samting bilong en, na basin wantaim peles bilong en, olsem igat consecrate olgets.

original: He also poured some of the anointing oil on Aaron’s head and anointed him to consecrate him.
translation: Em i pilim sampela bilong ol man i stap long hevi, na em i putim long hed bilong Aron, makim em i kamap man bilong God, na givim em autoriti long wok bilong Lotu.

original: Then Moses presented Aaron’s sons, put tunics on them, wrapped sashes around them, and tied headbands on them, just as the LORD had commanded him.
translation: Na Moses i kam presentation long ol pikinini bilong Aaron, ol i putim skirt bilong kol long ol, ol i kisim laplap bilong kol i go raunlong ol, na ol i bin kisim hedband bilong kol i go long ol, olsem Bikpela i tokim em.

original: Moses then brought the bull near for the sin offering, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on its head.
translation: Moses kisim bulmakau i kam klostu long tingting bilong sin, na Aaron na ol pikinini bilong en i plantim han bilong ol long hed bilong bulmakau.

original: Moses slaughtered the bull, took some of the blood, and applied it with his finger to all four horns of the altar, purifying the altar. He poured out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar and consecrated it so that atonement could be made on it.
translation: Moses i kilim bullok, na i kisim sampela blod bilong en, na i putim blod long olgeta foa horn bilong alta, na i mekim alta i kam klia. Na i puskim aut blod i stap long bun bilong alta, na i bikim em i holiman, olesta em i ken mekim peis long em.

original: Moses also took all the fat that was on the entrails, the lobe of the liver, and both kidneys and their fat, and burned it all on the altar.
translation: Na Mosese i kisim olgeta gris i stap long ints, loba bilong liva, na tu kidni wantaim gris bilong ol, na i barim olgeta long altia.

original: But the bull with its hide, flesh, and dung he burned outside the camp, as the LORD had commanded him.
translation: Buat tasol bulmak bilong en, sikin, bodi, na kas em i burnim ol i go longwe nau bikos taun, olsem Papa God i tokim em.

original: Then Moses presented the ram for the burnt offering, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on its head.
translation: Na Moses i kam bekim rami long ofa bilong brenim, na Aron na pikinini bilong em ol i putim han bilong ol long hed bilong rami.

original: Moses slaughtered the ram and sprinkled the blood on all sides of the altar.
translation: Mosis i kilim ram na i sprinklem blood long ol sait bilong alta.

original: He cut the ram into pieces and burned the head, the pieces, and the fat.
translation: Em i katim rami long hap, na em i burnim hedi, olgets bilong rami, na graun.

original: He washed the entrails and legs with water and burned the entire ram on the altar as a burnt offering, a pleasing aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Em i wasim insait na lek bilong ram long wara, na em i bunim ram olgeta long alta, olsem ofing bung, smel i kamap strong na liklik sweet, ofing we i mekim long paia long han bilong LORD, olsem LORD i givim tok long Moses.

original: After that, Moses presented the other ram, the ram of ordination, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on its head.
translation: Bihaen long dispela, Musu i kam bek long presentim rama bilong ordinesen, na Aron na ol pikinini bilong en i pasim han bilong ol long hed bilong em.

original: Moses slaughtered the ram and took some of its blood and put it on Aaron’s right earlobe, on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.
translation: Mosis i kilim ram na i kisim samting bilong blod bilong em, na i putim long lobelanga ear bilong Aron, long thaimbilong han bilong en, na long finger big bilong fut bilong en.

original: Moses also presented Aaron’s sons and put some of the blood on their right earlobes, on the thumbs of their right hands, and on the big toes of their right feet. Then he sprinkled the blood on all sides of the altar.
translation: Mosis i kam bekim ol pikinini bilong Aaron, na i putim samting bilong blekbilong ol long poro lobes bilong ol rait ear, long finga bilong ol rait han, long bikpela toe bilong ol rait leg, na i spredim blekbilong ol gen long ol sait bilong altia.

original: And Moses took the fat—the fat tail, all the fat that was on the entrails, the lobe of the liver, and both kidneys with their fat—as well as the right thigh.
translation: Na Musa i kisim bikos - bikos bilong tetel, bikos i stap long inpela balus, hap bilong liver, kidni na rigt laig bilong ol wantaim bikos bilong ol.

original: And from the basket of unleavened bread that was before the LORD, he took one cake of unleavened bread, one cake of bread made with oil, and one wafer, and he placed them on the fat portions and on the right thigh.
translation: Na long basket bilong bret nogat pauda i stap bifor LORD, em i kisim wanpela kek bilong bret nogat pauda, wanpela kek bilong bret i mekim wantaim oil, na wanpela wafela, na em i putim ol long poro bilong graun na long lej bilong dain.

original: He put all these in the hands of Aaron and his sons and waved them before the LORD as a wave offering.
translation: Em putim olgeta dispela insait long han bilong Aron na ol pikinini bilong en, na ol i waiim ol dispela bifo LORD olsem wai ofing.

original: Then Moses took these from their hands and burned them on the altar with the burnt offering. This was an ordination offering, a pleasing aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
translation: Na Moses i kisim ol dispela long han bilong ol, na i bunim ol antap long alta, wanpela ofing bung bilong ordination, smel i kamap strong na swit moa long nose, em i ofing we i mekim long paia long Bikpela.

original: He also took the breast—Moses’ portion of the ram of ordination—and waved it before the LORD as a wave offering, as the LORD had commanded him.
translation: Na em i kisim tu brese bilong pik, plesen bilong Mozes long ram bilong ordination, na em i waipeim bikos long LORD olsem LORD i tokim em.

original: Next, Moses took some of the anointing oil and some of the blood that was on the altar and sprinkled them on Aaron and his garments, and on his sons and their garments. So he consecrated Aaron and his garments, as well as Aaron’s sons and their garments.
translation: Nambawan, Moses kisim olsem hap long oil bilong anointing na blod i stap long alta, na winim i go long Aaron na klos bilong en, na long ol pikinini bilong en na klos bilong ol. Olsem na em i mekim Aaron na klos bilong en, na ol pikinini bilong en na klos bilong ol, i kamap santing bilong God.

original: And Moses said to Aaron and his sons, “Boil the meat at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting and eat it there with the bread that is in the basket of ordination offerings, as I commanded, saying, ‘Aaron and his sons are to eat it.’
translation: Na Mosis i tokim Aaron na ol pikinini bilong em, “Suim kokim mit blo yu long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting na kaikai mit blo yu long hap bilong bret long oliket bilong ordination ofings, olsem mi bin givim komando, ol i mekim, ‘Aaron na ol pikinini bilong em bai kaikai.’”

original: Then you must burn up the remainder of the meat and bread.
translation: Yu mas kukim ol narapela bilong mit na bret i go daun.

original: You must not go outside the entrance to the Tent of Meeting for seven days, until the days of your ordination are complete; for it will take seven days to ordain you.
translation: Yu no ken go longwe na i go autsait long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting foa sekhen dei, na dei bilong yumi i kamap pastor i pinis; bikos dei sekhen i nesesari long yumi i kamap pastor.

original: What has been done today has been commanded by the LORD in order to make atonement on your behalf.
translation: Olsem na i kamap nau em i tokim ol long hap bilong LORD, i mekim peis long bel bilong yu.

original: You must remain at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting day and night for seven days and keep the LORD’s charge so that you will not die, for this is what I have been commanded.”
translation: Yu mas stap klostu long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting long dei na nait, statim 7 de, na yu mas kisim kot long LORD, na bai yu no dai, bikos dispela em i tok olsem long mi.

original: So Aaron and his sons did everything the LORD had commanded through Moses.
translation: Aron na ol pikinini bilong em ol mekim olgeta samting we GOD em i givim tok from Mosis.

original: On the eighth day Moses summoned Aaron and his sons and the elders of Israel.
translation: Long eighth de Mosis i kirapim Aron na ol pikinini bilong em na ol big man bilong Israel.

original: He said to Aaron, “Take for yourself a young bull for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering, both without blemish, and present them before the LORD.
translation: Ol i tokim Aaron, “Kisim long han bilong yu bulmakau i no yet long ol ofing bilong sin na ram i no gat ebabebil long ofing bilong bun, na bringe ol i go long ples bilong LORD.

original: Then speak to the Israelites and say, ‘Take a male goat for a sin offering, a calf and a lamb—both a year old and without blemish—for a burnt offering,
translation: Tokim ol Israel, inap long kisim goat man bilong ofing bicom sin, kalf na lamb - ol i gat wanpela yia, na i stap gut, i gat strepela kain - bilong ofing bicom bun na go dasol.

original: an ox and a ram for a peace offering to sacrifice before the LORD, and a grain offering mixed with oil. For today the LORD will appear to you.’”
translation: Bulmakau na ram ol i go long peis ofing long sacrifis, na ofing bilong graun i mixim wantaim oil, ol i wokim long han bilong LORD. Nambautn yu, tude LORD bai kam ap inap long yu.

original: So they took what Moses had commanded to the front of the Tent of Meeting, and the whole congregation drew near and stood before the LORD.
translation: Ol i kisim olsem Mosis i givim komando, na ol i bring i go long Haus Bilong Areton, na ol pipol i gat bikpela hevi i kam antap, na stat long ples bilong LORD.

original: And Moses said, “This is what the LORD has commanded you to do, so that the glory of the LORD may appear to you.”
translation: Na Mosis i tok, "Dispela em i wanpela tok we LORD i givim yu lapun tok long mekim, bilong glori bilong LORD i kamap long yu."

original: Then Moses said to Aaron, “Approach the altar and sacrifice your sin offering and your burnt offering to make atonement for yourself and for the people. And sacrifice the people’s offering to make atonement for them, as the LORD has commanded.”
translation: Na Moses i tokim Aaron, “Kam klostu long alti na ofa sin bilong yu na ofa bilong yu we yu bren, olsem yu inap kam rait gen long ai bilong yu na long ai bilong ol pipol. Na ofa givim long pipol olsem yu inap mekim rait gen long ai bilong ol,” olsem Lod i tokim.

original: So Aaron approached the altar and slaughtered the calf as a sin offering for himself.
translation: Na Aron i go kas long alta na i kilim kal f olsem ofing bilong sin bilong em yet.

original: The sons of Aaron brought the blood to him, and he dipped his finger in the blood and applied it to the horns of the altar. And he poured out the rest of the blood at the base of the altar.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Aron i bringim blod long em, na em i putim finga long blod, stapim long horn bilong alta. Na em i puskim aut ol blod i stap long bun bilong alta.

original: On the altar he burned the fat, the kidneys, and the lobe of the liver from the sin offering, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Long alta em i bungim gris, kidni, na liva lob bilong ofing bai sindaun, olsem LORD i givim tok long Mosese.

original: But he burned up the flesh and the hide outside the camp.
translation: Em i bakim bodili na suka olsem paia i ka longwe na outsait long ples kanu.

original: Then Aaron slaughtered the burnt offering. His sons brought him the blood, and he sprinkled it on all sides of the altar.
translation: Na Aron i kilim bikpela ofing. Susa bilong en i kam bringim blod igo long en, na en i sprinkelim i long ol sait bilong alta.

original: They brought him the burnt offering piece by piece, including the head, and he burned them on the altar.
translation: Ol i kam bringim em bun na ofing, olgeta, inklusiv hed bilong en, na em i putim ol long alta.

original: He washed the entrails and the legs and burned them atop the burnt offering on the altar.
translation: Em i wasim na kisim gutpela na lek bilong animal, na em i bakim olsem long antap long bikpela offerin bai i go daun long altia.

original: Aaron then presented the people’s offering. He took the male goat for the people’s sin offering, slaughtered it, and offered it for sin like the first one.
translation: Aron bihaenim ofing bilong piple. Em i kisim male goat bilong sakimus bilong sin bilong piple, kilim em, na ofrim em olsem nambawan sakimus bilong sin.

original: He presented the burnt offering and offered it according to the ordinance.
translation: Em i bringim ofi bilong em na ofim olgeta long wei bilong lo.

original: Next he presented the grain offering, took a handful of it, and burned it on the altar in addition to the morning’s burnt offering.
translation: Nekis ol i bringim ofing bilong graun, ol i kisim hap wantaim na burnim long altan, longsaed wanpela ofing bilong moning bifo.

original: Then he slaughtered the ox and the ram as the people’s peace offering. His sons brought him the blood, and he sprinkled it on all sides of the altar.
translation: Na em i kilim oks na ram olsem peis ofing bilong pipol. Sonz bilong em i bringim blod igo long em, na em i sprinkim long ol sait bilong alta.

original: They also brought the fat portions from the ox and the ram—the fat tail, the fat covering the entrails, the kidneys, and the lobe of the liver—
translation: Ol i kisim i kam bek long bulmakau na karai—pispis bilong bikhed, ol samting i stap insait long bel, kidni, na lobe bilong lever—ol graun bilong kilo.

original: and placed these on the breasts. Aaron burned the fat portions on the altar,
translation: Na Harun i pasim ol dispela long susu, na Harun i burnim oili porshon long altia.

original: but he waved the breasts and the right thigh as a wave offering before the LORD, as Moses had commanded.
translation: Em i waipeim bris na leg sait long ta olsem ofing bifo LORD, olsem Musa i givim tok.

original: Aaron lifted up his hands toward the people and blessed them. And having made the sin offering, the burnt offering, and the peace offering, he stepped down.
translation: Aron em i go ap long hap bilong en, em i givim bikpela blesing long ol. Na em i mekim ofing bilong sin, ofing bilong bun, na ofing bilong pis, em i kam daun.

original: Moses and Aaron then entered the Tent of Meeting. When they came out, they blessed the people, and the glory of the LORD appeared to all the people.
translation: Moses na Aaron i go insait long Haus Bilong Miting. Ol i kam aut, ol i givim blesing long ol pipol, na glori bilong LORD i kamap nau long ai bilong olgeta pipol.

original: Fire came out from the presence of the LORD and consumed the burnt offering and the fat portions on the altar. And when all the people saw it, they shouted for joy and fell facedown.
translation: Aibis i kamap long ples bilong LORD, na i kaikai ofa bilong bungim na graun bilong bikpela i stap long alta. Na ol pipol i lukim, ol i singaut i sori na ol i pidim dai.

original: Now Aaron’s sons Nadab and Abihu took their censers, put fire in them and added incense, and offered unauthorized fire before the LORD, contrary to His command.
translation: Susa bilong Aaron, Nadab na Abihu, ol i kisim censers bilong ol, ol i putim faia insait na i addim smel, na ol i ofrim faia we em i no orait bifo Longpela God, longwe contra long tok bilong Em.

original: So fire came out from the presence of the LORD and consumed them, and they died in the presence of the LORD.
translation: Na faia i kam aut long ai bilong LORD, na ol i kat ol i go daun, na ol i dai long ai bilong LORD.

original: Then Moses said to Aaron, “This is what the LORD meant when He said: ‘To those who come near Me I will show My holiness, and in the sight of all the people I will reveal My glory.’” But Aaron remained silent.
translation: Na Moses i tokim Aaron, "Dispela em i min bilong Bikpela when em i tok: 'Ol manmeri i kam klostu long Me, bai mi showim holines bilong Mi, na long ai bilong olgeta manmeri, bai mi bekim glori bilong Mi.'" Na Aaron i stap mama.

original: Moses summoned Mishael and Elzaphan, sons of Aaron’s uncle Uzziel, and said to them, “Come here; carry the bodies of your cousins outside the camp, away from the front of the sanctuary.”
translation: Mosis i kirapim Misael na Elisafan, pikinini bilong brata bilong Aron, Usiel, na tokim ol: "Kam na karim bodi bilong ol brata bilong yu long wei etside long kanua, long wei etside long fas bilong hause lotu."

original: So they came forward and carried them, still in their tunics, outside the camp, as Moses had directed.
translation: Ol i kam bek long front na karim ol i go, yet ol i stap long tuniks bilong ol, na ol i kisim ol i go long bodi bilong ples kanaka, olsem Moses i givim tok instruksin.

original: Then Moses said to Aaron and his sons Eleazar and Ithamar, “Do not let your hair become disheveled and do not tear your garments, or else you will die, and the LORD will be angry with the whole congregation. But your brothers, the whole house of Israel, may mourn on account of the fire that the LORD has ignited.
translation: Na Moses i tokim Aaron na ol pikinini bilong em, Eleazar na Ithamar, “Nogat, yu no ken tirim het bilong yu long ol klos yu, na yu no ken rupim klos yu, nogat, othawise yu bai dai, na LORD bai kros long assembli kamap. Tasol brata na susa bilong yu, haus bilong Israel, inap i ail long pasin bilong ail bilong faia we LORD i lusim.”

original: You shall not go outside the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, or you will die, for the LORD’s anointing oil is on you.” So they did as Moses instructed.
translation: Yu no go longwe na outsaid long entrins bilong Haus bilong Miting, nogat, otherwise yu dai, bikos Oli bilong LORD long anointing i stap long yu. Na ol i mekim olsem Musa i tokim ol.

original: Then the LORD said to Aaron,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Aaron,

original: “You and your sons are not to drink wine or strong drink when you enter the Tent of Meeting, or else you will die; this is a permanent statute for the generations to come.
translation: Yu na ol pikinini bilong yu, yu no ken drink wain o ka olegta strong wenn yu go insait long Haus Bilong Miting, nogat, othawise yu bai dai; dispela em i statut we i no ken slip long ol generasi i kam bihain.

original: You must distinguish between the holy and the common, between the clean and the unclean,
translation: Yu mas skelimapim ol samting bilong Spirit na ol samting bilong bodi, na yu mas skelimapim ol samting i orait na ol samting i no orait. Yu mas tok bilong holines na klirnes, na noken samting i go long olgeta.

original: so that you may teach the Israelites all the statutes that the LORD has given them through Moses.”
translation: Ina yu ken skulim Pipol Israel olgeta loa we LORD i givim ol long han bilong Mosese.

original: And Moses said to Aaron and his remaining sons, Eleazar and Ithamar, “Take the grain offering that remains from the offerings made by fire to the LORD and eat it without leaven beside the altar, because it is most holy.
translation: Moses i tokim Aaron na ol pikinini i stap, Eleasa na Itama, “Kisim ofa bilong graun we i stap yet, olsem ofa ol i mekim long paia long LORD, kaikai gen without leven klosap altar, bikos em i holi tru.”

original: You shall eat it in a holy place, because it is your share and your sons’ share of the offerings made by fire to the LORD; for this is what I have been commanded.
translation: Yu bai kaikai em long ples bilong haliv, wantaim ol pikinini bilong yu, bikos em i stap long yu na long ol pikinini bilong yu, long samting ol i bringim i go daun long paia bilong LORD; bikos ol samting we mi bin kisim tok bilong en.

original: And you and your sons and daughters may eat the breast of the wave offering and the thigh of the contribution in a ceremonially clean place, because these portions have been assigned to you and your children from the peace offerings of the sons of Israel.
translation: Yu na pikinini man na meri bai kaikai brest bilong ofing bai go antap na leq bilong halivim long ples we i klia pinis, bikos ol dispela porisen em i kamap long yu na pikinini bilong yu long peis ofing bilong pikinini bilong Israel.

original: They are to bring the thigh of the contribution and the breast of the wave offering, together with the fat portions of the offerings made by fire, to wave as a wave offering before the LORD. It will belong permanently to you and your children, as the LORD has commanded.”
translation: Oli mas bringim thaik bilong kontribushen na bres bilong waev ofing, tu na gris ol i stap long bubu bilong ofa ol i mekim long paia, waevim olsem waev ofing bifo LORD. Em bai bilong yu na pikinini bilong yu genarashen olenshen, olsem LORD i tok.

original: Later, Moses searched carefully for the goat of the sin offering, and behold, it had been burned up. He was angry with Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron’s remaining sons, and asked,
translation: Moses i lukim gut, na em i bekim, ofing bai sindaun i bin burn olgeta. Em i bel kol long Eleazar na Ithamar, ol pikinini bilong Aaron, na em i askim.

original: “Why didn’t you eat the sin offering in the holy place? For it is most holy; it was given to you to take away the guilt of the congregation by making atonement for them before the LORD.
translation: Wai yus no kaikai sak CIM bilong yus long ples holiest? Em i mas holiest, na em i givim long yus olsem wanem, long karim awe gilit bilong kongregation, na long mekim peis long ol bilong LORD.

original: Since its blood was not brought inside the holy place, you should have eaten it in the sanctuary area, as I commanded.”
translation: Bikos blod bilong em i no bring insait long ples bilong haliv, yupela mas kaikai olsem long area bilong haliv, olsem na mi bin tok.

original: But Aaron replied to Moses, “Behold, this very day they presented their sin offering and their burnt offering before the LORD. Since these things have happened to me, if I had eaten the sin offering today, would it have been acceptable in the sight of the LORD?”
translation: Aron i tokim Moses, “Behold, dispela de today ol i kam bekim ofa bilong sin na ofa bilong burnt bifoa LORD. Sapos ol dispela samting i kamap long me, bai mi kai ofa bilong sin today, em bai i kamap gut long ai bilong LORD?”

original: And when Moses heard this explanation, he was satisfied.
translation: Na taim Moses harim dispela toksave, em i kamap strong long hap bilong en.

original: The LORD spoke again to Moses and Aaron, telling them,
translation: Papa God i tok gen long Moses na Aaron, i mekim ol i harim,

original: “Say to the Israelites, ‘Of all the beasts of the earth, these ones you may eat:
translation: Tokim ol Yisrael, long ol binatang long graun, dispela samting yu ken kaikai:

original: You may eat any animal that has a split hoof completely divided and that chews the cud.
translation: Yu ken kaikai animal ol i gat tupela kundu we i brek, na em i kisim kaikai i go bek long mun.

original: But of those that only chew the cud or only have a divided hoof, you are not to eat the following: The camel, though it chews the cud, does not have a divided hoof; it is unclean for you.
translation: Bain tubelo na wasolim nau ol i kaikai kunu tasol, yu no ken kaikai dispela kina kai: Camel, em i gat kaikai kunu, tasol em i no gat hoof we bilong animol i katim i go daun long tu; em i no inap long yu.

original: The rock badger, though it chews the cud, does not have a divided hoof; it is unclean for you.
translation: Kakaruk na ston, maski em i kaikai gras bilong ani, em i no gat duwai fut; em i nogut long yupela.

original: The rabbit, though it chews the cud, does not have a divided hoof; it is unclean for you.
translation: Kalip, maski em i kaikai gras na kisim bek, em i no gat ho we i go brukim i go ap gen; em i no inap long yupela.

original: And the pig, though it has a split hoof completely divided, does not chew the cud; it is unclean for you.
translation: Na pig i stap, i gat fulap ho na katim pinis i go daun, tasol i no kaikai gras agen, em i no inap long yupela.

original: You must not eat their meat or touch their carcasses; they are unclean for you.
translation: Yu no ken kaikai mit bilong ol, na yu no ken tach long bodi bilong animal i dai pinis; ol i stap long olgeta samting i no klea long yu.

original: Of all the creatures that live in the water, whether in the seas or in the streams, you may eat anything with fins and scales.
translation: Long olgeta krea ol i stap long wara, bai ol i stap long solwara o long roro, yupela ken kaikai ol samting i gat pinis na skeil.

original: But the following among all the teeming life and creatures in the water are detestable to you: everything in the seas or streams that does not have fins and scales.
translation: Bikos ol narapela long olgeta laip na planti animol i stap long wara, ol creature ol i no inap long yu: olgeta samting i stap long solwara o kirap, ol i no gat pinis blong pis na skel blong pis.

original: They shall be an abomination to you; you must not eat their meat, and you must detest their carcasses.
translation: Olgets bagarap tumas long kam na nogat gupla, bai irok long bamdaon long yu olgeta; yu no ken kaikai mit bilong ol, na yu mas ihatim bodi i pundaun bilong ol.

original: Everything in the water that does not have fins and scales shall be detestable to you.
translation: Olgeta samting long wara i no gat pinis na skeil, ol bai i hamar long yu.

original: Additionally, you are to detest the following birds, and they must not be eaten because they are detestable: the eagle, the bearded vulture, the black vulture,
translation: Yu mas i hatim ol pisin i go we: aglikan, kakaruk bilong beard, kakaruk bilong blak, na ol i no inogat man i kaikai, bikos ol i bilong tu em i nogut, na hatim olgets long list bilong pisin nogut, kaikai i nogut long Bibel.

original: the kite, any kind of falcon,
translation: Pitanis balus, olgeta kain balus,

original: any kind of raven,
translation: Ol kain biridim black,

original: the ostrich, the screech owl, the gull, any kind of hawk,
translation: Man bilong bus, kakaruk bilong wail, pisin bilong solwara, na olgeta kain bilong bikpela pisin i go long hevi,

original: the little owl, the cormorant, the great owl,
translation: Kaikai liklik, manuk kormoran, kaikai bikpela,

original: the white owl, the desert owl, the osprey,
translation: Kaikai ol i gat pluma wei, kaikai kantry bus, bosim bikpela,

original: the stork, any kind of heron, the hoopoe, and the bat.
translation: Stok bilong pisin, heron bilong eni kain, hoopoe pisin, na pipelmus.

original: All flying insects that walk on all fours are detestable to you.
translation: Ol insekts i flai, bihain i go long foa leg, em i nogat gutpela, strongpela birua long yu.

original: However, you may eat the following kinds of flying insects that walk on all fours: those having jointed legs above their feet for hopping on the ground.
translation: Yu ken kaikai balus i flai, ol i go long graun na olgeta foa, ol i gat lek bilong krab i go antap long lek bilong ol, na ol i jmp long graun.

original: Of these you may eat any kind of locust, katydid, cricket, or grasshopper.
translation: Yu ken kaikai olkain locost, kati did, kilika, o gras hopa long dispela.

original: All other flying insects that have four legs are detestable to you.
translation: Ol narapela insek bilong fly ol i gat foa leg em i nogut long yu.

original: These creatures will make you unclean. Whoever touches their carcasses will be unclean until evening,
translation: Krea ol dispela bai mekim yu birua. Husat tu i tap long bodi na skelton bilong bek bilong ol, yu birua yet stap olsem na i go inap long apinun.

original: and whoever picks up one of their carcasses must wash his clothes, and he will be unclean until evening.
translation: Husat i kam bekim bodi bilong ol, emas i wasim klos bilong en, na bai i no inap long go long tumbuna klia yet.

original: Every animal with hooves not completely divided or that does not chew the cud is unclean for you. Whoever touches any of them will be unclean.
translation: Olgeta animal we i gat kuk na kuk i no katim pinis, o i no ken kaikai gras na wokim olsem kuk bilong cow, em i no inap long yupela. Husait i tokim long en, bai yumi stap nogut.

original: All the four-footed animals that walk on their paws are unclean for you; whoever touches their carcasses will be unclean until evening,
translation: Olgeta animal husat i go long graun na i usim lek bilong ol, ol i no inap long yu; husat i kamapik long bodi bilong ol, bai em i no inap tru long apinun, tasol long belo.

original: and anyone who picks up a carcass must wash his clothes, and he will be unclean until evening. They are unclean for you.
translation: Na husat i kisim bek na ded, bai mas wasim klos bilong en, na bai i no inap long kamap kleen yet, na bai i stap olsem yet na go long belo sun. Ol i no inap long yu.

original: The following creatures that move along the ground are unclean for you: the mole, the mouse, any kind of great lizard,
translation: Ol krea ya em i go long graun, olsem mole, mouse, na ol bikpela lizad, nogat klia long yupela.

original: the gecko, the monitor lizard, the common lizard, the skink, and the chameleon.
translation: Gekko, monita lisatad, lisatad bilong ples, skink, na chamileon.

original: These animals are unclean for you among all the crawling creatures. Whoever touches them when they are dead shall be unclean until evening.
translation: Ol animol hia i no klia long olgeta kala kru long graun. Hu i kamap tasol long ol dai pinis, bai i no klia yet, na bai i stap olsem yet kas long san go doun.

original: When one of them dies and falls on something, that article becomes unclean; any article of wood, clothing, leather, sackcloth, or any implement used for work must be rinsed with water and will remain unclean until evening; then it will be clean.
translation: Wanpela i dai na i pundaun long samting, ol sampela samting bilong diwai, klos, sip bilong animal, klos bilong sack, o hap bilong wok bai i no inap long usim; yu mas wasim long wara, na bai i no inap long usim yet, na bai i stap olsem yet, long belo, na bihain bai em i kam clean gen.

original: If any of them falls into a clay pot, everything in it will be unclean; you must break the pot.
translation: Sapos wanpela bilong ol i pundaun na i go insait long pot klai, ol samting i inside bai i nogut, yu mas brukim pot.

original: Any food coming into contact with water from that pot will be unclean, and any drink in such a container will be unclean.
translation: Eni kai ibin kisim kontak long wara insait long dispela pok, bai em i no inap, na eni dringim i stap insait long kontena, em bai i no inap.

original: Anything upon which one of their carcasses falls will be unclean. If it is an oven or cooking pot, it must be smashed; it is unclean and will remain unclean for you.
translation: Oli samting we bodili bilong animal we i dai pinis bilong ol i pundaun, em bai i stap long hevi. Sapos em hap bilong kukim ka o mumu, em mas i brok, nau em i stap long hevi, nogat klia, na bai ol i stap long hevi long yupela.

original: Nevertheless, a spring or cistern containing water will remain clean, but one who touches a carcass in it will be unclean.
translation: Nogat, wanpela spring oa cistern we i gat wara inside bai i stap klin, tasol wanpela man we i tek i go long bodi bilong animal we i dai inside em bai i stap bagarap.

original: If a carcass falls on any seed for sowing, the seed is clean;
translation: I sapos kai i pundaun long eni kain seed bilong planim, seed em i stap klia.

original: but if water has been put on the seed and a carcass falls on it, it is unclean for you.
translation: Bain tasol wara imas go long seed na bodi i punda i kamdaun long en, em i no inap long yupela.

original: If an animal that you may eat dies, anyone who touches the carcass will be unclean until evening.
translation: Sapos animal we yu ken kaikai i dai, olsem wanem samting ibin tokim skina bilong em, bai em i no inap long go long puri bilong lotu na bai em i stap olsem yet long taim bilong san.

original: Whoever eats from the carcass must wash his clothes and will be unclean until evening, and anyone who picks up the carcass must wash his clothes and will be unclean until evening.
translation: Husait i kaikai na kai kina balus i dai, emasim i wasim klotes bilong en, bai i no inap kamap kleen yet long taim bilong san i go daun. Na husait i kisim na karim balus i dai, emasim i wasim klotes bilong en, bai i no inap kamap kleen yet long taim bilong san i go daun.

original: Every creature that moves along the ground is detestable; it must not be eaten.
translation: Olgeta krea ol i go long graun em i nogut tumas, ol kaikai i no inap long kaikai.

original: Do not eat any creature that moves along the ground, whether it crawls on its belly or walks on four or more feet; for such creatures are detestable.
translation: Yu no ken kaikai kina creature olgeta i go long graun, sapos em i go na i karam ap long bel bilong en o em i go long foa leg o moa leg; bikos creature olsem em i nogut tumas.

original: Do not defile yourselves by any crawling creature; do not become unclean or defiled by them.
translation: No ken stretim yuself long eni kain krukim kuk; no ken bagarap o paulim yuself long ol.

original: For I am the LORD your God; consecrate yourselves, therefore, and be holy, because I am holy. You must not defile yourselves by any creature that crawls along the ground.
translation: Mi GOD bilong yumi; bai yu yet kamap ol santing wei i go long God, na bai yu i stap olsem man holi, bikos mi tu holi. Yu no ken givim yuself long ol samting i kaikai, ol samting i wok daun long graun.

original: For I am the LORD, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt so that I would be your God; therefore be holy, because I am holy.
translation: Mi em i Lord, nambawan Bikpela, hu me bringim yu long hap graun bilong Ijip, na me laik bai yu gat respek long me olsem God bilong yu; olsem, yu mas stap holi, bikos mi holigan.

original: This is the law regarding animals, birds, all living creatures that move in the water, and all creatures that crawl along the ground.
translation: Dispela em i lo bilong animol, olgeta kain pisin, ol krea ol i go long wara, na olgeta krea ol i go long graun.

original: You must distinguish between the unclean and the clean, between animals that may be eaten and those that may not.’”
translation: Yu mas skelim gut long ol samting nogut na ol samting i klin, long ol kain animals ol pipel i inap kaikai na ol i no inap kaikai.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Say to the Israelites, ‘A woman who becomes pregnant and gives birth to a son will be unclean for seven days, as she is during the days of her menstruation.
translation: Tokim ol Israel, 'Meri i go bekem bel na karim man, bai em i no inap kamap long 7 de, olsem tait bilong meri i kam daun.

original: And on the eighth day the flesh of the boy’s foreskin is to be circumcised.
translation: Na long nait bilong eyt, flesh bilong skina bilong pikinini em i mas katim.

original: The woman shall continue in purification from her bleeding for thirty-three days. She must not touch anything sacred or go into the sanctuary until the days of her purification are complete.
translation: Meri i mas kontini long kleanim from bleding bilong em long 33 de. Em no ken touchen samting haliv na em no ken go insait long ples bilong haliv spirit yet, na taim bilong kleanim em i go daun yet.

original: If, however, she gives birth to a daughter, the woman will be unclean for two weeks as she is during her menstruation. Then she must continue in purification from her bleeding for sixty-six days.
translation: I karim bek long pikinini meri, bai meri em i no inap long wokim wok strong olsem em yet long taim bilong em i save kam daun, long tupela wik. Na emas yet long pasin bilong kleanim em yet long blod i kam daun long sixty-six de.

original: When the days of her purification are complete, whether for a son or for a daughter, she is to bring to the priest at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting a year-old lamb for a burnt offering and a young pigeon or a turtledove for a sin offering.
translation: Wanpela taim dei bilong en i kamap pinis long klia olgeta, bai em bring lamb wanpela yia i go long prist long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting olsem ofing na givim God, na pijin na turteldov olsem ofing long sindaun.

original: And the priest will present them before the LORD and make atonement for her; and she shall be ceremonially cleansed from her flow of blood. This is the law for a woman giving birth, whether to a male or to a female.
translation: Na prist i go putim olsem bifor LORD, mekimm peis bilong atonmen long en, na em bai i kamap klia long blood i stap insait long en. Dispela em i laikin bilong meri husat i karim bebi, sapos em i karim man o meri.

original: But if she cannot afford a lamb, she shall bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons, one for a burnt offering and the other for a sin offering. Then the priest will make atonement for her, and she will be clean.’”
translation: Sapos meri i no ina bekim lam, em bai bringim tu kina pisin turtelduv na tu kina pisin pijin i no ol yet, wan bilong ol long ofing na narapela long sin ofing. Prist bai mekim pekpek long sindaun bilong em, na em bai kamap klia.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses and Aaron,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses na Aaron,

original: “When someone has a swelling or rash or bright spot on his skin that could become an infectious skin disease, he must be brought to Aaron the priest or to one of his sons who is a priest.
translation: Wanpela man i gat pukpuk o bosboi o marasin skina i briht long skin bilong en, inap em i ken bikim sik skin long ol manmeri, em bai bekim i mas kam long Aaron prist o wanpela sun bilong en i prist.

original: The priest is to examine the infection on his skin, and if the hair in the infection has turned white and the sore appears to be deeper than the skin, it is a skin disease. After the priest examines him, he must pronounce him unclean.
translation: Prist i mas tosoim sindaun long infection long skin bilong man, na sapos gras bilong hed i kamap wait long infection, na sor i go daun long unda long skin, em i sik sick long skin. Olsem prist i toktok, em i mas kisim em i go long olsem i no inap, em i mas biruaim em olsem em i no inap.

original: If, however, the spot on his skin is white and does not appear to be deeper than the skin, and the hair in it has not turned white, the priest shall isolate the infected person for seven days.
translation: Sapos ples bilong skin bilong em i white, i no lukim olsem i go daun moa long skin yet, na gras bilong hed bilong em i no bin turnim white, pris bai klosim pesen i gat sik long body foa de long seven de.

original: On the seventh day the priest is to reexamine him, and if he sees that the infection is unchanged and has not spread on the skin, the priest must isolate him for another seven days.
translation: Long namba seventh de, prist i mas kam bek agen long em, na sapos em si dispela sik bilong en i no bin change na i no go waid long skin bilong en, prist i mas puppetim en gen long namba seven de.

original: The priest will examine him again on the seventh day, and if the sore has faded and has not spread on the skin, the priest shall pronounce him clean; it is a rash. The person must wash his clothes and be clean.
translation: Prist bai tukiim i go bek gen long de napela seven de, na sike sore i go daun pinis na i no go longlong olgeta hap bilong skin, prist bai bilipim em i klia; em i sik muskrai. Man husat i gat dispela sik muskrai bai wosim klos na bai yumi klia.

original: But if the rash spreads further on his skin after he has shown himself to the priest for his cleansing, he must present himself again to the priest.
translation: Sik muskru i go daun long skin bilong bodi bilong en, na em i showim em yet long prist, tasol ripa i go daun gen, em i mas kam bek gen long prist.

original: The priest will reexamine him, and if the rash has spread on the skin, the priest must pronounce him unclean; he has a skin disease.
translation: Prist i go tukim em gen, na tokolos i go pas long skin bilong em, orait Prist i mas skelim em olsem em i no ino, em i gat sik bilong skin.

original: When anyone develops a skin disease, he must be brought to the priest.
translation: Wanpela man i kamapim sik bilong skin, em i mas go long pastor.

original: The priest will examine him, and if there is a white swelling on the skin that has turned the hair white, and there is raw flesh in the swelling,
translation: Pries i go lukim em, na sapos i gat kolored white i kamap long skin bilong em, gras bilong em i bin kamap white, na i gat flesh nogut i inside long kolored,

original: it is a chronic skin disease and the priest must pronounce him unclean. He need not isolate him, for he is unclean.
translation: Em i sik bilong skin we i go dae yet, na pries i mas autim em olsem em i no inap kam long ples gras. Em i no nid tasol bai em i go wankain long bush, bikos em i tambu.

original: But if the skin disease breaks out all over his skin so that it covers all the skin of the infected person from head to foot, as far as the priest can see,
translation: Bai sindaun, i sakem olsem: Sika diseas i go antap long skin bilong man, na kamap long olgeta hap skin bilong en, long hed na fut, olsem praist i lukim.

original: the priest shall examine him, and if the disease has covered his entire body, he is to pronounce the infected person clean. Since it has all turned white, he is clean.
translation: Pris bai lukim em, na sapos sik i coverim bodi bilong em olgeta, em bai tokim man i sindaun olsem: "Yu klia". Bikos em i kamap white pinis, em klia.

original: But whenever raw flesh appears on someone, he will be unclean.
translation: Tasol waneva bodi i kamap strong olsem klostu, em bai i no inap long go long ples bilong Jehovah.

original: When the priest sees the raw flesh, he must pronounce him unclean. The raw flesh is unclean; it is a skin disease.
translation: Wanpela taim pries i lukim flesh bilong man i stap yet, em i mas kukim olsem: 'Em i doti'. Flesh bilong man i stap yet, em i doti; em i sik bilong skin.

original: But if the raw flesh changes and turns white, he must go to the priest.
translation: Sapos kuk bilong man i chang na i kamap wait, em i mas go long pastor.

original: The priest will reexamine him, and if the infection has turned white, the priest is to pronounce the infected person clean; then he is clean.
translation: Pries bilong em yet bai lukim gen, na if sik long skin i kamap white, pries bai tok olsem: 'man bilong infection em i klia', orait em i klia.

original: When a boil appears on someone’s skin and it heals,
translation: Wanpela sop bilong sik mama i kam up long skin bilong man na em i holim gen.

original: and a white swelling or a reddish-white spot develops where the boil was, he must present himself to the priest.
translation: Na wanpela hap bilong skin i kamap white o hap bilong skin i kamap red na white long ples boil i stap, em bai mas go kam long man bilong lotu.

original: The priest shall examine it, and if it appears to be beneath the skin and the hair in it has turned white, the priest shall pronounce him unclean; it is a diseased infection that has broken out in the boil.
translation: Pries i go lukim, sapos em i kamdaun nebong sking na gras bilong em i kamdaun wei, pries i go tokim em olsem em i no inap long kam; em i sik bilong olgeta we i paul long kwila.

original: But when the priest examines it, if there is no white hair in it, and it is not beneath the skin and has faded, the priest shall isolate him for seven days.
translation: Wän pries em i lukim, sapos nogat hap hair wei i stap long en, na i no aninit long skin, na i mati pinis, pries bai putim em i wait long wik 7.

original: If it spreads any further on the skin, the priest must pronounce him unclean; it is an infection.
translation: Em i go longwe na skin bilong em, pries i mas autim em olsem man i no klea; em i sik muc.

original: But if the spot remains unchanged and does not spread, it is only the scar from the boil, and the priest shall pronounce him clean.
translation: Bai mak i stap yet, i no go bek long narapela hap, na i no go spred, em i les long scar bilong bubu, na pris bai tokim olsem: em i klia.

original: When there is a burn on someone’s skin and the raw area of the burn becomes reddish-white or white,
translation: Wánem taim got i kam long skin bilong samting na ol ples we i pai long skin bilong em i kamap redish-wait o wait,

original: the priest must examine it. If the hair in the spot has turned white and the spot appears to be deeper than the skin, it is a disease that has broken out in the burn. The priest must pronounce him unclean; it is a diseased infection.
translation: Pries i mas tisaunim. If gras bilong ples ia i kam white pinis na ples ia i go daun moa long skin, em i sickness we i kamap long ples bung. Pries i mas tokim em olsem em i no inap; em i sik mun.

original: But if the priest examines it and there is no white hair in the spot, and it is not beneath the skin but has faded, the priest shall isolate him for seven days.
translation: Bain pries em i lukim, na i no gat het bilong waitpela gras long ples we i kamap, na em i no unda skin tasol em i redim, pries bai karim man hus long wik 7 dei.

original: On the seventh day the priest is to reexamine him, and if it has spread further on the skin, the priest must pronounce him unclean; it is a diseased infection.
translation: Long namba seven de, pris bai go lukim gen em, na sapos sik i go waid igo long skin, pris bai tok olsem: em i no klia, em i sik long skin.

original: But if the spot is unchanged and has not spread on the skin but has faded, it is a swelling from the burn, and the priest is to pronounce him clean; for it is only the scar from the burn.
translation: Bai ol i no ken chang, stap yet, na em i no go waid long skin bilong en, na em i kamap dae gen, em i skar bilong paia i bin kolim, pastor bai tokim em olsem: 'Yu clean'; bikos em i skar tasol bilong paia.

original: If a man or woman has an infection on the head or chin,
translation: Sapos man o meri i gat sik long het o cha,

original: the priest shall examine the infection, and if it appears to be deeper than the skin and the hair in it is yellow and thin, the priest must pronounce him unclean; it is a scaly outbreak, an infectious disease of the head or chin.
translation: Pris ol i lukim sik mun, na em i luk ol i go daun moa long olgeta skin, na gras bilong hed i kamap yelo na narrow, pris i mas tokem em ol i no inap; em i sik bilong gras, disease bilong hed o chin.

original: But if the priest examines the scaly infection and it does not appear to be deeper than the skin, and there is no black hair in it, the priest shall isolate the infected person for seven days.
translation: Tasol sapos prist i lukim susa long infection ol i kaikai skelin na em i no go daun longpela dan long skelin, na ino gat blackgras bilong hed i kamap long en, tasol prist bai putim infected man long wanpela hap long seven de.

original: On the seventh day the priest is to reexamine the infection, and if the scaly outbreak has not spread and there is no yellow hair in it, and it does not appear to be deeper than the skin,
translation: Long namba seven de, pris bilong kam bek na lukim gen sik musul, na em i lukim olsem skali igo i no go daun, na gras bilong yellow i no stap long en, na em i no luk olsem i go insait long skin.

original: then the person must shave himself except for the scaly area. Then the priest shall isolate him for another seven days.
translation: Na man i mas klapim hes bilong en, eksept long hap bilong skin i kamap olsem skel. Pries bai putim em apart long namba tu wanpela wik, seven de.

original: On the seventh day the priest shall examine the scaly outbreak, and if it has not spread on the skin and does not appear to be deeper than the skin, the priest is to pronounce him clean. He must wash his clothes, and he will be clean.
translation: Long nait bilong seven, pris bai kam bek long lukim sik bilong skin i go dae, na em i no go waid long skin, na i no luk deep moa long skin, ol i tok em i klia. Em mas wasim klos blong en, na bai em i klia.

original: If, however, the scaly outbreak spreads further on the skin after his cleansing,
