translation: Sapos, olsem, toksik skin sindaun i go daun long skin bilong en afta em i kamap klia,

original: the priest is to examine him, and if the scaly outbreak has spread on the skin, the priest need not look for yellow hair; the person is unclean.
translation: Pris bilong en i mas lukim em, na sapos dispela sik kan i go antap long skin bilong em, pris i no need lukim hairs bilong yellow; man bilong em i no klea.

original: If, however, in his sight the scaly outbreak is unchanged and black hair has grown in it, then it has healed. He is clean, and the priest is to pronounce him clean.
translation: Sapos sik mun bilong skin em i stap yet na gras bilong hed i growe i go insait long em, orait em i helem. Em i klia, na pries i mas makim em i klia.

original: When a man or a woman has white spots on the skin,
translation: Wanpela man o meri igat spak brak i kamap long skin,

original: the priest shall examine them, and if the spots are dull white, it is a harmless rash that has broken out on the skin; the person is clean.
translation: Pris bilong God bai tiroim ol, na sapos spots i kolim waite klostu braun, em i sik bilong skin nogat bikpela kamap long skin; man o meri i klia.

original: Now if a man loses his hair and is bald, he is still clean.
translation: Sapos man i lusim gras bilong en, na em i pausi, em yet i klin.

original: Or if his hairline recedes and he is bald on his forehead, he is still clean.
translation: Sip hai bilong en i go bak, na em i bald long hevi bilong en, em yet i klia.

original: But if there is a reddish-white sore on the bald head or forehead, it is an infectious disease breaking out on it.
translation: Sapos i gat sik bilong skin i kamap redim whit long het bilong man i dai olsem klosim skina o long ai bilong man, em i sindaun bilong sik i kalap.

original: The priest is to examine him, and if the swelling of the infection on his bald head or forehead is reddish-white like a skin disease,
translation: Prist i mas bekim em, na sapos pukpuk i kamap long infection long hevi bilong en o lox forehead i redish-wait pinis olsem sik bilong skin,

original: the man is diseased; he is unclean. The priest must pronounce him unclean because of the infection on his head.
translation: Man i sindaun long sik, em i no klia. Pries i mas autim em olsem em i no klia bikos sik i karim long hed bilong en.

original: A diseased person must wear torn clothes and let his hair hang loose, and he must cover his mouth and cry out, ‘Unclean, unclean!’
translation: Man i gat sik mas usim klos tupela we i bin brake olsem saen bilong nogut, na em i mas letim het bilong en i hang lois, na em i mas kisim hap bilong maus bilong en, na em i mas singaut, ‘Nogut, nogut!’

original: As long as he has the infection, he remains unclean. He must live alone in a place outside the camp.
translation: Olsem long olsem em i gat sik, em i nosave bilong pkinini yet, na em mas go wankain, istap lonten long ples i stap outsait long ples bilong ol.

original: If any fabric is contaminated with mildew—any wool or linen garment,
translation: Sapos eni kain bilum i kamap moa wantaim graon bilak, eni kain rausim wool o lingen kan.

original: any weave or knit of linen or wool, or any article of leather—
translation: Ol samting ya em i go long wokim string bilong klos na tricot, linin, wul, o letha –

original: and if the mark in the fabric, leather, weave, knit, or leather article is green or red, then it is contaminated with mildew and must be shown to the priest.
translation: Na sios em i stap long klos, sip, mat o samting narakain, na em i grin o ret, orait em i birua wantaim maiti, na bai em i mas showim long pries.

original: And the priest is to examine the mildew and isolate the contaminated fabric for seven days.
translation: Na prist i suskim na lukim spak bilong mait, na em bai kisim asid na rausim klost we i gat diri long seven de.

original: On the seventh day the priest shall reexamine it, and if the mildew has spread in the fabric, weave, knit, or leather, then regardless of how it is used, it is a harmful mildew; the article is unclean.
translation: Long wik sei ven pris ol i go lukim gen, na if mipela harim ol i go daun long klos, wev, knit, o sip, tasol usim em long wanem, em i bikpela hatwok; samting em i nogut, em i olsem nogut.

original: He is to burn the fabric, weave, or knit, whether the contaminated item is wool or linen or leather. Since the mildew is harmful, the article must be burned up.
translation: Em i mas bungim klos, wokim, or rekde, samting i bin pkin, ita bai wool, linen, o sip. Bikos sik muc em i bagarap, mas geta bung olgeta.

original: But when the priest reexamines it, if the mildew has not spread in the fabric, weave, knit, or leather article,
translation: Bai wannem pries em i lukim gen, sapos stong bilong graon em i no go antap long klos, wokim klos, o samting ol i wokim long sikis,

original: the priest is to order the contaminated article to be washed and isolated for another seven days.
translation: Pries i mas tokim ol wasim samting bilong bagarap na kisim ap long wail long namba seven de nogat.

original: After it has been washed, the priest is to reexamine it, and if the mildewed article has not changed in appearance, it is unclean. Even though the mildew has not spread, you must burn it, whether the rot is on the front or back.
translation: Bihaen long em i wasim finis, prist i mas reexamine again, sapos samting i gat milda i no bin changeap appearance yet, em i nogut, unclean. Nogat, even though milda i no go raun raun, yu mas burnim em, wether rot i stap long fron o bak.

original: If the priest examines it and the mildew has faded after it has been washed, he must cut the contaminated section out of the fabric, leather, weave, or knit.
translation: Pries i kam bekim eksaminashon long em, na moldi i bin go daun bihain long wasim, em bai katim aut sekshen kontamina long klos, sip, wevm, o nait.

original: But if it reappears in the fabric, weave, or knit, or on any leather article, it is spreading. You must burn the contaminated article.
translation: Bai em i kam bek gen long klos, stretim, knitem, o wivim antap long eni samting letha, em i go daun. Yu mas burnim samting i pkin.

original: If the mildew disappears from the fabric, weave, or knit, or any leather article after washing, then it is to be washed again, and it will be clean.
translation: Sapos maul bilong graas i go daun long klos, weave, knit, o samting bilong letha bihaen long wasim, then em bai wasim gen, na em bai klia.

original: This is the law concerning a mildew contamination in wool or linen fabric, weave, or knit, or any leather article, for pronouncing it clean or unclean.”
translation: Dispela em i lo bilong paitim ol samting i kamap doti long wul, linen, wev, knit, o letha, long stret bilong givim tok olsem em i klia o em i doti.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “This is the law for the one afflicted with a skin disease on the day of his cleansing, when he is brought to the priest.
translation: Dispela em i loa bilong cleansing long man husat i gat sik bilong skin, long de bikos em i kamap strong gen na em i go long pastor.

original: The priest is to go outside the camp to examine him, and if the skin disease of the afflicted person has healed,
translation: Prist i go longwe nau long namel, na em i lukim i tokautim man i katik, na if sik disease skin bilong man i katik i helem,

original: the priest shall order that two live clean birds, cedar wood, scarlet yarn, and hyssop be brought for the one to be cleansed.
translation: Pris i mas tokim ol man bung wantaim, long noken kisim bek long dispela man i mas klia, bai ol i bringim tupla pisin i stap strong na klin, timber bilong cedar, wol i stap reddim, na hyssop.

original: Then the priest shall command that one of the birds be slaughtered over fresh water in a clay pot.
translation: Na pris ya susu i tokaut long wanpela birid i pkinis pinis antap long wara fres i go insait long pot bilong kla.

original: And he is to take the live bird together with the cedar wood, scarlet yarn, and hyssop, and dip them into the blood of the bird that was slaughtered over the fresh water.
translation: Na em bai kisim pisin i stap yet, timber cedar, wol yela, na hyssop, na pulim ol i go insait long blod bilong pisin i bin katim ovasi long wara nupela.

original: Seven times he shall sprinkle the one to be cleansed of the skin disease. Then he shall pronounce him clean and release the live bird into the open field.
translation: Seven taim em bai sprikim man husat i gat sik diseas bilong skin. Olsem na em i ken klean i go, na yumi mus tokim em olsem em i klean, na lusi birid i stap yet i go long graun bilong bus.

original: The one being cleansed must wash his clothes, shave off all his hair, and bathe with water; then he will be ceremonially clean. Afterward, he may enter the camp, but he must remain outside his tent for seven days.
translation: Man i kam klia, em i mas wasim klotes bilong en, kukim of ol gras bilong en, na wasim skin long wara; nau em bai stap klin long loa bilong God. Bihaen, em i ken go insait long ples bilong ol, tasol em i mas stap klostu long haus bilong en long wik 7 dei.

original: On the seventh day he must shave off all his hair—his head, his beard, his eyebrows, and the rest of his hair. He must wash his clothes and bathe himself with water, and he will be clean.
translation: Long long seventh de em mas kisim of olgeta gras bilong en – gras bilong hed, berd, ebrow, na olgeta hap bilong body. Em mas wasim klotes bilong en na kukim body bilong en wantaim wara, na em bai i kamap klia.

original: On the eighth day he is to bring two unblemished male lambs, an unblemished ewe lamb a year old, a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with olive oil, and one log of olive oil.
translation: Long nait bilong eit, em i mas bringim tu ram na malol man i no gat kranki, pikinini mama pig em i no bin go long yia yet, ofa bilong graun we i mezim three-tenths bilong ephah bilong flauer bilong gude imeksim wantaim oil bilong oliv, na wan log bilong oil bilong oliv.

original: The priest who performs the cleansing shall present the one to be cleansed, together with these offerings, before the LORD at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Pries bilong mekim kleanning bai bringim man ia we ibin klia, wantaim ofa ol, long ai bilong LORD, long fron bilong Tent bilong Miting.

original: Then the priest is to take one of the male lambs and present it as a guilt offering, along with the log of olive oil; and he must wave them as a wave offering before the LORD.
translation: Na pris bai kisim wanpela lek bilong ram na bringim i go olsem ofing bilong guit, long nupela laip bilong oliv tan; na em bai winim ol long win olsem win ofing bifor GOD.

original: Then he is to slaughter the lamb in the sanctuary area where the sin offering and burnt offering are slaughtered. Like the sin offering, the guilt offering belongs to the priest; it is most holy.
translation: Na em i go kilim lam long ples bilong haliv, wai ol i kilim ofing bai i kam long sin na ofing bai i go daun long ai. Olsem ofing bai i kam long sin, ofing bai i go long gil, em i bilong pries; em i haliv tru.

original: The priest is to take some of the blood from the guilt offering and put it on the right earlobe of the one to be cleansed, on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.
translation: Prist i mas kisim sampela blod long ofing bilo pasin nogut na putim em long lobel i go raet bilong man i kam klia, long finga numbu wan bilong han raet, na long bikpela toe bilong lek raet.

original: Then the priest shall take some of the log of olive oil, pour it into his left palm,
translation: Na pris bai kisim sampela log bilong oliva oil, bai putim i go long lef han bilong en.

original: dip his right forefinger into the oil in his left palm, and sprinkle some of the oil with his finger seven times before the LORD.
translation: Em i wokim finga rin i go daun long oil i stap inside palma lef, na em i sprusim liklik oil wantaim finga rin seven taim bifor ai bilong LORD.

original: And the priest is to put some of the oil remaining in his palm on the right earlobe of the one to be cleansed, on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot, on top of the blood of the guilt offering.
translation: Na prist i go putim olgeta oil i save stap yet long han bilong en, long lob pkin bilong rait ia, long thumb bilong han rait, na long bikpela toe bilong lek rait, antap long blood bilong ofing bilong gilmor.

original: The rest of the oil in his palm, the priest is to put on the head of the one to be cleansed, to make atonement for him before the LORD.
translation: Ol i stap yet na bilong oli, pris i mas putim long hed bilong man i laik klia, na mekim pepa bilong en bifor LORD.

original: Then the priest is to sacrifice the sin offering and make atonement for the one to be cleansed from his uncleanness. After that, the priest shall slaughter the burnt offering
translation: Na prist i mas sakifikim ofing bicom sin, na mekim peis long wan i kam klia fram dirti bilong en. Na bihain, prist i mas kilim ofing bicom bun.

original: and offer it on the altar, with the grain offering, to make atonement for him, and he will be clean.
translation: Givim em long altia, na ofa bilong pisin, i go het long mekim peis bilong sindaun long en, na em bai i kamap klia.

original: If, however, the person is poor and cannot afford these offerings, he is to take one male lamb as a guilt offering to be waved to make atonement for him, along with a tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with olive oil for a grain offering, a log of olive oil,
translation: Sapos man i no gat moni na em i no ina bekim dispela ofring, bai em i usim wanpela ram bilong man olsem ofring bilong gilty na bai em i go antap long han bilong preist olsem ofring bilong gilty, longen em i mekim pemilim bilong en, na bai em i kisim tenthen bilong ephah bilong flauer bilong bun i mixim wantaim oil bilong oliv olsem ofring bilong ka, na log bilong oil bilong oliv.

original: and two turtledoves or two young pigeons, whichever he can afford, one to be a sin offering and the other a burnt offering.
translation: Na tu kurukuru na tu pisin pikinini, olsem we em i mas pilai long en, wan bilong ofing blo sin na narapela bilong ofing blo bungim.

original: On the eighth day he is to bring them for his cleansing to the priest at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting before the LORD.
translation: Long eightpela de, em bai bringim ol long prist, long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting, bifor LORD, na prist bai kamapim skin bilong en i klia.

original: The priest shall take the lamb for the guilt offering, along with the log of olive oil, and wave them as a wave offering before the LORD.
translation: Pries i go kisim lek bilong ofring bilong gilty, wantaim log bilong oil bilong oliv, na wipim olsem wipim ofring long han bilong en bifor ai bilong LORD.

original: And after he slaughters the lamb for the guilt offering, the priest is to take some of the blood of the guilt offering and put it on the right earlobe of the one to be cleansed, on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot.
translation: Na bihaen long em i kilim lamb bilong ofing bipo long givim pekpek, pris i mas tek sampela blod bilong ofing bipo na putim i go long lop we i stap long rait han bilong man i kamap klia, long finga numbuan bilong rait han, na long bikpela toe bilong rait fut.

original: Then the priest is to pour some of the oil into his left palm
translation: Na prinis bai em i go pasim olo long lef han bilong en.

original: and sprinkle with his right forefinger some of the oil in his left palm seven times before the LORD.
translation: Na sakim ol i go long finga rait bilong en sampela oil i stap long palma lef bilong en seven taim bifor LORD.

original: The priest shall also put some of the oil in his palm on the right earlobe of the one to be cleansed, on the thumb of his right hand, and on the big toe of his right foot—on the same places as the blood of the guilt offering.
translation: Prist i go putim olsem oil insait long palm bilong han, na bai em i putim i go long lob o ear bilong rait, long finga bilong han rait, na long big toenail bilong fut rait - olsem hap tisa bloo bilong ofing bilon gilt i go.

original: The rest of the oil in his palm, the priest is to put on the head of the one to be cleansed, to make atonement for him before the LORD.
translation: Ol i stap bilong oil, pris i go putim ol i go long hed bilong man i mas klia, na mekim peis bilong sin long en bifor LORD.

original: Then he must sacrifice the turtledoves or young pigeons, whichever he can afford,
translation: Em mas sacrifais pijin belo o turtuldoves, wusai em ina bekim na em i kan pei.

original: one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, together with the grain offering. In this way the priest will make atonement before the LORD for the one to be cleansed.
translation: Wan olsem ofing bika i kam long sin, na nather wan olsem ofing bai i burn olgeta, wantaim na ofing bilong graun. Olsem prist bai i mekim peis long han bilong LORD, na bai i kaerim pekimples long dispela man i kam klia.

original: This is the law for someone who has a skin disease and cannot afford the cost of his cleansing.”
translation: Em i law nau long man husat i gat sik bilong skin na i no ina moni long pe bilong cleansing bilong em.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses and Aaron,
translation: Na Lod i tok long Mosese na Aron,

original: “When you enter the land of Canaan, which I am giving you as your possession, and I put a contamination of mildew into a house in that land,
translation: Wanpela taim yu go insait long kantri bilong Kanani, we Mi givim yu olsem pasin bilong yu, na Mi putim birua, sik muc, insait long wanpela haus insait long kantri,

original: the owner of the house shall come and tell the priest, ‘Something like mildew has appeared in my house.’
translation: Ieta long haus i kam, em bai tokim pries, ‘Wanpela samting olsem milideu i karim bek long haus bilong mi.’

original: The priest must order that the house be cleared before he enters it to examine the mildew, so that nothing in the house will become unclean. After this, the priest shall go in to inspect the house.
translation: Prist i mas ordaim hus ikam bilong en i go klia bifor em i go insait long en kam lukim moldi, nogat samting insait long haus bai i kam bagarap. Bihaen long dispela, prist i go insait long lukim haus.

original: He is to examine the house, and if the mildew on the walls consists of green or red depressions that appear to be beneath the surface of the wall,
translation: Em i mas suskim hus, na sapos moldi long wal i gat kol gris na ret, hole hole, i luk olsem i stap aninit long saf blong wal,

original: the priest shall go outside the doorway of the house and close it up for seven days.
translation: Prist i go autsait long doa bilong haus na lusim i klos fo sevenpela de.

original: On the seventh day the priest is to return and inspect the house. If the mildew has spread on the walls,
translation: Long sewen de, prist i mas kam bek na lukim haus. Iftaim moldi ibin go longlong olpela poroman bilong haus,

original: he must order that the contaminated stones be pulled out and thrown into an unclean place outside the city.
translation: Em mas kukim ol ston i go daun, mekim ol i kisim aut, na tromwe long ples i no inap long taun.

original: And he shall have the inside of the house scraped completely and the plaster that is scraped off dumped into an unclean place outside the city.
translation: Na em bai skrapim pinis olgeta insaet bilong haus, na plasta we em i skrapim pinis bai troim long ples i no klin longwe bilong taun.

original: So different stones must be obtained to replace the contaminated ones, as well as additional mortar to replaster the house.
translation: Stoun olgeta i gat bikim nupela, rausim stoun i pait na bringim nupela wankain, kisim moa sipuns na pasim haus gen.

original: If the mildew reappears in the house after the stones have been torn out and the house has been scraped and replastered,
translation: Sapos masalai i kam bek gen long haus, long taim ston i pinis kilim na hus i skrapim na putim plasta gen,

original: the priest must come and inspect it. If the mildew has spread in the house, it is a destructive mildew; the house is unclean.
translation: Pris mas kam na lukim. Sapos mildio i go daun olpela long haus, em i mildio i bagarapim, nau haus i no inap long stap, em i haus i no klia.

original: It must be torn down with its stones, its timbers, and all its plaster, and taken outside the city to an unclean place.
translation: Em mas pusim i go daun, kisim stoan, timba, na plasta olgeta, karim i go long bodi bilong siti, na lusim i go long ples nogut.

original: Anyone who enters the house during any of the days that it is closed up will be unclean until evening.
translation: Husat i go insait long house olsem pipia long ol dek na de, bai i krosim skin bilong spirit na i no inap kamap strong yet olsem kasol long san, tasol bai i stap olasem san i go daun bilong de.

original: And anyone who sleeps in the house or eats in it must wash his clothes.
translation: Na husat i slip insait long haus o i kaikai long em, mas wasim klos blong en.

original: If, however, the priest comes and inspects it, and the mildew has not spread after the house has been replastered, he shall pronounce the house clean, because the mildew is gone.
translation: Sapos padi kan inspektim em, na moldi i no go bek long haus bihainim em i kamapim Haus, em bai tokim husat olgeta samting i orait, bikos moldi i pinis.

original: He is to take two birds, cedar wood, scarlet yarn, and hyssop to purify the house;
translation: Em i mas kisim tu bird, diwai cedar, yor meri skarlet, na hapos, na usim ol dispela long rituel bilong puripela, olsem na em i ken purihausenhaus.

original: and he shall slaughter one of the birds over fresh water in a clay pot.
translation: Na em bai kilim wanpela pisin long wara fres inside kala pot.

original: Then he shall take the cedar wood, the hyssop, the scarlet yarn, and the live bird, dip them in the blood of the slaughtered bird and the fresh water, and sprinkle the house seven times.
translation: Em bai kisim timber cedar, hapasop, tren yarning ret, na pisin i stap yet, puilim ol long blod bilong pisin i kilim na wara nupela, na sprinkim haus seven taim.

original: And he shall cleanse the house with the bird’s blood, the fresh water, the live bird, the cedar wood, the hyssop, and the scarlet yarn.
translation: Na em bai kliaim haus wantaim blod bilong pisin, wara fres, pisin i stap yet, diwai cedar, hap bilong hyssop, na threat bilong skarlet.

original: Finally, he is to release the live bird into the open fields outside the city. In this way he will make atonement for the house, and it will be clean.
translation: Finis, em i mas lukim pisin i stap yet long laif, long graun op i go long taun ousait. Olsem nau, em bai mekim peis bilong haus, na hus bai i kamap klia.

original: This is the law for any infectious skin disease, for a scaly outbreak,
translation: Em i lak bilong olgeta sickness skin i kamap doti, long olgeta tupela skin i kamap skel, lo bilong Mosese.

original: for mildew in clothing or in a house,
translation: Long moldi i kam insait long klos o long haus,

original: and for a swelling, rash, or spot,
translation: na long pukim skin, skingil, o mak i go daun long skin,

original: to determine when something is clean or unclean. This is the law regarding skin diseases and mildew.”
translation: Long ol i makim desisen long samting em i klia o nogat. Dispela em i lo bilong sickness skin na mikila.

original: And the LORD said to Moses and Aaron,
translation: Na Lod i tokim Moses na Aaron,

original: “Say to the Israelites, ‘When any man has a bodily discharge, the discharge is unclean.
translation: Tokim ol long ol Israel, 'Wanpela man i gat sik long bodi bilong en, sik bilong en em i no inof.'

original: This uncleanness is from his discharge, whether his body allows the discharge to flow or blocks it. So his discharge will bring about uncleanness.
translation: Disla pikinini i kam long kanu bilong en, wether bodi bilong en i strongim kanu bilong en i go antap o isepim, na kanu bilong en bai bringim pikinini.

original: Any bed on which the man with the discharge lies will be unclean, and any furniture on which he sits will be unclean.
translation: Eni bed man i gat sik long bodi em i go slip long en, bai olgeta samting em i save sit long, ol bai i no inap long usim.

original: Anyone who touches his bed must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will be unclean until evening.
translation: Husat i kamap long bet bilong en, bai im mas wasim klos bilong en na wosim long wara, na em bai i stap long hevi til besain.

original: Whoever sits on furniture on which the man with the discharge was sitting must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will be unclean until evening.
translation: Husait i sit daun long furnicha we man i gat sik mun em i sit daun, bai em i mas wasim klos blong em na wasim bodi wantaim wara, na bai em i no inkleen yet long san.

original: Whoever touches the body of the man with a discharge must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will be unclean until evening.
translation: Husat i kisim bodi blong man we i gat sip mak, mas wasim klos blong en na wosim long wara, na bai i stap bagarap long apinun.

original: If the man with the discharge spits on one who is clean, that person must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will be unclean until evening.
translation: Man i gat sik mun i kusim spit long narapela man i klia, bai em wasim klos na bainim skink water, na bai em i no inap kamap stronga yet olsem til apinun.

original: Any saddle on which the man with the discharge rides will be unclean.
translation: Eni sadl we man i go long ples we i gat sik bilong bodi i rait long em bai i bagarap bilong lotu.

original: Whoever touches anything that was under him will be unclean until evening, and whoever carries such things must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will be unclean until evening.
translation: Husat i tok ikam long eni samting i stap aninit long em, bai i no inap long go long tumbuna yet, tasol i go long san, na husat i karim ol samting olsem, mas wasim klos na wara, na bihain ol i kam klia, na ol i stap apinun long san.

original: If the man with the discharge touches anyone without first rinsing his hands with water, the one who was touched must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will be unclean until evening.
translation: Igat man i gat sik muc olsem, em i tacim husat i kam, bipo em i wasim han bilong en long wara, husat i paitim em bai wasim klos bilong en, na wasim bodi bilong en long wara, na em bai i stap olsem, nogat klia, kalabus long taem bilong apinun.

original: Any clay pot that the man with the discharge touches must be broken, and any wooden utensil must be rinsed with water.
translation: Eni klay pot i go long man i gat sik muc, em bai i brukim, na eniti wud pipia em mas i wasim long wara.

original: When the man has been cleansed from his discharge, he must count off seven days for his cleansing, wash his clothes, and bathe himself in fresh water, and he shall be clean.
translation: Wanpela man i kam klia from sip blong bodi bilong en, em bai kisim kaunt long sewen de bilong kliaing, wasim klos blong em, wosim bodi blong em long wata fres, na em bai i klia.

original: On the eighth day he is to take two turtledoves or two young pigeons, come before the LORD at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, and give them to the priest.
translation: Long naiten de, em i mas kisim tu turtuldov o tu pijin smol, kam bek gen long lod, ka long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting, na givim ol i go long prist.

original: The priest is to sacrifice them, one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering. In this way the priest will make atonement for the man before the LORD because of his discharge.
translation: Pries i mas sakim ol, wan long ofing bilong sin na narapela long ofing bilong bun. Olsem na pries bai mekim pekimbilng long man long ai bilong LORD bekim ol kamautim bilong en.

original: When a man has an emission of semen, he must bathe his whole body with water, and he will be unclean until evening.
translation: Wanpela man i gat Brunswick long semen, bai em as tingim bodi bilong en i go long wara, na bai em i stap long hevi, i no inap kamap stronga yet olsem til evening.

original: Any clothing or leather on which there is an emission of semen must be washed with water, and it will remain unclean until evening.
translation: Eni klos o sol bip i gat kamapim bilong semen, mas wasim long wara, na bai i stap pipia, nogat klia, yet long apinun.

original: If a man lies with a woman and there is an emission of semen, both must bathe with water, and they will remain unclean until evening.
translation: Man i go stap wantaim meri, bodili liklik i kam aut, tupela i mas wasim bodi long wara, na ol i stap pipel i no inap klia apostol long apinun.

original: When a woman has a discharge consisting of blood from her body, she will be unclean due to her menstruation for seven days, and anyone who touches her will be unclean until evening.
translation: Wanpela meri i gat sik bilong ded yet, em i bilong blekbilong blood, na em bai i no inait long taim bilong mun em, bikos bilong mons, long sevendei. Na husat i tokim em, husat i kamap wantaim em, bai em i no inait long apinun.

original: Anything on which she lies or sits during her menstruation will be unclean,
translation: Oli samting em i lain long en long taim em i kam aus, olgeta bai i tabu long meri tait.

original: and anyone who touches her bed must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will be unclean until evening.
translation: Na husat i kamap long bet bilong meri, em mas wasim klos bilong en, wosim bodi long wara, na bai em i stap long noken klia olsem kamapim apinun.

original: Whoever touches any furniture on which she was sitting must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will be unclean until evening.
translation: Husat i kisim ken long eni samting bilong haus em i sindaun, em bai mas wasim klos bilong en na wasim bodi wantaim wara, na bai em i no inap kamap klia yet stap olsem tasol long apinun.

original: And whether it is a bed or furniture on which she was sitting, whoever touches it will be unclean until evening.
translation: Na em i olsem, em i kat long bet o tasol samting we em i sib sit long en, nambaut hu i kamap long en bai i gat birua, i no inap go long san long apinun.

original: If a man lies with her and her menstrual flow touches him, he will be unclean for seven days, and any bed on which he lies will become unclean.
translation: Man i stap wantaim meri na blod bilong meri i kamap long en, em bai i no inof long sevendei, na eni bet bilong en i go daun, olsem lo bilong klean long taim bilong mun em i go daun.

original: When a woman has a discharge of her blood for many days at a time other than her menstrual period, or if it continues beyond her period, she will be unclean all the days of her unclean discharge, just as she is during the days of her menstruation.
translation: Wanpela meri i gat sik bilong blod long em olgeta de long taim, narapela taim, long taim bilong em yet, bai em i no inaitim oldei, olsem na em yet olsem long de bilong menstruashon bilong em, tasol em i go longa dan long taim bilong menstruashon bilong em, em bai i stap olsem, kastom nogut long narapela taim, em i no inaitim.

original: Any bed on which she lies or any furniture on which she sits during the days of her discharge will be unclean, like her bed during her menstrual period.
translation: Eni bet bilong en i stap, o eni klos bilong en i sibak, o eni samting we em i sidaon long em, o eni samting we em i holim long taim bilong em i kam aut, bai ol i pipia, nogat inap, olsem bet bilong en long taim bilong em i save kisim moning.

original: Anyone who touches these things will be unclean; he must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will be unclean until evening.
translation: I kamap long tus touchedim dispela samting, em bai i no inap, em mas wasim klos bilong en na wes na was long wara, na em bai i stap long hevi, i no inap, long taim bilong apinun.

original: When a woman is cleansed of her discharge, she must count off seven days, and after that she will be ceremonially clean.
translation: Wanpela meri em i klia na stap long wara bilong bodi, em bai mas kisim de sekendei seven, na bihain olgeta samting bai i orait moa long en, na em bai stap klia long lotu.

original: On the eighth day she is to take two turtledoves or two young pigeons and bring them to the priest at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Long long eighth de, em bai kisim tupela kalap bisopos oa Tupela pijin nogut, na bringim ol i go long han bilong pries long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting.

original: The priest is to sacrifice one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering. In this way the priest will make atonement for her before the LORD for her unclean discharge.
translation: Pries i go sacrifice wan olsem sin ofing na narakain olsem bikpela ofa. Olsem nau pries bai meekim peis long han bilong meri, long karamapim bilong bodi i paul, bilong en, long han bilong Bikpela.

original: You must keep the children of Israel separate from their uncleanness, so that they do not die by defiling My tabernacle, which is among them.
translation: Yu mas skulim ol pikinini bilong Isrel longwe two hap, na olmas no ken bagarap Haus bilong mi, nau yu yet ol bai dai long rausim bodi i go daun, bikos Haus bilong mi i stap long ol.

original: This is the law of him who has a discharge, of the man who has an emission of semen whereby he is unclean,
translation: Dispela em i lo bilong man i go daun, bilong man husat i go wet long bodi, na olsem na em i bagarap.

original: of a woman in her menstrual period, of any male or female who has a discharge, and of a man who lies with an unclean woman.’”
translation: bilong meri we i stap long taim bilong mun em, bilong man o meri we i gat sik mun, na bilong man we i slip wantaim meri we i no klin.

original: Now the LORD spoke to Moses after the death of two of Aaron’s sons when they approached the presence of the LORD.
translation: Nau LORD i tokim Mosese bihaenim dae bilong tu ol pikinini bilong Aron wanka na oli go kas long ples bilong LORD.

original: And the LORD said to Moses: “Tell your brother Aaron not to enter freely into the Most Holy Place behind the veil in front of the mercy seat on the ark, or else he will die, because I appear in the cloud above the mercy seat.
translation: Na Bikpela i tokim Mosis olsem: "Yu tokim brata yurua Aaron olsem, em no ken go insait long Ples bilong Holy of Holies frei, bihain long kala laplap i go antap long sit bilong mercy long ark, nogat, otherwise em bai dai, bikos Mi apakam long kloud ibaksait long sit bilong mercy.

original: This is how Aaron is to enter the Holy Place: with a young bull for a sin offering and a ram for a burnt offering.
translation: Dispela em i pasin bilong Aaron long go insait long Ples Bilong Holigren: wetim bulmakau i no ol yet long namel bilong ofing bilong sin na ram long namel bilong ofing bilong baren.

original: He is to wear the sacred linen tunic, with linen undergarments. He must tie a linen sash around him and put on the linen turban. These are holy garments, and he must bathe himself with water before he wears them.
translation: Em i mas wearim sakrik longwe bilong linen wantaim undergarment bilong linen. Em i mas kisim sash bilong linen na wapim em raunim bodi bilong en, na em i mas putim turban bilong linen. Dispela i ol klos holigud, na em i mas wasim body bilong en long wara bifo em wearim dispela.

original: And he shall take from the congregation of Israel two male goats for a sin offering and one ram for a burnt offering.
translation: Na em bai kisim long assemblie bilong Israel tu kik bilong goat man olsem ofing bilong sin, na wanpela bikpela ram olsem ofing bilong bun.

original: Aaron is to present the bull for his sin offering and make atonement for himself and his household.
translation: Aron i mas kam long givim bulu bilong ofa bilong sin na mekim pesem bilong em yet na bilong haus lain bilong en.

original: Then he shall take the two goats and present them before the LORD at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Em bai kisim tupela goats na bringim ol i go long ples bilong Lod, stap klostu long em, long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting.

original: After Aaron casts lots for the two goats, one for the LORD and the other for the scapegoat,
translation: Long taim Aaron i kirapim ston long twopela goat, wan bilong LORD, na narait bilong goat we i karim sik,

original: he shall present the goat chosen by lot for the LORD and sacrifice it as a sin offering.
translation: Em bai presentim kenguru i win long kwin bilong lod bilong Papa God na em bai kilim olsem ofa bilong sin.

original: But the goat chosen by lot as the scapegoat shall be presented alive before the LORD to make atonement by sending it into the wilderness as the scapegoat.
translation: Sip goet bilong kros i go chosen long wanpela, em bai i kamap strong na i go bek long ples bilong LORD olsem wanem, makin peis long en, troweim i go long bus.

original: When Aaron presents the bull for his sin offering and makes atonement for himself and his household, he is to slaughter the bull for his own sin offering.
translation: Wanpela taim Aaron i kam na givim bul bilong ofa bilong sin, na em i mekim peis long en na long haus lain bilong en, em bai i kilim bul bilong ofa bilong sin bilong en.

original: Then he must take a censer full of burning coals from the altar before the LORD, and two handfuls of finely ground fragrant incense, and take them inside the veil.
translation: Em i mas kisim wanpela bokis bilong smel i fulap long kol bilong faia husait long altia bifo Long Long We Iesu, na tu hanful bilong smel i bun pis, na karim ol i go insait long bel klostu.

original: He is to put the incense on the fire before the LORD, and the cloud of incense will cover the mercy seat above the Testimony, so that he will not die.
translation: Em bai putim insens long paia bifoa LORD, na smok bilong insens bai kisim kapul long sik mun i go antap long Tok bilong Wanesi, nasel em nogat ken die.

original: And he is to take some of the bull’s blood and sprinkle it with his finger on the east side of the mercy seat; then he shall sprinkle some of it with his finger seven times before the mercy seat.
translation: Na em bai kisim sampela blod bilong bulmakau, sakim long finga bilong en long sait east bilong sit bilong grace; olsem na em bai sakim gen sampela long finga bilong en seven taim bifor sit bilong grace.

original: Aaron shall then slaughter the goat for the sin offering for the people and bring its blood behind the veil, and with its blood he must do as he did with the bull’s blood: He is to sprinkle it against the mercy seat and in front of it.
translation: Aron bai kisim goat na i go kilim olsem ofing bilong sin bilong ol pipol, na baim bringim blod bilong em bihain long veil, na em mas wokim olsem em wokim long blod bilong bulmakau: Em mas sprusim i go long mercy seat na long hap bilong em.

original: So he shall make atonement for the Most Holy Place because of the impurities and rebellious acts of the Israelites in regard to all their sins. He is to do the same for the Tent of Meeting which abides among them, because it is surrounded by their impurities.
translation: Em bai mekim peis long Ples Bilong God we i kolim Holigas Holiga long olgeta birua na bagarap strong ol Israelit i mekim, long olgeta sin blong ol. Em bai wokim olsem tu long Haus Bilong Miting, em i go rait long ol birua bilong ol, bikos em i stap klostu long ol, na i go rait long ol birua bilong ol.

original: No one may be in the Tent of Meeting from the time Aaron goes in to make atonement in the Most Holy Place until he leaves, after he has made atonement for himself, his household, and the whole assembly of Israel.
translation: Nogat man i mas go insait long Haus Bilong Miting taim Aaron i go insait long Wanpela Holi Plies We na em i mekim pekpek bilong kisim bek sin, na em i no inap kam bek gen, bai em i mekim pekpek bilong kisim bek sin long en yet, long husat i bilong em, na long olgeta manmeri bilong Israel i kam togeta.

original: Then he shall go out to the altar that is before the LORD and make atonement for it. He is to take some of the bull’s blood and some of the goat’s blood and put it on all the horns of the altar.
translation: Em bai go long ol altar we i stap bifor BETEN na me kim bekim riti bilong pesem long en. Em bai kisim blod bilong bulmakau na blod bilong goat na putim i long ol horn bilong altar.

original: He is to sprinkle some of the blood on it with his finger seven times to cleanse it and consecrate it from the uncleanness of the Israelites.
translation: Em bai usim diksam bilong blood long han bilong en, seven taim, olsem em inap kamap klia na halim long olgeta birua na nogat gupela sindaun bilong Ol Israel.

original: When Aaron has finished purifying the Most Holy Place, the Tent of Meeting, and the altar, he is to bring forward the live goat.
translation: Wanpela taim Aaron i kamap long wok bilong pusi Holi of Holies, Haus Bilong Miting, na alta pinis, em bai bringim goat i stap yet i go kam.

original: Then he is to lay both hands on the head of the live goat and confess over it all the iniquities and rebellious acts of the Israelites in regard to all their sins. He is to put them on the goat’s head and send it away into the wilderness by the hand of a man appointed for the task.
translation: Em bai rupia tupela han long hed bilong goat i stap, na em bai kisim bek long mouth ol samting nogut, ol wok bilong bagarap, na sin bilong Israelites. Em bai putim ol i go antap long hed bilong goat, na em bai drivim i go long bus olsem ples bilong banisim o kliaim, long han bilong man we em i pikinim long wok dispela.

original: The goat will carry on itself all their iniquities into a solitary place, and the man will release it into the wilderness.
translation: Misis bilong goat bai karim bek long en ol samting nogut ol i mekim, na bai i go long ples wei igat nogat man, na man bai lusim i go long bus.

original: Then Aaron is to enter the Tent of Meeting, take off the linen garments he put on before entering the Most Holy Place, and leave them there.
translation: Na Aaron i go insait long Haus bilong Miting, rausim klotes linen em i putim bikos em i go insait long Ples Bilong Holide Holide, na lusim ol i stap.

original: He is to bathe himself with water in a holy place and put on his own clothes. Then he must go out and sacrifice his burnt offering and the people’s burnt offering to make atonement for himself and for the people.
translation: Em i go wasim skin bilong en wantaim wara long ples bilong holigren, na putim klos bilong en yet. Olsem em i go aut na sakrifais ofa bilong bun bilong en yet na ofa bilong bun bilong ol pipol, na em i mekim peis longen yet na long ol pipol.

original: He is also to burn the fat of the sin offering on the altar.
translation: Em i mas burnim mama bilong ofing bilong sin long altare.

original: The man who released the goat as the scapegoat must wash his clothes and bathe himself with water; afterward he may reenter the camp.
translation: Man i lukim goat na lusim olsem goat bilong kisim sikal, em i mas wasim klotes bilong en na kukim skin bilong en wantaim wara, na bai em i kam bek long ples kamp.

original: The bull for the sin offering and the goat for the sin offering, whose blood was brought into the Most Holy Place to make atonement, must be taken outside the camp; and their hides, flesh, and dung must be burned up.
translation: Bul na be i go long ofing blem tokol, wos blod i kam insait long Ples Bilong Gad i makim peis, inem tasol i kam autsait long ples bilong ol manmeri; na sken, flesh, na kabuk bilong ol i mas i pakim.

original: The one who burns them must wash his clothes and bathe himself with water, and afterward he may reenter the camp.
translation: Man i save bungim ol i go, em i mas wasim klos bilong en na wasim skin bilong en wantaim wara, na bihain em i ken go bek gen long ples bilong ol.

original: This is to be a permanent statute for you: On the tenth day of the seventh month, you shall humble yourselves and not do any work—whether the native or the foreigner who resides among you—
translation: Dispela em i lo bilong statut permanent long taim bilong yumi: Long dei ten bilong mun sevent, yumi mas kakarukim yuself na no ken mekim wok igo - man bilong ples o man i kam from naiton anather i stap long midst bilong yumi.

original: because on this day atonement will be made for you to cleanse you, and you will be clean from all your sins before the LORD.
translation: Long dispela de, atonmen bai mekim, na bai yu kamap klia, na yu bai i stap strong klia na fri long ol sin bilong yu bifor Bikpela.

original: It is a Sabbath of complete rest for you, that you may humble yourselves; it is a permanent statute.
translation: Sabad long ples bilong rip ot pinis bilong yupela, bikim yuself i go daun long graun; em i lo bilong oltaim.

original: The priest who is anointed and ordained to succeed his father as high priest shall make atonement. He will put on the sacred linen garments
translation: Pries bilong God we em i save long oil na i gat autoriti olsem bai bihainim tisa bilong em, em bai mekim pasin bilong kisim bek sin. Em bai putim klos bilong holidei we i gat spirit.

original: and make atonement for the Most Holy Place, the Tent of Meeting, and the altar, and for the priests and all the people of the assembly.
translation: Na me kim bekim rong bilong spirit long Ol Ples Bilong Holide Holy, Haus Bilong Miting, kaul bilong ofa, ol prist, na ol pipol bilong asamble.

original: This is to be a permanent statute for you, to make atonement once a year for the Israelites because of all their sins.” And all this was done as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Dispela em i go het na olsem wanpela loa tasol, long yupela, bikos yupela mas Mekim peis long taim wanpela yia bilong mekim penitens long ol Israel, long olgeta sin bilong ol. Na olgetsamting ol i wok long en, olsem LORD i givim komando long Moses.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Speak to Aaron, his sons, and all the Israelites and tell them this is what the LORD has commanded:
translation: Tokim long Aron, ol pikinini bilong en, na ol Israel, tokim ol: Dispela em i tok bilong LORD.

original: ‘Anyone from the house of Israel who slaughters an ox, a lamb, or a goat in the camp or outside of it
translation: Ol man hus bilong Isrel, hu igo kilim oks, lambi, o goat long ples kampe o nare go long ples i no kampe

original: instead of bringing it to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting to present it as an offering to the LORD before His tabernacle—that man shall incur bloodguilt. He has shed blood and must be cut off from among his people.
translation: Olsem man husat i no bringim ofing i go long entrance bilong Haus Bilong Miting, i go long ples bilong ofing long tabernakul bilong Bikpela, dispela man em i mas kisim skul long blood. Em i kilim man, na em i mas katim ausait long ol pipol bilong en.

original: For this reason the Israelites will bring to the LORD the sacrifices they have been offering in the open fields. They are to bring them to the priest at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting and offer them as sacrifices of peace to the LORD.
translation: Long ol dispela, Israelites bai bringim sakrifis ol i bin bringim long gras bilong kantry, na bai ol i kisim i go long pries long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting, na ol i mekim olsem sakrifis bilong peis long GOD bilong yumi.

original: The priest will then sprinkle the blood on the altar of the LORD at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting and burn the fat as a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
translation: Pris bilong God bai skaterim blod long alta bilong LORD namba wanpela entrance long Haus Bilong Miting na ol bai kaia fat na smel i kamap swit olsem aroma i ambuntim heart bilong LORD.

original: They must no longer offer their sacrifices to the goat demons to which they have prostituted themselves. This will be a permanent statute for them for the generations to come.’
translation: Ol i no ken bringim sakrifis bilong ol long goat debil ol i mekim pesion bilong ol yet. Dispela em i lo bilong statut we i stap foreva long jenarasin i kam bihain.

original: Tell them that if anyone from the house of Israel or any foreigner living among them offers a burnt offering or a sacrifice
translation: Tokim ol: if wanpela man husat i kam long haus bilong Isrel o wanpela man i kam from naiton ananit, i stap long ol, na bikim ofa bilong kotim o sakrifis

original: but does not bring it to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting to sacrifice it to the LORD, that man must be cut off from his people.
translation: Bai man i no bringim ofa bilong en go long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting i kam saksis long LORD, man ia bai i kat ol aus long ples bilong em.

original: If anyone from the house of Israel or a foreigner living among them eats any blood, I will set My face against that person and cut him off from among his people.
translation: Siposa long haos bilong Israel o man bilong kantry nait i stap long ol, na i kaikai bled, Mi bai kisim pes bilong mi i go bek gen long em, na Mi bai rausim em long ol pipo bilong en.

original: For the life of the flesh is in the blood, and I have given it to you to make atonement for your souls upon the altar; for it is the blood that makes atonement for the soul.
translation: Laip bilong flesh i stap long blod, na mi givim em long yu ol bikos blod i mas mekim peis long soul bilong yu ol long altia bilong sakrifis; bikos em blod i save mekim peis long soul.

original: Therefore I say to the Israelites, ‘None of you may eat blood, nor may any foreigner living among you eat blood.’
translation: Mi tokim long ol Yisrael, nogat wanpela blo iu ina kukim blod, na nogat wanpela man i kam bilong nesen ananit long ples bilong yu ina kukim blod.

original: And if any Israelite or foreigner living among them hunts down a wild animal or bird that may be eaten, he must drain its blood and cover it with dirt.
translation: Na sios, yuwai Israelit o man meri i kam from naiten i stap long ol, i go hapamasim animal i stap long bus o pisin lo bilong kaikai, em i mas birua blod bilong en, na kisim mati kam kova en.

original: For the life of all flesh is its blood. Therefore I have told the Israelites, ‘You must not eat the blood of any living thing, because the life of all flesh is its blood; whoever eats it must be cut off.’
translation: Bilong olkain kain animal, laip bilong ol i stap long blod bilong ol. Olsem na mi tokim Israel ol, 'Yu no ken kaikai blod bilong eni kain animal i stap yet, bikos laip bilong olkain kain animal i stap long blod bilong ol; na husat i kaikai, em bai i go daun long ples kot.'

original: And any person, whether native or foreigner, who eats anything found dead or mauled by wild beasts must wash his clothes and bathe with water, and he will be unclean until evening; then he will be clean.
translation: Na olgeta man meri, sapos yu kilala o pela kanaka, hu i kaikai nogat man i kilim, tasol i dai pinis, o ol busna monsta i kai pinis, bai em i wasim klos na sapim skin bilong en wantaim wara, na bai em i no inap long go long ples bilong olgeda yet, tasol bihain long belo bai em i kamap clean gen.

original: But if he does not wash his clothes and bathe himself, then he shall bear his iniquity.”
translation: Sapos em i no wasim klos blong en na wasim bodi blong en, baimbek em bai kisim sin blong em.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Speak to the Israelites and tell them: I am the LORD your God.
translation: Tokim long ol Israel, mi LORD God bilong yu.

original: You must not follow the practices of the land of Egypt, where you used to live, and you must not follow the practices of the land of Canaan, into which I am bringing you. You must not walk in their customs.
translation: Yupela no ken go bek long ol praesis blong kantri bilong Ejip, we bilong ples yupela usai stap, na yupela no ken go bek long ol praesis blong kantri bilong Kanaan, we mi bringen yupela go kam. Yupela no ken wokabaut long kastom blong ol.

original: You are to practice My judgments and keep My statutes by walking in them. I am the LORD your God.
translation: Yu mas praktisim ol jusis bilong mi, holim ol laen bilong mi, na i go long ol, warkim ol. Mi yet Jehovah God bilong yu.

original: Keep My statutes and My judgments, for the man who does these things will live by them. I am the LORD.
translation: Kipim statut bilong mi na majik bilong mi, ol man i mekim dispela samting bai yu ken liv olsem. Mi em i kam long LORD.

original: None of you are to approach any close relative to have sexual relations. I am the LORD.
translation: Ol famili klostu bilong yu, yu no ken go klostu long ol long mekim genocide. Mi LORD.

original: You must not expose the nakedness of your father by having sexual relations with your mother. She is your mother; you must not have sexual relations with her.
translation: Yu no ken mekim bekim skin bilong papa bilong yu, yanua long gat wes tekewe wantaim mama bilong yu. Em i mama bilong yu, yu no ken gat wes tekewe wantaim em.

original: You must not have sexual relations with your father’s wife; it would dishonor your father.
translation: Yu no ken gat wok long wife bilong papa bilong yu; em bai bringim shame long papa bilong yu.

original: You must not have sexual relations with your sister, either your father’s daughter or your mother’s daughter, whether she was born in the same home or elsewhere.
translation: Yu no ken gat seksuel reliesen wantaim susa bilong yu, em dota bilong papa bilong yu o dota bilong mama bilong yu, wether em i kam long hap same haus o apa.

original: You must not have sexual relations with your son’s daughter or your daughter’s daughter, for that would shame your family.
translation: Yu no ken gat wok long dota bilong yangpela bilong yu, o dota bilong dota bilong yu, dispela em bai bringim shame long famili bilong yu.

original: You must not have sexual relations with the daughter of your father’s wife, born to your father; she is your sister.
translation: Yu no ken gat wes wantaim susa bilong yu, em meri bilong papa bilong yu, em i pikinini bilong papa bilong yu; em i susa bilong yu.

original: You must not have sexual relations with your father’s sister; she is your father’s close relative.
translation: Yu no ken gat seksuel relisen wantsaim susa bilong papa yu, em i wanpela nambis bilong papa yu.

original: You must not have sexual relations with your mother’s sister, for she is your mother’s close relative.
translation: Yu no ken gat seksuel reliesen long susa bilong mama bilong yu, bikos em i wontok bilong mama bilong yu.

original: You must not dishonor your father’s brother by approaching his wife to have sexual relations with her; she is your aunt.
translation: Yu no ken bekim shame long brata bilong papa, olsem yu go klostu long meri bilong em, na yu laik gat wes tekne wantaim em; em i ant bilong yu.

original: You must not have sexual relations with your daughter-in-law. She is your son’s wife; you are not to have sexual relations with her.
translation: Yu no ken gat seksuel relisen long dota bilong pikinini bilong yu. Em i wai bilong pikinini bilong yu; yu no ken gat seksuel relisen long em.

original: You must not have sexual relations with your brother’s wife; that would shame your brother.
translation: Yu no ken gat seksuel reliesen wantaim meri bilong brata bilong yu; bai bringim shame long brata bilong yu.

original: You must not have sexual relations with both a woman and her daughter. You are not to marry her son’s daughter or her daughter’s daughter and have sexual relations with her. They are close relatives; it is depraved.
translation: Yupela no ken gat wes seksuel wantaim meri na pikinini meri bilong em. Yupela no ken marit Pikinini bilong Pikinini man bilong en, o Pikinini bilong Pikinini meri bilong en, na gat wes seksuel wantaim ol. Ol i relisen bilong famili stret, na i stap long pekpek, em i birua tru.

original: You must not take your wife’s sister as a rival wife and have sexual relations with her while your wife is still alive.
translation: Yu no ken tekem susa meri bilong meri bilong yu olsem meri i kam bihain, na yu kaikai wantaim em, wail meri bilong yu i stap.

original: You must not approach a woman to have sexual relations with her during her menstrual period.
translation: Yu no ken go klose long meri na gat seksuel relisen wantaim em wail em i stap long mun tik.

original: You must not lie carnally with your neighbor’s wife and thus defile yourself with her.
translation: Yu no ken slip long bodi wantaim meri bilong narapela man, na yu no ken bagarapim yuself wantaim em.

original: You must not give any of your children to be sacrificed to Molech, for you must not profane the name of your God. I am the LORD.
translation: Yu no ken givim pikinini bilong yu olsem bai i go long Molek bilong kisim sacrifice, yu no ken bagarap nem bilong God bilong yu. Mi em i go LORD.

original: You must not lie with a man as with a woman; that is an abomination.
translation: Yu no ken slip wantaim man olsem wan meri; dispela em i bagarap tru.

original: You must not lie carnally with any animal, thus defiling yourself with it; a woman must not stand before an animal to mate with it; that is a perversion.
translation: Yu no ken gat seksuel reliesen long bodi wantaim eni kain animal, na yusim yorself long bagarap; meri no ken stanap bifo long mekim gen wantaim animal, dispela em i bagarap tru.

original: Do not defile yourselves by any of these practices, for by all these things the nations I am driving out before you have defiled themselves.
translation: Yu no ken doti yuself long ol dispela kastom, wantaim ol samting olsem, nau ol nesen we mi daiwance long bifo yumi, ol i doti yuself long dispela.

original: Even the land has become defiled, so I am punishing it for its sin, and the land will vomit out its inhabitants.
translation: Kantri i bin bagarap, nau mi wankainim ol long sin bilong en, na kantri bai kulkal ol i stap long en.

original: But you are to keep My statutes and ordinances, and you must not commit any of these abominations—neither your native-born nor the foreigner who lives among you.
translation: Bai yupela holim statut bilong mi na lo bilong mi, na yupela no ken wokim sampela nau bilong dispela ken - nek long pisin bilong yu, nek long man i kam bihain long yu.

original: For the men who were in the land before you committed all these abominations, and the land has become defiled.
translation: Ol man we i stap long kantri bifo yumi, ol i mekim ol samting nogut i go daun, na kantri olsem ples bilong spirit i kamap bagarap.

original: So if you defile the land, it will vomit you out as it spewed out the nations before you.
translation: Sapos yu darumim graun, bai ol i kikim yu longwe olsem ol i kulkal nau na kisim aut kaen kaen nesen bifo yu.

original: Therefore anyone who commits any of these abominations must be cut off from among his people.
translation: Olsem na, yogona long wariu long dispela abomination, em i mas i go nau long ol ples bilong en, ol i kilim yu long komuniti bilong yumi.

original: You must keep My charge not to practice any of the abominable customs that were practiced before you, so that you do not defile yourselves by them. I am the LORD your God.”
translation: Yu mas kisim na holim ka bilong mi, inap long yu no wokim kastom nogut tru ol i bin wokim bifo yu, na yu no bagarap yuself long ol kastom nogut. Mi Bikpela LORD God bilong yu.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Speak to the whole congregation of Israel and tell them: Be holy because I, the LORD your God, am holy.
translation: Tokim long olgeta kongregation bilong Israel na tokim ol: Yusim holiness bikos mi, LORD God bilong yu, em i holiness tu.

original: Each of you must respect his mother and father, and you must keep My Sabbaths. I am the LORD your God.
translation: Yupela olgeta mas givim respek long mama na papa bilong yupela, na husat i go long dei bilong Sabat. Mi LORD, God bilong yumi.

original: Do not turn to idols or make for yourselves molten gods. I am the LORD your God.
translation: No ken go bek long idoli, no wokimapim olgeta god bilong yu yet long paitim. Mi LORD, God bilong yu.

original: When you sacrifice a peace offering to the LORD, you shall offer it for your acceptance.
translation: Wanpela taim yu mekim peis ofing long Jehovah, yu mas bringim em olsem yu kamap strong long akseptenshin bilong yu.

original: It shall be eaten on the day you sacrifice it, or on the next day; but what remains on the third day must be burned up.
translation: Em bai kaikaim long de ba yu mekim sakris long en, o long de nambis; be em i stap yet long de thrid, bai em i mas burn.

original: If any of it is eaten on the third day, it is tainted and will not be accepted.
translation: Sapos ol i kaikai planti long em long dei namba tri, em i bin pundaun, na em i no ina acceptim.

original: Whoever eats it will bear his iniquity, for he has profaned what is holy to the LORD. That person must be cut off from his people.
translation: Husat i kaikai, em i bai em i bekim bikos bilong sin blong en, wantaim em i bin vilim samting we i halo long GOD. Em i mas katolongwe long ol piple bilong en, no ken go bek long ol.

original: When you reap the harvest of your land, you are not to reap to the very edges of your field or gather the gleanings of your harvest.
translation: Wanpela taim yu kukim ka moninga long graun bilong yu, yu no ken kukim inap long ol ai bilong en, nau yu no ken kisim ol pikinini kumu.

original: You must not strip your vineyard bare or gather its fallen grapes. Leave them for the poor and the foreigner. I am the LORD your God.
translation: Yupela no ken slipim ples bilong drai na kaukau bere, na yupela no ken kam bek long ples na kambekim grapes i stap klostu grin. Lusim ol long ol por manmeri na ol man i kam from narapela hap. Mi Bikpela, God bilong yu.

original: You must not steal. You must not lie or deceive one another.
translation: Yupela no ken stel. Yupela no ken givim lie oposan long ol narapela.

original: You must not swear falsely by My name and so profane the name of your God. I am the LORD.
translation: Yu no ken swear long nem bilong Mi olsem nogat tru, na dispela kem bikos yu no ken bagarapim nem bilong God bilong yu. Mi em i LORD.

original: You must not defraud your neighbor or rob him. You must not withhold until morning the wages due a hired hand.
translation: Yu no ken bihainim nek bilong yu o stilim samting bilong em. Yu no ken holim salari bilong man i wok hired, klia long moning.

original: You must not curse the deaf or place a stumbling block before the blind, but you shall fear your God. I am the LORD.
translation: Yu no ken katim mouth long ol deaf, yu no ken putim ston i go daun na mekim ol pail i fal dawn, bai yu mas save respekim God bilong yu. Mi em i Bikpela.

original: You must not pervert justice; you must not show partiality to the poor or favoritism to the rich; you are to judge your neighbor fairly.
translation: Yupela no ken skulim rait; yupela no ken givim santing i favor long ol pobai, na yupela no ken givim santing i favor long ol ric; yupela mas jugde nabata bilong yupela long wei i fare.

original: You must not go about spreading slander among your people. You must not endanger the life of your neighbor. I am the LORD.
translation: Yupla no ken go long olsem katim tok bilong bagarap nem bilong narapela man. Yupla ina ken i bringim danis long laif bilong brata yumi. Mi em i Bikpela.

original: You must not harbor hatred against your brother in your heart. Directly rebuke your neighbor, so that you will not incur guilt on account of him.
translation: Yu no ken kisim hat long haret bilong yu againstim brata bilong yu. Yu mas tok strong i go long nek man bilong yu, na bai yu no ken kisim gilt bikos bilong em.

original: Do not seek revenge or bear a grudge against any of your people, but love your neighbor as yourself. I am the LORD.
translation: Yu no ken go bek long paybak, yu i no save mekim bel hevi long ol arapela, bai yu lovim narapela olsem yu lovim yuself. Mi Bikpela.

original: You are to keep My statutes. You shall not crossbreed two different kinds of livestock; you shall not sow your fields with two kinds of seed; and you shall not wear clothing made of two kinds of material.
translation: Yu mas kisim statuts bilong Mi i go. Yu no ken mezim na wokim olsem tu kain animol ibin planti; yu no ken plantim graun bilong yu wantaim tu kain pipia; na yu no ken wokim klotes na usim tu kain matirial.

original: If a man lies carnally with a slave girl promised to another man but who has not been redeemed or given her freedom, there must be due punishment. But they are not to be put to death, because she had not been freed.
translation: Man i go long bodi wantaim meri bilong servis em i promis long narapela man, tasol em i no bin peim bikim fri yet, penalti i kam bek long en. Ol i no ken kilim olsem desoin, bikos em i no bin kisim freedom yet.

original: The man, however, must bring a ram to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting as his guilt offering to the LORD.
translation: Man i mas bringim ram long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting olsem ofing bilong en long han bilong LORD.

original: The priest shall make atonement on his behalf before the LORD with the ram of the guilt offering for the sin he has committed, and he will be forgiven the sin he has committed.
translation: Prist i gobekim pekamna long han bilong en bifor ai bilong LORD wetem ram bilong ofing bikaos bilong gilty, long sin em i mekim, na em bai lukim olgeta, forgiven, long sin em i mekim.

original: When you enter the land and plant any kind of tree for food, you shall regard the fruit as forbidden. For three years it will be forbidden to you and must not be eaten.
translation: Wanpela taim yu go insait long graun na plantim kain kain tree bilong kaikai, yu sikirim fruit olsem samting i no inarapim. Long tripela yia, em i no inarapim long yu, yu no ken kaikai.

original: In the fourth year all its fruit must be consecrated as a praise offering to the LORD.
translation: Long namba foa yia, olgeta frut bilong em bai mas holem olsem santing bilong ples na givim olsem tok birua long LORD.

original: But in the fifth year you may eat its fruit; thus your harvest will be increased. I am the LORD your God.
translation: Bain olsem, long fifth yia, yu ken kaikai frut bilong em; olsem na harvest bilong yu bai i kamap bikpela. Mi LORD God bilong yu.

original: You must not eat anything with blood still in it. You must not practice divination or sorcery.
translation: Yupela no ken kaikai samting we i gat bled yet. Yupela no ken wokim singsing o sorcery.

original: You must not cut off the hair at the sides of your head or clip off the edges of your beard.
translation: Yu no ken kotim ol gras bilong yu long sait bilong hed bilong yu, na yu no ken klipim ol hap bilong bikpela gras bilong yu.

original: You must not make any cuts in your bodies for the dead or put tattoo marks on yourselves. I am the LORD.
translation: Yu no ken kamapim ol klet long bodi bilong yu olsem yu givim respek long ol dai, na yu no ken putim mak bilong tatu long bodi bilong yu. Mi em i God.

original: You must not defile your daughter by making her a prostitute, or the land will be prostituted and filled with depravity.
translation: Yu no ken dirtim dai pikinini meri bilong yu, ol i mekim em i go bek long sindik wok, na graun em i go daun long nogut pasin, plaesa i fulap long ol samting nogut.

original: You must keep My Sabbaths and have reverence for My sanctuary. I am the LORD.
translation: Yupela mas kipim Sabat bilong Mi, na yupela mas givim respek long templa bilong Mi. Mi em i bikpela, LORD.

original: You must not turn to mediums or spiritists; do not seek them out, or you will be defiled by them. I am the LORD your God.
translation: Yu no ken go bek long ol samthing bilong spirit na ol waitman; yu no ken go lusim na sindaun wantaim olgeta, bikos yu bai i kamap olsem bagarap long ol. Mi em i God bilong yu.

original: You are to rise in the presence of the elderly, honor the aged, and fear your God. I am the LORD.
translation: Yu mas kam daun long ai bilong tumbuna, givim respek long ol biceman, na iomu bikim fear long Bikpela. Mi Bikpela.

original: When a foreigner resides with you in your land, you must not oppress him.
translation: Wanpela man i kam from otside kantri, i stap wantaim yu long lan bilong yu, yu no ken dunaim im.

original: You must treat the foreigner living among you as native-born and love him as yourself, for you were foreigners in the land of Egypt. I am the LORD your God.
translation: Yumi mas givim rispek long ol plesboi we bistat wantaim yumi, olsem yumi lovim em olsem yumi yet, bikos yumi bistat ol plesboi long kantri bilong Ijip. Mi Bikpela, mi LORD, mi God bilong yumi.

original: You must not use dishonest measures of length, weight, or volume.
translation: Yu no ken usim ol samting we nogat treu long namel, wett o vas.

original: You shall maintain honest scales and weights, an honest ephah, and an honest hin. I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt.
translation: Yu mas halim pe bilong trut na balans, efah na hin, ol i stap straikt. Mi em i Got bilong yu, we mi bin bringim yu komoto long kantri bilong Ijip.

original: You must keep all My statutes and all My ordinances and follow them. I am the LORD.”
translation: Yu mas holim ol loa bilong Mi na ol ka bilong Mi, na bihainim ol. Mi em i Lod.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Tell the Israelites, ‘Any Israelite or foreigner living in Israel who gives any of his children to Molech must be put to death. The people of the land are to stone him.
translation: Tokim ol Israel, 'Nogat wanpela Israel na nogat wanpela man i kam from anor plaes i stap long Israel, husat i givim bek wanpela bilong ol pikinini bilong em long Molech, mas i dai pinis. Ol manmeri bilong kantri i mas stonim em.

original: And I will set My face against that man and cut him off from his people, because by giving his offspring to Molech, he has defiled My sanctuary and profaned My holy name.
translation: Na mi tromoi bek long man ia, na mi kisim em bes long ol pikinini bilong en, bikos em i givim pikinini bilong en long lotu long Molek, na em i stilim bek hevi long haus lotu bilong mi, na em i bagarapim nem bilong mi we i halo.

original: And if the people of the land ever hide their eyes and fail to put to death the man who gives one of his children to Molech,
translation: Na sapos ol pipol bilong kantri klosim ai bilong ol na no larim man i go long Molek, em i givim wanpela pikinini bilong en long Molek, ol bai no kilim man ia.

original: then I will set My face against that man and his family and cut off from among their people both him and all who follow him in prostituting themselves with Molech.
translation: Na bai mi go bekim face gen long man ia na famili bilong en, na rausim em na ol i wok long sindak wantaim Molek long narawan bilong ol.

original: Whoever turns to mediums or spiritists to prostitute himself with them, I will also set My face against that person and cut him off from his people.
translation: Husat i go bekim ol samting long spirit ol dai, o husat i kamapim skin bilong en i go daun long ol samting i no gut, Mi birua face bilong Mi long en, na Mi kisim en i go aut long ol piple bilong en.

original: Consecrate yourselves, therefore, and be holy, because I am the LORD your God.
translation: Kam long na wokim yuself, na bi holigan, bikos Mi yet LORD God bilong yu.

original: And you shall keep My statutes and practice them. I am the LORD who sanctifies you.
translation: Yu mas kisim statut bilong mi, strongim ol, na wokim ol. Mi em i LORD hu i mekim yumi kalap.

original: If anyone curses his father or mother, he must be put to death. He has cursed his father or mother; his blood shall be upon him.
translation: I go long ol man o meri i karim tok bung long papa na mama bilong en, em bai i kamap long dai. Em i karim tok bung long papa na mama bilong en; bled bilong em bai i stap long en.

original: If a man commits adultery with another man’s wife—with the wife of his neighbor—both the adulterer and the adulteress must surely be put to death.
translation: Man husat i gat bikim adoltri wantaim meri bilong neba blong em, bai mas i go long dai finis, na meri husat i mekim adoltri tu, bai i go long dai finis. Olgeta i kilim ol long wei bilong penalti.

original: If a man lies with his father’s wife, he has uncovered his father’s nakedness. Both must surely be put to death; their blood is upon them.
translation: Man i stap wantaim meri bilong papa, em i kisim nabaraba bilong papa. Ol i mas kilim, bled i stap long ol.

original: If a man lies with his daughter-in-law, both must surely be put to death. They have acted perversely; their blood is upon them.
translation: Man i go long daughta bilong man husban, ol i mas dai pinis. Ol i wok long wei i no gut; bled bilong ol i stap long ol.

original: If a man lies with a man as with a woman, they have both committed an abomination. They must surely be put to death; their blood is upon them.
translation: Man i go na man, ol i stap wantaim olsem man na meri, ol i mekim samting nogut tru. Ol mas i dai, des laif bilong ol i go long bun, blod bilong ol i save long ol.

original: If a man marries both a woman and her mother, it is depraved. Both he and they must be burned in the fire, so that there will be no depravity among you.
translation: Man i maritim meri na mama bilong meri, em i bagarap tru. Ol i mas katim na kaikai long paia, olsem depravity no ken stap long mipela.

original: If a man lies carnally with an animal, he must be put to death. And you are also to kill the animal.
translation: Man i go stap wantaim animol long bodi, em bai i die. Yu mas kilim ol deswela, na yu mas kilim animol tu.

original: If a woman approaches any animal to mate with it, you must kill both the woman and the animal. They must surely be put to death; their blood is upon them.
translation: Igat meri i kam ankona long animal na mekim gen wantaim, yu mas kilim olgeta twopela. Ol i mas dai pinis tru; bled bilong ol i stap long ol.

original: If a man marries his sister, whether the daughter of his father or of his mother, and they have sexual relations, it is a disgrace. They must be cut off in the sight of their people. He has uncovered the nakedness of his sister; he shall bear his iniquity.
translation: Man i marit sisa bilong en, em i pikinini bilong papa o mama, na ol i gat wok long tok bilong manmeri wantaim, em i sakar. Ol i mas dai long ai bilong ol papa bilong ol. Em i kilim sklep bilong sisa bilong en; em bai kisim hevi pasin bilong en.

original: If a man lies with a menstruating woman and has sexual relations with her, he has exposed the source of her flow, and she has uncovered the source of her blood. Both of them must be cut off from among their people.
translation: I gat man we i stap wantaim meri we i stap long mosim, na i gat seksuel relisen wanbel wantaim em, em i kirapim sos bilong blod bilong em, na meri em i pulimapim sos bilong blod bilong em, olgeta tupela i mas rausim long ol arapela, bikim ol i no inap stap wantaim ol arapela.

original: You must not have sexual relations with the sister of your mother or your father, for it is exposing one’s own kin; both shall bear their iniquity.
translation: Yu no ken gat woks long susa bilong mama o papa bilong yu, wantaim em i bagarapim relashon bilong ol arafelo; tupela bai kisim bikos bilong olgeta samting nogut.

original: If a man lies with his uncle’s wife, he has uncovered the nakedness of his uncle. They will bear their sin; they shall die childless.
translation: Man i go long haus meri bilong pleskata, em i opim skintaic bilong pleskata. Ol i kisim bek sin bilong ol, ol bai dai na ol i no go inap bringim pikinini.

original: If a man marries his brother’s wife, it is an act of impurity. He has uncovered the nakedness of his brother; they shall be childless.
translation: Igat man i marit meri bilong brata bilong en, em i wok bilong hevi. Em i kilim skindokim bilong brata bilong en; olgeta bai ol i no gat pikinini.

original: You are therefore to keep all My statutes and ordinances, so that the land where I am bringing you to live will not vomit you out.
translation: Olsem, yu mas halivim ol loa na ol ordonans bilong mi, nau kantri we mi karim yu go laip i no bai stap pusim yu long en.

original: You must not follow the statutes of the nations I am driving out before you. Because they did all these things, I abhorred them.
translation: Yu no ken bihainim lo bilong ol nesen we mi drivaim ol i go bifo yu, bikos ol i mekim ol dispela samting, na bikos ol i mekim ol dispela, mi bilong hatim ol.

original: But I have told you that you will inherit their land, since I will give it to you as an inheritance—a land flowing with milk and honey. I am the LORD your God, who has set you apart from the peoples.
translation: Mi bin tokim yu, yu bai iheritim kantri bilong ol, na Mi bai givim long yu olsem inheritance – kantri i flowe wantaim mik na honey. Mi em i LORD God bilong yu, we em i setim yu apart long ol narapela ples.

original: You are therefore to distinguish between clean and unclean animals and birds. Do not become contaminated by any animal or bird, or by anything that crawls on the ground; I have set these apart as unclean for you.
translation: Yu mas skelim gut long ol animal na pisin, bai yu save welim ol samting i klia na ol samting i no klia. Yu no ken gat birua long eni kain animal, pisin, o sembling i go long graun; mi bin setim ol dispela apart long yu olsem samting no klia.

original: You are to be holy to Me because I, the LORD, am holy, and I have set you apart from the nations to be My own.
translation: Yu mas kamap santing wei i go long heven bikos mi, Bikpela, em i Santing, na mi tok olsem, na mi mekim yu longwe tasol i kam long ol nesen, na yu bai bilong mi.

original: A man or a woman who is a medium or spiritist must surely be put to death. They shall be stoned; their blood is upon them.’”
translation: Wanpela man o meri i go long spirit olsem, em bai i mas dai pinis. Ol i mas rokim ston long ol; bled bilong ol i stap long ol.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Speak to Aaron’s sons, the priests, and tell them that a priest is not to defile himself for a dead person among his people,
translation: Bikpela i tokim Mose, “Tokim ol pikinini bilong Aaron, ol minista, long pasin bilong ol, ol minista em ino mas bagarap himself long wok misis bilong deat long ol ples bilong ol.”

original: except for his immediate family—his mother, father, son, daughter, or brother,
translation: emas long ol famili bilong em yet - mama bilong en, papa bilong en, pikinini man bilong en, pikinini meri bilong en, o brata bilong en

original: or his unmarried sister who is near to him, since she has no husband.
