translation: Oda susa meri bilong em yet i no marit, em i nambaut wantaim em, bikos em i no gat husban.

original: He is not to defile himself for those related to him by marriage, and so profane himself.
translation: Em i no ken dirtenim skin bilong en long ol wantok bilong en we i kamap long mariage, na em i no profaneim skin bilong en.

original: Priests must not make bald spots on their heads, shave off the edges of their beards, or make cuts in their bodies.
translation: Ol priast i no ken mekim hed bilong ol i bagarap, tasol ol i no ken kisim hap bilong beard bilong ol, na ol i no ken mekim mak i kam long bodi bilong ol.

original: They must be holy to their God and not profane the name of their God. Because they present to the LORD the offerings made by fire, the food of their God, they must be holy.
translation: Oli mas holide long God bilong ol, no ken bagarapim nem bilong God bilong ol. Ol i bringim ofa na kaikai long LORD olsem ai bilong faia, em i kaikai bilong God bilong ol, na ol i mas holi.

original: A priest must not marry a woman defiled by prostitution or divorced by her husband, for the priest is holy to his God.
translation: Prist i no inap mary meri i bin paitim long prostityusen o husban bilong em i bin divosim em, wantaim prist em i hol long God bilong em.

original: You are to regard him as holy, since he presents the food of your God. He shall be holy to you, because I the LORD am holy—I who set you apart.
translation: Bamim long tingim em olsem santing wei i go long God, bikos em i bringim kaikai bilong God yu. Em bai i stap olsem santing wei i go long yu, bikos mi LORD, mi i stap olsem santing wei i go long yu - mi we i mekim yu difren long ol narapela.

original: If a priest’s daughter defiles herself by prostituting herself, she profanes her father; she must be burned in the fire.
translation: Sapos pikinini meri bilong pries wokim singsing olsem prostitute, em i mekim papa bilong em bagarap, na em mas kilim olsem long paia.

original: The priest who is highest among his brothers, who has had the anointing oil poured on his head and has been ordained to wear the priestly garments, must not let his hair hang loose or tear his garments.
translation: Prist long wei i gat bikpela posisin long ol brata bilong en, em i bin putim oil bilong anointing antap long hed bilong en, na em i bin ordainim bilong werim klos bilong prist, no ken lusim het bilong en i hang lo, na no ken rausim klos bilong en.

original: He must not go near any dead body; he must not defile himself, even for his father or mother.
translation: Em i no ken go klostu long eni bodi i dai, em i no ken bagarapim skin bilong en, nau tasol olsem em i kam ap long papa o mama.

original: He must not leave or desecrate the sanctuary of his God, for the consecration of the anointing oil of his God is on him. I am the LORD.
translation: Em i mas no lusim o tainim haus lotu bilong God blong em, wantaim ol man bilong ainiting blong God blong em i stap long en, spoilen ples bilong God blong em. Mi LORD.

original: The woman he marries must be a virgin.
translation: Meri em i mari wantaim mas i gat stil bikos em i no bin gat husban bifo.

original: He is not to marry a widow, a divorced woman, or one defiled by prostitution. He is to marry a virgin from his own people,
translation: Em i no ken mari widu meri, meri i go long divorce, o meri i bin pisin long sindak. Em i mas mari meri i nogat man yet bilong ol ples bilong em.

original: so that he does not defile his offspring among his people, for I am the LORD who sanctifies him.”
translation: Na em i no ken givim beses long pikinini bilong en long ol pipol bilong en, bikos mi LORD, mi stap mekim em hol.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Say to Aaron, ‘For the generations to come, none of your descendants who has a physical defect may approach to offer the food of his God.
translation: Tokim long Aaron, long olgenarason i kam, nogat wanpela pikinini bilong yu i gat kakai i no gut inap mas ap long ofa kaikai bilong God blong em.

original: No man who has any defect may approach—no man who is blind, lame, disfigured, or deformed;
translation: Nogat man we i gat birua, bilong, sakal, pundaun, o bagarap i kam bek long ples klia na puri long lotu.

original: no man who has a broken foot or hand,
translation: I no gat man hu i gat lek bilong fut o lek bilong han,

original: or who is a hunchback or dwarf, or who has an eye defect, a festering rash, scabs, or a crushed testicle.
translation: Oda hu i gat bak i kruk, o hu i pikinini tumas, o hu i gat problim long ai, rop bilong skin i paul, skab, o bal bilong man i bruk.

original: No descendant of Aaron the priest who has a defect shall approach to present the offerings made by fire to the LORD. Since he has a defect, he is not to come near to offer the food of his God.
translation: Nogat wanpela desendent bilong Aron pris husat i gat birua inap kam klostu long givim ofing we i mekim long paia long LORD. Bikos em i gat birua, em i no ken kam klostu long ofim kaikai bilong God blong em.

original: He may eat the most holy food of his God as well as the holy food,
translation: Em ina kaikai kaiau bilong God em i stap long ples bilong halo tru, na yu yet, kaiau bilong halo.

original: but because he has a defect, he must not go near the veil or approach the altar, so as not to desecrate My sanctuaries. For I am the LORD who sanctifies them.’”
translation: Bikos em i gat birua, inogat go klostu long skrin bilong hap, stap long ston bilong ofa, olsem inogat bagarapim ples bilong mi. Bilong yumi em i Gavman bilong hevi, em i mekim ol santuari i kamap klea.

original: Moses told this to Aaron and his sons and to all the Israelites.
translation: Mosese i tokim dispela stori long Aron na suspel bilong en na long ol Israel bilong yumi olgeta.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Tell Aaron and his sons to treat with respect the sacred offerings that the Israelites have consecrated to Me, so that they do not profane My holy name. I am the LORD.
translation: Tokim Aaron na ol pikinini bilong em olsem: Ol i mas respektem ofa bilong God we Israelites i givim long mi, so ol nogat bagarap nem bilong mi we i halo. Mi Bikpela.

original: Tell them that for the generations to come, if any of their descendants in a state of uncleanness approaches the sacred offerings that the Israelites consecrate to the LORD, that person must be cut off from My presence. I am the LORD.
translation: Tokim ol long taim bai i kam, ol genaraison i go bek, long dispela hevi, bai yumi tokim ol: em tasol, long taim ol i stap long hevi, na i kam klostu long ka bilong tokples bilong God we Israelites i wokim birua long han bilong LORD, dispela man bai yumi rausim long mai pesens. Mi em i LORD.

original: If a descendant of Aaron has a skin disease or a discharge, he may not eat the sacred offerings until he is clean. Whoever touches anything defiled by a corpse or by a man who has an emission of semen,
translation: Ol descendants bilong Aaron, i gat sik bilong skin o warawara, em i no inap kaikai ofa bilong God, tasol long em i kam klia. Husat i tetchem ol samting i defile long tubuna o wara bilong man, em i klia pinis bai em i inap kaikai ofa bilong God.

original: or whoever touches a crawling creature or a person that makes him unclean, whatever the uncleanness may be—
translation: Husat i tetchim kruim kreisa o husat i kamap long man o meri, na husat i mekim em i no klin, sips long bagarap nogut olsem,

original: the man who touches any of these will remain unclean until evening. He must not eat from the sacred offerings unless he has bathed himself with water.
translation: Man husat i kamap long eni bilong dispela, em bai i stap olsem long olgeta taim go long apinun. Em i no ken kaikai long kaikai bilong spirit, tasol em i wasim skin bilong en na bai em i ken.

original: When the sun has set, he will become clean, and then he may eat from the sacred offerings, for they are his food.
translation: Wanpela taim san i go daun, em bai kamap klia, na em ken kaikai sakramen ofa, bikos ol i kaikai bilong em.

original: He must not eat anything found dead or torn by wild animals, which would make him unclean. I am the LORD.
translation: Em ina nau no ken kaikai ol samting we I lukim dead o ol animal ibin kisim na kilim, bikos ol i mekim em i no inap long kam. Mi LORD.

original: The priests must keep My charge, lest they bear the guilt and die because they profane it. I am the LORD who sanctifies them.
translation: Pris istap mus kisim ka na raitim pasin bilong Mi, nau ol bai kisim bikos na i dai long bagarapim em. Mi em i gova na mekim ol santu, Mi em i LORD.

original: No one outside a priest’s family may eat the sacred offering, nor may the guest of a priest or his hired hand eat it.
translation: Nogat man ousait long famili bilong pries inap kaikai ofingi bikpela, na gest bilong pries o man i wok hired long han bilong pries, inap tu kaikai ofingi bikpela.

original: But if a priest buys a slave with his own money, or if a slave is born in his household, that slave may eat his food.
translation: Sapos prist baim slave long moni bilong en, o sapos slave i kamap long hus bilong em, tasol slave em i ken kaikai ka long prist.

original: If the priest’s daughter is married to a man other than a priest, she is not to eat of the sacred contributions.
translation: Iftarim meri bilong pries i marit long man i no pries, em ina kaikai no long samting bilong tokwin God.

original: But if a priest’s daughter with no children becomes widowed or divorced and returns to her father’s house, she may share her father’s food as in her youth. But no outsider may share it.
translation: Bai wanpela pikini meri bilong pries, em i lusim husban o em i dai, na em i no moa gat pikinini, i go bek long haus bilong papa, orait em inap shaere ka bilong papa olsem taim em i yus yet. Tasol, narapela man bus i no inap kam shaere ka bilong papa wantaim em.

original: If anyone eats a sacred offering in error, he must add a fifth to its value and give the sacred offering to the priest.
translation: Igat man i kaikai ofa bilong God long akis, em bai mas putim pris long em, igo long han five, na givim ofa bilong God long pries.

original: The priests must not profane the sacred offerings that the Israelites present to the LORD
translation: Pries ol i no ken stretim na profanem sakred ofing ol Israelites i givim long LORD.

original: by allowing the people to eat the sacred offerings and thus to bear the punishment for guilt. For I am the LORD who sanctifies them.”
translation: Ol i kaikai ofa bilong santu, na ol bai bekim penati bilong gilit. Wantaim, Mi LORD hu igo long mekim santu ol.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Speak to Aaron and his sons and all the Israelites and tell them, ‘Any man of the house of Israel or any foreign resident who presents a gift for a burnt offering to the LORD, whether to fulfill a vow or as a freewill offering,
translation: Tokim long Aaron na ol pikinini bilong em, na yumitokim ol Israel, 'Oli man husat i kam long haus bilong Israel, o oli man bilong narapela hap, husat i bringim gif bilong bun ol samthing longaira long LORD, bai ol i mekim dispela taim ol i mas mekim promis, o olsem wankain ofa,

original: must offer an unblemished male from the cattle, sheep, or goats in order for it to be accepted on your behalf.
translation: Yu mas givim man bulmakau, sip, o kenguru i no bin gat skindok long en, na bai ol i akseptim long namel bilong yu.

original: You must not present anything with a defect, because it will not be accepted on your behalf.
translation: Yupela no ken bringim samting we i gat dipela i no gut long hap bilong yu, em bai no kamap akseptim ofa bilong lotu.

original: When a man presents a peace offering to the LORD from the herd or flock to fulfill a vow or as a freewill offering, it must be without blemish or defect to be acceptable.
translation: Wanpela man i givim ofing bilong pis long Jehovah husat i kam long ol bulmakau o ol pik, em bai i kamapim promis bilong en o em i givim ofing long vola, tasol ofing bilong pis bai i no gat skinpela birua na i stap strong, orait bai em i kamapim ofing bilong pes.

original: You are not to present to the LORD any animal that is blind, injured, or maimed, or anything with a running sore, a festering rash, or a scab; you must not put any of these on the altar as an offering made by fire to the LORD.
translation: Yu no ken presen long LORD olsem kina animal husat i peli i no inap luk, i katim o i bruk, o i bagarap, o husat i gat sop long skin, sik bilong skin i karim bus, o skab; yu no ken putim dispela kina samting long alta olsem ofing bai ka.

original: You may present as a freewill offering an ox or sheep that has a deformed or stunted limb, but it is not acceptable in fulfillment of a vow.
translation: Yu ina ken givim olsem ofering bilong yu nau, ol bulmakau o sip bilong yu husat i gat lek bagarap o no kamap bikpela, tasol em i no ina kamap gut long taim yu promis.

original: You are not to present to the LORD an animal whose testicles are bruised, crushed, torn, or cut; you are not to sacrifice them in your land.
translation: Yu no ken givim LORD olsem kain animal husat balus bilong em i pundaun, krusim, toromwe, o kotim; yu no ken sakrisim ol long kantri bilong yu.

original: Neither you nor a foreigner shall present food to your God from any such animal. They will not be accepted on your behalf, because they are deformed and flawed.’”
translation: Nogat yu na nogat man i kam long nesen bai inap givim ka long Gud bilong yu husat i bagarap na i no gut. Olgeta samting olsem bai no inap tok aut long ain bilong yu, bikos em i bagarap na em i no gut.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lik Pikinini i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “When an ox, a sheep, or a goat is born, it must remain with its mother for seven days. From the eighth day on, it will be acceptable as an offering made by fire to the LORD.
translation: Wanpela oks, sip, o goats i kamap nau, em i mas stap wantaim mama bilong em long seven de. Long naiten de ibin go pinis, em ina kamap narakain ofing bai yumi givim long LORD olsem.

original: But you must not slaughter an ox or a sheep on the same day as its young.
translation: Yu no ken skarabai bulmakau oa sip wantaim pikinini bilong en long wanpela de olsem mama belong en.

original: When you sacrifice a thank offering to the LORD, offer it so that it may be acceptable on your behalf.
translation: Wanpela taim yu bringim sakrifis bilong tankyu long LORD, yu mas ofa im bek long em, na em bai kamap nais long hap blong yu.

original: It must be eaten that same day. Do not leave any of it until morning. I am the LORD.
translation: Em i mas i kaikai na stap long dispela de. Yu no ken lusim bek sampela kas olsem moning. Mi bilong GOD.

original: You are to keep My commandments and practice them. I am the LORD.
translation: Yu mas bihainim komandom bilong mi na wokim ol i go. Mi em i LORD.

original: You must not profane My holy name. I must be acknowledged as holy among the Israelites. I am the LORD who sanctifies you,
translation: Yu no ken bilong pilimapim nama haligud bilong Mi. Mi mas i kamap olsem haligud long ol Israel. Mi em i LORD hu i mekim yu ol i stap haligud.

original: who brought you out of the land of Egypt to be your God. I am the LORD.”
translation: bam bekim yu kam long kantri bilong Ijip ol i stap bilong yu. Mi bikpela, em LORDE.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Speak to the Israelites and say to them, ‘These are My appointed feasts, the feasts of the LORD that you are to proclaim as sacred assemblies.
translation: Tokim long ol Israel na tokim olsem: 'Ol kaen depe na mine, ol kaen depe bilong LORD, inap yu kisim olsem samting bilong halivim.

original: For six days work may be done, but the seventh day is a Sabbath of complete rest, a day of sacred assembly. You must not do any work; wherever you live, it is a Sabbath to the LORD.
translation: Long sikis dei, wok inap i kamap, tapi seventh dei em i Sabat bilong paura rest, dei bilong assemble sacred. Yu no ken mekim wok igo; we bilong yu stap, em i Sabat long Bikpela.

original: These are the LORD’s appointed feasts, the sacred assemblies you are to proclaim at their appointed times.
translation: Dispela i go ya: ol kaen feasts bilong LORD, mobilisasiun bilong haliv, usa husat yu mas kirapim long taim bilong ol.

original: The Passover to the LORD begins at twilight on the fourteenth day of the first month.
translation: Pasova long LorD i kamap long belo sun i go daun long de fourteen dei bilong mun em i kamp.

original: On the fifteenth day of the same month begins the Feast of Unleavened Bread to the LORD. For seven days you must eat unleavened bread.
translation: Long fifteenth de bilevel long mun tasol, em i stat long Kaikai Bred Nogat Rai long han bilong LORD. Long seven de, yu mas kaikai bred nogat rai.

original: On the first day you are to hold a sacred assembly; you are not to do any regular work.
translation: Long hap de poisenpela dei, mipela mas hoiim asamble sakred; mipela no inogat wok bilong oldei.

original: For seven days you are to present an offering made by fire to the LORD. On the seventh day there shall be a sacred assembly; you must not do any regular work.’”
translation: Long de namba seven dei, yu mas bringim ofa i go long paia long LORD. Long de namba seven dei, bai i gat assemblies long halivim; yu no ken wok long taim bilong yu.

original: And the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lord i tokim Moses,

original: “Speak to the Israelites and say, ‘When you enter the land that I am giving you and you reap its harvest, you are to bring to the priest a sheaf of the firstfruits of your harvest.
translation: Tokim long ol Israelit, mipela i go insait long kantri we God i givim mipela, na mipela i kisim bek harvest bilong en, inap bringim wan han bilong graun, ka moning bilong graun, i go long priest.

original: And he shall wave the sheaf before the LORD so that it may be accepted on your behalf; the priest is to wave it on the day after the Sabbath.
translation: Na em bai kilim sheaf i go bifor ai bilong GOD, olsem igat akseptans long han bilong yu; prist i mas kilim sheaf i go long de bihain long wikend.

original: On the day you wave the sheaf, you shall offer a year-old lamb without blemish as a burnt offering to the LORD,
translation: Long de ya yu winim sik bilong graun, yu mas givim bek lamp wei em i no gat kranki, em i stap long yia wan olsem ofing bung na givim go long LORD.

original: along with its grain offering of two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil—an offering made by fire to the LORD, a pleasing aroma—and its drink offering of a quarter hin of wine.
translation: Longol getim grain ofing of two-tenths ephah flauer finis i mixim wantaim oil, na smel i swit moa long LORD, olsem ofing i go long ples bilong LORD, na ka ikam long ai, na dring ofing bilong em of a quarter hin wain.

original: You must not eat any bread or roasted or new grain until the very day you have brought this offering to your God. This is to be a permanent statute for the generations to come, wherever you live.
translation: Yu no ken kaikai bret, kaukau i bin kuk, nor kaukau nupela, longwe go long de tasol bilong yu bringim ofing i go long God bilong yu. Dispela em i go bek long taim bipo na long taim namor, olsem lo bilong law, long genarasin ol i kam bihain, we bilong yu stap.

original: From the day after the Sabbath, the day you brought the sheaf of the wave offering, you are to count off seven full weeks.
translation: Bihain long dei bilong Sabat, dei yu bringim sheaf bilong ofing bung, yu mas kauntim daun sevén ful wiks.

original: You shall count off fifty days until the day after the seventh Sabbath, and then present an offering of new grain to the LORD.
translation: Yu mas kisim kaunt long fifty de, na go long dei bihain long sevendei Sabat, na bai yu brinngim ofing bilong grain nupela long LORD.

original: Bring two loaves of bread from your dwellings as a wave offering, each made from two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour, baked with leaven, as the firstfruits to the LORD.
translation: Kisim tu loaf bread long haus bilong yu, olsem ofring we i go antap, wanwan loaf em i mekim long flauer naispin, epa tu tenths, ibin bakim wantaim yiest, olsem ka bilong bipo long han bilong LORD.

original: Along with the bread you are to present seven unblemished male lambs a year old, one young bull, and two rams. They will be a burnt offering to the LORD, together with their grain offerings and drink offerings—an offering made by fire, a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
translation: Wanpela wantaim bred yu mas putim seven ol pikinini lambs i gat man, i no gat sik, wei i gat wanpela yia, wanpela bulmakau i no gat bikpela yet, na tu ram. Ol dispela bai i go olsem: em i go na i kamap ofing bilong graun na ofing bilong wara, olsem ofing we yu wasim olsem na bungim LORD - em i ofing we yu wai pupa, wanpela smel i kamap strong long LORD.

original: You shall also prepare one male goat as a sin offering and two male lambs a year old as a peace offering.
translation: Yu mas preparim wanpela male goat olsem sin ofering, na tu male lambs we i gat wonpela yia olsem peis ofering.

original: The priest is to wave the lambs as a wave offering before the LORD, together with the bread of the firstfruits. The bread and the two lambs shall be holy to the LORD for the priest.
translation: Priest i mas wim ai ol lambs olsem ofring bilong wim bifor ai LORD, long namel na bret bilong kam bek Genan moninga. Bret na tu lambs em i mas holi long LORD bilong priest.

original: On that same day you are to proclaim a sacred assembly, and you must not do any regular work. This is to be a permanent statute wherever you live for the generations to come.
translation: Long de same dei, yu mas kirapim assembli bilong wei, na yu no ken mekim wok bilong de. Dispela em i go bek long taim igo, na bai i stap olsem long statut, we bilong yu stap genarasin i go bek.

original: When you reap the harvest of your land, do not reap all the way to the edges of your field or gather the gleanings of your harvest. Leave them for the poor and the foreign resident. I am the LORD your God.’”
translation: Wanpela taim yu pilim ka moninga long graun bilong yu, no ken kisim olgeta long hap bilong gaden. Lusim bikos bilong pisin i stap na lusiim ol long ol porena na man i kam long kantri anor. Mi LORD, GOD bilong yumi.

original: The LORD also said to Moses,
translation: Bikpela i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Speak to the Israelites and say, ‘On the first day of the seventh month you are to have a day of rest, a sacred assembly announced by trumpet blasts.
translation: Tokim long ol Israel, long dai wan bilong mun seventh, bai yumi mas havim dei bilong res, sindaun i holim, na ol i kolim long saun bilong trambol.

original: You must not do any regular work, but you are to present an offering made by fire to the LORD.’”
translation: Yu no ken mekim wok bilong yu olsem taim bifo, tasol yu mas brinim ofa long paia i go long LORD.

original: Again the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Papa God i tokim Mosis gen

original: “The tenth day of this seventh month is the Day of Atonement. You shall hold a sacred assembly and humble yourselves, and present an offering made by fire to the LORD.
translation: De tenth dei bilong dis seventh manth em i Dei bilong Makim Raitim Agianim. Mipela masu gat toktok long wanpela sacred miting, yu masu bringim yu yet long bel, na mipela masu bringim ofa we mipela wakim from paia long Bikpela.

original: On this day you are not to do any work, for it is the Day of Atonement, when atonement is made for you before the LORD your God.
translation: Long de bikos, yu no ken wokim wok, wantaim em i De bilong Pesem Sin, we pesem sin i mekim strong long yu bifor LORD God bilong yu.

original: If anyone does not humble himself on this day, he must be cut off from his people.
translation: I gat man i no inapim yet long dei nai, ol i mas katim em of long ol pikinini bilong en.

original: I will destroy from among his people anyone who does any work on this day.
translation: Mi bai bagarapim long ol pipol bilong em olgeta man i mekim wok long dei nau.

original: You are not to do any work at all. This is a permanent statute for the generations to come, wherever you live.
translation: Yupela no ken wokim wok. Dispela em i lais long taim, na bai i go inap long genarason i karim na go, we yupela stap long ples.

original: It will be a Sabbath of complete rest for you, and you shall humble yourselves. From the evening of the ninth day of the month until the following evening you are to keep your Sabbath.”
translation: Bai yumi kisim Sabati bilong ples resis olgeta, na yuself yumi mas woksikim. Long apinun bilong nain dei bilong mun, na go long apinun bilong dei nambaut, yumi mas kispel Sabati bilong yu.

original: And the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok long Mosese,

original: “Speak to the Israelites and say, ‘On the fifteenth day of the seventh month the Feast of Tabernacles to the LORD begins, and it continues for seven days.
translation: Tokim long ol Israel, ka bilong Tabenakol i go long LORD em i stat long fifteenth de bilong seventh mun, na em i go inap long sevenpela de.

original: On the first day there shall be a sacred assembly. You must not do any regular work.
translation: Long dia festa, bai i gat assemble olsem santing bilong spirit. Yupela no ken wok bilong de.

original: For seven days you are to present an offering made by fire to the LORD. On the eighth day you are to hold a sacred assembly and present an offering made by fire to the LORD. It is a solemn assembly; you must not do any regular work.
translation: Long sikis dei, yu mas kisim ofa we i bagarap long ai, givim long LORD. Long dei namba et, yu mas holim bikpela toktok, kisim ofa we i bagarap long ai, givim long LORD. Em i dei bilong bikpela toktok; yu no ken mekim wok narakai.

original: These are the LORD’s appointed feasts, which you are to proclaim as sacred assemblies for presenting offerings by fire to the LORD—burnt offerings and grain offerings, sacrifices and drink offerings, each on its designated day.
translation: Dispela i stap ol de bilong LORD, na yu mas kukim olsem santing bilong halivim - mobilisasiun bilong santing bilong bringe ofa bilong bunnim na ofa bilong ka no kamap long LORD, sakrifais na ofa bilong dring, wanwan long de bilong em.

original: These offerings are in addition to the offerings for the LORD’s Sabbaths, and in addition to your gifts, to all your vow offerings, and to all the freewill offerings you give to the LORD.
translation: Dispela ofring i kam bek gen long olgeta ofring long Sabat Dei bilong Lod, na long olgeta gift yu givim, long olgeta vov ofring, na long olgeta freewil ofring yu givim long volken bilong yu long Lod.

original: On the fifteenth day of the seventh month, after you have gathered the produce of the land, you are to celebrate a feast to the LORD for seven days. There shall be complete rest on the first day and also on the eighth day.
translation: Long fifteenth de long sevén mun, bihaenim yu kam kaikai kolos long graun, yu mas halivim fest long LORD olsem seven de. Bai olgeta man i go daun komplet long dia fesde na long dia etde.

original: On the first day you are to gather the fruit of majestic trees, the branches of palm trees, and the boughs of leafy trees and of willows of the brook. And you are to rejoice before the LORD your God for seven days.
translation: Long moning drai, yu mas kam bek long gathering na kisim fruit bilong diwai bilong bikpela, branches bilong palma diwai, na boughs bilong diwai bilong ol ivi na wilow bilong wara. Na yu mas halim man i rejoisa long ples bilong LORD God bilong yu long nap hap de, sefen de.

original: You are to celebrate this as a feast to the LORD for seven days each year. This is a permanent statute for the generations to come; you are to celebrate it in the seventh month.
translation: Yupela mas singsing olsem dispela kaikai bilong singsing long LORD, long mun sewen, sevendei evri yia. Dispela em i lo bilong ples nau, na bai i go long genarason i kam; yupela mas mekim dispela kaikai bilong singsing long mun sewen.

original: You are to dwell in booths for seven days. All the native-born of Israel must dwell in booths,
translation: Yupela mas stap long han hus long sevenpela de. Ol pipol bilong ples Israel, yupela mas stap long han hus.

original: so that your descendants may know that I made the Israelites dwell in booths when I brought them out of the land of Egypt. I am the LORD your God.’”
translation: Na ol pikinini bilong yu yet mas save, mi mekim Israel i stap long haus bilong leaf, wän mi kam bekim ol i go long kantri Egypt. Mi em i God bilong yu.

original: So Moses announced to the Israelites the appointed feasts of the LORD.
translation: Na Moses i tokim ol Israel long ol de i pundaon bilong LORD.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Command the Israelites to bring you pure oil of pressed olives for the light, to keep the lamps burning continually.
translation: Iusim tok long Ol Israel, ol mas bringim oil paiya bilong oliv pipel i pres long lait, olsem lamp i stap lait oltaim.

original: Outside the veil of the Testimony in the Tent of Meeting, Aaron is to tend the lamps continually before the LORD from evening until morning. This is to be a permanent statute for the generations to come.
translation: Bihain long bilong veil blong Testimoni long Haus blong Miting, Aaron mas kisim ka long lams olgeta taim bifor LORD, from evning go inap long moning. Dispela em i wan loa blong statit long genarashun i go i kam.

original: He shall tend the lamps on the pure gold lampstand before the LORD continually.
translation: Em bai kisim ka long lamp long ples we lamp i mekim long gol pipel bifor LORD oltaim.

original: You are also to take fine flour and bake twelve loaves, using two-tenths of an ephah for each loaf,
translation: Yupela mas kisim florai goad na mekim twelv loaves, usim tu-tenths bilong ephah long bekim wanpela loaf.

original: and set them in two rows—six per row—on the table of pure gold before the LORD.
translation: Plantim ol i go long tupela lain - sikis i go long wanpela lain - long tepil bilong golpela bifor ai bilong LORD.

original: And you are to place pure frankincense near each row, so that it may serve as a memorial portion for the bread, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
translation: Na yu mas putim frankinsens bilong papa i go klostu long ol row, wokim olsem memori bilong bred, ofa bilong faia long Bikpela.

original: Every Sabbath day the bread is to be set out before the LORD on behalf of the Israelites as a permanent covenant.
translation: Long olgeta de bilong Sabat, bret i mas go long ples we bifor LORD long han bilong Israel olsem wonem covenant tru.

original: It belongs to Aaron and his sons, who are to eat it in a holy place; for it is to him a most holy part of the offerings made by fire to the LORD—his portion forever.”
translation: Em i bilong Aaron na ol pikinini bilong en, ol i mas kaikai long ples santing; em i pati moa santing long givim ol samting we i go daun long paia long Bikpela – em i ka no ken go daun long en, stap oltaim.

original: Now the son of an Israelite mother and an Egyptian father went out among the Israelites, and a fight broke out in the camp between him and an Israelite.
translation: Nau, pikinini blo mama Israelait na papa Ijip i go aut long ol Israelait, na fait i kamap long ples kanu bitwen em na wanpela Israelait.

original: The son of the Israelite woman blasphemed the Name with a curse. So they brought him to Moses. (His mother’s name was Shelomith daughter of Dibri, of the tribe of Dan.)
translation: Pikinini blo Israel meri i susa i go bekim olsem nogut long Nem bilong God, na ol i kam kisim em na kisim em go long Musa. Mama bilong em, nem bilong em Shelomith, pikinini meri bilong Dibri, blo taim bilong Dan.

original: They placed him in custody until the will of the LORD should be made clear to them.
translation: Ol i putim em insait long kis, long taem bikos oli waitim na bilong Bikpela bai i kamap klia long ol.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Take the blasphemer outside the camp, and have all who heard him lay their hands on his head; then have the whole assembly stone him.
translation: Kisim man i bin kurukuru na karamapim i go long way bilong kamp, ol man i bin harim toktok bilong en, ol mas putim han bilong ol long het bilong en, na bihain ol pipel olgeta bung mas rokim ston long en.

original: And you are to tell the Israelites, ‘If anyone curses his God, he shall bear the consequences of his sin.
translation: Yu mas tokim ol Isrelita, 'Yuspela man i kros Bikpela bilong en, em bai bekim pes bilong sin bilong en.'

original: Whoever blasphemes the name of the LORD must surely be put to death; the whole assembly must surely stone him, whether he is a foreign resident or native; if he blasphemes the Name, he must be put to death.
translation: Husat i nau kurakai nem bilong LORD, em i mas dai pinis; olgeta assembli i mas paitim ston long em, wether em i man bilong narapela kantri o indigenous, tasol if em i kurakai Nem bilong GOD, em i mas dai pinis.

original: And if a man takes the life of anyone else, he must surely be put to death.
translation: Na man i kirapim laip bilong arapela man, em i mas dai tasol.

original: Whoever kills an animal must make restitution—life for life.
translation: Husai i kilim animal, em i mas pisim bek - laip bilong laip.

original: If anyone injures his neighbor, whatever he has done must be done to him:
translation: Sapos wanpela i krosim nambis bilong em, olgeta samting em i mekim, bai ol i mekim long em: ain bilong ain, tis bilong tis.

original: fracture for fracture, eye for eye, tooth for tooth. Just as he injured the other person, the same must be inflicted on him.
translation: Bruk bilong bruk, ai bilong ai, tith bilong tith. Olsem em i kam bagarapim narapela man, olsem nau em bai i kam bagarap long em gen.

original: Whoever kills an animal must make restitution, but whoever kills a man must be put to death.
translation: Husat i kilim animal, em i mas givim bek long moni i takim, tasol husat i kilim man, em i mas dai.

original: You are to have the same standard of law for the foreign resident and the native; for I am the LORD your God.’”
translation: Yu mas husatim wanpela laik bilong loa long ol ples narapela i kam na long ol indigenous; bikos LORD Bikpela yu em i tok olsem.

original: Then Moses spoke to the Israelites, and they took the blasphemer outside the camp and stoned him. So the Israelites did as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Na Moses i tokim ol Israel, na ol i kisim man blong blaspheme na kisim i go ousait long kanu, na ol i kilim em wantaim ston. Na ol Israel i mekim olsem LORD i bin tokim Moses.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses on Mount Sinai,
translation: Bikpela i tok long Mosese long Maunt Sinay,

original: “Speak to the Israelites and say to them: When you enter the land that I am giving you, the land itself must observe a Sabbath to the LORD.
translation: Tokim long ol Israel na tokim ol: Wanpela taim yu go insait long kantri we mi givim yu, kantri em yet mas lukautim dei bilong Sabat long LORDE.

original: For six years you may sow your field and prune your vineyard and gather its crops.
translation: Long stret six yia yu ken plantim graun bilong yu, kisim kot bilong win, na kambekim ka bilong en.

original: But in the seventh year there shall be a Sabbath of complete rest for the land—a Sabbath to the LORD. You are not to sow your field or prune your vineyard.
translation: Bai long namba seven yia, bai i kamap wanpela Sabat bilong ples tasol – em i Sabat long han bilong LORD. Yu no ken plantim graun bilong yu o yu no ken kisim win bilong yu.

original: You are not to reap the aftergrowth of your harvest or gather the grapes of your untended vines. The land must have a year of complete rest.
translation: Yupela no ken kai kai kunai i stap long graun biloong yupela, na yupela no ken kam kaikai grape bilong vine we yupela i no wokim bekim. Lan i masi havim yia blo pabrik long en.

original: Whatever the land yields during the Sabbath year shall be food for you—for yourself, your manservant and maidservant, the hired hand or foreigner who stays with you,
translation: Olgeta samting ples i kamap long yia bilong Sabat, em i kamap olka long ka, na bai yu kaikai, yu, man husat i wokim wok long yu, meri husat i wokim wok long yu, na husat i kisim pe long wokim wok long yu o Aus man i stap wantaim yu.

original: and for your livestock and the wild animals in your land. All its growth may serve as food.
translation: Na long ol pikinini animal bilong yu, na long ol bus na moninga kain kain animal long graun bilong yu, Olsen gekem i go long kaikai tasol.

original: And you shall count off seven Sabbaths of years—seven times seven years—so that the seven Sabbaths of years amount to forty-nine years.
translation: Na yu mas kisim kaunt long sevnpela Sabat bilong yia - sevnpela taim sevnpela yia - na husat i kamap olgeta long 49 yia.

original: Then you are to sound the horn far and wide on the tenth day of the seventh month, the Day of Atonement. You shall sound it throughout your land.
translation: Bai yu kirapim trambul longwe na waid long tenth de bilong sevenc mondh, em i De bilong Pusiun. Yu mas kirapim trambul olsem signal long olgeta hap bilong kantri.

original: So you are to consecrate the fiftieth year and proclaim liberty in the land for all its inhabitants. It shall be your Jubilee, when each of you is to return to his property and to his clan.
translation: Makim holidei long yia 50, na kisim tok bilong fri long kantri olgeta long en. Em bai i kamap olsem Taim bilong Jubilee, na husat i go bek long ples bilong en, na husat i go bek long clan bilong en.

original: The fiftieth year will be a Jubilee for you; you are not to sow the land or reap its aftergrowth or harvest the untended vines.
translation: Yia kaipela fifty bai i kam, na em bai i go olsem Kaikai Bilong Frees bilong yu; yu no ken plantim graun, bai katim gras we i kam bihain, o bai katim win bilong drai.

original: For it is a Jubilee; it shall be holy to you. You may eat only the crops taken directly from the field.
translation: Em i Jubili; bai em i holu long yu. Yu inap kaikai kaukau na fraut bilong graun, tasol.

original: In this Year of Jubilee, each of you shall return to his own property.
translation: Long Yia Jubili, yupela yet ol i go bek long propati bilong ol.

original: If you make a sale to your neighbor or a purchase from him, you must not take advantage of each other.
translation: Yupela no ken usim i go long nekiba bilong yupela, sapos yupela mekim sel o bamaim long em, matesen.

original: You are to buy from your neighbor according to the number of years since the last Jubilee; he is to sell to you according to the number of harvest years remaining.
translation: Bai bilong yu baim long nek bilong yu olsem nembla bilong yia sinds long laspela Jubilee; bai selim i go long yu olsem nembla bilong yia bilong harvest we i stap.

original: You shall increase the price in proportion to a greater number of years, or decrease it in proportion to a lesser number of years; for he is selling you a given number of harvests.
translation: Yu mas ekim pris long em olsem planti yia i go i kam, o yu tam pris i go daun olsem liklik yia tasol i stap; wantaim em i selim yu harvest long namel, na yu baim ol harvest ya.

original: Do not take advantage of each other, but fear your God; for I am the LORD your God.
translation: No ken slipim i go long ol narapela, stap io tremba long Bikpela, wantaim yu save olsem: Mi em i LORD God bilong yu.

original: You are to keep My statutes and carefully observe My judgments, so that you may dwell securely in the land.
translation: Yu mas kisim statut bilong mi na halivim, na yu mas bihainim judgment bilong mi, kalap so yu ken stap long ples na lukautim yuself long pece.

original: Then the land will yield its fruit, so that you can eat your fill and dwell in safety in the land.
translation: Kantri bai givim planti ka, na yu ken kaikai belolong yu yet, stap long ples, na yu no inaf.

original: Now you may wonder, ‘What will we eat in the seventh year if we do not sow or gather our produce?’
translation: Yu yet bai wanem, pez long yumi bai kai long namba sevén yia, sapos yumi no planim oa kamakim?

original: But I will send My blessing upon you in the sixth year, so that the land will yield a crop sufficient for three years.
translation: Mi bai sendim blessing bilong Mi long yia namba sikis, na graun bai kisim kanu win, inap long yia tripela.

original: While you are sowing in the eighth year, you will be eating from the previous harvest, until the ninth year’s harvest comes in.
translation: Wail yu plantim ka long yia namba 8, yu bai kaikai long ka bilong ples bifo, na rait na klostu long yia namba 9 ka i kam.

original: The land must not be sold permanently, because it is Mine, and you are but foreigners and residents with Me.
translation: Graun em i no ken sel oltaim, bikos em i bilong Mi, na yupela i man bilong narapela kantri, stap wantaim Mi olsem tenaman.

original: Thus for every piece of property you possess, you must provide for the redemption of the land.
translation: Long olgeta samting bilong papa graun, yu mas providim ka long baiem bek long graun.

original: If your brother becomes impoverished and sells some of his property, his nearest of kin may come and redeem what his brother has sold.
translation: I gat wanpela brata, em i kukim na em selim sampela bilong en long ol samting, brata bilong em i kambek, i ken kam, em baim bek ol samting em nau bilong brata.

original: Or if a man has no one to redeem it for him, but he prospers and acquires enough to redeem his land,
translation: Otasem, man i no gat husat i ken bekim em, tasol em i wok strong na i kisim planti, na bai em i ken bekim graun bilong en.

original: he shall calculate the years since its sale, repay the balance to the man to whom he sold it, and return to his property.
translation: Em i mas kaunkulim yia sins sel i kam, peim bek balans long man i bin selim ples bilong en, na i go bek long ples bilong en.

original: But if he cannot obtain enough to repay him, what he sold will remain in possession of the buyer until the Year of Jubilee. In the Jubilee, however, it is to be released, so that he may return to his property.
translation: Bai em i no inap nemu enuf long bekim pe, ol samting em i salim bai i stap yet long han bilong baiman, na i go long Yia bilong Freedom. Na long Yia bilong Freedom, em bai i kamout fri, na em bai i go bak long ples bilong en.

original: If a man sells a house in a walled city, he retains his right of redemption until a full year after its sale; during that year it may be redeemed.
translation: Igat man i salim haus long taun we i gat fenis, em i holim rait bilong en i baim bek, na em i ken usim rait ia long yia kamap; long yia ia bai em i ken baim bek.

original: If it is not redeemed by the end of a full year, then the house in the walled city is permanently transferred to its buyer and his descendants. It is not to be released in the Jubilee.
translation: I sibai yua kamap na em i no skelim, bikos em i go long olsem, haus ikam long taun we i gat fenis i go i stap long hap bilong man i baim na ol pikinini bilong papa na mama oltaim. Em i no ken go bek gen long taim bilong Jubilee.

original: But houses in villages with no walls around them are to be considered as open fields. They may be redeemed, and they shall be released in the Jubilee.
translation: Haus i stap long ples vilij i no gat banis, ol bikim olsem graun op. Inap em i bekim bek, na bai em i let long yia Jubili.

original: As for the cities of the Levites, the Levites always have the right to redeem their houses in the cities they possess.
translation: Long taun bilong Levi, Levi i gat pait long baim bek haus bilong ol long taim ol i laik long taun ol i bosim.

original: So whatever belongs to the Levites may be redeemed—a house sold in a city they possess—and must be released in the Jubilee, because the houses in the cities of the Levites are their possession among the Israelites.
translation: Olgeta samting bilong Levaiti inap em i ken redeem, hus ikam long siti ol i bosim, mas lukautim na lusim long taim bilong Jubili, wantaim hus long siti bilong Levaiti i stap bilong ol long taim bung bilong Israelaiti.

original: But the open pastureland around their cities may not be sold, for this is their permanent possession.
translation: Bareket na graun we i go ronraun long siti bilong ol, em ino ken sel, kosi dispela em i ples bilong ol long taim.

original: Now if your countryman becomes destitute and cannot support himself among you, then you are to help him as you would a foreigner or stranger, so that he can continue to live among you.
translation: Sapos brata bilong kantri i kamap nating na i no ina bekim em yet, yu mas helpim em olsem yu helpim man i kam long narapela ples, na em bai i stap nabaut long yupela.

original: Do not take any interest or profit from him, but fear your God, that your countryman may live among you.
translation: Yu no ken takim eni bekim moni o bekim munus long brata bilong yu, be yu mas saves long God bilong yu, na brata bilong yu i ken stap wantaim yu.

original: You must not lend him your silver at interest or sell him your food for profit.
translation: Yu no ken givim em silva bilong yu long interist, nau yu no ken selim ka bilong yu long em olsem yu laik kamap profot.

original: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt to give you the land of Canaan and to be your God.
translation: Mi em i Bikpela, God bilong yu, nau mi kam bekim yupela long kantri bilong Ijip, long givim yupela kantri bilong Kanaan, na long kam bilong God bilong yupela.

original: If a countryman among you becomes destitute and sells himself to you, then you must not force him into slave labor.
translation: I gat brata bilong ples, em i kamap nating, na em i selim em yet long yu, den yu no ken mekim wok bembe long en olsem servit.

original: Let him stay with you as a hired worker or temporary resident; he is to work for you until the Year of Jubilee.
translation: Em i mas stap wantaim yu olsem man i wok hires o man i stap olsem gest, na em i mas wok long yu, na bai em i go long taim bilong Yia bilong Freedom.

original: Then he and his children are to be released, and he may return to his clan and to the property of his fathers.
translation: Na em, wantaim ol pikinini bilong en, bai i kam bek long hap bilong en, na em bai go bek long klan bilong en, na long gras bilong papa bilong en.

original: Because the Israelites are My servants, whom I brought out of the land of Egypt, they are not to be sold as slaves.
translation: Bikos Israelites ol i servis man meri bilong Mi, ol wei mi bringim olt long lan Egypt, ol no ken sel ol long olsem slav.

original: You are not to rule over them harshly, but you shall fear your God.
translation: Yu no ken givim autoriti i go long ol longwe time, baptisa yu mas saves tokim long Bikpela.

original: Your menservants and maidservants shall come from the nations around you, from whom you may purchase them.
translation: Ol i servis manmeri na ol meri servis bai kam long kantri i stap arondim yu, na husat yu ken baim ol long ol ples we yu laik.

original: You may also purchase them from the foreigners residing among you or their clans living among you who are born in your land. These may become your property.
translation: Yupela inap baim olgeta long ol man i kam from nesen i stap long mipela, o ol clan bilong ol i stap long mipela, ol i bon long kantri bilong yupela. Ol bai kamap propati bilong yupela.

original: You may leave them to your sons after you to inherit as property; you can make them slaves for life. But as for your brothers, the Israelites, no man may rule harshly over his brother.
translation: Yu ken livaim ol long pikinini bilong yu, inheritem olsem propati; yu ken wokim ol long slave oltaim. Tasol, long brata bilong yumi, Israel, nogat man i ken bossim ol i stap strong long brata bilong en.

original: If a foreigner residing among you prospers, but your countryman dwelling near him becomes destitute and sells himself to the foreigner or to a member of his clan,
translation: Sapos wanpela man i kam na i stap long ples bilong yu, na em i kamap strong na i planim gud, tasol wanpela brata bilong yu i no inap long ka, na em i selim em yet long dispela man i kam o long wanpela memba bilong klan bilong em.

original: he retains the right of redemption after he has sold himself. One of his brothers may redeem him:
translation: Em i gat rait bilong bem redeemi, na em i salim em yet long han bilong narapela man, wanpela brotha bilong en bai ken redeemim em.

original: either his uncle or cousin or any close relative from his clan may redeem him. Or if he prospers, he may redeem himself.
translation: Wanem famili bilong en, antikos, kusin, o narapela niu bilong kantri i mas pai baksaitim em. O tasol em i kamap strong, em ina ken pai baksaitim em yet.

original: He and his purchaser will then count the time from the year he sold himself up to the Year of Jubilee. The price of his sale will be determined by the number of years, based on the daily wages of a hired hand.
translation: Em tasol na man i baim em bai kisim kaunt long taim, stat long yia em salim em yet, kam liklik bek long Yia bilong Jubili. Prais bilong salim em bai kamap olsem, inap long namba bilong yia, strong long pe bilong wanpela man i wok hired.

original: If many years remain, he must pay for his redemption in proportion to his purchase price.
translation: Sapos i gat planti yia i kam bek, em i mas pei bekim em yet long pris bilong en olsem pris bilong en i bin kisim long bikim.

original: If only a few years remain until the Year of Jubilee, he is to calculate and pay his redemption according to his remaining years.
translation: Sapos i kamapim ol yia i nap long taim na go long Yia bilong Freedom, em i mas kalkulim na peim bekim pes blong en strongim long ol yia i stap yet.

original: He shall be treated like a man hired from year to year, but a foreign owner must not rule over him harshly in your sight.
translation: Em bai i usim olsem man husat i save wok long yia na yia, tasol masta ibeka i no ken givim em bos long hariap long ai bilong yu.

original: Even if he is not redeemed in any of these ways, he and his children shall be released in the Year of Jubilee.
translation: Sapos em i no ken save long ol samting we, em na pikinini bilong em bai i lusi pinis long yia Jubilee.

original: For the Israelites are My servants. They are My servants, whom I brought out of the land of Egypt. I am the LORD your God.
translation: Ol Israeliti em i servis man meri bilong Mi. Ol em i servis man meri bilong Mi, we mi kam autim ol long kantri Egypt. Mi em i Bikpela, God bilong yu.

original: “You must not make idols for yourselves or set up a carved image or sacred pillar; you must not place a sculpted stone in your land to bow down to it. For I am the LORD your God.
translation: Yupela no ken wokim ol selman bilong yupela, plantim piksa ka o sipal i kamap long graun, na putim ston i wokim long han bilong yu, na yu kirap i go daun long en. Bikos Mi em i God bilong yu, LORD.

original: You must keep My Sabbaths and have reverence for My sanctuary. I am the LORD.
translation: Yu mas kisim Sabbat bilong mi, na yu mas i gat respek long templa bilong mi. Mi yet Jehovah.

original: If you follow My statutes and carefully keep My commandments,
translation: Yupela i go bihainim statut bilong Mi, na yupela i mas jugumim komando bilong Mi long wei bilong save,

original: I will give you rains in their season, and the land will yield its produce, and the trees of the field will bear their fruit.
translation: Mi bai givim yu ren long taim bilong ol, na graun bai kisim ka, bringim planti kaikai, na diwai bilong bus bai karim fruit.

original: Your threshing will continue until the grape harvest, and the grape harvest will continue until sowing time; you will have your fill of food to eat and will dwell securely in your land.
translation: Tisa bilong yu bai go i stap na bosim bek long taem bilong harvest bilong drai, na harvest bilong drai bai go i stap na bosim bek long taem bilong plantim; yu bai kisim kaikai i naf finisim, na yu bai kaikai, na yu bai stap wantaim sikuriti long laine bilong yu.

original: And I will give peace to the land, and you will lie down with nothing to fear. I will rid the land of dangerous animals, and no sword will pass through your land.
translation: Mi bai givim pis long kantri, na yu bai slip long graun na i no gat féar. Mi bai rausim ol animal bilong bagarap long kantri, na sop bai no pas long kantri bilong yu.

original: You will pursue your enemies, and they will fall by the sword before you.
translation: Yupela bai pasim bek enemies bilong yupela, na ol i bai pundaun na kail bilong ol i go daun long sop bilong yu.

original: Five of you will pursue a hundred, and a hundred of you will pursue ten thousand, and your enemies will fall by the sword before you.
translation: Five bilong yu bai go bekim hundred, na hundred bilong yu bai go bekim ten thousand, na enemies bilong yu ol bai pundaun na kilim ol long sos bifor yu.

original: I will turn toward you and make you fruitful and multiply you, and I will establish My covenant with you.
translation: Mi bai kisim hevi long yu na mekim yu i kamap planti, na yu bai i go aplau, na mi bai statim pakt bilong mi long yu.

original: You will still be eating the old supply of grain when you need to clear it out to make room for the new.
translation: Yupela yet bai kaikai kaikai i stap olsem tumbuna, wannem yumi mas kisim aut na klearim, olsem yumi inap mekim rum long nupela.

original: And I will make My dwelling place among you, and My soul will not despise you.
translation: Mipela bai mekim ples bilong mipela i stap long yupela, na soul bilong mi no biruaim yupela.

original: I will walk among you and be your God, and you will be My people.
translation: Mi bai wok long narapela sais bilong yu, na Bai mi i stap kam na biyu bilong yu, na yu bai i stap kam na ol pipol bilong Mi.

original: I am the LORD your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt so that you would no longer be slaves to the Egyptians. I broke the bars of your yoke and enabled you to walk in uprightness.
translation: Mi bin stap long yu, em i Bikpela bilong yu, nau mi bin karim yu komota long kantri bilong Ijip, Olsen yu no inap i stap ol slave long taim bilong Ol Ijip. Mi bin setim yu fri long bel hevi, na mi bin givim yu strong long wok strong na katol long rot bilong yu.

original: If, however, you fail to obey Me and to carry out all these commandments,
translation: Sapos yupela i no bihainim Mina na yogel long kamapim olgeta dispela komando hia,

original: and if you reject My statutes, despise My ordinances, and neglect to carry out all My commandments, and so break My covenant,
translation: Na sapos yu rausim ol loa bilong Mi, i no gat respek long ol ordonas bilong Mi, yu no bin kisim ka long mekim ol wok bilong Mi olgeta, na brukim covenant bilong Mi,

original: then this is what I will do to you: I will bring upon you sudden terror, wasting disease, and fever that will destroy your sight and drain your life. You will sow your seed in vain, because your enemies will eat it.
translation: Mi bai mekim ol dispela: Mi bai bringim bek long yu krosim trau ai, sik bilong dai pinis, na het bilong bodi ol i bagarap lukim bilong yu, na bai drai laip bilong yu. Yu bai planim sik bilong yu i go long ken, tasol poitpin bilong yu bai kaiim, na yu no inap kukim.

original: And I will set My face against you, so that you will be defeated by your enemies. Those who hate you will rule over you, and you will flee when no one pursues you.
translation: Na mi bai plantim faes bilong me i go long yu, na yu bai kilim bek long han bilong eni a nemigas bilong yu. Ol man i no laikim yu bai bosim yu, na yu bai ranawe nogat, tasol yu bai ran i go, maski nigat i go bek long eni man.

original: And if after all this you will not obey Me, I will proceed to punish you sevenfold for your sins.
translation: Na bai mi go bek long dispela, yupela i no bin hariapim Meka, bai mi go long punisim yupela siksfold long sins bilong yupela.

original: I will break down your stubborn pride and make your sky like iron and your land like bronze,
translation: Mi bai bagarapim praid bilong strongim hed bilong yu, na mi bai mekim heven bilong yu olsem aipis, na graun bilong yu olsem bronz.

original: and your strength will be spent in vain. For your land will not yield its produce, and the trees of the land will not bear their fruit.
translation: Strong bilong yu bai i go long nogat, na graun bilong yu bai i no kamapim ka, na diwai bilong kantri bai i no karim frut.

original: If you walk in hostility toward Me and refuse to obey Me, I will multiply your plagues seven times, according to your sins.
translation: Sapos yu wokabaut long ken long me na yu no lissen, yu no obedi, bai mi karim plagi i go antap long yu seven taimes, olgeta bihainim sin bilong yu.

original: I will send wild animals against you to rob you of your children, destroy your livestock, and reduce your numbers, until your roads lie desolate.
translation: Mi bai sendim ol bek na animol i go againstim yu, ol bai kisim bek pikinini bilong yu, distroyim ol animol bilong yu, na redusim ol manmeri bilong yu, na ol rot bilong yu bai stap desolate.

original: And if in spite of these things you do not accept My discipline, but continue to walk in hostility toward Me,
translation: Na sapos yu no bilipim tok bilong mi yet, na yu yet i go long rot bilong het, nogat long ol dispela samting, yu no gat bel hat long tok bilong mi.

original: then I will act with hostility toward you, and I will strike you sevenfold for your sins.
translation: Mi bai kam aktem wanpela pasim yu, na mi bai paitim yu sevenfala tam olsem yu mekim sin.

original: And I will bring a sword against you to execute the vengeance of the covenant. Though you withdraw into your cities, I will send a plague among you, and you will be delivered into the hand of the enemy.
translation: Na mi bai bringim sot long yu bilong warkim ripos long pakt. Nogat, yu mas go bak insait long towns bilong yu, mi bai sendim sik long yu, na yu bai givim i go long han bilong eni.

original: When I cut off your supply of bread, ten women will bake your bread in a single oven and dole out your bread by weight, so that you will eat but not be satisfied.
translation: Wanpela taim mi katim bekim saplai bilong bret long yu, tenpela meri bai mekim bret bilong yu long wanpela ovn, na bai givim bret long ol man long wett, na yu bai kaikai tasol i no inap fulim bel.

original: But if in spite of all this you do not obey Me, but continue to walk in hostility toward Me,
translation: Barekat, yupela no bihainim Mi, yet yupela i go antap long hat bik long Mi,

original: then I will walk in fury against you, and I, even I, will punish you sevenfold for your sins.
translation: Na bai mi go long rot bilong bikpela i pas, na mi yet, mi yet, bai punisim yu sevenfala tam olsem yu mekim sins.

original: You will eat the flesh of your own sons and daughters.
translation: Yupela bai kaikai bodili bilong pikinini yupela, pikinini manmeri na pikinini womanmeri.

original: I will destroy your high places, cut down your incense altars, and heap your lifeless bodies on the lifeless remains of your idols; and My soul will despise you.
translation: Mipela bai bagarapim bikpela ples bilong lotu bilong tumbuna, katim daun wok bilong hevi bilong pagal igat, na kisim bodi ol i dai pinis na putim long top bilong ol spirits i no truth ol i dai pinis tu; na Soul bilong mipela bai i amamas long yu.

original: I will reduce your cities to rubble and lay waste your sanctuaries, and I will refuse to smell the pleasing aroma of your sacrifices.
translation: Mi bai bagarapim ol taun bilong yu na wasim ol hap bilong yu, na mi no laik smel gutpela smel bilong ofa bilong yu.

original: And I will lay waste the land, so that your enemies who dwell in it will be appalled.
translation: Mi bai bagarapim kantri, na ol i masalai tru long ples, eni a i kam bek long em.

original: But I will scatter you among the nations and will draw out a sword after you as your land becomes desolate and your cities are laid waste.
translation: Mipela bai kusim yu long olgeta hap na mipela bai kisim sais i go bek long yu, na graun bilong yupela bai stap olsem gras bilong kukim, na towns bilong yupela bai i bagarap.

original: Then the land shall enjoy its Sabbaths all the days it lies desolate, while you are in the land of your enemies. At that time the land will rest and enjoy its Sabbaths.
translation: Na graun bai kran i go enjoi Sabat bilong em olgeta dei em i stap desoliet, wail yu stap long lan bilong enimi bilong yu. Long dispela taim, graun bai istap, na bai enjoi Sabat bilong em.

original: As long as it lies desolate, the land will have the rest it did not receive during the Sabbaths when you lived in it.
translation: Olsem long ol i stap katikati na bosboi, graun bai kisim ripos we em i no kisim long taim bilong Sabat wankain taim yu stap long en.

original: As for those of you who survive, I will send a faintness into their hearts in the lands of their enemies, so that even the sound of a windblown leaf will put them to flight. And they will flee as one flees the sword, and fall when no one pursues them.
translation: Long ol pipel we i stap, na yu yet kam bek, mi go bringim wonem kain sik kurukuru long hep bilong ol kantri bilong ol birua, na sapos samting narakai olsem lip blong diwai i blow, bai ol i ranawe. Na ol i ranawe olsem man i ranawe long su, na ol i pundaun nogat wanman i go bek long en.

original: They will stumble over one another as before the sword, though no one is behind them. So you will not be able to stand against your enemies.
translation: Ol i pilai antap long ol olsem taim bifo naip, maski nogat man i bihainim ol, na yupela no inap planti bek long enemies bilong yupela.

original: You will perish among the nations, and the land of your enemies will consume you.
translation: Yu bai dai long kantri ol i go daun, na lan bilong eni yu yet, em bai kaikaim yu.

original: Those of you who survive in the lands of your enemies will waste away in their iniquity and will decay in the sins of their fathers.
translation: Yupela i stap olsem long kantri bilong poitpinis, bai yupela i bagarap long sakim na ogatta bilong ol, na bai yupela i birua long sin bilong tumbuna bilong ol.

original: But if they will confess their iniquity and that of their fathers in the unfaithfulness that they practiced against Me, by which they have also walked in hostility toward Me—
translation: Bai ol i tokautim olgeta namba bilong ol, na bagarap bilong tumbuna ol i bin warkim long taim bifo, na ol i bin warkim strong long mekim bel hevi long Mi —

original: and I acted with hostility toward them and brought them into the land of their enemies—and if their uncircumcised hearts will be humbled and they will make amends for their iniquity,
translation: Na mi wok strong long ol, ol i birua, na mi brinngim ol i go long graun bilong ol i eni – na sapos hert no katim bilong ol i pulim i daun na bai ol i paim bek long sin blong ol,

original: then I will remember My covenant with Jacob and My covenant with Isaac and My covenant with Abraham, and I will remember the land.
translation: Na bai mi rimembim kokane bilong Mi long Jacob na kokane bilong Mi long Isaac na kokane bilong Mi long Abraham, na mi bai rimembim graun.

original: For the land will be abandoned by them, and it will enjoy its Sabbaths by lying desolate without them. And they will pay the penalty for their iniquity, because they rejected My ordinances and abhorred My statutes.
translation: Kantri bai i stap weigela, na bai i amenesim Sabbat yumi na kantri i stap desolat. Na ol bai pukim pe na penati long hevi bilong sin bilong ol, wantaim ol tromoi ol loa bilong mi, na ol pukim ol statut bilong mi.

original: Yet in spite of this, when they are in the land of their enemies, I will not reject or despise them so as to destroy them and break My covenant with them; for I am the LORD their God.
translation: Nogat long dispela, wewan ol i stap long kantri bilong ol enemy, Mi no ken rausim ol o legim ol i nogut, oli bikim ol i bagarap na kilim kaunsil bilong Mi wantaim ol; bikos Mi em i LORD God bilong ol.

original: But for their sake I will remember the covenant with their fathers, whom I brought out of the land of Egypt in the sight of the nations, that I might be their God. I am the LORD.”
translation: Bikpela i tok: "Olsem nau long ol kaen bilong ol tumbuna, mi bai rimember kontrak long ol, ol i kamap long kantri bilong Ijip long nesen bilong olgeta nesen, na mi bai i God bilong ol."

original: These are the statutes, ordinances, and laws that the LORD established between Himself and the Israelites through Moses on Mount Sinai.
translation: Dispela em i statut, ordinas na lo bilong Bikpela, em i kamap strong long em yet na Pipol bilong Isrel, long han bilong Mosese long Maunt Sinai.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Speak to the Israelites and say to them, ‘When someone makes a special vow to the LORD involving the value of persons,
translation: Tokim long ol Israel na tokim ol, 'Wanpela man i laik wokim wanpela vout i spesal long Papa God, vout bilong em inaravai long ol geta bilong manmeri,'

original: if the valuation concerns a male from twenty to sixty years of age, then your valuation shall be fifty shekels of silver, according to the sanctuary shekel.
translation: Sapos valeusen i kam long man husat i gat umur twenty kaen sixty yia, na bai yu mas putim pris blong em fifty sikkel silva, olsem shekel bilong ples bilong Lotu.

original: Or if it is a female, then your valuation shall be thirty shekels.
translation: O ile em i meri, na prais bilong yu bai bi 30 sikils.

original: And if the person is from five to twenty years of age, then your valuation for the male shall be twenty shekels, and for the female ten shekels.
translation: Na sapos man i kam long paits fam na twenti yia, bambai valuasyon bilong man em twenty sikels, na valuasyon bilong meri em ten sikels.

original: Now if the person is from one month to five years of age, then your valuation for the male shall be five shekels of silver, and for the female three shekels of silver.
translation: Nau, sapos man husat i kam long wan manis tasol long 5 yia, bai prais bilong yu long man em i go long 5 sikl bilong silva, na long meri em i go long 3 sikl bilong silva.

original: And if the person is sixty years of age or older, then your valuation shall be fifteen shekels for the male and ten shekels for the female.
translation: Sapos man i 60 yia na i go antap, then valyuasen bilong yu bai i stap so: fiften sikels long man na ten sikels long meri.

original: But if the one making the vow is too poor to pay the valuation, he is to present the person before the priest, who shall set the value according to what the one making the vow can afford.
translation: Sapos man i mekim vov i no inap pei moni bilong valyuasyon, em bai kisim man i go long ples bilong pries, na pries i mas setim pris olsem man i mekim vov i inap pei.

original: If he vows an animal that may be brought as an offering to the LORD, any such animal given to the LORD shall be holy.
translation: Em i tok olsem bai em givim animal, na animal olsem em i bringim kam olsem ofing long LORD, dispela animal em i givim long LORD, em bai i holi.

original: He must not replace it or exchange it, either good for bad or bad for good. But if he does substitute one animal for another, both that animal and its substitute will be holy.
translation: Em i no ken ripleyeim o exchenjem ol i go, ayting gut long bod o bod long gut. Tasol sapos em switim wan animal wantaim narapela, bikos tu animal ya bai i hol, bilong kontek bilong lotu, na em i biknem hol.

original: But if the vow involves any of the unclean animals that may not be brought as an offering to the LORD, the animal must be presented before the priest.
translation: Sapos promis i kam long ol animol i no inap long Jehovah, mas i kam bung long priest.

original: The priest shall set its value, whether high or low; as the priest values it, the price will be set.
translation: Pries i mas putim pris blong em, olsem pries i givim viliu long en, pris bai i kamap.

original: If, however, the owner decides to redeem the animal, he must add a fifth to its value.
translation: Sapos iet bilong en i desis long bebakim animal ia, em mas putim moa long valui bilong en, 1/5 bilong em yet.

original: Now if a man consecrates his house as holy to the LORD, then the priest shall value it either as good or bad. The price will stand just as the priest values it.
translation: Sapos man i kamapim haus bilong en olsem samting wei halo long LORD, maka prist i mas putim pris bilong en, itingut o nogut. Pris bai i stap olsem, stap so olsem prist i putim.

original: But if he who consecrated his house redeems it, he must add a fifth to the assessed value, and it will belong to him.
translation: Sapos man i bin makim haus bilong en i baym bek, em mas putim 1/5 long valui we ol i mekim, na haus bilong en bai i stap long en.

original: If a man consecrates to the LORD a parcel of his land, then your valuation shall be proportional to the seed required for it—fifty shekels of silver for every homer of barley seed.
translation: Wanpela man i makim holem long Lod peles bilong graun em, nou valuasyon bai i kamap olsem nem bilong dispenser long si i gat nid long en - fifty sikul bilong silva long wanpela homa bilong si bilong bareli.

original: If he consecrates his field during the Year of Jubilee, the price will stand according to your valuation.
translation: Em i makim field bilong en i kamap wei holy long taim bilong Yia bilong Freedom, prais bilong em bai i stap olsem yu traiim.

original: But if he consecrates his field after the Jubilee, the priest is to calculate the price in proportion to the years left until the next Year of Jubilee, so that your valuation will be reduced.
translation: Sapos em i makim field bilong en i holidaun bia Jubilee i kam, pries i mas kukim prais olsem yia i stap yet kam inap long nupela Yia bilong Jubilee, na bai valuasen bilong yu i kam daun.

original: And if the one who consecrated the field decides to redeem it, he must add a fifth to the assessed value, and it shall belong to him.
translation: Sapos man i bin makim feil i holit long papa na em i kam bek long em na baim bek, em mas putim 1/5 long valiu i bin givim, na feil i go bek long em gen.

original: If, however, he does not redeem the field, or if he has sold it to another man, it may no longer be redeemed.
translation: Sapos em i no baim bekim graun, o sapos em i salim i go long narapela man, bai ol i no inap baim bekim gen.

original: When the field is released in the Jubilee, it will become holy, like a field devoted to the LORD; it becomes the property of the priests.
translation: Wanpela taim graun i lusim olgeta long taim bilong Jubili, em bai kamap halow, olsem graun we wokim long Lod; em bai kamap propati bilong prist na tasol.

original: Now if a man consecrates to the LORD a field he has purchased, which is not a part of his own property,
translation: Sapos man i baim wanpela gras, na em i no part bilong propati bilong en, na em i givim kantri long han bilong LORD,

original: then the priest shall calculate for him the value up to the Year of Jubilee, and the man shall pay the assessed value on that day as a sacred offering to the LORD.
translation: Na pries i mas kisim prais bilong en, go long yia bilong Jubili, na man i mas pe em prais we i bin ases long dei, olsem ofing bilong God.

original: In the Year of Jubilee the field shall return to the one from whom it was bought—the original owner of the land.
translation: Long Yia bilong Jubili, gras bilong ka bai go bek long man bilong as bilong ples – dispela man we em baim.

original: Every valuation will be according to the sanctuary shekel, twenty gerahs to the shekel.
translation: Olgeta valyuasim bai i kamap olsem laik long shekel bilong haiwe haus, twentieth gerahs ikam long wanpela shekel.

original: But no one may consecrate a firstborn of the livestock, because a firstborn belongs to the LORD. Whether it is an ox or a sheep, it is the LORD’s.
translation: Nogat wan man i ken dedicatem firstborn bilong animol, bikos firstborn em i bilong LORD. I tasol sips olsem ox o sheep, em i bilong LORD.

original: But if it is among the unclean animals, then he may redeem it according to your valuation and add a fifth of its value. If it is not redeemed, then it shall be sold according to your valuation.
translation: Sapos em i stap long ol animal we no inap long kaikai, em inap baim bek long harga we yu givim, na yu mas putim hap five bilong pris blong en. Sapos em i no bin baim bek, em bai sel olsem harga we yu putim.

original: Nothing that a man sets apart to the LORD from all he owns—whether a man, an animal, or his inherited land—can be sold or redeemed; everything so devoted is most holy to the LORD.
translation: Nogat samting we man i makim appart long LORD olsem manmeri, animal, o grun bilong tumbuna inap baim o isave bek long pris, bikos olgeta samting we i bin devote em i moa holy long LORD.

original: No person set apart for destruction may be ransomed; he must surely be put to death.
translation: Nogat man i ken baiem bek long pris, em i mas dai pinis.

original: Thus any tithe from the land, whether from the seed of the land or the fruit of the trees, belongs to the LORD; it is holy to the LORD.
translation: Olgeta 10% bilong graun, sios bilong graun o buai bilong diwai, i bilong LORD; em i halu long LORD.

original: If a man wishes to redeem part of his tithe, he must add a fifth to its value.
translation: Igatu man i laik bai en bikim bek pato bilong duali tit bilong en, bai en i mas putim 20% moa long valiu bilong em.

original: Every tenth animal from the herd or flock that passes under the shepherd’s rod will be holy to the LORD.
translation: Everi tenpela animal long han bilong mobo o long han bilong kaul ol i go daun bilo rod bilong pasinda, bai i kamap santing bilong Papa God.

original: He must not inspect whether it is good or bad, and he shall not make any substitution. But if he does make a substitution, both the animal and its substitute shall become holy; they cannot be redeemed.’”
translation: Em i mas no ken kam bek long lukim igat gutpela oa nogut, na em i no ken wokim sampela narapela samting bilong sindaun. Bai tasol em wokim sampela narapela samting bilong sindaun, olgeta samting i go halow, ol i no ken baim bek gen.

original: These are the commandments that the LORD gave to Moses for the Israelites on Mount Sinai.
translation: Dispela em i komandmen we Bikpela i givim long Moses olsem wanem bikos long ol Israelit long Maunt Sinay.

original: On the first day of the second month of the second year after the Israelites had come out of the land of Egypt, the LORD spoke to Moses in the Tent of Meeting in the Wilderness of Sinai. He said:
translation: Long moning dae bilong sekend mont bilong sekend yia bihaen Israelites i kam aut long graun bilong Ijip, LORD i tokim Moses inside Haus Bilong Miting long Desert bilong Sinai. Em i tok olsem:

original: “Take a census of the whole congregation of Israel by their clans and families, listing every man by name, one by one.
translation: Kisim namba bilong olgeta yangpela pipol bilong Isrel long clan na famili bilong ol, raitim em nama bilong ol manmeri wanwan.

original: You and Aaron are to number those who are twenty years of age or older by their divisions—everyone who can serve in Israel’s army.
translation: Yu na Aron mas kam kauntim ol man husat i gat twenty yia i go pas, ol i stap long olpela grupe bilong ol, ol man husat i gat strong long warkim solja long ples bilong Israel.

original: And one man from each tribe, the head of each family, must be there with you.
translation: Wan man husat i kam long wanpela tribe, em i bic head bilong ol famili, mas i go wantaim yu.

original: These are the names of the men who are to assist you: From the tribe of Reuben, Elizur son of Shedeur;
translation: Dispela nem bilong ol man i mas helpim yu: Long clan bilong Ruben, Elisua sun bilong Sedeur;

original: from Simeon, Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai;
translation: Long Simeon, Shelumiel pikinini bilong Zurishaddai;

original: from Judah, Nahshon son of Amminadab;
translation: Long Judah, Nahshon pikinini bilong Amminadab

original: from Issachar, Nethanel son of Zuar;
translation: Long Isakara, Nethanel pikinini bilong Zuar;

original: from Zebulun, Eliab son of Helon;
translation: Long Zebulun, Eliab pikinini bilong Helon;

original: from the sons of Joseph: from Ephraim, Elishama son of Ammihud, and from Manasseh, Gamaliel son of Pedahzur;
translation: Long ol pikinini bilong Yosef: long ol pikinini bilong Efrayim, Elisama man bilong Ammihud, na long ol pikinini bilong Manase, Gamaliel man bilong Pedazur;

original: from Benjamin, Abidan son of Gideoni;
translation: Long Benjimin, Abidan pikinini bilong Gideoni;

original: from Dan, Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai;
translation: Long Dan, Ahiezer, pikinini bilong Ammishaddai;

original: from Asher, Pagiel son of Ocran;
translation: Long Esara, Pagiel sut bilong Okan;

original: from Gad, Eliasaph son of Deuel;
translation: Long Gad, Eliasaph sa-o bilong Deuel;

original: and from Naphtali, Ahira son of Enan.”
translation: Na long Naphtali, Ahira man bilong Enan.

original: These men were appointed from the congregation; they were the leaders of the tribes of their fathers, the heads of the clans of Israel.
translation: Ol man haiman i kamap long asamble; ol i bikpela man bilong trib bilong tumbuna ol, na hed bilong ol famili bilong Israel.

original: So Moses and Aaron took these men who had been designated by name,
translation: Mosese na Aron i kisim ol man husat ol i bin kukim long nem,

original: and on the first day of the second month they assembled the whole congregation and recorded their ancestry by clans and families, counting one by one the names of those twenty years of age or older,
translation: Long moning bilong sekend mun, ol i kam olgeta long wanpela ples, ol i raitim istori bilong tumbuna ol long clan na famili, na ol i kisim nem bilong ol, statim long uman twenty yia na i go longwe or olgeder, wanpain wan.

original: just as the LORD had commanded Moses. So Moses numbered them in the Wilderness of Sinai:
translation: Olsem ol i laikim pinis long han bilong LORD, na Moses i kanimasim ol long bus bilong Sinai.

original: From the sons of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel, according to the records of their clans and families, counting one by one the names of every male twenty years of age or older who could serve in the army,
