translation: Long ol pikinini namba wan bilong Israel, husat i pikinini bilong Ruben, olsem ol rekod long clan na famili bilong ol, kisim nem bilong ol man husat i gat twenty yia na i go long hap, ol i mas kamap wankain, wanwan, husat i ken wok long ples bilong armi.

original: those registered to the tribe of Reuben numbered 46,500.
translation: Ol manmeri regisa long traib bilong Ruben i gat 46,500.

original: From the sons of Simeon, according to the records of their clans and families, counting one by one the names of every male twenty years of age or older who could serve in the army,
translation: Long ol pikinini bilong Simeon, olsem ol rekod long ol clan na ol famili bilong ol, kisim nem bilong ol man husat i stap, wan wan, nem bilong en us twenty yia na i go antap, husat i ken warkim wok bilong solja.

original: those registered to the tribe of Simeon numbered 59,300.
translation: Ol i skruim long buk bilong tribe bilong Simeon geta 59,300.

original: From the sons of Gad, according to the records of their clans and families, counting the names of all those twenty years of age or older who could serve in the army,
translation: Long ol pikinini bilong Gad, olsem ol stori bilong ol clan na ol famili bilong ol, ol kauntim nem bilong ol husat i gat twenti yia na i go antap long dispela, husat i ken warkim wara long ples bilong faet.

original: those registered to the tribe of Gad numbered 45,650.
translation: Ol manmeri i regista long traib bilong Gad i kountim 45,650.

original: From the sons of Judah, according to the records of their clans and families, counting the names of all those twenty years of age or older who could serve in the army,
translation: Long ol pikinini bilong Yuda, olsem ol stori bilong ol clan na ol famili bilong ol, ol kauntim nem bilong ol husat i gat twenty yia na i go antap, husat i ken warkim wara long ples bilong fait.

original: those registered to the tribe of Judah numbered 74,600.
translation: Ol i regisim long traib bilong Juta, kauntim ol i kamap 74,600.

original: From the sons of Issachar, according to the records of their clans and families, counting the names of all those twenty years of age or older who could serve in the army,
translation: Long ol pikinini bilong Esakar, olsem ol rekod long clan na famili bilong ol, kauntim nem bilong ol husat i gat twenty yia na i go antap, husat i ken warkim wara long ples bilong faet.

original: those registered to the tribe of Issachar numbered 54,400.
translation: Ol i skrivim nem bilong ol long taem bilong mata Issakara i kabimo 54,400.

original: From the sons of Zebulun, according to the records of their clans and families, counting the names of all those twenty years of age or older who could serve in the army,
translation: Long ol pikinini bilong Zebulun, olsem ol rekod long klans na famili bilong ol, kisim nau ol nem bilong ol husat i gat twenty yia na i go antap, husat i ken warkim wara long ples bilong fait.

original: those registered to the tribe of Zebulun numbered 57,400.
translation: Ol i skrivim nem long tribe bilong Zebulun i kamap 57,400.

original: From the sons of Joseph: From the sons of Ephraim, according to the records of their clans and families, counting the names of all those twenty years of age or older who could serve in the army,
translation: Long ol pikinini bilong Josep: Long ol pikinini bilong Efraim, olsem katolik long stori bilong ol clan na famili bilong ol, kauntim nem bilong ol man husat i gat twenty yia na i go antap, husat ina ken warkim servis long army.

original: those registered to the tribe of Ephraim numbered 40,500.
translation: Ol i skulpela nam na katim long taem bilong tribe Ephraim, ol i kontim 40,500.

original: And from the sons of Manasseh, according to the records of their clans and families, counting the names of all those twenty years of age or older who could serve in the army,
translation: Na long ol pikanini bilong Manase, olsem ol stori bilong ol clan na ol famili bilong ol, ol kauntim nem bilong ol i gat usia twenty yia na i go antap, ol i ken warka long army.

original: those registered to the tribe of Manasseh numbered 32,200.
translation: Ol i kamap long lis long taip bilong Manase i gat 32,200.

original: From the sons of Benjamin, according to the records of their clans and families, counting the names of all those twenty years of age or older who could serve in the army,
translation: Long ol pikinini bilong Benjamin, olsem ol rekod long clan na famili bilong ol, kisim nem bilong ol man husat i gat twenty yia na i go antap, husat ina ken warkim wara.

original: those registered to the tribe of Benjamin numbered 35,400.
translation: Ol i skruim long tribe bilong Benjamin i gat 35,400.

original: From the sons of Dan, according to the records of their clans and families, counting the names of all those twenty years of age or older who could serve in the army,
translation: Long ol pikinini bilong Dan, olsem katlik long stori bilong ol klan na famili bilong ol, kauntim nem bilong ol man husat i gat twenty yia na i go antap, husat ina i ken warkim servis long ples bilong faet.

original: those registered to the tribe of Dan numbered 62,700.
translation: Ol i skrivim nem bilong ol long taem bilong Dan, na ol i katim 62,700.

original: From the sons of Asher, according to the records of their clans and families, counting the names of all those twenty years of age or older who could serve in the army,
translation: Long ol pikinini bilong Esa, olsem ol rekod long clan na famili bilong ol, kisim namel long ol man husat i gat twenty yia na i go antap, husat ina ken warkim wara long army.

original: those registered to the tribe of Asher numbered 41,500.
translation: Ol i regisa long traib bilong Esa i kamdap long namba 41,500.

original: From the sons of Naphtali, according to the records of their clans and families, counting the names of all those twenty years of age or older who could serve in the army,
translation: Long ol pikinini bilong Naphtali, olsem ol rekod long klan na famili bilong ol, kisim nem bilong ol husat i gat twenty yia na i go antap long ol, husat i ken warkim wara long ples bilong faet.

original: those registered to the tribe of Naphtali numbered 53,400.
translation: Ol i skrivim nem long hap bilong Naphtali i kamap 53,400.

original: These were the men numbered by Moses and Aaron, with the assistance of the twelve leaders of Israel, each one representing his family.
translation: Ol man ol i kamap long namba, em oli Moses na Aaron i kontaim, wantaim hap bilong twelve bikpela leda bilong Israel, wanwan bilong ol i riprezentim ples bilong en.

original: So all the Israelites twenty years of age or older who could serve in Israel’s army were counted according to their families.
translation: Ol Israeliti twenty yia na olgeda, ol i ken wok long pait bilong Israel, na ol i kam kauntim olgen according long ol famili bilong ol.

original: And all those counted totaled 603,550.
translation: Na olgeta i kamap long kaun em i go bam 603,550.

original: The Levites, however, were not numbered along with them by the tribe of their fathers.
translation: Ol Levit i no inimapim long ol aninit long tribe bilong ol papa.

original: For the LORD had said to Moses:
translation: Bikos Pipia i tok long Mosese:

original: “Do not number the tribe of Levi in the census with the other Israelites.
translation: No ken kauntim tain bilong Levi long kot bilong ples wanpela tasol long ol Israel.

original: Instead, you are to appoint the Levites over the tabernacle of the Testimony, all its furnishings, and everything in it. They shall carry the tabernacle and all its articles, care for it, and camp around it.
translation: Insteadi, yu mas apoinim Levit olsem bos bilong tabenakel bilong Testimeni, na ol samting bilong em, na ol samting i stap insait long en. Ol Levit bai karim tabenakel i go, na ol samting bilong seremoni, lukautim em, na kamp olsem long sait bilong en.

original: Whenever the tabernacle is to move, the Levites are to take it down, and whenever it is to be pitched, the Levites are to set it up. Any outsider who goes near it must be put to death.
translation: Wanem taim Haus Bilong God i mas go, Levitimmas i mas kisim i daun, na wanem taim em i mas kamapim, Levitimmas i mas putim i ap. Eni man o meri husat i no bilong tribe, husat i go klostu long em, em i mas kilim, em bai dai.

original: The Israelites are to camp by their divisions, each man in his own camp and under his own standard.
translation: Ol Pipol bilong Isrel i mas kam kamp long grup ol i divelop, ol i stap long ples bilong ol yet, na i stap unda long baner bilong ol.

original: But the Levites are to camp around the tabernacle of the Testimony and watch over it, so that no wrath will fall on the congregation of Israel. So the Levites are responsible for the tabernacle of the Testimony.”
translation: Bai ol Levaita i stap klostu long haus bilong tok bilong Testimoni, karem lokolok long em, na birua no ken kamdaun long kongresen bilong Israel. Olsem na ol Levaita i gat wajib long haus bilong tok bilong Testimoni.

original: Thus the Israelites did everything just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Ol Israelait i mekim olgeta samting olsem Ol Masalai i givim tok instruksin long Mosese.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses and Aaron:
translation: Bikpela i tok long Moses na Aaron:

original: “The Israelites are to camp around the Tent of Meeting at a distance from it, each man under his standard, with the banners of his family.
translation: Pipol Israel i mas kampe long rond Haus Bilong Miting, ol i go longwe na farapela long en, namba wan man i go daun long baner bilong en, wantaim baner bilong famili bilong en.

original: On the east side, toward the sunrise, the divisions of Judah are to camp under their standard: The leader of the descendants of Judah is Nahshon son of Amminadab,
translation: Long sait bilong east, i go longwei bilong san i kamap, ol grup bilong Yuda oli mas kam kamp wantaim flag bilong ol: Bikpela leda bilong ol desenden bilong Yuda em Nahson son bilong Amminadab.

original: and his division numbers 74,600.
translation: Na divisen bilong em i gat namba 74,600.

original: The tribe of Issachar will camp next to it. The leader of the Issacharites is Nethanel son of Zuar,
translation: Ol pipol bilong tain Isakar bai kampe klostu long em. Bikman bilong ol Isakarites em i Netaniel son bilong Suare,

original: and his division numbers 54,400.
translation: Na hap bilong em i gat namba 54,400.

original: Next will be the tribe of Zebulun. The leader of the Zebulunites is Eliab son of Helon,
translation: Nekis i go bai tribe bilong Zebulun. Lidaman bilong ol Zebulunites em i Eliab sun bilong Helon,

original: and his division numbers 57,400.
translation: Na hap bilong en i gat namba 57,400.

original: The total number of men in the divisions of the camp of Judah is 186,400; they shall set out first.
translation: Namba olsem wel bilong man long divisons bilong ples kanu bilong Yuda em 186,400; ol bai go bes.

original: On the south side, the divisions of Reuben are to camp under their standard: The leader of the Reubenites is Elizur son of Shedeur,
translation: Long sait bilong sout, ol divijen bilong Reuben yet i go kampla long baner bilong ol; Bikman bilong Ol Reuben emi Elizur son bilong Shedeur.

original: and his division numbers 46,500.
translation: Na hap bilong em i gat namba 46,500.

original: The tribe of Simeon will camp next to it. The leader of the Simeonites is Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai,
translation: Taim Simeon bai kampe klostu long en. Bikman bilong ol Simeon em Shelumiel son bilong Zurishaddai,

original: and his division numbers 59,300.
translation: Na hap bilong en i gat namba 59,300.

original: Next will be the tribe of Gad. The leader of the Gadites is Eliasaph son of Deuel,
translation: Nambawan bai bihainim tripe blong Gad. Bikman blong Gadites em i Eliasaph son blong Deuel,

original: and his division numbers 45,650.
translation: Na hap bilong em i gat namba 45,650.

original: The total number of men in the divisions of the camp of Reuben is 151,450; they shall set out second.
translation: Namba bikpela bilong ol man long grup bilong ples bilong kamp bilong Reuben i kamap 151,450; ol i mas go bek gen bihain.

original: In the middle of the camps, the Tent of Meeting is to travel with the camp of the Levites. They are to set out in the order they encamped, each in his own place under his standard.
translation: Long mitim husat i stap, Haus bilong Miting i go wantaim kamp bilong Levai. Oli mas kamap gen long ol ordar ol i stap bifo, nen long ples bilong en, anan long banar bilong en.

original: On the west side, the divisions of Ephraim are to camp under their standard: The leader of the Ephraimites is Elishama son of Ammihud,
translation: Long wes sais, divijon bilong Efream bai kampe long hap aninit long baner bilong ol: Liida bilong ol Efreami em i Elisama, pikinini bilong Ammihud.

original: and his division numbers 40,500.
translation: Na hap bilong em i gat namba 40,500.

original: The tribe of Manasseh will be next to it. The leader of the Manassites is Gamaliel son of Pedahzur,
translation: Tribe bilong Manase bai kam nambauta long em. Bikman bilong ol Manase em i Gamaliel son bilong Pedahzur,

original: and his division numbers 32,200.
translation: Na hap bilong em i gat namba 32,200.

original: Next will be the tribe of Benjamin. The leader of the Benjamites is Abidan son of Gideoni,
translation: Nekis i go nau taem bilong tribe Benjamin. Bikman bilong ol Benjamites em i Abidan, pikinini bilong Gideoni.

original: and his division numbers 35,400.
translation: Na hap bilong em i gat namba 35,400.

original: The total number of men in the divisions of the camp of Ephraim is 108,100; they shall set out third.
translation: Namba olsem bilong man husat i go longpela divison bilong grup bilong Efrayim kamp em i 108,100; ol bai go bek gen tripela.

original: On the north side, the divisions of Dan are to camp under their standard: The leader of the Danites is Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai,
translation: Long naait side, ol divisen bilong Dan bai kam kamp daunba banis bilong ol: Bikpela leda bilong Danites em i Ahiezer, pikinini bilong Ammishaddai.

original: and his division numbers 62,700.
translation: Na hap bilong en em i gat namba 62,700.

original: The tribe of Asher will camp next to it. The leader of the Asherites is Pagiel son of Ocran,
translation: Traipela Asher bai kamap long sai. Bikman bilong ol Asher em i Pagiel, pikinini bilong Ocran.

original: and his division numbers 41,500.
translation: Na hap bilong en i gat namba 41,500.

original: Next will be the tribe of Naphtali. The leader of the Naphtalites is Ahira son of Enan,
translation: Nambawan bai tripe bilong Naphtali. Bikman bilong ol Naphtalites em i Ahira son bilong Enan,

original: and his division numbers 53,400.
translation: Na hap bilong em i gat namba 53,400.

original: The total number of men in the camp of Dan is 157,600; they shall set out last, under their standards.”
translation: Namba bilong ol man olgeta long kamp bilong Dan em 157,600; oli mas go bek long las, march unde kaunsel bilong ol.

original: These are the Israelites, numbered according to their families. The total of those counted in the camps, by their divisions, was 603,550.
translation: Ol Israelites i go we, ol i kamap long namel bilong ol famili. Nambaut bilong ol i kan long kamped, na ol i divelop long grup bilong ol, em i 603,550.

original: But the Levites were not counted among the other Israelites, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Bai ol Levit i no kabim yet longol ol narapela Israel, olsem LORD i tokim Moses.

original: So the Israelites did everything the LORD commanded Moses; they camped under their standards in this way and set out in the same way, each man with his clan and his family.
translation: Na Israelites i mekim olgeta samting olsem Jehovah i tokim Moses; ol i kamap biloong long baner bilong ol long dispela rot, na ol i go long we long samepela rot, husat i stap wantaim clan bilong en na famili bilong en.

original: This is the account of Aaron and Moses at the time the LORD spoke with Moses on Mount Sinai.
translation: Dispela em i stori bilong Aaron na Moses, taim GOD i tokim Moses long Maunt Sinai.

original: These are the names of the sons of Aaron: Nadab the firstborn, then Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar.
translation: Dispela nem bilong pikinini bilong Aron: Nadab em i kam first, olsem Abihu, Eleaza, na Itama.

original: These were Aaron’s sons, the anointed priests, who were ordained to serve as priests.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Aron, ol priis we i gat anointing, we i ordinance olsem priis.

original: Nadab and Abihu, however, died in the presence of the LORD when they offered unauthorized fire before the LORD in the Wilderness of Sinai. And since they had no sons, only Eleazar and Ithamar served as priests during the lifetime of their father Aaron.
translation: Nadab na Abihu i dai long wei bilong LORD tasol wen ol i givim fai we em i no gat permissin bifo LORD long Wilerness bilong Sinai. Na bikos ol i no gat pikinini man, tasol Eleazar na Ithamar i wark long olsem pries long taim bilong life bilong tamberi ol Aaron.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Bring the tribe of Levi and present them to Aaron the priest to assist him.
translation: Kisim ol tribe bilong Levi i kam, presentim ol long Aaron priast, na ol i helpim em.

original: They are to perform duties for him and for the whole congregation before the Tent of Meeting, attending to the service of the tabernacle.
translation: Oli mas wokim wajib long en na long whole kongres long Haus Bilong Miting, ol i mas kam long servise bilong tabenakol.

original: They shall take care of all the furnishings of the Tent of Meeting and fulfill obligations for the Israelites by attending to the service of the tabernacle.
translation: Ol i mas kisim kekare long olgeta samting bilong insait long Haus bilong Miting na pilimupim obligesin bilong ol Israelites, na ol i.servis long tabenakol.

original: Assign the Levites to Aaron and his sons; they have been given exclusively to him from among the Israelites.
translation: Givim wok long ol Levit long Aaron na ol pikinini bilong em, ol i givim olsem tasol long em ausait long ol Israel.

original: So you shall appoint Aaron and his sons to carry out the duties of the priesthood; but any outsider who approaches the tabernacle must be put to death.”
translation: Yupela mas appointim Aaron na ol descendants bilong en long wokim wok bilong priesthood; bai nambis man i sidaun i kam klostu long tabernacle, em bai mas i dai.

original: Again the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
translation: Bikpela i tokim Moses gen, olsem:

original: “Behold, I have taken the Levites from among the children of Israel in place of every firstborn Israelite from the womb. The Levites belong to Me,
translation: Lukim, mi kisim Levaitim long olgeta pikinini Israel we em i kam bek long hap bilong en. Levaitim olsem sem tupela long olgeta pikinini Israel we em i kam bek long hap bilong en, na Levaitim i bilong Mi, noken bilong God.

original: for all the firstborn are Mine. On the day I struck down every firstborn in the land of Egypt, I consecrated to Myself all the firstborn in Israel, both man and beast. They are Mine; I am the LORD.”
translation: Olgeta pikinini bilong papa i bilong mi. Long de mipela kilim daun olgeta pikinini bilong papa long graun bilong Ijip, mipela makim olgeta pikinini bilong papa long Israel, man na animol, ol i bilong mipela yet. Ol i bilong mi; mi em i bos.

original: Then the LORD spoke to Moses in the Wilderness of Sinai, saying,
translation: Bikpela i tok long Moses long bus bilong Sinai, olsem:

original: “Number the Levites by their families and clans. You are to count every male a month old or more.”
translation: Kountim ol Levit olsem familia na clan bilong ol, kisim ol man husat em i gat wan mun o mor.

original: So Moses numbered them according to the word of the LORD, as he had been commanded.
translation: Na Mosis i kaunim ol long tok bilong Jehovah, olsem em i bin kisim bekim.

original: These were the sons of Levi by name: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Levi long nem: Gesoni, Kohati, na Merari.

original: These were the names of the sons of Gershon by their clans: Libni and Shimei.
translation: Dispela i nem bilong ol pikinini man bilong Gershon ol i kam long ol clan bilong ol: Libni na Shimei.

original: The sons of Kohath by their clans were Amram, Izhar, Hebron, and Uzziel.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Kohath ollain long ol clan bilong ol i gat Amram, Izhar, Hebron, na Uzziel.

original: And the sons of Merari by their clans were Mahli and Mushi. These were the clans of the Levites, according to their families.
translation: Na ol pikinini bilong Merari long ol lain bilong ol em i Mahli na Mushi. Dispela ol lain bilong Levit, olsem bilong ol famili.

original: From Gershon came the Libnite clan and the Shimeite clan; these were the Gershonite clans.
translation: Long Gershon i kam, na klans bilong Libnait na Shimeit; dispela i klans bilong Gershonait.

original: The number of all the males a month old or more was 7,500.
translation: Namba bilong ol man husat i gat wan mun em bai go long moa o i gat moa yet, em i 7,500.

original: The Gershonite clans were to camp on the west, behind the tabernacle,
translation: Ol klana Gershonite i mas kamap long ples we istap long wes, bihain long templa.

original: and the leader of the families of the Gershonites was Eliasaph son of Lael.
translation: Na bikman bilong ol famili bilong Gershonait em i Eliasaph sori bilong Lael.

original: The duties of the Gershonites at the Tent of Meeting were the tabernacle and tent, its covering, the curtain for the entrance to the Tent of Meeting,
translation: Wok bilong Gershonites long Haus Bilong Miting em i tabernakel na haus bilong tent, kovering bilong en, karpet bilong entris long Haus Bilong Miting.

original: the curtains of the courtyard, the curtain for the entrance to the courtyard that surrounds the tabernacle and altar, and the cords—all the service for these items.
translation: Karai bilong kaunsil, karai long entris long kaunsil ol i go raun long tabernakul na alta, na ol rop – ol sabis bilong dispela samting.

original: From Kohath came the clans of the Amramites, the Izharites, the Hebronites, and the Uzzielites; these were the clans of the Kohathites.
translation: Long klana Kohath i kam ol klana Ol Amram, Ol Izhar, Ol Hebron, na Ol Uzziel; dispela ol klana em i bilong ol Kohathites.

original: The number of all the males a month old or more was 8,600. They were responsible for the duties of the sanctuary.
translation: Namba bilong ol man husat i gat em i gat mun wan kluk o win long nau em i 8,600. Ol i mas bekim wok bilong ol responisbiliti long ples bilong Lotu.

original: The clans of the Kohathites were to camp on the south side of the tabernacle,
translation: Ol clan bilong Kohat i mas kamap long sait bilong saus bilong tabenakul.

original: and the leader of the families of the Kohathites was Elizaphan son of Uzziel.
translation: Na bikman bilong ol famili bilong ol Kohatita em i Elizafan san bilong Uzziel.

original: Their duties were the ark, the table, the lampstand, the altars, the articles of the sanctuary used with them, and the curtain—all the service for these items.
translation: Wok bilong ol i kam long bokis bilong ka, tebol, lait stan, alta, samting bilong ples bilong Gad ol i usim wantaim, na katen - servis bilong sampela samting ol.

original: The chief of the leaders of the Levites was Eleazar son of Aaron the priest; he oversaw those responsible for the duties of the sanctuary.
translation: Bikpela bos bilong ol Levaim lidaman em i Eleazar sun bilong Aaron pris; em i lukautim ol i responcibol long wok bilong ples bilong halivim.

original: From Merari came the clans of the Mahlites and Mushites; these were the Merarite clans.
translation: Long hap bilong Merari i kam ol clan bilong Mahlait na Mushait; dispela ol clan bilong Merarait i stap.

original: The number of all the males a month old or more was 6,200.
translation: Namba bilong ol man husat i gat wan mun o i go long em i gat 6,200.

original: The leader of the families of the Merarites was Zuriel son of Abihail; they were to camp on the north side of the tabernacle.
translation: Bibipo bilong ol famili Merarait em Zuriel son bilong Abihail; ol bai kampe long ples long sait bilong not bilong tabernakul.

original: The duties assigned to the sons of Merari were the tabernacle’s frames, crossbars, posts, bases, and all its equipment—all the service for these items,
translation: Wok i save long ol pikinini bilong Merari em i kamap long bengen bilong tabernakel, bar bilong kros, pos, pes bilong en, na ol samting bilong en - olgets dispela samting ol i servos long en.

original: as well as the posts of the surrounding courtyard with their bases, tent pegs, and ropes.
translation: Post bilong yard iles, wantaim bes bilong ol, pegs bilong tent, na ropes.

original: Moses, Aaron, and Aaron’s sons were to camp to the east of the tabernacle, toward the sunrise, before the Tent of Meeting. They were to perform the duties of the sanctuary as a service on behalf of the Israelites; but any outsider who approached the sanctuary was to be put to death.
translation: Moses, Aron, na pikinini bilong Aron i mas kampe long sindaun, long sait bilong san i go antap, bifo Haus Bilong Miting. Ol i mas mekim wok bilong haus bilong holide olsem servis long bihainim Israel; tasol nambis man i kam klostu long ples bilong holide, em i mas dai.

original: The total number of Levites that Moses and Aaron counted by their clans at the LORD’s command, including all the males a month old or more, was 22,000.
translation: Namba olgeta bilong Levai i Moses na Aron i countim ol long famili bilong ol, from we ol i gat mosong bilong wan mun em i go long 22,000, ol countim ol long tok bilong LORD.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Number every firstborn male of the Israelites a month old or more, and list their names.
translation: Papa God i tokim Mosis, “Kamdai ol pikinini man bilong papa bilong ol Israelites em i gat wan mun em olsem, na raitim nem bilong ol.”

original: You are to take the Levites for Me—I am the LORD—in place of all the firstborn of Israel, and the livestock of the Levites in place of all the firstborn of the livestock of the Israelites.”
translation: Yu mas tekim Levi bilong GOD — Mi GOD — long hap bilong olgeta pikinini bilong hap bilong Isrel, na ol katel bilong Levi long hap bilong olgeta pikinini bilong hap bilong ol katel bilong Isrel.

original: So Moses numbered all the firstborn of the Israelites, as the LORD had commanded him.
translation: Moses i kamapim olgeta pikinini bilong man i kam first bilong Israel, olsem LORD i tokim em.

original: The total number of the firstborn males a month old or more, listed by name, was 22,273.
translation: Namba olgeta blong man bilong papa ikam, em i gat wan mun o moa, ol i raitim nem bilong ol long buk, em i 22,273.

original: Again the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
translation: Bikpela i tokim Moses gen, olsem:

original: “Take the Levites in place of all the firstborn of Israel, and the livestock of the Levites in place of their livestock. The Levites belong to Me; I am the LORD.
translation: Tukim Levit long hap bilong olgeta pikinini birua bilong Israel, na ol liklik beasts bilong Levit long hap bilong ol liklik beasts bilong ol. Levit i bilong Mi; Mi Bikpela.

original: To redeem the 273 firstborn Israelites who outnumber the Levites,
translation: Baimbekim ol 273 pikinini Israel bilong papa na mama ibin kam first, ol i gat planti long ol Levit.

original: you are to collect five shekels for each one, according to the sanctuary shekel of twenty gerahs.
translation: Yu mas kisim faiv sikul long ol i go, olsem laip long sikul bilong haiwe we istap twenti gera.

original: Give the money to Aaron and his sons as the redemption price for the excess among the Israelites.”
translation: Givim moni long Aaron na ol pikinini bilong em olsem prais bilong bikim fri long ol Israeliti i go ovas.

original: So Moses collected the redemption money from those in excess of the number redeemed by the Levites.
translation: Moses i kam bekim moni bilong ples namel long ol pikinini i stap long moninga long namba i kamap redeem, we Ol Levitika i bin redeem.

original: He collected the money from the firstborn of the Israelites: 1,365 shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel.
translation: Em kisim moni long ol pikinini birua bilong Israel: 1,365 shekels, olsem laip long shekel bilong Haus Lotu.

original: And Moses gave the redemption money to Aaron and his sons in obedience to the word of the LORD, just as the LORD had commanded him.
translation: Na Mosis i givim mani bilong pekemon long Aron na ol pikinini bilong en long obisience long tok bilong LORD, olsem LORD i bin tokim em.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses and Aaron,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses na Aaron,

original: “Take a census of the Kohathites among the Levites by their clans and families,
translation: Kisim kaunten long Ol Kohatit i stap long ol Levait, olsem ol i stap long clan na famili bilong ol.

original: men from thirty to fifty years old—everyone who is qualified to serve in the work at the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Man meri long thirty ka fifti yia — ol man husat i gat kwalifikesen long warkim wark long Haus bilong Miting.

original: This service of the Kohathites at the Tent of Meeting regards the most holy things.
translation: Servis bilong ol Kohatiti long Haus Bilong Miting i kamapim long samting namba wan pepepa.

original: Whenever the camp sets out, Aaron and his sons are to go in, take down the veil of the curtain, and cover the ark of the Testimony with it.
translation: Wanpela taim kamp i go nau, Aron na ol pikinini bilong en i go insait, kisim i kom daun bikos bilong karim kurten, na karamapim ark bilong Testimeni wantaim.

original: They are to place over this a covering of fine leather, spread a solid blue cloth over it, and insert its poles.
translation: Oli mas putim antap long dispela sampela samting bilong kisim hap long, olsem sipak skin bilong animal we i swit moa, na kisim i go olsem san map long klos blu i strong, na putim stick bilong em.

original: Over the table of the Presence they are to spread a blue cloth and place the plates and cups on it, along with the bowls and pitchers for the drink offering. The regular bread offering is to remain on it.
translation: Antap long tepul bilong Presens, ol i mas katim klos blu na putim pliet na kap antap, wantaim bol na pitja bilong ofing bai dring. Bred ofing bilong taim olsem i mas stap antap long em.

original: And they shall spread a scarlet cloth over them, cover them with fine leather, and insert the poles.
translation: Tupela i go stretim skarlet klos bilong rod ova ol, kavarim olgeta wantaim letha finis, na putim stik bilong karim i go insait.

original: They are to take a blue cloth and cover the lampstand used for light, together with its lamps, wick trimmers, and trays, as well as the jars of oil with which to supply it.
translation: Tena nao oli mas kisim klos blu na kaverim lampstan bilong Haus Lotu, i usim long dait, wantaim na lamips bilong en, tingting bilong karm pasin, tray bilong karim, na tu ol jar bilong oil, olsem nau oli ken stap supplyim em.

original: Then they shall wrap it and all its utensils inside a covering of fine leather and put it on the carrying frame.
translation: Ol bai rapiim ol samting bilong kukim ka na ol putim i go long kaveri bilong letha nip, na bihain ol putim i go long bikpela raketa bilong karim.

original: Over the gold altar they are to spread a blue cloth, cover it with fine leather, and insert the poles.
translation: Antap long altan bilong gol, ol i mas kisim klos blu i go antap, kisim sip blong letha i go antap, na putim stik i go insait.

original: They are to take all the utensils for serving in the sanctuary, place them in a blue cloth, cover them with fine leather, and put them on the carrying frame.
translation: Oli mas kisim olgeta bilong kaikai na karamapim long haus lotu, putim ol long buk blupela kaliko, kaverim ol wantaim lepa skin bilong animal we i dekoratim, na putim ol long bikpela rak na karim i go.

original: Then they shall remove the ashes from the bronze altar, spread a purple cloth over it,
translation: Tisa bai ol i kisim wei na kastam ashes long alta long bronzu, stretim klath purpel antap long em.

original: and place on it all the vessels used to serve there: the firepans, meat forks, shovels, and sprinkling bowls—all the equipment of the altar. They are to spread over it a covering of fine leather and insert the poles.
translation: Na putim ol vesl long en, ol paip long faia, pigia long katim mit, speda long kisim as, na bowl long was - ol samting i bilong alta. Olges i usim long sarvis bere: putim sip lukim skin long en, na putim stik bilong karim i go insait.

original: When Aaron and his sons have finished covering the holy objects and all their equipment, as soon as the camp is ready to move, the Kohathites shall come and do the carrying. But they must not touch the holy objects, or they will die. These are the transportation duties of the Kohathites regarding the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Wanpela taim Aaron na ol sinduna bilong en i stap finishim kasim ol samting bilong holigod na olgeta samting bilong wok, olgeta taim ples bilong kamp i redi long go, Kohatita i kam na wokim kare. Tasol ol i no ken touchim samting bilong holigod, nau ol bai dai. Dispela em i wok bilong Kohatita long kisim i go insait long Haus Bilong Miting.

original: Eleazar son of Aaron the priest shall oversee the oil for the light, the fragrant incense, the daily grain offering, and the anointing oil. He has oversight of the entire tabernacle and everything in it, including the holy objects and their utensils.”
translation: Eleaza, pikinini bilong Aron pris, bai kiim i lukautim oil bilong lait, smel gut paua, ofa bilong bikpela ka, na oil bilong waisen. Em i gat bos bilong holep tabernakel na olgeta samting i inside, inklusiv samting bilong holigud na karamapim bilong ol.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses and Aaron,
translation: Na bikos LORD i tok olsem long Moses na Aaron,

original: “Do not allow the Kohathite tribal clans to be cut off from among the Levites.
translation: No ken allowim ol clans bilong tribe Kohati i go naba long ol Levitiko.

original: In order that they may live and not die when they come near the most holy things, do this for them: Aaron and his sons are to go in and assign each man his task and what he is to carry.
translation: Ol i ken stap long laip, na wanken ol i kam klostu long samting nogut tru, mekim dispela wok long ol: Aaron na ol pikinini bilong en i go insait na givim wok long ol man, na tusim ol long wok bilong ol, na strongim ol long samting ol mas kisim na karim.

original: But the Kohathites are not to go in and look at the holy objects, even for a moment, or they will die.”
translation: Bai ol Kohatit no ken go insait kisim luk long samting bilong God nem bilong wanpela taem tasol, o bai ol i dai.

original: And the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok long Mosese,

original: “Take a census of the Gershonites as well, by their families and clans,
translation: Kam bek long ol Gershonites, na ol i go daunim ol lista bilong ol famili na klans bilong ol.

original: from thirty to fifty years old, counting everyone who comes to serve in the work at the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Long thirty ya ki long fifty yia, kisim ol i kam wok bung long wok bilong Tent blong Miting.

original: This is the service of the Gershonite clans regarding work and transport:
translation: Em i servis bilong ol clan bilong Gershon long kain kain wok na karim.

original: They are to carry the curtains of the tabernacle, the Tent of Meeting with the covering of fine leather over it, the curtains for the entrance to the Tent of Meeting,
translation: Ol i mas karim bus long tabenakel, Haus Bilong Miting wantaim kava bilong skin pikinini i go antap long en, na bus bilong entris long Haus Bilong Miting.

original: the curtains of the courtyard, and the curtains for the entrance at the gate of the courtyard that surrounds the tabernacle and altar, along with their ropes and all the equipment for their service. The Gershonites will do all that needs to be done with these items.
translation: Kurtens bilong ka long ples, kurtens bilong entris long gate ol i go raun long tabenakel na alta, longol rop bilong ol na ol samting bilong wok bilong ol. Gershonait bai mekim olgeta wok i mas long dispela samting.

original: All the service of the Gershonites—all their transport duties and other work—is to be done at the direction of Aaron and his sons; you are to assign to them all that they are responsible to carry.
translation: Ol servis bilong ol Gershonites, wok bilong ol i kam long karim na wok narak, ol i mas mekim long tok bilong Aron na pikinini bilong em; yu mas givim ol wok bilong ol yet, ol mas karim.

original: This is the service of the Gershonite clans at the Tent of Meeting, and their duties shall be under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.
translation: Em i servis bilong Ol clan bilong Gershon long Haus Bilong Miting, na wok bilong ol i kam bek long han bilong Ithamar son bilong Aaron bishop.

original: As for the sons of Merari, you are to number them by their clans and families,
translation: Long ol son bilong Merari, yu mas katim nau ol olsem long clan na famili bilong ol.

original: from thirty to fifty years old, counting everyone who comes to serve in the work of the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Long thirty kaon bihain long fifty yia, kisim olgeta manmeri i kam wokim senvis long wok bilong Tent bilong Miting.

original: This is the duty for all their service at the Tent of Meeting: to carry the frames of the tabernacle with its crossbars, posts, and bases,
translation: Dispela em i waj ibin strong long olgeta wok bilong ol long Haus Bilong Miting: ol i karim banis bilong tabenakl, pekha bilong kros, pok na post, na pes bilong tabenakl.

original: and the posts of the surrounding courtyard with their bases, tent pegs, and ropes, including all their equipment and everything related to their use. You shall assign by name the items that they are responsible to carry.
translation: Na pos bilong yard igo ronnda long em, wantaim bes bilong en, peg bilong tent, ropes, na olgeta samting bilong wok bilong ol, olgeta samting i kamap long usim bilong ol, yu mas givim nem bilong ol samting ol i mas karim.

original: This is the service of the Merarite clans according to all their work at the Tent of Meeting, under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.”
translation: Em i servis bilong Ol clan bilong Merari olsem ol i wokim olgeta wok bilong ol long hap bilong Haus Bilong Miting, anus long direksen bilong Ithamar man bilong Aaron pries.

original: So Moses, Aaron, and the leaders of the congregation numbered the Kohathites by their clans and families,
translation: Moses, Aaron, na ol lida i mekim kaunt long ol Kohat olsem clan na famili bilong ol.

original: everyone from thirty to fifty years old who came to serve in the work at the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Olgeta long thirty kaen fifty yia olsem i kam wokim servis long wok bilong Tent blong Miting.

original: And those numbered by their clans totaled 2,750.
translation: Na ol i grup long klan bilong ol, ol i kamap namba 2,750.

original: These were counted from the Kohathite clans, everyone who could serve at the Tent of Meeting. Moses and Aaron numbered them according to the command of the LORD through Moses.
translation: Ol i kamap long klans bilong Kohat, ol i ken wok long Haus Bilong Miting. Moses na Aron i kisim ol long namba, olsem LORD i tokim Moses long hap bilong tok bilong em.

original: Then the Gershonites were numbered by their clans and families,
translation: Na Gesoni i kamapim ol long namba long klain na famili bilong ol.

original: everyone from thirty to fifty years old who came to serve in the work at the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Olgeta long thirty kaen fifty yia olsem i kam wokim servis long wok bilong Ten Haus Ples Kot.

original: And those numbered by their clans and families totaled 2,630.
translation: Na ol i kauntim ol long klan na famili bilong ol, i kamap 2,630.

original: These were counted from the Gershonite clans who served at the Tent of Meeting, whom Moses and Aaron counted at the LORD’s command.
translation: Ol i kamapo long klana Gershon, ol i wokim servis long Haus Bilong Miting, ol wel Moses na Aaron i kamapo long tok bilong LORD.

original: And the Merarites were numbered by their clans and families,
translation: Na Meraraites i kamap long namba, ol i divelop long ol klana na ol famili bilong ol.

original: everyone from thirty to fifty years old who came to serve in the work at the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Ol man na meri long ol thirty na fifiti yia, ol i kam wokim servis long wok bilong Temel Haus.

original: The men registered by their clans numbered 3,200.
translation: Ol man i skrivim nem bilong ol long clan bilong ol, i kamap 3,200.

original: These were counted from the Merarite clans, whom Moses and Aaron numbered at the LORD’s command through Moses.
translation: Dispela i kamap long kukimi ol man meri long klans bilong Merari, ol i bin kukim long tok bilong LORD, Moses na Aron i bin mekim dispela kukimi long tok bilong LORD, thruim Moses.

original: So Moses, Aaron, and the leaders of Israel numbered by their clans and families all the Levites
translation: Mosese, Aron, na lidaman bilong Isrel i kamapim ol Levaiti long klana na famili bilong ol.

original: from thirty to fifty years old who came to do the work of serving and carrying the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Ol man long thirty ya ki bek long fifty yia i kam wokim wok bilong servis na kisim i go long Haus Bilong Miting.

original: And the number of men was 8,580.
translation: Namba bilong man em i 8,580.

original: At the LORD’s command they were numbered through Moses and each one was assigned his work and burden, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Long tok bilong LORD, ol i kamapim ol long han bilong Moses, na Moses i givim wok na laif bilong en long ol, olsem LORD i bin komandoim Moses.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Command the Israelites to send away from the camp anyone with a skin disease, anyone who has a bodily discharge, and anyone who is defiled by a dead body.
translation: Iusim tok bilong Israelites, olsem: rasim ol i gat sik bilong skin, wara i kam long bodi, na ol i paitim long mosin bilong hed, bai ol i go longwe kot long bus.

original: You must send away male and female alike; send them outside the camp so they will not defile their camp, where I dwell among them.”
translation: Yu mas kisim man na meri i go we, mekim ol i go longwe na outsaid long ples bilong ol, na ol biruaim ples bilong ol, ples wei mi stap wantaim ol.

original: So the Israelites did this, sending such people outside the camp. They did just as the LORD had instructed Moses.
translation: Na Israelit i mekim olsem, tromwe na rausim ol manmeri olsem long bodi. Ol i mekim olgeta strongpela olsem LORD i givim instructon long Moses.

original: And the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tokim Moses,

original: “Tell the Israelites that when a man or woman acts unfaithfully against the LORD by committing any sin against another, that person is guilty
translation: Tokim ol Israel, em bai yu yet long ol man o meri husat i wokim ol samting i no orait long Jehovah, olsem na wokim kain sin yet long narapela man, dispela man o meri em bikhet long, em gilty.

original: and must confess the sin he has committed. He must make full restitution, add a fifth to its value, and give all this to the one he has wronged.
translation: Na em i mas tok bautim sin em i mekim, peilim bek olgeta samting long wanem em i mekim wrong. Em i mas putim 1/5 moa long valui bilong samting, na givim bek olgeta long dispela man we em i bin wongim.

original: But if the man has no relative to whom restitution can be made for the wrong, the restitution belongs to the LORD and must be given to the priest along with the ram of atonement, by which the atonement is made for him.
translation: Bai man i no gat nepkin bilong en em i posibol long pekimbak i go bek long dispela wrong, dispela pekimbak i bilong LORD, em i mas i givim long prist wantaim ol ram bilong pekimbak i go bek, olsem na pekimbak i kamap long en.

original: Every sacred contribution the Israelites bring to the priest shall belong to him.
translation: Olgeta halivim bikos bilong God ol Israel pipol igat na kisim long pries, olgeta em bilonim belong pries.

original: Each man’s sacred gifts are his own, but whatever he gives to the priest will belong to the priest.”
translation: Ol samting bilong God ol i bilong em yet, tasol wap evri man i givim long pries, ol bai i go long pries.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses

original: “Speak to the Israelites and tell them that if any man’s wife goes astray and is unfaithful to him
translation: Tokim ol Yisrael, long tingting bilong yumi, if sipsip meri bilong en i go daun long rot, na i no bihainim em, yumitokim ol.

original: by sleeping with another man, and it is concealed from her husband and her impurity is undetected (since there is no witness against her and she was not caught in the act),
translation: Ol i go stap wantaim man narak, na dispela bikhet em i kaivpin long husat bilong em, na hevi pasin bilong em i no inap long kamautim, bekos i no gat witnes ibaksait long en, na em i no kisim bek long hap.

original: and if a feeling of jealousy comes over her husband and he suspects his wife who has defiled herself—or if a feeling of jealousy comes over him and he suspects her even though she has not defiled herself—
translation: Na husban bilong em i kamapim susa long em, na em i tingim meri bilong em i gat birua, olsem meri bilong em i stap katol long spirit nogut - o husban bilong em i kamapim susa long em, na em i tingim meri bilong em i gat birua tasol em i no katol long spirit nogut.

original: then he is to bring his wife to the priest. He must also bring for her an offering of a tenth of an ephah of barley flour. He is not to pour oil over it or put frankincense on it, because it is a grain offering for jealousy, an offering of memorial as a reminder of iniquity.
translation: Em bai bringim meri i go long ples bilong pries. Em mas kisim ofing bilong wan tapul epa flour bilong barley, na bringim i go wantaim meri. Em no ken putim oil antap long em, na em no ken putim frankincense antap long em, bikos dispela em i ofing bilong dram bilong man i jelos, ofing bilong memori olsem wanesa long hevi bilong spirit.

original: The priest is to bring the wife forward and have her stand before the LORD.
translation: Prist i kisim meri i kam na makim em i stap bifor LORD.

original: Then he is to take some holy water in a clay jar and put some of the dust from the tabernacle floor into the water.
translation: Em i mas kisim wahta hailan i go insait long bek moa klai na putim sampela dust bilong floa bilong tabenakl insait long wara.

original: After the priest has the woman stand before the LORD, he is to let down her hair and place in her hands the grain offering of memorial, which is the grain offering for jealousy. The priest is to hold the bitter water that brings a curse.
translation: Bihaen pries bilong mekim meri i stanap bifo GOD bilong yumi, i pilim i go daun ol graon bilong em, na i putim ofa bilong baret ol i memba long han bilong em, ofa bilong baret long taim zelos. Pries i mas holum wata i no sweet, wata i givim kisim kros.

original: And he is to put the woman under oath and say to her, ‘If no other man has slept with you and you have not gone astray and become defiled while under your husband’s authority, may you be immune to this bitter water that brings a curse.
translation: Na em i mas putim meri long oath na tokim olsem: 'Igat narapela man we i no slip wantaim yu, na yu no go na stret long rot bilong yu, na yu no kilim bodi bilong yu stap undersub mit bilong husban bilong yu, bikos wara bilong poisen i bringim kros, yu mas fri long dispela wara.'

original: But if you have gone astray while under your husband’s authority and have defiled yourself and lain carnally with a man other than your husband’—
translation: Bai yu go long wei narapela wail na yu stap aninit long powa bilong husat yu, na yu rusim bodi bilong yu, na yu kisim bek bilong man narapela, long wei yu no husat bilong yu —

original: and the priest shall have the woman swear under the oath of the curse—‘then may the LORD make you an attested curse among your people by making your thigh shrivel and your belly swell.
translation: Na pries i mas makim meri i tok strong long olegisain bilong karim, ‘Mak em i givim yu long wail pikinini, na bel i go daun, na lewa i paul, na yu kamap olsem samting we olgeta man i takim shame long, long olgeta piple.’

original: May this water that brings a curse enter your stomach and cause your belly to swell and your thigh to shrivel.’ Then the woman is to say, ‘Amen, Amen.’
translation: Dispela wata i kam bekim kat kat i go insait long bel bilong yu, na bai mekim bel bilong yu i punda, na lek bilong yu i sik. Na meri bai tok, 'Amen, Amen.'

original: And the priest shall write these curses on a scroll and wash them off into the bitter water.
translation: Na pris i raitim dispela kros long banis bilong buk na wasim i go daun long wara Pekpek.

original: He is to have the woman drink the bitter water that brings a curse, and it will enter her and cause her bitter suffering.
translation: Meri bai dringim wara painim we i bringim katikati, na em bai go insait long en, na bai makim meri i sufara tru.

original: The priest shall take from her hand the grain offering for jealousy, wave it before the LORD, and bring it to the altar.
translation: Pries bai kisim long han bilong em ofing bilong grain bilong zelos, waipeim i go antap long LORD, na bringim i go long alta.

original: Then the priest is to take a handful of the grain offering as a memorial portion and burn it on the altar; after that he is to have the woman drink the water.
translation: Na prist i kisim hap wanpela ofa bilong grain olsem sampel bilong memoriam, burnim em long alta; nacha mipela i givim meri dringim wara.

original: When he has made her drink the water, if she has defiled herself and been unfaithful to her husband, then the water that brings a curse will enter her and cause bitter suffering; her belly will swell, her thigh will shrivel, and she will become accursed among her people.
translation: Wanpela taim em i givim ol water long en, sapos meri i go long narapela man na i no kamap strong long hasband bilong en, ol water bilong katikati bai go insait long en na bai bringim sik kurukuru i kam long en; belly bilong en bai i go daun, leg bilong en bai i bagarap, na meri bai i stap klostu long ol pipol bilong en.

original: But if the woman has not defiled herself and is clean, she will be unaffected and able to conceive children.
translation: Bai sapos meri i no bin bagarapim skel bilong en, em bai i kamap strong na klia, na em bai i no inuafectim, em inap long karim pikinini.

original: This is the law of jealousy when a wife goes astray and defiles herself while under her husband’s authority,
translation: Dispela em i laik bilong sik bilong jelos, wanem meri i go long rot bilong nogat gutpela pasin, na bagarap bodi bilong en, wail em i stap aninit long han bilong husban bilong en.

original: or when a feeling of jealousy comes over a husband and he suspects his wife. He is to have the woman stand before the LORD, and the priest is to apply to her this entire law.
translation: Wanpela taim husban i gat kaskas, em i tokim olsem meri bilong en i gat pasin, em bai i kirapim meri, na prist bai yusim dispela lo long em, ol i sanap bifo LORD.

original: The husband will be free from guilt, but the woman shall bear her iniquity.”
translation: Poro bai fri long gilt, tasol meri bai karim simuk bilong em.

original: And the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok long Moses,

original: “Speak to the Israelites and tell them that if a man or woman makes a special vow, the vow of a Nazirite, to separate himself to the LORD,
translation: Tokim ol Israel, i makim wan spesol promis, promis bilong Nazirait, ol i separatem sebetsyen long LORD, i stap aparaim long LORD.

original: he is to abstain from wine and strong drink. He must not drink vinegar made from wine or strong drink, and he must not drink any grape juice or eat fresh grapes or raisins.
translation: Em i mas pundaun wain na dring strong. I no inusim viniga we em i kam long wain o dring strong, na i no inusim jus bilong grape, o kaikai grape i stap yet, o raisin.

original: All the days of his separation, he is not to eat anything that comes from the grapevine, not even the seeds or skins.
translation: Ol dei bilong hem i go long taim em i stap apart, em i no ken kaikai samting ol i kam long vin, nokis sip na skin bilong drai.

original: For the entire period of his vow of separation, no razor shall pass over his head. He must be holy until the time of his separation to the LORD is complete; he must let the hair of his head grow long.
translation: Olgeta taim bilong promis blong parting blong em, maisin bilong kutim gras i no ken go antap long hed bilong em. Em mas halow, na bai em i kamap long taim blong em i parting long LORD, tasol em mas lusim hair blong hed bilong em i grow long.

original: Throughout the days of his separation to the LORD, he must not go near a dead body.
translation: Long ol taim we em i stap apart long God, em i no ken go klostu long bodi i dai.

original: Even if his father or mother or brother or sister should die, he is not to defile himself, because the crown of consecration to his God is upon his head.
translation: Sapos papa, mama, brata, o susa bilong en i dai, em i no ken givim bodi bilong en i go long ol samting nogut, wantaim kraun bilong halivim em i stap long hed bilong en.

original: Throughout the time of his separation, he is holy to the LORD.
translation: Long taim em i stap apart, em i man bilong Papa God.

original: If someone suddenly dies in his presence and defiles his consecrated head of hair, he must shave his head on the day of his cleansing—the seventh day.
translation: I gat man i dai suden long han bilong plesen na i bagarapim hed bilong en we em i tanim olsem, em bai kisim kap bilong en long dei namba seven, dei em i mekim klin i go.

original: On the eighth day he must bring two turtledoves or two young pigeons to the priest at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Long namel bilong eigth de, em i mas bringim tu turtuldoves o tu pijin nogut yet i go long han bilong pries long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting.

original: And the priest is to offer one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering to make atonement for him, because he has sinned by being in the presence of the dead body. On that day he must consecrate his head again.
translation: Na prist i mas givim wan olsem sin ofing na narak ai olsem bun ofing, meekim peis long en, bikos em i stap klostu long bodi i dai pinis. Long de i mas mekim hed bilong en i holin gen.

original: He must rededicate his time of separation to the LORD and bring a year-old male lamb as a guilt offering. But the preceding days shall not be counted, because his separation was defiled.
translation: Em i mas redediket taim bilong hapkas long LORD, na bringim lak i gat wanpela yia olsem ofing bilong gilm. Tasol dei olgeta bifora bai no ken kountim, wantaim em i mekim hapkas i paitim.

original: Now this is the law of the Nazirite when his time of separation is complete: He must be brought to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting,
translation: Nau dispela em i loa bilong Nazarita wannem taim bilong hem i kamap pinis: Hem mas i bringim i go long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting,

original: and he is to present an offering to the LORD of an unblemished year-old male lamb as a burnt offering, an unblemished year-old female lamb as a sin offering, and an unblemished ram as a peace offering—
translation: Na em bai kisim i go long ples bilong ofing long LORD, wanpela ram we i gat wan yia, man, i gat kain kain birua nogat, olsem naus bilong ofing em i paul ais, lip female goat we i gat wan yia, i gat kain kain birua nogat, olsem naus bilong ofing bilong sin, na wanpela ram i gat kain kain birua nogat, olsem naus bilong ofing bilong peis—

original: together with their grain offerings and drink offerings—and a basket of unleavened cakes made from fine flour mixed with oil and unleavened wafers coated with oil.
translation: Olgeta wantaim ka moning long graun na dring ofrings, na wanpela baskit bilong kek i no gat yist, ol i mekmol long flaupau bilong gudepela kualiti i mixim wantaim oil, na wafer i no gat yist, ol i saveman long oil.

original: The priest is to present all these before the LORD and make the sin offering and the burnt offering.
translation: Prist bai wokim ol dispela sakrifis long bifor ai bilong LORD, na wokim ofing bilong sin na ofing bilong bun.

original: He shall also offer the ram as a peace offering to the LORD, along with the basket of unleavened bread. And the priest is to offer the accompanying grain offering and drink offering.
translation: Em bai ofa ram olsem peis ofing long Jehovah, wantaim basket bilong bret isipela. Na prist i mas ofa ofa bilong graun na ofa bilong dring i go wantaim.

original: Then at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, the Nazirite is to shave his consecrated head, take the hair, and put it on the fire under the peace offering.
translation: Na long entris bilong Tenen blong Mitim, Nazirait i mas kisim hed bilong en i stap long hap bilong God, kem na kisim hed bilong en, putim i go daunbilo long paits bilong peis ofing.

original: And the priest is to take the boiled shoulder from the ram, one unleavened cake from the basket, and one unleavened wafer, and put them into the hands of the Nazirite who has just shaved the hair of his consecration.
translation: Na prist i mas tekem skul boilt bilong ram, wanpela bisket i no gat yeast from basket, na wanpela wafer i no gat yeast, na putim ol i go long han bilong Nazirait we nasel em i kisim hap bilong hed bilong em we em i bin kukim long taim bilong bikpela wok bilong promis bilong em.

original: The priest shall then wave them as a wave offering before the LORD. This is a holy portion for the priest, in addition to the breast of the wave offering and the thigh that was presented. After that, the Nazirite may drink wine.
translation: Prist bai wokim olsem wanpela ofring we yu waipe i go bifor ai bilong LORD. Em i wanpela hap graun long priest, longsaed na long hap bilong brest we yu waipe i go, na han bilong lek we yu tokautim. Bihaenim, Nazirite inap dring wain.

original: This is the law of the Nazirite who vows his offering to the LORD for his separation, in addition to whatever else he can afford; he must fulfill whatever vow he makes, according to the law of his separation.”
translation: Dispela em i lo bilong Nazarit, husat i tokim bikpela painim long Lod long taim bilong em i kamap strong, plis long ol samting narakain em ina save kisim; em mas mekim olsem lo bilong taim em i strong, na usim olsem.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Tell Aaron and his sons: This is how you are to bless the Israelites. Say to them:
translation: Tokim Aaron na ol pikinini bilong em: Dispela em i wanem samting yu mas blesim ol Israel. Yu tokim ol:

original: ‘May the LORD bless you and keep you;
translation: Papa bilong mipela i givim bikos long yu na i stap lukim yu;

original: may the LORD cause His face to shine upon you and be gracious to you;
translation: Mipela hop long LORD ibin mekim pes bilong em i kamap shine long yu na ibin givim yu graun.

original: may the LORD lift up His countenance toward you and give you peace.’
translation: Papa God i kirapim pes bilong en long yu na givim yu pis.

original: So they shall put My name on the Israelites, and I will bless them.”
translation: Ol bai putim nem bilong mi long ol Israel, na mi bai givim bikpela bless long ol.

original: On the day Moses finished setting up the tabernacle, he anointed and consecrated it and all its furnishings, along with the altar and all its utensils.
translation: Long day Mosisi i kamapim pinis haus lotu, em i givim oili na makim em i holide, olgeta samting bilong insait long em, longsaitim alta na kakaruk bilong alta.

original: And the leaders of Israel, the heads of their families, presented an offering. These men were the tribal leaders who had supervised the registration.
translation: Na ol lida bilong Isrel, ol bikpela man bilong ol famili, i givim ofing. Ol man hia i stap ol lida bilong ol tripe ol i bin supervisa long resitrisen.

original: They brought as their offering before the LORD six covered carts and twelve oxen—an ox from each leader and a cart from every two leaders—and presented them before the tabernacle.
translation: Ol i bringim sikis karet klosim na twelv bikman - wanpela bikman long wanpela bikman, na wanpela karet long tu pela bikman - olsem ofing bilong ol long hap bilong LORD, na ol i presentim ol long hap bilong tabernakul.

original: And the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Bikpela i tok long Moses,

original: “Accept these gifts from them, that they may be used in the work of the Tent of Meeting. And give them to the Levites, to each man according to his service.”
translation: Kabim gif olsem long ol, ola i ken usim long wok bilong Haus Bilong Miting. Na givim ol i go long ol Levait, long olgen man, strongim sabis bilong en.

original: So Moses took the carts and oxen and gave them to the Levites.
translation: Na Mosis em i kisim karet na bulmakau, em i givim ol i go long Levai.

original: He gave the Gershonites two carts and four oxen, as their service required,
translation: Em i givim Gershonites tu ka na foa bulmakau, olsem wok bilong ol i stap.

original: and he gave the Merarites four carts and eight oxen, as their service required, all under the direction of Ithamar son of Aaron the priest.
translation: Na em givim Merarites foa ka na eyt bulmakau, olsem wok bilong ol i askim, long hap bilong Ithamar, pikinini bilong Aron pris.

original: But he did not give any to the Kohathites, since they were to carry on their shoulders the holy objects for which they were responsible.
translation: Bai em i no givim notin long ol Kohathi, wantaim ol i mas karim i go long ol shaula bilong ol samting bilong halivim we ol i save kim.

original: When the altar was anointed, the leaders approached with their offerings for its dedication and presented them before the altar.
translation: Taim em i bin salim alti, bikman i kam na brinngim ofring bilong ol long wei bilong bikpela de, na ol i bin prisentim ofring bilong ol long alti.

original: And the LORD said to Moses, “Each day one leader is to present his offering for the dedication of the altar.”
translation: Na Bikpela i tokim Mosis, "Long dispela de, wanpela bikpela i mas kam bekim ofing bilong en long taim bilong kamapim altia."

original: On the first day Nahshon son of Amminadab from the tribe of Judah drew near with his offering.
translation: Long monding dei wan, Nahshon, pikinini bilong Amminadab, husat i bin man bilong tribe bilong Judah, i kam klus wantaim ofing bilong en.

original: His offering was one silver platter weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel and filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
translation: Ofing bilong em i bin wanpela plati silva weiting 130 sekels, na wanpela bol silva weiting 70 sekels, olsem laip long sanctuary sekels, na jubel long flour finis i mixim wantaim oil bilong ofing bilong grain.

original: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;
translation: Wanpela plak bilong gol, em i wei ten sikil, i fulap long smel bilong bikpela ston;

original: one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old for a burnt offering;
translation: Wanpela bulmakau i go nau, wanpela rami, na wanpela male lamb we em i gat wanpela yia ol i go long saksak pinis olsem givim sacrifice.

original: one male goat for a sin offering;
translation: Wanpela male goat long offerings bilong sin;

original: and a peace offering of two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Nahshon son of Amminadab.
translation: Na ofa bilong pis long tupela bulmakau, faiv ram, faiv male goat bilong man, na faiv male lamb bilong man we em i gat wan yia. Dispela em ofa bilong Nahshon sussa bilong Amminadab.

original: On the second day Nethanel son of Zuar, the leader of Issachar, drew near.
translation: Long sekond dei Nethanel, pikinini bilong Zuar, bikman bilong Issachar, kam klostu.

original: The offering he presented was one silver platter weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel and filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
translation: Ofa em i givim wanpela plati silva we i ka 130 shekel, na wanpela bol silva we i ka 70 shekel, ol i go olsem shekel bilong Hai Haus Lotu, na ol i fulap long flour fini i mixim wantaim oil olsem ofa bilong graun;

original: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;
translation: Wanpela bikpela plati bilong gol, em i wieit ten shekels, i kamap long smel;

original: one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old for a burnt offering;
translation: Wanpela bulmakau i no ol yet, wanpela rami, na wanpela male lamb we em i gat wanpela yia ol i go long ofisa burnim.

original: one male goat for a sin offering;
translation: Wanpela male goat long offering bilong sin;

original: and a peace offering of two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Nethanel son of Zuar.
translation: Na wanpela peis ofing long tu bulmakau, faiv ram, faiv male goat, na faiv male lamb we i gat wan yia. Em i bikim olsem, ofing bilong Nethanel, pikinini bilong Zuar.

original: On the third day Eliab son of Helon, the leader of the Zebulunites, drew near.
translation: Long dei tre, Eliab, pikinini bilong Helon, bikman bilong Zebulunait, kam klostu.

original: His offering was one silver platter weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel and filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
translation: Ofing bilong em i wanpela plati silva weiting em hundred na trimpi sikil, na wanpela bol silva weiting em seventi sikil, olgeta ikam long hap kas moni bilong sanctuary sikil, na ol i kamapim finisfla na oil long dinau bilong grain.

original: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;
translation: Wanpela plak bilong gol, em i kaikai ten shekel, i fulap long smel;

original: one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old for a burnt offering;
translation: Wanpela bulmakau i no ol yet, wanpela rame, na wanpela male lamb we em i gat wanpela yia olsem ofering we yu mas burn long loa;

original: one male goat for a sin offering;
translation: Wanpela male goat long ofing bilong sin;

original: and a peace offering of two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Eliab son of Helon.
translation: Na wanpela peis ofing bilong Tupela bulmakau, faiv ram, faiv mamel goat, na faiv mamel olpikinini wanpela yia ol. Dispela em ofing bilong Eliab sut bilong Helon.

original: On the fourth day Elizur son of Shedeur, the leader of the Reubenites, drew near.
translation: Long degeda de, Elizur, pikinini bilong Shedeur, bikman bilong Pipol bilong Ruben, kam antap.

original: His offering was one silver platter weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel and filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
translation: Ofing bilong em i bin wan plater silva weiting 130 shekels, na wan bol silva weiting 70 shekels, olgeta ikam long shekel bilong haus lotu, na jubel long flour nogut tru i mixim wantaim oil bilong ofing bilong graun.

original: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;
translation: Wanpela plati bilong gol, em i wei ten shekel, i fulap long insens;

original: one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old for a burnt offering;
translation: Wanpela bulmakau i no ol yet, wanpela rama, na wanpela male lamb we em i gat wanpela yia long ofisa na brenim.

original: one male goat for a sin offering;
translation: Wanpela male goat long ofing bilong sin;

original: and a peace offering of two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Elizur son of Shedeur.
translation: Na ofing bilong peas bilong tupela bulmakau, faiv ram, faiv male goat bilong man, na faiv male lamb bilong man wanpela yia olsem. Dispela em ofing bilong Elizur sone Shedeur.

original: On the fifth day Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai, the leader of the Simeonites, drew near.
translation: Long dia faiv, Shelumiel, pikinini bilong Zurishaddai, bikman bilong Simeonitis, kam klostu.

original: His offering was one silver platter weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel and filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
translation: Ofing bilong em i bin wanpela plati silva weiting 130 sekil, na wanpela bol silva weiting 70 sekil, ol i kamap fulap long flour fini i mixim wantaim oil olsem ofing bilong grain, olsem long sanctuary sekil.

original: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;
translation: Wanpela plati bilong gol i gat weiT ten shekel, i fulap long smel;

original: one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old for a burnt offering;
translation: Wanpela bulmakau i go nau, wanpela rama, na wanpela male lamb we em i gat wanpela yia ol i bringim go long ples bilong bung na kisim i go ap.

original: one male goat for a sin offering;
translation: Wanpela male goat long offering bilong sin;

original: and a peace offering of two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai.
translation: Na wanpela peis ofing long tupela bulmakau, faiv ram, faiv male goat, na faiv male lamb we i gat wanpela yia ol. Dispela em i ofing bilong Shelumiel, pikinini bilong Zurishaddai.

original: On the sixth day Eliasaph son of Deuel, the leader of the Gadites, drew near.
translation: Long dei sikis Eliasaf sana bilong Deuel, bikman bilong Gaditis, i kam klostu.

original: His offering was one silver platter weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel and filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
translation: Ofaring bilong em i stap: wanpela plati silva weiting hundred thirty sikel, na wanpela bol silva weiting seventy sikel, olsem laik sanctuary sikel, na i kamap fulap long flour fini ikam long oi olsem ofaring bilong grain.

original: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;
translation: Wanpela plati bilong gol i kamap long ten shekels, i fulap long smel;

original: one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old for a burnt offering;
translation: Wanpela bulmakau i no ol yet, wanpela rame, na wanpela male lamb we em i gat wanpela yia olsem long sacrifis bilong bren;

original: one male goat for a sin offering;
translation: Wanpela male goat long ofing bilong sin;

original: and a peace offering of two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Eliasaph son of Deuel.
translation: Na wanpela ofing bilong peis, long ol bulmakau tu, rams faiv, male goat bilong man faiv, na male lamb bilong man faiv, ol i stap wanpela yia. Em i ofing bilong Eliasaph, Pikinini bilong Deuel.

original: On the seventh day Elishama son of Ammihud, the leader of the Ephraimites, drew near.
translation: Long long seventh de, Elishama, pikinini bilong Ammihud, bikman bilong Efrayimta, i kam klus.

original: His offering was one silver platter weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel and filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
translation: Ofing bilong em i bin wan plati silva we i kaikai hundred na thirty sikels, na wan bol silva we i kaikai seventy sikels, olsem lo bilong sikels bilong hai haus, na tupela i fulap long flour nogut ikam long oil bilong ofing bilong grain;

original: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;
translation: Wanpela pleni bilong gol, em i weipim ten shekel, i fulap long insens;

original: one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old for a burnt offering;
translation: Wanpela bulmakau i go nau, wanpela rama, na wanpela male lamb we em i gat wanpela yia ol i go long ofing bilong God.

original: one male goat for a sin offering;
translation: Wanpela male goat long Offering bilong sin;

original: and a peace offering of two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Elishama son of Ammihud.
translation: Na ofing bilong pis long tupela bulmakau, faiv ram, faiv kabir man, na faiv lamb man we i gat wan yia. Dispela em i ofing bilong Elishama, pikinini bilong Ammihud.

original: On the eighth day Gamaliel son of Pedahzur, the leader of the Manassites, drew near.
translation: Long de namba eight, Gamaliel, pikinini bilong Pedahzur, lidaman bilong Manasi, kam klostu.

original: His offering was one silver platter weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel and filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
translation: Ofa bilong em i bin wanpela plati silva we i gat wei hundret na tiriti shekel, na wanpela bol silva we i gat wei seventi shekel, olsem laik shekel bilong haihaus, na tupela i fulap bilong flauer fini mixim wantaim oil bilong ofa bilong grain.

original: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;
translation: Wanpela plak bilong gol we i holim ten shekels, i fulap na i holim smel;

original: one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old for a burnt offering;
translation: Wanpela bulmakau i no ol yet, wanpela rame, na wanpela male lamb we em i gat wanpela yia ol i go long ofa bilong bungim hevi.

original: one male goat for a sin offering;
translation: Wanpela male goat long offering bilong sin;

original: and a peace offering of two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Gamaliel son of Pedahzur.
translation: Na wanpela peis ofing long two bulmakau, five ram, five male goat, na five male lambs we i gat wanpela yia ol. Dispela em i ofing bilong Gamaliel sussa bilong Pedahzur.

original: On the ninth day Abidan son of Gideoni, the leader of the Benjamites, drew near.
translation: Long nait bilong nain, Abidan, pikinini bilong Gideoni, bikman bilong ol Benjamait, i kam klostu.

original: His offering was one silver platter weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel and filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
translation: Ofing bilong em i bin wanpela plati silva we i pikimap long 130 sekels, na wanpela bol silva we i pikimap long 70 sekels, olsem sanctuary sekels i tok, na tupela i kamap long flour nogut tru ibin mixim wantaim oil bilong ofing bilong grain.

original: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;
translation: Wanpela plati bilong gol, em i weiting ten shekels, i fulap long incense;

original: one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old for a burnt offering;
translation: Wanpela bulmakau i no ol yet, wanpela rami, na wanpela male lamb we em i gat wanpela yia, ol i go long saksis long paia;

original: one male goat for a sin offering;
translation: Wanpela male goat long Offering bilong sin;

original: and a peace offering of two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Abidan son of Gideoni.
translation: Na wanpela peis ofing long tupela bulmakau, faiv ram, faiv bikpela kambek masalai, na faiv smolpela ram we i gat wanpela yia. Em i bikim ofing long Abidan, pikinini bilong Gideoni.

original: On the tenth day Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai, the leader of the Danites, drew near.
translation: Long dekedena dei, Ahiezer, Pikinini bilong Ammishaddai, bic head bilong Pipol bilong Dan, i kam antap.

original: His offering was one silver platter weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel and filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
translation: Ofa bilong em i wan plati silva weiting hundred na trimpi shekels, na wan bol silva weiting seventy shekels, olgeta ikam long sikil bilong hai hus, na juempela i kamap long flour finpela miksim wantaim oil bilong ofa bilong grain.

original: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;
translation: Wanpela plati bilong gol weiting ten shekel, i kamap long insens;

original: one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old for a burnt offering;
translation: Wanpela bulmakau i go long, wanpela rame, na wanpela male lamb we em i gat wonpela yia olsem ofering we yu mas burn long ples bilong Gad.

original: one male goat for a sin offering;
translation: Wanpela male goat long offering bilong sin;

original: and a peace offering of two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai.
translation: Na wanpela ofing bilong pis long tupela bulmakau, faiv ram, faiv male goat, na faiv male lamb we em i gat wanpela yia. Dispela em i ofing bilong Ahiezer, pikinini bilong Ammishaddai.

original: On the eleventh day Pagiel son of Ocran, the leader of the Asherites, drew near.
translation: Long degeda eleben dei, Pagiel sosa bilong Ocran, bikman bilong ol Asheri, i kam klostu.

original: His offering was one silver platter weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel and filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
translation: Ofa bilong em i bin wan plati silva weiting hundred thirty shekel, na wan bol silva weiting seventy shekel, olsem shekel bilong haiwe haus, na tupela i kamap bilong flour gutpela i mixim wantaim oil bilong ofa bilong grain;

original: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;
translation: Wanpela plati bilong gol, weiting ten shekel, ipla long incense;

original: one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old for a burnt offering;
translation: Wanpela bulmakau i go nau, wanpela rami, na wanpela ram male we em i gat wanpela yia ol i go long bikim ofing.

original: one male goat for a sin offering;
translation: Wanpela male goat long offering bilong sin;
