original: and a peace offering of two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Pagiel son of Ocran.
translation: Na wanpela peis ofing long two bulmakau, five rams, five male goats, na five male lep ol i gat wanpela yia. Dispela em i ofing bilong Pagiel sasan bilong Ocran.

original: On the twelfth day Ahira son of Enan, the leader of the Naphtalites, drew near.
translation: Long de twelv, Ahira man bilong Enan, bikman bilong Olegta descendan bilong Naphtali, i kam antap.

original: His offering was one silver platter weighing a hundred and thirty shekels, and one silver bowl weighing seventy shekels, both according to the sanctuary shekel and filled with fine flour mixed with oil for a grain offering;
translation: Ofing bilong em i bin wan plati silva weiting hundred na tiri sekels, na wan bol silva weiting seventy sekels, olgeta olsem laik sekels bilong haihaus, na juimapim wantaim flour finis na oil bilong mekim ofing bilong grain.

original: one gold dish weighing ten shekels, filled with incense;
translation: Wanpela plak bilong gol weiting ten shekel, i kamap long incense;

original: one young bull, one ram, and one male lamb a year old for a burnt offering;
translation: Wanpela bulmakau i go nau, wanpela rami, na wanpela male lamb we em i gat wanpela yia ol i go long ofisa bung wantaim faia.

original: one male goat for a sin offering;
translation: Wanpela male goat long offering bilong sindoon;

original: and a peace offering of two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Ahira son of Enan.
translation: Na wanpela ofing bilong peis long tupela bulmakau, faiv ram, faiv male goat bilong man, na faiv male lamb bilong man ol i gat wanpela yia ol. Dispela em i ofing bilong Ahira man bilong Enan.

original: So these were the offerings from the leaders of Israel for the dedication of the altar when it was anointed: twelve silver platters, twelve silver bowls, and twelve gold dishes.
translation: Ol ofa bilong ol bikpela man bilong Isrel long taim bilong dedisem bilong altar wén i kam anointim em i go olsem: twelv pleta silva, twelv bol silva, na twelv dishes gol.

original: Each silver platter weighed a hundred and thirty shekels, and each silver bowl seventy shekels. The total weight of the silver articles was two thousand four hundred shekels, according to the sanctuary shekel.
translation: Nambis silva plita i gat wei hundred thirty sekels, na nambis bowl silva i gat seventy sekels. Wei bilong ol samting silva em i go daun long two thousand four hundred sekels, strongim long sekels bilong haihaus.

original: The twelve gold dishes filled with incense weighed ten shekels each, according to the sanctuary shekel. The total weight of the gold dishes was a hundred and twenty shekels.
translation: Twelefpea gol kap bilong insens i fillim-ap, na ol i wail long ten shekel, long hap bilong sanctuary shekel. Wet bilong gol kap olgeta i kamap em i wan hundred na twenty shekel.

original: All the livestock for the burnt offering totaled twelve bulls, twelve rams, and twelve male lambs a year old—together with their grain offerings—and twelve male goats for the sin offering.
translation: Olgeta bulmakau, ram, na lek bilong sip husat i go long ples bilong God long ofing em we yol i burn olgeta, i kamap twelv by hand, twelv ram, na twelv lek bilong sip wanpela yia olsem - wantaim poroman bilong grain - na twelv lek bilong goat long ofing bilo sin.

original: All the livestock sacrificed for the peace offering totaled twenty-four bulls, sixty rams, sixty male goats, and sixty male lambs a year old. This was the dedication offering for the altar after it was anointed.
translation: Olgeta animal husat i bin sacrifisim long peis ofing em i kamap namba twenty-four bulmakau, sixty ram, sixty male goat, na sixty male lep husat i gat wan yia. Dispela em i dedikeshon ofring long alta bihaenim em i bin anointim.

original: When Moses entered the Tent of Meeting to speak with the LORD, he heard the voice speaking to him from between the two cherubim above the mercy seat on the ark of the Testimony. Thus the LORD spoke to him.
translation: Wanpela taim Musos go insait long Haus Bilong Miting bilong tokim wantaim LORD, em i harim voys bilong tokim wantaim em, voys i kam bek gen from antap long cherubim tu ol i save stap abov sit bilong mercy long bokis bilong Testimeni. Olsem nau LORD i tokim wantaim em.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Speak to Aaron and tell him: ‘When you set up the seven lamps, they are to light the area in front of the lampstand.’”
translation: Tokim long Aaron, em bai yu plantim lamp seven, na ol i mas givim lait long hap bilong lamp.

original: And Aaron did so; he set up the lamps facing toward the front of the lampstand, just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Na Aron i mekim olsem; i setim lamplong, ol i luk i go long hap bilong lampstand, olsem Jehovah i tokim Mose.

original: This is how the lampstand was constructed: it was made of hammered gold from its base to its blossoms, fashioned according to the pattern the LORD had shown Moses.
translation: Em i go long olsem na lampstand ibin mekim: em ibin mekim long gol we ibin pekpek, from wes ibin stat long en iles long flauer, ibin wokim olsem piktua LORD ibin showim Moses.

original: Again the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
translation: Papa God i tokim Mosis gen, olsem:

original: “Take the Levites from among the Israelites and make them ceremonially clean.
translation: Kisim Levaitis long hap bilong Israelitis, woshim ol, na mekim ol i kamap klia long wei bilong lotu.

original: This is what you must do to cleanse them: Sprinkle them with the water of purification. Have them shave their whole bodies and wash their clothes, and so purify themselves.
translation: Dispela em i go long ol: Sprinkim ol wantaim wata bilong kliaim. Ol mas kisim raus olgeta gras bilong bodi, wasim klos, na bai ol i klia gen, me kim bek gen long klia.

original: Then have them take a young bull with its grain offering of fine flour mixed with oil, and you are to take a second young bull for a sin offering.
translation: Ol i bringim bulmakau yangpela i go wantaim ka moning long flauer finis i mixim long oil, na yu mas bringim narapela bulmakau yangpela long offering bilong sin.

original: Bring the Levites before the Tent of Meeting and assemble the whole congregation of Israel.
translation: Kisim ol Levit na kam long hap bilong Tent blong Miting, na tokautim olgeta yangpela Isael.

original: You are to present the Levites before the LORD and have the Israelites lay their hands upon them.
translation: Yu mas bringim Levita i go bifoa LORD, na Israelita i mas raitim han bilong ol long ol.

original: Aaron is to present the Levites before the LORD as a wave offering from the sons of Israel, so that they may perform the service of the LORD.
translation: Aron mas bekim Levait long hap bilong ol long ai bilong LORD, olsem wok bung long ofa bilong pikinini bilong Israel, na bai ol i ken wokim wok bilong LORD.

original: And the Levites are to lay their hands on the heads of the bulls, and offer to the LORD one as a sin offering and the other as a burnt offering, to make atonement for the Levites.
translation: Na Levites ol i laikim han bilong ol long hed bilong bullok, na ofa bilong sin na ofa bilong bun ol i givim long LORD, wan long ofa bilong sin na narapela long ofa bilong bun, ol i mekim pes bilong Levites.

original: You are to have the Levites stand before Aaron and his sons and then present them before the LORD as a wave offering.
translation: Ol Levitimai i stap bifo Aaron na ol pikinini bilong en, na bringe ol long bifo LORD olsem ofing bilong wap.

original: In this way you shall separate the Levites from the rest of the Israelites, and the Levites will belong to Me.
translation: Olsem yu inap sepereim Levit long wei, na ol Levy i bilong Mipela, na olgeta Israel bai i stap gen.

original: After you have cleansed them and presented them as a wave offering, they may come to serve at the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Bihaenim yu wasim ol i klia, ol i kam bek long han bilong yu na yu presentim ol olsem waf bilong ofa, bikos yu kam wark long Haus bilong Miting.

original: For the Levites have been wholly given to Me from among the sons of Israel. I have taken them for Myself in place of all who come first from the womb, the firstborn of all the sons of Israel.
translation: Levai ol i givim ol yet long me, na mi bin tekim ol long me yet, long hap bilong pikinini bilong Israel i kam first long belle, olsem pikinini i kam first.

original: For every firstborn male in Israel is Mine, both man and beast. I set them apart for Myself on the day I struck down all the firstborn in the land of Egypt.
translation: Olgeta pikinini man bilong Israel, ol man na ol bek, em i bilong Mi. Mi bin setim ol long we bilong Misesa long de mi bin kilim olgeta pikinini man long graun bilong Ijip.

original: But I have taken the Levites in place of all the firstborn among the sons of Israel.
translation: Mi kisim Ol Levait long halim long ol pikinini bilong wer ibmong ol pikinini bilong Isrel.

original: And I have given the Levites as a gift to Aaron and his sons from among the Israelites, to perform the service for the Israelites at the Tent of Meeting and to make atonement on their behalf, so that no plague will come against the Israelites when they approach the sanctuary.”
translation: Na mi givim Levit olsem gif long Aaron na sussa bilong en, ol i wok long sarvis bilong Israelit long Haus Bilong Miting, na ol i mekim pe bilong tok iam bilong ol, bilong we i no ken kisim sik long Israelit we bilong ol i go long ples bilong holide.

original: So Moses, Aaron, and the whole congregation of Israel did with the Levites everything that the LORD had commanded Moses they should do.
translation: Moses, Aron, na olgeta kantri bilong Isrel i mekim wok wantaim Ol Levai olgeta samting we Bikpela i tokim Moses mas Mekim.

original: The Levites purified themselves and washed their clothes, and Aaron presented them as a wave offering before the LORD. Aaron also made atonement for them to cleanse them.
translation: Ol Levita i kam klia yet ol yet, na wasim skut bilong ol, na Aron i bin kisim ol long we bilong ofring bifor Bikpela, na Aron i bin mekim peis long bilong ol olsem ia ibin kliaim ol.

original: After that, the Levites came to perform their service at the Tent of Meeting in the presence of Aaron and his sons. Thus they did with the Levites just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Nambis na, Levai i kam wokim wok bilong ol long Haus Bilong Miting, long ai bilong Aron na pikinini bilong en. Ol i mekim olsem na, olsem LORD i tokim Mose.

original: And the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok long Mosese,

original: “This applies to the Levites: Men twenty-five years of age or older shall enter to perform the service in the work at the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Dispela i go long Ol Levit: Man husat i gat twenty-five yia na i go antap long wok bilong mekim sarvis insait long Haus Bilong Miting.

original: But at the age of fifty, they must retire from performing the work and no longer serve.
translation: Taim bilong 50 yia, ol i mas lusi wok long mekim wok, na nobodi no inap servim moa.

original: After that, they may assist their brothers in fulfilling their duties at the Tent of Meeting, but they themselves are not to do the work. This is how you are to assign responsibilities to the Levites.”
translation: Bihaen long dispela, ol Levaita inap helpim brata bilong ol long wokim wok bilong ol long Haus Bilong Miting, tasol ol yet inap wokim wok. Dispela em way bilong givim responcibilti long Levaita.

original: In the first month of the second year after Israel had come out of the land of Egypt, the LORD spoke to Moses in the Wilderness of Sinai:
translation: Long moni em i kam, bai yar tu ol Israel i kam aut long graun Egypt, LORD i tokim Moses long bus Sinai:

original: “The Israelites are to observe the Passover at its appointed time.
translation: Oli Israel i mas observim Pasaova long taim em i kamap.

original: You are to observe it at the appointed time, at twilight on the fourteenth day of this month, in accordance with its statutes and ordinances.”
translation: Yu mas observeim em long taim we i save, long belo bilong dey foaotin, long dey foawtin bilong dispela mun, strongim olgeta loa na ordonas i gat.

original: So Moses told the Israelites to observe the Passover,
translation: Na Mosis i tokim ol Israel long observeim Pasowa.

original: and they did so in the Wilderness of Sinai, at twilight on the fourteenth day of the first month. The Israelites did everything just as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Na ol Israelites mekim olsem long Wanpela wel wilderness bilong Sinai, long taitm bilong dog nap, degede 14 bilong mun em i kam first. Ol Israelites mekim everything olsem Jehovah i givim komando long Moses.

original: But there were some men who were unclean due to a dead body, so they could not observe the Passover on that day. And they came before Moses and Aaron that same day
translation: I gat ol man meri we i stap long bikhet na bikhet long bodi dai, olsem oli no ina paitim Pasowa long de bikhet. Na ol i kam bifo Mosese na Aron long dispela de.

original: and said to Moses, “We are unclean because of a dead body, but why should we be excluded from presenting the LORD’s offering with the other Israelites at the appointed time?”
translation: Ol i tokim Mosis, “Mipela i no klea bikos mipela i kamap long bodi i dai, tasol bilong wanem mipela i no inap go long en na bekim ofing bilong Lod wantaim narepela Israelites long taim we i appointim?”

original: “Wait here until I find out what the LORD commands concerning you,” Moses replied.
translation: Weti hia na mi bai go lukim olsem LORD i tokim mi long yu, Na Musa i tok.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Tell the Israelites: ‘When any one of you or your descendants is unclean because of a dead body, or is away on a journey, he may still observe the Passover to the LORD.
translation: Tokim ol Israel: 'Wanpela man husat i gat dek bilong man, o em i go wokabaut na i no inap long kam, bai em yet ken hariapim Peseka long LORD.

original: Such people are to observe it at twilight on the fourteenth day of the second month. They are to eat the lamb, together with unleavened bread and bitter herbs;
translation: Ol manmeri husat i mas observim em long belo bilong san, long de14 bilong mun tu. Ol i mas kaikai olgeta lamb, wantaim bret bipo unripe na spakel herb;

original: they may not leave any of it until morning or break any of its bones. They must observe the Passover according to all its statutes.
translation: Ol i no ken lusim sampela long namel o brukim neu bilong en, ol i mas holim Pasawa kaikan statut long olgeta wai bilong lo.

original: But if a man who is ceremonially clean and is not on a journey still fails to observe the Passover, he must be cut off from his people, because he did not present the LORD’s offering at its appointed time. That man will bear the consequences of his sin.
translation: Bai em i kamap strong long ples bilong em, i mezim klean, na em i no go wokabaut, tasol em yet i no bihainim Pasova, em bai katim aut long ol pikinini bilong en, bekos em i no bringim ofing bilong Lod long taim we i oraitim, na bai em yet i bekim bikos bilong sin bilong en.

original: If a foreigner dwelling among you wants to observe the Passover to the LORD, he is to do so according to the Passover statute and its ordinances. You are to apply the same statute to both the foreigner and the native of the land.’”
translation: Sapos wanpela man i kam na i stap long ples bilong yu, na em i laik kisim kaekai bilong Peseka long Bikpela, em i mas mekim ol samting long peseka, ol loa na ol rul we i gat. Yu mas usim ol samting olsem long ol i kam na ol indigenous long ples.

original: On the day that the tabernacle, the Tent of the Testimony, was set up, the cloud covered it and appeared like fire above the tabernacle from evening until morning.
translation: Long de ya Haus Bilong Toktok i kamap pinis, kol i kambak i go antap long em, na i luk olsem faia ibin go antap long em, stat long apinon go inap long moning.

original: It remained that way continually; the cloud would cover the tabernacle by day, and at night it would appear like fire.
translation: Em i stap olsem oltaim; klauwud i kap tabernakol long de bilem, na long nait em i luk liklik faia.

original: Whenever the cloud was lifted from above the Tent, the Israelites would set out, and wherever the cloud settled, there the Israelites would camp.
translation: Wanpela taim kalabus i go ap long Haus Bilong Lotu, oli Israelites bai i go i go long rot, na we bilong kalabus i kalap long hap, oli Israelites bai i kam pundaun stap.

original: At the LORD’s command the Israelites set out, and at the LORD’s command they camped. As long as the cloud remained over the tabernacle, they remained encamped.
translation: Long olsem Jehovah i givim tok, Israelites i go na kisim wokabaut, na long olsem Jehovah i givim tok, ol i pasin na katik. Oltaim we klau i stap yet long tabernakul, ol i no lus, tasol i stap yet.

original: Even when the cloud lingered over the tabernacle for many days, the Israelites kept the LORD’s charge and did not set out.
translation: Na klau i stap yet long haus bilong Lod, Olie Israel i holim strong ol wok bilong Lod, na ol i no go yet.

original: Sometimes the cloud remained over the tabernacle for only a few days, and they would camp at the LORD’s command and set out at the LORD’s command.
translation: Wanpela taim kalabus i stap yet long Haus Bilong Tambu, na em i go bek gen long narpela de, ol i kampe long ples na ol i go bek long tok bilong LORD, na ol i go gen long ples narak na ol i stap long ples yet long tok bilong LORD.

original: Sometimes the cloud remained only from evening until morning, and when it lifted in the morning, they would set out. Whether it was by day or by night, when the cloud was taken up, they would set out.
translation: Sampela taim kaan i stap yet long apinun na moning, na em bai i liftp long moning, ol bai i karim i go. Bai em i de bihaen, bai em i nait, taim kaan i kamap long moning, ol bai i go bek, na taim em i karim i go, ol bai i go.

original: Whether the cloud lingered for two days, a month, or longer, the Israelites camped and did not set out as long as the cloud remained over the tabernacle; but when it was lifted, they would set out.
translation: Klok i stap yet long taim olgeta, fo dai, wan mun o longeta, Israelites i kam pundaun na kampedon, tasol oli i no go yet, olsta klok i stap yet ibox long tabernakul; bai wanpela taim em i liftpela, orait oli i go bek.

original: They camped at the LORD’s command, and they set out at the LORD’s command; they carried out the LORD’s charge according to His command through Moses.
translation: Ol i kampe long tok bilong LORD, na ol i go long tok bilong LORD; ol i warkim wok bilong LORD olsem tok bilong en long Moses.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Make two trumpets of hammered silver to be used for calling the congregation and for having the camps set out.
translation: Wokim tupela trambel long silva i wokim na hamar, olsem na bai yusim ol long kisim asamble long ol pipol, na long ol ka long ples i go bek.

original: When both are sounded, the whole congregation is to assemble before you at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Wanpela taim ol i blowim tu, ol assemble mas kam olgeta bifor yu long entris bilong Haus Bilong Lotu.

original: But if only one is sounded, then the leaders, the heads of the clans of Israel, are to gather before you.
translation: Sapos wanpela wokim saun, tasol ol bikpela man bilong clan bilong Isrel, lida i mas kam bung long yu.

original: When you sound short blasts, the camps that lie on the east side are to set out.
translation: Wanpela taim yu kirapim sak em i go olsem, ol ka bilong ples i laki long sait bilong east i mas go bek.

original: When you sound the short blasts a second time, the camps that lie on the south side are to set out. The blasts are to signal them to set out.
translation: Wanpela taim yu kirapim sampela shot blakits, ol kamp we i stap long sait bilong saut i mas go bek. Shot blakits ya em i givim signal olsem ol i go bek long ples narapela.

original: To convene the assembly, you are to sound long blasts, not short ones.
translation: Wokim sanis i go longwe, bai ol i harim na ol i kam bihain long miting.

original: The sons of Aaron, the priests, are to sound the trumpets. This shall be a permanent statute for you and the generations to come.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Haron, ol man bilong lotu, bai mekim sautim trambul. Dispela bai i go we i kam, na bai i stap oltaim long yumi na long ol desenden bilong yumi.

original: When you enter into battle in your land against an adversary who attacks you, sound short blasts on the trumpets, and you will be remembered before the LORD your God and saved from your enemies.
translation: Wanpela taim yu go long battle long graun bilong yu, na eni man i kam bekim yu, yu wokim santing ol i save long trambol, ol i blowim trumpet i stap, na bai yu i stap long memori bilong LORD God bilong yu, na yu bai yu save long enemy bilong yu.

original: And on your joyous occasions, your appointed feasts, and the beginning of each month, you are to blow the trumpets over your burnt offerings and fellowship offerings to serve as a reminder for you before your God. I am the LORD your God.”
translation: Na long taim blong hap, long feis blong yu we God apointim, na long bikpela de bilong mun, yu mas putim saut long trambol olsem wok bilong lotu long ofa blong bun na ofa blong pisin, olsem wanem samting bai remindim yu long God blong yu. Mi bin tok, Mi bin God blong yu.

original: On the twentieth day of the second month of the second year, the cloud was lifted from above the tabernacle of the Testimony,
translation: Long degede dai twenty bilong mun tu bilong yia tu, kol kilik i go apo long hap bilong tabernakel bilong Testimoni.

original: and the Israelites set out from the Wilderness of Sinai, traveling from place to place until the cloud settled in the Wilderness of Paran.
translation: Na Pipol Israel i go bek long Bikpela Kantri Sinai, wokabaut long hap bilong ples i go, na klau i kam daun stap long Bikpela Kantri Paran.

original: They set out this first time according to the LORD’s command through Moses.
translation: Ol i go kam long wel bikos LORD i tok olsem thru Moses.

original: First, the divisions of the camp of Judah set out under their standard, with Nahshon son of Amminadab in command.
translation: Ol divisen bilong kantri bilong Yuda i go bek, na Nakson son bilong Amminadab em i lidim ol, ol i go unda flag bilong ol.

original: Nethanel son of Zuar was over the division of the tribe of Issachar,
translation: Nethanel pikinini bilong Zuar em i bos bilong divelop bilong tribe Issachar.

original: and Eliab son of Helon was over the division of the tribe of Zebulun.
translation: Na Eliab suk bilong Helon i bikpela long divelop bilong tribe Zebulun.

original: Then the tabernacle was taken down, and the Gershonites and the Merarites set out, transporting it.
translation: Na tabenakel i kam daun, na Gershonait na Merarait i go na wail, ol i kisim i karim i go.

original: Then the divisions of the camp of Reuben set out under their standard, with Elizur son of Shedeur in command.
translation: Olgeta hap graun bilong Reuben i go bek aninit long baner bilong ol, na Elizur son bilong Shedeur em i lidim.

original: Shelumiel son of Zurishaddai was over the division of the tribe of Simeon,
translation: Shelumiol son bilong Zurishadai em i bikpela bos bilong divison, grup bilong ol pipol, bilong tribe, wantok, bilong Simeon.

original: and Eliasaph son of Deuel was over the division of the tribe of Gad.
translation: Na Eliasaph pikinini bilong Deuel i bikpela man long divisiun bilong tribe Gad.

original: Then the Kohathites set out, transporting the holy objects; the tabernacle was to be set up before their arrival.
translation: Na Ol Kohati i go bek, ol i kisim na karamapim ol samting bilong God; haus bilong Lotu em bai planti bifor ol i kam.

original: Next, the divisions of the camp of Ephraim set out under their standard, with Elishama son of Ammihud in command.
translation: Nekis, ol divishen bilong kamp bilong Efrem i go bek aninit long stik bilong ol, wantaim Elishama sot bilong Amihud i lidim ol.

original: Gamaliel son of Pedahzur was over the division of the tribe of Manasseh,
translation: Gamaliel pikinini bilong Pedahzur em i bos bilong wanpela hap bilong tribe Manasseh,

original: and Abidan son of Gideoni was over the division of the tribe of Benjamin.
translation: Na Abidan sussa bilong Gideoni i bin kiap long hap bilong tribe Benjamin.

original: Finally, the divisions of the camp of Dan set out under their standard, serving as the rear guard for all units, with Ahiezer son of Ammishaddai in command.
translation: Finally, olgeta yunit bilong Dan i go bung long en, ol i wok long bekim rear guard long olgeta yunit, na Ahiezer son bilong Ammishaddai i stap long komanda.

original: Pagiel son of Ocran was over the division of the tribe of Asher,
translation: Pagiel pikinini bilong Ocran i bikpela man longpela divelop bilong tribe Asher.

original: and Ahira son of Enan was over the division of the tribe of Naphtali.
translation: Na Ahira sussa bilong Enan em i bikpela long hap bilong trib Ol Naphtali.

original: This was the order of march for the Israelite divisions as they set out.
translation: Dispela em i ordinal bilong kam na go bilong divisions bilong Israel ol i go.

original: Then Moses said to Hobab, the son of Moses’ father-in-law Reuel the Midianite, “We are setting out for the place of which the LORD said: ‘I will give it to you.’ Come with us, and we will treat you well, for the LORD has promised good things to Israel.”
translation: Na Moses i tokim Hobab, pikinini bilong Reuel Man Midian, papa bilong meri bilong en, olsem: "Yumi go long ples we Lod i tok olsem: 'Mi bai givim yumi.' Kam wantaim yumi, na yumi bai givim yu gudpela ka, bikos Lod i promisim ol gudpela samting long Israel."

original: “I will not go,” Hobab replied. “Instead, I am going back to my own land and my own people.”
translation: Hobab i tok, "Mi no go," Hobab i tok. "Mi yet go bek long ples bilong mi, plesen bilong mi, na ol wantok bilong mi."

original: “Please do not leave us,” Moses said, “since you know where we should camp in the wilderness, and you can serve as our eyes.
translation: “Plez, no lusim mipela,” Moses i tokim ol, “long kantri bus, yupela save long ples bilong kamp nau mipela mas kamap, na yupela inap wok olsem ai bilong mipela.”

original: If you come with us, we will share with you whatever good things the LORD gives us.”
translation: Sapos yu kam wantaim mipela, mipela bai sharim gutpela samting we Bikpela i givim mipela wantaim yupela.

original: So they set out on a three-day journey from the mountain of the LORD, with the ark of the covenant of the LORD traveling ahead of them for those three days to seek a resting place for them.
translation: Ol i go long wei long jerni tri dei from maunten bilong LORD, na bokis bilong kaen covenant bilong LORD i wokabaut i go bifor ol long dispela taim ol i lukim ples bilong resis bilong ol.

original: And the cloud of the LORD was over them by day when they set out from the camp.
translation: Na klau bilong Lod i stap we namel long ol bihaenim taim ol i kirap nau long ples kanu.

original: Whenever the ark set out, Moses would say, “Rise up, O LORD! May Your enemies be scattered; may those who hate You flee before You.”
translation: Wanpela taim bokis bilong agrikos i go, Moses itok, “Kam daun, Bikpela! Enimig bilong yu ol i spred ol i go; na ol i no likim yu, ol i ranawe bikos bilong yu.”

original: And when it came to rest, he would say: “Return, O LORD, to the countless thousands of Israel.”
translation: Na em i kam bilong pisin, em bai tok: “Kam bek, Papa God, long ol thousand tausen bilong Israel.”

original: Soon the people began to complain about their hardship in the hearing of the LORD, and when He heard them, His anger was kindled, and fire from the LORD blazed among them and consumed the outskirts of the camp.
translation: Ol pipel i statim tokbed long hapkas bilong ol long han bilong LORD, na wen em harim tok bilong ol, anga bilong em i kalap, na faia bilong LORD i paitim na kamlapim ples i stap long bipoa bilong kanu.

original: And the people cried out to Moses, and he prayed to the LORD, and the fire died down.
translation: Na ol pipol i kirap strong long Moses, na em i beten long LORD olsem, na faia i mati.

original: So that place was called Taberah, because the fire of the LORD had burned among them.
translation: Na hap bilong en em i kolim Taberah, bikos faia bilong Lod i bin ka long ol.

original: Meanwhile, the rabble among them had a strong craving for other food, and again the Israelites wept and said, “Who will feed us meat?
translation: Wanpela taim, ol i go dae bipmaus long ol i gat bikpela laik long kai narapela, na Israeli ol i kisim sori, na ol i tukim tok, “Husat bai givim mipela mit?”

original: We remember the fish we ate freely in Egypt, along with the cucumbers, melons, leeks, onions, and garlic.
translation: Yumi i stap rememba mipela kai kilakai nating long Egip, wantaim kuka, melon, lik, onion, na garlik.

original: But now our appetite is gone; there is nothing to see but this manna!”
translation: Bikpela i kamapim hungri bilong yumi i go daun; i no gat sampela samting long lukim, tasol dispela manna bilong God.

original: Now the manna resembled coriander seed, and its appearance was like that of gum resin.
translation: Nau man na man i kamap olsem si coriander, na em i luk olsem resin bilong diwai.

original: The people walked around and gathered it, ground it on a handmill or crushed it in a mortar, then boiled it in a cooking pot or shaped it into cakes. It tasted like pastry baked with fine oil.
translation: Ol pipol i wokabaunt na katim samting, mipela grinding i go longpela hanmil o krushim i go insait mortar, mipela suim i go long kukim pot o mipela mekim olsem kek. Ol i swit olsem pastrii i bin bakim wantaim finis oli.

original: When the dew fell on the camp at night, the manna would fall with it.
translation: Taim dew i kam daun long kemp bihain, maná bai i kam daun wantaim.

original: Then Moses heard the people of family after family weeping at the entrances to their tents, and the anger of the LORD was kindled greatly, and Moses was also displeased.
translation: Na Moses i harim ol pipol long pela famili na famili i krai long entrans bilong haus bilong ol, na fini bilong Jehovah i kalabim tumas, na Moses i sori tru.

original: So Moses asked the LORD, “Why have You brought this trouble on Your servant? Why have I not found favor in Your sight, that You have laid upon me the burden of all these people?
translation: Moses askim LORD, "Wai yu bringim dispela trabel long wokman yu? Wai mipela i no pikinim gras long ai bilong yu, na yu givim mipela dispela bikhet long karim olgeta dispela ol pipel?"

original: Did I conceive all these people? Did I give them birth, so that You should tell me, ‘Carry them in your bosom, as a nurse carries an infant,’ to the land that You swore to give their fathers?
translation: Mi biruaim ol pipol i go? Mi givim ol birth, na yu tokim mi, 'Kilim ol long bosom bilong yu, olsem susa i karim liklik man,' go long ples we yu promis long tumbuna ol?

original: Where can I get meat for all these people? For they keep crying out to me, ‘Give us meat to eat!’
translation: We bilong kisim mit na wei olgeta long dispela ol pipol? Ol i kirap na kalabus long mi, ol tisim tok long mi, "Givim mipela mit long kaikai!"

original: I cannot carry all these people by myself; it is too burdensome for me.
translation: Mi no inap karim ol pipel ya olgeta long mi wanpela; em i tumas long ol skul bilong mi.

original: If this is how You are going to treat me, please kill me right now—if I have found favor in Your eyes—and let me not see my own wretchedness.”
translation: Sapos yu laik tratim mi olsem, yu kirim mi nau yet - sapos mi stap gut long ai bilong yu - na mi no ken si bel hevi bilong mi yet.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Bring Me seventy of the elders of Israel known to you as leaders and officers of the people. Bring them to the Tent of Meeting and have them stand there with you.
translation: LORD i tokim Moses, “Kisim na kam 70 bilong ol bikpela man bilong Israel i go long me, ol i save olsem ol bikpela man na ofisa bilong pipo. Kisim ol i go long Haus Bilong Miting, na ol i stap tasol long hap bilong yu.”

original: And I will come down and speak with you there, and I will take some of the Spirit that is on you and put that Spirit on them. They will help you bear the burden of the people, so that you do not have to bear it by yourself.
translation: Na mi bai kam daun na tokim yu long hap dere, na mi bai kisim olsem samting bilong Speret i stap long yu, na putim dispela Speret long ol. Ol bai helpim yu long karim bek hevi bilong ol pipol, naso yu no ken karim bek i wanpela tasol.

original: And say to the people: Consecrate yourselves for tomorrow, and you will eat meat, because you have cried out in the hearing of the LORD, saying: ‘Who will feed us meat? For we were better off in Egypt!’ Therefore the LORD will give you meat, and you will eat.
translation: Kamel olsem yupela yet long tude, na yupela bai kaikai mit, bikos yupela harim tok bilong ol i go antap long han bilong LORD, olsem: ‘ Husat bai givim mipela ka?’ Olgeta samting ibin kamap gut long Egypt! Sapos, LORD bai givim yupela ka, na yupela bai kaikai.

original: You will eat it not for one or two days, nor for five or ten or twenty days,
translation: Yupela bai kaikai, nogat long wanpela de tasol, na nogat long tu de, na faiv de, na ten de, na twenty de.

original: but for a whole month—until it comes out of your nostrils and makes you nauseous—because you have rejected the LORD, who is among you, and have cried out before Him, saying, ‘Why did we ever leave Egypt?’”
translation: Ba tasol long mun wanpela — na bai i kam aut na kusim yu na mekim yu sik — bikos yu pilim i no laik LORD, hu igo long yu, na ol i krai ausait long em, tukim tok olsem, ‘Bai yumi lusim Egypt long wanem?’”

original: But Moses replied, “Here I am among 600,000 men on foot, yet You say, ‘I will give them meat, and they will eat for a month.’
translation: Na Mosese i tok bek, "Mi stap hirere long narapela sikis tausen man i go wakabaut, yet Yu tok olsem, 'Mi bai givim ol meat na ol bai kaikai moning tripe long wanpela mun.'"

original: If all our flocks and herds were slaughtered for them, would they have enough? Or if all the fish in the sea were caught for them, would they have enough?”
translation: Sapos olgeta bulmakau na pig bilong mipela i kamapim pinis, bai ol i kisim i stap long en? O sapos olgeta pis bilong solwara i kamapim pinis, bai ol i kisim i stap long en?

original: The LORD answered Moses, “Is the LORD’s arm too short? Now you will see whether or not My word will come to pass.”
translation: Papa God i ansa long Moses, “Arm bilong Papa God i stap kukim olsem? Nau yu go si bai yumu save long tok bilong mi bai kam olsem.”

original: So Moses went out and relayed to the people the words of the LORD, and he gathered seventy of the elders of the people and had them stand around the tent.
translation: Mosis i go aut na i givim tok bilong Bikpela long ol pipol, na i kisim seventy bilong ol bikpela manmeri na ol i stap arond long haus bilong toktok.

original: Then the LORD came down in the cloud and spoke to him, and He took some of the Spirit that was on Moses and placed that Spirit on the seventy elders. As the Spirit rested on them, they prophesied—but they never did so again.
translation: Na Bikpela i kam daun long klaud, na i tokim em, na i kisim olsem wanpela hap Spirit we i stap long Mosese, na i putim dispela Spirit long seventi elders. Na spirit i stap long ol, na ol i prophesy – tasol ol i no prophesy gen.

original: Two men, however, had remained in the camp—one named Eldad and the other Medad—and the Spirit rested on them. They were among those listed, but they had not gone out to the tent, and they prophesied in the camp.
translation: Tu man i stap yet long kamp, wan nem bilong en Eldad, na narak na Medad, na Spirut i kam rausim ruim i go long ol. Ol i stap long lista, tasol ol i no go aut long haus bilong spirit, na ol i tokaut long kamp.

original: A young man ran and reported to Moses, “Eldad and Medad are prophesying in the camp.”
translation: Wanpela yangpela man i ran na i ripotim stori long Musa, “Eldad na Medad i prophesy long ples.”

original: Joshua son of Nun, the attendant to Moses since youth, spoke up and said, “Moses, my lord, stop them!”
translation: Joshua, pikinini bilong Nun, haus boi bilong Moses long taim em i bikim, i tok strong na i mekim, "Moses, papa bilong mipela, rupim ol!"

original: But Moses replied, “Are you jealous on my account? I wish that all the LORD’s people were prophets and that the LORD would place His Spirit on them!”
translation: Moses i tok bek, “Yupela i save jelos long namel bilong mi? Mi laikim ol pipol bilong LORD i gohet long Spirit, na LORD bai givim Spirit bilong En i go long ol, olgeta i profet!”

original: Then Moses returned to the camp, along with the elders of Israel.
translation: Moses i kam bek long ka, wantaim ol bikpela man bilong Isrel.

original: Now a wind sent by the LORD came up, drove in quail from the sea, and brought them near the camp, about two cubits above the surface of the ground, for a day’s journey in every direction around the camp.
translation: Na win blong GOD i kam up, drivim pisin quail from solwara i go insait, bringim ol i klostu long kamp, antap long graun olsem tu han fut, long wanpela de poitin long olgetswei aronde kamp.

original: All that day and night, and all the next day, the people stayed up gathering the quail. No one gathered less than ten homers, and they spread them out all around the camp.
translation: Oldei na nait, na oldei namba tu, ol i go daun yet, ol i kam bek gen, na ol i skatera ol gen long graun. Nogat wanpela i kisim kweila liklik, nogat les dan ten homana, na ol i spredim aut ol gen long ken.

original: But while the meat was still between their teeth, before it was chewed, the anger of the LORD burned against the people, and the LORD struck them with a severe plague.
translation: Bai wail ol i stap yet long tung bilong ol, bifoa ol i kaikai pinis, ros bilong Pita i birua long ol pipol, na Pita i givim ol bikpela sik.

original: So they called that place Kibroth-hattaavah, because there they buried the people who had craved other food.
translation: Ol i kolim ples we Kibroth-hattaavah, bikos long hap ol i bin planti long kaikai narakai, na ol i bin kisim i go daun long graun.

original: From Kibroth-hattaavah the people moved on to Hazeroth, where they remained for some time.
translation: Ol pipol i go bek gen long Haiwes long Taava, na ol i kamap long Haserot, na ol stap we liklik taim.

original: Then Miriam and Aaron criticized Moses because of the Cushite woman he had married, for he had taken a Cushite wife.
translation: Na Miriam na Aron i tok besen long Mosese long wanpela meri blong Kush em i mari, bikos em i kisim meri blong Kush olsem wife.

original: “Does the LORD speak only through Moses?” they said. “Does He not also speak through us?” And the LORD heard this.
translation: Papa God i tok olsem tasol long Moses? Em i no tok tu long mipela? Na Papa God i harim dispela toksave.

original: Now Moses was a very humble man, more so than any man on the face of the earth.
translation: Nau Mosese em i man bilong kanua, i gat bikpela humbles long en, olsem narapela man igo long fas bilong graun.

original: And suddenly the LORD said to Moses, Aaron, and Miriam, “You three, come out to the Tent of Meeting.” So the three went out,
translation: Na sipas olsem, LORD i tokim Moses, Aron, na Miriam, “Yu tripela, kam aut go long Haus Bilong Miting.” So tripela man i go aut,

original: and the LORD came down in a pillar of cloud, stood at the entrance to the Tent, and summoned Aaron and Miriam. When both of them had stepped forward,
translation: Na Bikpela i kam daun long pila bilong klod, i stap long entris bilong Haus Bilong Lotu, na i singautim Aaron na Miriam. Ol i kam bek wanpela,

original: He said, “Hear now My words: If there is a prophet among you, I, the LORD, will reveal Myself to him in a vision; I will speak to him in a dream.
translation: Harim nau ol tok bilong mi: I gat propet klostu yumi, Mi, God, bai shoim em maself long em insait long vipin; Mi bai toktok wantaim em long drim.

original: But this is not so with My servant Moses; he is faithful in all My house.
translation: Barehet, Moses wokman bilong mi, em i trai long haus bilong mi na olgeta samting.

original: I speak with him face to face, clearly and not in riddles; he sees the form of the LORD. Why then were you unafraid to speak against My servant Moses?”
translation: Mi tokim long em fas tu fas, klia na no in tok ples; em i lukim fom bilong LORD. Oli no ken tok bagarap long servant Moses bilong Mi?

original: So the anger of the LORD burned against them, and He departed.
translation: Iri bilong Jehovah i brom long ol, na em i go bek.

original: As the cloud lifted from above the Tent, suddenly Miriam became leprous, white as snow. Aaron turned toward her, saw that she was leprous,
translation: Klau i go apo long Haus Tumbuna, Miriam i kamap sik lepura, wait pinis olsem snou. Aron i lusim ai i kam long en, i lukim olsem em i kamap sik lepura.

original: and said to Moses, “My lord, please do not hold against us this sin we have so foolishly committed.
translation: Ol i tokim Mosis, “Papa bilong yumi, yu no holim bek long yumi dis pagal nogut yumi mekim long nogo nogut.”

original: Please do not let her be like a stillborn infant whose flesh is half consumed when he comes out of his mother’s womb.”
translation: No ken gim lego olsem pikinini i kam na i dai bifo em i kam, bodili i half kukim na i go daun long bel bilong mama.

original: So Moses cried out to the LORD, “O God, please heal her!”
translation: Mosis krai aus long GOD bilong ol taim, "O Bikpela, makim meri i kamap gen!"

original: But the LORD answered Moses, “If her father had but spit in her face, would she not have been in disgrace for seven days? Let her be confined outside the camp for seven days; after that she may be brought back in.”
translation: Papa God i givim tok long Musa, “Sapos papa bilong em i spetim pes long faes bilong em, em bai i stap i go long sham long wei seven de? Makem em i go pasim long autoblong kantri seven de, na bihain bai em inap kam bek gen.”

original: So Miriam was confined outside the camp for seven days, and the people did not move on until she was brought in again.
translation: Miriam i go bek long haus sik mun long sait bilong kanu long wik sep, na ol pipel i no moa mov until em i kam bek gen.

original: After that, the people set out from Hazeroth and camped in the Wilderness of Paran.
translation: Ol manmeri i go bekim Hazeroth, na ol i kam pundaun long bus na kamon long Wiwildernes bilong Paran.

original: And the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Bikpela i tok long Moses,

original: “Send out for yourself men to spy out the land of Canaan, which I am giving to the Israelites. From each of their fathers’ tribes send one man who is a leader among them.”
translation: Sindaun man nau long ples bilong yu, go lukim gut dispela lain bilong Kanaan, we mi mekim givim i go long Israel. Long tribe bilong tumbuna ol, bai yu kisim wan bic head, wan man, na bai yu senis i go.

original: So at the consent of the LORD, Moses sent them out from the Wilderness of Paran. All the men were leaders of the Israelites,
translation: Long bilong agreement bilong LORD, Moses salim ol i go from Desert bilong Paran. Ol man ol i bikpela leda bilong Israel.

original: and these were their names: From the tribe of Reuben, Shammua son of Zaccur;
translation: Na dispela i stap namel bilong ol: Long hap bilong tribe bilong Reuben, Shammua man bilong Zaccur;

original: from the tribe of Simeon, Shaphat son of Hori;
translation: Long klab bilong Simeon, Shaphat suköl bilong Hori

original: from the tribe of Judah, Caleb son of Jephunneh;
translation: Long tripe bilong Yuda, Kalebu sun bilong Yepunne;

original: from the tribe of Issachar, Igal son of Joseph;
translation: Long tripe blong Issachar, Igal sussa blong Joseph;

original: from the tribe of Ephraim, Hoshea son of Nun;
translation: Long klab bilong Efrem, Hosea sone bilong Nun;

original: from the tribe of Benjamin, Palti son of Raphu;
translation: Long tripe bilong Binjimin, Palti sussa bilong Raphu;

original: from the tribe of Zebulun, Gaddiel son of Sodi;
translation: Long tripe bilong Zebulun, Gaddiel, pikinini bilong Sodi;

original: from the tribe of Manasseh (a tribe of Joseph), Gaddi son of Susi;
translation: Long tribe bilong Manase, wanpela tribe bilong Joseph, Gadi san bilong Susi;

original: from the tribe of Dan, Ammiel son of Gemalli;
translation: Long tripe bilong Dan, Ammiel pikinini bilong Gemalli;

original: from the tribe of Asher, Sethur son of Michael;
translation: Long tripe bilong Eser, Sethur man bilong Michael;

original: from the tribe of Naphtali, Nahbi son of Vophsi;
translation: Long tripe bilong Naphtali, Nahbi man bilong Vophsi;

original: and from the tribe of Gad, Geuel son of Machi.
translation: Na long tripe bilong Gad, Geuel man bilong Machi.

original: These were the names of the men Moses sent to spy out the land; and Moses gave to Hoshea son of Nun the name Joshua.
translation: Dispela i nem bilong man ol Moses salim go lukim klostu long kantri; na Moses i givim nem Joshua long Hoshea, pikinini bilong Nun.

original: When Moses sent them to spy out the land of Canaan, he told them, “Go up through the Negev and into the hill country.
translation: Moses i sendim ol i go lukluk gras bilong Kanaan, na em i tokim ol, "Go ap long Negev na go insait long kantri bilong maunten."

original: See what the land is like and whether its people are strong or weak, few or many.
translation: Lukim olsem graun i kamap olsem wanem, bai yumupela harim ol pipol bilong en i strong o nogat, i bikpela o liklik, ol i liklik tasol o i plenti.

original: Is the land where they live good or bad? Are the cities where they dwell open camps or fortifications?
translation: Grun we ol i stap em i gutpela o nogut? Towns we ol i stap em i heneng ples nomane o ibin gat barak?

original: Is the soil fertile or unproductive? Are there trees in it or not? Be courageous, and bring back some of the fruit of the land.” (It was the season for the first ripe grapes.)
translation: Ples bilong en i stap strongpela ka o isipela? I gat diwai long en o nogat? Yu mas stronghold na kisim i go bek sampela buit bilong graun.” (Em i taim bilong draypela grape i kam bek).

original: So they went up and spied out the land from the Wilderness of Zin as far as Rehob, toward Lebo-hamath.
translation: Ol i go ap, na ol i lukim bek long kantri, stat long Wilanes long Zin, na i kam inap long Rehob, we i stret long Lebo-hamath.

original: They went up through the Negev and came to Hebron, where Ahiman, Sheshai, and Talmai, the descendants of Anak, dwelled. It had been built seven years before Zoan in Egypt.
translation: Ol i go ap long Negev na kam long Hebron, we ol Ahiman, Sheshai, na Talmai, ol desenden bilong Anak, ol i stap. Taun Hebron em i bin mekim gen seven yia bifo Zoan long Egip.

original: When they came to the Valley of Eshcol, they cut down a branch with a single cluster of grapes, which they carried on a pole between two men. They also took some pomegranates and figs.
translation: Tupela i kam long Vali bilong Eshkol, na ol i kisim wan branch na katim, na long em i gat bun bilong grape. Ol i karim i go long wan stick, na stick em i go long tung bilong tupela man. Ol i kisim pomegranates na figs tu.

original: Because of the cluster of grapes the Israelites cut there, that place was called the Valley of Eshcol.
translation: Bikos long bun bilong grape ol Pipol Israel i katim hap ia, ples ia i kallim Valley of Eshkol.

original: After forty days the men returned from spying out the land,
translation: After foati dei ol man i kam bek from lukim laut long graun,

original: and they went back to Moses, Aaron, and the whole congregation of Israel in the Wilderness of Paran at Kadesh. They brought back a report for the whole congregation and showed them the fruit of the land.
translation: Na ol i go bek gen long Mosese, Aron, na olgeta pipol Israel i stap long Wilerness bilong Paran, long Kades. Ol i kam bek na tok stret long olgeta pipol, na ol i suim givim ol pipol lukim ka bilong graun.

original: And they gave this account to Moses: “We went into the land to which you sent us, and indeed, it is flowing with milk and honey. Here is some of its fruit!
translation: Ol i givim dispela tok long Musa: “Ol i go insait long kantri we yu sendim yumi go, na em i kamap olsem kantri i flai wantaim mik na hari. Em i got samting bilong en, yumi bringim i kam, mi tok olsem, Dispela diwai i gat ka bilong en.”

original: Nevertheless, the people living in the land are strong, and the cities are large and fortified. We even saw the descendants of Anak there.
translation: Nogat sem, ol pipol i stap long kantri i strongpela, na sities i bikpela na i stap strong. Mipela i lukim ol desenden bilong Anak long hap.

original: The Amalekites live in the land of the Negev; the Hittites, Jebusites, and Amorites live in the hill country; and the Canaanites live by the sea and along the Jordan.”
translation: Amalekait i stap long Negev; Hittait, Jebusait, na Amorait i stap long maunten; na Kanaanait i stap long solwara na walong Jordan.

original: Then Caleb quieted the people before Moses and said, “We must go up and take possession of the land, for we can certainly conquer it!”
translation: Na Keleb i stilim ol pipol long en bibong Moses, na em i tok, “Yumi mas go apo na bam bikim dispela graun, bikos yumi inap winim ol i winim!”

original: But the men who had gone up with him replied, “We cannot go up against the people, for they are stronger than we are!”
translation: Ol man i go antap wantaim em i tok bek, "Mipela i no inap go autsait long ol pipol, bikos ol i strongpela yet na mipela i no inam!"

original: So they gave the Israelites a bad report about the land that they had spied out: “The land we explored devours its inhabitants, and all the people we saw there are great in stature.
translation: Ol i givim Israelites ripot i no gut long graun we i go lusim ai bilong en: "Graun em i kaikai ol pipol i stap insait long en, na ol manmeri mipela i lukim long hap em i bikpela tru."

original: We even saw the Nephilim there—the descendants of Anak that come from the Nephilim! We seemed like grasshoppers in our own sight, and we must have seemed the same to them!”
translation: Mipela i lukim Nefilim, ol desenden bilong Anak, ol i kam long Nefilim! Mipela i kamap olsem kunai long ai bilong mipela, na mipela i bin kamap olsem long ai bilong ol!

original: Then the whole congregation lifted up their voices and cried out, and that night the people wept.
translation: Olgeta pipel i go antap long voisis, na ol i kirap strong, na nait i go daun, ol pipel i kisim sore.

original: All the Israelites grumbled against Moses and Aaron, and the whole congregation said to them, “If only we had died in the land of Egypt, or if only we had died in this wilderness!
translation: Ol Israelaiti i tok strong long Mosese na Aron, na lotu bilong ol i tok, "Maski yumi dai pinis long kantri bilong Ijip, o maski yumi dai pinis long dispela bus!

original: Why is the LORD bringing us into this land to fall by the sword? Our wives and children will become plunder. Would it not be better for us to go back to Egypt?”
translation: Olsem wanem LORD i bringim mipela i go long dispela graun bipor mimilo pundaun na kisim dai long sop? Meri na pikinini bilong mipela bai i go daun olgeta, na bai oli kisim ol long taim bilong plunder. Em i no nap bet long mipela go bek long Egip?

original: So they said to one another, “Let us appoint a leader and return to Egypt.”
translation: Ol i tok long ol yet, “Mipela mas appointim wanpela lidia na go bek long Egip.”

original: Then Moses and Aaron fell facedown before the whole assembly of the congregation of Israel.
translation: Na Mosese na Aron i pundaun, ol i kilim gras bifor olgeta assembli bilong kongregation bilong Israel.

original: Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh, who were among those who had spied out the land, tore their clothes
translation: Joshua pikinini bilong Nun na Caleb pikinini bilong Jephunneh, ol i bin go lukim gras bilong kantri, ol i rausim klos blong ol.

original: and said to the whole congregation of Israel, “The land we passed through and explored is an exceedingly good land.
translation: Em i tokim ol asamble bilong Israel, "Kantri mipela i go throo na lukluk em i gutpela tru long olgeta hap."

original: If the LORD delights in us, He will bring us into this land, a land flowing with milk and honey, and He will give it to us.
translation: Ifr GOD i amusim gut long mipela, em bai bringim mipela i go long promisd graun, wanpela hap graun we i gat plenti milk na honey olsem simbol bilong plenti, na em bai givim long mipela.

original: Only do not rebel against the LORD, and do not be afraid of the people of the land, for they will be like bread for us. Their protection has been removed, and the LORD is with us. Do not be afraid of them!”
translation: No ken stap long ribel gen long PAPA GOD, na no ken bikim pret long ol pipol bilong kantri, ol bai olsem bun bilong yumi. Proteksen blong ol i go daun, na PAPA GOD i stap wantaim yumi. No ken bikim pret long ol!

original: But the whole congregation threatened to stone Joshua and Caleb. Then the glory of the LORD appeared to all the Israelites at the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Bikos olgeta asambli i laik paitim ston long Joshua na Kalebu. Na glori bilong LORD i kamap strong long ol Israel, ol i lukim long Haus bilong Miting.

original: And the LORD said to Moses, “How long will this people treat Me with contempt? How long will they refuse to believe in Me, despite all the signs I have performed among them?
translation: Na Papa God i tokim Mosis, “Olgeta hait, mipela i stap long dispela, yupela i mekim mi lait long mipela? Olgeta hait, bai yupela i no bilip long mi, maski ol samting olsem nau mi wokim pinis long midst bilong yupela?”

original: I will strike them with a plague and destroy them—and I will make you into a nation greater and mightier than they are.”
translation: Mi bai kilim ol long sik, na bagarapim ol, na Mi bai mekim yu olsem wanpela nesen moa big na strongpela moa olegeta long ol.

original: But Moses said to the LORD, “The Egyptians will hear of it, for by Your strength You brought this people from among them.
translation: Moses i tokim LORD olsem, "Eipitas ol i harim dispela toktok, bikos yu usim strongpela pasin bilong yu bringen ples ya klostu long ol."

original: And they will tell it to the inhabitants of this land. They have already heard that You, O LORD, are in the midst of this people, that You, O LORD, have been seen face to face, that Your cloud stands over them, and that You go before them in a pillar of cloud by day and a pillar of fire by night.
translation: Ol bai tokim dispela stori long pipol bilong kantri. Ol i harim pinis, Papa God, yu stap long mitim na mitim bilong dispela pipol, ol i save yu, Papa God, yu stap, ol i lukim yu belly to belly, klau bilong yu i stap antap long ol, na yu go bifo ol long klau bilong de na long paia bilong nait.

original: If You kill this people as one man, the nations who have heard of Your fame will say,
translation: Yupela i kilim ol pikinini ya olsem wan man, ol nesen i harim biknem bilong Yu bai tok.

original: ‘Because the LORD was unable to bring this people into the land He swore to give them, He has slaughtered them in the wilderness.’
translation: Bikpela LORD i no inap bringim ples ya go long graun bilong promis, em i tok promis long givim ol, nau em i kilim ol long bus.

original: So now I pray, may the power of my Lord be magnified, just as You have declared:
translation: Mi praip, na pawa bilong Bikpela i go antap moa, olsem yu tok.

original: ‘The LORD is slow to anger and abounding in loving devotion, forgiving iniquity and transgression. Yet He will by no means leave the guilty unpunished; He will visit the iniquity of the fathers upon their children to the third and fourth generation.’
translation: LORD i no skaile long bungim bel, na em i plenti long givim lav, em i givim sin i go, na i lusim ol samting nogut. Tasol em i no ken leevim ol pipol we i mekim nogut bai i stap fri; em bai i kam bekim ol samting nogut we tumbuna i mekim long ol pikinini long jenereishon thri na foa.

original: Pardon, I pray, the iniquity of this people, in keeping with the greatness of Your loving devotion, just as You have forgiven them ever since they left Egypt.”
translation: Padi, mi baim nogut bilong dispela ples, olsem namba wan laik long bikpela ren, olsem yu hammmer long forgivim ol, stat long taim ol luskim Egypt.

original: “I have pardoned them as you requested,” the LORD replied.
translation: “Mi givim pardon long ol olsem yu bin askim,” Bikpela i tok.

original: “Yet as surely as I live and as surely as the whole earth is filled with the glory of the LORD,
translation: Olsem mi yet laip, na olsem graun yet i kamap strong long glori bilong LORD.

original: not one of the men who have seen My glory and the signs I performed in Egypt and in the wilderness—yet have tested Me and disobeyed Me these ten times—
translation: I no wanpela bilong ol man ol i lukim glori bilong Mi na sain bilong Mi me me mekim long Ijip na long bus, yet ol i tesim Mi na i no bihainim Mi dispela ten taim –

original: not one will ever see the land that I swore to give their fathers. None of those who have treated Me with contempt will see it.
translation: Nogat wan bai lukim gras na mi bin tok pak long givim long ol tumbuna bilong ol. Nogat wan bilong ol i bin bagarap mipela bai lukim.

original: But because My servant Caleb has a different spirit and has followed Me wholeheartedly, I will bring him into the land he has entered, and his descendants will inherit it.
translation: Bikos wokman Kalep i gat spirits olsem na em i folo Mimi long hap hap, Mai bai bringim i go long lain God i promis, na ol pikinini bilong em bai inetitim.

original: Now since the Amalekites and Canaanites are living in the valleys, turn back tomorrow and head for the wilderness along the route to the Red Sea.”
translation: Nau ol Amalekitis na Kanaanit i stap long ples vali, katim bek tude na go long bus along rot bilong Solwara Red.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses and Aaron,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses na Aaron,

original: “How long will this wicked congregation grumble against Me? I have heard the complaints that the Israelites are making against Me.
translation: Oli long ol pipol i stap long wei bilong Satan i no givim raitim tok bek gen long mi? Mi harem ol kaikai tok long ol Israel i mekim bek long mi.

original: So tell them: As surely as I live, declares the LORD, I will do to you exactly as I heard you say.
translation: Tokim ol: Olsem laip bilong mi, em i tok olsem, LORD i tok klar, bai mi mekim olsem nau long yu olgeta olsem yu ol tokim mi harim.

original: Your bodies will fall in this wilderness—all who were numbered in the census, everyone twenty years of age or older—because you have grumbled against Me.
translation: Bodies bilong yuail bai bagarap long bus kantri ia – ol manmeri husat i gat twenty yia na i go antap, husat i bin kensosim, bikos yu masalai tok strong long me.

original: Surely none of you will enter the land in which I swore to settle you, except Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.
translation: Tru, nogat wanpela blo yu bai go insait long kantri we mi promis olsem bai mi planim yu, eksept Kaleb sone Jephunneh na Joshua sone Nun.

original: But I will bring your children, whom you said would become plunder, into the land you have rejected—and they will enjoy it.
translation: Mipela bai bringim ol pikinini bilong yu, we yu bin tok ol bai bamdaun olsem loot, inside kantri we yu bin tok nogut long en—and ol bai amamas long en.

original: As for you, however, your bodies will fall in this wilderness.
translation: Long yu, bikos bodies bilong yu bai i go daun long dispela wei nogut.

original: Your children will be shepherds in the wilderness for forty years, and they will suffer for your unfaithfulness until the last of your bodies lies in the wilderness.
translation: Pikinini bilong yupela bai wok olsem pasinda long bus 40 yia, na bai kisim pain long sin bilong yupela, until ol bodi bilong yupela i lie long bus.

original: In keeping with the forty days you spied out the land, you shall bear your guilt forty years—a year for each day—and you will experience My alienation.
translation: Olsem na, long taim dai forti yu pilai i lukim gras bilong yumi, yu mas kisim bikos bilong yu yet long dai forti - wan yia bilong wan dei tasol, na yu bai kisim hatwok long mi.

original: I, the LORD, have spoken, and I will surely do these things to this entire wicked congregation, which has conspired against Me. They will meet their end in the wilderness, and there they will die.”
translation: Mi, LORD, talema, na mi bai mekim ol dispela samting long assembli ol pipol i nogut ol i kam tu ya, ol i bin givim han long go het long Mi. Ol i bai katim na i go daun long bus, na bai ol i dai long bus em i ples bilong pain o dek long ol man.

original: So the men Moses had sent to spy out the land, who had returned and made the whole congregation grumble against him by bringing out a bad report about the land—
translation: Na ol man we Moses bingim go lukim klostu long graun, ol i kam bek na mekim ol pipol we igat bikpela tok bagarap pinis, ol briningim ripot i no gut long graun.

original: those men who had brought out the bad report about the land—were struck down by a plague before the LORD.
translation: Ol man husat i kamautim ripot i no gut long lan – ol i bin dai bekim disease long face bilong LORD.

original: Of those men who had gone to spy out the land, only Joshua son of Nun and Caleb son of Jephunneh remained alive.
translation: Ol man we i go bekim graun, tasol Josua son bilong Nun na Kaleb son bilong Jefunne i stap yet.

original: And when Moses relayed these words to all the Israelites, the people mourned bitterly.
translation: Na taim Moses i tokim ol dispela kina tok long ol Israelites olegata, ol pipel i bin mekim sori tru.

original: Early the next morning they got up and went up toward the ridge of the hill country. “We have indeed sinned,” they said, “but we will go to the place the LORD has promised.”
translation: Bikos nem moning ol i go ap long hap bilong kantri. “Mipela truth sin,” ol i tok, “tasol mipela bai go long ples we Lod i promis.”

original: But Moses said, “Why are you transgressing the commandment of the LORD? This will not succeed!
translation: Masau i tok, "Bai yumi go longwe bilong Papa God olsem wanem? Dispela bai i no inap kamap gut!"

original: Do not go up, lest you be struck down by your enemies, because the LORD is not among you.
translation: No go antap, bikos yu no ken kilim ol, LORD i no stap wantaim yumi.

original: For there the Amalekites and Canaanites will face you, and you will fall by the sword. Because you have turned away from the LORD, He will not be with you.”
translation: Long hap em, Amalekaitis na Kananaitis bai yu harim yu, na ol i punda long sward na ol i dai. Bikos yu tumas bek gen long HAD, em i no stap wantaim yu.

original: But they dared to go up to the ridge of the hill country, though neither Moses nor the ark of the covenant of the LORD moved from the camp.
translation: Tupela i stap long go ap long hap bilong kantri hailans, nogat Moses na bokis bilong kaen long Lod i mosim from kamp.

original: Then the Amalekites and Canaanites who lived in that part of the hill country came down, attacked them, and routed them all the way to Hormah.
translation: Na Amalekit na Kananan i stap long maunten kandre, ol i kam daun, ol i harim ol, na ol i winim ol, ol go long Horma.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Speak to the Israelites and tell them: After you enter the land that I am giving you as a home
translation: Tokim long ol Israel na tokim ol: Bihaenim yu go insait long kantri Mi givim yu kantri nau olsem haus bilong yu.

original: and you present an offering made by fire to the LORD from the herd or flock to produce a pleasing aroma to the LORD—either a burnt offering or a sacrifice, for a special vow or freewill offering or appointed feast—
translation: Na yumi kisim i go long ples bilong givim ofa we i go long paia na bungim ol i go long paia, husat i kam long ol bulmakau o long ol pipel bilong kisim ka, olsem wanem samting i kamap strong long nose, i kirapim het bilong God—emas long tokstrong ples, o long wok bung wantaim, o long dei bilong bikpela katik—yumi bungim ofa em i go long paia olsem bun samting, o saksis, long taim yumi usim ol bulmakau na ol pipel bilong kisim ka olsem ofa.

original: then the one presenting his offering to the LORD shall also present a grain offering of a tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with a quarter hin of olive oil.
translation: Bai man i bringim ofa bilong en long Jehovah, na em bai bringim tu ofa bilong graun, wanpela ten bilong efa bilong flauer finis imiks wantaim oil bilong oliv kwata hin.

original: With the burnt offering or sacrifice of each lamb, you are to prepare a quarter hin of wine as a drink offering.
translation: Long taim yu mekim ofing bung o sakrifis bilong ol lam, yu mas prepearim kwata hin wain olsem dring ofing.

original: With a ram you are to prepare a grain offering of two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with a third of a hin of olive oil,
translation: Wanpela ram, yu mas preparim ofa bilong graun long two-tenths bilong ephah flauer finis, ikam mixim wantaim oil bilong oliv long third bilong hin.

original: and a third of a hin of wine as a drink offering, a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
translation: Na wan third bilong wan hin win olsem draik ofing, em i givim smel i kamap strong long tok bilong LORD.

original: When you prepare a young bull as a burnt offering or sacrifice to fulfill a vow or as a peace offering to the LORD,
translation: Wanpela taim yu preparim bulmakau yangpela olsem ofing bai i go daun, o sakis, o bai yu mekim promis, o peis ofing long Lod,

original: present with the bull a grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with half a hin of olive oil.
translation: Kisim na kam wantaim bulmakau ofa bilong grain long tri-tenths efaa flauer gudepela mixim wantaim haf han olive oil.

original: Also present half a hin of wine as a drink offering. It is an offering made by fire, a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
translation: Tu na halivim hanfala hap hin bilong wain olsem dring ofing. Em i ofing we yu mekim long paia, em i gat wonem smel i gat swit igo long LORD.

original: This is to be done for each bull, ram, lamb, or goat.
translation: Emas long mekim dispela wok long olgeta bulmakau, ram, lek, na kambing.

original: This is how you must prepare each one, no matter how many.
translation: Yupela mas preparim ol i go, nogat wanpela i kamap, tasol.

original: Everyone who is native-born shall prepare these things in this way when he presents an offering made by fire as a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
translation: Ol pipol we i kamap long hap bilong en bai ol i prepaim ol samting dispela long wei dispela wankain taem em i kisim ofing we i go daun long paia olsem wonem smel i swit moa long ai bilong LORD.

original: And for the generations to come, if a foreigner residing with you or someone else among you wants to prepare an offering made by fire as a pleasing aroma to the LORD, he is to do exactly as you do.
translation: Na long olsem generashon i go i kam, sapos wanpela man i stap wantaim yu o someone narapela i stap wantaim yus, i laik mekim ofing we i wail long paia olsem nem blo smel i swit moa long ai blo LORD, em i mas mekim olgeta samting olsem yu.

original: The assembly is to have the same statute both for you and for the foreign resident; it is a permanent statute for the generations to come. You and the foreigner shall be the same before the LORD.
translation: Ol assembli olgeta i mas havim samting wanpela loa long yu na long ol man i stap yet long ples; em i loa strongpela long ol genarason i kam bihain. Yu na ol yangpela man i mas olsem wanpela bifor long LORD.

original: The same law and the same ordinance will apply both to you and to the foreigner residing with you.”
translation: Sampela lo na ordinance em i sam, na em bai apply long yumi na long ol man bilong narapela kantri i kam stap wantaim yumi.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Speak to the Israelites and tell them: When you enter the land to which I am bringing you
translation: Tokim long ol Israel na tokim ol: Wanpela taim yu go insait long kantri we mi kam bringim yumi, yumusim ol i harim dispela toktok.

original: and you eat the food of the land, you shall lift up an offering to the LORD.
translation: Na yu kaikai kaikai bilong kantri, yu mas liftim ofing long Jehova.

original: From the first of your dough, you are to lift up a cake as a contribution; offer it just like an offering from the threshing floor.
translation: Long taim yu statim mekim bun, yu mas putim ap wanpela kiek olsem kontribusen, yu bringim em olsem yu bringim ofing long ples bilong krungim ka.

original: Throughout your generations, you are to give the LORD an offering from the first of your dough.
translation: Bai ol i go daun long ol genarason bilong yu, bai yu givim ofing long LORD long hap bilong ka bilong yu.

original: Now if you stray unintentionally and do not obey all these commandments that the LORD has spoken to Moses—
translation: Sapos yu go long we na yu no bihainim olgeta kaantri bilong Bikpela i tokim Mosese—

original: all that the LORD has commanded you through Moses from the day the LORD gave them and continuing through the generations to come—
translation: Olgeta we LORD i givim tok long Moses, wonnem dei LORD i givim ol dispela ka na i go inap long genarashon i kam.

original: and if it was done unintentionally without the knowledge of the congregation, then the whole congregation is to prepare one young bull as a burnt offering, a pleasing aroma to the LORD, with its grain offering and drink offering according to the regulation, and one male goat as a sin offering.
translation: Na sapos em i wokim nogat intension, bipo congregation i no save, ol congregation mas i prepare nau wanpela bulmakau i pikinini olsem ofing na bai go antap long LORD, smel i swit moa long LORD, wantaim ofing bilong grain na ofing bilong dringim olsem lo bilong regulation, na wanpela male goat olsem ofing bilong sin.

original: The priest is to make atonement for the whole congregation of Israel, so that they may be forgiven; for the sin was unintentional and they have brought to the LORD an offering made by fire and a sin offering, presented before the LORD for their unintentional sin.
translation: Prist i mas mekim pasin bilong peis long olgeta kalabus bilong Israel, na bai ol i kamap pardinkin long yu; long sin nogat stap long tingting, na ol i bringim ofing we bilong faia na ofing bilong sin i go long LORD, na ol i bin presentim em long LORD long sin nogat stap long tingting bilong ol.

original: Then the whole congregation of Israel and the foreigners residing among them will be forgiven, since it happened to all the people unintentionally.
translation: Olgeta asosiesen bilong Israel na ol plesnati i stap long ol bai forgivim, bihaen long olgeta samting i kamap long ol pipel long nogo.

original: Also, if one person sins unintentionally, he is to present a year-old female goat as a sin offering.
translation: Sapos wanpela man i kamapim sin long wei nogat niupela tingting, em bai bringim kriket we i gat wanpela yia, female goat ol i usim olsem ofing bilong sin.

original: And the priest shall make atonement before the LORD on behalf of the person who erred by sinning unintentionally; and when atonement has been made for him, he will be forgiven.
translation: Na prist i mas mekim peis long hed bilong Bikpela olsem wan man i go daun long sin nogut, tasol i no save; na taim peis im go dasol, em bai givim forgive long hem.

original: You shall have the same law for the one who acts in error, whether he is a native-born Israelite or a foreigner residing among you.
translation: Yupela mas havim same loa long ol man, sapos em i wok long kanu na igat skelim, bai em pikinini bilong Israel we i kamap long kantri, os em man i kam from naitan i stap long ples bilong yupela.

original: But the person who sins defiantly, whether a native or foreigner, blasphemes the LORD. That person shall be cut off from among his people.
translation: Bikpela i krosim nem bilong God, em i wari long sin bilong en, bai ol i no inap long stap wantaim ples bilong en, olsem na, em bai i go daun long hap bilong en gen.

original: He shall certainly be cut off, because he has despised the word of the LORD and broken His commandment; his guilt remains on him.”
translation: Em bai i go daun komplet, olsem em i bilakim tok bilong LORD, na em i brazim ka bilong em; gilt bilong em i stap yet long en.

original: While the Israelites were in the wilderness, a man was found gathering wood on the Sabbath day.
translation: Wail Israeliti i stap long bus, man wanpela i kamap pikinim lak long dei Sabat.

original: Those who found the man gathering wood brought him to Moses, Aaron, and the whole congregation,
translation: Ol i kanimasim man i kam bek long kisim diwai, ol i bringim i go long Mosis, Aron, na asambeli olgeta.

original: and because it had not been declared what should be done to him, they placed him in custody.
translation: Na bihain long em i no bin tokaut yet, ol i putim em insait klosap.

original: And the LORD said to Moses, “The man must surely be put to death. The whole congregation is to stone him outside the camp.”
translation: LORD i tokim Mosis, “Man i mas kilim em pinis. Olgeta kantri mas ropim ston long en na kisim i go long kamp.”

original: So the whole congregation took the man outside the camp and stoned him to death, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Konjenesen ol i kisim man go long nambis na pas, na ol i rokim ston long en, olsem Jehovah i bin tokim Moses.

original: Later, the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Bihain, LORD i tokim Moses,

original: “Speak to the Israelites and tell them that throughout the generations to come they are to make for themselves tassels for the corners of their garments, with a blue cord on each tassel.
translation: Tokim ol long ol Israel, long genarason bai i kam, ol mas mekim tassel bilong ol yet long koner bilong klot ol i wear, wantaim blu rop olsem simbol i go long tassel.

original: These will serve as tassels for you to look at, so that you may remember all the commandments of the LORD, that you may obey them and not prostitute yourselves by following your own heart and your own eyes.
translation: Dispela bai i servim olsem tassel long yu, na yu yet long rememberim olgeta kaan long tok bilong GOD, na yu mas lusim ol, na yu no ken slip long bodi bihainim het bilong yu yet na ai bilong yu.

original: Then you will remember and obey all My commandments, and you will be holy to your God.
translation: Na yu bai rimembir, obiem olgeta komandom we Mipela givim, na yu bai kamap holy long God bilong yu.

original: I am the LORD your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt to be your God. I am the LORD your God.”
translation: Mi LORD God bilong yu, mi kam bekim yupela long kantri bilong Ijip olsem God bilong yu. Mi LORD God bilong yu.

original: Now Korah son of Izhar, the son of Kohath son of Levi, along with some Reubenites—Dathan and Abiram, sons of Eliab, and On son of Peleth—conducted
translation: Nau Korah pikinini bilong Izhar, pikinini bilong Kohath, pikinini bilong Levi, olsem na sampela man Reuben - Dathan na Abiram, pikinini bilong Eliab, na On pikinini bilong Peleth, wokim

original: a rebellion against Moses, along with 250 men of Israel renowned as leaders of the congregation and representatives in the assembly.
translation: Wanpela birua gen long Mosese, na 250 man bilong Isrel we i gat bikpela nem olsem lidaman na ripresantativa long assembli.

original: They came together against Moses and Aaron and told them, “You have taken too much upon yourselves! For everyone in the entire congregation is holy, and the LORD is in their midst. Why then do you exalt yourselves above the assembly of the LORD?”
translation: Ol i kam tugeta olsem long agensim Moses na Aron na tokim ol, "Yu takim tu moa wail long hed bilong yu! Olgeta manmeri long kantri i hol, na LORD i stap long mit bilong ol. Bilong wanem yu lifim ap yupela yet long bikpela assembli bilong LORD?"

original: When Moses heard this, he fell facedown.
translation: Taim Moses harim tok bilong dispela, em i pundaun na kisim hed bilong en long graon.

original: Then he said to Korah and all his followers, “Tomorrow morning the LORD will reveal who belongs to Him and who is holy, and He will bring that person near to Himself. The one He chooses, He will bring near to Himself.
translation: Na em i tok long Korah na ol i bihainim em, "Tumora moning bai LORD mekim klarim husat i bilong em, na husat i holi, na em bai bringim dispela man i kam klostu long em yet. Dispela man em i chusim, em bai bringim i kam klostu long em yet."

original: You, Korah, and all your followers are to do as follows: Take censers,
translation: Yu, Korah, na ol i go long yu, yumas husait long mekim olsem: Kisim censer bilong prayers.

original: and tomorrow you are to place fire and incense in them in the presence of the LORD. Then the man the LORD chooses will be the one who is holy. It is you sons of Levi who have taken too much upon yourselves!”
translation: Na tumora, yu mas putim faya na smel i go ap longwei bilong ples blong LORD. Den man we LORD i pikinim em bai i holi. Yuhamas i kisim tu mutpela wok long han bilong yu, ol pikinini bilong Levi!

original: Moses also said to Korah, “Now listen, you sons of Levi!
translation: Musu i tokim Korah, “Nau harim, yupela pikinini bilong Levi!

original: Is it not enough for you that the God of Israel has separated you from the congregation of Israel and brought you near to Himself to perform the work at the LORD’s tabernacle, and to stand before the congregation to minister to them?
translation: Em i no nuf long yu yet, we God bilong Israel i mekim yu seperea from ol narapela manmeri bilong Israel, na God i bringim yu klostu long em yet, wokim wok long haus lotu bilong LORD, stanap bifo ol manmeri bilong Israel na sarvim ol?

original: He has brought you near, you and all your fellow Levites, but you are seeking the priesthood as well.
