translation: Em i bringim yu gen klostu, yu na ol felo Levait bilong yu, tasol yupela i lukim ofis bilong pries tu.

original: Therefore, it is you and all your followers who have conspired against the LORD! As for Aaron, who is he that you should grumble against him?”
translation: Em i yu na ol i go long yu ol i bin mekim birua gen long Jehovah! Na Aaron, em husat nau, yen yu ol i bekim tok kros long em?

original: Then Moses summoned Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, but they said, “We will not come!
translation: Na Mosese i kirapim Datan na Abiram, pikinini bilong Eliab, tasol ol i tok, "Mipela no inap go!"

original: Is it not enough that you have brought us up out of a land flowing with milk and honey to kill us in the wilderness? Must you also appoint yourself as ruler over us?
translation: Em i no inap long yu yet, olsem yu kisim mipela kam bek long graun i floe na susu na honey, na nau yu laik kilim mipela long bus? Yu mas yet yu yet bikman bilong mipela?

original: Moreover, you have not brought us into a land flowing with milk and honey or given us an inheritance of fields and vineyards. Will you gouge out the eyes of these men? No, we will not come!”
translation: Yumi no bringim mipela long laine bilong promis, we bilong gras bilong milk na honey i plenti, na yumi no givim mipela ka moning long grass bilong kaukau na win bilong drai. Bai yu rausim ai bilong ol man ya? Nogat, mipela no kam!

original: Then Moses became very angry and said to the LORD, “Do not regard their offering. I have not taken one donkey from them or mistreated a single one of them.”
translation: Na Mosis i bek kam rausim bel hat, tokim long LORD, “Yu no ken kisim ofing bilong ol. Mi no gat kisim wanpela donki bilong ol, mi no bin bagarapim wanpela tasol bilong ol.”

original: And Moses said to Korah, “You and all your followers are to appear before the LORD tomorrow—you and they and Aaron.
translation: Mosese i tokim Korah, “Yu na ol i go long yu, olgeta, bai yumi kamap bung long ples bilong Kot klostu – yu, ol, na Aron.”

original: Each man is to take his censer, place incense in it, and present it before the LORD—250 censers. You and Aaron are to present your censers as well.”
translation: Yupela man, husat i go kilim censer bilong en, putim insens long en, na bringim i go long ples bilong LORD—250 censer. Yu na Aron, yupela tu mas bringim censer bilong yupela.

original: So each man took his censer, put fire and incense in it, and stood with Moses and Aaron at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Ol man i kisim censer bilong ol, ol i putim faia na smel i go insait long en, na ol i stan wantaim Mosese na Aron long entris bilong Haus Bilong Miting.

original: When Korah had gathered his whole assembly against them at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, the glory of the LORD appeared to the whole congregation.
translation: Taim Korah im kamapim asamble bilong em yet long entris bilong Ten bilong Mitim, glori bilong LOD i kamap long kongregesin ol.

original: And the LORD said to Moses and Aaron,
translation: Na Bikpela i tok long Moses na Aaron,

original: “Separate yourselves from this congregation so that I may consume them in an instant.”
translation: Wariim long yuself long hap komuniti bilong lotu ya, so na mi ken kaikai ol i go olgeta long wanpela taem.

original: But Moses and Aaron fell facedown and said, “O God, the God of the spirits of all flesh, when one man sins, will You be angry with the whole congregation?”
translation: Moses na Aaron i go daun klostu long graun na tokim God olsem: "O God, yu bilong ol spiris bilong ol man, wanpela man i sindaun, bai yu birua long olgeta yangpela?"

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Tell the congregation to move away from the dwellings of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.”
translation: Tokim ol pipol long lotu mus lukaut i go longwe bilong haus bilong Korah, Dathan, na Abiram.

original: So Moses got up and went to Dathan and Abiram, and the elders of Israel followed him.
translation: Na Musu i kam bek long graun, i go long Datan na Abiram, na ol bikpela man bilong Isrel i foloem i go.

original: And he warned the congregation, “Move away now from the tents of these wicked men. Do not touch anything that belongs to them, or you will be swept away because of all their sins.”
translation: Na em i tok strong long kongregesion, “Mus move go nau longwe na i go pasim haus bilong ples blong ol man i no gat laif. No touchim samting blong ol, othawis bai yumi go daun olsem wara bekos olgeta sin blong ol.”

original: So they moved away from the dwellings of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram. Meanwhile, Dathan and Abiram had come out and stood at the entrances to their tents with their wives and children and infants.
translation: Ol i go apo long ples bilong Korah, Dathan, na Abiram. Dathan na Abiram i kam aut na stanap long entris bilong tent bilong ol, wantaim meri, pikinini, na liklik pikinini bilong ol.

original: Then Moses said, “This is how you will know that the LORD has sent me to do all these things, for it was not my own doing:
translation: Na Moses i tok, "Dispela em i rot bilong yupela i save olsem Jehovah i salim mi long me wokim ol dispela wok, em i no bikmoh long me tasol."

original: If these men die a natural death, or if they suffer the fate of all men, then the LORD has not sent me.
translation: Igo long taim bai ol i dai na mati tasol, o ba igo long taim bai ol i kisim pes bilong ol man yet, orait then Bikpela i no bin sendim mi.

original: But if the LORD brings about something unprecedented, and the earth opens its mouth and swallows them and all that belongs to them so that they go down alive into Sheol, then you will know that these men have treated the LORD with contempt.”
translation: Bai LORD i bringim sampela nupela samting we i no bin save long taim bipo, na graun i opim maus bilong en na kaikaim ol, na olgeta samting bilong ol, na ol i go daun na i liv yet long Sheol, den yumi bai save olsem man meri oli bin givim birua long LORD.

original: As soon as Moses had finished saying all this, the ground beneath them split open,
translation: Olsem mamaus Moses i go finis tokim ol dispela, gras ananit i go op long bodi bilong ol.

original: and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them and their households—all Korah’s men and all their possessions.
translation: Na graun i opim maus bilong en, na i kaikai ol, ol man bilong Korah, na ol pamily bilong ol, na olgeta samting bilong ol.

original: They went down alive into Sheol with all they owned. The earth closed over them, and they vanished from the assembly.
translation: Ol i go daun na stap yet, ol i go insait long Sheol wantaim ol samting ol i gat. Gras i kamapim ol, na ol i lus pinis long assembli.

original: At their cries, all the people of Israel who were around them fled, saying, “The earth may swallow us too!”
translation: Long ol tok bilong ol, pipol bilong Isrel i ranawe, ol i tok, “Graun bai kaikaim mipela tu!”

original: And fire came forth from the LORD and consumed the 250 men who were offering the incense.
translation: Na faia i kam ananitas long Bikpela na i katim ol man 250 hunden i wes wokim smel bilong prayer.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok long Mosese,

original: “Tell Eleazar son of Aaron the priest to remove the censers from the flames and to scatter the coals far away, because the censers are holy.
translation: Tokim Eleazar suss bilong Aaron priis, usim han bilong en long kisim censers i go long flams, pirim koals i go longwe na farawe, bikos dispela censers em i samting holem.

original: As for the censers of those who sinned at the cost of their own lives, hammer them into sheets to overlay the altar, for these were presented before the LORD, and so have become holy. They will serve as a sign to the Israelites.”
translation: Long censers ol i go bamim ol iet long sip long plet, na yu hamarim ol long plais, bai ol i kamap olsem skal bilong altare, wantaim ol i bin presentim igo long LORD, na huli ol i kamap holy. Ol bai stap olsem saen long Israelites.

original: So Eleazar the priest took the bronze censers brought by those who had been burned up, and he had them hammered out to overlay the altar,
translation: Eleazar prist i kisim censer bronzu ol i bring, na em i paitim ol i go flat, na wokim ol i kamap dae pinis long altia.

original: just as the LORD commanded him through Moses. This was to be a reminder to the Israelites that no outsider who is not a descendant of Aaron should approach to offer incense before the LORD, lest he become like Korah and his followers.
translation: Olsem Jehovah i givim komando em long Moses, na dispela em i kam bilong yumi Israel rememba, olsem bai no wanpela man i no bilong famili bilong Aron inap go bek long ofa insens bifor Jehovah, nogat, bai em i kamap olsem Korah na ol folower bilong en.

original: The next day the whole congregation of Israel grumbled against Moses and Aaron, saying, “You have killed the LORD’s people!”
translation: Dia nao olgeta asamble i go tok strong long Israel, ol i tok, "Yu kisim laip bilong ol pipel bilong LORD!"

original: But when the congregation gathered against them, Moses and Aaron turned toward the Tent of Meeting, and suddenly the cloud covered it and the glory of the LORD appeared.
translation: Tasol taim ol pipol i kam na was long ol, Moses na Aaron i turnim bek long Haus bilong Miting, na klobi i kambengim em, na glori bilong LORD i kamap.

original: Then Moses and Aaron went to the front of the Tent of Meeting,
translation: Na Moses na Aron i go apo long Haus Bilong Miting,

original: and the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Bikpela i tok long Mosese,

original: “Get away from this congregation so that I may consume them in an instant.” And Moses and Aaron fell facedown.
translation: Kam bek long dispela lotu na mi bai kaikai ol i go aut yet. Na Moses na Aron i pundaun klostu long graun.

original: Moses said to Aaron, “Take your censer, place fire from the altar in it, and add incense. Go quickly to the congregation and make atonement for them, because wrath has come out from the LORD; the plague has begun.”
translation: Mosese i tokim Aaron, “Kam bek long censer bilong yu, putim faiya husat i kam long altiya i go insait, na yu putim smel i go antap. Yu go kisim spid olsem na go long ol pipol na mekim peis long han bilong ol, bikos rop bilong GOD i kam ausa; sik long ol pipol i stat.”

original: So Aaron took the censer as Moses had ordered and ran into the midst of the assembly. And seeing that the plague had begun among the people, he offered the incense and made atonement for the people.
translation: Na Aron i kisim kaonisel, olsem Mosis i bin givim oda, na i ran i go insait long ol pipel. Na em i lukim pes bilong dai i stat long ol pipol, na i bringim smel bilong incense, na i mekim peis long ol pipol.

original: He stood between the living and the dead, and the plague was halted.
translation: Em i stap long namel long ol laif na ol dai, na pes bilong sik i stap.

original: But those who died from the plague numbered 14,700, in addition to those who had died on account of Korah.
translation: Na ol i dai pinis long sik bilong pes, olsem na longtpela taim 14,700, olsem wanem samting ibin kamap bilong Korah.

original: Then Aaron returned to Moses at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, since the plague had been halted.
translation: Na Aaron i go bek long Moses long entris bilong Tenk Haus bilong Miting, olsem sik long ol pipol i stop already.

original: And the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok long Moses,

original: “Speak to the Israelites and take from them twelve staffs, one from the leader of each tribe. Write each man’s name on his staff,
translation: Tokim ol Isrel na kisim twelve stik bilong ol, wan bilong bikman bilong everi tribe. Raitim nem bilong everi man long stik bilong em.

original: and write Aaron’s name on the staff of Levi, because there must be one staff for the head of each tribe.
translation: Raitim nem bilong Aaron long stik bilong Levi, bikos wan stik tasol i mas kamap long bikpela man bilong everi tribe.

original: Place the staffs in the Tent of Meeting in front of the Testimony, where I meet with you.
translation: Putim stik nau long Haus Bilong Miting bifor Fakim Tol, wea mi kam mitim yu.

original: The staff belonging to the man I choose will sprout, and I will rid Myself of the constant grumbling of the Israelites against you.”
translation: Stik bilong man em mi bikim chusim bai kamap, na mi bai lusim ol tok bilong samting nogut ol Israel i givim long yu.

original: So Moses spoke to the Israelites, and each of their leaders gave him a staff—one for each of the leaders of their tribes, twelve staffs in all. And Aaron’s staff was among them.
translation: Mosis i tokim ol Isrel, na ol bikpela i givim em wan stick bilong ol yet, wan bilong ol bikpela long ol tripe bilong ol, twelve stick bilong ol i stap. Na stick bilong Aron i stap long ol.

original: Then Moses placed the staffs before the LORD in the Tent of the Testimony.
translation: Na Moses i putim stik bilong ol long hap bilong LORD inside Haus Bilong Tok Aut.

original: The next day Moses entered the Tent of the Testimony and saw that Aaron’s staff, representing the house of Levi, had sprouted, put forth buds, blossomed, and produced almonds.
translation: Dia nambawan, Moses go insait long Haus Bilong Toksik' na i lukim dat stap bilong Aaron, we i kamap long haus bilong Levi, i kamap na bringim bud, i blooming, na i bringim almon.

original: Then Moses brought out all the staffs from the LORD’s presence to all the Israelites. They saw them, and each man took his own staff.
translation: Na Moses kisim oltab long ol stik na karim i go long ples bilong ol Israel, long ples bilong LORD. Ol Israel i lukim ol, na nenpela man i kisim stik bilong en.

original: The LORD said to Moses, “Put Aaron’s staff back in front of the Testimony, to be kept as a sign for the rebellious, so that you may put an end to their grumbling against Me, lest they die.”
translation: LORD i tokim Mosis, “Putim stik bilong Aaron bek gen long Wanesave, olsem wanpela sahin long ol i bagarap, mipela bai klosim mouth bilong ol, bikos ol no ken tok bung long taim, bicuz ol no ken dai.”

original: So Moses did as the LORD had commanded him.
translation: Na Mosis i mekim olsem Jehovah i tokim em.

original: Then the Israelites declared to Moses, “Look, we are perishing! We are lost; we are all lost!
translation: Na Israelait i tokim Moses olsem, "Kam, yumi stap dai pinis! Yumi lus pinis, yumi olgeta lus pinis!"

original: Anyone who comes near the tabernacle of the LORD will die. Are we all going to perish?”
translation: Olsem wan i kam klostu long haus kilim bilong Lord, bai i dai. Yupela olgeta bai mipela i dai finis?

original: So the LORD said to Aaron, “You and your sons and your father’s house must bear the iniquity involving the sanctuary. And you and your sons alone must bear the iniquity involving your priesthood.
translation: Bikpela i tokim Aaron, “Yu na pikinini yu na famili bilong papa yu mas kisim bek long hevi i kam long ples bilong tambu. Na yu na pikinini yu tasol mas kisim bek long hevi i kam long wok bilong pris.”

original: But bring with you also your brothers from the tribe of Levi, the tribe of your father, that they may join you and assist you and your sons before the Tent of the Testimony.
translation: Bipla, kisim i go wantaim yu brata bilong yu olsem traip bilong Levi, traip bilong papa bilong yu, na ol i jionim yu na helpim yu na pikinini bilong yu bifor Haus bilong Tok Aut.

original: And they shall attend to your duties and to all the duties of the Tent; but they must not come near to the furnishings of the sanctuary or the altar, or both they and you will die.
translation: Ol i mas kisim hevi long wok bilong yu na olgeta wok bilong Tent, bek ol i no ken kam klostu long samting bilong Haus Lotu o alta, nogat wanpela blo yumi bai dai, tumbiligo ol i dai.

original: They are to join you and attend to the duties of the Tent of Meeting, doing all the work at the Tent; but no outsider may come near you.
translation: Ol i mas kam daun joiim yu, na ol i mas wokim woks bilong duties long Haus Bilong Miting, na ol i mas wokim olgeta wok long Haus Bilong Miting; be ol man i no stap insait i no ken kam klostu long yu.

original: And you shall attend to the duties of the sanctuary and of the altar, so that wrath may not fall on the Israelites again.
translation: Yu mas kisim kaer long wok bilong haus lotu na kaunta bilong ofa, olsem poro bai no ken kam long Israel pipol gen.

original: Behold, I Myself have selected your fellow Levites from the Israelites as a gift to you, dedicated to the LORD to perform the service for the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Lukim, Mi Masen seleksen Levaitis ol bilong yu long Israelitis olsem gif long yu, dedike long LORD, ol i mas mekim wok long Haus Bilong Miting.

original: But only you and your sons shall attend to your priesthood for everything concerning the altar and what is inside the veil, and you are to perform that service. I am giving you the work of the priesthood as a gift, but any outsider who comes near the sanctuary must be put to death.”
translation: Bikos yu tasol na ol pikinini bilong yu mas kisim kaer long prieshod bilong yu long tok bilong alta na insait long bel, na yu mas wokim servis bilong yu. Mi givim yu wok bilong prieshod olsem gift, be any man i no gat ples i kam klostu long holy haus, em bai i dai.

original: Then the LORD said to Aaron, “Behold, I have put you in charge of My offerings. As for all the sacred offerings of the Israelites, I have given them to you and your sons as a portion and a permanent statute.
translation: Bikpela i tokim Aaron, "Sios, lukim! Mi putim yu yet long ples bilong bos. Ol samting bilong bungim God bilong Israel pipol, mi givim ol dispela long yu na ol ka bilong yu olsem ka bilong yu, lo bilong ol taim."

original: A portion of the most holy offerings reserved from the fire will be yours. From all the offerings they render to Me as most holy offerings, whether grain offerings or sin offerings or guilt offerings, that part belongs to you and your sons.
translation: Wanpela hap bilong ofing na holiest, i stap, i no go daun long paia, bai yu kaivim. Ol manmeri bai bringim ofing bilong ka, ofing bilong sin, na ofing bilong gilt long Mi olsem ofing na holiest, na dispela hap em i bilong yu na pikinini bilong yu.

original: You are to eat it as a most holy offering, and every male may eat it. You shall regard it as holy.
translation: Yupela mas kaikai olsem ofring we i go long ples bilong God, na ol man husat i gat strepela bilong en i ken kaikai. Yupela mas lukim em olsem samting we i go long ples bilong God.

original: And this is yours as well: the offering of their gifts, along with all the wave offerings of the Israelites. I have given this to you and your sons and daughters as a permanent statute. Every ceremonially clean person in your household may eat it.
translation: Na dispela em belong yu tu: ofa bilong ol ip long givim gif, olgeta ofa bilong waf wantaim bilong Israel. Mi givim dispela to yu na pikinini bilong yu man na meri olsem laen bilong ples nogut long taim. Ol manmeri i kamap strong long halivim na klem long hous blong yu inap kaikai.

original: I give you all the freshest olive oil and all the finest new wine and grain that the Israelites give to the LORD as their firstfruits.
translation: Mi givim yu ol gras bilong oliv oi nau mai na ol wain nupela na graun olsem ka bilong tumbuna, ol Israelait i givim long LORD olsem ofa.

original: The firstfruits of everything in their land that they bring to the LORD will belong to you. Every ceremonially clean person in your household may eat them.
translation: Olgeta samting husat ol i bringim i go long LORD, em i bilong yupela. Ol man meri husat i klia long wei bilong lotu longaus husat bilong yupela, olgeta i ken kaikai.

original: Every devoted thing in Israel belongs to you.
translation: Ol samting we i devo long Isrel, ol i bilong yu.

original: The firstborn of every womb, whether man or beast, that is offered to the LORD belongs to you. But you must surely redeem every firstborn son and every firstborn male of unclean animals.
translation: Pikinini bilong bek na narapela wom long ol man o ol animal, em ol i stap, i bilong yu, tasol yu mas pai bikos em i tok long lukim na Pai bek long em. Yu mas pai bek long ol pikinini bilong bek na ol kindi animal we nogat klia.

original: You are to pay the redemption price for a month-old male according to your valuation: five shekels of silver, according to the sanctuary shekel, which is twenty gerahs.
translation: Yu mas peim pris blong redeem long man bilong mun wan male olsem long valiusen bilong yu: faiv sikl bilong silva, olsem long sanctuary sikl, we i gat twenti gerahs.

original: But you must not redeem the firstborn of an ox, a sheep, or a goat; they are holy. You are to sprinkle their blood on the altar and burn their fat as an offering made by fire, a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
translation: Bikos yu no ken baim bek pikinini namba wan bulmakau, sip, na be kat, ol i holy. Yu sprinklem blod bilong ol long alta, na yu kaikai kol bilong ol olsem ofing we i pakim long paia, em i smel i swit moa long LORD.

original: And their meat belongs to you, just as the breast and right thigh of the wave offering belong to you.
translation: Ka kai bilong ol i go long yu, olsem brus na thi rait bilong givim ol samting long God, em i go long yu.

original: All the holy offerings that the Israelites present to the LORD I give to you and to your sons and daughters as a permanent statute. It is a permanent covenant of salt before the LORD for you and your offspring.”
translation: Oli ofisa na halim ol Isrelaiti bringim i go long LORD, mi givim i go long yu na long pikinini bilong yu olsem lo bilong taim olgeta. Em i kovenan bilong solt strong bifor LORD long yu na long genaration bilong yu.

original: Then the LORD said to Aaron, “You will have no inheritance in their land, nor will you have any portion among them. I am your portion and your inheritance among the Israelites.
translation: Na Lod i tokim Aaron, "Yupela no go havim shar long graun bilong ol, na yupela no go gat porcin ibilong yupela long ol. Mi Lod yumi stap long yu, na mi stap long yu olsem inheritance na porcin bilong yu long ol Israel."

original: Behold, I have given to the Levites all the tithes in Israel as an inheritance in return for the work they do, the service of the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Lukim, mi givim Ol Levit, ol i kam long tribe bilong Levi, olgeta titas, em moni bilong God, 10% em i go long Church, long ol as inheritem bilong ol long wok ol i mekim, servis bilong Haus bilong Miting, em ples ol Israel i go bung wantaim God.

original: No longer may the Israelites come near to the Tent of Meeting, or they will incur guilt and die.
translation: Oli Israel oli no inap kam klostu long Haus Bilong Miting, nogat, ol bai kisim gilta long tok bilong sin na i dai.

original: The Levites are to perform the work of the Tent of Meeting, and they must bear their iniquity. This is a permanent statute for the generations to come. The Levites will not receive an inheritance among the Israelites.
translation: Levait bai wokim wok bilong Haus Bilong Miting, na ol bai kisim bek i go long sindaon bilong ol. Dispela em lo bilong taim olgeta long jenarisen. Levait bai no kisim kantri bilong en long ol Israel.

original: For I have given to the Levites as their inheritance the tithe that the Israelites present to the LORD as a contribution. That is why I told them that they would not receive an inheritance among the Israelites.”
translation: Mi givim Levita olsem inheritance bilong ol, em daks nas ol Israel i bringim long Bikpela olsem sampela kina helpim. Bipela em tokim ol long hap, olsem nau: Levita bai no ineritem inheritance ibong ol Israel.

original: And the LORD instructed Moses,
translation: Na Lod i givim instructon long Mosese

original: “Speak to the Levites and tell them: ‘When you receive from the Israelites the tithe that I have given you as your inheritance, you must present part of it as an offering to the LORD—a tithe of the tithe.
translation: Tokim long ol Levit na tokim ol: 'Wanem taim yu kisim long ol Israel tith we God givim yu olsem inaun bilong yu, yu mas bringim sampela bilong em olsem ofing long LORD - wan tith insait long tith.

original: Your offering will be reckoned to you as grain from the threshing floor or juice from the winepress.
translation: Ofing bilong yu bai kisim bek long yu olsem ka bilong bun long ples bilong kirapim bun oslem jus bilong wain long ples bilong kirapim wain.

original: So you are to present an offering to the LORD from all the tithes you receive from the Israelites, and from these you are to give the LORD’s offering to Aaron the priest.
translation: Yupela mas kisim i go long ples bilong ofing long LORD olgeta tithe husat yumi kisim long Israelites, na yupela mas givim ofing bilong LORD long Aaron pris.

original: You must present the offering due the LORD from all the best of every gift, the holiest part of it.’
translation: Yupela mas bringim ofring bilong Bikpela long olgeta gutpela samting bilong gif, part bilong hem we i mas holy.

original: Therefore say to the Levites, ‘When you have presented the best part, it will be reckoned to you as the produce of the threshing floor or winepress.
translation: Tokim long ol Levait, ‘Wanpela taim yu bringim na givim kaikai i go we bilong yu, em bai kamap olsem prodak bilong ples bilong kisim bun o ples bilong kisim win, em bai kamap olsem em bilong yu.

original: And you and your households may eat the rest of it anywhere; it is the compensation for your work at the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Yu na husat i stap wantaim yu inap kaikai olgeta hap bilong en long eni ples; em i pe bilong wok bung long Haus Bilong Miting.

original: Once you have presented the best part of it, you will not incur guilt because of it. But you must not defile the sacred offerings of the Israelites, or else you will die.’”
translation: Wanpela taim yu givim diwai bes na i kamap bikpela, yu no ken kisim hevi long en. Bikos yu mas pilim ol samting sacred bilong Israelites long dota, nogat, othawise yu dai.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses and Aaron,
translation: Bikpela i tok long Moses na Aaron,

original: “This is the statute of the law that the LORD has commanded: Instruct the Israelites to bring you an unblemished red heifer that has no defect and has never been placed under a yoke.
translation: Dispela em i loa bilong bikpela pes we LORD i tokim: Iusim Israelites i kam na bringim i go long yu bulmakau ren na i gat hevi skin, i no gat birua na i no bin katim long yoke.

original: Give it to Eleazar the priest, and he will have it brought outside the camp and slaughtered in his presence.
translation: Givim i go long Eleaza pries, na em bai kisim i go autsait long hos, na ol i pokisim i long ai bilong em.

original: Eleazar the priest is to take some of its blood on his finger and sprinkle it seven times toward the front of the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Eleaza prist bai kisim sampela blod bilong en long finga bilong en, na sprinklem seben taim i go long hap side bilong Tent bilong Miting.

original: Then the heifer must be burned in his sight. Its hide, its flesh, and its blood are to be burned, along with its dung.
translation: Na bulmakau i mas i go daun long paia long ai bilong em. Sking, bosom, bled i stap, na dung bilong animal i mas i go daun long paia olgeta.

original: The priest is to take cedar wood, hyssop, and scarlet wool and throw them onto the burning heifer.
translation: Prist i mas kisim diwai cedar, hap, na wol ret, na jekim ol i go long bun i go na heifer.

original: Then the priest must wash his clothes and bathe his body in water; after that he may enter the camp, but he will be ceremonially unclean until evening.
translation: Na pris i mas wasim klos bilong en, na en tasol i go was long wara; nacha em i ken go insait long ples bilong ol, tasol bodili bilong en i stap long birua kam long apinun.

original: The one who burned the heifer must also wash his clothes and bathe his body in water, and he too will be ceremonially unclean until evening.
translation: Man i bungim heifer, em i masi wasim klos bilong en na wasim bodi bilong en long wara, na bai em i no inap kamap kleen yet, na em bai i stap olsem yet, long belo.

original: Then a man who is ceremonially clean is to gather up the ashes of the heifer and store them in a ceremonially clean place outside the camp. They must be kept by the congregation of Israel for preparing the water of purification; this is for purification from sin.
translation: Na man i go long wei, i mas kisim ashes bilong bulmakau i khar na putim ol long ples klia bilong seremoni i go long wei, long taun em i go long wei long kanua. Ol ashes ya i save long hand bilong kalabus bilong Israel long mekim wara bilong klirim sin, long klirim sin bilong yumi.

original: The man who has gathered up the ashes of the heifer must also wash his clothes, and he will be ceremonially unclean until evening. This is a permanent statute for the Israelites and for the foreigner residing among them.
translation: Man i kisim i go nau abus bilong kukai, em i mas wosim klos bilong en, na bai em i no ino klia long law long taim tasol, na kam bek long apinun. Dispela em lop statit long taim bilong Israelites na bilong man i kam bihain, i stap wantaim ol.

original: Whoever touches any dead body will be unclean for seven days.
translation: Husat i tetchim bodi i dai pinis, em bai i no inap kamap klea long sampela seven de.

original: He must purify himself with the water on the third day and on the seventh day; then he will be clean. But if he does not purify himself on the third and seventh days, he will not be clean.
translation: Em mas usim wara long dei namba tri na dei namba seven, na bai em kamap klia. Tasol sapos em i no kleamim em yet long dei namba tri na dei namba seven, em bai i no kamap klia.

original: Anyone who touches a human corpse and fails to purify himself defiles the tabernacle of the LORD. That person must be cut off from Israel. He remains unclean, because the water of purification has not been sprinkled on him, and his uncleanness is still on him.
translation: Husat i kamap long bodi pinis bilong man na i no purifyim yet em yet, i bagarap templa bilong LORD. Man hait i katim long ol Israel. Em i stap yet long kanaka, bikos wara bilong purifyim yet i no sprikim long em, na kanaka i stap yet long em.

original: This is the law when a person dies in a tent: Everyone who enters the tent and everyone already in the tent will be unclean for seven days,
translation: Em i law nau: Wanpela man i dai insait long han, olgeta i go insait long han, na olgeta i stap long moger, bai olgeta i no inap kamap kleen long wik 7.

original: and any open container without a lid fastened on it is unclean.
translation: Na ol kontena pipia we i no katim hap bilong en, ol i stap long krai.

original: Anyone in the open field who touches someone who has been killed by the sword or has died of natural causes, or anyone who touches a human bone or a grave, will be unclean for seven days.
translation: Olsem na, long gras bilong ples, husat i tambuaim man i dai pinis bekim sword o i dai bekim ol narapela kain sik, o husat i tok autim banis bilong man o graon bilong dei, em bai i bagarap long taim bilong kliaim seven de.

original: For the purification of the unclean person, take some of the ashes of the burnt sin offering, put them in a jar, and pour fresh water over them.
translation: Long bilong pasin bilong klirim man i no klir yet, kisim ash bilong ofing bai i go daun long sin, putim ol ash ya long wanpela bek, na watham fresh yu putim antap long ol ash.

original: Then a man who is ceremonially clean is to take some hyssop, dip it in the water, and sprinkle the tent, all the furnishings, and the people who were there. He is also to sprinkle the one who touched a bone, a grave, or a person who has died or been slain.
translation: Na man i go long ples bilong kolos, em i pak olsem, kisim hap bilong hyssop, tubum long wara, na sprinkel haus bilong tupela, ol samting i inside, na ol manmeri i stap. Em i sprinkel tu man i kamap long ban, graun bilong dai, o em i holim man i dai o i pundaun.

original: The man who is ceremonially clean is to sprinkle the unclean person on the third day and on the seventh day. After he purifies the unclean person on the seventh day, the one being cleansed must wash his clothes and bathe in water, and that evening he will be clean.
translation: Man i go long ples bilong klean i mas potisim man i no klean long dei three na long dei seven. Bihaen em i kleanim man i no klean long dei seven, man i no klean bai kisim kleanin, wasim klos na swim long wara, na bel isi em bai klean.

original: But if a person who is unclean does not purify himself, he will be cut off from the assembly, because he has defiled the sanctuary of the LORD. The water of purification has not been sprinkled on him; he is unclean.
translation: Sapos man i no klia yet, em bai i katim aut long ol pipol, wantaim em i bin bagarapim haus lotu bilong LORD, na wara bilong purifai em i no bin sprikim long em yet; olsem na em i no klia yet.

original: This is a permanent statute for the people: The one who sprinkles the water of purification must wash his clothes, and whoever touches the water of purification will be unclean until evening.
translation: Em i statut permanent long ol pipol: Man husat i sprinklem wara bilong purifikेशन, emas wasim klos bilong en, na husat i tok wara bilong purifikेशन, bai i no inap kamap kleen yet, tasol i no klia long taim bilong belo san.

original: Anything the unclean person touches will become unclean, and anyone who touches it will be unclean until evening.”
translation: Oli samting we pisin man yet i tek, bai i kamap pisin, na husat i kamap long en, olgeta bai ol i stap pisin long taim bilong san i go daun.

original: In the first month, the whole congregation of Israel entered the Wilderness of Zin and stayed in Kadesh. There Miriam died and was buried.
translation: Long moning taem, olgeta asamble ya Israel i go insait long Wilerness bilong Zin na ol i stap long Kadesh. Long hap em tasol, Miriam i dai na ol i birim em.

original: Now there was no water for the congregation, so they gathered against Moses and Aaron.
translation: Nau, water i no stap long kongresen bilong Israel, ol pipel i kam biksi long Mosese na Aron.

original: The people quarreled with Moses and said, “If only we had perished with our brothers before the LORD!
translation: Ol pipol i bagarap long Mosese, ol i tok, "I mas yu yet, mipela i dai tasol wantaim brata bilong mipela long wei bilong Lod!"

original: Why have you brought the LORD’s assembly into this wilderness for us and our livestock to die here?
translation: Bam bringim assemblia bilong LORD i kam long dispela wiknes, na mipela wantaim kakaruk bilong mipela i dai hap long hia?

original: Why have you led us up out of Egypt to bring us to this wretched place? It is not a place of grain, figs, vines, or pomegranates—and there is no water to drink!”
translation: Wailusim mipela long kam bek aus long Ijip na bringim mipela i kam long dispela hap gras bilong sori? Em i no ples bilong ka, fig, vayns, o pomegranet – na inogat wara trink!

original: Then Moses and Aaron went from the presence of the assembly to the entrance to the Tent of Meeting. They fell facedown, and the glory of the LORD appeared to them.
translation: Na Moses na Aaron i go bek long ples bilong ol assembli, go long entris long Haus Bilong Miting. Ol i kilim graun klostu, na glori bilong LORD i kamap long ol.

original: And the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Bikpela i tok long Moses,

original: “Take the staff and assemble the congregation. You and your brother Aaron are to speak to the rock while they watch, and it will pour out its water. You will bring out water from the rock and provide drink for the congregation and their livestock.”
translation: Kisim stik na kalabus ol pipol long kam. Yu na brata Aron, yu mas tokim long rak bilong ol wachim, na em bai i kamautim wara. Yu ken kisim wara komiot long rak, na givim kaikai long ol pipol na ol kibarang bilong ol.

original: So Moses took the staff from the LORD’s presence, just as he had been commanded.
translation: Na Moses kisim stik long hap bilong LORD, olsem we em i bin kolim.

original: Then Moses and Aaron gathered the assembly in front of the rock, and Moses said to them, “Listen now, you rebels, must we bring you water out of this rock?”
translation: Na Moses na Aron i katim assembli long sait bilong rok, na Moses i tokim ol, "Harim nau, yu ol i bagarap, mipela bai kisim wara kamaut long dispela rok?"

original: Then Moses raised his hand and struck the rock twice with his staff, so that a great amount of water gushed out, and the congregation and their livestock were able to drink.
translation: Na Mosese em i lusim han bilong en, na kilim ston twis wantaim stik bilong en, na wara i kam aut bung, na kongres na animal bilong ol i ken dring.

original: But the LORD said to Moses and Aaron, “Because you did not trust Me to show My holiness in the sight of the Israelites, you will not bring this assembly into the land that I have given them.”
translation: Bikpela i tokim Mosis na Aron, “Bikos yu no trastim mi long showim holiness bilong mi long ai bilong Israelites, olsem na yu no bringim assembli dispela i go long laine we mi givim ol long en.”

original: These were the waters of Meribah, where the Israelites quarreled with the LORD, and He showed His holiness among them.
translation: Wara bilong Meribah, hap bilong Israel i bagarap na fightim tok long ol LORD, na Em i shoim saintines bilong En ibmong ol.

original: From Kadesh, Moses sent messengers to tell the king of Edom, “This is what your brother Israel says: You know all the hardship that has befallen us,
translation: Long Kades, Mususi sendim messenja i go tokim king bilong Edom, olsem brata yumi Israel i tok: Yumi save olgeta hapsait i kam long yumi,

original: how our fathers went down to Egypt, where we lived many years. The Egyptians mistreated us and our fathers,
translation: Papa bilong yumi i go daun long Egip, na yumi stap long taim olgeta. Egipian i bagarapim yumi na papa bilong yumi.

original: and when we cried out to the LORD, He heard our voice, sent an angel, and brought us out of Egypt. Now look, we are in Kadesh, a city on the edge of your territory.
translation: Na taim mipela kisim strong na krai long LORD, em i harim tok bilong mipela, bihainim ein angel, na kisim mipela kamaut long Egip. Nau lukim, mipela i stap long Kades, wanpela taon we i stap long ais bilong kantri bilong yu.

original: Please let us pass through your land. We will not cut through any field or vineyard, or drink water from any well. We will stay on the King’s Highway; we will not turn to the right or to the left until we have passed through your territory.”
translation: Mipela i go tres long lan bilong yu, mipela i no ken cutim gras bilong yu o gaun long vineyard, o dringim wara long wel. Mipela i stap long rot bilong King; mipela i no inap hariapim na go long sait rait o long sait lefet, mipela i laik i stap yet long rot bilong King, na mipela bai pas long graun bilong yu, na bihain mipela bai lusim graun bilong yu.

original: But Edom answered, “You may not travel through our land, or we will come out and confront you with the sword.”
translation: Baat Edom i tok, “Yu no ken go long kantry bilong mipela, nogat, olsem mipela bai kamaut na bagarapim yu wantaim sord.”

original: “We will stay on the main road,” the Israelites replied, “and if we or our herds drink your water, we will pay for it. There will be no problem; only let us pass through on foot.”
translation: “Mipela bai stap long rot bilong ples,” ol Israelites i tok, “na mipela o herd bilong mipela pijnim wara bilong yu, mipela bai pei bilong em. Nogat samting; lep mipela pas long fut tasol.”

original: But Edom insisted, “You may not pass through.” And they came out to confront the Israelites with a large army and a strong hand.
translation: Buat Edom i tokas strong, “Yu no ken go pasim.” Na ol i kam aut long konfron wantaim army bikpela na han strong.

original: So Edom refused to allow Israel to pass through their territory, and Israel turned away from them.
translation: Na Edom i no givim chanis long Isrel ol i pas tu long grun bilong ol, na tupela Isrel i turnim bek long ol.

original: After they had set out from Kadesh, the whole congregation of Israel came to Mount Hor.
translation: Bikos ol i go bekim Kadesh na lusim, kongresion bilong Israel kamap long Maunt Hor.

original: And at Mount Hor, near the border of the land of Edom, the LORD said to Moses and Aaron,
translation: Long Mount Hor, nambis long kauntri bilong Edom, LORD i tokim Moses na Aaron,

original: “Aaron will be gathered to his people; he will not enter the land that I have given the Israelites, because both of you rebelled against My command at the waters of Meribah.
translation: Aron em bai go kamap wantaim papa na mama bilong en; em no go insait long lan we mi givim long Israelites, bikos yutupela i bagarap komanda bilong mi long wata bilong Meriba.

original: Take Aaron and his son Eleazar and bring them up Mount Hor.
translation: Kisim Aaron na sussa bilong em, Eleazar, na kam bek long Maunt Hor.

original: Remove Aaron’s priestly garments and put them on his son Eleazar. Aaron will be gathered to his people and will die there.”
translation: Kisim long laplap bilong priest bilong Aaron na pitim i go long Eleazar, pikinini bilong en. Aaron bai i kamap wantaim ol papa bilong en na bai em i dai hap long hap.

original: So Moses did as the LORD had commanded, and they climbed Mount Hor in the sight of the whole congregation.
translation: Na Moses i mekim olsem Jehovah i givim tok, na ol i go antap long Maunten Hor long ai bilong konferens holegay.

original: After Moses had removed Aaron’s garments and put them on his son Eleazar, Aaron died there on top of the mountain. Then Moses and Eleazar came down from the mountain.
translation: Long Mosis i kisim pinis klotes bilong Aron, na i putim ol long bodi bilong pikinini bilong em Eleaza, Aron i dai stap we long antap bilong maunten. Na Mosis na Eleaza i kam daun bilong maunten.

original: When the whole congregation saw that Aaron had died, the entire house of Israel mourned for him thirty days.
translation: Olgeta assembli i lukim olsem Aron em i dai pinis, na olgeta haus bilong Israel i mekim sori long em long teti de.

original: When the Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the Negev, heard that Israel was coming along the road to Atharim, he attacked Israel and captured some prisoners.
translation: Taim ki kap Arad kanaka i harim long hap bilong Negev, em i harm dat Israel i kam long rot bilong Atharim, na em i go aksem Israel na kisim ol samting bilong prisoner.

original: So Israel made a vow to the LORD: “If You will deliver this people into our hands, we will devote their cities to destruction.”
translation: Israel i wokim tok strong long Lod: "Sapos yu bai kisim dispela manmeri na givim long han bilong mipela, mipela bai mekim ples ol i go daun, na ol i no inap kam bek gen, mipela bai bagarapim."

original: And the LORD heard Israel’s plea and delivered up the Canaanites. Israel devoted them and their cities to destruction; so they named the place Hormah.
translation: Na LORD i harim bek na Isrel, na em i givim win long ol Kanaanit. Isrel i masalai ol yet na taun bilong ol i go daun long dai; na em i kisim nem bilong ples ia, Horma.

original: Then they set out from Mount Hor along the route to the Red Sea, in order to bypass the land of Edom. But the people grew impatient on the journey
translation: Ol i go bek long Maunt Hor, ol i wokabaut long rot bilong Red Si, ol i wokim bikpela ka long pipia Edom. Na ol i birua long jerni.

original: and spoke against God and against Moses: “Why have you led us up out of Egypt to die in the wilderness? There is no bread or water, and we detest this wretched food!”
translation: Na ol i tok bagarap long God na long Mosese: “Wai yumus bringim mipela i go apo long Egypt, nau mipela i dai long bus? Igat no kaikai, igat no wara, na yumi hevi long dispela kai nogut!”

original: So the LORD sent venomous snakes among the people, and many of the Israelites were bitten and died.
translation: Na Bikpela i sendim snek bilong poin long ol Israel pipol, na plenti i kaikai na i dai.

original: Then the people came to Moses and said, “We have sinned by speaking against the LORD and against you. Intercede with the LORD so He will take the snakes away from us.” So Moses interceded for the people.
translation: Ol pikinini i kam long Mosese na tokim em, "Mipela i go hevi, mipela i tok strong long Bikpela na long yu. Yu mas bekim na helpim mipela long Bikpela, bai em i kisim snaek ol i go long us." Na Mosese i bekim na helpim ol pikinini.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Make a fiery serpent and mount it on a pole. When anyone who is bitten looks at it, he will live.”
translation: Bikpela i tokim Mose, “Wokim snek bilong faia na karamapim long stick. Olsem wanem man i kaikai, em i lukim, em bai i stap.”

original: So Moses made a bronze snake and mounted it on a pole. If anyone who was bitten looked at the bronze snake, he would live.
translation: Moses wokim snek brops braon, na em putim snek i go antap long stik. Ol man meri husat i kaikai pinis, tasol oli lukim snek brops braon, em bai i stap.

original: Then the Israelites set out and camped at Oboth.
translation: Na Pipol Isrel i go bek long rot, na ol i kamp long Oboth.

original: They journeyed from Oboth and camped at Iye-abarim in the wilderness opposite Moab to the east.
translation: Ol i go pinis long Oboth, na ol i kam kamp long Iye-abarim long bus long sait bilong Moab long sindaun sun.

original: From there they set out and camped in the Valley of Zered.
translation: Ol i go na stap, na ol i kam pikinini long Vali bilong Zered.

original: From there they moved on and camped on the other side of the Arnon, in the wilderness that extends into the Amorite territory. Now the Arnon is the border between the Moabites and the Amorites.
translation: Oli i go nap long na kam pundaun klostu long sait narak bilong Arnon, long bus em i stret olsem inap long grun bilong Ol Amoraites. Nau Arnon em i bikpela skul bilong en, em i daun bilong Ol Moabites na Ol Amoraites.

original: Therefore it is stated in the Book of the Wars of the LORD: “Waheb in Suphah and the wadis of the Arnon,
translation: Oleh long Buk bilong Waas bilong GOD, ol i tok olsem: Waheb long Suphah na ol wadi long Arnon.

original: even the slopes of the wadis that extend to the site of Ar and lie along the border of Moab.”
translation: Slops bilong ol wadi i go daun long ples Ar, na ol i stap wantaim lon borsta bilong Moab.

original: From there they went on to Beer, the well where the LORD said to Moses, “Gather the people so that I may give them water.”
translation: Ol i go bek long Bia, wara hap LORD i tokim Mosis, “Kisim ol pipol na mi bai givim ol wara.”

original: Then Israel sang this song: “Spring up, O well, all of you sing to it!
translation: Isrel i singim dispela sang: “Kam bek, o wel, yupela olgeta sing long em! ”

original: The princes dug the well; the nobles of the people hollowed it out with their scepters and with their staffs.” From the wilderness the Israelites went on to Mattanah,
translation: Prinses i wokim wel; nobol bilong piple i holim em ausait wantaim skeptas bilong ol na staf bilong ol. Ol Israelites i go inap long Mattanah, husat i kam long bus.

original: and from Mattanah to Nahaliel, and from Nahaliel to Bamoth,
translation: Na long Mattanah i go long Nahaliel, na long Nahaliel i go long Bamoth,

original: and from Bamoth to the valley in Moab where the top of Pisgah overlooks the wasteland.
translation: Na long Bamoth i go daun istap long vale long hap graun bilong Moab, we antap bilong Pisgah i luk i go daun long ples i no gat gras.

original: Then Israel sent messengers to Sihon king of the Amorites, saying,
translation: Na Isrel i salim pasinda long Sihon, papa bilong kantri bilong Amorait, ol tok:

original: “Let us pass through your land. We will not cut through any field or vineyard, or drink water from any well. We will stay on the King’s Highway until we have passed through your territory.”
translation: "Mipela laik go pinis long graun bilong yu. Mipela no ken katim na go insait long gaden bilong wain o fabrik, o dring wara long wel. Mipela stap long rot bilong King, mipela go pinis insait long kaontri bilong yu."

original: But Sihon would not let Israel pass through his territory. Instead, he gathered his whole army and went out to confront Israel in the wilderness. When he came to Jahaz, he fought against Israel.
translation: Sihon i no lem Israel i pasim go long graun bilong en. Insedad, i kam bikos long ples na i kisim ol solja bilong en, na i go aut long bus na i wari wantaim Israel. Wanpela taim i kam long Jahaz, i fait wantaim Israel.

original: And Israel put him to the sword and took possession of his land, from the Arnon to the Jabbok—but only up to the border of the Ammonites, because it was fortified.
translation: Na Isrel i kilim man i go long swod na ol i tek i go long graun bilong en, stat long Arnon ka ikam long Jabbok - tasol inap long lain bilong Ammonait, bikos em i gat barakol.

original: Israel captured all the cities of the Amorites and occupied them, including Heshbon and all its villages.
translation: Isrel i kisim olgeta taun bilong Amori, na ol i stap i usim, Hesbon na ol vilij long en i go.

original: Heshbon was the city of Sihon king of the Amorites, who had fought against the former king of Moab and taken all his land as far as the Arnon.
translation: Heshbon emi siti bilong Sihon king bilong Amori, nau emi go fait wantaim kingly bifo bilong Moab na bam takim olgeta graun bilong en olsem farastem Arnon.

original: That is why the poets say: “Come to Heshbon, let it be rebuilt; let the city of Sihon be restored.
translation: Em i bikos bilong dispela, ol poetics i tok olsem: “Kam long Heshbon, imas gen em i go bek again long as bilong en; taun bilong Sihon i kamap gen.”

original: For a fire went out from Heshbon, a blaze from the city of Sihon. It consumed Ar of Moab, the rulers of Arnon’s heights.
translation: Fai i go aut long Heshbon, glow bilong fai long siti bilong Sihon. Em i kaikaim Ar bilong Moab, ol bikpela man bilong hait bilong Arnon.

original: Woe to you, O Moab! You are destroyed, O people of Chemosh! He gave up his sons as refugees, and his daughters into captivity to Sihon king of the Amorites.
translation: Woi long yu, o Moab! Yu kisim dae, ol pipol bilong Chemosh! Em i givim sut bilong em long ranawe, na daughters bilong em i go long kapitisin long Sihon king bilong Amorites.

original: But we have overthrown them; Heshbon is destroyed as far as Dibon. We demolished them as far as Nophah, which reaches to Medeba.”
translation: Mipela winim ol i go daun; Heshbon em i bagarap pinis longwe Dibon. Mipela kisim ol i braik longwe Nophah, em i rin i kamap long Medeba.”

original: So Israel lived in the land of the Amorites.
translation: Na Isrel i stap long kantri bilong Amori.

original: After Moses had sent spies to Jazer, Israel captured its villages and drove out the Amorites who were there.
translation: Bihaenim Moses i sendim spes olgeta long Jesa, Isrel i kisim vilij ol bilong Amorit na tromoitim Amorit long ples.

original: Then they turned and went up the road to Bashan, and Og king of Bashan and his whole army came out to meet them in battle at Edrei.
translation: Tisa em na go ap long rot bilong Basan, na Og king bilong Basan wantaim ol solja bilong em i kamaut long mikim ol long bikpela fait long Ederei.

original: But the LORD said to Moses, “Do not fear him, for I have delivered him into your hand, along with all his people and his land. Do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon.”
translation: Bareket i tokim Mosis, “No ken kirap long em, bikos mi givim em long han bilong yu, wantaim ol pipol bilong en na graun bilong en. Wokim olsem yu wokim long Sihon king bilong Amoriti, we i stap long Hesbon.”

original: So they struck down Og, along with his sons and his whole army, until no remnant was left. And they took possession of his land.
translation: Ol i kilim daun Og, wantaim ol pikinini bilong en na hol army bilong en, until no wanpela i stap. Na ol i tek posesen long graun bilong en.

original: Then the Israelites traveled on and camped in the plains of Moab near the Jordan, across from Jericho.
translation: Pipol Israel i go longwe na i kamp long bus long ples flat long Moab, nambis long Jordan, long sait bilong Jeriko.

original: Now Balak son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites,
translation: Nau Balak sambai bilong Zippor i lukim olgeta we Isrel i mekim long Amorites,

original: and Moab was terrified of the people because they were numerous. Indeed, Moab dreaded the Israelites.
translation: Na Moab i bikim traus long ol Israel tasol ol i planti, na Moab i gat Bikpela fear long ol.

original: So the Moabites said to the elders of Midian, “This horde will devour everything around us, as an ox licks up the grass of the field.” Since Balak son of Zippor was king of Moab at that time,
translation: Ol Moabiti i tokim ol bikman bilong Midian, "Grup bilong ol i kam, bai ol i kaikaim everything long narapela hap, olsem ox i laikim gras bilong ples." Long taim em, Balak san bilong Zippor em i king bilong Moab.

original: he sent messengers to Balaam son of Beor at Pethor, which is by the Euphrates in the land of his people. “Behold, a people has come out of Egypt,” said Balak. “They cover the face of the land and have settled next to me.
translation: Em i sendim mesa long Balaam susa Beor we i stap klostu long riva Euphrates. "Behold, wanpela grup bilong pipo i kamap long Egip," ol i tok olsem Balak. "Ol i kap long graun, ol i kova olgeta, na ol i wakim haus olsem klostu long mi."

original: So please come now and put a curse on this people, because they are too mighty for me. Perhaps I may be able to defeat them and drive them out of the land; for I know that those you bless are blessed, and those you curse are cursed.”
translation: Kam daun nau na putim katukus long dispela ples, bikos ol i kalap long me. Mipela harim ol i gat strongpela spirit, mipela no inap winim ol. Mi hop long winim ol na draivim ol long graun; bikos mi save olsem pipel yu givim blesi, ol i blesi, na pipel yu givim katukus, ol i katukus.

original: The elders of Moab and Midian departed with the fees for divination in hand. They came to Balaam and relayed to him the words of Balak.
translation: Olam bilong Moab na Midian i go bek long han, wantaim pe bilong singautim spirit. Ol i kam kasol long Balaam na ol i givim em tok bilong Balak.

original: “Spend the night here,” Balaam replied, “and I will give you the answer that the LORD speaks to me.” So the princes of Moab stayed with Balaam.
translation: Komon stap hariap long ples, Balaam i tok, na mi bai givim yu ansa long tok bilong Bikpela i tok long mi. Na prins bilong Moab i stap wantaim Balaam.

original: Then God came to Balaam and asked, “Who are these men with you?”
translation: Na God i kam bek gen long Balaam, i askim, 'Husait ol man ya i stap wantaim yu?'

original: And Balaam said to God, “Balak son of Zippor, king of Moab, sent me this message:
translation: Na Balaam i tokim God olsem, "Balak son bilong Zippor, king bilong Moab, i sendim mi dispela mesij:

original: ‘Behold, a people has come out of Egypt, and they cover the face of the land. Now come and put a curse on them for me. Perhaps I may be able to fight against them and drive them away.’”
translation: Lukim, wanpela ples i kam aut long Egip, na ol i kova olgeta graun. Nau kam na kursim ol long me, bai mi inap harim war long ol na drivim ol i go.

original: But God said to Balaam, “Do not go with them. You are not to curse this people, for they are blessed.”
translation: Bikos God i tokim Balaam, “Yu no ken go wantaim ol. Yu no ken karim dispela ples, bikos dispela ol i gat bikpela blesi.”

original: So Balaam got up the next morning and said to Balak’s princes, “Go back to your homeland, because the LORD has refused to let me go with you.”
translation: Em i kamap gen long moning nambawan dei na em i tokim prins Balak, "Yu go bak long kantri bilong yu, bikos GOD i no givim permission long me long go wantaim yu."

original: And the princes of Moab arose, returned to Balak, and said, “Balaam refused to come with us.”
translation: Na prins bilong Moab i kam antap, ol i go bek long Balak, na ol i tok, "Balaam i no kam wantaim mipela."

original: Then Balak sent other princes, more numerous and more distinguished than the first messengers.
translation: Na Balak i sendim narapela prins, ol i gat moa manmeri na ol i gat moa bikpela nem long ol i go bifor.

original: They came to Balaam and said, “This is what Balak son of Zippor says: ‘Please let nothing hinder you from coming to me,
translation: Ol i kam long Balaam na tok olsem: "Balak sut bilong Zippor i tok, 'Mipela harim yu, nothing no stap harim yu kom long me'"

original: for I will honor you richly and do whatever you say. So please come and put a curse on this people for me!’”
translation: Bai mi givim yu onor bikpela, na mipela bai mekim olgeta samting yu tok. Olsem, mipela bihainim yu, kam na kisim bek long ol pipol ya!

original: But Balaam replied to the servants of Balak, “If Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I could not do anything small or great to go beyond the command of the LORD my God.
translation: Balaam i tokim ol iubilo bilong Balak, "Sapos Balak i givim mi em haus bilong en i fulap long silva na gol, bai mi no inap harim samting nait ken go pas long komando bilong Bikpela, God bilong mi."

original: So now, please stay here overnight as the others did, that I may find out what else the LORD has to tell me.”
translation: Nau, mipela i askim yu, stap hia na nait, olsem ol narapela i stap, mipela bai harim moa wanpela tok bilong Bikpela, em i gat moa wanpela tok long mi.

original: That night God came to Balaam and said, “Since these men have come to summon you, get up and go with them, but you must only do what I tell you.”
translation: Nait i go, God i kam long Balaam na tokim em, "Ol man ya i kam singautim yu, kam daun na go wantaim ol, bai yu mas only mekim ol samting we mi tokim yu."

original: So in the morning Balaam got up, saddled his donkey, and went with the princes of Moab.
translation: Long moning Balaam em i kam daun, em i putim sak bilong donki, na em i go wantaim prinis bilong Moab.

original: Then God’s anger was kindled because Balaam was going along, and the angel of the LORD stood in the road to oppose him. Balaam was riding his donkey, and his two servants were with him.
translation: Na Anga bilong God i kamil bikos Balaam i go long rot, na Eyian bilong Lod i stap long rot long kam bek gen im. Balaam i ridim donki bilong en, na tu servist bilong em i stap wantaim em.

original: When the donkey saw the angel of the LORD standing in the road with a drawn sword in his hand, she turned off the path and went into a field. So Balaam beat her to return her to the path.
translation: Taim donki i lukim engel bilong Jehovah i stap long rot, na em i gat sowrd i kilim stret long han bilong en, donki i turnim bek na i go insait long graon. Olsem na Balaam i paitim em bilong bringim bak long rot.

original: Then the angel of the LORD stood in a narrow passage between two vineyards, with walls on either side.
translation: Na Eyanggel bilong God i stap long narpela pasis, bikos tu vineya i stap, na wal i go daun longeta hap bilong en.

original: And the donkey saw the angel of the LORD and pressed herself against the wall, crushing Balaam’s foot against it. So he beat her once again.
translation: Na dokimak i lukim enjel bilong LORD na em i pas long wanpela hap, na i kisim fut bilong Balaam i krang long diwai. Na em i paitim gen.

original: And the angel of the LORD moved on ahead and stood in a narrow place where there was no room to turn to the right or left.
translation: Na enjel bilong LORD i go bek long fron, em i stap long ples narapela tru, inogat spes bilong wend long sait o long lef.

original: When the donkey saw the angel of the LORD, she lay down under Balaam, and he became furious and beat her with his staff.
translation: Taim donki i lukim enjel bilong Jehovah, i klostu klostu underneath Balaam, na Balaam i bel hat na i paitim em wantaim stik.

original: Then the LORD opened the donkey’s mouth, and she said to Balaam, “What have I done to you that you have beaten me these three times?”
translation: Na LORD i opim maus bilong donki, na em i tokim Balaam, "Mi mekim wanem long yu, nau yu i hammarem mi tripsela taim?"

original: Balaam answered the donkey, “You have made a fool of me! If I had a sword in my hand, I would kill you right now!”
translation: Balaam i bekim ol i tok long pik, “Yu mekim mi bagarap yet! Sapos mi holim sivat long han bilong mi, bai mi kilim yu nau yet!”

original: But the donkey said to Balaam, “Am I not the donkey you have ridden all your life until today? Have I ever treated you this way before?” “No,” he replied.
translation: Dol i tokim Balaam, “Mi nogat dol yu bin karim long ol taim bipo na kam inap nau? Mi bin harm yu olsem bifo?” “Nogat,” na em i tok.

original: Then the LORD opened Balaam’s eyes, and he saw the angel of the LORD standing in the road with a drawn sword in his hand. And Balaam bowed low and fell facedown.
translation: Na Papa God i opim ai bilong Balaam, na em i lukim enjel bilong Papa God i stanap long rot wantaim sip bilong sword i kamaut long han bilong en. Na Balaam i krosim knees na kilim face daun olgeta.

original: The angel of the LORD asked him, “Why have you beaten your donkey these three times? Behold, I have come out to oppose you, because your way is perverse before me.
translation: Ein angel bilong Lod i askim em, “Wai yu paitim donki bilong yu dispela tripela taim? Lukim, mi kamaut long paitim yu, bikos rot bilong yu i krung long me.

original: The donkey saw me and turned away from me these three times. If she had not turned away, then by now I would surely have killed you and let her live.”
translation: Donki i lukim me na tromwe nau long me dispela tripe tim. Sapos em i no tromwe, orait bai mi kilim yu stap, na bai mi lusim donki i stap.

original: “I have sinned,” Balaam said to the angel of the LORD, “for I did not realize that you were standing in the road to confront me. And now, if this is displeasing in your sight, I will go back home.”
translation: “Mi bin sindaun,” Balaam i tokim ainjel bilong LORD, “mi no save yu stap yet long rot, long kam konfrontim mi. Sapos dispela i no liklik long ai bilong yu, bai mi go bek long haus bilong mi.”

original: But the angel of the LORD said to Balaam, “Go with the men, but you are to speak only what I tell you.” So Balaam went with the princes of Balak.
translation: Engin bilong Jehovah i tok long Balaam, “Yu go wantaim ol man, tasol yu mas tok bikos mi yet kam tokim yu.” Na Balaam i go wantaim ol prins bilong Balak.

original: When Balak heard that Balaam was coming, he went out to meet him at the Moabite city on the Arnon border, at the edge of his territory.
translation: Taim Balak harim olsem Balaam i kam, em i go aut long miksim nau long taun bilong Moab long kaunti Arnon, long hap boundary bilong en.

original: And he said to Balaam, “Did I not send you an urgent summons? Why did you not come to me? Am I really not able to richly reward you?”
translation: Ol i tokim Balaam, “Mi go senim kukurum ikam long yu, yu why yu no kam? Mi no gat planti strong moni bai mi givim yu?”

original: “See, I have come to you,” Balaam replied, “but can I say just anything? I must speak only the word that God puts in my mouth.”
translation: “Mi kam long yu,” Balaam i tok, “tasol bai mi tok olsem wanpela wod? Nogat, mi mas tok tasol wanpela wod we Bikpela i givim long maus bilong mi.”

original: So Balaam accompanied Balak, and they came to Kiriath-huzoth.
translation: Na Balaam i go wailk wantaim Balak, na ol i kam long Kiriath-huzoth.

original: Balak sacrificed cattle and sheep, and he gave portions to Balaam and the princes who were with him.
translation: Balak i kilim ol bulmakau na ol sheep, na em i givim kaikai long Balaam na ol prinsis i stap wantaim em.

original: The next morning, Balak took Balaam and brought him up to Bamoth-baal. From there he could see the outskirts of the camp of the people.
translation: Long moning i kam, Balak kisim Balaam i go long ples Bamoth-baal. Na long hap em, ol i lukim hap bilong kanua bilong ol pipol.

original: Then Balaam said to Balak, “Build for me seven altars here, and prepare for me seven bulls and seven rams.”
translation: Na Balaam i tokim Balak, “Bilimipim mi sampela altars sevén hia, na preparim mipela bulmakau sekén na ram sekén.”

original: So Balak did as Balaam had instructed, and Balak and Balaam offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
translation: Na Balak i mekim olsem Balaam i bin instruktim, na Balak na Balaam i ofa wan bullok na wan ram long bikos long eni altar.

original: “Stay here by your burnt offering while I am gone,” Balaam said to Balak. “Perhaps the LORD will meet with me. And whatever He reveals to me, I will tell you.” So Balaam went off to a barren height,
translation: “Stap hia beside of ka Vakai bilong yu,” Balaam i tokim Balak, “LORD bai kam ka tokim mi. Na wanpela samting em i mekim bekim mi, mi bai tokim yu.” Na Balaam i go na i kamap long wanpela hap graun i no gat gris.

original: and God met with him. “I have set up seven altars,” Balaam said, “and on each altar I have offered a bull and a ram.”
translation: Na Bikpela i kam nau long em. “Mi plantim sampela altars seven,” Balaam i tok, “na long ek altar mi putum bullok na ram, na mi ofa ol.”

original: Then the LORD put a message in Balaam’s mouth, saying, “Return to Balak and give him this message.”
translation: Na Papa God putim tok long mupela Balaam, olsem: "Go bek gen long Balak, na givim em dispela tok."

original: So he returned to Balak, who was standing there beside his burnt offering, with all the princes of Moab.
translation: Em i go bek gen long Balak, we em i stap yet kamda besaid long ka bilong em we em i bin burnim olgeta, wantaim ol bifman bilong Moab.

original: And Balaam lifted up an oracle, saying: “Balak brought me from Aram, the king of Moab from the mountains of the east. ‘Come,’ he said, ‘put a curse on Jacob for me; come and denounce Israel!’
translation: Na Balaam i go ap long tok bilong spirit, i tok olsem: “Balak, king bilong Moaib, em i kam bekim mi long Aram, long maunten bilong east. Em i tok, ‘Kam,’ em i tok, ‘givim jakim long Yakob, na krungut long Israel!’”

original: How can I curse what God has not cursed? How can I denounce what the LORD has not denounced?
translation: Mi no inap karim olsem ol geta we Bikpela i no karim. Mi no inap tok bes long ol geta we Bikpela i no tok bes long.

original: For I see them from atop the rocky cliffs, and I watch them from the hills. Behold, a people dwelling apart, not reckoning themselves among the nations.
translation: Mi lukim ol long antap long klip we i go daun, na mi wachim ol long maunten. Nesen, ol i stap wanpela tasol, ol i no kalkulim ol yet long nesen.

original: Who can count the dust of Jacob or number even a fourth of Israel? Let me die the death of the righteous; let my end be like theirs!”
translation: Hu ina ken kisim kaunt long dos bilong Yakob, o nambautim gen wan paat bilong Isrel? Mi laik dai olsem dai bilong man i kamap strong, na bihaen bai mi go daun olsem ol!

original: Then Balak said to Balaam, “What have you done to me? I brought you here to curse my enemies, and behold, you have only blessed them!”
translation: Na Balak i tokim Balaam olsem, "Wanem yu mekim long mi? Mi bringim yu hap long dispela ples bilong katim ol i no laikim bilong mi, na lukim, yu trai blessim ol, tasol!"

original: But Balaam replied, “Should I not speak exactly what the LORD puts in my mouth?”
translation: Balaam i tok bek, “Inap mi no tok stret olgeta we Papa bilong olgeta i putim word long mouth bilong me?”

original: Then Balak said to him, “Please come with me to another place where you can see them. You will only see the outskirts of their camp—not all of them. And from there, curse them for me.”
translation: Balak i tokim em, "Kam wantaim mi long narapela hap, na yu ken lukim ol long hap emo. Yu no ken lukim olgeta, bikos yu lukim long hap taem ol i stap long kemp. Na praitim dispela kat bikos mi long bahn ples."

original: So Balak took him to the field of Zophim, to the top of Pisgah, where he built seven altars and offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
translation: Na Balak i kisim Balaam go long ples Zophim, long top bilong Pisgah, na ol i bikim seven altar bilong ofa, na ol i ofa bulmakau na ram long bek harim altar.

original: Balaam said to Balak, “Stay here beside your burnt offering while I meet the LORD over there.”
translation: Balaam i tokim Balak, “Yu stap hariap long ofa bilong yu wail em mi go kamdaun long ples we mi mas kilim LORDE.”

original: And the LORD met with Balaam and put a message in his mouth, saying, “Return to Balak and speak what I tell you.”
translation: Na Papa God i kam bek long Balaam na i putim tok-save i go insait mout bilong em, olsem: “Go bak long Balak na tok olsem mi talk.”

original: So he returned to Balak, who was standing there by his burnt offering with the princes of Moab. “What did the LORD say?” Balak asked.
translation: Na em i go bek gen long Balak, i stap yet long ples we em i bin mekim ka long ol samting em i bin bungim wantaim ol leda bilong Moab. “LORD i tok wetem wanem?” Balak i askim.

original: Then Balaam lifted up an oracle, saying: “Arise, O Balak, and listen; give ear to me, O son of Zippor.
translation: Na Balaam em i go ap long tok bilong Spirit, olsem: "Kam daun, O Balak, na harim nau; kisim han bilong harim tok bilong mi, O Pikinini bilong Zippor.

original: God is not a man, that He should lie, or a son of man, that He should change His mind. Does He speak and not act? Does He promise and not fulfill?
translation: God em i no man, olsem na em bai katim tok bilong em, na em i no pikinini bilong man, olsem na em bai chanjim maing bilong em. Em toktok tasol i no warkim? Em promis tasol i no kamapim?

original: I have indeed received a command to bless; He has blessed, and I cannot change it.
translation: Mi tasol kamapim komando long bles, em i givim blesing, na mi no inap senisim.

original: He considers no disaster for Jacob; He sees no trouble for Israel. The LORD their God is with them, and the shout of the King is among them.
translation: GOD i no save tingim bekim olgeta disaster long Jakob; i no save lukim trabel long Isrel. GOD bilong ol i stap wantaim ol, na krais bilong King i stap namel long ol.

original: God brought them out of Egypt with strength like a wild ox.
translation: Bikpela i kam bekim ol long Egip, na ol i gat strong olsem bulmakau.

original: For there is no spell against Jacob and no divination against Israel. It will now be said of Jacob and Israel, ‘What great things God has done!’
translation: I gat no singsing long Jakob, na i gat no tok bilong spirik long Israel. Nau bai ol pikinini tok olsem long Jakob na Israel, 'Ol samting bikpela we God mekim!'

original: Behold, the people rise like a lioness; they rouse themselves like a lion, not resting until they devour their prey and drink the blood of the slain.”
translation: Lukim, ol pipol i kamap strong olsem lion meri; ol i wokim skul long ol yet na kamap strong olsem lion, no givim ap, trai kolim na kaikai nau til tai bai go daun na dringim blod bilong ol i pait.

original: Now Balak said to Balaam, “Then neither curse them at all nor bless them at all!”
translation: Nau Balak i tokim Balaam, “Yu no ken kilim ol narapela long tok bai yu kursem ol, na yu no ken givim ol blesing, tasol bai yu no ken toktok long ol, na yu no ken givim ol samting gut, na yu no ken pasim ol i go daun.”

original: But Balaam replied, “Did I not tell you that whatever the LORD says, I must do?”
translation: Balaam i tok bek long ol, "Mi no bin tokim yu already, dispela Papa bilong ol i tok wanem, mi mas wokim?"

original: “Please come,” said Balak, “I will take you to another place. Perhaps it will please God that you curse them for me from there.”
translation: “Kam bek long stap,” olsem Balak tok, “mi bai karim yu go long narapela ples. Em i mas posible bai God i lukim gut long ai bilong en, na yu ken krosim ol long hap bilong mi.”

original: And Balak took Balaam to the top of Peor, which overlooks the wasteland.
translation: Na Balak kisim Balaam go long tp bilong Peor, ples we i lukaut i go long kantri i birua.

original: Then Balaam said, “Build for me seven altars here, and prepare for me seven bulls and seven rams.”
translation: Na Balaam i tok olsem, “Wokim mipela seven alta hia, na preparim mipela seven bullok na seven ram bic.”

original: So Balak did as Balaam had instructed, and he offered a bull and a ram on each altar.
translation: Na Balak i mekim olsem Balaam i tok, na i ofa wan bulmakau na wan ram long bikos long eni altar.

original: And when Balaam saw that it pleased the LORD to bless Israel, he did not resort to sorcery as on previous occasions, but he turned his face toward the wilderness.
translation: Na Balaam i lukim ol i amaze long LORD, em i sambai givim blesing long Israel, em i no go bek long magik olsem taim bifo, tasol em i turnim face long bus.

original: When Balaam looked up and saw Israel encamped tribe by tribe, the Spirit of God came upon him,
translation: Taim Balaam lukaut i go, na i si Israel i kamap olsem wanpela trib i stap besait long narapela trib, Spirut bilong God i kam i pundaun long em.

original: and he lifted up an oracle, saying: “This is the prophecy of Balaam son of Beor, the prophecy of a man whose eyes are open,
translation: Na em i kirapim wanpela propesi, tok olsem: “Dispela em i propesi bilong Balaam, pikinini bilong Beor, man bilong wanem ai i op,

original: the prophecy of one who hears the words of God, who sees a vision from the Almighty, who bows down with eyes wide open:
translation: Tok bilong wanpela i harim tok bilong God, hu i lukim vip bilong Bikpela, hu i kukuatim hed na kaikai lapun:

original: How lovely are your tents, O Jacob, your dwellings, O Israel!
translation: O, hamamas ol tent bilong yu, Jakob, ol ples bilong yu, Irael!

original: They spread out like palm groves, like gardens beside a stream, like aloes the LORD has planted, like cedars beside the waters.
translation: Ol i skulpasim olsem graon bilong palma, olsem gadin long sait bilong wata, olsem aloiwe LORD i plantim, olsem seda long sait bilong wata.

original: Water will flow from his buckets, and his seed will have abundant water. His king will be greater than Agag, and his kingdom will be exalted.
translation: Wara bai i kamaut long ol buket bilong en, na ol pikinini bilong en bai gat wara i kamap tru. King bilong en bai bikpela mo dan Agag, na kingdom bilong en bai go antap longpela.

original: God brought him out of Egypt with strength like a wild ox, to devour hostile nations and crush their bones, to pierce them with arrows.
translation: God i kamautim em long Egypt olsem bulmakau buskanin, na i kaikai nasin i stap walng bilong en, bai ol i bungim banis bilong ol, na ol i ritim ol wantaim aluwawa.

original: He crouches, he lies down like a lion; like a lioness, who dares to rouse him? Blessed are those who bless you and cursed are those who curse you.”
translation: Em i kuku, em i sip olsem laion; olsem laiones, hu mas rausim em? Ol man i givim blesing long yu, bles i kam long ol, na ol man i givim keras long yu, i kirap long ol.

original: Then Balak’s anger burned against Balaam, and he struck his hands together and said to Balaam, “I summoned you to curse my enemies, but behold, you have persisted in blessing them these three times.
translation: Balak i masalai pinis, em i paitim han bilong en tugeta, na em tokim Balaam, "Mi bin kallim yu kam kasim ol enemy bilong mi, tasol yu yet kamap strong long blesim ol dispela tripa."

original: Therefore, flee at once to your home! I said I would richly reward you, but instead the LORD has denied your reward.”
translation: Nogat samting, rin bek long haim bilong yu! Mi bin tok olsem mi bai givim yu planti samting gut, tasol LORD im denyim reward bilong yu.

original: Balaam answered Balak, “Did I not already tell the messengers you sent me
translation: Balaam i bekim Balak, "Mi bihainim yu pinis olsem long ol messija yu sendim i kam long mi"

original: that even if Balak were to give me his house full of silver and gold, I could not do anything of my own accord, good or bad, to go beyond the command of the LORD? I will speak whatever the LORD says.
translation: Nogat Balak ina givim mi haus i fulap long silva na gol, mi no ken mekim wankain samting long mi yet, ya nogut oa gut, long go pasis tok bilong LORD. Mi bai tok olgeta we LORD itok.

original: Now I am going back to my people, but come, let me warn you what this people will do to your people in the days to come.”
translation: Mipela bai go bek long mipela yet, kam, mi hamamasim yu long dispela: ol dispela man bai mekim olsem long ol pikinini bilong yu long taim i kam.

original: Then Balaam lifted up an oracle, saying, “This is the prophecy of Balaam son of Beor, the prophecy of a man whose eyes are open,
translation: Na Balaam i go ap long tok bilong Spirit, olsem: “Dispela em i propesi bilong Balaam, pikinini bilong Beor, em i man husat ai bilong en i op,

original: the prophecy of one who hears the words of God, who has knowledge from the Most High, who sees a vision from the Almighty, who bows down with eyes wide open:
translation: Tok bilong wanpela i harim tok bilong God, em i gat save longpela na kam bek long Hanud i gat pawa, em i lukim sain long Hanud i gat bikpela pawa, em i kuku grubelong na mati i op:

original: I see him, but not now; I behold him, but not near. A star will come forth from Jacob, and a scepter will arise from Israel. He will crush the skulls of Moab and strike down all the sons of Sheth.
translation: Mi lukim em, tasol nogat nau; mi behim em, tasol i no nesa. Wanpela sta bilong Jacob bai kamap, na wanpela scepter bai araise long Israel. Em bai krushim hed bilong Moab na em bai kilim ol pikinini bilong Sheth.

original: Edom will become a possession, as will Seir, his enemy; but Israel will perform with valor.
translation: Edom bai bam bikim propati bilong ol, na Maunten Seir, poit bilong em, tu; tasol Isrel bai wok strong na bravely.

original: A ruler will come from Jacob and destroy the survivors of the city.”
translation: Wanpela bikman bai kam long hap bilong Jacob bai bagarap ol i stap yet long taun.

original: Then Balaam saw Amalek and lifted up an oracle, saying: “Amalek was first among the nations, but his end is destruction.”
translation: Na Balaam i lukim Amalek, na em i kisim hap tok bilong Spirit, em i tok olsem: “Amalek em i kam first long ol narawan pesen, tasol em i go daun long bagarap.”

original: Next he saw the Kenites and lifted up an oracle, saying: “Your dwelling place is secure, and your nest is set in a cliff.
