translation: Nekis ol i lukim Keniti na em i kisim bek na tok ples bilong spirit, em i tok olsem: “Haus bilong yu em i stret na saf, na nest bilong yu i stap long klif.

original: Yet Kain will be destroyed when Asshur takes you captive.”
translation: Kain bai i go daun wanpela taim Asshur i kam holim yu na kisim yu go we.

original: Once more Balaam lifted up an oracle, saying: “Ah, who can live unless God has ordained it?
translation: Genama Balaam i go ap long wanpela tok bilong Spirit, olsem: "O, husat ina bai i stap olsem God yet im i laik?"

original: Ships will come from the coasts of Cyprus; they will subdue Asshur and Eber, but they too will perish forever.”
translation: Ship i go kam long kos bilong Saipras; ol i winim Asiria na Eber, na beside ol tu bai i dai i go longwe.

original: Then Balaam arose and returned to his homeland, and Balak also went on his way.
translation: Na Balaam i kam bek gen na i go bak long ples bilong em, na Balak i go long we bilong en.

original: While Israel was staying in Shittim, the men began to indulge in sexual immorality with the daughters of Moab,
translation: Wanpela taim Isrel i stap yet long Shittim, ol man i stat long mekim pikinini nogut wantaim daughta bilong Moab.

original: who also invited them to the sacrifices for their gods. And the people ate and bowed down to these gods.
translation: Ol i kisim ol long go na katim ani bilong ol, na ol i kaikai na katim hed long debdeb bilong ol.

original: So Israel joined in worshiping Baal of Peor, and the anger of the LORD burned against them.
translation: Na Isrel i kamap long worshipim Baal bilong Peor, na aire bilong LORD i pai na i bung long ol.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Take all the leaders of the people and execute them in broad daylight before the LORD, so that His fierce anger may turn away from Israel.”
translation: Bikpela i tokim Mose, “Yu mas kisim ol bic men bilong ples na kilim ol long taim biknait bifor Bikpela, na husat bai mekim hesa bikpela bilong en i lusim hesa i go long ples Israel.”

original: So Moses told the judges of Israel, “Each of you must kill all of his men who have joined in worshiping Baal of Peor.”
translation: Mususi i tokim ol jaj bilong Israel, "Yupela yet long kilim ol man bilong yumi olgeta iusim ol i kamap na joim long servisim Baal bilong Peor."

original: Just then an Israelite man brought to his family a Midianite woman in the sight of Moses and the whole congregation of Israel while they were weeping at the entrance to the Tent of Meeting.
translation: Olsem taim, wanpela man bilong Israel kisim i go long ples bilong papa na mama bilong em wanpela meri bilong Midian long ai bilong Moses na ol assemblies bilong Israel wail em tasol long entris bilong Haus Bilong Prayer.

original: On seeing this, Phinehas son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, got up from the assembly, took a spear in his hand,
translation: Long taim Finias, pikinini bilong Elezar, pikinini bilong Aron biskop, i lukim dispela, em i kirap ausait long husat i bin sitdaun, em i kisim spia na putim long han bilong en.

original: followed the Israelite into his tent, and drove the spear through both of them—through the Israelite and on through the belly of the woman. So the plague against the Israelites was halted,
translation: I go bekim Israelait long hap bilong en, na i kilim ol i go long spia na pinisim ol tu - Israelait na go dae long bel bilong meri. Na plesen ikam long Ol Israelait i go dae.

original: but those who died in the plague numbered 24,000.
translation: Bai ol i dai pinis long taim bilong pes, na ol i kauntim 24,000.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Phinehas son of Eleazar, the son of Aaron the priest, has turned My wrath away from the Israelites; for he was zealous for My sake among them, so that I did not consume the Israelites in My zeal.
translation: Finehas, pikinini bilong Elezar, pikinini bilong Aron prist, em i kisim bek long rong bilong mi long Israelites; bikos em i gat laif strong long mekim wok bilong mi, na mi no kaikai ol Israelites long rong bilong mi.

original: Declare, therefore, that I am granting him My covenant of peace.
translation: Olsem, yu tok dus, Mi givim em Pikinini blong Mi long Peis.

original: It will be a covenant of permanent priesthood for him and his descendants, because he was zealous for his God and made atonement for the Israelites.”
translation: Em bai kamap olsem wanpela treaty bilong priesthood we i stap long taim long em na long ol desenden bilong em, wantaim em i gat laif bilong enjesa long God bilong em, na em mekim peis bilong Israel.

original: The name of the Israelite who was slain with the Midianite woman was Zimri son of Salu, the leader of a Simeonite family.
translation: Nem bilong Israelit i bin kil wantaim meri Midian em Zimri, sut bilong susbilong Salu, bikman bilong wanpela famili Simeon.

original: And the name of the slain Midianite woman was Cozbi, the daughter of Zur, a tribal chief of a Midianite family.
translation: Na nem bilong meri Midian wei i bin dai em Cozbi, daughter bilong Zur, bic man bilong ples, cheif bilong famili Midian.

original: And the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tokim Moses,

original: “Attack the Midianites and strike them dead.
translation: Tok paitim ol Midianiti na kilim ol.

original: For they assailed you deceitfully when they seduced you in the matter of Peor and their sister Cozbi, the daughter of the Midianite leader, the woman who was killed on the day the plague came because of Peor.”
translation: Ol i bikim olsem long yu na tok pikinini, ol i lukim yu long stori bilong Peor, na sistta bilong ol, Kozbi, meri bilong Bib Long Midian, i dai long de plagi ikam long taim em Peor.

original: After the plague had ended, the LORD said to Moses and Eleazar son of Aaron the priest,
translation: Plag bilong dei i go pinis, Bikpela i tokim Mosis na Eleaza, pikinini bilong Aron pris,

original: “Take a census of the whole congregation of Israel by the houses of their fathers—all those twenty years of age or older who can serve in the army of Israel.”
translation: Kisim kaunta long olgeta kongregation bilong Isarel, ol i stap long haus bilong tumbuna, na kisim ol yangpela twenty yia na i go long hap, em i ken wokim servis long arme bilong Isarel.

original: So on the plains of Moab by the Jordan, across from Jericho, Moses and Eleazar the priest issued the instruction,
translation: Long plaen bilong Moab, besain wara Jordan, olsidan long Jeriko, Moses na Eleazar priis i givim despla instraksen.

original: “Take a census of the men twenty years of age or older, as the LORD has commanded Moses.” And these were the Israelites who came out of the land of Egypt:
translation: Kisim kaunta long ol man twenty yia na olega be bihain, olsem Jehovah i tokim Moses. Na dispela em i stori bilong ol Israel hu i kamap long laine Egypt:

original: Reuben was the firstborn of Israel. These were the descendants of Reuben: The Hanochite clan from Hanoch, the Palluite clan from Pallu,
translation: Ruben em i pikinini namba wan bilong Isrel. Ol dispela i bin kam long olsem, ol desenden bilong Ruben: Ol grup bilong Hanokait long Hanok, na ol grup bilong Paluit long Palu,

original: the Hezronite clan from Hezron, and the Carmite clan from Carmi.
translation: Klan Hezronait long han bilong Hezron, na klan Karmait long han bilong Karmi.

original: These were the clans of Reuben, and their registration numbered 43,730.
translation: Ol i stap long klana Reuben, na ol i kamap long kona 43,730.

original: Now the son of Pallu was Eliab,
translation: Na Pikinini bilong Pallu em i Eliab,

original: and the sons of Eliab were Nemuel, Dathan, and Abiram. It was Dathan and Abiram, chosen by the congregation, who fought against Moses and Aaron with the followers of Korah who rebelled against the LORD.
translation: Na ol pikinini bilong Eliab em Nemuel, Dathan, na Abiram. Em Dathan na Abiram, ol iambatan long ol pipol i tok, i go bekim Moses na Aaron, na ol i folo Korah, ol i bagarap long Jehovah.

original: And the earth opened its mouth and swallowed them along with Korah, whose followers died when the fire consumed 250 men. They serve as a warning sign.
translation: Na gras i opim maus bilong en, na i kaikai olgeta long Korah, husat i gat sampela man i folo em, ol i dai pinis taim faia i kaikai ol, 250 man. Ol i servim olsem sampela tok bilong waran.

original: However, the line of Korah did not die out.
translation: Lain bilong Korah i no finis yet.

original: These were the descendants of Simeon by their clans: The Nemuelite clan from Nemuel, the Jaminite clan from Jamin, the Jachinite clan from Jachin,
translation: Ol desenden bilong Simeon i stap long ol clan: Clan bilong Nemuelite i kam long Nemuel, clan bilong Jaminite i kam long Jamin, clan bilong Jachinite i kam long Jachin.

original: the Zerahite clan from Zerah, and the Shaulite clan from Shaul.
translation: Klan Zerahite long hap bilong Zerah, na klan Shaulite long hap bilong Shaul.

original: These were the clans of Simeon, and there were 22,200 men.
translation: Ol i bin klans bilong Simeon, na ol geta 22,200 man.

original: These were the descendants of Gad by their clans: The Zephonite clan from Zephon, the Haggite clan from Haggi, the Shunite clan from Shuni,
translation: Ol desenden bilong Gad i kam long ol grup bilong tribal klan: Klan bilong Zephonite i kam long Zephon, klan bilong Haggite i kam long Haggi, klan bilong Shunite i kam long Shuni.

original: the Oznite clan from Ozni, the Erite clan from Eri,
translation: Klan Oznite bilong Ozni, klan Erite bilong Eri,

original: the Arodite clan from Arod, and the Arelite clan from Areli.
translation: Klan bilong Arodite long Arod, na klan bilong Arelite long Areli.

original: These were the clans of Gad, and their registration numbered 40,500.
translation: Ol klana bilong Gad i stap olsem, na ol i kamap 40,500 long kautim ol.

original: The sons of Judah were Er and Onan, but they died in the land of Canaan.
translation: Ol pikinini bilong Juda em i Er na Onan, tasol ol i dai long kantri bilong Kanaan.

original: These were the descendants of Judah by their clans: The Shelanite clan from Shelah, the Perezite clan from Perez, and the Zerahite clan from Zerah.
translation: Ol desenden bilong Yuda i kam long ol klana bilong ol: Klen bilong Shelani bilong Shelah, Klen bilong Perezi bilong Perez, na Klen bilong Zera bilong Zerah.

original: And these were the descendants of Perez: the Hezronite clan from Hezron and the Hamulite clan from Hamul.
translation: Na dispela i kam: ol desenden bilong Perez, klan Hezronite bilong Hezron na klan Hamulite bilong Hamul.

original: These were the clans of Judah, and their registration numbered 76,500.
translation: Ol klana i stap long Judah, na ol i skelim ol long list, na i gobamapim 76,500.

original: These were the descendants of Issachar by their clans: The Tolaite clan from Tola, the Punite clan from Puvah,
translation: Ol desenden bilong Isakar long klana bilong ol i kam: klan Tolaite long Tola, klan Punite long Puvah.

original: the Jashubite clan from Jashub, and the Shimronite clan from Shimron.
translation: Klan Jashubite long hap bilong Jashub, na klan Shimronite long hap bilong Shimron.

original: These were the clans of Issachar, and their registration numbered 64,300.
translation: Ol klana i stap long Isaka, na ol i skelim ol long kensos, na i go kamap 64,300.

original: These were the descendants of Zebulun by their clans: The Seredite clan from Sered, the Elonite clan from Elon, and the Jahleelite clan from Jahleel.
translation: Ol desenden bilong Zebulun i kam bek long ol clan bilong ol. Clan Seredite i kam long hap Sered, clan Elonite i kam long hap Elon, na clan Jahleelite i kam long hap Jahleel.

original: These were the clans of Zebulun, and their registration numbered 60,500.
translation: Ol klan bilong Zebulun i bin ples, na ol i bin skelim 60,500 long resitreshon.

original: The descendants of Joseph included the clans of Manasseh and Ephraim.
translation: Ol desenden bilong Joseph em i inkludim clan bilong Manasseh na Ephraim.

original: These were the descendants of Manasseh: The Machirite clan from Machir, the father of Gilead, and the Gileadite clan from Gilead.
translation: Ol desenden bilong Manase ol i kam: Ol clan bilong Makirait husat i kam long Makir, papa bilong Gilead, na ol clan bilong Gileadait husat i kam long Gilead.

original: These were the descendants of Gilead: the Iezerite clan from Iezer, the Helekite clan from Helek,
translation: Ol desenden bilong Gilead: ol klana Iezerite bilong Iezer, ol klana Helekite bilong Helek,

original: the Asrielite clan from Asriel, the Shechemite clan from Shechem,
translation: Klan Asrielait bilong Asriel, klan Sikemait bilong Sikem,

original: the Shemidaite clan from Shemida, and the Hepherite clan from Hepher.
translation: Klan Shemidaite long ples Shemida, na klan Hepherite long ples Hepher.

original: Now Zelophehad son of Hepher had no sons but only daughters. The names of his daughters were Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.
translation: Na Zelophehad mak bilong Hepa i no gat pikinini man, tasol em i gat pikinini meri. Nem bilong daughters bilong em ol i Mahla, Noa, Hogla, Milka, na Tirza.

original: These were the clans of Manasseh, and their registration numbered 52,700.
translation: Ol klana igo bilong Manase, na ol i kamap long kountim ol na i go 52,700.

original: These were the descendants of Ephraim by their clans: The Shuthelahite clan from Shuthelah, the Becherite clan from Becher, and the Tahanite clan from Tahan.
translation: Ol desenden bilong Efrayim, ol i stap long ol clan bilong ol, na ol i kam bes na: clan Shuthelahite kam long Shuthelah, clan Becherite kam long Becher, na clan Tahanite kam long Tahan.

original: And the descendants of Shuthelah were the Eranite clan from Eran.
translation: Na ol desenden bilong Shuthelah i kamapim klan Eranite, klan bilong Eran.

original: These were the clans of Ephraim, and their registration numbered 32,500. These clans were the descendants of Joseph.
translation: Ol klin i go na Ephraim, ol i katim pinis long namba 32,500. Ol klin i go nau em i pikinini bilong Joseph.

original: These were the descendants of Benjamin by their clans: The Belaite clan from Bela, the Ashbelite clan from Ashbel, the Ahiramite clan from Ahiram,
translation: Ol desendent bilong Benjamin i kam long ol klana bilong ol: Klen bilong Belaite bilong Bela, Klen bilong Ashbelite bilong Ashbel, Klen bilong Ahiramite bilong Ahiram.

original: the Shuphamite clan from Shupham, and the Huphamite clan from Hupham.
translation: Klan Shupham bilong Shupham, na klan Hupham bilong Hupham.

original: And the descendants of Bela from Ard and Naaman were the Ardite clan from Ard and the Naamite clan from Naaman.
translation: Na ol desenden bilong Bela long Ard na Naaman i gat tupela klan: klan bilong Ardite long Ard, na klan bilong Naamite long Naaman.

original: These were the clans of Benjamin, and their registration numbered 45,600.
translation: Ol i stap long klans bilong Benjamin, na ol i kamap 45,600 long kount.

original: These were the descendants of Dan by their clans: The Shuhamite clan from Shuham. These were the clans of Dan.
translation: Ol desenden bilong Dan i bin kam bek long ol klana bilong ol: Klana Shuhamait long hap bilong Shuham. Ol klana bilong Dan i stap.

original: All of them were Shuhamite clans, and their registration numbered 64,400.
translation: Ol i kol Shuhamite clan, na namba bilong ol long register em i 64,400.

original: These were the descendants of Asher by their clans: The Imnite clan from Imnah, the Ishvite clan from Ishvi, and the Beriite clan from Beriah.
translation: Ol descendent bilong Asher i kam bek long ol clan: Lain bilong Imnite i kam bek long Imnah, lain bilong Ishvite i kam bek long Ishvi, na lain bilong Beriite i kam bek long Beriah.

original: And these were the descendants of Beriah: the Heberite clan from Heber and the Malchielite clan from Malchiel.
translation: Na dispela i stap: ol desenden bilong Beriah, klan Heberite husat i kam long Heber na klan Malchielite husat i kam long Malchiel.

original: And the name of Asher’s daughter was Serah.
translation: Nem bilong pikinini meri Asher em i tokol olsem Serah.

original: These were the clans of Asher, and their registration numbered 53,400.
translation: Ol klana bilong Esara i stap, na ol i kamap 53,400 long kaukus.

original: These were the descendants of Naphtali by their clans: The Jahzeelite clan from Jahzeel, the Gunite clan from Guni,
translation: Ol i bikmata na long ol klana bilong Naphtali: Ol Jahzeelite klan long Jahzeel, ol Gunite klan long Guni,

original: the Jezerite clan from Jezer, and the Shillemite clan from Shillem.
translation: Klan Jezerite long ples Jezer, na klan Shillemite long ples Shillem.

original: These were the clans of Naphtali, and their registration numbered 45,400.
translation: Ol klan bilong Naphtali i stap, na ol i katim na 45,400 i kamap long resit bilong ol.

original: These men of Israel numbered 601,730 in all.
translation: Ol man bilong Isrel, olgeta i kamap 601,730 long dispela.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “The land is to be divided among the tribes as an inheritance, according to the number of names.
translation: Graun i go long olpela tribe ol, strongim naus bilong ol nem, olsem inheritance long ol lain.

original: Increase the inheritance for a large tribe and decrease it for a small one; each tribe is to receive its inheritance according to the number of those registered.
translation: Kisim moa long inheritance bilong tim bilong ples i gat planti manmeri, na kisim i go daun long tim bilong ples i gat liklik manmeri; yumi mas skulim ol pipol long olgeta namel, na kisim inheritance bilong em oli mas kamap long namba bilong ol i skulim.

original: Indeed, the land must be divided by lot; they shall receive their inheritance according to the names of the tribes of their fathers.
translation: Graun bai i mas dividim long ka; olgeta bai kisim inheretans bilong ol, strongim namel bilong tribe bilong papa na mama bilong ol.

original: Each inheritance is to be divided by lot among the larger and smaller tribes.”
translation: Olgreta inheritens bai i go daun long lot, na olgeta clan, bikpela na liklik, oli share.

original: Now these were the Levites numbered by their clans: The Gershonite clan from Gershon, the Kohathite clan from Kohath, and the Merarite clan from Merari.
translation: Na ol Levites i kamapim olgeta long kaunt, longpela klan bilong ol: Klan Gershonite ikam long Gershon, clan Kohathite ikam long Kohath, na clan Merarite ikam long Merari.

original: These were the families of the Levites: The Libnite clan, the Hebronite clan, the Mahlite clan, the Mushite clan, and the Korahite clan. Now Kohath was the father of Amram,
translation: Ol i bikpela famili bilong Levaiti: ol Libnait, ol Hebroni, ol Mahalai, ol Musi, na ol Korahi. Na Kohat em papa bilong Amran.

original: and Amram’s wife was named Jochebed. She was also a daughter of Levi, born to Levi in Egypt. To Amram she bore Aaron, Moses, and their sister Miriam.
translation: Meri bilong Amram i kolim Jochebed. Em i dai bilong Levi, em i kamap long Aihipti tasol bilong Levi. Na Jochebed i karim bek long Amram, na em i banisim Aaron, Moses, na susa bilong ol, Miriam.

original: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar were born to Aaron,
translation: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, na Ithamar i kamap long tumbuna Aaron.

original: but Nadab and Abihu died when they offered unauthorized fire before the LORD.
translation: Nadab na Abihu i dai pinis long taim ol i bringim faya we em i no laik bifoa Papa God.

original: The registration of the Levites totaled 23,000, every male a month old or more; they were not numbered among the other Israelites, because no inheritance was given to them among the Israelites.
translation: Rijister long ol Levait i kamap 23,000, ol man husat i gat mun em i go long moning na i go antap; ol i no inap kisim namba wantaim narepela Israelites, bikos nogat ples ikam long ol long inekeisim ples bilong Israelites.

original: These were the ones numbered by Moses and Eleazar the priest when they counted the Israelites on the plains of Moab by the Jordan, across from Jericho.
translation: Ol i bin kantriim nau, ol ia i go pinis, Moses na Eleazar priis i bin kantriim Israel long plais bilong Moab, lonsg Jordan, antap long Jeriko.

original: Among all these, however, there was not one who had been numbered by Moses and Aaron the priest when they counted the Israelites in the Wilderness of Sinai.
translation: Long olgeta dispela, i no gat wan yet long ol dispela we Mosis na Aron pries ili bin kauntim wewan oli bin kauntim Israel long Wilerness bilong Sinai.

original: For the LORD had told them that they would surely die in the wilderness. Not one was left except Caleb son of Jephunneh and Joshua son of Nun.
translation: Papa God i tokim ol: ol bai dai olgeta long bus. No wan i stap, bek tasol Kalebu sapi Jefune na Josaia sapi Nun.

original: Now the daughters of Zelophehad son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, belonged to the clans of Manasseh son of Joseph. These were the names of his daughters: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah. They approached
translation: Na ol meri bilong Zelophehad, pikinini bilong Hepa, pikinini bilong Gilead, pikinini bilong Makir, pikinini bilong Manasseh, ol i bilong clan bilong Manasseh, pikinini bilong Joseph. Dispela em i nem bilong ol meri bilong en: Mahla, Noa, Hogla, Milka, na Tirza. Ol i kam klostu.

original: the entrance to the Tent of Meeting, stood before Moses, Eleazar the priest, the leaders, and the whole congregation, and said,
translation: I stap bifor entris long Haus Bilong Miting, Moses, Eleaza priis, ol bikpela man, na lotu ol i stap, na ol i tok,

original: “Our father died in the wilderness, but he was not among the followers of Korah who gathered together against the LORD. Instead, he died because of his own sin, and he had no sons.
translation: Papa bilong mipela i dai long bus, tasol em i no stap wantaim ol folowa bilong Korah ol i kam togeta againstim Bikpela. Em i dai bikos em i mekim hevi long en himself, na em i no gat pikinini man.

original: Why should the name of our father disappear from his clan because he had no sons? Give us property among our father’s brothers.”
translation: Nupela nem bilong papa bilong mipela i no inap lus pinis long clan bilong em bikos em i no gat suk, Givim mipela gras long ol bratha bilong papa bilong mipela.

original: So Moses brought their case before the LORD,
translation: Na Moses i bringim kes bilong ol long hap bilong LORD,

original: and the LORD answered him,
translation: Na Bikpela i tokim em,

original: “The daughters of Zelophehad speak correctly. You certainly must give them property as an inheritance among their father’s brothers, and transfer their father’s inheritance to them.
translation: Oli meri bilong Zelophehad i tok stret. Yus, bai yumui givim olgeta ples long ol meri olsem ineritans, na salim ineritans bilong papa bilong ol long ol, em namel long brata bilong papa bilong ol.

original: Furthermore, you shall say to the Israelites, ‘If a man dies and leaves no son, you are to transfer his inheritance to his daughter.
translation: Yu mas tokim ol Israel, 'I sapos man i dai na i no lusim bek son, baimbai em bai givim lo bilong en long pikinini meri.

original: If he has no daughter, give his inheritance to his brothers.
translation: Sapos em i no go hed pikinini wan meri, givim olgeta propati bilong en long ol brata bilong en.

original: If he has no brothers, give his inheritance to his father’s brothers.
translation: Sapos em i no gat brata, givim inheretans bilong en long brata bilong papa bilong en.

original: And if his father has no brothers, give his inheritance to the next of kin from his clan, that he may take possession of it. This is to be a statutory ordinance for the Israelites, as the LORD has commanded Moses.’”
translation: Na sapos papa bilong em i no gat brata, givim inheritasin bilong em long nambawan wantok bilong clan bilong em, ole em inap kisim na bungim. Dispela em i go be loa bilong Israel, olsem Bikpela i tokim Mosis.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses, “Go up this mountain of the Abarim range and see the land that I have given the Israelites.
translation: Na Lod i tokim Mosese, “Go ap long maunten ia bilong Abarim renj na lukim kantri we mi givim long pisin Israel.”

original: After you have seen it, you too will be gathered to your people, as your brother Aaron was;
translation: Bihaenim yu harim, yu yet tu bai kam bek long ples bilong yu, olsem brata Aaron bilong yu.

original: for when the congregation contended in the Wilderness of Zin, both of you rebelled against My command to show My holiness in their sight regarding the waters.” Those were the waters of Meribah in Kadesh, in the Wilderness of Zin.
translation: Wanpela taim asosiasi i bagarap insait long Wilanes bilong Zin, yupela i stap agensim komanda bilong mi, bai mi showim saintnes bilong mi long tok bilong wata. Wata bilong Meribah em i stap long Kadesh, insait long Wilanes bilong Zin.

original: So Moses appealed to the LORD,
translation: Na Mosis i kirapim long LORD,

original: “May the LORD, the God of the spirits of all flesh, appoint a man over the congregation
translation: Mai Lod, God bilong spirit bilong ol bodi, i appointim man wan long lidim asamble.

original: who will go out and come in before them, and who will lead them out and bring them in, so that the congregation of the LORD will not be like sheep without a shepherd.”
translation: Husat bai go aut na kam insait bifor ol, na husat bai lekim ol i go na bringim ol i kam, bilong mekim assembli bilong LORD i no olsem sip bilong sheep i no gat pasta?

original: And the LORD replied to Moses, “Take Joshua son of Nun, a man with the Spirit in him, and lay your hands on him.
translation: Na Papa God i tok bek long Moses, “Kisim Jusua, pikinini bilong Nun, man i gat Spiriti i stap inside em, na putim han bilong yu long em.

original: Have him stand before Eleazar the priest and the whole congregation, and commission him in their sight.
translation: Mekim em i stap long Eleaza pries na kongresen, na givim em wok long ai bilong ol.

original: Confer on him some of your authority, so that the whole congregation of Israel will obey him.
translation: Givim i kam bek long yu, i go het long em autoriti, na olgeta asamble bilong Israel bai harim i go.

original: He shall stand before Eleazar the priest, who will seek counsel for him before the LORD by the judgment of the Urim. At his command, he and all the Israelites with him—the entire congregation—will go out and come in.”
translation: Em bai stap bifor Eleazar prist, na em bai sakim tok bilong konsel long en bilong Bikpela long rul bilong Urim. Long komando bilong em, em na olgeta Pipol Israel yangpela wantaim em – kongregesen olgeta – bai go aut na kam insait.

original: Moses did as the LORD had commanded him. He took Joshua, had him stand before Eleazar the priest and the whole congregation,
translation: Moses wokim olsem Ol Mak i bin givim em tok. Em kisim Josa, em putim i stan bifor Eleasa ole pries na ol pipol i go daun,

original: and laid his hands on him and commissioned him, as the LORD had instructed through Moses.
translation: Na em i pasim han bilong en long em, em i givim autoriti long em, olsem Jehovah i tokim Moses.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Command the Israelites and say to them: See that you present to Me at its appointed time the food for My offerings by fire, as a pleasing aroma to Me.
translation: Iusim tok bilong ol Israel na tokim ol: Lukim, bai yumui bringim long mi long taim we mi appointim maten bilong ai givim na ka bilong faya, olsem smel i kamap strong na swit long mi.

original: And tell them that this is the offering made by fire you are to present to the LORD as a regular burnt offering each day: two unblemished year-old male lambs.
translation: Tokim ol, dispela em ofa bilong faia yu mas bringim i go long LORD oltaim long dikeni: tu ram na malem 12 mons, i gat klostu, nogat birua.

original: Offer one lamb in the morning and the other at twilight,
translation: Ofa wanpela liklik bulum long moning na namba tu long belo san,

original: along with a tenth of an ephah of fine flour as a grain offering, mixed with a quarter hin of oil from pressed olives.
translation: Wantaim tenth blo ephah blo flour i go we, olsem grain ofering, mixim wantaim quarter hin blo oil husait i kam long oliv pipia i pres.

original: This is a regular burnt offering established at Mount Sinai as a pleasing aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
translation: Em i ofing bung bilong saksak long maunt Sinani, olsem smel i kamap strong, ofing i mekim olsem ai bilong bikpela.

original: The drink offering accompanying each lamb shall be a quarter hin. Pour out the offering of fermented drink to the LORD in the sanctuary area.
translation: Kaikai bilong ofing i go wantaim ol narapela lam, em i go bek quarter hin. Pilim dringol strongpela i go daun long hap graun bilong Lotu, ol i givim long Bikpela.

original: And offer the second lamb at twilight, with the same grain offering and drink offering as in the morning. It is an offering made by fire, a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
translation: Na givim sekend lamb long taem san i go daun, wantaim samting bilong kaikai ofing na dring ofing olsem long moning. Em i ofing we i kuk olsem paia, smel i kamap strong na liklik long LORD.

original: On the Sabbath day, present two unblemished year-old male lambs, accompanied by a grain offering of two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil, as well as a drink offering.
translation: Long dei Sabat, kisim tu male lambs we i no go long yia, ol i nambawan klostu, na ol i no bin gat skirapim, wantaim ofa bilong ka, em i two-tenths bilong efah bilong flauer bilong gude imiks long oil, na tu ofa bilong dring.

original: This is the burnt offering for every Sabbath, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.
translation: Em i ofa bilong bun long ol sabat, aplus long ofa bilong bun we ili stap wantaim kaikai bilong dringim.

original: At the beginning of every month, you are to present to the LORD a burnt offering of two young bulls, one ram, and seven male lambs a year old, all unblemished,
translation: Long moning bai i kam, yupela mas bringim ofa bilong bun em i go long LORD, iki bulmakau i no save long taim, wanpela ram, na seven ol pikinini makau man we i gat wonpela yia, ol i nogat birua.

original: along with three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering with each bull, two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering with the ram,
translation: Olsem na tri-tenths bilong ephah blo finis flauer, miks wantaim oyl olsem grain ofering wanpela long ol bul, tu-tenths bilong ephah blo finis flauer, miks wantaim oyl olsem grain ofering wanpela long ram.

original: and a tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering with each lamb. This is a burnt offering, a pleasing aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
translation: Na taipela desep na ephah bilong painim finis flawa ibin mixim wantaim oil olsem grain ofing long ol lak, dispela em i ofing bai i go daun, em i givim smel bilong switpela arapela, ofing ibin mekim long paia long LORD.

original: Their drink offerings shall be half a hin of wine with each bull, a third of a hin with the ram, and a quarter hin with each lamb. This is the monthly burnt offering to be made at each new moon throughout the year.
translation: Ofa bilong dring bai i stap, na em i mas kontainim hap halfrim wain wantaim bulmakau, tripod hin wantaim ram, na kwata hin wantaim lamb. Dispela em ofa bilong bun i mekim long mun wel, na bai yumi mekim long dispela de bilong nupela mun olgeta taim long yia.

original: In addition to the regular burnt offering with its drink offering, one male goat is to be presented to the LORD as a sin offering.
translation: Olsem na i kam long hap, bai yu mas bringim ofa bilong sin long Holi Spirit bilong Jehovah, wanpela male goat bilong man, longsaed wantaim ofa em i go daun oltaim na ofa bilong dringim.

original: The fourteenth day of the first month is the LORD’s Passover.
translation: De fourtin dei bilong monin em i kam i bikos Pasova bilong LORD.

original: On the fifteenth day of this month, there shall be a feast; for seven days unleavened bread is to be eaten.
translation: Long fifteenth dei bilong mun em, ol i mas kam na kaikai bilong ples; na long seven dei, bai yumai i go long kaikai bun.

original: On the first day there is to be a sacred assembly; you must not do any regular work.
translation: Long monding de bilong em, bai i gat ples bilong Maman; yupela no ken wok bilong tede.

original: Present to the LORD an offering made by fire, a burnt offering of two young bulls, one ram, and seven male lambs a year old, all unblemished.
translation: Presen i go long LORD ofa bilong wok bilong faia, ofa em i pakim olsem bun, tu bulmakau i kamap yet, wan ram na seven male lambs we i gat wan yia, ol i no gat kain kain birua nogut.

original: The grain offering shall consist of fine flour mixed with oil; offer three-tenths of an ephah with each bull, two-tenths of an ephah with the ram,
translation: Ofa bilong graun bai kamap long flauer nais mixim wantaim oil; ofa long ol bulmakau bai tres-tenths ofah, ofa long ol ram bai tu-tenths ofah.

original: and a tenth of an ephah with each of the seven lambs.
translation: na taen desimal blo ephah wantaim olgeta seven lambs.

original: Include one male goat as a sin offering to make atonement for you.
translation: Putim wanpela male goat olsem ofing bicom sin bilong yu, na bai peisim bikim yu rait gen.

original: You are to present these in addition to the regular morning burnt offering.
translation: Yu mas bringim dispela long stap long ofa bilong moning we yu mekim bilong bungim ol samting i go daun.

original: Offer the same food each day for seven days as an offering made by fire, a pleasing aroma to the LORD. It is to be offered with its drink offering and the regular burnt offering.
translation: Givim sampela kaikai olsem yet long dispela de, long sevenpela de, olsem ofing bai kamap na i go het long LORD, na i kamap strong long LORD olsem switpela smell. Em bai i go wantaim dring bai em i go long en, na ol bikpela ofing we yumi mas mekim belo.

original: On the seventh day you shall hold a sacred assembly; you must not do any regular work.
translation: Long dei sevhen, yumui mas husait i go stap long miting bilong lotu; yumui no ken wok long wok bilong dei.

original: On the day of firstfruits, when you present an offering of new grain to the LORD during the Feast of Weeks, you are to hold a sacred assembly; you must not do any regular work.
translation: Long de dai bilong fest bilong krai i kam, wokim ofing bilong nupela kai go long LORD long taim bilong Fest bilong Wiks, yu mas holim bigpela miting bilong spirut; yu no ken mekim wok bilong dei.

original: Present a burnt offering of two young bulls, one ram, and seven male lambs a year old as a pleasing aroma to the LORD,
translation: Kisim ka na wasim tu bulmakau i no big yet, wanpela ram, na sebmale lambs i no long taim yet, ol i gat wanpela yia olsem, na usim ol long wok bilong sakrifis, olsem samting i kamap strong long nose bilong LORD.

original: together with their grain offerings of fine flour mixed with oil—three-tenths of an ephah with each bull, two-tenths of an ephah with the ram,
translation: Wantaim ka moninga bilong ol, hus flour finis mixim na ol i gat oili - three-tenths efaa wantaim bikpela bulmakau, two-tenths efaa wantaim rami.

original: and a tenth of an ephah with each of the seven lambs.
translation: Na wan desim na efa i go wantaim wispela lamb seven ol.

original: Include one male goat to make atonement for you.
translation: Inklusim wanpela male bikpela goat olsem bai mekim peis long sin bilong yu.

original: Offer them with their drink offerings in addition to the regular burnt offering and its grain offering. The animals must be unblemished.
translation: Ofimo wantaim ofa bilong ol i kam long narapela saklem pasin bai i go hap, olgeta saklem i wok long taim bifo, na saklem bilong ka, na ofa bilong dringim. Ol animals i mas no gat skrap na i kamap strong.

original: “On the first day of the seventh month, you are to hold a sacred assembly, and you must not do any regular work. This will be a day for you to sound the trumpets.
translation: Long monding bilong seventh mun, kem olgeta long miting bilong saint, na yu no ken wok nabaut. Dei bilong yu ol i save soundim trambul.

original: As a pleasing aroma to the LORD, you are to present a burnt offering of one young bull, one ram, and seven male lambs a year old, all unblemished,
translation: Olsem won smel i kamap strong long LORD, yu mas bringim ofing bung bilong bren: wanpela bulmakau i no long taim, i strong yet, wanpela ram, na seven male pik ol i gat wanpela yia, ol i no gat strepela kain pasin, i gat gutpela sindaun.

original: together with their grain offerings of fine flour mixed with oil—three-tenths of an ephah with the bull, two-tenths of an ephah with the ram,
translation: Wantaim ka moninga bilong ol, bilong powa finpela i miksim wantaim oil, tri-tenths ephah i go wantaim bulmakau, tu-tenths ephah i go wantaim ram.

original: and a tenth of an ephah with each of the seven male lambs.
translation: Na wan tent o f epa i go wantaim ol sevxn malol bikman ya.

original: Include one male goat as a sin offering to make atonement for you.
translation: Kamapim wanpela male goat olsem ofing bilong sin long mekim peis long yu.

original: These are in addition to the monthly and daily burnt offerings with their prescribed grain offerings and drink offerings. They are a pleasing aroma, an offering made by fire to the LORD.
translation: Dispela ol i go longlong ol i go, olsem na ofa bilong bun, ofa bilong ka, na ofa bilong wara, we i go long mun na dei, olgeta i kamap smel i kamap strong na swit moa long Bikpela, olsem ofa we i go long paia.

original: On the tenth day of this seventh month, you are to hold a sacred assembly, and you shall humble yourselves; you must not do any work.
translation: Long namba ten dei bilong dispela sevenc mondh, mipela mas kam tu olgeta long wankain dei i go long bikpela miting bilong God, na yupela mas bikim yuself i go daun, no holim het bilong yuself, na yupela no ken warkim wok igo.

original: Present as a pleasing aroma to the LORD a burnt offering of one young bull, one ram, and seven male lambs a year old, all unblemished,
translation: Bikpela, yu bringim ofa bilong kotim ol samting i go daun long paia olsem swit moa long nus, wanpela bulmakau i no big yet, wanpela mak bilong male, na sevenpela pikinini bulmakau man ol i gat wanpela yia, ol gutpela na isip long bodi.

original: together with their grain offerings of fine flour mixed with oil—three-tenths of an ephah with the bull, two-tenths of an ephah with the ram,
translation: Wantaim ol ka moninga bilong ol, ka moninga naispela i miksim wantaim oil, ol i bringim: long bulmakau, tri-tenths ofan ephah, na long ram, tu-tenths ofan ephah.

original: and a tenth of an ephah with each of the seven lambs.
translation: na hap ten bilong efaha wantaim olgeta seven lambs.

original: Include one male goat for a sin offering, in addition to the sin offering of atonement and the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offerings.
translation: Putim wanpela male goat i go long sin ofing, longsait long ofing bai i kam bek gen, na ofing em i stap, wantaim ofing bilong graun na ofing bilong wara.

original: On the fifteenth day of the seventh month, you are to hold a sacred assembly; you must not do any regular work, and you shall observe a feast to the LORD for seven days.
translation: Long fifteenth de bilong seventh mun, yu mas Mekim assembli santing; yu no ken mekim wok bilong yu yet, na yu mas kisim kaikai bilong halivim long Bikpela, na halivim olsem long seven de.

original: As a pleasing aroma to the LORD, you are to present an offering made by fire, a burnt offering of thirteen young bulls, two rams, and fourteen male lambs a year old, all unblemished,
translation: Olsem won smel i kamap strong long LORD, yu mas putim ofing we yu mekim long paia, ofing em i go daun long paia, em i bikos thirteen bulmakau i pikinini, ram i bikpela tu, na fourteen lep i man i pikinini, ol i gat wan yia, olgeta i stap strong, no bin gat ples.

original: along with the grain offering of three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil with each of the thirteen bulls, two-tenths of an ephah with each of the two rams,
translation: Olsem wan na ofa bilong graun, long tripela-tenths bilong efa blo finespala flour ibin mixim wantaim oil, wantaim olgeta thirteen bulmakau, na tu-tenths bilong efa wantaim olgeta tu ram.

original: and a tenth of an ephah with each of the fourteen lambs.
translation: Na wanpela ten bilong efaha i go wantaim ol kamap fourteen lambs.

original: Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.
translation: Putim wanpela male goat olsem ofing bilong sin, longpa moninga na bungim ol samting bilong ofing em i stap, wannem na planti grain bilong ofing na dring bilong ofing.

original: On the second day you are to present twelve young bulls, two rams, and fourteen male lambs a year old, all unblemished,
translation: Long nambawan de, yu mas presentim twelve bulmakau i no long taim, tu ram, na fourteen liklik bulmakau man i go strong, olgeta i go strong, na i no gat birua.

original: along with the grain and drink offerings for the bulls, rams, and lambs, according to the number prescribed.
translation: Wantaim grain na dring ofring long bulmakau, ram, na lamb, olsem nem bilong kaunt.

original: Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.
translation: Putim wanpela male goat olsem sin ofing, longsait long regula bun burnim ofing, wantiem grain ofing na dring ofing.

original: On the third day you are to present eleven bulls, two rams, and fourteen male lambs a year old, all unblemished,
translation: Long dei thri, yu mas bringim eleben bulmakau, tu ram, na fohtin male pik ol i stap wan yia, ol gutpela na is.

original: along with the grain and drink offerings for the bulls, rams, and lambs, according to the number prescribed.
translation: Wantaim long gran na draun ofrings bilong bulmakau, rams, na lambs, olsem namba i save prescription.

original: Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.
translation: Putim wanpela male goat olsem sin ofing, longsait long regula bun burnt ofing wantaim grain ofing na dring ofing bilong en.

original: On the fourth day you are to present ten bulls, two rams, and fourteen male lambs a year old, all unblemished,
translation: Long dei foa, yu mas presentim ten bulmakau, tu ram, na fourteen male pik i go strong, olgeta i no bin gat kranki,

original: along with the grain and drink offerings for the bulls, rams, and lambs, according to the number prescribed.
translation: Wanpela tasol long grain na dring ofrings bilong bulmakau, ram, na lamb, olsem nau namba i preskraibim.

original: Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.
translation: Inim goet man i kam olsem ofing bilong sin, longpinga long taim bilong ofing bilong bun wantaim planti ofing na ofing bilong wara.

original: On the fifth day you are to present nine bulls, two rams, and fourteen male lambs a year old, all unblemished,
translation: Long namba faiv dei, yu mas kam bekimol naunpela bulmakau, tupela ram, na fotelin male pik ol i go long yia, ol i nogat birua.

original: along with the grain and drink offerings for the bulls, rams, and lambs, according to the number prescribed.
translation: Wantaim ka moninga na dring bung bilong ofa bilong bulmakau, ram, na lamb, olsem namba i save stap long tok bilong.

original: Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.
translation: Putim wanpela male goat olsem ofa bilong sin, longsaide ofa bilong bun em i go olsem oltaim wantaim ofa bilong graun na ofa bilong wara.

original: On the sixth day you are to present eight bulls, two rams, and fourteen male lambs a year old, all unblemished,
translation: Long dei sikis, yu mas presentim eyt bulmakau, tu ram, na fourteen ol pikinini bulmakau man we i gat wan yia, ol gutpela na nogut birua.

original: along with the grain and drink offerings for the bulls, rams, and lambs, according to the number prescribed.
translation: Olgeta wantaim ofa bilong bulmakau, ram, na lamb, na dring ofa, olsem numbus i preskraibim.

original: Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.
translation: Putim wanpela male goat olsem sin ofing, longsait long regula bun burnim ofing, wantaim grain ofing na dring ofing bilong en.

original: On the seventh day you are to present seven bulls, two rams, and fourteen male lambs a year old, all unblemished,
translation: Long Sabad yu mas bringim seven bulmakau, tu ram, na fourteen kakaruk bilong man we ol i gat wanpela yia, ol gutpela.

original: along with the grain and drink offerings for the bulls, rams, and lambs, according to the number prescribed.
translation: Wantaim long graun na draun ofrings bilong bulmakau, rams, na lambs, olsem numba i save preskraibim.

original: Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.
translation: Putim wanpela male goat olsem sin ofring, plasa long regular baren ofring, wantaim grain ofring na dring ofring bilong en.

original: On the eighth day you are to hold a solemn assembly; you must not do any regular work.
translation: Long nait bilong eigth, yumi mas lukautim assembli bikpela; yupela no ken wok bilong dei.

original: As a pleasing aroma to the LORD, you are to present an offering made by fire, a burnt offering of one bull, one ram, and seven male lambs a year old, all unblemished,
translation: Olsem switpela smel i kamap long Bikpela, yu mas bringim ofing we bilong faia, ofing we i paul ai, wanpela bulmakau, wanpela ram, na seven ol male pik we i gat wanpela yia, ol i gat strepela kulim, nogat narapela kul.

original: along with the grain and drink offerings for the bulls, rams, and lambs, according to the number prescribed.
translation: Kaikai na dring bung long namel, olsem bulmakau, ram, na lamb, i go wantaim, olsem numbus we ripot i mekim.

original: Include one male goat as a sin offering, in addition to the regular burnt offering with its grain offering and drink offering.
translation: Kamapim wanpela male goat olsem sin ofing, plasa long regula bun burnin ofing, wantaem grain ofing na drink ofing bilong en.

original: You are to present these offerings to the LORD at your appointed times, in addition to your vow and freewill offerings, whether burnt offerings, grain offerings, drink offerings, or peace offerings.”
translation: Yu mas bringim desplai dispela ol ofa long GOD long taim yu tokem, plauns long tok ples bilong yu na ofa bilong yu frei wokim, em i inkludim ofa bilong burnim ol samting, ofa bilong ka, ofa bilong wara, na ofa bilong peis.

original: So Moses spoke all this to the Israelites just as the LORD had commanded him.
translation: Na Mosis i tokim olgeta dispela stori long ol Israel, olsem Yahweh i bin givim em tok.

original: Then Moses said to the heads of the tribes of Israel, “This is what the LORD has commanded:
translation: Na Moses i tokim ol hed bilong ol traib bilong Israel, "Olsem Bikpela i givim komando:"

original: If a man makes a vow to the LORD or swears an oath to obligate himself by a pledge, he must not break his word; he must do everything he has promised.
translation: I makim promis long LORD, o i nus pinis olegisien long pledji bilong en yet, i no ken lusim tok bilong en; i mas mekim olgeta samting em i promis.

original: And if a woman in her father’s house during her youth makes a vow to the LORD or obligates herself by a pledge,
translation: Na sipos meri i stap long haus bilong papa bilong en long taim em i yus yet, na em i mekim vot long Bikpela o em i birua yet olsem promis,

original: and her father hears about her vow or pledge but says nothing to her, then all the vows or pledges by which she has bound herself shall stand.
translation: Na papa bilong em i harim tok bilong em yet long promis, tasol i no tokim em yet, orait olsem, ol promis ya bai i stap, na ol undertaking ya em bai i holim yumi yet long em.

original: But if her father prohibits her on the day he hears about it, then none of the vows or pledges by which she has bound herself shall stand. The LORD will absolve her because her father has prohibited her.
translation: Sapos papa bilong em i stap agensim long de em i harim tok bilong em, ol sel bilong em o obligesen bilong em bai no inap kamap. Bikpela i go bekim em bikos papa bilong em i stap agensim.

original: If a woman marries while under a vow or rash promise by which she has bound herself,
translation: Igat meri i marit wantaim promis, o meri i mekim promis i go bek long hed, olgeta samting em i bin holim em yet, em bai i stap long kastom bilong marit.

original: and her husband hears of it but says nothing to her on that day, then the vows or pledges by which she has bound herself shall stand.
translation: Na husban bilong em harim tok, tasol em i no tokim em long de bikos, orait ol promis na ol plegis we em i bin mekim bai i stap.

original: But if her husband prohibits her when he hears of it, he nullifies the vow that binds her or the rash promise she has made, and the LORD will absolve her.
translation: Bai sapos husband bilong em i stap agensim wanpela taim em i harim, em i rausim tok bilong promis, olsem na tok harom strong na i go long wei bilong bikim we em i mekim, na LORD bai givim em fri long sin.

original: Every vow a widow or divorced woman pledges to fulfill is binding on her.
translation: Olkain kaikai bilong promis meri husat i bin lusim husband o i bin divos bilong en, em i tokaut long en, olgeta samting em i tokaut bung wantaim em, em i bikim kamap, na em i strong long en.

original: If a woman in her husband’s house has made a vow or put herself under an obligation with an oath,
translation: Meri i stap insait long haus bilong husband, em i mekim promis oa tok bokis, em i bin putim yuself underneath obbigesen long tok bokis,

original: and her husband hears of it but says nothing to her and does not prohibit her, then all the vows or pledges by which she has bound herself shall stand.
translation: Na husban bilong em harim tok, tasol em i no tokim em, na em i no stopim em, orait ol promis na ol samting em i bin mekim bilong em yet long em bai i stap.

original: But if her husband nullifies them on the day he hears of them, then nothing that came from her lips, whether her vows or pledges, shall stand. Her husband has nullified them, and the LORD will absolve her.
translation: Bai husban bai ken nullim ol tok bilong meri long de em harim, na notin i kam long maus bilong meri, aiya tok bilong hart oa promis, bai stap. Husban bai nullim olsem, na Bikpela bai givim meri fri long sin.

original: Her husband may confirm or nullify any vow or any sworn pledge to deny herself.
translation: Husband bilong meri em inap konfirmim o kanelim ol sel bilong en, ol pleg bilong en i tok strong long kam bikim em i no inap.

original: But if her husband says nothing to her from day to day, then he confirms all the vows and pledges that bind her. He has confirmed them, because he said nothing to her on the day he heard about them.
translation: Sapos husban bilong em i no tok long em ol dei bihain ol dei, em bai igatim strong ol promis na samting em i pomois long mekim. Em igatim ol dispela, bikos em i no bin givim wod long em long de bilong em harim ol dispela.

original: But if he nullifies them after he hears of them, then he will bear her iniquity.”
translation: Barewa em i rausim ol sapos em i harim tok bilong ol, orait em bai kisim bikhet long en.

original: These are the statutes that the LORD commanded Moses concerning the relationship between a man and his wife, and between a father and a young daughter still in his home.
translation: Dispela ol lo bilong Pikinini i kam long LORD i givim tok long Mosese, em i tok long relisen bilong man wantaim meri, bitwin man na meri bilong em, na bitwin papa na pikinini gel bilong em i stap yet long haus bilong papa.

original: And the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Bikpela i tok long Moses,

original: “Take vengeance on the Midianites for the Israelites. After that, you will be gathered to your people.”
translation: Givim pekpek long ol Midian long ol Israel. Bihaen long dispela, na yu kamap ikam daun long ol arapela pisin bilong yu.

original: So Moses told the people, “Arm some of your men for war, that they may go against the Midianites and execute the LORD’s vengeance on them.
translation: Moses i tokim ol pipol, "Kisim sampela man bilong yu na arm ol long faet, oli go bek gen long Midian na wokim venjesen bilong LORD long ol."

original: Send into battle a thousand men from each tribe of Israel.”
translation: Sindim go long fait wan thousand man bilong bek wara tribe bilong Israel.

original: So a thousand men were recruited from each tribe of Israel—twelve thousand armed for war.
translation: Wan tasen man i go kam long ol clan bilong Israel, ol i skulim, na twelve tasen man i kisim weapon bilong fait.

original: And Moses sent the thousand from each tribe into battle, along with Phinehas son of Eleazar the priest, who took with him the vessels of the sanctuary and the trumpets for signaling.
translation: Na Mosese salim thousand long ol tribe go kamap long pait, wantaim Finehas sut bilong Eleaza prist, em i kisim vessel bilong hap tambu na trampet bilong singautim i go wantaim ol.

original: Then they waged war against Midian, as the LORD had commanded Moses, and they killed every male.
translation: Ol i wari i kam bek long Midian, olsem Jehovah i tokim Mosis, na ol i kilim ol man husat i bin stap.

original: Among the slain were Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, and Reba—the five kings of Midian. They also killed Balaam son of Beor with the sword.
translation: Long ol pipel i dai finis, em i Evi, Rekem, Zur, Hur, na Reba – faiv kings bilong Midian. Ol i kilim Balaam pikinini bilong Beor wantaim sword.

original: The Israelites captured the Midianite women and their children, and they plundered all their herds, flocks, and goods.
translation: Olia Israel i kisim meri na pikinini bilong Ol Midian, na ol i bagarapim olgeta ol bulmakau, ol pik, na ol samting bilong ol.

original: Then they burned all the cities where the Midianites had lived, as well as all their encampments,
translation: Na ol i brenim ol ples bilong ol Midianitis we ol i stap, na ol pati bilong ol yet.

original: and carried away all the plunder and spoils, both people and animals.
translation: Na oli kisim i go long wei olgeta lo bilong war na ol samting bilong winim, ol manmeri na ol animals.

original: They brought the captives, spoils, and plunder to Moses, to Eleazar the priest, and to the congregation of Israel at the camp on the plains of Moab, by the Jordan across from Jericho.
translation: Ol i bringim ol prisen, ol samting em i winim, na plunda long Mosese, long Eleaza priester, na long kongresion bilong Israel long ples kamp long plaen bilong Moab, long sait bilong Jordan, long hap tasol bilong Jeriko.

original: And Moses, Eleazar the priest, and all the leaders of the congregation went to meet them outside the camp.
translation: Na Moses, Eleazar prist, na bikman bilong ol i stap antap long komuniti, ol i go bekim ol long wei ousait long ples bilong ol.

original: But Moses was angry with the officers of the army—the commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds—who were returning from the battle.
translation: Mosis i las long ofisa bilong army, ol bos bilong tausen na bos bilong handet, husat i kam bek gen long bikpela faet.

original: “Have you spared all the women?” he asked them.
translation: Em i askim ol, "Yu katim ol meri yet?"

original: “Look, these women caused the sons of Israel, through the counsel of Balaam, to turn unfaithfully against the LORD at Peor, so that the plague struck the congregation of the LORD.
translation: Susu, ol meri dispela i mekim ol piken bilong Isrel, long tok bilong Balaam, i bikim bagarap agensim Bikpela long Peor, na pestim i kamap, i kilim planti manmeri long congeregashen bilong Bikpela.

original: So now, kill all the boys, as well as every woman who has had relations with a man,
translation: Nau, kilim olgeta manmeri, na ol meri husat i gat expeiriens wantaim man.

original: but spare for yourselves every girl who has never had relations with a man.
translation: Bai yu yet savem ol meri ol i no gat save long man, ol i no gat husban.

original: All of you who have killed a person or touched the dead are to remain outside the camp for seven days. On the third day and the seventh day you are to purify both yourselves and your captives.
translation: Yupela olgeta husat i kilim man o meri o tachim ol dai pinis, yupela i mas stap outsaid long ples fo seven dei. Long dei namba tri na dei namba seven, yupela i mas purifaim yuself yet na purifaim ol priseni bilong yu.

original: And purify every garment and leather good, everything made of goat’s hair, and every article of wood.”
translation: Na mekim ol klos i klia, mekim ol samting long letha i klia, ol samting we i wokim long hari bilong goat, na ol samting we i wokim long diwai.

original: Then Eleazar the priest said to the soldiers who had gone into battle, “This is the statute of the law which the LORD has commanded Moses:
translation: Na Eleaza pries i tok olsem long ol solda we i go lusim na go fait, “Dispela em i lo bilong statut long laip we Bikpela i givim Moses:

original: Only the gold, silver, bronze, iron, tin, and lead—
translation: Gołd, silva, bronz, aian, tini, na li – Metal bilong em tasol

original: everything that can withstand the fire—must be put through the fire, and it will be clean. But it must still be purified with the water of purification. And everything that cannot withstand the fire must pass through the water.
translation: Olgeta samting we i mas holim strong long paia, mas go insait long paia, na bai i kamap klia, tasol inap yet long papia klia wantaim wata bilong klia. Na olgeta samting we no inap holim strong long paia, mas go daun insait long wata.

original: On the seventh day you are to wash your clothes, and you will be clean. After that you may enter the camp.”
translation: Long nambor seven de, yu mas wasim klos blong yu, na yu bai kamap kleen. Bihaen long dispela, yu ken go insait long ples kamp.

original: The LORD said to Moses,
translation: Bikpela i tok long Moses,

original: “You and Eleazar the priest and the family heads of the congregation are to take a count of what was captured, both of man and beast.
translation: Yu na Eleazar pries na ol bic head bilong lotu, bai yu i go kisim namba bilong ol samting ol i bin kisim, na ol manmeri na ol animol.

original: Then divide the captives between the troops who went out to battle and the rest of the congregation.
translation: Then givim prisen long ol solder na ol i go aut long faet, na ol arapela long asamble.

original: Set aside a tribute for the LORD from what belongs to the soldiers who went into battle: one out of every five hundred, whether persons, cattle, donkeys, or sheep.
translation: Putim asi wanpela tokana moni bilong LORD long ol samting ol solja i kisim long taim bilong wik: wanpela long ole five hundred, ol man, bulmakau, donki, o sip.

original: Take it from their half and give it to Eleazar the priest as an offering to the LORD.
translation: Tilim i go long hap bilong ol, givim i long Eleazar prist olsem wanpela ofing long Jehovah.

original: From the Israelites’ half, take one out of every fifty, whether persons, cattle, donkeys, sheep, or other animals, and give them to the Levites who keep charge of the tabernacle of the LORD.”
translation: Long hap bilong Israel, kisim wan bilong fifty, ol manmeri, bulmakau, donki, sheep, na animal narak, givim ol i go long Levait ol i lukautim tabenakl bilong LORD.

original: So Moses and Eleazar the priest did as the LORD had commanded Moses,
translation: Na Moses na Eleazar pries i mekim olgeta samting olsem LORD i givim komando long Moses.

original: and this plunder remained from the spoils the soldiers had taken: 675,000 sheep,
translation: Na dispela pilim i stap yet: sip 675,000 ol i bin kisim long moni bilong win soja.

original: 72,000 cattle,
translation: Seventi tu tusen bulmakau

original: 61,000 donkeys,
translation: Siksis Tausan wan donki

original: and 32,000 women who had not slept with a man.
translation: Na 32,000 meri i no sleep wantaim man.

original: This was the half portion for those who had gone to war: 337,500 sheep,
translation: Em i hap bilong ol man i go wok long war: 337,500 sheep.

original: including a tribute to the LORD of 675,
translation: I gat tribut long LORD, em i kamap 675, wantaim tok save long han bilong GOD.

original: 36,000 cattle, including a tribute to the LORD of 72,
translation: 36,000 bulmakau, em i pertein long Jehovah, ol i givim 72, bringim ka long Jehovah.

original: 30,500 donkeys, including a tribute to the LORD of 61,
translation: 30,500 dolfini, klia na samting bilong pe pe long tokim gutpela narapela long Jehovah 61.

original: and 16,000 people, including a tribute to the LORD of 32.
translation: Na ol 16,000 manmeri, wantaim tokguili long LORD bilong yumu 32.

original: Moses gave the tribute to Eleazar the priest as an offering for the LORD, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Moses i givim triebut long Eleaza pris olsem ofing long LORD, olsem LORD i bin tokim long Moses.

original: From the Israelites’ half, which Moses had set apart from the men who had gone to war,
translation: Long hap bilong Israelites, Moses i bin setim aparaim long ol man i go wok war,

original: this half belonged to the congregation: 337,500 sheep,
translation: Hap i go long komuniti: 337,500 pipol sheep

original: 36,000 cattle,
translation: 36,000 bulmakau

original: 30,500 donkeys,
translation: Tripati tausen fim hundred donki.

original: and 16,000 people.
translation: Na siksela tusand ol pipol.

original: From the Israelites’ half, Moses took one out of every fifty persons and animals and gave them to the Levites who kept charge of the tabernacle of the LORD, as the LORD had commanded him.
translation: Long hap bilong Israel, Moses i tek wan long olgeta fifty manmeri na animals, na i givim ol long Levai ol i lukautim tabenakel bilong LORD, olsem LORD i bin tokim em.

original: Then the officers who were over the units of the army—the commanders of thousands and of hundreds—approached Moses
translation: Na ofisa i go klostu long Mosese, ol komanda bilong tausen na bilong hundres, ol i bin stap i lukautim ol yunit bilong pait.

original: and said, “Your servants have counted the soldiers under our command, and not one of us is missing.
translation: Ol i tok, “Mipela i kauntim solja i stap aninit long komando bilong mipela, na nikam long mipela i no lak.”

original: So we have brought to the LORD an offering of the gold articles each man acquired—armlets, bracelets, rings, earrings, and necklaces—to make atonement for ourselves before the LORD.”
translation: Mipela kisim bek i go long LorD olsem, em i givim mipela ka: armlet, breslet, ring, karat, nekles - ol samting bilong gol we mipela usim. Mipela mekim pasin bilong pesem bilong mipela yet long LorD.

original: So Moses and Eleazar the priest received from them all the articles made out of gold.
translation: Na Mosis na Eleaza pries i kam bekim long ol samting we i wokim long gol.

original: All the gold that the commanders of thousands and of hundreds presented as an offering to the LORD weighed 16,750 shekels.
translation: Olgeta gol i kam long komandan bilong thousand na hundret, ol i bringim na ofim long LORD, em i kamap 16,750 shekel.

original: Each of the soldiers had taken plunder for himself.
translation: Ol soja yet ol i kisim ka na karamapim long namel bilong ol yet.

original: And Moses and Eleazar the priest received the gold from the commanders of thousands and of hundreds and brought it into the Tent of Meeting as a memorial for the Israelites before the LORD.
translation: Na Moses na Eleazar priest ol i kisim gol na ol i bringim i go insait long Haus Bilong Miting, olsem wanpela simbol long ol Israel bifor LORD, em i kam from komanda bilong tausen na bilong hundret.

original: Now the Reubenites and Gadites, who had very large herds and flocks, surveyed the lands of Jazer and Gilead, and they saw that the region was suitable for livestock.
translation: Na ol Reubin na ol Gadi, ol i gat moa bikpela hed na fok long ol, ol i go lukim graun bilong Jazer na Gilead, na ol i lukim ol i kam to know ol ples i gutpela long animol.

original: So the Gadites and Reubenites came to Moses, Eleazar the priest, and the leaders of the congregation, and said,
translation: Na Gadites na Reubenites i kam bek long Mosese, Eleaza prist, na ol bikpela man bilong asemble, na ol i tokim,

original: “Ataroth, Dibon, Jazer, Nimrah, Heshbon, Elealeh, Sebam, Nebo, and Beon,
translation: Atarot, Dibon, Jaza, Nimra, Hesbon, Eleale, Sebam, Nebo, na Beon,

original: which the LORD conquered before the congregation of Israel, are suitable for livestock—and your servants have livestock.”
translation: we usai ol LORD i winim bifoa asosiesen bilong Yisrael, ol narapela samting em i gutpela long ol anus—na servant bilong yu ol i gat ol anus.

original: “If we have found favor in your sight,” they said, “let this land be given to your servants as a possession. Do not make us cross the Jordan.”
translation: “Sapos yumui givim mipela gude welkam long ai bilong yu,” ol i tok, “inap mipela i ken kisim despla graun na bungim long servant bilong yu olsem propati. No ken lesem yumi go antap long Jordan.”

original: But Moses asked the Gadites and Reubenites, “Shall your brothers go to war while you sit here?
translation: Mosis i askim ol Gad na Reuben, “Ol brata bilong yu i go long war, na yu yet sindaun hia?”

original: Why are you discouraging the Israelites from crossing into the land that the LORD has given them?
translation: Wai yus i stap bikim ol Israel pipol i no inap go insait long kantri we Bikpela i givim long ol?

original: This is what your fathers did when I sent them from Kadesh-barnea to inspect the land.
translation: Em i olsem tinging bilo papa bilong yu wen mi sendim ol long Kadesi-Barnea ol go lukim gras bilong kantri.

original: For when your fathers went up to the Valley of Eshcol and saw the land, they discouraged the Israelites from entering the land that the LORD had given them.
translation: Taim papa bilong yu go ap long Vali bilong Eshkol, na ol i lukim graun, ol i bikim bel kol long Israelites, na ol i no inap go insait long graun we Bikpela i givim ol.

original: So the anger of the LORD was kindled that day, and He swore an oath, saying,
translation: So i rom blong LORD i kam antap strong olsem de, na Em i tok ole, olsem:

original: ‘Because they did not follow Me wholeheartedly, not one of the men twenty years of age or older who came out of Egypt will see the land that I swore to give Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob—
translation: Bikos ol i no bihainim mi long hart, ol man husat i gat twenty yia na ap moa, husat i kamap long Egip, bai ol i no lukim dispela graun we mi promis long Abraham, Aisak, na Jakob.

original: not one except Caleb son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite and Joshua son of Nun—because they did follow the LORD wholeheartedly.’
translation: I no gat wan tasol, Kalebu su na Jefune Kenisi na Josua su na Nun – bikos ol i bihain LORD olgeta hat.

original: The anger of the LORD burned against Israel, and He made them wander in the wilderness forty years, until the whole generation who had done evil in His sight was gone.
translation: Ira bilong LORD i bum long Israel, na em i mekim ol i go waida long bus fort yia, kam lukim holep laif jenarason ol i mekim ol samting nogut long ai bilong em i dai pinis.

original: Now behold, you, a brood of sinners, have risen up in place of your fathers to further stoke the burning anger of the LORD against Israel.
translation: Nau lukim, yusupela Pikinini bilong ol man sin, i kamap nau long hap bilong tumbuna bilong yusupela, long mekim birua bilong PAPA bilong olgeta i kalap moa gen against Isrel.

original: For if you turn away from following Him, He will once again leave this people in the wilderness, and you will be the cause of their destruction.”
translation: Sapos yu lusim go long bihainim Em, bai Em i go bek gen long livim dispela manmeri long bus, na yu yet bai yu kirapim dispela bagarap long ol.

original: Then the Gadites and Reubenites approached Moses and said, “We want to build sheepfolds here for our livestock and cities for our little ones.
translation: Ol Gadites na Reubenites i go klostu long Moses na tokim em, “Mipela laik buildim ol ples bilong ol sheep hia long ol animol belong mipela, na mipela i laik bilong buildim siti hia long ol liklik pikinini belong mipela.”

original: But we will arm ourselves and be ready to go ahead of the Israelites until we have brought them into their place. Meanwhile, our little ones will remain in the fortified cities for protection from the inhabitants of the land.
translation: Mipela i save long strongim skinstain bilong mipela, na mipela i redi long go bek long hap bilong Pipol Israel, olsem na mipela i bringim ol go long ples bilong ol. Traim na pikinini bilong mipela i stap yet long siti bilong wara, olsem bai ol i save long ol pipol i stap long graun.

original: We will not return to our homes until every Israelite has taken possession of his inheritance.
translation: Yumi no go bak long ples bilong yumi yet, na yumi waitsim olgeta Israelit i kisim holim inheritasen bilong en, na tok bikim ol i kamap tru long em.

original: Yet we will not have an inheritance with them across the Jordan and beyond, because our inheritance has come to us on the east side of the Jordan.”
translation: Mipela no go ken kaikai long graun bilong papa long hap side na bihain long Jodan, wantaim olsem, kaikai bilong yumi em i kam long sait bilong solwara long Jodan.

original: Moses replied, “If you will do this—if you will arm yourselves before the LORD for battle,
translation: Moses i tokim ol, "Yupela mas mekim dispela - yupela bai kisim wapen bilong yupela na go long bikpela fait wantaim LORD, long han bilong LORD."

original: and if every one of your armed men crosses the Jordan before the LORD, until He has driven His enemies out before Him,
translation: Na sapos ol soldia yu olgeta go karim wes long Jordan bifor Bikpela, na Em i paitim ol enemy bilong Em long pus bilong Em,

original: then when the land is subdued before the LORD, you may return and be free of obligation to the LORD and to Israel. And this land will belong to you as a possession before the LORD.
translation: Wanpela taim graun i go daun bikos Jehovah, ken yu go bak na yu fri long obligesion long Jehovah na long Israel. Na dispela graun bai bilong yu olsem propati long ai bilong Jehovah.

original: But if you do not do this, you will certainly sin against the LORD—and be assured that your sin will find you out.
translation: Sapos yu no mekim dispela, yu ken sins against Bikpela, na bai yu skulim olsem sin bilong yu bai i kam bek long yu.

original: Build cities for your little ones and folds for your flocks, but do what you have promised.”
translation: Bilongim siti long pikinini bilong yu, wokim pen long lukim ol animol bilong yu, na me kim tok long moning, yu mas mekim promis bilong yu.

original: The Gadites and Reubenites said to Moses, “Your servants will do just as our lord commands.
translation: Ol Gadites na ol Reubenites i tokim Mosis, “Wokman bilong yu, yumi wak long komando bilong papa bilong yumi olsem.”

original: Our children, our wives, our livestock, and all our animals will remain here in the cities of Gilead.
translation: Pikinini bilong yumi, meri bilong yumi, animals bilong yumi, na olgeta kain animals bilong yumi yet stap hia long towns bilong Gilead.

original: But your servants are equipped for war, and every man will cross over to the battle before the LORD, just as our lord says.”
translation: Wokman bilo yu ol i redi long fait, na ol man bai go antap long bikpela fait bifor ai bilong Jehovah, olsem Bikpela bos bilong mipela i tok.

original: So Moses gave orders about them to Eleazar the priest, to Joshua son of Nun, and to the family leaders of the tribes of Israel.
translation: Na Moses i givim tok long Eleazar pris, long Joshua sun bilong Nun, na long ol bikpela man bilong famili bilong taips bilong Israel.

original: And Moses said to them, “If the Gadites and Reubenites cross the Jordan with you, with every man armed for battle before the LORD, and the land is subdued before you, then you are to give them the land of Gilead as a possession.
translation: Moses i tokim ol long dispela, "Sapos Gadites na Reubenites i go beklong Jordan wantaim yumi, na ol man i kam bek long wara bifo Papa God, na kantri i kamdaun pinis bifo yumi, den bai yumui givim ol ples long Gilead long ol bilong possessions."

original: But if they do not arm themselves and go across with you, then they must accept their possession among you in the land of Canaan.”
translation: Bai ol i no kisim wail bilong ol, kamap strong, na go bek gen long hap tumas wantaim yu, orait ol i mas gat shares bilong ol gen long mipela long Grun bilong Kanaan.

original: The Gadites and Reubenites replied, “As the LORD has spoken to your servants, so we will do.
translation: Ol Pikinini bilong Gad na Ol Pikinini bilong Reuben i tokim, “Olsem Papa bilong yumi i tokim long hausboi na meri bilong en, naso bai yumi mekim.”

original: We will cross over into the land of Canaan armed before the LORD, that we may have our inheritance on this side of the Jordan.”
translation: Mipela bai go antap long kantri bilong Kanaan, milakol i kamap befro long Han, mipela bai kisim inhiritans bilong mipela long sait bilong Joden.

original: So Moses gave to the Gadites, to the Reubenites, and to the half-tribe of Manasseh son of Joseph the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites and the kingdom of Og king of Bashan—the land including its cities and the territory surrounding them.
translation: Na Moses i givim long ol Gad, long ol Reuben, na long hap-tribe bilong Manasseh pikinini bilong Josep, kingdom bilong Sihon king bilong ol Amorite na kingdom bilong Og king bilong Bashan - graun, vilij, na gras bilong en, na ol ples i karim long ol bodi.

original: And the Gadites built up Dibon, Ataroth, Aroer,
translation: Na Ol Gaditi i bikim ap Dibon, Ataroth, Aroer,

original: Atroth-shophan, Jazer, Jogbehah,
translation: Atrot-Sofan, Jaza, Jogbeha,

original: Beth-nimrah, and Beth-haran as fortified cities, and they built folds for their flocks.
translation: Betenimara, na Betenaran olsem taun bung bilong wara, na ol i bikim ples bilong pem bilong ol pipel bilong ol yet.

original: The Reubenites built up Heshbon, Elealeh, Kiriathaim,
translation: Ol Reubenites i bikim ap Heshbon, Elealeh, Kiriathaim,

original: as well as Nebo and Baal-meon (whose names were changed), and Sibmah. And they renamed the cities they rebuilt.
translation: Olsem olgeta Nebo na Baal-meon (ol nem bilong ol i bin chanjim), na Sibmah. Na oli givim nem gen i go long siti ol ipaintim.

original: The descendants of Machir son of Manasseh went to Gilead, captured it, and drove out the Amorites who were there.
translation: Ol desenden bilong Machir man bilong Manasseh i go long Gilead, ol i kisim dispela, na ol i drivim aut Amorites i stap bek.

original: So Moses gave Gilead to the clan of Machir son of Manasseh, and they settled there.
translation: Mosese i givim Gilead long clan bilong Makir man bilong Manase, na ol i stap we.

original: Jair, a descendant of Manasseh, went and captured their villages and called them Havvoth-jair.
translation: Jair, pikinini bilong Manase, i go pinis na kisim ol vilij i bilong ol, na ol i kolim olgeta Havvoth-jair.

original: And Nobah went and captured Kenath and its villages and called it Nobah, after his own name.
translation: Na Nobah i go na kisim Kenath na vilij bilong en, na em i kolim Nobah, long nem bilong em yet.

original: These are the journeys of the Israelites when they came out of the land of Egypt by their divisions under the leadership of Moses and Aaron.
translation: Dispela em i stori bilong jiones bilong Yisrael, taim Yisrael i kamap long kantri birua Egypt, na ol i go long grup bilong ol unda lidimpela Moses na Aaron.

original: At the LORD’s command, Moses recorded the stages of their journey. These are the stages listed by their starting points:
translation: Long tok bilong LORD, Moses raitim ol stap bilong wokabaut bilong ol. Dispela ol stap i kamap long ol ples we ol i statim.

original: On the fifteenth day of the first month, on the day after the Passover, the Israelites set out from Rameses. They marched out defiantly in full view of all the Egyptians,
translation: Long de fifteenth, moning wan, bihaenim Pasaova, Israelites i go bek long Rameses. Ol i marchaut i go olsem wankain man, tromoi ol i lukim yu gut, long as ples bilong olgeta Ijip.

original: who were burying all their firstborn, whom the LORD had struck down among them; for the LORD had executed judgment against their gods.
translation: Ol i kisim ol pikinini bilong kaytaim na i wok long planti pinis, ol pikinini bilong kaytaim we LORD i kamautim long ol; bikos LORD i bin mekim desisen long ol gogo bilong ol.

original: The Israelites set out from Rameses and camped at Succoth.
translation: Israelait i wakabung long Rameses na ol i kamp long Sukot.

original: They set out from Succoth and camped at Etham, on the edge of the wilderness.
translation: Ol i go bek long Sakot na kamap long Etam, long sait bilong bus.

original: They set out from Etham and turned back to Pi-hahiroth, opposite Baal-zephon, and they camped near Migdol.
translation: Ol i go bek long Etam na ol i turnim bek long Pi-hairoth, klostu long Baal-sefon, na ol i kamp klostu long Migdol.

original: They set out from Pi-hahiroth and crossed through the sea, into the wilderness, and they journeyed three days into the Wilderness of Etham and camped at Marah.
translation: Ol i go bek long Pi-hahiroth, waraunai i go daun long solwara, na ol i wokabaut tri de insait long Bus Kantri bilong Etham, na ol i kam anketa long Marah.

original: They set out from Marah and came to Elim, where there were twelve springs and seventy palm trees, and they camped there.
translation: Ol i go bek long Marah, na ol i kamap long Elim, we ol i finim twelv wara i kam long graun na seveti palma treis, na ol i kamp tasol long hap bilong ol.

original: They set out from Elim and camped by the Red Sea.
