translation: Ol i go bek long Elim, na ol i kamping long Solwara Red.

original: They set out from the Red Sea and camped in the Desert of Sin.
translation: Ol i go bek gen long Solwara Red na ol i kamp wantaim long Desert bilong Sin.

original: They set out from the Desert of Sin and camped at Dophkah.
translation: Ol i go bek gen na kampe long Dofka, ol i stap long Deset bilong Sin.

original: They set out from Dophkah and camped at Alush.
translation: Oli go bek long Dofka na kamp long Alus.

original: They set out from Alush and camped at Rephidim, where there was no water for the people to drink.
translation: Ol i go bek long Alush na kisim kampein long Rephidim, na i no gat wara bilong ol man i drink.

original: They set out from Rephidim and camped in the Wilderness of Sinai.
translation: Ol i go bek gen from Repiddim na ol i kamp long Wilanes long Sainai.

original: They set out from the Wilderness of Sinai and camped at Kibroth-hattaavah.
translation: Ol i go bek long Wilanes long Sinai na ol i kamp wantaim long Kibrot-i-taava.

original: They set out from Kibroth-hattaavah and camped at Hazeroth.
translation: Ol i go bek gen long Kibrot Hataava na ol i kamp long Hazerot.

original: They set out from Hazeroth and camped at Rithmah.
translation: Ol i go bek long Heseroth na ol i kamp long Ritimah.

original: They set out from Rithmah and camped at Rimmon-perez.
translation: Ol i go bek long Rithmah na ol i kamp long Rimmon-perez.

original: They set out from Rimmon-perez and camped at Libnah.
translation: Ol i go bek long Rimmon-perez, na ol i kam pundaun long Libnah.

original: They set out from Libnah and camped at Rissah.
translation: Ol i go bek gen long Libnah na ol i kamp long Rissah.

original: They set out from Rissah and camped at Kehelathah.
translation: Ol i go kam long Rissah na ol i stap long Kehelathah.

original: They set out from Kehelathah and camped at Mount Shepher.
translation: Ol i go bek long Kehelata na ol i kamp long Maunten Shepherd.

original: They set out from Mount Shepher and camped at Haradah.
translation: Ol i go bek gen long Maunten Sheper na ol i kamp wantaim long Harada.

original: They set out from Haradah and camped at Makheloth.
translation: Ol i go bek long Harada na ol i kamp long Makeolot.

original: They set out from Makheloth and camped at Tahath.
translation: Ol i go bek gen long Makelot na ol i kamp wantaim long Tahat.

original: They set out from Tahath and camped at Terah.
translation: Ol i go bek long Tahath na ol i kam pundaun na kamping long Terah.

original: They set out from Terah and camped at Mithkah.
translation: Ol i go bek long Terah na ol kamapim ka long Mithkah.

original: They set out from Mithkah and camped at Hashmonah.
translation: Ol i go bekim Mithkah na ol i kamp long Hashmonah.

original: They set out from Hashmonah and camped at Moseroth.
translation: Ol i go bek gen long Hashmonah na ol i kamp long Moserote.

original: They set out from Moseroth and camped at Bene-jaakan.
translation: Ol i go bek long Moseroth na ol i kam pikinim ka long Bene-jaakan.

original: They set out from Bene-jaakan and camped at Hor-haggidgad.
translation: Ol i go pinis long Bene-jaakan na ol i kamp long Hor-haggidgad.

original: They set out from Hor-haggidgad and camped at Jotbathah.
translation: Ol i go bek long Hor-Hagidgad na kamap long kanu long Yotbata.

original: They set out from Jotbathah and camped at Abronah.
translation: Oli go bek long Jotbathah na oli kamp long Abronah.

original: They set out from Abronah and camped at Ezion-geber.
translation: Ol i go bek long Abirona na ol i kamp long Esion-geba.

original: They set out from Ezion-geber and camped at Kadesh in the Wilderness of Zin.
translation: Ol i go bek long Ezion-geber na ol i kamp long Kades insait long Wilerness bilong Zin.

original: They set out from Kadesh and camped at Mount Hor, on the outskirts of the land of Edom.
translation: Ol i go bek long Kadesh, na kamonim long Maunt Hor, long sait bilong lanim Edom.

original: At the LORD’s command, Aaron the priest climbed Mount Hor and died there on the first day of the fifth month, in the fortieth year after the Israelites had come out of the land of Egypt.
translation: Long tok bilong LORD, Aaron prist i go antap long Maunt Hor na i dai hap long de moning fif, long de firstede de, long yia fourti em i kam bihain Israelites i kom aut long graun Egypt.

original: Aaron was 123 years old when he died on Mount Hor.
translation: Aron em i 123 yia nau taim em i dai pinis long Maunt Hor.

original: Now the Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the Negev in the land of Canaan, heard that the Israelites were coming.
translation: Nau kanaka king bilong Arad, we em i stap long Negev long kantri bilong Kananan, em i harim ol Isrelaiti i kam.

original: And the Israelites set out from Mount Hor and camped at Zalmonah.
translation: Na Pipol Israel i go bek long Maunten Hor na kamp long Zalmona.

original: They set out from Zalmonah and camped at Punon.
translation: Ol i go bek long ples Zalmonah na ol i kamp long Punon.

original: They set out from Punon and camped at Oboth.
translation: Ol i go bek gen long Punon na ol i kamp long Oboth.

original: They set out from Oboth and camped at Iye-abarim on the border of Moab.
translation: Ol i go bek gen long Oboth na ol i kamp long Iye-abarim long bikpela hap bilong Moab.

original: They set out from Iyim and camped at Dibon-gad.
translation: Ol i go bek long Aiam na ol i kamp long Dibongat.

original: They set out from Dibon-gad and camped at Almon-diblathaim.
translation: Ol i go bek long Dibon-gad na ol i kamp long Almon-diblathaim.

original: They set out from Almon-diblathaim and camped in the mountains of Abarim facing Nebo.
translation: Ol i go bek long Almon-diblathaim na ol i kamp long maunten bilong Abarim, karim head i go long Nebo.

original: They set out from the mountains of Abarim and camped on the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho.
translation: Ol i wakabaut long mauntin bilong Abarim na ol i kamp long plen bilong Moab long sait bilong Jordan, long sait i go daun, klostu long Jeriko.

original: And there on the plains of Moab they camped by the Jordan, from Beth-jeshimoth to Abel-shittim.
translation: Na ol i kam pundaun ananit long Jordan, long plan long Moab, from Bet-Jesimot kasol long Abel-Sitim.

original: On the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho, the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Long plaen bilong Moab nambis Jordan, kwila long Jeriko, LORD i tokim Moses,

original: “Speak to the Israelites and tell them: When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
translation: Tokim ol Israel, yumitokim ol: Wanpela taim yu go pas long Warai Jordan, i go insait long Kantri bilong Canaan,

original: you must drive out before you all the inhabitants of the land, destroy all their carved images and cast idols, and demolish all their high places.
translation: Yu mas drivim olt bifo yu olgeta ol pipal i stap long kantri, bagarap olgeta piksa i wokim long ston na kastim we idol i kast, na kukim daun olgeta hap pos.

original: You are to take possession of the land and settle in it, for I have given you the land to possess.
translation: Yu mas kisim i go na stap insait long graun, na yu mas stap i go na wakem haus long em, wantaim mi givim yu dispela graun olgeta.

original: And you are to divide the land by lot according to your clans. Give a larger inheritance to a larger clan and a smaller inheritance to a smaller one. Whatever falls to each one by lot will be his. You will receive an inheritance according to the tribes of your fathers.
translation: Yupela mas dividim graun long rot olsem famili bilong yupela. Givim planti ka bilong papa long clan i gat planti manmeri, na givim liklik ka bilong papa long clan i gat liklik manmeri. Wanem i kam daun long rot bilong wanwan man, em i bilong em. Yupela kisim inheritance olsem wantok bilong tumbuna bilong yupela.

original: But if you do not drive out the inhabitants of the land before you, those you allow to remain will become barbs in your eyes and thorns in your sides; they will harass you in the land where you settle.
translation: Bai yumas no kisim aut olegta papa bilong ples bipo yu, ol dispela i yu strongim ol i stap yet, bai ol kamap ol sik bilong ai bilong yu, na ol prik bilong rib bilong yu; bai ol wariim yu long ples we yu kamdaun na stap.

original: And then I will do to you what I had planned to do to them.”
translation: Na bai mi ken mekim long yu ol samting we mi bin laikim long mekim long ol.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Command the Israelites and say to them: When you enter the land of Canaan, it will be allotted to you as an inheritance with these boundaries:
translation: I givim komando long ol Israel na tokim ol: Wanpela taim yu go insait long kantri bilong Kanaan, em bai i kam long yu olsem inheritance, wantaim dispela boundary ya:

original: Your southern border will extend from the Wilderness of Zin along the border of Edom. On the east, your southern border will run from the end of the Salt Sea,
translation: Sauten boda bilong yu ina go daun long Wilernes bilong Zin, na ron i kamap gen long boda bilong Edom. Long eastern sait, sauten boda bilong yu ina ron from we hap bilong en Solwara Solt.

original: cross south of the Ascent of Akrabbim, continue to Zin, and go south of Kadesh-barnea. Then it will go on to Hazar-addar and proceed to Azmon,
translation: Kros saut bilong Asent blong Akrabbim, kontinu long Zin, na go long saut bilong Kadesh-barnea. Em bai go long Hazar-addar na proseed long Azmon.

original: where it will turn from Azmon, join the Brook of Egypt, and end at the Sea.
translation: Wanpela hap, em bai lusim Azmon, jionim na River Egypt, na klostu long Solwara.

original: Your western border will be the coastline of the Great Sea; this will be your boundary on the west.
translation: Boda wes bilong yu bai kam bek long bahn hevi bilong Solwara Bikpela, na dispela em i go bek long boundary bilong yu long wes.

original: Your northern border will run from the Great Sea directly to Mount Hor,
translation: Boda bilong yu long not i go long wei bilong Great Sia, na em i go stret long Maunt Hor.

original: and from Mount Hor to Lebo-hamath, then extend to Zedad,
translation: Na long Maunten Hor i go inap long Lebo-hamath, na stret yet long Zedad,

original: continue to Ziphron, and end at Hazar-enan. This will be your boundary on the north.
translation: Em i go inap long Zifron, na em i pinis long Hazarenan, na dispela bai kauntri bilong yu long sip.

original: And your eastern border will run straight from Hazar-enan to Shepham,
translation: Na boda bilong yu i go stret long east, from Hazar-enan i go long Shepham,

original: then go down from Shepham to Riblah on the east side of Ain and continue along the slopes east of the Sea of Chinnereth.
translation: Kam doun long Shepham, go long Riblah long sait bilong east bilong Ain, na kontinu long slops bilong east bilong Solwara Chinnereth.

original: Then the border will go down along the Jordan and end at the Salt Sea. This will be your land, defined by its borders on all sides.”
translation: Na kauntri bung i go daun long Jordan, i kam pinis long Solwara Salt. Ol kauntri i stap long en bilem, na dispela em i bungim kauntri bilong yu, long ol sait bilong en.

original: So Moses commanded the Israelites, “Apportion this land by lot as an inheritance. The LORD has commanded that it be given to the nine and a half tribes.
translation: Moses i givim komando long ol Israel, “Givim kantri ikam long hap pas, olsem prodak bilong tumbuna. LORD i givim komando, em i laik im givim kantri ia long nain na hap tribe.

original: For the tribes of the Reubenites and Gadites, along with the half-tribe of Manasseh, have already received their inheritance.
translation: Long ol clan bilong Ol Reubenites, Ol Gadites, wantaim hap-tribe bilong Manase, olgeta i kam bek gen long inheritans bilong ol.

original: These two and a half tribes have received their inheritance across the Jordan from Jericho, toward the sunrise.”
translation: Dispela tu na hap tribes i kamap na kisim inheritance bilong ol long sait bilong warai bilong Jordan, long taun bilong Jeriko, i go long wei bilong san i kamap.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “These are the names of the men who are to assign the land as an inheritance for you: Eleazar the priest and Joshua son of Nun.
translation: Dispela i ol nem bilong man we bai givim graun long ol olsem inhertens bilong yu: Eleaza prist na Josaia sisi bilong Nan.

original: Appoint one leader from each tribe to distribute the land.
translation: Appointim wanpela lida long ol klain ibilong yumi, oli bungim graun.

original: These are their names: Caleb son of Jephunneh from the tribe of Judah;
translation: Nem bilong ol i stap: Kalebu su bilong Jefune long hap bilong trai bilong Juta;

original: Shemuel son of Ammihud from the tribe of Simeon;
translation: Shemuel pikinini bilong Ammihud long hap tribe bilong Simeon

original: Elidad son of Chislon from the tribe of Benjamin;
translation: Elidad Pikinini bilong Chislon long tain bilong Benjimin;

original: Bukki son of Jogli, a leader from the tribe of Dan;
translation: Bukki pikinini bilong Jogli, wan bos bilong traib bilong Dan;

original: Hanniel son of Ephod, a leader from the tribe of Manasseh son of Joseph;
translation: Hanniel pikinini bilong Ephod, bikman long Manasseh, taim bilong Joseph;

original: Kemuel son of Shiphtan, a leader from the tribe of Ephraim;
translation: Kemuel pikinini bilong Shiphtan, wan bigman long taip bilong Efraim;

original: Eli-zaphan son of Parnach, a leader from the tribe of Zebulun;
translation: Eli-zafan son bilong Parnak, wan bikpela man bilong Zebulun tribe;

original: Paltiel son of Azzan, a leader from the tribe of Issachar;
translation: Paltiel pikinini bilong Azzan, wan bikman long tribe Issachar;

original: Ahihud son of Shelomi, a leader from the tribe of Asher;
translation: Ahihud pikinini bilong Shelomi, wan bikpela man bilong tripe bilong Asher;

original: and Pedahel son of Ammihud, a leader from the tribe of Naphtali.”
translation: Na Pedahel pikinini bilong Ammihud, wan bikman bilong tribe Naphtali.

original: These are the ones whom the LORD commanded to apportion the inheritance to the Israelites in the land of Canaan.
translation: Ol dispela i go olsem Bikpela i givim tok long dinaim ka, oltipa givim brigana long Pipol Israel long kantri bilong Canaan.

original: Again the LORD spoke to Moses on the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho:
translation: Bikpela i tokim Mosis gen: long ples Moab i go daun, long Jordan sait long Jeriko.

original: “Command the Israelites to give, from the inheritance they will possess, cities for the Levites to live in and pasturelands around the cities.
translation: Imsave long ol Israelait, bai yu givim samting long graun bilong inpata, taun olsem Levait bai sindaun i go, na gras bilong ka long sait bilong taun.

original: The cities will be for them to live in, and the pasturelands will be for their herds, their flocks, and all their other livestock.
translation: Taun ol manmeri i stap, na gras bilong ol animit, ol fok, na ol ka, olgeta samting bilong ol i kisim ka long ol i stap.

original: The pasturelands around the cities you are to give the Levites will extend a thousand cubits from the wall on every side.
translation: Gras bilong animals long ol sait bilong towns, yu mas givim Levait pipol, na em bai stret olsem tausen cubit from wal long bek bilong en, long ol sait.

original: You are also to measure two thousand cubits outside the city on the east, two thousand on the south, two thousand on the west, and two thousand on the north, with the city in the center. These areas will serve as larger pasturelands for the cities.
translation: Yu mas mesure tu tasen kibit ouside long siti long sip (east), tu tasen long saut, tu tasen long wes, na tu tasen long not, wantaim siti i stap insait long senta. Dispela eria i servim olsem graun bigpela gras bilong animal long ol siti.

original: Six of the cities you give the Levites are to be appointed as cities of refuge, to which a manslayer may flee. In addition to these, give the Levites forty-two other cities.
translation: Sip bilong sikis ol ples iyu ino givim long Ol Levait, ol i mas ranawe long dispela, na man i kilim man i go na stap, na long namel ol dispela, yiu mas givim olgets forty-two ol narapela ples.

original: The total number of cities you give the Levites will be forty-eight, with their corresponding pasturelands.
translation: Namba bilong siti olgeta we yu givim Levait i go, em forty-eight, wantaim graun ol i kaikai.

original: The cities that you apportion from the territory of the Israelites should be given to the Levites in proportion to the inheritance of each tribe: more from a larger tribe and less from a smaller one.”
translation: Siti ol iu givim long Levaita, inap long olsem laip bilong kila trib long en: long bikpela trib, givim moa, na long liklik trib, givim liklik.

original: Then the LORD said to Moses,
translation: Na Lod i tok olsem long Moses,

original: “Speak to the Israelites and tell them: When you cross the Jordan into the land of Canaan,
translation: Tokim long ol Israel, yumusim tok: Wanpela taim yu go pas long Jordan, i go insait long kantri bilong Canaan,

original: designate cities to serve as your cities of refuge, so that a person who kills someone unintentionally may flee there.
translation: Inapim ples bilong rest, na bai ol i servim olsem tok ples long stap, bilong man i kilim man nogat long tingim, tasol i kam bek long han, em i ranawe na go long hap, na kisim res long hap.

original: You are to have these cities as a refuge from the avenger, so that the manslayer will not die until he stands trial before the assembly.
translation: Yupela mas gat deskael sipos olsem nau, nogat mansleeya bai i dai yet, na em bai go kam long tribunal bilong ol pipol.

original: The cities you select will be your six cities of refuge.
translation: Sities ol yu pilim bai i kamap ol sikis sities bilong refugees.

original: Select three cities across the Jordan and three in the land of Canaan as cities of refuge.
translation: Tekim tripela taun long hap long sait bilong Jordan, na tekim tripela taun long kantri bilong Kanaan, olsem taun bilong pide na toktok.

original: These six cities will serve as a refuge for the Israelites and for the foreigner or stranger among them, so that anyone who kills a person unintentionally may flee there.
translation: Siksipela ples bilong sindaun bai stap, na ol Pipol Israel na man i kam long nesen o man i no save husat i stap long ol bai usim, mama bai eni man i kilim man i no laik, em bai kam bek long ples bilong sindaun, na bai ron igo long hap.

original: If, however, anyone strikes a person with an iron object and kills him, he is a murderer; the murderer must surely be put to death.
translation: Sapos wanpela man i usim pisibus na kilim arapela, em i kilaman; ol i mas katim laip bilong em, em bai i dai tasol.

original: Or if anyone has in his hand a stone of deadly size, and he strikes and kills another, he is a murderer; the murderer must surely be put to death.
translation: O i gat stoan bilong kilim long han bilong en, na em i kilim na i pundaunim man arere, em bai man muruk; man muruk bai mas dai tasol.

original: If anyone has in his hand a deadly object of wood, and he strikes and kills another, he is a murderer; the murderer must surely be put to death.
translation: Sapos wanpela i gat diwai bilong kilim long han bilong em, na em i paitim na kilim narapela man, em i man bilong kilim ol; em i mas dai tasol, emas i mas dai bilong justis.

original: The avenger of blood is to put the murderer to death; when he finds him, he is to kill him.
translation: Man i holim raga bilong blokd i mas kilim man i kilim man, na taim em i kambek long em, em i mas kilim olsem i dai finis.

original: Likewise, if anyone maliciously pushes another or intentionally throws an object at him and kills him,
translation: Olsem tu, sapos wanpela man i kirapim narapela long olsem o i tromwe samting long en na i kilim em,

original: or if in hostility he strikes him with his hand and he dies, the one who struck him must surely be put to death; he is a murderer. When the avenger of blood finds the murderer, he is to kill him.
translation: Sapos em i kilim em wantaim han bilong em long wol wara na em i dai pinis, namba wan i paitim em, em mas dai pinis; em i murim man. Taim govilman bilong blod i kam bek long hap murim man, em bai kilim em.

original: But if anyone pushes a person suddenly, without hostility, or throws an object at him unintentionally,
translation: Bipola na ogasta, i kilim man long taim narapela, o i rokim samting i go antap long em bai i no laik,

original: or without looking drops a heavy stone that kills him, but he was not an enemy and did not intend to harm him,
translation: Ota em i no luk yet em i kirapim wanpela bikhet ston, na ston i kilim man, tasol em i no bin eni, na em i no laik mekim man i sik.

original: then the congregation must judge between the slayer and the avenger of blood according to these ordinances.
translation: Na bung bilong ol pipol i mas jijim long bikos bilong man i kilim na man i bekim blod, strongim ol tok ples ba yumi usim.

original: The assembly is to protect the manslayer from the hand of the avenger of blood. Then the assembly will return him to the city of refuge to which he fled, and he must live there until the death of the high priest, who was anointed with the holy oil.
translation: Asili em i mas protektim man i kilim man long han bilong man i kam bekim blod. Na asili em bai i bekim em i go bak long siti bilong sikir we em i ranawe go, na em i mas stap hap til dai bilong bif piri we em i bin anointim long olio bilong spirik.

original: But if the manslayer ever goes outside the limits of the city of refuge to which he fled
translation: Bai sapos man i kilim man i go bek gen long small na ikam long aut, na i go beyond boundari bilong taun bilong refuj we em i ran im go,

original: and the avenger of blood finds him outside of his city of refuge and kills him, then the avenger will not be guilty of bloodshed
translation: Na man i kilim blohd bilong em i kam bek long en long wei ouside siti bilong ripot bilong em, na i kilim em, olsem na man i kilim blohd bai no gilty long dai bilong blohd.

original: because the manslayer must remain in his city of refuge until the death of the high priest. Only after the death of the high priest may he return to the land he owns.
translation: Bikos man i kilim man emas i stap yet long ples bilong sikirim na bai em i stap yet olsem na i go long pinis bilong hai pris, na bai em bai i go bek gen long graun bilong em.

original: This will be a statutory ordinance for you for the generations to come, wherever you live.
translation: Dispela bai i kam bek long laen bilong ples long yupela, long genarashon i go i kam, weh yupela i stap.

original: If anyone kills a person, the murderer is to be put to death on the testimony of the witnesses. But no one is to be put to death based on the testimony of a lone witness.
translation: Sapos man i kilim man, bai man i kilim man em bai i go long deat olsem long toktok bilong ol witness. Tasol, inap long wanpela witness tasol, inap putim man i go long deat. Bai i askim planti witness, na taim ol i toktrue, orait bai i ken putim man i kilim man i go long deat.

original: You are not to accept a ransom for the life of a murderer who deserves to die; he must surely be put to death.
translation: Yupela no ken akseptim man i pai bilong lif bilong man i kilim man, em i mas dai tasol, na em bai dai.

original: Nor should you accept a ransom for the person who flees to a city of refuge and allow him to return and live on his own land before the death of the high priest.
translation: Yupela no ken kisim paeman long sindaun long man i ranawe go long ples bilong sikuru, na yupela i givim em kam bek na stai long graun bilong en bipo dai bilong prist bikpela.

original: Do not pollute the land where you live, for bloodshed pollutes the land, and no atonement can be made for the land on which the blood is shed, except by the blood of the one who shed it.
translation: No ken polluteim graun we yu stap, wantaim olsem blodshed i polluteim graun, na nogat wanem samting bai kam bekim peis long graun, tasol blooed bilong man i spil umu bai bekim peis long en.

original: Do not defile the land where you live and where I dwell. For I, the LORD, dwell among the Israelites.”
translation: No ken pilim graun we mipela i stap, na we mi stap, wantaim Mi, LORD, mipela i stap long midst bilong ol Israel.

original: Now the family heads of the clan of Gilead son of Machir son of Manasseh, one of the clans of Joseph, approached Moses and the leaders who were the heads of the Israelite families and addressed them,
translation: Nau bikman bilong famili bilong klan Gilead, mak bilong Machir, mak bilong Manasseh, wanpela long klan bilong Joseph, i go karakai long Moses na ol lida, bikman bilong famili bilong Israel, na tokim ol.

original: saying, “When the LORD commanded my lord to give the land as an inheritance to the Israelites by lot, He also commanded him to give the inheritance of our brother Zelophehad to his daughters.
translation: Ol Masalai i givim tok, “Taim bikpela masalai bilong mipela i tokim mipela long dinau graun bilong Yisrael long ol jako ineritans long wei bilong klosim ston, na em i tokim mipela tu long givim ineritans bilong brata Zelophehad long ol meri bilong em.”

original: But if they marry any of the men from the other tribes of Israel, their inheritance will be withdrawn from the portion of our fathers and added to the tribe into which they marry. So our allotted inheritance would be taken away.
translation: Bai ol i marit long ol man bilong narapela tribe bilong Israel, inheretens bilong ol bai i kam bek long portion bilong ka bilong papa bilong mipela, na bai i pasim long tribe bilong ol i marit. Olsem, inheretens emi pasim long mipela bai i taitim go long narapela.

original: And when the Jubilee for the Israelites comes, their inheritance will be added to the tribe into which they marry and taken away from the tribe of our fathers.”
translation: Na wewan em Jubilee bilong Israel i kam, bruk na kaikai bilong ol, em bai i go antap long trib bilong ol i kisim, na olisim long trib bilong tumbuna bilong yumi.

original: So at the word of the LORD, Moses commanded the Israelites: “The tribe of the sons of Joseph speaks correctly.
translation: Long tok bilong Jehovah, Moses i givim komando long Israelait: "Trai bilong pikinini belong Joseph i toktok rait."

original: This is what the LORD has commanded concerning the daughters of Zelophehad: They may marry anyone they please, provided they marry within a clan of the tribe of their father.
translation: Olsem LORD i givim komando long ol meri pikinini bilong Zelofehad, ol i go maritim hu na husat bai ol i laik, tasol ol i mas maritim long wanpela klain bilong trib na papa bilong ol.

original: No inheritance in Israel may be transferred from tribe to tribe, because each of the Israelites is to retain the inheritance of the tribe of his fathers.
translation: Ineritans long Isrel i no ken go long narapela tribe, bikos ol Isrelait i mas holim strong ineritans bilong tribe bilong papa bilong ol.

original: Every daughter who possesses an inheritance from any Israelite tribe must marry within a clan of the tribe of her father, so that every Israelite will possess the inheritance of his fathers.
translation: Oli pikini meri husat i gat inheretans bilong en long narapela tribe bilong Israelait, em bai marit wantaim famili bilong klana bilong tribe bilong papa bilong en, so olgeta Israelait bai i gat inheretans bilong tumbuna bilong ol.

original: No inheritance may be transferred from one tribe to another, for each tribe of Israel must retain its inheritance.”
translation: Ineritans i no inap stap long narapela traib, bikos olgeta traib blong Isrel i mas holim inheritasen blong ol yet.

original: So the daughters of Zelophehad did as the LORD had commanded Moses.
translation: Ol meri bilong Zelophehad i mekim olsem LORD i tokim Moses.

original: Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah, the daughters of Zelophehad, were married to cousins on their father’s side.
translation: Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, na Noah, ol dok meri bilong Zelophehad, ol i marit wantaim bratas bilong papa bilong ol.

original: They married within the clans of the descendants of Manasseh son of Joseph, and their inheritance remained within the tribe of their father’s clan.
translation: Ol i marit long klana bilong desendant bilong Manase, pikinini bilong Josep, na bris bilong ol i stap yet long tribe bilong klan bilong papa bilong ol.

original: These are the commandments and ordinances that the LORD gave the Israelites through Moses on the plains of Moab by the Jordan across from Jericho.
translation: Em i komando na lo bilong Jehovah we Jehovah i givim long ol Israel long han bilong Moisi long plaen bilong Moab, long wanpela sait bilong Jordan, klostu long Jeriko.

original: These are the words that Moses spoke to all Israel in the wilderness east of the Jordan—in the Arabah opposite Suph—between Paran and Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, and Dizahab.
translation: Em i tok olsem, Mosese i tokim ol Israel long bus em i stap long sindaun bilong Jordan, long kalabus bilong Suph, bitwen Paran na Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, na Dizahab.

original: It is an eleven-day journey from Horeb to Kadesh-barnea by way of Mount Seir.
translation: Em i go long wei olsem long montain Seir, from Horeb long go Kadesi Barnea, na em i jurney long eleven de.

original: In the fortieth year, on the first day of the eleventh month, Moses proclaimed to the Israelites all that the LORD had commanded him concerning them.
translation: Long long taim 40 yia igo, bai dai wan bilong mun eleben, Moses i tokautim ol Israel olgeta samting we Bikpela i givim em tok bilong ol.

original: This was after he had defeated Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon, and then at Edrei had defeated Og king of Bashan, who lived in Ashtaroth.
translation: Em i kam bihaen long em i winim Sihon king bilong Ol Amorites, we i stap long Heshbon, na em i go winim Og king bilong Bashan long Edrei, we i stap long Ashtaroth.

original: On the east side of the Jordan in the land of Moab, Moses began to explain this law, saying:
translation: Long sais bilong east bilong Jordan long lan bilong Moab, Mosis em i statim eksplainim lo bilong God, olsem:

original: The LORD our God said to us at Horeb: “You have stayed at this mountain long enough.
translation: Bikpela God bilong yumi tokim mipela long Horeb: “Yupela i stap long maunten ili bikpela taim nau”.

original: Resume your journey and go to the hill country of the Amorites; go to all the neighboring peoples in the Arabah, in the hill country, in the foothills, in the Negev, and along the seacoast to the land of the Canaanites and to Lebanon, as far as the great River Euphrates.
translation: Kam bek long jurni bilong yu na go long kantri bilong maunten bilong Amoraitis; go long ol ples i daunbo na karim na nambis long Arabah, long fut bilong maunten, long kantri bilong Negev, na lon solwara go long kantri bilong Kanaanitis na go long Lebanon, stretem long wei bilong bikpela river Euphrates.

original: See, I have placed the land before you. Enter and possess the land that the LORD swore He would give to your fathers Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, and to their descendants after them.”
translation: Luksi, mi putim graun i go longpela yu. Go insait na kisim graun we Bikpela LORD i tok bek long taim bipo em i givim long ol tumbuna bilong yu, Abraham, Aisak, na Jakob, na long ol desenden bilong yumi.

original: At that time I said to you, “I cannot carry the burden for you alone.
translation: Long taim ia, mi tokim yu, Mi no inap karim bek pes bilong yumi wanpela tasol.

original: The LORD your God has multiplied you, so that today you are as numerous as the stars in the sky.
translation: Papa God bilong yu i mekim yu planti, na nau yu ol i bikpela olsem sta i go daun long heven.

original: May the LORD, the God of your fathers, increase you a thousand times over and bless you as He has promised.
translation: Mipela i laik LORD, God bilong papa bilong yupela, i bringim yupela i go forward tausend taim moa, na blessim yupela olsem em i promis.

original: But how can I bear your troubles, burdens, and disputes all by myself?
translation: Mi no inap kisim long trabel, wari, na faet bilong yu ol, long mi wanpela?

original: Choose for yourselves wise, understanding, and respected men from each of your tribes, and I will appoint them as your leaders.”
translation: Bai yu yet tusel olsem i gat save, i gat lotu, na ol man i gat nem long ol ples bilong yupela yet, na mi bai apoinim ol long bihain bungim yupela ol bikman bilong yumi.

original: And you answered me and said, “What you propose to do is good.”
translation: Yu ansa mipela na tok, “Wanem yu laik mekim em i gutpela.”

original: So I took the leaders of your tribes, wise and respected men, and appointed them as leaders over you—as commanders of thousands, of hundreds, of fifties, and of tens, and as officers for your tribes.
translation: Mi kisim ol bikpela man meri bilong yu, ol i gat taips na ol i gat respek, na mi apoinim ol bikpela man meri olsem lidaman bilong yu—ol komanda bilong tausen, bilong hundret, bilong fifiti, na bilong ten, na ofisa bilong tribu bilong yu.

original: At that time I charged your judges: “Hear the disputes between your brothers, and judge fairly between a man and his brother or a foreign resident.
translation: Long taim ia, mi bin givim komando long ol jajas bilong yu: “Harim tok bilong ol bratas na ol stranga, na jaj long wei tru, no bikim desisen long wan man na brata bilong em, o wan man na stranga.”

original: Show no partiality in judging; hear both small and great alike. Do not be intimidated by anyone, for judgment belongs to God. And bring to me any case too difficult for you, and I will hear it.”
translation: No ken tok pes bilong yu long jujement; harim tok bilong ol liklik na ol bikpela. No ken kirapim yu bilong eni man, olsem na jujement i bilong God tasol. Kisim i go long mi eni kesa we i bikim yu pen, na bai mi harim.

original: And at that time I commanded you all the things you were to do.
translation: Na long dispela taim mi bin givim yu ol tok bilong ol samting yu mas mekim.

original: And just as the LORD our God had commanded us, we set out from Horeb and went toward the hill country of the Amorites, through all the vast and terrifying wilderness you have seen. When we reached Kadesh-barnea,
translation: Na olsem Jehovah God bilong yumi tokim, yumi go bek long Horeb, yumi i go longun na i kam bek gen long kantri bilong Amorait, long olgeta wilderness bikpela na i save pret long fearim yumi lukim, taim yumi kamap long Kades Barnea.

original: I said: “You have reached the hill country of the Amorites, which the LORD our God is giving us.
translation: Mi tok: "Yupela i go ap long kantri bilong maunten bilong Pipol Amori, we Bikpela God bilong mipela em i givim mipela.

original: See, the LORD your God has placed the land before you. Go up and take possession of it as the LORD, the God of your fathers, has told you. Do not be afraid or discouraged.”
translation: Lukim, LORD God bilong yu, em i givim kantri long yu. Go ap na kisim olgeta hap bilong yu olsem LORD, God bilong papa bilong yu, em i tokim yu. No ken bikim birua o sem tumas.

original: Then all of you approached me and said, “Let us send men ahead of us to search out the land and bring us word of what route to follow and which cities to enter.”
translation: Ol i kam klostu long me na tokim mi olsem, "Yu salim man i go bifor long yumi, skulimawei long graun, rot na taun, na bringim us tok long wanem rot yumi mas follem na wanem taun yumi mas go insait."

original: The plan seemed good to me, so I selected twelve men from among you, one from each tribe.
translation: Plani em i luk bikpela na gud long ai, olesem na mi chusim twelv man, wanpela long olgeta tain, long olgeta husat i stap.

original: They left and went up into the hill country, and came to the Valley of Eshcol and spied out the land.
translation: Tupela i go bek long hap i go ap long kantri long maunten, na tupela i kam long Vale Bong Eshkol na ol i lukim i skulim ples.

original: They took some of the fruit of the land in their hands, carried it down to us, and brought us word: “It is a good land that the LORD our God is giving us.”
translation: Ol i kisim sampela bilong diwai, ol i karim i daun long han bilong ol, na ol i bringim us tok: “Em i ka bilong graun nais, LORD God bilong yumi i givim mipela.”

original: But you were unwilling to go up; you rebelled against the command of the LORD your God.
translation: Bikpela, yu no bin wan go ap; yu bin bagarapim komand bilong LORD Bikpela God bilong yu.

original: You grumbled in your tents and said, “Because the LORD hates us, He has brought us out of the land of Egypt to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites to be annihilated.
translation: Yupela i bikim tok bilong bel hevi long haus bilong yupela, ol i tok, "Bikos GOD Papa i no laikim mipela, em i kam bekim mipela long kantri bilong Ijip, na i bringim mipela i go daun long han bilong Amorait, oli brukim olgeta.

original: Where can we go? Our brothers have made our hearts melt, saying: ‘The people are larger and taller than we are; the cities are large, with walls up to the heavens. We even saw the descendants of the Anakim there.’”
translation: Bai yumui go we? Brata bilong mipela i makim bel bilong mipela i kam daun, olsem: ‘Ol pipel i bikpela na longpela more than mipela; taun ol i gat banis, na banis ol i go ap long heven. Mipela i lukim tu ol pikinini bilong ol man bilong Anakim i stap there.’”

original: So I said to you: “Do not be terrified or afraid of them!
translation: Mi tokim yu: “Yu no ken skelim, nau yu no ken pret long ol!

original: The LORD your God, who goes before you, will fight for you, just as you saw Him do for you in Egypt
translation: Bikpela Gott bilong yu i go bifor yu, baim i kam fait long yu, olsem yu lukim em i mekim long yu long Egip

original: and in the wilderness, where the LORD your God carried you, as a man carries his son, all the way by which you traveled until you reached this place.”
translation: Na long bus na wik, Bikpela, God bilong yu, em i kisim yu olsem man i kisim pikinini bilong em, olsem ol i go, stret long rot bilong yu, yusama yu i kamap long hap ia.

original: But in spite of all this, you did not trust the LORD your God,
translation: Olsem yet, yupela i no bilip long Bikpela LORD God bilong yu.

original: who went before you on the journey, in the fire by night and in the cloud by day, to seek out a place for you to camp and to show you the road to travel.
translation: Ol i go bipo yu long jorni, inap faia long nait na klau bilong de, for makim ples bilong yu stap na for showim yu rod bilong yu wokabaut.

original: When the LORD heard your words, He grew angry and swore an oath, saying,
translation: Taim Lord i harim tok bilong yu, em i bel kol kol, na em i mek promis, olsem em i tok:

original: “Not one of the men of this evil generation shall see the good land I swore to give your fathers,
translation: Nogat wanpela man husat i stap long disla genarason ol i no gat laip bai lukim gutpela graun we mi bin promis bai mi givim papa bilong yu.

original: except Caleb son of Jephunneh. He will see it, and I will give him and his descendants the land on which he has set foot, because he followed the LORD wholeheartedly.”
translation: Bikos Kalebu sambai Jefune. Em bai lukim, na mi bai givim em na ol desenden bilong em lain bilong promis we em plantim fut long en, bikos em i follem LORD olgeta hapt.

original: The LORD was also angry with me on your account, and He said, “Not even you shall enter the land.
translation: Papa God i masalai long olgetting bilong yu, na Em i tok, "Yu yet, yu no go insait long kantri."

original: Joshua son of Nun, who stands before you, will enter it. Encourage him, for he will enable Israel to inherit the land.
translation: Josaia sori bilong Nun, i stap bifor yu, em bai go insait long en. Givim kauntim long em, bikos em makim Israel i ken kisim kantri.

original: And the little ones you said would become captives—your children who on that day did not know good from evil—will enter the land that I will give them, and they will possess it.
translation: Na ol pikinini yu tokim ol bai bikim prisna—ol pikinini yu husat nogat save long gutpela na marasin long dei em i go—ol bai go insait long kantri God promis, na ol bai kisim i stap.

original: But you are to turn back and head for the wilderness along the route to the Red Sea.”
translation: Bikos yu mas turnim bek, go long bus, na i go long rot igo long Solwara Red.

original: “We have sinned against the LORD,” you replied. “We will go up and fight, as the LORD our God has commanded us.” Then each of you put on his weapons of war, thinking it easy to go up into the hill country.
translation: Mipela i go sin long han bilong LORD, yu tokim. Mipela i go ap na fight, olsem LORD God bilong mipela i tokim mipela. Na yupela yet putim wep bilong fait long bodi bilong yupela, na yumisep thinkim i es bilong go ap long kantri bilong maunten.

original: But the LORD said to me, “Tell them not to go up and fight, for I am not with you to keep you from defeat by your enemies.”
translation: Bikpela i tokim olsem long me, "Yu tokim ol: ol no ken go ap na fait, bikos mi no stap wantaim yu bilong saveim yu long bikim i los long han bilong poisen."

original: So I spoke to you, but you would not listen. You rebelled against the command of the LORD and presumptuously went up into the hill country.
translation: Mi tokim yu, yu no harim nau. Yu krosim ka long tok bilong Jehovah, na yu go antap long kantri bai yu.

original: Then the Amorites who lived in the hills came out against you and chased you like a swarm of bees. They routed you from Seir all the way to Hormah.
translation: Na Amori ol i stap long maunten, ol i kam aut na go against yu, na ol i draivim yu olsem wanpela swam bilong bi. Ol i pusim yu long Seir go long Hormah.

original: And you returned and wept before the LORD, but He would not listen to your voice or give ear to you.
translation: Na yu go bek gen na yu krai bifor LORD, tasol Em i no lisnen long tok bilong yu, na em i no givim ear long yu.

original: For this reason you stayed in Kadesh for a long time—a very long time.
translation: Long olsem, yu stap long Kades long taim nogut — taim tumas tru.

original: Then we turned back and headed for the wilderness by way of the Red Sea, as the LORD had instructed me, and for many days we wandered around Mount Seir.
translation: Tanim bek, yumi i go long bus lon rot bilong Siamani Rot, olsem LORD i tokim mi, na long taim olgeta yumi warkabaut longun Mount Seir.

original: At this time the LORD said to me,
translation: Long dispela taim Bikpela i tokim olsem long me,

original: “You have been wandering around this hill country long enough; turn to the north
translation: Yu bin wanda long kantri hap olketa taim nau; turnim yu i go long not.

original: and command the people: ‘You will pass through the territory of your brothers, the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir. They will be afraid of you, so you must be very careful.
translation: Givim tok bilong ol pipol: ‘Yupela bai pas long graun bilong yupela bratas, descendan bilong Esau, ol i stap long Seir. Ol i poret long yumi, na Yupela mas kisim hevi ka, bai yumi no bagarap.

original: Do not provoke them, for I will not give you any of their land, not even a footprint, because I have given Mount Seir to Esau as his possession.
translation: Yu no ken kisim tok long ol, nau mi no bai givim yu eni hap bilong ol, nogat even mak bilong fut, wantaim mi givim Maunt Seir long Esau olsem propati bilong em.

original: You are to pay them in silver for the food you eat and the water you drink.’”
translation: Yu mas peim ol long silva bilong kaikai yu kaikai na wara yu drinkim.

original: Indeed, the LORD your God has blessed you in all the work of your hands. He has watched over your journey through this vast wilderness. The LORD your God has been with you these forty years, and you have lacked nothing.
translation: Tru, LORD God bilong yu im bin blesim yu long olgeta wok bilong han bilong yu. Im bin wachim i go long jorney bilong yu inside bus balus i go daun yet. LORD God bilong yu im bin stap wantaim yu long forti yia, na yu no bin missim notin.

original: So we passed by our brothers, the descendants of Esau, who live in Seir. We turned away from the Arabah road, which comes up from Elath and Ezion-geber, and traveled along the road of the Wilderness of Moab.
translation: Mipela i pas long brata bilong yumi, ol desenden bilong Esau, ol i stap long Seir. Mipela tonawe nau long rot bilong Arabah, em i kam up long Elath na Ezion-geber, na mipela wokabaut i go long rot bilong Wiknes bilong Moab.

original: Then the LORD said to me, “Do not harass the Moabites or provoke them to war, for I will not give you any of their land, because I have given Ar to the descendants of Lot as their possession.”
translation: Bikpela i tokim olsem long me, “Yu no ken harim Moabiti, yu no ken kisim wara long ol, bikos mi no baim yu eni graun bilong ol, bikos mi givim Ar long pikinini bilong Lot olsem propati bilong ol.”

original: (The Emites used to live there, a people great and many, as tall as the Anakites.
translation: Ol Emait i stap long taim bipo, manmeri gutpela na planti, ol i liklik tumas olsem Anakait.

original: Like the Anakites, they were also regarded as Rephaim, though the Moabites called them Emites.
translation: Olsem Anakites, ol i kamap olsem Rephaim, tasol Moabites i kolim ol olsem Emites.

original: The Horites used to live in Seir, but the descendants of Esau drove them out. They destroyed the Horites from before them and settled in their place, just as Israel did in the land that the LORD gave them as their possession.)
translation: Horit i usim stap long Seir, tasol descendants bilong Esau i drivim ol longwe. Ol i bagarapim Horit long bifor ol, na ol i kam staple long ples bilong ol, olsem Israel i mekim long pla bilong LORD i givim ol long taim bilong inheritance.

original: “Now arise and cross over the Brook of Zered.” So we crossed over the Brook of Zered.
translation: Nau kam daun na go pas long Brook of Zered. Na mipela i go pas long Brook of Zered.

original: The time we spent traveling from Kadesh-barnea until we crossed over the Brook of Zered was thirty-eight years, until that entire generation of fighting men had perished from the camp, as the LORD had sworn to them.
translation: Taim yumui mipela usim go long rot from Kadesh-barnea kamap ol i go daun yet long Zered Creek em thirty-eight yia, til nogat wanpela genarason bilong ol soldia i bin dai finis long kamp, olsem Bikpela i promis long ol.

original: Indeed, the LORD’s hand was against them, to eliminate them from the camp, until they had all perished.
translation: Han bilong Lod i birua ol, ol i paitim ol long husat ol i no inap kam bek gen long ples bilong ol, na ol i dai pinis.

original: Now when all the fighting men among the people had died,
translation: Nau long taim ol soldia husat i stap long ples ol i dai pinis,

original: the LORD said to me,
translation: Bikpela i tokim mi

original: “Today you are going to cross the border of Moab at Ar.
translation: Tudei yu go nau krosim skelim i go long Moab bihain long Ar.

original: But when you get close to the Ammonites, do not harass them or provoke them, for I will not give you any of the land of the Ammonites. I have given it to the descendants of Lot as their possession.”
translation: Bain olgeta klostu long ol Ammonait, no ken harim oisim ol, no ken provokim ol, bikos mi no baim yu eni hap graun bilong ol. Mi givim graun ia long desenden bilong Lot olsem possession bilong ol.

original: (That too was regarded as the land of the Rephaim, who used to live there, though the Ammonites called them Zamzummites.
translation: Em i kukim olsem graun bilong ol Rephaim, ol i usim stap long hap, nogat, Amonait i kolim ol Zamzummait.

original: They were a people great and many, as tall as the Anakites. But the LORD destroyed them from before the Ammonites, who drove them out and settled in their place,
translation: Ol i stap bikpela na ol i planti, olgeta long olsem Anakits. Biaten LORD i bagarapim ol long fon bilong Amunaitis, ol i rausim ol na i kam wail long ples bilong ol.

original: just as He had done for the descendants of Esau who lived in Seir, when He destroyed the Horites from before them. They drove them out and have lived in their place to this day.
translation: Olsem em bin mekim long deshendant bilong Esau ol i stap long Maunten Seir, wén em bin bagarapim Horiti long bifor ol. Ol i drivim ol longwe, na ol i stap na i wokim haus long ples bilong ol inap long tude.

original: And the Avvim, who lived in villages as far as Gaza, were destroyed by the Caphtorites, who came out of Caphtor and settled in their place.)
translation: Na Avvim, ol i stap long vilij long wei inap kas Gaza, ol i bin bagarap nau long ol han bilong Ol Caphtorit, ol i kamap long Caphtor na muvim na stap long ples bilong ol.

original: “Arise, set out, and cross the Arnon Valley. See, I have delivered into your hand Sihon the Amorite, king of Heshbon, and his land. Begin to take possession of it and engage him in battle.
translation: Kam daun, go na pas, kaikim i go long Vali Arnon. Lukim, mi bin givim Sihon bilong Amorite, papa bilong Heshbon, na kantri bilong en, i go long han bilong yu. Begim long kisim i go na go antap long en na painim em.

original: This very day I will begin to put the dread and fear of you upon all the nations under heaven. They will hear the reports of you and tremble in anguish because of you.”
translation: Mi bai statim go putim respek na ogota long yu long olgeta nesen long heven. Ol i harim toktok long yu, na ol i traim kisim soram long yu.

original: So from the Wilderness of Kedemoth I sent messengers with an offer of peace to Sihon king of Heshbon, saying,
translation: Long bus bilong Kedemoth, mi sendim messenja wantaim ofa bilong pis go long Sihon king bilong Heshbon, ol tok:

original: “Let us pass through your land; we will stay on the main road. We will not turn to the right or to the left.
translation: Mipela i laik pas long graun bilong yu; mipela bai stap long rot bilong pablik, mipela no bai lusim rot long sait rgba na sait Helt.

original: You can sell us food to eat and water to drink in exchange for silver. Only let us pass through on foot,
translation: Yupela ken selim kaikai na wara long yumi, inap long silva, tasol lulim yumi pas wantaim leg.

original: just as the descendants of Esau who live in Seir and the Moabites who live in Ar did for us, until we cross the Jordan into the land that the LORD our God is giving us.”
translation: Olsem olsem na descendants bilong Esau ol dei stap long Seir na Moabites ol dei stap long Ar, ol i mekim gutpela wok long yumi, until yumui crossim Jordan, na go insait long kantri we LORD God bilong yumi givim yumi.

original: But Sihon king of Heshbon would not let us pass through, for the LORD your God had made his spirit stubborn and his heart obstinate, that He might deliver him into your hand, as is the case this day.
translation: Bareket Sihon king bilong Heshbon i no lem us go throo, wantaim LORD God bilong yu em i mekim spirit bilong em i strong hed, na em i mekim bel bilong em i strong, olsem nau em inap givim em long han bilong yu, olsem em i kamap nau.

original: Then the LORD said to me, “See, I have begun to deliver Sihon and his land over to you. Now begin to conquer and possess his land.”
translation: Bikpela i tokim olsem long me, "Luke, mi bin statim salim Sihon na graun bilong en long yu. Nau yupela i go bekim na kisim graun bilong en."

original: So Sihon and his whole army came out for battle against us at Jahaz.
translation: Na Sihon wantaim solida bilong en i kamaut long pait bilong fait long Jahaz, long hap bilong yumi.

original: And the LORD our God delivered him over to us, and we defeated him and his sons and his whole army.
translation: Na LORD Bikpela bilong mipela i givim em long na kam lukim mipela, mipela i winim em, em na ol pikinini bilong en, na ol solja bilong em hap.

original: At that time we captured all his cities and devoted to destruction the people of every city, including women and children. We left no survivors.
translation: Long taim ya, mipela kisim olgeta taun bilong em, na mipela i birua ol i go long dae, ol man, meri, na pikinini, mipela i lusim nogat wanpela.

original: We carried off for ourselves only the livestock and the plunder from the cities we captured.
translation: Yumi kisim i go long yumui ol ani na ol lo bilong yumi long ol ples yumi bin harim.

original: From Aroer on the rim of the Arnon Valley, along with the city in the valley, even as far as Gilead, not one city had walls too high for us. The LORD our God gave us all of them.
translation: Long Aroer antap long rif bilong Arnon Valley, wantaim taun i go daun long valley, na em i go yet long Gilead, tasol not a singlepela taun i gat wal bikpela olsem yumi no inap winim. LORD God bilong yumi i givim mipela everything.

original: But you did not go near the land of the Ammonites, or the land along the banks of the Jabbok River, or the cities of the hill country, or any place that the LORD our God had forbidden.
translation: Bikos yu no go klostu long graun bilong Pipol Ammon, na Yu no go klostu long sait bilong Riv Jabbok, na yu no go klostu long siti long kantri bilong mauntin, na yu no go long eni hap we LORD God bilong yumipla em i bin forbiding.

original: Then we turned and went up the road to Bashan, and Og king of Bashan and his whole army came out to meet us in battle at Edrei.
translation: Na mipela i turnim na i go ap long rot bilong Bashan, na Og king bilong Bashan na ol solja bilong en i kam aut long mitim mipela long bikpela fait na Edrei.

original: But the LORD said to me, “Do not fear him, for I have delivered him into your hand, along with all his people and his land. Do to him as you did to Sihon king of the Amorites, who lived in Heshbon.”
translation: Bikpela i tokim mi, “Yu no ken fearim em, bikos mi givim em long han bilong yu, wantaim ol pipol bilong en na graun bilong en. Wokim olsem yu wokim long Sihon king bilong Amoriti, we i stap long Heshbon.”

original: So the LORD our God also delivered Og king of Bashan and his whole army into our hands. We struck them down until no survivor was left.
translation: Na Bikpela LORD God bilong yumi i kam long han bilong yumi, em i givim Og king bilong Bashan na ol solja bilong en i go long han bilong yumi. Yumi i kilim ol, tasol inap man i stap, yumi i kilim ol yet.

original: At that time we captured all sixty of his cities. There was not a single city we failed to take—the entire region of Argob, the kingdom of Og in Bashan.
translation: Long taim ia mipela kisim olgeta siksikiti bilong en, nem tasol sixty. Nogat wanpela siti mipela no bin kisim – hol holepela hap graun bilong Argob, kingdom bilong Og long hap graun Bashan.

original: All these cities were fortified with high walls and gates and bars, and there were many more unwalled villages.
translation: Olgeta siti ya i gat bikpela wail long en, na ol i kukim ol yet long klosim long ol i gat bigpela wal, gate, na bar, na i gat planti arere vilij long kantri we i no gat wal.

original: We devoted them to destruction, as we had done to Sihon king of Heshbon, utterly destroying the men, women, and children of every city.
translation: Mipela i kamapim ol long narapela rot, olsem mipela i mekim long Sihon king bilong Heshbon, mipela i bagarapim ol man, meri, na pikinini long ples bilong tumbuna ol, ol i dai pinis.

original: But all the livestock and plunder of the cities we carried off for ourselves.
translation: Mipela kisim olgeta animal hus na bulmakau, stua bilong ol siti, na mipela kisim i go long mipela.

original: At that time we took from the two kings of the Amorites the land across the Jordan, from the Arnon Valley as far as Mount Hermon—
translation: Long taim ya, mipela kisim long tupela king bilong Amorait gras bilong Jordan, stat long Vali Arnon i go inap long Maun Hermon—

original: which the Sidonians call Sirion but the Amorites call Senir—
translation: Wanpela maunten ol Sidonia i kolim Sirion tasol ol Amoria i kolim Senir —

original: all the cities of the plateau, all of Gilead, and all of Bashan as far as the cities of Salecah and Edrei in the kingdom of Og.
translation: Olgeta taun long hap graun, olgeta hap Gilead, na olgeta hap Basan, inap long ol taun Saleka na Edere, i stap long kingdom bilong Og.

original: (For only Og king of Bashan had remained of the remnant of the Rephaim. His bed of iron, nine cubits long and four cubits wide, is still in Rabbah of the Ammonites.)
translation: Og king bilong Bashan i stap yet long ol i stap yet long Rephaim. Bet bilong aian, em nau long nain kubiti longet na foa kubiti wid, i stap yet long Rabbah bilong Ammonites.

original: So at that time we took possession of this land. To the Reubenites and Gadites I gave the land beyond Aroer along the Arnon Valley, and half the hill country of Gilead, along with its cities.
translation: Long dispela taim mipela i tek olgeta long dispela graun. Mi givim Ol Reubenites na Ol Gadites dispela graun long biksan Aroer, long daun bilong vail Arnon, na hap halv bilong kantri long Gilead, longolgets cities bilong en.
